name: #FREEDOM Craft Brewery
description: #FREEDOM started as a joint venture of Barry Hansen Jr, Greg Cristallo, Angus Sinclair, David Hitchings, Eric Phillips and Harris Decker. The company now consists of eight partners and has recently moved into a new facility to begin production.    Established in 2012, #FREEDOM Craft Brewery (pronounced "Hashtag Freedom") features modern beers brewed using traditional methods. Our brews are all natural and our flagship beer is created entirely of American grown ingredients.

name: (512) Brewing Company
description: (512) Brewing is a microbrewery located in the heart of Austin, brewing for the community using as many local, domestic and organic ingredients as possible. We use USDA organic 2-row base malt because it's the right thing to do. We self distribute because we can and we're draft only to keep the product fresh and to reduce disposable packaging. You can taste the passion in our products and we appreciate all our local support.

name: 101 North Brewing Company
description: Just a bunch of reckless boys who aren’t afraid to put the cart before the horse, twist every arm, break every sweat, and genuinely fake it till we make it. Because in these troubled times, creating and sharing beer with the world just made sense, if we could do it our way... with visual aids and a soundtrack.    At 101 North, we believe progressive is a beer style.

name: 1188 Brewing Company
description: Grant County's first brewery, we are nestled in the city of John Day, Oregon surrounded by beautiful mountains, rivers, and ranchlands. Stop by for a cold pint, or to fill a growler or two. In addition to our own beers brewed on site, we also offer a number of guest taps from small breweries around Oregon.

name: 14th Star Brewing
description: History books tell us that local Vermonter and beer enthusiast Ethan Allen was a leader inthe effort to make Vermont the fourteenth star on the U.S. flag in 1791. And those textbooks are right; especially about the 1791 part.    Today, in Franklin County, Vermont, Army veteran Steve Gagner is honoring his home state and passion – brewing great beer – with 14th Star Brewing Co.    14th Star is Steve’s 1,200-square-foot nanobrewery on Lower Newton Street, in St. Albans City.    Nanobreweries make less than four-barrel batches, and as of your eyes hitting this paragraph, there are still less than 100 nanobreweries in America.    What makes 14th Star stand out? Well, it’s about the only brewery in Vermont that’s located above Burlington. Period.    But that’s not it. Not entirely.    You see – this is your beer. Oh, sure, Steve plans on starting you off with one-barrel batches of pale ale, brown ale, and Belgian white. There will be more, of course, but that’s up to you. So tell Steve what style beer you want in your 14th Star growler at: steve@14thstarbrewing.com.  On our end, we are readying to open our doors. Our goal is this July. (Check out our Pint of Progress on our home page.)    We can’t wait to watch you let your hair down and lift your glass, Vermont. We’ll enjoy that. And remember – this is your beer. You enjoy it.
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  5:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  5:00pm - 9:00pm Sun:  9:00am - 12:00pm

name: 16 Mile Brewing Company
description: 16 Mile Brewing Company, Inc. opened its doors in July 2009 to the public. It is owned and operated by Brett McCrea and Chad Campbell.    The 16 Mile Brewing Company name harkens back to the late 1700’s when Georgetown was still known as Pettijohn’s old field, a rather isolated town, centrally located in Sussex County. The area was “16 miles from anywhere” in the county and was the best place for farmers, merchants, and politicians to meet to conduct official business. Georgetown replaced Lewes as the County Seat when numerous petitions were sent to Delaware’s General Assembly requesting that the move be made to accommodate all county residents. (For more information see “16 Miles from Anywhere: A History of Georgetown, Del., by William J. Wade.)

name: 18th Street Brewery
description: Hand-crafting small and big beers for NW Indiana and Chicagoland.

name: 192 Brewing Company
description: We began building our dream in 2007. We have improved our recipes, gathered feedback, made changes, and sampled our products. We have one concept. We want to Make great beer. Not beer that tastes like a bitter plant, or a leather belt. Not clear beer that has been mass produced and over filtered. Just wonderful, fantastic beer, for the many. All from a very small space. 192 square feet to be exact. We have packed only the essentials into our brewery. We make every batch by hand and we nurture it every step of the way. Great beer is what we work for, and great beer is what we enjoy.

name: 1933 Brewing Company
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  3:00pm - 8:30pm Tue:  3:00pm - 8:30pm Wed:  3:00pm - 8:30pm Thu:  12:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  12:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 9:00pm Sun:  1:00pm - 7:00pm

name: 1974 Brewing Company
description: 1974 Brewing Company is a nano brewery in planning, founded in 2012. We began brewing in late 2008 on a hobby scale with all grain 5 gallon batches. In late 2011 we moved up to 10 gallon batches. Brewing is not only a hobby but a way of life for us, once we started we just couldn’t seem to stop. We really enjoy the process of making the beer as well the finished product. Some of the success we have had in home brewing competitions has only given us confidence and motivation to take our hobby further. We plan on expanding our system to produce 7-10 barrels per batch in 2012 as well as filing the necessary paperwork to begin a legitimate brewery, distributing our beers to the public.

name: 2 Witches Winery and Brewing Company, Inc.
description: 2 Witches Winery & Brewing Company, located in Danville, Virginia, is a combination farm/urban winery and picobrewery. We are affiliated with 2 Witches Vineyard located in Chatham, Virginia. We hope to open in May 2013.

name: 21st Amendment Brewery
description: The 21st Amendment Brewery offers a variety of award winning house made brews and American grilled cuisine in a comfortable loft like setting. Join us before and after Giants baseball games in our outdoor beer garden. A great location for functions and parties in our semi-private Brewers Loft. See you soon at the 21A!

name: 23rd Street Brewery
description: Here at the 23rd Street Brewery, we pride ourselves in creating and offering ales and lagers of exceptional quality. Often in the micro brewing industry, quality is compromised for quantity. We brew handcrafted, small batch beers to ensure freshness is as crisp as it is clean. We use only the finest domestic and imported barley and hops to brew beers of tradition and beers of distinction. The brew house we call home is a 15 barrel Pub Brewing System located on the upper level of the impressive brewery interior. In the past year, we have doubled our production to exceed 1000 barrels (2000 Kegs) per year and have begun distributing to other bars and restaurants throughout Kansas.

name: 2kids Brewing Company
description: Two Kids Brewing Company is San Diego's newest Nanobrewery! Now open, we're serving the finest in tasty and unusual ales, sans snobby attitude.

name: 2nd Shift Brewing Co
description: We are a micro that will be making beer that is big on flavor and aroma, the way beer should be. There will be several styles and a continuing line of seasonal and special beers that will be produced throughout the year.

name: 3 Beards Beer Company
description: 3 Beards Beer Company enables undiscovered artisan brews from all over the world to be locally brewed and freshly distributed. We focus on talented individuals who have the desire, but not necessarily the means, to share their creations with other enthusiasts.

name: 3 Daughters Brewing
description: 3 Daughters Brewing will be opening fall of 2013 with several exciting new craft beers. With our 30 barrel brewhouse, we will have the capacity to serve the Tampa Bay market new and innovative flavors in our Beach Blonde Ale, Brown Pelican Dunkelweizen and Summer Storm Stout. Keep an eye out for the 3DB brand in your local restaurant and stay tuned for the opening of our tasting room coming soon.

name: 3 Guys and a Beer'd Brewing Company
description: We strive to make a quality, flavorful brew that all tastebuds will enjoy!

name: 3 Herons Brewing Company
description: We will be opening the restaurant Friday, August 24, preparing for the NY brewery license after.     We will offer fresh meats both outside in the BBQ and inside the restaurant. We will use local produce as much as we can, from local Finger Lakes farms.     We will strive to be family-friendly in price & atmosphere, offering local favorites (BBQ etc) and quality musical entertainment.    Smoked meats, handmade sausage & cheese, homemade pasta & flatbreads.    Craft — Flavor — Quality
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  4:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 8:00pm Sat:  6:00am - 9:00pm Sun:  6:00am - 8:00pm

name: 3 Sheeps Brewing Company
description: All families have their stories: tales of grandparents and great-grandparents and the incredible things they accomplished, or lived through, or overcame. My family was no different. I grew up hearing stories that cascaded across a broad plain of topics, but the ones that fascinated me most centered around the Kingsbury Breweries.    Back in 1926, the Kingsbury Breweries, then known as the Gutsch Brewery, declared bankruptcy. It was a tough time for breweries across the country as Prohibition was in full effect. Many breweries failed during that time, and the Gutsch Brewery was on its way to joining them. It was at this time that my family took the helm of the brewery. Soon after, they changed the name to the Kingsbury Breweries, expanded coast-to-coast, and turned the brewery into what we remember it as today.    I grew up hearing stories from my father, who, as a child with his father, would go around the various Kingsbury Breweries, see the brewers hard at work, and watch the customers enjoy a beer in the Ratskellar. This is where my interest was first piqued by the great world of beer. Many years later, thanks to a brilliant gift on my wife’s part, I started making my own beer. From that point forward there was no turning back. The hobby turned into a passion, which turned into an obsession, which turned into quitting my day job and opening a brewery.    This is my Really Cool Waterslide - my choice to take a dream and make it my reality. Thank you to all those who have helped me get here.    - Grant Pauly, 3 Sheeps Brewing

name: 3 Stars Brewing Company
description: 3 Stars Brewing is a DC based production brewery founded by Mike McGarvey and Dave Coleman to provide the community with great, fresh, local craftbeer.     We are looking forward to opening our doors in 2011. In doing so, we will proudly brew beers that push the limits of conventional brewing while still providing our customers with great, fresh, local craft beers...contact us at info@3starsbrewing.com

name: 300 Suns Brewing
description: 300 Suns Brewing was really just an idea brought up years ago, that kept surfacing every time a brewery was toured, a GABF was attended, a new craft beer was tasted, a bottle of homebrew was shared on the back deck in the cool summer evening air. It was just a dream and one day (gulp), we worked up the nerve to make it a reality. We wanted to put our time and our work into something that brought joy to others the way those moments brought joy to us. And we wanted to give our community very meaningful ways that they could become part of the shaping of our brewery.

name: 350 Brewing Company
description: The 350 Brewing Company has spawned from the ashes of our failed Collegiate careers at Northern Illinois University. Let me explain. 350 Augusta Ave. was our address in Dekalb, IL. At the time, your founders Todd and Erik spent more time on projects like way below average punk rock bands in the attic, and a Hardcore Wrestling Federation called WCVF (this took place in our kitchen), instead of focusing on classes like Humanities 227 in DuSable Hall. I mean, have you ever choke slammed one of your best friends into an oven pre-heated to "550 degrees"? Well i have, and that was just a random Wednesday night. This raw energy (stupidity) and creativity is what eventually drew us to the Craft Beer scene. That’s what craft beer is…a creative and fresh twist on a beverage that has been mass produced and shoved down our throats for much too long (carefully stepping down from soapbox). Why not name our Brewery after the point in our life when we were most creative? Well…..we did. It was during these times we were also introduced to good, quality beer.    Once NIU had enough of our shenanigans, Erik went on to continue his education while I submerged myself into the cesspool known as corporate America. I feel dirty just talking about it. Over the last decade, my soul has been slowly rotting and exiting my body so there was a need for this creative juice to be squeezed once again. Since wrestling and punk rock was now out of the question, brewing beer quickly became that much needed release from the Groundhog Day that had become the norm for us. Erik like most homebrewers started out brewing with extract several years ago and quickly rose to the challenge of all-grain batches. Erik, the 350 Head brewer, has been very successful when entering brewing competitions walking away with multiple awards for his Porter and Patersbier. Myself on the other hand have had a love for flavorful craft beer for many moons, and once I learned of Erik’s brewing expertise years ago, I too became emerged in this brewing lifestyle. It was a match made in heaven. Erik brewed awesome beer, and I was awesome at drinking and sharing that beer!!!     From that point on things just sort of clicked and for the last 2 years Erik and I have been researching and concocting this master plan of opening a brewery. The time has come. We want all of you to enjoy this journey with us. Tinley Park has always been our #1 choice for the 350 Brewing Company. Downtown Tinley Park embodies the spirit of 350. With great electricity in the downtown area, coupled with an amazing artistic feel, will definitely pair well with our vision of always making sure a visit to our brewery is an interesting experience. We feel Tinley Park is ready for a neighborhood brewery. It really was an easy decision based on Tinley Park’s sense of community and passion for supporting local products.    We are looking forward to joining the family of incredible Illinois Brewers. We should all thank our lucky stars that we live in a state with such high quality Breweries.

name: 38 State Brewing Company
description: We started out years ago brewing in our garage. Friends and family would always come by to hang out, drink our beer, socialize and watch whatever game was on. Soon our garage was filled with so many people we decided to find a bigger one and open it up to everyone! We took a chance and opened a nano-brewery and tasting room. Now we can offer our beer to current and future friends in our community! Visit our website for our beer menu, more info and updates. www.38statebrew.com    We're located in Littleton, Colorado. So whether you're a local or just passing through, please stop by, take a load off and sample some of our tasty brews. Trust us... you will not be disappointed! Cheers!!

name: 3rd Wave Brewing Co.
description: 3rd Wave Brewing Co. is a dream between to friends who love the beach and love to brew beer. We hope you visit us often and enjoy Good Friends, Good Waves, Great Beer!
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  4:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  1:00pm - 9:00pm Sun:  12:00pm - 6:00pm

name: 4 Brothers Blended Beer
description: 4 Brothers Custom Blended Craft Beer evolved from a combination of passion, innovation, experimentation, configuration and fermentation; followed by extensive libation and imbibition. Yep, brewing blended beer is damn hard work. Especially the tasting part. Cheers for Libations!    Until we 4 Brothers started the process of evolving our avocation into our vocation, there really hasn't been a true innovation in the beer industry in years. Maybe since the monks first put their quills to parchment and recorded their initial beer recipes.    IPAs, Porters, Pilsners, Lagers, Browns, Reds, Blondes. All magnificent purebreds. 4 Brothers is the World Class Custom Blended Craft Beer, combining the best qualities of each.    Our signature beer, Sibling Rivalry, combines the taste profiles of a darker beer, a lighter beer and a hoppier beer to produce an incredibly drinkable and delicious beer.    4 Brothers custom blended craft beers are perfect for enthusiasts, fun-lovers and those who don't take themselves too seriously. Yep; drinkability, flavor and authenticity. And we think that is something to shout about, despite the monk's vow of silence.

name: 4 Hands Brewing Company
description: 4 Hands Brewing Company, located in the LaSalle Park neighborhood, will provide the craft beer enthusiast a handcrafted portfolio inspired by the American craft movement that pushes the limits of creativity. Our barrel -aging program will produce a truly unique line on beers. The use of wine and spirit barrels containing an array of fruit, herbs, and spices in conjunction with wild yeast strains will enhance the flavors to produce a one of a kind beer.

name: 4 Noses Brewing Company
description: The 4 Noses Brewery is a family owned and operated craft brewery and tasting room. 4 Noses has a passion for creatively brewing our unique interpretation of classic styles. Using ingredients from around the world, 4 Noses combines traditional styles with nontraditional flavor profiles to give the beers our own distinct personality.

name: 4 Paws Brewing
description: 4 Paws Brewing LLC is a microbrewery established in Chicago, IL. The brewery will be located in the Uptown/Edgewater neighborhood at a site to be determined. 4 Paws is hoping to be fully operational by 2013!    We believe in our company, what we stand for, and most of all the beers we serve. We would never make anything we wouldn't drink just to turn a profit and we would never say anything or do anything to compromise our core beliefs. We hope that our supporters and friends join us in believing in 4 Paws too!    So why 4 paws you might ask? The short answer is our little dog Sadie. Sadie is a rescue dog that we adopted over Memorial Day weekend of 2010. She's a big part of who we are and what we're all about. So that's how we got our name, but what are we all about?

name: 4 Seasons Brewery
description: Coming January 2015

name: 40 North Brewing
description: Currently in planning.  For info contact 40NorthBrewing@gmail.com

name: 450 North Brewing Company
description: Owners David and Brenda Simmons had a plan to expand their winery business with a restaurant. Several of the wine customers are also beer drinkers. What better way to satisfy all customers than to offer fresh locally produced beer. Opening in Sept. of 2012, 450 North Brewing Company will open as a Brewpub with a full service restaurant.

name: 4th Street Brewing Co
description: Welcome to Gresham's favorite locally-owned brew pub and restaurant! Come check out our state of the art facility in the heart of downtown Gresham on the corner of 4th and Roberts. Whether you come for our locally brewed beer, our family-friendly restaurant, our incredible sports bar, or our unparalleled meeting space perfect for private parties, rehearsal dinners, meetings and more, 4th Street Brewing is the perfect choice for any occasion.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  4:00pm - 1:00am Tue:  4:00pm - 1:00am Wed:  4:00pm - 1:00am Thu:  4:00pm - 1:00am Fri:  4:00pm - 1:00am Sat:  12:00pm - 1:00am Sun:  12:00pm - 1:00am

name: 4th Way Brewing Company
description: Microbrewery with a cafe to feature our wide range of beer styles matched with local organic eats.

name: 5 Points Brewing Co
description: 5 Points Brewing Co. is located at the Historic Mission Brewery Plaza in San Diego. Built in 1913 as the Mission Brewing Company, the brewery operated until the eve of Prohibition in 1919. 5 Points Brewing Co. has restored the brewing tradition at this great location and is proud to serve fresh Ales and Lagers to thirsty craft beer enthusiasts. We keep 10 brewery fresh beers on tap at all times with seasonal and specialty beer available throughout the year. Our tasting area is located in the brewery so you can enjoy a real craft beer experience, right where it happens! Our team looks forward to sharing our brewery and beer with you, Cheers!

name: 5 Rabbit Cerveceria Inc
description: The first Latin microbrewery in the US, 5 Rabbit is all about making the best beer. At 5 Rabbit we celebrate the centuries-old myth behind Latin drinking culture with an innovative concept that revolves that uniquely Latin attitude towards life that has so captured the imagination of the world. It additionally sets out to become an integral part of the local Hispanic community and aid in its advancement. 5 Rabbit is locally brewed in Chicago, Illinois.

name: Prado
description: 5 Seasons Brewing is passionate about serving local produce, all-natural meats, and artisanal cheeses. We believe in conserving the spirit of the farm and supporting local farmers. We are also acknowledged as the center of Atlanta’s beer culture.

name: 5 Stones Artisan Brewery
description: We are a small batch nano-brewery located "down around" San Antone. Our primary focus is limited releases each season brewed with the freshest local ingredients we can get our hands on.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  8:00am - 4:00pm Tue:  8:00am - 4:00pm Fri:  8:00am - 4:00pm

name: 50 Back Brewing Company
description: Our entire purpose is to say "Thank you" to all of the active Troops and Veterans in our Country who have served so selflessly to protect and preserve our dear Nation and precious Freedom! Of course, our gratitude began close to our hearts with our own fathers, grand-fathers and uncles, and quickly spread to friends, neighbors, and colleagues.    We searched for a way to carry out our goal, we decided to find an avenue that would facilitate wide-spread reception and the ability to give back repeatedly. What better way than a great tasting lager? As predicted, the reception to our mission has, indeed, been overwhelmingly positive and dynamic. As we share our idea, everyone invariably expresses their gratitude for the fact that we are providing a manner in which they can give back on an individual and personal level. Surprisingly, Troops and Veterans have said "Thank you" back to us!

name: 508 Gastrobrewery
description: 508 Restaurant and Brewery, Bar and Mediterranean American Rustic Cuisine SOHO, NY

name: 51 North Brewing Company
description: Attention Beer Lovers, what you've been hearing is true! Lake Orion is about to have its very own microbrewery – 51 North Brewing Company. We will be located at 51 North Broadway, hence the name. Mary and Don Gindhart lead a small group of beer-loving, business-minded individuals that share one purpose – to create a microbrewery like no other. We will have an amazing lineup of hand-crafted beers, wines and meads, all made in-house. Along with this diverse group of drink selections, we will offer unique food pairings to complement these libations and provide high-quality entertainment and service. All these ingredients add up to a destination perfect for individuals, couples, families and friends.

name: 515 Brewing Company
description: Exceptional Folks Drink Exceptional Beer

name: 51st Ward Beer Company
description: We make unique beers the traditional way. Beer is our passion. We use only the highest quality ingredients and make small batches to ensure that we supply our community with the purest, freshest, highest quality beer possible. Fresh beer always tastes the best! Small scale, local distribution is our way of ensuring our product is in its prime when it gets to your glass. We have a number of staple beers plus we will be providing a rotating line of seasonal and specialty brews. As we say.....Great Beer, Born Here.

name: 53 Peaks Brewing Co
description: In dedication of the great state of Colorado, 53P takes its inspiration from the highest peaks in the state. We hand craft all our beer with unparalleled passion to provide you with a brew worthy of Colorado's indescribable natural splendor.     Welcome to 53 Peaks Brewing Company!

name: 57 Brew Pub & Bistro
description: 57 Brew Pub & Bistro is located in Greenville Michigan. We are excited to bring this new establishment to our community. We feature our own locally brewed beers on site, and our Bistro features a full menu of American Cuisine from appetizers, soups & salads, Burgers, Sandwiches, Entrees & Desserts. We opened in late October 2012! Stop in and see us soon

name: 5th Street Brewpub
description: Opened in June of 2003 in historic Downtown Sedalia, Missouri. The 5th Street Brewpub is a restaurant with a full bar featuring our own handcrafted beers. Our brewing system came on-line in February 2005. We have pale and red ales, a great dark porter, and are currently producing other seasonal beers. We are also proud to serve the major brands brews as well as specialty brews from other handcrafting breweries.

name: 612Brew
description: In the heart of the Northeast Minneapolis Arts and Brewery District, 612Brew calls Central and Broadway home. 612Brew produces small-batch beers to satisfy both the weekend beer drinker and the craft beer drinker with a discerning palate. Enjoy the local brewing culture while sipping a pint in our taproom, then look upon our mirror-polished tanks or sit in the courtyard amphitheater and rain garden. Come on, Minnesota. I'm Thirsty Already.

name: 7 Devils Brewing Co
description: The 7 Devils Brewing Company is a small craft brewery on a mission to bring the inspiration of our coastal area to the tap. Walking through our doors should create the same restorative feelings of walking toward the shore. We wish to be a sustainable business that is socially, ethically and environmentally responsible and provides a place where passionate people converge to create a positive environment and inspired products. Our goal is to enhance the community in which we live and succeed financially so that we can provide family wage jobs for creative people in a progressive workplace. With core values of efficiency, ingenuity, pride in craftsmanship, environmental and social responsibility and superior customer service, the 7 Devils Brewing Company is crafting the change we wish to see in the world.

name: 7 Hermits Brewing Company
description: Brewpub in Eagle Ranch  We carry wine, spirits, guest beer, and of course our own.  Beer styles range from easy drinking summer pils, to outrageous hop bombs. There's a style for everyone here.     Food is a lighter, healthier fare including unique flat breads, salads, and cool snacks. Nothing deep fried here.

name: 7 Seas Brewing Company
description: Formed in 2008 by Travis Guterson and Mike Runion, 7 Seas Brewing is an innovative craft brewery, making audacious, yet technically well-executed beers; utilizing cans rather than bottles; and championing environmental stewardship.    Having survived a fire at our original location which delayed our opening by six months, we now occupy a 3,000 square foot brewing facility superbly located in Gig Harbor, Washington.    At 7 Seas Brewing we strive to brew, innovate and perfect the Ultimate Proper Pint, one that will invoke an emotional, contemplative response from the drinker. It should cause them to smile, knowing that in our homogenized, cookie cutter world of consumerism, there are still people crafting something of integrity and authenticity.
hoursOfOperation: Wed:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Thu:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  2:00pm - 8:00pm Sun:  2:00pm - 8:00pm

name: 75th Street Brewery
description: 75th Street Brewery is Kansas City’s first and best brewpub that opened its doors in 1993.  Located in the historic Waldo district, the Brewery is home to live, local music (including Kansas City’s own Brew Jam every Sunday, and live Bluegrass music every Wednesday).    The Brewery boasts award-winning hand-crafted beers (fresh growlers to go every day) and a made-from-scratch menu. 75th Street Brewery has received local, regional, and national awards and accolades, including the 1999 Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup for the Red-Eye Rye Beer.    75th Street Brewery features beers brewed from the great traditions of England, Germany, Ireland, and Czechoslovakia. We also offer special seasonal styles with influences from around the globe. Each of our beers is produced from the finest barley and hops in the world and includes only four basic ingredients: Barley, Hops, Yeast, and Water. No additives or preservatives are used. Because our beers are handcrafted in small batches and kept cold, no preservatives or pasteurization are required. You are guaranteed a fresh and natural pint of beer every time. Cheers!

name: 7venth Sun Brewing
description: Belgian-style beer, IPAs, second use spirit barrel aged beer, oak aged sour beer.

name: 8th Wonder Brewing Company
description: A crafty brewery in HouTex. Our proximity to Minute Maid Park, Toyota Center & Dynamo Stadium, makes 8W the craft beer for the home team.     We are dedicated to brewing fresh, tasty artisanal ales.

name: 903 Brewers
description: 903 Brewers was founded on a simple idea; make great beer for a great community. With that idea in mind Jeremy and Natalie Roberts began building the foundation for 903 Brewers back in 2011.     Jeremy Roberts is not only the founder but also the head brewer. He spent years perfecting his recipes and letting the community decide what beers they wanted from their local brewery. He fearlessly concocted hundreds of different beers to see what new flavors he might come up with. Not all were a hit, but that is how you find a gem. Do you have an idea for a beer you’d like to try? Let him know, he just might try it out.     903 Brewers officially opened its doors in June of 2013 and introduced to the world The Chosen One Coconut Ale and Roo’s Red Ale. Since that time they have released many new and exciting beers. Starting fall of 2014 you will be able to find their beers in 22oz bombers.

name: A1A Ale Works
description: Handcrafted and brewed to excellence, A1A Ale Works goes to great lengths to serve each guest the freshest beer possible. This commitment to serving nothing but the finest and freshest beer has led to numerous awards.

name: Abandon Brewing Company
description: Overlooking beautiful Keuka Lake, we brew many different Belgian and Farmstyle craft beers for the Penn Yan and surrounding Finger Lakes areas.

name: Abbey Brewing Co
description: Miami Beach's world famous Abbey Brewing Company is home to award winning, hand crafted beers, friendly service, and a down to Earth atmosphere. One of the oldest bars in Miami, it has the old world charm of a traditional European pub
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  1:00pm - 5:00am Tue:  1:00pm - 5:00am Wed:  1:00pm - 5:00am Thu:  1:00pm - 5:00am Fri:  1:00pm - 5:00am Sat:  1:00pm - 5:00am Sun:  1:00pm - 5:00am

name: Abbey Brewing Company, LLC
description: Abbey Beverage Company, located in Abiquiu, New Mexico, is the producer of Monks' Ales starting with Monks' Ale released in 2005.    The brewery is located on the grounds of the Benedictine Monastery of Christ in the Desert.  The monks do not allow visits to the brewery.
streetAddress: Monastery of Christ in the Desert

name: Abbey Wright Brewing Company
description: The Valley Inn & Abbey Wright Brewing Co. have a superb selection of our own hand-crafted beers. We also have 22 beers on tap, and a huge selection of bottled beer from around the world.

name: Aberdeen Brewing
description: Aberdeen Brewing Company

name: Abigaile Brewery
description: Abigaile is an effort by Hermosa Beach local Jed Sanford to bring a distinctive take on the American brasserie experience to Hermosa Beach; all in a communal setting that celebrates the location’s rich history as a gathering place for locals from all walks of life.

name: Absolution Brewing Company
description: As the world grows in its understanding of what beer can and should be, no longer imprisoned by the tasteless, unfilling beers of the recent past, it craves beer made with sincere passion and an unwavering boldness of flavor. And to provide that beer is our mission.    Focusing on Old World styles and New World hops, we are creating a fusion of flavors and aromas to titillate the palate and arouse the olfactory. British, Belgian, and German styles will dominate our taps, while sours will be fermenting and aging from early on.    Absolution Brewing Company is a labor of love for three friends that have a passion for delicious craft beer. Nigel is an English gent that found his way to the West Coast more than two decades ago. Steve is a local boy, born and raised in the South Bay Los Angeles area with deep ties throughout the community. Wes is from the swamps of Louisiana and discovered Southern California via the Navy. Individually, we are but mere beer drinkers in love with the craft. Together, we are a team dedicated to fulfilling our dreams to bring the best beers to the world that others may feel the passion on their palates.

name: AC Golden Brewing Company
description: The AC Golden Brewing Company is a subsidiary of MillerCoors, a joint venture between SABMiller and Molson Coors Brewing Company. Its purpose is to serve as a specialty brewing arm of MillerCoors, in the words of president Glenn Knippenberg, "Our mission for AC Golden is to be a brand incubator for what is now MillerCoors". The AC Golden Brewery operates in the former pilot brewery of the Coors Brewery. It debuted its first beer, Herman Joseph's Private Reserve, in 2008. The company began brewing its seasonal beer, a Vienna Style lager called Winterfest, in 2009. In April 2010, AC Golden introduced Colorado Native lager in Colorado, an amber lager made with 100% Colorado ingredients.

name: Acadian Farms
description: Nestled in the fertile Carson valley, Acadian Farms is a small family farm and nano-brewery. We believe the old adage, "You are what you eat", so we organically raise our vegetables and animals. We use certified organic barley & malt in our beers and we bake our artisan breads with all natural and/or organic flours from Bob's Red Mill.  Our farmstead cheeses are made with raw milk from grass-fed goats at a local dairy. We invite you out to the farm for a pint and views of the beautiful Columbia River Gorge!
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  4:00pm - 7:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 7:00pm Sat:  1:00pm - 7:00pm Sun:  1:00pm - 7:00pm

name: Mission Brewery Plaza
description: Acoustic Ales Brewing Experiment is located in the historic Mission Brewery Plaza along the I-5, just north of downtown San Diego and just a hop away from the San Diego airport.    The original brewery housed in this building was shut down during Prohibition. The Old Brewery has now been expertly reconditioned and is up and running with a   15-barrel brewing capacity, not to mention producing some exceptional beers.

name: Acoustic Draft Mead
description: BzZz Loves You

name: Adelbert's Brewery
description: Adelbert’s Brewery is committed to brewing Belgian-style, bottle-conditioned ales for people to seek, savor, and share with others.  We believe quality beers require quality ingredients and a painstaking attention to detail throughout the brewing process.      Adelbert’s uses Bohemian old-world floor malted barley, low alpha Noble Czech hops, and fresh yeast propagated at the brewery. In our seven vessel brewhouse, we use a time consuming, multi-temperature decoction mash technique which extracts a more complex flavor from our grains.    We produce a gambit of hand-crafted Belgian style ales right here in Austin, Texas. With our vast array of beer styles, you're sure to find a brew that suits you.     Our Belgian-Style Ales include:  Naked Nun Wit  Black Rhino Black Ale  Scratchin' Hippo Biere de Garde  Philosophizer Saison  Dancin' Monks Dubbel Ale  Tripel B Tripel Ale  The Traveler Belgian IPA  Flyin' Monks Quadrupel Ale     Also, look for our Barrel-Aged "Vintage Series" where we age one of our eight ales in oak barrels for an extended period of time.    Although our selection of beer is great to enjoy by itself; each of them also pair perfectly with just about any food. From spicy Thai food to a backyard barbecue with ribs and brisket, to a formal dinner with steak or seafood and a dark chocolate dessert; our artisanal Belgian-style ales go with pretty much everything. Please share pictures and recipes that you've either used our beer to cook with or have enjoyed right alongside them!
hoursOfOperation: Wed:  5:00pm - 8:00pm Thu:  5:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  5:00pm - 8:00pm Sat:  1:00pm - 4:00pm

name: Adirondack Pub & Brewery
description: All of our craft-brewed beers are made on the premises using only the finest malt, hops, yeast and water. We currently produce these beers on a 15-barrel Bohemian copper brewhouse. Our fermantation capacity is 60 barrels (1,860 gallons), with an even larger serving capacity in our cold cellars. We invite you to taste hand-crafted beer at its finest. Look for Adirondack Pub & Brewery's hand-crafted beers at great establishments throughout New York State.

name: Admiral Sasquatch
description: Admiral Sasquatch is a proto-brewery at the moment. We're doing test batches and figuring out how best to get our fine, quality brews to the thirsty of Chicagoland.Keep your eyes peeled for us! The Admiral loves beer, and he loves you! Drink up!

name: Adroit Theory Brewing Company
description: Adroit Theory Brewing Company is the newest nano-brewery in Loudoun County Virginia. We make esoteric beers with an emphasis on barrel aging.  CONSUME LIFE / DRINK ART

name: Adventure Brewing Company
description: Adventure Brewing Company makes great craft beer in the Stafford and Fredericksburg, Virginia area.

name: Aeronaut Brewing Company
description: Aeronaut is a craft brewery and foods hub under one roof. Here, our inspired team of brewers and scientists collaborate with New England farmers and food makers to drive the invention of craft beers and spur a renaissance of local victuals and industrial revitalization.
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  5:00pm - 10:00pm Fri:  2:00pm - 10:00pm Sat:  2:00pm - 10:00pm  Taproom OPEN 5-10pm Thurs and Fri, 2-10pm Sat

name: Aftershock Brewing Company
description: After 27 years of steady brewing, we thought it would be fun to share the results of the brewing experience with others.  We are a small brewery, and are truly “hands on” every step of the brewing process.  Our goal is to produce the best, most flavorful, most memorable local beers possible.  We think we’ve met that goal, & hope you’ll agree.    At Aftershock, we believe there are two different approaches to brewing.  The most common approach used by the major breweries is a ‘scientific one’.  All stages of the brewing process are closely monitored to ensure a consistent, if tasteless product.  Computers and other high tech equipment are more in control than the brewer himself.  With this approach you get ‘scientific’ beer.  The other approach is a more artistic one, while still respecting basic laws of science, and the need for spotless cleanliness.  That’s the approach we plan to always take at Aftershock.  At the risk of losing an undetectable amount of consistency, the result is beer with much more character, subtle nuances, and awesome flavor.  Don’t take our word for it; check us out.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  3:00pm - 8:00pm Tue:  3:00pm - 8:00pm Wed:  1:00pm - 8:00pm Thu:  1:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  1:00pm - 8:00pm Sat:  1:00pm - 8:00pm Sun:  1:00pm - 8:00pm  Mon - Tue: 3:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Wed - Sun: 1:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Against The Grain Brewery
description: Louisville's only brewer-owned brewery is, like most worthwhile undertakings, the product of dissatisfaction with the status quo. The Louisville area has had a number of quality brewpubs for some time now, but still there was simply not enough beer! Against the Grain is an effort to help solve this problem. We maintain a diverse array of beers covering all of the major categories of beer flavor while generating an endless stream of innovative new brews. In short, everything is "specialty" Boredom will be extremely difficult.    Our food is designed with same philosophy as our brewing. Fresh and interesting smokehouse fare with a gastropub flare lets us bring you the very best flavors to stand alone and to compliment our beers. Regular menu changes allow us to take full advantage of the best seasonal ingredients, our chef's whim, and optimal pairing with our dynamic beer list.    Throw your preconceived notions right the hell out the window. We aren't just another brewpub. We are Against the Grain!

name: Agrarian Ales
description: Agrarian Ales strives to provide the Southern Willamette Valley with beer brewed from the finest ingredients possible. We use exclusively the hops consciously grown on our own farm, as well as any other farm bounty we can put into our mash tun, brew kettle, or fermenter! Our ultimate goal is to grow every ingredient that goes into our beer.    We are on 25 acres North of Eugene near the beautiful Willamette River. We make beer that reflects our connection to the Earth.
hoursOfOperation: Fri:  3:00pm - 7:00pm  Fri: 3:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: Airdale Brewing Company
description: Founded in 2008, Airdale Brewing is a craft beer company located in San Diego, California. Founded by a former Naval Aviator and a veteran southern California craft brewer, Airdale strives to create well-balanced, unique, flavorful beers that embody their mantra of, "Work Hard | Play Hard"    Airdale Brewing Co. is working to bring its line of premium craft beers to every market available. We intent to do this by producing quality beers that stand on their own as true examples of artisan american ales.

name: Airways Brewing Company
description: Friendly service and tasty beer make us a favorite of locals as well as beer enthusiasts from all over.     Special and seasonal beers make a frequent appearance. Our tap room has bar seating as well as small tables. On sunny days, garden seating is available.    Airways opened on March 4, 2010. Founder and brewer Alex Dittmar has had a lifelong passion for 60?s era jetliners. Airways is a combination of his love for airplanes, good beer, and a connection with people from all over the world.

name: Aksarben Brewing Company
description: Aksarben Brewing Company

name: Alameda Brewing Company
description: Alameda Brewhouse is a brewpub in the heart of the Beaumont Village in Northeast Portland. We have been in business for nine years, offering hand crafted ales and freshly prepared food. All of our beers are produced on location in our 5.5 BBL brewhouse under the watch of headbrewer Carston Haney. He produces a wide variety of beers, from the light, refreshing Siskiyou Golden Ale to the deep, impenetrable Black Bear Double Stout, which won the Gold Medal at the 2003 GABF and the Silver Medal in 2006 and 2008 in the foreign-style stout category. In addition, there is always at least one seasonal beer on tap to fit the mood of the season and one selection served on nitrogen.

name: Alaskan Brewing Company
description: Alaska has a rich history of brewing. From the explorers of the 1700s through the Gold Rush, many a thirsty Alaskan has been able to enjoy locally made beers.    In 1986, 28-year-olds Marcy and Geoff Larson reignited that tradition when they opened the Alaskan Brewing Company, the 67th brewery in the country and the first brewery in Juneau since Prohibition. Alaskan beers reflect many of the same characteristics of beers that were brewed here during the gold rush era. From the historically based Alaskan Amber recipe to alder-smoked malts and Sitka spruce tips, Alaskan beers reflect Juneau's local brewing history and innovation.    Marcy and Geoff were drawn to the beauty and adventure of Alaska, but finding a livelihood that would allow them to stay was a challenge. "Why not start a brewery?" a friend suggested. Other than the extreme financial and logistical challenges of brewing beer in the Last Frontier, they couldn't think of why not.    Maybe the idea wasn't so far-fetched. After all, Geoff was a chemical engineer and a homebrewer and was married to Marcy, an adventure-seeking accountant and aspiring bush pilot. Together they brought a unique skill set to the task of opening a brewery in Alaska.    While researching brewing in Alaska, Marcy unearthed shipping records from Douglas City Brewing Co. (1899-1907) that listed ingredients for its popular beers and a newspaper article that described the way it was brewed. Geoff homebrewed a batch of the Gold Rush-era brew and they could see what made it so popular. That beer is now known as Alaskan Amber.    In December 1986, Alaskan Brewing Co. officially began operations when Geoff, Marcy and 10 volunteers spent 12 hours hand packaging the first 253 cases of Alaskan Amber for distribution in Juneau, Alaska. From that very humble beginning, Alaskan Brewing Co. has grown to become the most award-winning craft brewery in the history of the Great American Beer Festival and expanded distribution to 14 states.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  8:00am - 5:00pm Tue:  11:00am - 5:00pm  Business hours:  8 a.m. - 5 p.m., Monday - Friday    Gift shop and tour hours:  Winter Hours: October - April: 11 a.m. - 5:00 p.m., Tuesday - Saturday  Summer Hours: May - September: 11 a.m. - 6 p.m., 7 days a week

name: Alcatraz Brewing Co
description: San Francisco's exciting sights and extraordinary cuisine have been captured for your enjoyment at Alcatraz Brewing Company!    Take a virtual vacation to San Francisco every time you visit one of our locations across the U.S. See scale replicas of the Golden Gate Bridge and a Chinese pagoda while sampling foods from famous Bay Area neighborhoods. Enjoy award-winning, hand crafted beers and cask ales. And be sure to leave room for our signature "The Rock" dessert.

name: Aldus Brewing
description: We want to take the fear out of craft beer. Well crafted beer thats easy to drink. Craft beer for All!

name: Ale Asylum
description: At ALE ASYLUM, we brew beers in the tradition of our friend Crusty Oldbrewer who sent us on this path: brew honest, brew like you mean it. Thus, our beer is brewed and bottled with our own hands on Madison’s East Side. In fact, ALE ASYLUM operates the only bottling facility in Madison.    ALE ASYLUM is unfiltered and all natural. We use no additives, preservatives, fruit, horse hooves, fish guts, or extracts. Our ingredient list: water, malt, hops, and yeast. This is what we mean when we say our beer is FERMENTED IN SANITY. You know who makes it, you know what it’s made with. You know after having one you’ll want another.    We brew traditional, bold beers for those who demand quality and consistency. To those people we say: raise a pint, because you believe how we believe.

name: Ale House Brewing Company
description: Located in San Jose California, we founded our brewery the principle of creating high quality, low volume, hand crafted beers. Ale House Brewing will take beers back to what they are meant to be - full bodied and flavorful. All of our beers are aged on oak to enhance the flavor profile and extract some of the natural sugars found in the wood. We invite you to experience our beers!

name: Ale Industries
description: The idea for Ale Industries started on the front porch of the Old River house, on Hammer Island, CA. Steve and Morgan brewed together almost every weekend, through scorching summers, wind and rain, and one time even through a flood! During the week they both worked at the local craft brewery, and learned how to turn their dream into an actual production brewery. Morgan sold the river house, and Steve sold everything he owned, then the two started down the path to Ale Industries.

name: Aleman Brewpub
description: Coming to Chicago in 2013

name: AleSmith Brewing Company
description: Forged in 1995, AleSmith is an artisan microbrewery that specializes in handcrafted ales in a variety of styles. Deeply rooted in the amateur and craft brewing communities, AleSmith ales have continued to garner national and international awards and acclaim, as well as a loyal and rabid following among beer enthusiasts.

description: Ali'i Brewing Company

name: All Saints Brewing Company
description: All Saints Brewing Company is a new craft brewery in Greensburg, PA. Our mission is to build a brand focused on selling locally manufactured craft beer, for beer people, by beer people. Consistently good tasting craft beer, brewed locally and with Western Pennsylvania pride and passion.    Our brew house is a 7 bbl system which was originally installed at the Red Star Brewery in Greensburg, PA. The system was expanded when brought to All Saints Brewing Company. This expansion allows us additional capacity in addition to providing the opportunity to brew a number of diverse craft brews along with seasonal specialties and Jeff’s world famous barley wines.

name: Allentown Brew Works
description: The Allentown Brew Works is housed inside the historic Harold's Furniture Building at 812 W Hamilton Street. Years in the making, the new Allentown restaurant and brewery are part of the continuing vision of the Fegley family that established the original Bethlehem Brew Works in 1998. Proud to be part of the resurging downtown, the 400 seat restaurant is a testament to the vibrant heartbeat that thrives in this Queen City. Offering two and a half levels of dining, plus state of the art banquet facilities in The Hamilton Room, and multiple bars offering different atmospheres, as well as an outdoor casual Biergarten and a new seductive lower level lounge, Silk.

name: Tall Paul’s Brewpub & Alligator Brewhouse
description: The Alligator brewery is a one-bbl in-house brewpub. We usually have at least ten or more rotating beers on draft at any given time.  Our focus is on the integration of new styles and old-world brewing methods, with a mindset somewhere in between mild reverence and gleeful irreverence.    Alligator is, for now, a very small operation, but we’re working hard to keep things interesting.

name: Alltech Lexington Brewing and Distilling Company
description: Welcome to our little microbrewery in the heart of downtown Lexington. People often ask us why a global company that’s in the business of science also owns a brewery. Well, to make a long story short, my forefathers in Ireland had their hand in the brewing business and crafting beer casks when barrels were made out of wood.    Today, my own family is in the business of making yeast that happens to also go into the making of beer. So, it was a natural for us to revive the brewery that has been in Lexington since 1794. Welcome and enjoy.
hoursOfOperation: Scheduled Tour Hours:  Monday - Friday at 3:00pm  Saturday at 1:00pm

name: Almanac Beer Co
description: Our artisanal ales are brewed in collaboration with select Northern California sustainable farms. Each limited release is a unique beer to be enjoyed with friends and savored around the seasonal table.

name: Almar Orchards
description: This Original Hard-Cider has been made on our family-owned farm in Flushing, Michigan for well over a hundred years. It was first pressed back in the 1850's. Not much as changed in the process since then. We use the same apples from the same orchards as my great-great grandfather did before the time of the Civil War. We are proud of that. It gives us a sense of history.    The cider has played an important role in the ongoing history of our farm. The sale of cider actually saved our farm during the Great Depression. And, during the Prohibition people came from far and wide for our "Special Farm Cider."

name: Aloha Beer Company
description: Aloha Beer Company embodies the classic Hawaii lifestyle. With the generous spirit of Aloha as a namesake, this is a premium beer that combines the smooth balance of ohana with the refreshing, hang-loose attitude of a Sunday barbecue. Every bottle of "Hawaii's Beer" is a heartfelt "wish you were here" message from the Islands of Aloha.    We can't create a Hawaiian sunrise, but we can brew the next best thing.

name: Alosta Brewing Co.
description: It is Alosta Brewing Co.’s mission to produce quality, craft ales and lagers, while incorporating the rich history of the San Gabriel Valley and outlying communities, into our products.

name: Alpha Brewing Co
description: Aggressive Ales.   Alpha Brewing Company is a St. Louis Microbrewery.

name: Alphabet City Brewing Company
description: Established in 2012 and proud to be one of the few New York City breweries. NYC has had a rich brewing history that reaches back over 100 years. This has given ACBC a strong foundation on which to build and offers a challenge we enthusiastically embrace everyday. We started as two roommates in the Alphabet City neighborhood of the East Village of NYC brewing beer in our kitchen and are excited to be on the verge of opening a brew pub there in the near future. We love beer and love sharing our beers with friends and that's what our style of brewing is all about. It's about camaraderie and the group experience. We provide brews for the table that everyone can gather around; brews perfect for the meal you're about to have or the story about to be shared - brews for celebrations and brews for collaboration - we brew for you.
hoursOfOperation: Fri:  12:00pm - 2:00am Sat:  12:00pm - 2:00am  Sun thru Thu: 12 noon to 12 midnight  Fri & Sat: 12 noon to 2 am

name: Alpine Beer Company
description: Alpine Beer Company opened its doors in the fall of 2002. Years before, an interest in craft brewing developed into an actual goal for the future. There were years of home brew competitions, brew science classes, and extended beer runs thinly disguised as vacations.   The brewery went through an expansion starting in late 2008 and became operational in mid 2009. Four double sized fermentors were installed in an old garage behind the current brewery. A cold box was erected adjacent to the garage and a bottling machine with a nice labeler are housed there too. There is a small barrel shed on the shady, north side of the garage.

name: Alpine Dog Brewing Company
description: Alpine Dog is a term coined for Coloradans. While we do love our dogs, this term goes deeper than that. It is a reflection of the people. In Colorado we love the mountains. It's where we go to play; it's where we go to exercise, relax, make friends and have fun getting away. Whether its crushing single track on a mountain bike, tearing up the slopes on skis or a snowboardi, hiking one of CO's 54 1...See More

name: Altamont Beer Works
description: Livermore is no longer only wine country! Altamont Beer Works is Livermore's future local brewery; owned and operated by Stephen Sartori and Greg Robles. Keep posted for updates and opening projections. Cheers!

name: Altamont Brewing Company
description: Brewer Gordon Kear, former brewer for Flagstaff Brewing Company for the past six years, and business partner Ben Wiggins wanted to bring more coolness to West Asheville. Their way of doing it, build a brewing company and bar with all the best Asheville has to offer. Known locally as “the bar”, the Altamont boasts a wide open floor plan with regulation ping-pong, a foosball table and single disc-golf basket. The place hosts a variety of musicians and dj’s weekly plus open mic-night every tuesday. While the brewing facility is still a work-in-progress, the Altamont has some of the finest locals on tap.    We're here make great beer people enjoy and provide a great place for drinking it! The Altamont is not your average bar. Kayaks are stored behind the bar, cyclists can ride right in, and dogs lounge around, asking for pretzel handouts.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  4:00pm - 2:00am Tue:  4:00pm - 2:00am Wed:  4:00pm - 2:00am Thu:  4:00pm - 2:00am Fri:  12:00pm - 2:00am Sat:  12:00pm - 2:00am Sun:  12:00pm - 2:00am  Mon - Thu: 4:00 pm - 2:00 am  Fri - Sun: 12:00 pm - 2:00 am

name: Altitude Chophouse & Brewery
description: Our brewery, which is nestled inside of our dining room walls, is primarily an ale producing brewery. Ninety five percent of all the beer we brew at Altitude is ale, including our award winning 7200’ Stout and Rosebud Strong Ale.    Our beer is brewed using single step and multi-step infusion mashing, which is patterned off the British brewing tradition.  All of our beer is made from four basic ingredients: malt, hops, yeast and water. Our recipes use American malts, hops from Europe and America, and yeast cultured from the traditional yeast stocks found throughout the world. We do not filter our beer.    We brew over 20 styles of beer throughout the year. We offer eight beers on tap year round and we pour up to three specialty beers at any given time.    We invite you to try Altitude’s microbrews and we hope you’ll like them as much as we do!

name: Alvarado Street Brewery & Grill
description: Neighborhood brewpub with an ingredient driven, locally sourced menu, harmonizing the flavors and aromas of our beer with that of our food.

name: Amalgamated Brewing Company
description: Amalgamated is a craft brewery and micro distillery in St. Louis, MO.     We offer a great selection of craft beer from our own brewasters, as well as from other distinctive craft brewers across country, in our three restaurants/brewpubs. We also distill handcrafted spirits, including 85 Lashes rum, which can be found in restaurants and liquor stores with good taste across the St. Louis metro area.

name: Ambacht Brewing
description: Ambacht Brewing makes Belgian-inspired ales using local organic ingredients. Our base malt is Great Western Malting's Organic 2-row and our hops come from the Willamette Valley. We bottle condition all our ales with northwestern honey (usually blackberry!).  Ambacht is the Flemish word for hand-crafted and our 5-barrel brewhouse is definitely hands-0n. Stop by for a visit!
hoursOfOperation: Open daily from Tuesday until Friday from 4 until 8 pm. Saturday and Sunday we will be at Farmers' Markets.

name: America's Brewing Company
description: It has been said that America’s Brewing Company is the epitome to the American Brewing Tradition; not just creating quality, handcrafted, small-batch brews but creating beers that have won three consecutive Gold Medals at the World Beer Cup Competitions.    In the 20th century (1996) the Roundhouse started bottling the Payton Pilsner, Honey Wheat and Rootbeer.  Now in the 21st century (2009), the beer selection has increased enormously!  Because you asked for it, now the Roundhouse also bottles: Payton Pilsner Light and Aurora Amber Ale.  This diverse selection of beer is now available not only in six-packs, but in four-packs as well.  Now you can enjoy...

name: American Brewing Company
description: American Brewing Company has been providing high quality, full flavored craft beers for the past two years. Our master brewer is Skip Madsen, an award winning, esteemed craftsman with deep roots in the history of micro brewing in the Pacific Northwest.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Tue:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Wed:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Thu:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  3:00pm - 10:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 10:00pm Sun:  12:00pm - 8:00pm  Mon - Thurs  - 3 pm - 9 pm  Fri:3:00 pm - 10 pm  Sat: 12 pm - 10:00 pm  Sun: 12 pm - 8:00 pm

name: American Dream Brewing
description: American Dream Brewing is a craft brewery coming to Simi Valley soon, offering quality, handcrafted, fresh, brewed beers for both wholesale and retail distribution.  We will have an on-premise tasting room to experience the full flavor taste of our craft brewed beers. We create both traditional beer styles as well as new styles with unique twists.      American Dream Brewing Company understands the passion that surrounds beer.  We pour that passion into every drop of our beer.  It’s that love to enjoy the best tasting beer that we use the highest quality ingredients.      We look forward to inviting you to enjoy the American Dream by drinking our beers and celebrating life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness!

name: American Honor Beer Company
description: Our classical revolutionary heroes including Henry, Franklin, Jefferson, and Washington set forth a paradigm to enable American prosperity and the creation of the greatest civilization in history. At American Honor Beer Company, our brews serve as a rallying point for those who cherish and commemorate America’s founding principles. General Liberty raises a toast to each and every American who honors the individual's natural rights to life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness.

name: American River Brewing
description: American River Brewing was formerly known as Brewers of Auburn and was sold to Hoppy Brewing before the Oatmeal Stout was brewed.

name: American River Brewing Company
description: NESTLED near the American River in Rancho Cordova, CA and located in a revitalized warehouse along Trade Center Drive is American River Brewing Company.    The dream-come-true of founder/brewer David Mathis and Head Brewer Andy Armstrong, American River Brewing Company encompasses the life-long passions of beer and the art/science of brewing.    Plans for the brewery began in 2010. After more than 15 years in the commercial brewing industry, we embarked on locating a useable location to house a production level brewery that would include a tasting room and space to grow. After an exhaustive search a home was found and construction began in the summer of 2011.    The original scope called for a modest 7 bbl brew house with tanks enough to manage 2000 bbl of production per year. After much re-thinking and soul-searching the brewery was increased in size to 15 bbl and room to grow to 10,000 bbls production per year. By October 2011, we started to formulate the first recipes.
hoursOfOperation: Wed:  4:00pm - 8:00pm Thu:  4:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 8:00pm  Wednesday-Friday 4:00pm - 8:00pm

name: American Sky Brewing Company
description: Hudson, Wisconsin Brewery, inspired by the spirit of American heroism and individuality represented by US aviators of World War II, American Sky aspires to be a great American brand known for inclusive, timeless beers that appeal to not only microbrew fanatics, but also that common thread inherent in all beer- drinking Americans.    Stop in our taproom, The Hangar, to have a pint, fill a growler, take a tour or shop our merchandise room. Hours of operation are listed above.

name: Amherst Brewing Company
description: Amherst Brewing Company is a full-service brewpub located in downtown Amherst, Massachusetts. Our 10-Barrel brewery is visible from the bar and produces some of the finest ales and lagers for serving in our 150-seat restaurant and 100-seat lounge and game room. Brewery tours can be made by appointment. Our giant, brass-top bar seats over 30 people and is fully stocked, including Single Malt Scotches and Small Batch Bourbons. An additional 40 seats are available on our seasonal patio; the best place in town to relax and enjoy an ABC draft or specialty brew while watching passersby. --From Amherst Website

name: Amicas Pizza, Microbrews and More
description: Amicas’ award winning brewery produces a wide spectrum of ales and lagers to accompany your meal. We’ve got delicious beer selections on tap, as well as our foamy house made root beer (made with honey and real vanilla).

name: Portland
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  3:00pm - 12:00pm Tue:  12:00pm - 12:00pm Wed:  12:00pm - 12:00pm Thu:  12:00pm - 12:00pm Fri:  12:00pm - 12:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 12:00pm Sun:  12:00pm - 12:00pm  Monday 3-12 p.m.  Tue - Sun 12-12 p.m.  Dogs Welcome, Minors Not

name: Washougal
hoursOfOperation: Wed, Thurs 3pm-close.  Fri, Sat, Sun 11am-close.

name: Amplified Ale Works
description: Alex Pierson and JC Hill got their noses in the restaurant business in 2009, opening the first California Kebab at San Diego State University. After a few years, it was clear they needed to spread the kebab love elsewhere, and decided on a run down old resturant site with an ocean view..    Craft beer has been a part of the concept since day 1, and JC's severe homebrewing addiction ignited the need for their own brewing system at the new establishment - Amplified Ale Works was born. Why Amplified you ask? Two parts – one, our obsession with live music (a band was formed between CK staff in 2009, playing in JC’s garage ever since), and two, our take on the meaning of Amplified- to us, it means intensifying the craft beer experience by staying true to our homebrewing roots. We hope to see you soon at CK Brewpub enjoying a fresh ale on our biergarten patio at the beach. Prost!

name: Anacapa Brewing Co
description: The Anacapa Brewing Company is Ventura?s only restaurant and brewery, or “Brewpub.”    We serve fresh, hand-crafted ales and lagers produced in our 12-tank stainless steel brewery by our Head Brewer Jason Coudray.

name: Anacortes Brewery
description: Our brewers focus on high quality ingredients, a carefully controlled process and delicate handling to provide one of the best beers you will find in the industry. We operate a seven barrel brewery designed and installed by Sound Brewing Systems of Seattle with vessels fabricated by Ripley Stainless in British Columbia. Our brewery features a cold room specially designed for lagering to provide our beers with a traditional character and complexity.

name: Anaheim Brewery
description: We’re a 140-year old company that just opened. That’s right! The first Anaheim Brewery opened in 1870, in downtown Anaheim. We took a 90 year break after National Prohibition closed the taps in 1920. Today, the home of the Anaheim Brewery is the Packard Building, a 1920s structure within the city’s Historic District. Located at 336 South Anaheim Boulevard, the Packard Building is one of the anchors for Anaheim’s Colony Marketplace. Stop by our Tasting Room and enjoy a glass of “Famous Anaheim Beer!” .
hoursOfOperation: Fri:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  11:00am - 9:00pm Sun:  11:00am - 6:00pm  Friday 4 pm – 9 pm  Saturday 11 am – 9 pm   Sunday 11 am – 6 pm

name: Anchor Brewing Company
description: Anchor Brewing Company’s roots date back to the California gold rush making it one of America’s oldest breweries. Its Anchor Steam® Beer is San Francisco’s original since 1896.     In 1965, Fritz Maytag acquired and revived the struggling brewery at a time when mass production of beer dominated and seemed unstoppable. Maytag started a revolution in beer that originated today’s craft beer movement.   An undisputed icon, Anchor is America’s first craft brewery where beers are handmade in our traditional copper brewhouse from an all-malt mash. At Anchor, we practice the time-honored art of classical brewing, employing state-of-the-art methods to ensure that our beers are always pure and fresh. We know of no brewery in the world that matches our efforts to combine traditional, natural brewing with such carefully applied, modern methods of sanitation, finishing, packaging and transporting.
hoursOfOperation: Two tours are available each weekday by reservation only.  For tour reservations call: 415-863-8350

name: Ancient Lakes Brewing Company
description: Ancient Lakes Brewing Company where we are passionate about making beer and work hard to brew beers that look good, smell good and taste good! Ours is a very small manufacturing brewery located in Grant County, just north and west of Quincy, Washington. Founded in August, 2010 by three families from the Quincy area, the Ancient Lakes Brewing Company currently has one brewer.    Our 2/3 barrel brewhouse produces small batches of beer that take about three weeks from brew-day to packaging-day. We hand-fill our Cornelius and 1/6 bbl kegs and hand-bottle/hand-pack each case of 22 ounce bottles.

name: Andean Brewing Company, Inc.
description: Imagine a place where ancient knowledge meets modern concepts, where tradition meets the distinct, a place where two elements fuse as one, a place so exhilarating it escapes the imagination. This union is only possible because of the long-standing tradition of the Andean people committing themselves to the Pachamama - Mother Earth.
hoursOfOperation: Fri:  4:00pm - 7:00pm  Fridays: 4:00 - 7:00 pm

name: Anderson Valley Brewing Company
description: We carefully craft our world-class ales using only the finest ingredients; premium malted and roasted grains, hops, yeast, and pristine Boonville water straight from our own unique aquifer, and we never heat pasteurize or sterile filter our beers. Our tradition of carefully crafting inspired, flavorful, ales of the highest caliber has earned numerous awards, a loyal following, and our two-time placement among the World Beer Championships® as well as a 2011 Gold Medal at the GABF® for our Brother David's Double.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  11:00am - 6:00pm Tue:  11:00am - 6:00pm Wed:  11:00am - 6:00pm Thu:  11:00am - 6:00pm Fri:  11:00am - 7:00pm Sat:  11:00am - 6:00pm Sun:  11:00am - 6:00pm  Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 6:00 pm  Fri: 11:00 am - 7:00 pm  Sat - Sun: 11:00 am - 6:00 pm

name: Andrews Brewing Company
description: Located in the town's first jail at Calaboose Cellars.
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  12:00pm - 5:00pm Fri:  12:00pm - 5:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 5:00pm  Thu - Sat: 12:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Angel City Brewing
description: Angel City Brewery is excited to be part of the brewing renaissance of Downtown LA by bringing old-world, small-batch, craft brewing to the new world of the expanding Arts District. We are committed to the continued growth and revitalization of our neighborhood by being an interactive and supportive partner to the arts and business communities, as well as the burgeoning craft beer movement in Los Angeles.    Angel City Brewing was founded in 1997. Starting modestly, Angel City quickly became a leader in the LA craft beer scene. In 2004 Angel City bought an 8,000 barrel German-made brewery in Alpine Village near Los Angeles on EBay! and lovingly restored the facility. In late 2010, Angel City relocated the brewery to the historic John A. Roebling Building in LA’s Downtown Arts District. The vision was, and remains, to give this great city a great brewery.    On January 5, 2012, Angel City Brewery was acquired by Alchemy & Science, a craft beer collaboration led by Alan Newman and Stacey Steinmetz, formerly of Magic Hat Brewing Company.    Since January 2012, we’ve undergone massive renovations, including the addition of a new mustache bar. We began brewing in April of 2012, and started popping up in local LA bars and restaurants soon thereafter.    In February 2013, we opened the doors to the Brewery and Public House, but with limited hours as construction continued. We offer an ever-rotating selection of Angel City beer on tap, which includes a number of beers exclusively available at the Brewery. In addition to pints and flights, we offer brewery tours, events, and a great place to gather with friends. We have a small on-site retail store as well. Outside food is always welcome, and there are a number of great locations in our neighborhood that offer take out. In addition to the neighborhood cuisine, our parking lot has become a hot spot for food trucks, with one parked outside nearly every night we’re open. On May 5th, 2013 we had our grand opening with our first ever Heritage Festival. We’re now seven days a week for brewery tours and tastings, and we have full roster of weekly events.

name: Angry Chair Brewing
description: A small Craft brewery featuring artisanal ales.

name: Angry Erik Brewing
description: A new craft microbrewery set to open in early 2014. "Passionate about beer, serious about our passion!"

name: Antietam Brewery
description: Our journey began with the opening of Benny's Pub 5 years ago. We have become known for our excellence in customer service and our strong passion for creating the best experiences and memories for our patrons. We are an American version of the throw-back 'Public Houses' that were the forefathers of today's 'Pubs'. We create delicious soups from scratch, unique sandwiches and dinner entrees using the best local ingredients.    Crafting delicious beer was the next natural step for Benny's Pub. Our loyal customers are passionate about the food and beer they drink- and we promise to deliver. Consumers want healthy, organic produce and food- and they want it to be local. Our menu highlights local meats, fresh cheeses and now hand-crafted beer brewed right in front of you.

name: Apocalypse Ale Works
description: Apocalypse Ale Works is the first brewery in Forest, Virginia since Thomas Jefferson brewed in the 1800's at Poplar Forest. In addition to a brewery, we also have a tasting room, where the public can try our products. We are located in the old Forest Volunteer Fire Department, beside Pints O'Plenty. The brewery will sell kegs all over the state of Virginia, with an emphasis on supplying the local restaurants first. Eventually we will expand to bottling our beer. Our mission is to brew quality beer for all palates. The end of bad beer is here!
hoursOfOperation: Wed:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Thu:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 11:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 11:00pm Sun:  12:00pm - 7:00pm  Wed - Thu: 4:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Fri: 4:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: Apocalypse Brew Works
description: Brewery and Taproom in Louisville, KY brewing beer for the masses and for your survival. Drink beer til the end of the world!

name: Harrisburg
description: Appalachian Brewing Company is located in a historic downtown building. We are proud to be the first brewery in the Pennsylvania State Capital since 1951. ABC serves fresh innovative cuisine to match our tremendous handcrafted ales and lagers!
