name: Appalachian Mountain Brewery
description: The Appalachian Mountain Brewery (AMB) is a craft brewery located in the heart of North Carolina’s High Country. Home of the Appalachian State Mountaineers, Boone has countless outdoor activities at your fingertips: rock climbing, hiking, biking, kayaking, skiing, snowboarding, and more! AMB supplies fresh, flavorful beer to the High Country, while maintaining a strong emphasis on both sustainable values and the local community.    Although our craft is beer, AMB is much more than a brewery. Our founding principles go well beyond the pint glass and focus on ideals that strive to empower individuals, support local enterprise, and give back to the greater Appalachian region.  This can best be summarized in our motto:  ”Act Local. Drink Local.”    We will set a new precedent within the brewing industry through an intimate knowledge of the science behind sustainability and a strong desire to improve the current status quo in the field.  We will utilize photovoltaic solar panels, native rain gardens and wetlands, rain water harvesting, and local farm collaboration. Through these efforts AMB will make the highest quality beer while maintaining the highest quality of respect for not only the local community but also the planet at large.    Act Local. Drink Local.

name: Apple Blossom Brewing Company
description: Evan McDonald, Ching Mong, Al Shaffer, Daniel Smith, Sammie Stephenson, and Joe Utsch would like to announce the start of construction of The Apple Blossom Brewing Company!    Named after the Arkansas state flower, the 8,500 square foot, 250 seat brewpub will be a celebration of all things local, from the food to the ingredients in the beer.  The 10 barrel brewing system will be the birthplace of many varied styles and flavors, with an eye to the emerging trends coming from the coasts and Colorado. Fayetteville can expect the traditional favorites, such as pale ales and ESB's, but should also be ready for tantilising and challenging specials and seasonals.     The kitchen will be headed by Joe Utsch, who wowed Fayetteville years ago with his menu at Joe's Bistro. Soups, salads, sandwiches, and focaccia pizzas will be flagship menu items, all featuring either ABBC beer as an ingredient or as a recommended pairing. Weekends and evening will be graced with exciting and delicious specials, dreamed up in the minds of our chefs and made with the finest and freshest that can be found locally.

name: Appleton Beer Factory
description: From the self-performed renovation to the custom-fabricated brew train, Appleton Beer Factory was built to immerse patrons in beer culture & display the brewing process. We’re proud of our beer & want you to witness its journey from tun to tongue.    We have an obvious and delicious priority – beer. Our goal is to put top-notch brew in your glass while putting you in a friendly and fun atmosphere. Appleton Beer Factory beers are crafted to deliver what is so often missing from many beers on the market today – balance. This balance was struck from passionate experimentation by knowledgeable brewers who have focused on respecting the ingredients they use and the people they serve.

name: Appleton Brewing
description: Appleton Brewing is under new management as of October 2004. On January 1, 2005, the new owners, Steve and Tom Lonsway, changed the brewpub's name to Stone Cellar Brewpub & Restaurant.

name: Arbor Brewing Company
description: Our love affair with beer began in 1991 with our first batch of homebrew. Eventually the brewing operation took over the kitchen and basement and we decided it was time to look for larger digs. So with the help of family and friends, we opened the ABC Brewpub a brewery and restaurant in Ann Arbor, Michigan in 1995.

name: Arcade Brewery
description: Arcade Brewery is a prospective production brewery. We want to create a deeper connection between our customers and their beer. Our goal is to create amazingly delicious craft beer with the help of our customers. With design challenges posted on our website, our customers will create and choose most aspects of beer creation from packaging/label design to even the ingredients that go into some of our seasonal beers. We want our customers to have greater control over the beer that they drink. Plus, we like to have fun and want to deliver you an amazing experience through your beer.    Arcade Brewery is also collaborating with amazing comic book artists and writers to bring label and packaging design to a whole new level of awesomeness. We are currently working with the talented Tony Moore (The Walking Dead), Eisner-nominated writer Jason Aaron (Scalped, Wolverine, PunisherMAX), and graphic artist Seibei.  Arcade Brewery is fun. We don’t believe in pretentious brews, but we do believe in great beers that satisfy our customers educated palette.     Arcade Brewery is only limited to your imagination. Make the next beer your beer.

name: Arcadia Brewing Company
description: Arcadia Brewing Company was established in 1996 as a microbrewery specializing in handcrafted British-style ales. All of our beers are produced in small batches, and our 25 Barrel Peter Austin Brewery and methods originated in England, which allows this style of beer to reflect over 250 years of world class brewing heritage.    In addition to brewing on authentic British equipment, Arcadia uses only the finest malted barley from England, and when combined with the freshest hops from the Pacific Northwest of our United States, and our legendary Ringwood yeast, the result is some of the best and freshest handcrafted ales available, on any continent.

name: Arcana Brewing Company
description: Craft brewery definitely in the microbrewery or nano scale at 3.5 bbl per batch, our brewing facility and tasting room are located in the Carlsbad Gateway Center business park between El Camino Real and Palmer Way.  Open four days a week, you can come in and enjoy various sized tastings of all of our current beers, get growler fills to-go, and relax and enjoy the atmosphere with friends and fellow beer fans.  We're a 21+ facility, but can make limited exceptions for designated drivers and certain other cases (on Thursday & Sunday) if you check with us ahead of time.  Drink well and do good work!

description: Micro Brewery on the Southern Oregon Coast with a 15 barrel brewhouse and 30 barrel fermenters.

name: Arclight Brewing
description: A purveyor of fine hand crafted ales.

name: Ardent Craft Ales
description: We are a craft brewery located in Richmond, Virginia. Beginning in June of 2014, our beer will be available in our taproom and beer garden, as well as on draft at local restaurants.
hoursOfOperation: Wed:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Thu:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  11:00am - 9:00pm Sun:  11:00am - 6:00pm  Wed - Fri: 4:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 6:00 pm

name: Area 51 Craft Brewery
description: Area 51 Craft Brewery was founded by Mike Hawkins of Rialto, California.  His vision of becoming a unique brewer in a competitive business is a success story in the creation of "Alien Head Beer", which is now known worldwide.  He started very small, but is now growing at an unbelieveable pace, thanks to a lot of hard work finally paying off and a lot of prayers being answered.   Says Mike: "Initially, I decided to make everything from scratch because I couldn't afford to buy whatI needed.  Once I made a 1932 yellow deuce coupe in my garage and it became a beautiful running hot rod.  A buddy of mine told me "If I could do that, then I could make a brewery come true!"  That really stuck with me.  Little Area 51 Craft Brewery takes a chance in a worldwide market and it was a good choice according to an ever growing popularity.  Why Alien Head Beer? Earthly beers are brewed somewhat similar ways and have a common process.  Alien Head Beer is actually brewed in a special process that is unlike other breweries and delivers a taste that is out of this world!  "We're already thinking ahead and out of the box of what may come next.  Maybe one day soon, we'll think of something crazier!" says Mike.
hoursOfOperation: Wed:  1:00pm - 6:00pm Thu:  1:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  1:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  1:00pm - 6:00pm  Wed: 1:00pm to 6:00pm  Thurs & Fri 1:00pm to 9:00pm  Sat 1:00pm to 6:00pm

name: Argilla Brewing Co. @ Pietro's Pizza
description: We first opened our doors in Prices Corner in 1978, later settling in Pike Creek for over 20 years. After Homebrewing for several years, we've decided to expand to our new location (2667 Kirkwood Highway - Newark, DE) and install a 1.5 barrel brewery, making us the smallest brewery in the state of Delaware. We brew beers to please all kinds, including an Amber Ale, Rye Stout and an IPA that recently won a ribbon at the Delaware State Fair Battle of the Brews.    Since we're so small, we'll be sure to experiment with several different styles of beer, so there will always be something new to check out.  Along with the beer, we'll have the same great pizzas we've been serving up for over 33 years. We'll also have soups, salads, pub sandwiches and select entrees. Also be on the lookout for our occasional beer dinners and pizza beer dinners.   We're just as passionate about our food as we are about our beer.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  11:00am - 1:00am Tue:  11:00am - 1:00am Wed:  11:00am - 1:00am Thu:  11:00am - 1:00am Fri:  11:00am - 1:00am Sat:  11:00am - 1:00am Sun:  11:00am - 1:00am  11am-1am 7 days a week

name: Argyle Brewing Company
description: Argyle Brewing Company is a small brewery operating under a New York Farm Brewery license, meaning a certain amount of our ingredients come from right here in New York State! With a combined 30 years of brewing experience between them, founders Matt Stewart and Chris Castrio are passionate about beer and dedicated to supporting our local farmers. Local hops and malts will combine with water and the finest yeasts to create several regular offerings and a variety of seasonal brews.     Matt and Chris both hail from the farming community of Argyle, New York, but since Argyle is a dry town, our brewery is located in the fine Village of Greenwich.

name: Arizona Wilderness Brewing Company
description: For years we've dreamed of bringing together our two loves: The beautiful and diverse state of Arizona together with hand crafted, artisanal ales. While backpacking the wondrous depths of Arizona we forged ideas that would one day become Arizona Wilderness Brewing Co. Well, here we are! We will continue our endeavor into the remote beauties of both the Arizona Wilderness and Craft Beer.    Our belief is that beer is more than a beverage to guzzle on Sundays, just another beverage at the party, or cheap yellow fizzy stuff dad drank while wearing his dirty flannel shirts. Beer is culture and we have a true PASSION for this amazing beverage! Check out our food menu, as it was created to pair quite nicely with our fine ales. C’mon in and see what we are up to next!

name: Arkose Brewery
description: We are a microbrewery in Palmer, Alaska offering fresh, locally-brewed beer in our tasting room “The Growler Cache.” Enjoy a flight of tasters or a pint while we fill your growler. Logo pint glasses, logo taster glasses, and U.S. made apparel in 100% organic cotton and recycled environmentally-friendly fabrics also available.
hoursOfOperation: Tue:  2:00pm - 8:00pm Wed:  2:00pm - 8:00pm Thu:  2:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  2:00pm - 8:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 8:00pm  Tuesdays - Fridays: 2 - 8 p.m.  Saturdays: Noon - 8 p.m.  Closed Sundays, Mondays, & Holidays

name: Armadillo Ale Works
description: Our mission is to give Denton, TX fresh, handcrafted beers that are as unique as it is. We believe that bigger is not necessarily better, and good things come in small packages: like babies, puppies, and kittens. We believe our beer should be no different. By staying small, we’ll be able to devote the time, care, and love to each beer.

name: Artisan's Brewery & Italian Grill
description: At Artisan's Brewery, "Beer is Art".  Our Brewmaster Dave Hoffman hand selects hops and malted barley from only quality suppliers.    All of our beers are handcrafted in the on premise Brewery, made from our Brewmaster’s own recipes.    We proudly brew a variety of traditional beer styles and more distinctive specialty ales and lagers.

name: Arvada Beer Company
description: Arvada Beer Company is located in Olde Town Arvada, CO. Arvada Beer Company is the first Micro Brewery in the city of Arvada.    Arvada Beer Company is considered a “micro-brewery”, which produces beer that is wholesaled to pubs, taverns and restaurants in the city of Arvada, throughout Jefferson County, and  to the broader regional market.    Our tasting room allows you to view the operation of the brewery, purchase beer by the glass, growlers and kegs of beer to go, and retail items such as T-shirts and glassware with our logo.    Arvada Beer Company is different than most microbreweries due to our large tasting room. We have approximately 150 seats.    We have 14 taps that allow us to have specialty beers as well as our flagship beers on tap at all times.    Arvada Beer Company produces beer with a 7-barrel, stainless steel brewing plant.

name: Asher Brewing Company
description: At Asher Brewing Company our mission is operate a successful brewery that produces world-class certified organic ales, while utilizing environmentally sustainable and socially responsible business practices. Our brewery is run on 100% wind power!    Chris Asher decided that the Boulder market deserved to have locally brewed organic beers. After nearly a year of planning, research, and hard work building a brewery, Asher Brewing Company opened the doors for business on November 20th, 2009.      On February 25th, 2010 organic certification was issued for all beers at Asher Brewing Company; making it the first all organic brewery in the state of Colorado. Organic ingredients are better for the consumer, better for the environment, and better for the beer. (Studies have shown that pesticides are detrimental to the shelf-life of beer.)    USDA Organic Brewery
hoursOfOperation: Sat:  2:00pm - 10:00pm Sun:  2:00pm - 10:00pm Thu:  2:00pm - 12:00am Fri:  2:00pm - 12:00am  Tap Room Hours:  Sat-Wed  2pm-10pm  Thurs/Fri 2pm - 12am

name: North Asheville
description: A gem to the Asheville micro-brewing scene, Asheville Brewing creates it's own unique draw for the locals and visitors alike!! Along with our well known craft brews... SHIVA IPA, HOUDINI ESP, NINJA PORTER, ROCKET GIRL ALE, SCOTTISH BROWN, ROLANDS E.S.B, as well as limited addition Ales.... we also offer a full liqour bar at our Coxe Ave location, with daily drink specials!!     We offer a full, fantastic food menu, including our "famous" pizza buffet during the week 11-3.    Our Coxe Ave location offers a "Beer Infuser Creation" every Thursday at 5:30!!
hoursOfOperation: Open 7 Days a week 11am until Midnight

name: Downtown Asheville
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Thursday 11am until Midnight  Friday 11am until 2am  Saturday Noon until 2am, Sunday Noon until Midnight

name: Ashtown Brewing Company
description: Ashtown was conceptualized on a cold morning around a homebrewing setup in Longview Washington by two cousins who found themselves on a map in between two craft beer meccas and knew something needed to change to bring good beer to a vacant area.    In September of 2013 Ashtown opened their doors bringing local hand crafted ales to Southwest Washington. Ashtown believes in its community and the change it can make on a local level.
hoursOfOperation: Wed:  3:00pm - 10:00pm Fri:  3:00pm - 10:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 10:00pm  WED/TH/FRI 3-10pm  SAT 12-10pm  SUN 1-6

name: Aslan Brewing Company
description: Aslan Brewing Company is a local microbrewery committed to pushing the boundaries of craft beer while preserving the purity of brewing tradition. We only use the finest certified organic ingredients the Pacific Northwest has to offer, creating some of the cleanest and most unique brews in the market today. Truly dank brew; Pride of the Organic Northwest.

name: Ass Clown Brewing Company
description: We are a small handcrafted Brewing Company that specialize in unique flavors. We use only the best ingredients, and use organic whenever it is available.    We believe in making a product that is NOT based off of a profit model, but uses the best local organic ingredients (when available).                                 We also believe it is important to know what is in the beer you drink and that it is made in an environmentally responsible way.  Ass Clown Brewing strives to be  a "green" brewing company that uses alternative energy and finds uses for brewing waste. For example, our warehouse will have recycled items, lights, furniture and equipment.     Local ingredients will also be a focus for Ass Clown Brewing Company. We grow our own hops.  As our production expands we will be looking for North Carolina hop growing farms, malting farms, spices and fruits.
hoursOfOperation: 9:30 - 5:30 Monday to Friday

name: Ass Kisser Ales
description: Ass Kisser Beverage Company is based in Fort Worth, Texas. We are a family owned company from South Australia. It is operated by Rocland Wine Imports. The Ales are brewed at our brewery in San Jose, CA.     The Line includes a Double IPA, Smoked Porter, Vanilla Pale Ale, Hefewiezen and a Strawberry Wit.     Ass Kisser Ales is a state of mind. Just as you contemplate the flavors and aromas of this fine ale, you can comtemplate sharing it with your friend or your boss. Maybe they are one in the same or maybe not! We are Just Sayin!

name: Atlas Brew Works
description: A packaging craft brewery in the District of Columbia. Atlas Brew Works focuses on providing D.C. with fresh, craft ales and lagers.

name: Atlas Brewing Company
description: Atlas Brewing Company is a state of the art small batch brewery. From Atlas Golden Ale to the Andromeda Milk Stout, or the Sweet Oblivion Strong Dark Ale, aged with oak and tawny port, Brewers Ben and John Saller have developed an impressive range of craft beer.

name: Atomic Ale Brewpub and Eatery
description: Founded by Aaron Burks in 1997, Atomic Ale Brewpub & Eatery is the Tri-Cities’ first brewpub. We feature a distinctive menu cooked in the Tri-Cities’ original wood-fired oven to complement our fresh, full-flavored handcrafted ales. Set in an atmosphere that reflects the rich history of the Mid-Columbia basin and the Hanford Site, we work hard to provide an exceptional dining experience.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  11:00am - 10:00pm Tue:  11:00am - 10:00pm Wed:  11:00am - 10:00pm Thu:  11:00am - 10:00pm Fri:  11:00am - 11:00pm Sat:  11:00am - 11:00pm Sun:  11:00am - 8:00pm  Monday – Thursday – 11:00 am – 10:00 pm (last seating)  Friday – Saturday – 11:00 am – 11:00 pm (last seating)  Sunday – 11:00 am – 8:00 pm (last seating)

name: Atwater Brewery
description: Atwater Block Brewery, founded in 1997, is housed in a 1916 factory warehouse located in Detroit's historic Rivertown district. Brewing relentlessly on our imported Kaspar Schultz system, we've ridden the wave of aggressive ales while holding true to our German roots through our traditional Lagers. With drinkability and tradition at heart, it's easy for us to "Drink Our Share and Sell the Rest"!

name: Auburn Alehouse
description: A recent addition to Old Town Auburn, the Auburn Alehouse Brewery and Restaurant is located in the historic American Block Building at 289 Washington Street in Old Town Auburn, California. You may better remember the building as the former home of the Shanghai Restaurant and bar, where scenes from the movie, Phenomenon were filmed.    The ambiance of the Auburn Alehouse combines the charm and character of this historic brick and mortar building with the bold industrial elements of a gleaming 10-barrel microbrewery.    Guests and friends can enjoy lunch, dinner, and libation while watching the freshly crafted beer they are drinking being produced just a few feet away.    There is also an outdoor patio with a great view of the historic Auburn courthouse. There are always at least 6-8 beers on tap and Hard Cider and select "guest" craft beers are also available on draught. Interestingly, the Auburn Alehouse is located just 1/10th of a mile from the original Auburn Brewery, which brewed for thirsty Auburnites from 1855 until 1908. You may stop by for the ale, but you’ll find the food is a star attraction as well. Whether you’re in the mood for pub fare or a sit down dinner, there is something for every one at the Alehouse.

name: August Schell Brewing Company
description: The August Schell Brewing Company is a brewing company in New Ulm, Minnesota. It was founded by German immigrants August Schell and Jacob Bernhardt in 1860 and passed into the possession of the Schell family in 1866. It is the second oldest family-owned brewery in America and became the oldest and largest brewery in Minnesota when the company bought the Grain Belt rights in 2002.
hoursOfOperation: Brewery Gift Shop  Open daily 11am - 5pm.    Brewery Tours:  September - May  Friday 3:00 pm  Saturday: Noon, 1:00, 2:00, 3:00, and 4:00  Sunday (Sept. - Dec.): 1:00, 2:00, 3:00, and 4:00  Sunday (Jan. - May): 1:00    Summer Schedule  Tours run daily Memorial Day through Labor Day  Monday through Friday:  1:00, 2:30 and 4:00  Saturday:  Noon, 1:00, 2:00, 3:00 and 4:00  Sunday:  1:00, 2:00, 3:00 and 4:00

name: Augusta Brew Haus & Bier Garden - Main Brewery
description: The Augusta Brewing Company & Beer Garden is located on the KATY Trail in Augusta, Missouri.  With Augusta's strong German heritage, there always been a love of great beers. Our hope is to revive this tradition by serving our own Beer in this unique setting.

name: Austin Beerworks
description: Austin Beerworks is an owner-operated Texas brewery hell-bent on excellence. Our beers are canned for quality. We brew for two reasons: to make consistently exceptional craft beer, and to build community in the town we love.

name: Automatic Brewing Co.
description: Automatic Brewing Co is anything but automatic.

name: Avenues Proper Restaurant and Publick House
description: New Restaurant & Small Batch Brewery In The Avenues of Salt Lake City, Utah.

name: Avery Brewing Company
description: Since 1993 our brewery has been committed to producing eccentric ales and lagers that defy styles or categories. Our products are thoroughly American at heart: blending Old World tradition and expertise with ingenuity, creativity and boldness.
hoursOfOperation: Avery Tap Room Hours: 11AM to 11PM - 7 days a week.  Brewery Tours are at 4PM weekdays and 2PM on weekends.

name: Aviator Brewing Company
description: Aviator Brewing Company was started to provide fine ales and lagers in North Carolina.    We also got sick of driving to the store all the time to buy beer so we thought...what the heck....lets brew lots of beer and drink most of it ourselves.
hoursOfOperation: Thursday & Friday – We open the doors at 5pm, single tour at 6pm and close at 8pm. Note there is only one tour at 6pm.    Saturday – We open the doors at 3pm, and do tours from 4pm-6pm and close at 8pm.  No tours after 6pm.

name: Tap House

name: SmokeHouse Restaurant
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  11:30am - 10:00pm Tue:  11:30am - 10:00pm Wed:  11:30am - 10:00pm Thu:  11:30am - 10:00pm Fri:  11:30am - 10:00pm Sat:  11:30am - 11:00pm Sun:  12:00pm - 9:00pm  Mon-Fri 11:30am-10pm  Sat 11:30am-11pm  Sun Noon-9pm

name: Avondale Brewing Company
description: Combine the charm of a historic town, the passions of several good friends, a rooted respect for the craft of brewing and you have unearthed the beginning of what Avondale Brewing Company is all about. A byproduct of the collaboration between Coby Lake, Hunter Lake and Craig Shaw, ABC is a locally owned and operated brewery in the heart of the Deep South with an unmistakable affection for hand-crafted brews.    As you'll discover throughout our website and branding, Avondale Brewing Company is rooted in layers of rich history. We are a young brewery built on years of knowledge, experience, and family bonds. We brew from the heart and pour from the hip. We are confident that you will fall in love with the beer we brew and the stories we tell! Cheers to good beer!

name: Aztec Brewing Company
description: ABC. Aztec Brewing Company - rediscovered by John Webster in 2008. Aztec Brewery specializes in California Ales and Mexican-style lagers. Come in and learn more about the Aztec Story and the cervezas especiales. aztecbrewery.com blog.californiabeerco.com
hoursOfOperation: Wed:  4:00pm - 8:00pm Thu:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  1:00pm - 9:00pm Sun:  1:00pm - 7:00pm  Wed: 4:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Thu - Fri: 4:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 1:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun: 1:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: Main Meadery
description: Known for the most amazing and creative alcoholic beverages made from honey. B. Nektar is a world-wide sensation.    To boldly go where no meadery has gone before. To prove to you that the horrible mead your best friend made one time in college is NOT what a good mead should taste like. To show you that mead doesn't HAVE to be sweet. To educate you on the different styles of mead. To bring mead into the mainstream, but still maintain our integrity. To everyday thank my mom and tell her that I love her (shouldn't we all?).
hoursOfOperation: Fri:  5:30pm - 10:00pm Sat:  1:00pm - 7:00pm  Fri: 5:30 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat: 1:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: B.O.B.'s House Of Brews
description: B.O.B.'s Brewery is heading in a fresh direction with a new Brewmaster and attitude. Brewmaster, John Svaboda, has brought a wealth of experience and talent with him to The B.O.B. The result has been the highest quality microbrews the brewery has ever produced. Along with technical know how, John has introduced an air of fun, ingenuity and tempered insanity with some of the most unique and delicious special batch brews ever available at The B.O.B. The Mango Chipotle and Papaya Peach Ginger ales come to mind most immediately. For the more traditional beer connoisseur we have our standard brews - Afterglow Amber, Nautical Dawn Pale and Platinum Blonde. John also rotates classic brews such as Stouts, Porters and Wheats.

name: Bacchus Brewing Company
description: At Bacchus Brewing Company, we start each day with a singular focus. We love what we do and want to provide you with only the highest quality beer. Every beer we produce is made with premium ingredients and attention to detail. The quality of our beer reflects who we are and what we care about. We encourage you to sit back, relax, and enjoy an exceptional taste of the Finger Lakes. Visit us in person or at www.bacchusbrewing.com.
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  4:00pm - 6:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 6:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 6:00pm  Thu - Fri:4:00 pm - 6:00 pm  Sat:12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Back Alley Brewery
description: Back Alley Brewery was established in 2012 as a privately owned brewery and sports bar. It offers several hand crafted beers and ales. Come join us for great brew and watch your favorite sporting events.

name: Back Bay Brewing
description: Back Bay Brewing Co was founded in 2011 by a group of Virginia Beach friends. With deep roots in Virginia Beach’s Back Bay, Charlie Burroughs and Josh Canada were in a duck blind discussing their dream of brewing their own beer when they decided to make that dream a reality. They brought on three life-long friends and Virginia Beach natives, George Powell, Will Yearick, and Josh Malbon who all share their passion for beer and the outdoors. A year later, with each partner bringing a unique skill set, Back Bay Brewing Co. is proud to announce the release of their locally brewed False Cape Ale.

name: Back East Brewing Company
description: Back East was formed by Edward Fabrycki, Jr. and Tony Karlowicz, two cousins with a passion for great-tasting, high-quality beer. Back East brews several different styles of high-quality ales and lagers and distributed on draft and in 64 oz growlers and 750 ml bottles at fine establishments throughout the Greater Hartford area.     Although originally from Connecticut, Edward began to home-brew while living in San Diego in the early 1990s. He eventually moved Back East to Connecticut in 2000, with the dream of someday operating a Craft brewery. As a Professional Engineer, Edward enjoys the technical aspects of brewing. Tony developed his appreciation for Craft beer during his college years in Vermont, and always imagined launching a brewery. An entrepreneur at heart and a CPA with extensive experience in accounting, auditing, and insurance, Tony loves building a successful business from the ground up. Tony and Edward began homebrewing and experimenting with different recipes in early 2006, and immersed themselves in all things Craft beer.     Over this time, we have developed several exciting recipes that we are proud to put the Back East name on. Our beer will be brewed at our small, but state-of-the-art brewery in Bloomfield.

name: Back Forty Beer Company
description: Back Forty is a micro brewery based out of Gadsden, Alabama. With 2 offerings currently distributed throughout the state, Back Forty is the only Alabama based brewery that can be found anywhere from Muscle Shoals to Mobile.    The name Back Forty Beer Company is basically a reference to the back 40 acres of the farm. Tradionally the "Back 40" of a farm is the most challenging to maintain, but also produces some of the best yields due to the rich content of the earth. Likewise, Alabama was one of the last States in The Union to update it's outdated beer laws (MS is the only one left), and now it's time to reap those yields.    The craft beer market in Alabama has a lot of room to grow, and we plan on doing everything we can to make that happen. Our main goal is to focus on the local community and support other small business owners while offering up our tasty flavors for the people of Alabama.     The company is founded in Alabama, and just about every aspect of this business is supported by Alabama based suppliers. We've worked with a Design firm out of Athens, AL on our label and logos, our attorney is in Birmingham, our accountant is in Dothan, AL, our shirts are printed in Huntsville and our Brewmaster is out of Montgomery, AL.     We've been working with Jamie Ray (A nationally recognized Brewmaster who has won several medals at the Great American Beer Festival in Denver, CO), for over a year on our first offering, "Naked Pig Pale Ale". And we have several ideas in the works for additional year round offerings in the coming months. We're looking forward to producing some great beers that Alabamian's have never tasted before. Once things get up and running, we'll start releasing some seasonal offerings, one-time offerings, limited edition batches, etc. That's what we're really excited about.    The only aspect of this operation that isn't planted firmly in Alabama soil, is the production and packaging. We had to go to another craft brewery in a neighboring state for our first production batches. This is partially due to the enormous start-up costs associated with building a complete brewery operation from scratch. But it's also given us the opportunity to support another regional micro-brewery while we get up and running.

name: Back Road Brewery
description: "We put LaPorte on the beer Map"    "Small brewery big beers"
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  4:00pm - 6:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 6:00pm Sat:  1:00pm - 4:00pm Sun:  2:00pm - 4:00pm  Thurs - Fri: 4:00 to 6:00 PM  Saturday 1:00 to 4:00 PM  Sunday 2:00 to 4:00 PM

name: Irvine
description: Our neighborhood brewpubs bring together Lamppost Pizza's award winning pizza with the freshest handcrafted ales and lagers.    Our brewmasters use traditional brewing methods along with the finest imported ingredients available. We brew our beers in small batches to ensure freshness and quality. Although our methods are more expensive, we believe this process creates the best tasting beer.    As a brewpub, we allow our brewmasters more freedom to brew a variety of styles, and we have a constantly rotating variety of beers on tap. Our brewmasters create four to seven variety beers, while keeping four favorite, constant brews always on tap.

name: Backcountry Brewery
description: Frisco’s Backcountry Brewery and Restaurant was established in 1996 by a group of Frisco and Summit County residents with a desire to bring great brews and food to their community for the enjoyment of locals and visitors alike.  Backcountry is the second oldest brewpub in summit county. The property (site) Acquired in 1994 by the Mount Royal Brewing Company joined forces with our founding brewmaster and managing partner Anthony Carestia and construction of the Mount Royal Plaza quickly ensued.  The Brewery and Restaurant opened on September16, 1996. Over our 14 year history the Backcountry has established itself as a sanctuary for Summit County visitors and locals longing for great brews, great food and great views. We take great pride in offering diverse ales, lagers and American pub fare. Enjoy!
hoursOfOperation: Fri:  11:30am - 12:00am Sat:  11:30am - 12:00am Sun:  11:30am - 11:00pm  11:30 a.m. - Midnight Friday & Saturday  11:30 a.m. - 11 p.m. Sunday - Thursday

name: Backlash Beer Company
description: It’s time to stand up against the predictable, old beer establishment and craft beers the way they were intended: flavorful, gimmick free and not produced in ridiculous quantities. We’re a Boston company with a Boston attitude, here to reclaim beer by recruiting people to fuel the craft beer movement.    Join the Backlash.

name: Backpocket Brewing
description: Backpocket Beer is German-inspired and hand-crafted right here in Iowa. We strive to provide Iowans with a simple, enjoyable world-class beer.

name: Backshore Brewing Company
description: There's something about the beach that feeds your soul, keeps you young, and demands your return. Of the millions who visit, a few are distracted by romantic visions of life at the beach and are left behind, never to return to the "real world." It's an existence unaffected by time or authority. Days and nights blend together, signaled by sunrises over the ocean and sunsets in the bay. Their hearts become gorged with rebellion and pride, inherent in all Americans but enjoyed by few. It is with the same celebration of freedom and togetherness that we have conceived this beer. We brew our beer in the salty air with our toes in the sand and the sun on our faces. Lucky for you, we can't finish it all. Please have as much fun drinking Backshore Beer as we have making it. We've spent serious time creating it. Have a ridiculous time enjoying it.

name: Backside Brewing Co.
description: Our first beer was brewed in a barn at the backside of a small community in rural western Oregon. Although our facility and equipment has been upgraded, our idea remains simple, Make. Great. Beer. So tip one back and have some fun.

name: Backwoods Brewing Company
description: We are a locally owned, and locally brewing in the Backwoods.    We are a 10 BBL Brewery in our first year of operation. The Brewery is nestled in the Heart of the Gorge. The Waters Family operates the brewpub and loves to serve our customers. We cannot wait to serve you and show you what our beer and the Gorge has to offer!
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Sun:  3:00pm - 9:00pm  Thu - Sun: 3:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Bad Ass Brewery
description: My name is Matt I have been home brewing for 23 plus years.  A friend of mine Allen O’Brien introduced me to “real” beer when I tried to offer him a Keystone.  I’ve been hooked on making and drinking real beer ever since.  My wife enrolled me in a home brewing class in Durango Colorado.  Over the past 23 years I have only made three bad beers out of thousands of batches.  I ended 26 years of the construction trades February of 2010 to fulfill my dream of opening a micro brewery.  Welcome to BAB short for Bad Ass Brewery.  My beers are hand crafted personal recipes sometimes extreme gravity.  I invite you to come on out and sample some of my latest creations.  No less than 20 beers on tap from Girly Pale, fruited beers to award winning stouts and over the top barley wines.

name: Bad Bear Brewery
description: Bad Bear Brewery - Makers of Natural, Unfiltered, hand crafted Bad Bear beers and ciders that are created in small batches from local ingredients. Truly a brew that reflects our Great Lakes, we use regional grains, and hops from the world famous land of Sleeping Bear. We are committed to giving you quality libations that represent a sense of place and purpose. Bad never tasted so good!
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  11:00am - 7:00pm Tue:  11:00am - 7:00pm Wed:  11:00am - 7:00pm Thu:  11:00am - 8:00pm Fri:  10:00am - 10:00pm Sat:  10:00am - 10:00pm Sun:  12:00pm - 6:00pm  Monday - Wednesday   11:00 am - 7:00 pm  Thursday   11:00 am - 8:00 pm  Friday - Saturday   10:00 am - 10:00 pm  Sunday  Noon - 6:00 pm

name: BAD Brewing Company
description: BAD Brewing Company is a small Microbrewery locatedin downtown Mason, MI that opened in the Summer of 2012. We will offer a wide selection of hand crafted beers. We will have at least five house beers on tap, with several more on a rotating basis. All of the beers are hand crafted on site by the owner, and new recipes are always in the works! BAD Brewing looks forward to serving Mason and the Greater Lansing area the finest hand crafted beers possible. Have a BAD day!

name: Bad Jimmy's Brewery
description: In todays world to have great taste in beer you have to go to your craft brewers were beer is actually studied and time is taken to insure the quality and taste is always the same. Supporting your local breweries is a great way to keep wonderful, full flavor ale's and lagers available. Ballard, Wa. will soon be the home to Bad Jimmy's with a tap room for everyone to enjoy the full flavor ale's that we have to offer. Watch for us in your local bars and please let us know what you think of our tasty liquid joy.

name: Bad Martha Beer
description: At Bad Martha, we believe in three things: great beer, getting bad and doing good. Every sip of our premium craft beer is a reminder that there’s a paradise out there where you can kick off your boat shoes, let your hair down and leave it all behind. That paradise is Martha’s Vineyard. Don’t hold back. Don’t bring your off-island worries. Don’t be too good. Drink it all in.    And while there’s a bit of bad in every drop of beer we brew, there’s also a whole lot of good that comes with every bottle we sell. That’s because Bad Martha is built on a simple idea – community first. We bring this idea to life by donating the first portion of profits to a local hunger relief charity. What’s left goes back into brewing more delicious Bad Martha.    We’re proud of our beer. We’re even prouder of the island that inspired it. We hope you enjoy both as much as we do.

name: Bad Weather Brewing Company
description: Bad Weather Brewing Company knows the beer-lover's calendar is one that changes with seasons. BWBC offers unique beers with Midwestern Edge to them. These beers complement and celebrate the shifting summer sun and frigid winter winds.

name: Baderbräu
description: Chicago's Original Craft Beer

name: Badger Hill Brewing
description: A family united by a hankering for travel and craft beer. In our blood: A melting pot of European heritage. Our passion: The singular love of beer. Our mission: Sharing what topped our taste-o-meters. We do hope you like them—and our promise is that we’ll keep coming up with new recipes while staying true to the brew. Mostly.    Wondering about our name? Badger Hill is a rough translation of the two brothers’ names in Old English and speaks to the influence of their European heritage. Plus, they liked how it sounded.

name: Badger Mountain Brewing
description: We are Wenatchee's largest craft brewery. We have 12 taps that pour our beer, guest beer, and cider. Together with Country Boys BBQ you can't go wrong.

name: Badger State Brewing Company
description: Badger State Brewing Company is a craft brewery located in the shadows of Lambeau Field. Opening officially in 2013 and excited to be a part of the Green Bay Area and great state of Wisconsin. Looking forward to sharing a beer with you!

name: Taproom
description: BadWolf Brewing Company is a family-owned and operated nanobrewery in Manassas, VA founded on June 28, 2012. The Co-Founders, Jeremy and Sarah Meyers, are local residents who grew up in the NOVA area and have always dreamed of having a brewery. Jeremy has been brewing beer over 10 years inspired by his trip to Germany. Sarah has a background in business so it's a perfect match. The couple is passionate about craft beer and believes in sharing it with YOU!     The brewing setup is a 1 barrel brewing system so BadWolf can pump out a variety of beers in the taproom. Free popcorn will be offered to cleanse the palate! We don't serve food but you can bring your own or order delivery. BadWolf will offer pints and samples on site and offer growlers to go.
hoursOfOperation: Wed:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Thu:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  3:00pm - 10:00pm Sat:  2:00pm - 10:00pm  Tuesday - Private Events  Wed 4-9pm    Thurs 4-9pm   Fri 3-10pm   Sat 2-10pm

name: Baeltane Brewing
description: Baeltane Brewing is a small production brewery and tasting room located in Novato, CA (Marin County).    Our Marin brewery proudly produces artisanal ales for the discerning consumer. The beers we produce feature the artistry of our Head Brewer, Alan Atha, specializing in Belgian, French and West Coast Ale styles.    We might be small but our impression is huge.

name: Baere Brewing Company
description: An industrial farmhouse in the Historic Baker District of Denver.

name: Baerlic Brewing
description: Literally translating to ‘of barley’ in old english, bærlic reiterates the fundamental idea that all things, no matter how complex or involved, can always be traced backward to single, simple core or point of view.    Our point of view comes from a belief that we are all in this together and that our actions shape our world – by being honest, we are approachable; by being consistent, we are trusted; by being considerate, we can sleep at night; and by choosing to keep it simple, we are able to do this really well.

name: Bagby Beer Company
description: World-class beer. Simple food done well.  Inviting hospitality.    Simply put, this is our vision. With ever-increasing choices when it comes to dining out (and ever-tightening budgets), we wanted to create an inviting, casual environment with amazing beer and cocktails coupled with an exciting yet accessible menu, made from all fresh ingredients, that won't break the bank.     Of course, the food and the beer should always be spectacular - as should the service level. For Bagby Beer Company, the product is just as important as the way it is delivered. The guest experience we intend to deliver is rooted in hospitality. We've chosen some of the most talented and personable staff who are excited to bring this vision to life and make your experience amazing.     Thanks for coming in,   Jeff and Dande Bagby

name: Bainbridge Island Brewing Company
description: Making a great beer requires a combination of art and science.  Science, in knowing what the gear and the ingredients can do.  Art, in imagining what beer can be.  Whether it's excellent versions of classic styles, or boundary pushing experimental brews, we strive to blend the art and science of beer.    But beer is also a social beverage.  The pub is part of our culture, and here in the Northwest that means locally brewed craft beer.  The local brewery is part of the fabric of the community, giving it character, individuality, and indeed, an air of hometown pride.  Bainbridge Island is certainly a great place to live, but it's been lacking one thing: our own craft microbrewery.  Well, no longer!  Bainbridge Island Brewing is the island's brewery, and the island is as much a part of us as we are of it.
hoursOfOperation: Tue:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Wed:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Thu:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 9:00pm Sun:  12:00pm - 9:00pm  Tues - Fri: 3:00 - 9:00 pm  Sat & Sun: 12:00 - 9:00 pm   Mon: Closed for Brew Day

name: Baldy Beard Brewing Company
description: Baldy Beard is the founder and creator of the brewery which bares his name. He is rarely seen, but heard from often. Drink With Friends.    Baldy Beard Brewing Company is a nanobrewery with a 1.5 barrel system.  Our brewery is currently under construction, but there will be plenty of time soon to #DrinkWithFriends.

name: Bale Breaker Brewing Company
description: Bale Breaker Brewing Company is a new brewery in Moxee, WA, but our story starts back in 1932, when our great-grandparents planted our family’s first five-acre hop field in the Yakima Valley. Now, 80 years later, our love of hops and passion for craft beer has led us to where we are today – in the midst of building a craft brewery surrounded by our family’s hop fields, just minutes from where we were born and raised.    Bale Breaker Brewing Company will focus on handcrafted ales that showcase Yakima Valley hops and will celebrate Yakima’s status as one of the leading hop growing regions in the world. We’re optimistic that we will be pouring pints at our on-site tasting room and distributing kegs and cans to local bars, restaurants, and grocery stores this winter. Visit our website (www.balebreaker.com) or like us on Facebook to follow our progress. Cheers!

name: Home Brew Mart
description: Ballast Point Brewing Company is one of San Diego's Premiere Breweries. We started out modestly as Home Brew Mart in 1992. Our goal was to teach others how to brew quality handcrafted beer at home. In 1996 the brewery was installed by New World Brewing Systems in the space behind our retail store and production began in September. In May of 2005 we open our second brewery in Scripps Ranch.  We currently distribute five of our favorite beers, Yellowtail Pale Ale,  Calico Amber Ale , Big Eye I.P.A., Black Marlin Porter and Wahoo Wheat Beer to a thirsty San Diego.  Come to our brewery and we will gladly give you a tour and allow you to sample our newest selection of beers. Currently our beer is available in twelve ounce bottles to 15.5 gallon kegs. We also offer half gallon and gallon glass jugs to go. Kegs are available for rent to the public with a minimum deposit.  The name for our brewery comes from the point where Juan Rodriguez Cabrillo first set foot in California. Located on the Point Loma Peninsula, Ballast Point is considered the gateway to San Diego Harbor. Stones from this area were used as ballast in the cargo holds of sailing ships returning to the eastern seaboard. Many New England streets are still lined with the cobblestones brought back from San Diego.
hoursOfOperation: Tasting Room & Store Hours  Monday-Friday, 11:00-7:00  Saturday-Sunday, 10:00-5:00

name: Tasting Room & Kitchen
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  11:00am - 11:00pm Tue:  11:00am - 11:00pm Wed:  11:00am - 11:00pm Thu:  11:00am - 11:00pm Fri:  11:00am - 11:00pm Sat:  11:00am - 11:00pm Sun:  11:00am - 9:00pm  Mon–Fri 11:00am–11:00pm  Saturday 11:00am–11:00pm  Sunday 11:00am–9:00pm

name: Ballyhoo Brewing Company
description: The Ballyhoo Brewing Company is a new craft brewery located on the Texas Gulf Coast. We are currently working to finish up the conceptual design of our brewery. This blog will be a place for us to document what the team is working on as we start our brewery and will eventually transition into a place for us to interact with our fans and customers with photos of the brewery’s progress, notes on exciting and upcoming brews, and news about the most exciting Gulf Coast Brewery – Ballyhoo Brewing Company.

name: Baltimore-Washington Beer Works
description: Our beer was first conceived in Luxembourg between founders Stephen Demczuk and Wolfgang Stark.  Stephen was in Europe doing research in molecular biology and experienced its beer culture that lead to his mid-career crisis.  He started writing about beer, and then tried to open a brewery in Arlon, Belgium but that faltered.  He then formed the first beer-of-the-month club in Europe, Beer Around the World.  Importing beer into Luxembourg, boxing it up and shipping it within the EU.  One supplier of his beers was Wolfgang Stark of Haus de 131 Biere.  Wolfgang imported beer from all over the world. He supplied Ngoma from Togo, Flame from New Zealand, and Lapin Kulta from Finland.   One day Wolfgang asked Stephen if he would like to make a beer in Germany and using an American marketing theme.  It took Stephen just a second to say yes and a day to come up with The Raven.  The new company was registered in Baltimore and the new beer was eventually produced in Nagold, Germany and called in honor of Baltimore's Edgar Allan Poe The Raven Special Lager.

name: Bandwagon Brew Pub
description: The Bandwagon Brew Pub of Ithaca, NY features delicious beers brewed in small batches paired with locally and seasonally influenced dishes.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  5:00pm - 1:00am Tue:  5:00pm - 1:00am Wed:  5:00pm - 1:00am Thu:  5:00pm - 1:00am Fri:  12:00pm - 1:00am Sat:  12:00pm - 1:00am Sun:  12:00pm - 1:00am  Mon - Thu: 5:00 pm - 1:00 am  Fri - Sun: 12:00 pm - 1:00 am

name: Banger Brewing Company
description: We are a microbrewery located on Fremont Street in Downtown Las Vegas.  We feature a tap tasting room with free tours, growler fills, and beer flights
hoursOfOperation: Sun-Thurs. 5pm-Midnight  Fri-Sat 5pm-1am

name: Bank Beer Company
description: The Bank Beer Company started on a quiet main street in Hendricks, Minnesota a stones throw from the South Dakota Border. We are a brewing company built on the premise that we should give back and leave a legacy bigger than ourselves. With that mission we set out to build a company that devotes its energy to quality beer and giving back a portion of our profits to wildlife land acquisitions and preservation of our history.

name: Bantam Cider
description: Modern American Cider. We are committed to making creative and distinctive crafted cider using fresh pressed apples and high-quality, all-natural ingredients.

name: BAR
description: New Haven's best brick oven pizza team and sexiest crew of bartenders and waitresses around.  Come for our micro-brew beers, brick oven pizza, free pool, live music, best DJs in town, and the game on the big screen.     BAR began brewing beer in 1996

name: Baranof Island Brewing Company
description: Baranof Island Brewing Co. is owned, operated, sampled and sold by Sitkan beer lovers, Rick and Suzan. When they opened the brewery in 2010, enthusiastic townspeople drank up the supply so quickly, they immediately had to ramp up the capacity of their operations.  Now that they can keep the thirsty locals satisfied (look for BIBCo. on tap at local restaurants), they are ready to share with you their passion for really good hand-crafted beer.    Brew nerds will appreciate that every unfiltered 55-gallon batch is a combination of pure, glacier-fed Alaskan water and a blend of gourmet malts and hops, lovingly selected by master brewer, Sam.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Bards Tale Beer Company
description: Bard's Beer is not only the world's first craft-brewed gluten-free beer, it's also the only beer that's brewed with 100% malted gluten-free sorghum.

name: Bare Hands Brewery
description: A small batch brewery specializing in hand crafted Ales.

name: Barhop Brewing
description: Barhop Brewing: Like many native Californians, Tom struggled with the all the rain in the northwest until he figured out what to do with it: start fermenting it! And so Barhop Brewing was born. On brew days, you can hear Tom brewing to the tunes of Pearl Jam, Bob Marley, The Grateful Dead, Led Zepplin, and so on. Tom’s California beer-drinking youth provided him with a strong affinity for the pioneers of micro-brewing, back when Sierra Nevada, Pete’s Wicked, and Mendocino Brewing were small craft brewers. Decades of drinking beer – and specifically micro-brews – have contributed to Tom’s brewing pedigree. (Or so he says.) Currently he is a big fan of Elysian and Russian River Brewing, and these companies have influenced his brewing style which he calls “aggressive California-style ales, with a Northwest twist, using fresh Northwest ingredients”.

name: Barley and Hops Grill & Microbrewery
description: When the same old thing just won’t do, head to Barley & Hops! You’ll find great beer brewed the old-fashioned way, award-winning  food, and a friendly atmosphere you don’t get in those cookie-cutter restaurants. Conveniently located in Frederick, Maryland at the interchange of I-70 and I-270, Barley and Hops is just a short Drive from Baltimore, Washington, and the surrounding tri-state area.    Whether you are shopping at the mall or antiquing in our historic downtown, Barley and Hops provides the perfect break for lunch, entertaining guests, or an unforgettable evening dinner. Also a great place to take in the game, learn about the art of brewing, or meet new friends. From the large screen TV to the glass enclosed working brewery, there is always something to do or see.     Open Sunday, 11:00 a.m. ’til 10:00 p.m; Monday through Thursday, 11:00 a.m. ’til 11:00 p.m.; and Friday and Saturday, 11:00 a.m. ’til midnight. Call ahead of your visit at 301-668-5555 to check on seating availability.

name: Barley and Vine Brewery
description: Since 2003, family and friends have come to know that initials on the bottle caps along with names of classic cars designate beers from the Barley and Vine Brewery.   Barley and Vine is becoming known for great quality ales, and at times going to extremes to provide the very best in beer.    From the first batch of beer, Rambler Red, brewing was destined for the garage or outdoors because of the huge mess and bad smell made in the kitchen. So, for the first four years Barley and Vine was making 5-gallon extract batches.  Barley and Vine began sharing the beers with friends and family looking for input and making corrections and changes when needed.  As time went by the brewing skill level and quality of the beer continued to improve.   Changing from 5-gallon extract batched to 10 gallon all-grain batches made a huge difference in the quality of the final product.    Barley and Vine is a nano brewery in the planning.  As we continue to build our business plan, determine a location, and perfect our recipes and processes we will do our best to keep people up to speed through this website, Facebook, and our blog.  The ultimate dream is to have a brewery and a brewpub.

name: Barley Brothers Restaurant & Brewery
description: Barley Brothers restaurant and brewery is an upscale-casual eatery known for its extensive menu, great music, and award winning draft beer. From classic lagers to more obscure ales and stouts there's a draft beer flavor for everyone. Our American cuisine menu includes an impressive selection of appetizers, salads, pastas, sandwiches, wood fired pizzas, ribs and rotisserie chicken. Barley Brothers plays America’s favorite - classic rock and an abundance of flat screens showcase the day's sports and special events.    Barley Brothers is part of the Shugrues Restaurant and Brewery Group. Restaurants are located Lake Havasu City, and Sedona Arizona.    There is something for everyone at the Barley Brothers.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: Barley Brown's Brew Pub
description: Small batch hand-crafted beer, good food, good company, good times...
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Saturday: 4:00 p.m. - 10:00 p.m.  Closed most holidays

name: Barley Creek Brewing Company
description: Located in Tannersville, right off route 80's exit 299 in between the Crossings Outlet Stores and Camelback Ski area (Camelbeach Water Park, Barley Creek is the Pocono Mountains' Original Brewpub and Restaurant, where you can always find great food, freshly brewed beer, a comfortable atmosphere, friendly people, and a unique place to kick back, relax and have a great time. Bring your friends, bring your family, bring your friends' families. We are open every day at 11:01am, and serve dinner till about 10pm. On Friday and Saturday we are serving dinner till about 11:00pm. The bar stays open a little longer (so you can finish your fun if you ordered food just before the kitchen closed) Cheers!

name: Barley Forge Brewing Co.
description: Barley Forge Brewing creates robust, unique, and tasty beers inspired by the cultural melting pot of southern California.

name: Barley Island Brewing Company
description: Barley Island’s national award winning handcrafted ales produced on-premise with only the finest malts and hops. Being independently owned and operated has its advantages. We can quickly implement new food trends or even beer flavors to suit our local clientele.
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Thursday: 11 am - 12 am  Sunday: 12 pm - 12 am  Friday - Saturday: 11 am - 1 am

name: Barley Mow Brewing Company
description: The BMBC is a nanobrewery and tavern in downtown Largo, FL. For all the non-Floridians out there, Largo is located in Pinellas County just north of St Petersburg. We have a 2 BBL system, which means we're able to produce about 4 kegs at a time. We started out with 3-80 gallon fermenters and have already added a 4th, 3 BBL fermenter!  Our tavern has 14 constantly rotating taps. We try to keep a many of our own beers on tap at all times, when we can't fill them, the rest are reserved for only American brews, most of which are Florida born. We also have an awesome wine list.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat: 3:00 pm - 2:00 am  Sun: 3:00 pm - 12:00 am

name: Barnhouse Brewery
description: We are a small nano sized brewery that focuses on making great beer for our local community.  We make every effort to use locally grown ingredients from our home grown hops to fruit and honey from our local farmers.     We work hard on our 20 Gallon brewing system and two 80 Gallon Fermenters to bring you beer that is designed to be tasty but not over the top with weird ingredients and trendy gimmicks, just simple tried and true processes with a spark of creativity thrown in resulting in laid back beers for laid back people!
hoursOfOperation: Check Website

name: Baron Brewing Company
description: Mike Baker and Jeff Smiley founded Baron Brewing in the beginning of 2003. A brewery has been in the works for sometime. Lots of discussions on what if we had a brewery were had, over lots of good German beer. The opportunity came for us to travel to Germany to really get involved with the German brewing process and ideology - as well as sample the best beer on earth. After that trip, the direction of the brewery was set. German beer had to be re-discovered by the population. After many discussions on opening a brewery and a trip to Germany, the dream became reality. We found an existing brewery to purchase - Lunar Brewing. After purchasing Lunar and getting approved for all the necessary licensing, Baron is ready to go. On June 14th, the world of Seattle will have the chance to finally taste and purchase Baron Beer. The first style of many to be released is our flagship beer - Munich Lager.That is all for the history. We are growing on a daily basis and plan to be around for quite some time.

name: Barrage Brewing Company
description: Barrage Brewing Company is a 1 BBL capacity Brewery, but soon to become a 3 BBL Brewery. The Brewery was Started in 2010 with it's roots in Nassau County. Distribution will only be through out the Long Island and Manhattan areas.     Quality Brewed Craft Beers for the common person as well as the Beer Connoisseur.

name: Barrel Harbor Brewing
description: We at Barrel Harbor Brewing are passionate about brewing craft beers that are simply exceptional. We draw inspiration from our home brewing roots and the vibrant Vista, California brew culture. Using only the finest ingredients available, our Brewmaster draws from a decade of experience to deliver a variety of hand crafted beers. Barrel Harbor represents old world antiquity and celebrates centuries of quality brewing, so sail in and enjoy complex, flavorful beers that are sure to satisfy.
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Thurs 3 - 9 PM  Fri 3 - 10 PM  Sat 12 - 10 PM   Sun 12 - 6 PM

name: Brewery and Beer Gardens!
description: Barrelhouse Brewing Co. is nestled in the rolling hills of San Luis Obispo County on the edge of Paso Robles and in the heart of wine country…what will our neighbors think?    As you turn off Ramada Drive and onto Marquita Way, you will meander around a majestic oak tree.  This majestic white oak stands in the middle of where the road would have gone, if not for this tree’s historical significance.  If you look closely at the trunk of this old oak, you will notice the mark of an equal armed cross carved into its bark. The cross was carved sometime between 1775 and 1776 when Spanish Lt. Colonel Juan Batista de Anza led more than 240 men, women and children on an overland journey from the frontier New Spain to settle in Alta California. During that 1,200 mile journey, the very thirsty Colonel carved the cross to signify the perfect location for a brewery…well, that’s our story at Barrelhouse and we can’t exactly prove it, but we’re sticking to it!  Historians believe that Juan Batista de Anza or someone on his team carved the cross to indicate a safe place to camp.  We think it makes a sweet logo, too!    After you pass the old oak, make a left on Limestone Way and look for the dragon fly…you can’t miss it.     Stop by, grab a brew or two and relax.  Enjoy our glorious beer gardens with friends while you listen to the waterfall and experience the central coast the way it was meant to be enjoyed…outside.  You can also pull up to the bar inside the brewery where you’ll feel like you’re part of the brewing action. Along with our amazing line-up of beers, we will also feature our very own custom crafted rootbeers.  If you ask nicely, we can even float a scoop of ice cream in your favorite sarsaparilla or stout.
hoursOfOperation: Monday-Tuesday: Closed  Wednesday-Thursday: 2-8  Friday-Saturday: 11-9  Sunday: 11-8
