description: Barrels and Bottles is a nanobrewery that offers craft beer, wines and tapas in Golden, CO.    22 beers on tap  24 wines on tap  Colorado's 1st Fusion Tower  Wine Slushies  Delicious fresh food
hoursOfOperation: Mon: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Wed - Thu: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Barren Hill Tavern & Brewery
description: A brewpub in Lafayette Hill, PA with 30 drafts featuring on average of 10 house beers along with a selection of the best craft & imported beers

name: Barrier Brewing Company
description: Barrier Brewing Co. is a 1bbl brewery operated by Evan Klein and Craig Frymark located in Oceanside, NY. The focus is small scale production of a breadth of styles and flavors brewed for the local market. The first batches were released to the public in June 2010.    "Brewing For Quality Not Quantity"

name: Barrington Brewery and Restaurant
description: Welcome to the homepage of the Barrington Brewery & Restaurant. Our casual dining atmosphere is located at 420 Stockbridge Road (Route 7) in the Jenifer House Commons, Great Barrington, Massachusetts. We offer the freshest, handcrafted food and beer made right here.    Since 1995 the Barrington Brewery has been serving our own Barn Brewed Beer and food made from scratch and we were the first brewery on the east coast to install a solar panel system that supplies solar-heated hot water for brewing and restaurant use.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thurs:	11:30 am - 9:30 pm  Fri:	11:30 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat:	11:30 am - 10:00 pm  Sun: 11:30 am - 9:00 pm

name: Barrio Brewing Company
description: We are proudly located at the corner of Toole and 16th St. Come on down and try any or all of our fresh microbrews, we have up to 12 on tap for all of your drinking pleasure. Combine the beer with our food, and you’ll have the recipe for a great night.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Tue:	11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Wed - Sat:	11:00 am - 12:00 am  Sun:	11:00 am - 11:00 pm

name: Barts Tap Room & Brewery
description: Our brewery, produced by DME Engineering from Prince Edward Island, Canada, consists of a 15 barrel system (465 gallons per brew) and has a fermentation capacity of 135 barrels.    Ice-cold beer is served from ten 15 barrel serving vessels located behind our main bar.    You can also buy our brew to enjoy at home!  Purchase party pigs(2.25 gallons), growlers (64 oz.) or 1/4 and 1/2 barrels for your next party or event.

name: Base Camp Brewing Company
description: Base Camp Brewing Company is the result of brewmaster Justin Fay’s determined vision and years of hard work.  His and brewer Paul Thurston’s combined decades of professional brewing experience are evident in each of Base Camp’s recipes.  Each of our beers have been crafted with an eye toward innovation and creativity as well as consistency and balance, making for awesome brewskies that are at once approachable for any beer drinker and satisfying for the most adventure-minded palate.
hoursOfOperation: Sunday-Wednesday noon to 9pm,  Thursday-Saturday 11am to midnight!

name: Basil T's Brewery & Italian Grill
description: In the Rallo family, cooking isn't merely about food, it's a way of life. Victor Sr. and Jr. have spent the majority of their lives perfecting the art of fine cuisine. The Rallo's time tested recipes are showcased regularly at the Original Basil T's. Their famous Pizza Napolitana, authentic Italian, and original recipes are a feast for the body and soul.    The Original Basil T's is all about tradition. Everything is homemade, from the sauces and dressings to the mozzarella cheese, as well as the spectacular desserts and award winning beers. Come and enjoy truly unequaled culinary delights that only generations of dedication can produce. To the Rallo family, the Original Basil T's is much more than a restaurant. . .it is life itself.

name: Basket Case Brewing Company
description: Basket Case Brewing Company is a nanobrewery in Jasper, IN. We are located in The Mill House Restaurant where we make and sell our beer.

name: Bastone Brewery
description: Bastone first opened its doors in May of 2004. It is named and styled after the famous Belgian city (though the spelling has been simplified). This unique restaurant and brewery is housed in a 1930’s era building, the exterior of which has been restored to it’s original art deco look in association with the State of Michigan Historical Society. Inside, the high arched ceiling, wood floors and white subway wall tiles create the comfortable yet sophisticated atmosphere of a European brasserie.

name: Bastrop Brewhouse
description: Bastrop's First Brewpub!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Sat: 11:00 am - 1:00 am  Sun: 10:00 am - 12:00 am

name: Bat Creek Brewery
description: Bat Creek Brewery was established in late 2008. It is owned by Jeremy Gilbert and Ryan and Heather Daffron. We are located in the heart of America at 4 West Main in Bowling Green, Missouri. A wise man once told us that if you aren’t passionate about your job and if you don’t love what you do, get out. We started this brewery because our passion is beer.    Our humble operation is run out of a machine shed. We currently brew less than a barrel at a time, although we will be expanding as soon as we can. We have five year round brews that we are extremely proud to offer. Keep an eye out for new seasonal and limited edition brews as well.

name: Batch Brewing Company
description: Small batch, handcrafted beer in Detroit. Also to feature brew-on-premise, guest brewers, and events that bring some of the city's creative minds together celebrating art, music, and beer.

name: Battenkill Brewing Company
description: Battenkill, or the Battenkill River, is a 50-mile river rising in Vermont that flows into New York and is a tributary of the Hudson River. The “Battenkill” barn that houses our brewery in Poulsbo, Washington is reminiscent of the Yankee Style barns that have been built throughout the Battenkill Valley and is the perfect size for either a small craft brewery or dairy milking house. We chose the brewery!

name: Battle Born Beer Company
description: Let’s face it. Most beer is pretty damn good.    Sure, we’ll argue about which one we think is best.  But in the grand scheme of things, how much better can you make something that should only have about four ingredients?    That’s the way we see it anyway.    People who only want the best beer will always be looking for it.  We’d rather just sell good beer to people who believe what we believe.    Battle Born personifies those beliefs.    So while everyone else tries to invent the next pumpkin nut brown ale, we figure we’d keep it simple and build a great brand.    After all, it’s just beer.

name: Battle Road Brewing Company
description: We strive to make Ales, Porter and Beer of the highest quality for our Commonwealth of Massachusetts, our home and place of business. Our primary criteria for our beer is that we apply our combined 36 years of Professional Brewing Expertise, painstakingly select the Finest Ingredients, and Insure that they arrive in your glass in Prime Condition.

name: Battlefield Brew Works
description: Brewpub located in historic Gettysburg, PA. Housed in a barn/former field hospital from the Civil War.
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Sat 10am-10pm   Sunday 11am-9pm

name: Battlefield Brewing Co
description: Fredericksburg’s first Brewpub - The Pub Restaurant Pub logo has been serving the area’s best food and drinks for 15 years. We offer some of the best food in Fredericksburg at prices that can’t be matched. Our ½ lb. burgers are the best in town and our secret spiced shrimp is enticing! With over 100 items on our menu you can’t go wrong. Kids menu and carry out available. We have a full service bar serving premium liquors and wine. We also have 16 beers on tap including 5 from our own microbrewery.
hoursOfOperation: Hours:  Mon-Thu 11am-11pm  Fri-Sat 11am-12am  Sun 12-8pm

name: BattleGreen Beer Co.
description: We are a grassroots beer company in the Atlanta area who is dedicated to delivering quality ales to the southeast region.  Our mission is simple – bring you great beer that you can enjoy after all your day’s battles as a reward to yourself and your friends.

name: Bauhaus Brew Labs
description: Bauhaus Brew Labs is a family of musicians, scientists, artists and above all, beer lovers, aiming to reinvigorate the spirit of the family brewery. At Bauhaus, we take a unique look at classic German-inspired beer styles, skewed slightly by a sense of play and adventure. Our flavor-forward, sessionable beers are crafted to surprise and delight without taxing the palate.

name: Bavarian Barbarian Brewing Company
description: Bavarian Barbarian Brewing Company is Williamsport's first production brewery since the 1950's. The brewery, which occupies 9,000 square feet at 429 W. 3rd St in Williamsport, Pennsylvania, was founded by Mike Hiller in July 2007.  Though a native of South Williamsport, Barbarian Chief, Mike Hiller, first entered the craft brewing industry in 1997 as an Account Services Associate for Legendary Distributors, Ltd., of Richmond, Virginia. After nearly a year of distributing beer, an opportunity arose for Mike to work as a brewer for Legend Brewing Company. Mike worked with five other brewers to perform duties at all levels of production including brewing, cellar work, cleaning and maintenance.  After nearly four years of service at Legend Brewing Company, Mike moved to Boston, MA, so his wife, Kira, could attend grad school. Tired of listening to him whine about how much he missed brewing, Kira gave him a home brewing kit as an anniversary gift. Mike began brewing whenever he could find the time. He developed the recipes for Hammerin' Ale, Headbangerz Brown Ale, Square Feet Wheat, Weldspatter I.P.A. and several other beers in five-gallon batches on his apartment's balcony.  Mike was also commissioned by friends and co-workers to brew beer for special occasions.  In fact, Square Feet Wheat was actually first brewed for an art gallery opening featuring works by the Barbarian's logo and label designer, Erick Thomas.  After reading Brewing Up a Business: Adventures in Entrepreneurship by Sam Calagione of Dogfish Head Brewery fame, Mike was inspired to start his own brewery. He spent eight months researching and writing a business plan. Another year was spent gathering support and revising his business plans. Thanks to the support of family, friends and other area businessmen who believed in Mike's dream, Bavarian Barbarian Brewing Company is now a reality.

name: Bayhawk Ales
description: Bayhawk Ales, Orange County's largest microbrewery, began operation in late 1994 with our first beer being poured in February '95. We are a public corporation with over 1000 local and out of state stockholders. Bayhawk specializes in brewing House Beers for many fine restaurants and taverns throughout California, Arizona, Nevada, Oregon, and Washington. We just might be the Greatest Beer You Never Knew You Drank!

name: Baying Hound Aleworks
description: Baying Hound Aleworks is a small independent nano-brewery in Rockville, Maryland. The brewery produces small batch beers and uses only the highest quality ingredients.    Our beers are unpasteurized and contain no additives or preservatives. Instead of forcing carbonation, Baying Hound ales undergo a secondary fermentation and are conditioned under a controlled environment.
hoursOfOperation: Tours/Tastings are $5.00, this entitles you to free samples, and you can buy up to 288oz per person for take out only.    Monday – Wednesday – Tastings are available by appointment only and is subject to the brewing schedule.    Thursday – 5:00 PM – 8:00 PM  Friday – 5:00 PM – 9:00 PM  Saturday – 12:00 PM – 6:00 PM

name: Bayne Brewing Company, LLC
description: Bayne Brewing Company is a local family owned beer brewery serving the Lake Norman area. We specialize in high quality craft beer using fresh, high quality ingredients. We will brew on a 2 BBL brew system, taking hand crafted beers to the next level. Cheers!

name: BBC Brewing Co., LLC
description: Bluegrass Brewing Co is proud to be the largest microbrewery located in the state of Kentucky. Reaching back over one hundred years, the city of Louisville has a rich and complex brewing history; a history that has provided BBC with a strong foundation on which to build and grow. It is a challenge we enthusiastically look forward to everyday. Led by our fearless brew master David Pierce who has been brewing award winning BBC beers for over fourteen years, our brewing philosophy is an audacious style that allows us to work diligently with the entire palette of malts and hops. This diligence and discipline is carefully brought to every batch that is brewed at Bluegrass Brewing Co. To truly enjoy life you have to love what you doÃ¯Â¿Â½and we love brewing. Our sole focus relies on consistency and producing the best beer available. We hope that you will taste that bold style in every BBC beer that you drink. Enjoy great craft beer wherever you live and remember this most important piece of advice: Don't Buy Beer From Strangers . . . Support Your Local Brewery!

name: Beach Brewing Company
description: We are a craft brewery, located in sunny Virginia Beach, Virginia. When we say 'craft', we don't just mean small; we mean our beer is made with great care, using only the purest ingredients and smartest techniques. We don't just aim to create beers that satisfy, but rather to craft brews that inspire. We love what we do and that passion is inherent in every ounce of what flows out of our brewhouse.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu:	3:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Fri:	3:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat:	11:00 am - 8:00 pm  Sun:	1:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Beach Chalet Brewery and Restaurant
description: The Beach Chalet Brewery & Restaurant is located above the Golden Gate Park Visitor's Center which features the amazing and historic WPA frescoes created by Lucien Labaudt in the 1930's. The artwork captures the flavor of San Francisco in that era in a style of the Arts and Crafts movement – a must see for fans of the style and for anyone who wants a taste of the strange and incredible period in which the WPA allowed art projects like this to exist during such hard times.    Upstairs you will find the Beach Chalet Brewery & Restaurant. It was developed by Gar and Lara Truppelli and Timon Malloy in 1997 after the Chalet had sat vacant for 17 years. To remodel and restore this historic building to its former glory so it could be a landmark to be enjoyed by future generations as well as to create a space for their restaurateurs’ dreams, they brought Heller Manus Architects onboard to help make their dreams a reality.    Today thousands of guests enjoy the Modern American Cuisine menu and hand crafted ales. The Beach Chalet offers a full bar, abundant free parking and a breathtaking ocean view. Bay Area residents and visitors find the Beach Chalet to be a wonderful San Francisco experience while visiting Golden Gate Park and Ocean Beach. Join us and find out why the Beach Chalet is your kind of place.

name: Beach City Brewery
description: The Beach City Brewery team is  proud to be located in Orange County.  Our flagship beers were created with the characteristics of Surf City in mind and seasonal offerings will reflect and represent all of OC.  Being immediately accepted and brought into the Craft Beer community by its brewers was both humbling and a privilege.  Come and enjoy a beer with our team at the Tasting Room soon!

name: Beachwood BBQ & Brewing
description: At Beachwood BBQ & Brewing we take craft beer very seriously. As downtown Long Beach’s only independent craft brewery, we strive to make sure our passion for craft beer shines through with every sip.    Our award-winning Brewmaster, Julian Shrago, spends countless hours perfecting each recipe, researching new ones, and pushing the boundaries of craft beer brewing today. Our general philosophy on brewing is to always think of flavor first. No matter how creative you want to be, beer, much like food, must taste good (or hopefully outstanding).    We brew a wide variety of American styles, as well as some traditional British, German, and Belgian-style beers. Having a large variety of beers keeps customers excited and creates a sense of adventure associated with the brand. It also allows us to have unlimited creative freedom, and that always keeps things fresh. Cheers!
hoursOfOperation: Tuesday - Sunday  Kitchen open 11:30 to 9:30  Bar open 11:30 to Midnightish

name: Bear Creek Brews
description: Bear Creek Brews has been a dream for over 30 years. Ever since the beginnings of the American Beer Renaissance, I have wanted to brew my own great tasting beer and make it available to the beer drinking public and help people learn about and appreciate beer. Coming from Oshkosh, Wisconsin, beer brewing is in my veins.    Twelve years ago my wonderful wife bought me the "everything but the kitchen sink" homebrew kit and it all started. After a few extract brew sessions, I built a 15 gallon brew sculpture and graduated to all-grain brewing, and things really got serious. Now after over 200 brews, BCB is in business!    The brewery is small, we call it a Nano-Brewery, we are hidden in the middle of 38 acres of woods in the heart of North Carolina. Most everything is recycled or made in-house. The Brew-House is an old 20' steel cargo container, the Beer-Garden brew patio is recycled flagstone and granite, nestled under spreading oaks and pines, our cooling water is stored rain water from a cistern, the chickens just love the spent mash. All the ingredients are as fresh as possible, some are even home grown. American malts, hops, and yeast are the mainstay of our beers. The water is from our 450' well and is just as pure and clean as can be. Our small batch brewing lets us assure you that each keg or bottle of beer will be as fresh and wonderful as though we were brewing it for ourselves to drink.

name: Bear Republic - Pub & Restaurant
description: Bear Republic's brews are hand-crafted using traditional brewing methods. We hand select only the choicest ingredients for each batch. The specialty grains and hops used by Bear Republic have been chosen for their unique characteristics. The recipes and their final formulations were developed over a period of several years. Those wonderful homebrewing sessions and the lessons learned from trial and error have established the solid foundations for each recipe's commercial equivalents. It's our goal to continually develop new recipes using our time tested home brewing methods. "I feel home brewing is the laboratory where true advancement of beer styles is coming from. "Richard G. Norgrove, Master Brewer.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 9:30 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: Beards Brewery
description: At Beards Brewery, we are devoted to making great beer. Stop by to watch us brew and enjoy a pint or two.
hoursOfOperation: Sun-Thu 3-11pm  Fri-Sat Noon-Midnight

name: BearWaters Brewing Company
description: BearWaters Brewing Company is located in Waynesville North Carolina in the beautiful Smoky Mountains of Western North Carolina. BearWaters was named in honor of the region's pristine source of mountain water. BearWaters captures the spirit, traditions and majesty of the Great Smoky Mountains. Come enjoy what happens when fearless creativity, maticulous brewing meets natures greatest natural resource.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat: 1:00 pm - 10:15 pm

name: Beast Brewing Company
description: Beast Brewing offers a unique line of craft beer focusing on robust flavors for the adventurous palate. We are conveniently located on Highway 92 in the San Jose section of Bisbee, just five minutes from downtown. Our facility offers Stunning views of the Mule Mountains in the USA to the north & the San Jose Mountains in Mexico to the south, indoor & outdoor seating, ample parking and entertainment. We are minutes from internationally renowned birding spot – the San Pedro Riparian, as well as many of Arizona’s beautiful state and national parks, including Coronado National Memorial & Forest for hiking, biking, caving, picnicking, and the like. In addition to Beast Brewing’s adventurous beer offerings, we are Proudly continuing a Bisbee tradition, we brew Electric Beer.  Electric Brewing dates back to 1988, making it Arizona’s first microbrewery.  Electric Beer provides a high-quality approachable line of products. Beast Brewing Company strives to reduce our carbon footprint by incorporating locally sourced ingredients into our products when possible, utilizing refurbished equipment, capturing gray water and donating spent grain to farmers. Stop in to Arizona’s first & wildest craft brewery for a cold, refreshing beverage after an active and sunny day in Arizona. Cheers! - See more at: http://beastbrewingcompany.com/#sthash.NabirAAL.dpuf
hoursOfOperation: Monday – Tuesday: Closed for Brewing Wednesday – Saturday: 12pm – 8pm Sunday: 12pm – 6pm - See more at: http://beastbrewingcompany.com/brewery/#sthash.k9iPJKUV.dpuf

name: Beaver Brewing Company
description: We aren’t a microbrewery…we are an artisan NANO-brewery.   Beaver Brewing Company has a 1.5 Barrel system that ensures that every beer is LITERALLY hand crafted.  Every batch is tested before it is bottled to make sure you are getting the freshest and best tasting beer money can buy.
hoursOfOperation: THURSDAYS: 4 to 10 PM  FRIDAYS: 4 to 10pm  SATURDAYS: 4 to 10 PM

name: Beaver Street Brewery
description: You can watch the chefs create your meal in our open kitchen or view the brewer creating our handcrafted ales and lagers behind the bar.

name: Beaver View Brew Co
description: Each Beaver View Brew is small-batch handcrafted within a stone's throw of the mighty Beaver Creek. We're really just a couple guys who like to make (and drink) good beer. We use an all-grain method, hand-grinding select grains fresh for each brew.

name: Becker Brewing Company
hoursOfOperation: Open Daily Noon to 6 pm, Saturday 11am to 6pm

name: Bee Creek Brewery
description: Bee Creek Brewery is a family business that nestles comfortably in an old growth forest of immense Maples, bush tangles, and surrounding thickets in Clay County, Indiana.    Established on May 7th 2007 by Dr. Frank  Forster, wife Julie, and Julie's big brother, Mark Snelling, the brewery was christened Bee Creek for the stream cutting through the center of the property.    The Forster's are dynamic owners.  Not satisfied to manage from the front office, Julie and Dr. Frank are hands-on, day-to-day problem solvers.    Then there is Bee Creek's signature ales; a product of Brewmaster Mark Snelling's accomplished recipes of hops, honey, wheat, yeast and magical elements.  A navy veteran, he commands over 25 years brewing experience.

name: Beech Mountain Brewing Co.
description: The newest craft brewery in Western North Carolina has opened in the Alpine Village at Beech Mountain Resort. Beech Mountain Brewing Co. has the capacity to brew up to 100 gallons per day and will be open year round to serve skiers, snowboarders, mountain bikers and other resort visitors.  The brewery features three distinct ales created on-site, with consulting from award-winning brewer Will Young of Blind Squirrel in nearby Plumtree. Heading the list of beers is the 5506 Pale Ale, followed by the Liberty and Yard Sale Ales. Patrons may purchase these high-quality craft beers by the pint or the growler. Flight tastings are also available, along with brewery tours, which include a pint and a keepsake glass.    "The brewery is yet another amenity added to the resort as part of our effort to become a year-round destination,” said Ryan Costin, general manager. “With the growing popularity of craft beer in North Carolina, we believe our customers will enjoy the experience."
hoursOfOperation: Thursday through Sunday. Please call ahead for hours of operation

name: Beer Army Combat Brewery
description: The Beer Army Combat Brewery is a micro brewery located in Trenton, North Carolina. The brewery opened on April 19th, 2013 in the small town of 287 people.  The brewery maintains a tap room called the "Bunker" where patrons can come sit and drink inside the brewery.  Head Brewer Jeff Brungard retired from the Marine Corps in late 2012.  Owner Dustin Canestorp is currently enlisted as a Major.

name: Beer By Design Brewery
description: Beer By Design (BBD) Brewery is the first craft brewery in Northglenn, CO. We are a production micro-brewery, producing high-quality beer designed to be enjoyed. We are an independent, traditional style brewer bringing innovation to craft beer design.    At Beer By Design, we believe that fresh quality beer produced locally, using the finest ingredients and without chemicals in processing or for preservation is the key to success among beer drinking enthusiasts.
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Thursday: 3:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Friday: 3:00 pm to 10:00 pm  Saturday: 1:00 pm to 10:00 pm  Sunday: 1:00 pm to 7:00 pm

name: Beer Engine
description: We're passionate about brewing great beer and enjoying new beers. Feel free to stop in and try one of our own brews or one of our many guest drafts. No bottles, No watered down brews, No comparsion.

name: Beer Engineers
description: We are Alabama's newest Craft Beer Company. We are dedicated to making the South's finest high gravity beers. We are experimental. We are new. We are better by design.

name: Beer Hound Brewery
hoursOfOperation: Tue:	11:00 am - 6:00 pm  Wed - Thu:	11:00 am - 7:00 pm  Fri:	11:00 am - 8:00 pm  Sat:	10:00 am - 8:00 pm  Sun:	12:30 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Beer Valley Brewing Company
description: Beer Valley Brewing Company is an award winning microbrewery located in Eastern Oregon. Founded in 2005 by brewer Pete Ricks, the brewery started production in Ontario, Oregon in the summer of 2007. Specializing in the production of strong ales, the brewery currently produces 6 brands year round, plus occasional seasonals. Beer Valley Brewing beers are available in the states of Oregon, Washington, Idaho, California, Nevada, and Arizona.
hoursOfOperation: Thursdays:  2 - 6 PM  Fridays:  2 - 6 PM  Saturdays:  11 AM - 3 PM

name: Beerded Brothers Brewing
description: Beerded Brothers Brewing Company is started by two step-brothers, Gabriel Pedersen and Max Scudder.    Beerded Brothers Brewing is a 1BBL nanobrewery located in a newly built shop in East Vancouver. Utilizing a mire 540 sq. ft., Beerded Brothers might compete for the smallest nanobrewery in Vancouver, and maybe the country!

name: Beggars Brewery
description: Beggars is a small production brewery and taproom located in the Chums Corners area of Traverse City, MI. Expect beer Fall of 2012.

name: Begyle Brewing
description: Begyle Brewing is a Community Supported Brewery, located in the Ravenswood Industrial Corridor, Chicago, IL.    Using a CSA (community supported agriculture) model, we will supply beer to our members via monthly subscriptions (referred to as a CSB or Beer-CSA!). In addition to the growler subscriptions we will offer growler fills to walk up customers through our retail space, as well as kegs and bottle for sale. We source many of our hops locally, you can expect the majority of our beers to include locally grown hops from Wisconsin and Michigan. We have lots of other things up our sleeves, too, like using spent grain for dog treats and sharing our space with local artists.

name: Production Facility & Tasting Room
description: Micro Brewery in Vista, CA - North San Diego County

name: Belford Brewing Company
description: A one-barrel nano-brewery at Campbell's Junction in the Belford section of Middletown, NJ. Open on Fridays and Saturdays with a well-rounded selection of beers.
hoursOfOperation: Fri:  6:30pm - 8:30pm Sat:  1:00pm - 5:00pm

name: Bell's Brewery, Inc.
description: Bell's Brewery, Inc. began in 1985 with a quest for better beer and a 15 gallon soup kettle. Since then, we've grown into a regional craft brewery that employs more than 200 people over an 20 state area, in addition to Puerto Rico and Washington DC. The dedication to brewing flavorful, unfiltered, quality craft beers that started in 1985 is still with us today. We currently brew over 20 beers for distribution as well as many other small batch beers that are served at our pub in Kalamazoo, the Eccentric Cafe. Our ongoing goal is to brew thoughtfully, creatively and artistically. We strive to bring an authentic and pleasant experience to all of our customers through our unique ales and beers.

name: Bell's Eccentric Cafe
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  11:00am - 12:00am Tue:  11:00am - 12:00am Wed:  11:00am - 12:00am Thu:  11:00am - 2:00am Fri:  11:00am - 2:00am Sat:  11:00am - 2:00am Sun:  12:00pm - 12:00am  Our kitchen closes daily at 9 p.m.

name: Bell's Eccentric Cafe
hoursOfOperation: Mon.-Wed.: 11 a.m.-12 a.m. Thu.-Sat.: 11 a.m.-2 a.m. Sun.: Noon-12 a.m.

name: Bellevue Brewing Company
description: Bellevue's first production brewery specializing in small-batch, handcrafted ales and lagers! We will be utilizing a 20BBL brewhouse with 160BBLs of fermentation capacity.    Although we don't intend to be an organic brewery, we will use organic ingredients whenever possible and, once food service begins, our menu items will feature organic ingredients as well. A children's menu will also be offered.    Our goal is to showcase the wonderful flavors of Washington with local food and brewing ingredients...keeping it local is good business!    We'll also feature a new Washington State wine each month and provide two guest taps for our craft brewing colleagues to showcase their beers.

name: Bellows Brew Crew
description: Bellows moved from Waunakee to Watertown in December 2001. Their new location sports a ten-barrel brewhouse in the front window, and a pool table in the back. I'm told their building will allow them to triple their ground-level floor space, and there's also a huge banquet-type room on the second floor, and a ballroom on the third, so watch for some major expansion here in the future.

name: Bellwether Hard Cider Company
description: Bellwether Hard Cider is owned and operated by Cheryl and Bill Barton.  We started the business in 1999, inspired by travels through the cider regions of France and after years of “research and development” as home cidermakers.  We started our business with the simple goals of making fine artisanal ciders and to lead the revival of a great American tradition.    We started operations in an old Babcock chicken hatchery building on Route 96 in Ithaca, New York.   In 2003 we built a new building on Route 89 in Trumansburg, New York, and planted an orchard of European cider varieties. We have been an active member of the Cayuga Lake Wine Trail for over 5 years.  At present, we produce around 10 varieties of hard ciders, ranging from very dry to semi-sweet, some with carbonation and some still.
hoursOfOperation: Open Year Round    November-February:  M-Sat 10:30am-5:00pm Sun 12:00pm-5:00pm    March-October:  M-Sat 10:30am-5:30pm Sun 12:00pm-5:30pm    Closed New Year's Day, Easter, Thanksgiving, Christmas Eve, and Christmas Day.     WE REQUIRE ADVANCE RESERVATIONS FOR GROUPS OF 10 OR MORE.

name: Belly Love Brewing Company
description: Why Belly Love?    Well... it's hard to put into words the thoughts that led to the name, because so much of it is simply the feeling you have when you consume a carefully, dare I say lovingly, crafted beer. Complex and simple at the same time. Satiating but refreshing. Nourishment for your senses. Quite plainly; beer is liquid soul food.    We feel that beer makes bellies happy and shows them love. So... raise a glass, love your belly; Belly Love!

name: Belmont Brewing Co
description: The Belmont Brewing Company opened in 1990 and is Southern California's oldest operating brewpub. Come by for a taster set of award-winning ales crafted by Head Brewer Blackwell. We serve classic American fare with international flair and the warmest customer service around.

name: Below Grade Brewing
description: In 1992 Dean Wise made his first batch of beer. Things went well--at least nothing blew up. . . and the beer was, um, beer--but he wanted something more. Dean went from using a brew kit to creating his own recipes with shocking amounts of the best malts and hops. Some questioned his sanity, but the result was exceptional beer everyone loved. Having dedicated part of his basement to a brewery, when it came time to name his burgeoning business, Below Grade Brewing was a natural fit.

name: Below the Radar Brewing Company
description: Below the Radar is Huntsville’s first Micro-Brewhouse situated in the Historic Huntsville Times Building in the recently stablished “downtown entertainment district”. Below the Radar opened its doors on August 2012 and has been expanding its lunch and dinner menu of goodness as well as its micro-brews & drinks ever since.Below the Radar is a great place to have lunch or meet after work for socializing with friends and co-workers. BTR is known for its one of a kind variety of micro-brews, extensive wine list and liquor drinks or its wonder array of food by its own in-house Chef Bill Harden. BTR menu items include like roast beef sliders topped with cilantro-horseradish sauce. And how about some Lazy Magnolia Southern Pecan Ice Cream for dessert!  Enjoy live music every Tesday night to make it a night to remember.    BTR is open 7 days a week for lunch & dinner (including a very special “Chef Bill Brunch” on Sundays). Be sure to check out the Chef Dish Pick of the Week.    BTR has thirty-two beers on tap including 7 craft brews made in-house, more than 27 bottled beers.    BTR has a Full bar and a great selection of fine wines. Be sure to check our Wine Pick of the Week.    An upscale, yet relaxed, and nonsmoking atmosphere.

name: Beltane Brewing
description: We are a start-up brewery and beer cafe located in Novato, CA (Marin County).  We are not open yet, however!  Planned opening date is on Bastille Day, July 14, 2012.  Please click on the Brewers Blog or contact us and stay in touch with our progress towards opening.    We proudly produce artisinal small-batch ales for the discerning consumer.  The cafe  will also offer chartucerie, cheese plates, pannini and snacks, sourced from local producers.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat 11:30am until 10pm  Sun 11:30am until 8pm

name: Beltway Brewing Company
description: Beltway Brewing Company is a brewery in Sterling, Virginia (Loudoun County, a Washington D.C. suburb) built exclusively as a host for partner brewing, contract brewing and production of private label beers. The mission of Beltway Brewing Company is to professionally produce high quality craft beer for those who cannot build or expand their own breweries.    Brewing operations started in September 2013 and the Tasting Room is expected to open in Spring 2014.

name: Bemidji Brewing Company
description: Bemidji Brewing Company LLC is a small craft brewery based out of the beautiful city of Bemidji, MN. Craft beer is our passion, and we hope to provide the freshest, most high quality craft beer to Bemidji and the northwoods.

name: Benchmark Brewing Company
description: Benchmark Brewing is all about delicious beer, beer that we want to take home and drink. We want consistently awesome beer that you can rely on to be the gold standard of the style.  Our year round beers are low in alcohol and high in flavor; we often find that it is nice to be able to enjoy a beer or two and keep your wits about you.  We also know that there are times when a ten percent beer is just what you need to keep you warm at night; to that end we will celebrate the seasons, months, weeks, or whatever we feel needs celebration with specialty releases that will vary wildly in alcohol content and style.  No matter the style or strength all Benchmark Beer will set the standard for its kind.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 3:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Bend Brewing Company
description: Bend Brewing Company overlooks the Deschutes River at Mirror Pond in Bend, Oregon. Locally owned and operated, this exceptional brewpub opened its doors in February of 1995 and quickly became a favorite for locals and visitors alike. The people of the B.B.C. take pride in creative, award-winning handcrafted brews, fresh and flavorful menu selections, a casual and friendly atmosphere and superb service.    Bend Brewing Co. is a great place to have lunch, dinner or just some hot nachos and cold handcrafted beer after a day skiing or hiking in Central Oregon's recreational paradise.  In the summer, B.B.C.'s patio is the best place in town to dine outside. In the winter, come in and warm up with a malty seasonal ale.   Come and see for yourself why we're the locals' favorite!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat: 11:30 am - 11:00 pm  Sun: 11:30 am - 10:00 pm

name: Benny Brewing Co.
description: Providing great quality hand crafted ales and lagers to the surrounding area.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Sat: 5:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Benson Brewery
description: Cradled in the heart of Benson on Omaha’s north side - you will find Benson Brewery, a cozy neighborhood brew-pub welcoming all who look for friendly company, good conversation, house made beers and solid drinks. We believe a bar is what its patrons and community make it, which is why we serve true, locally sourced foods when possible, well-crafted brews, and drinks to please all.    The Benson Brewery is a pub for all times. From its reclaimed wooden flooring, to its warm interiors, modern brewery, and exposed brick walls – Benson Brewery is a place without pretense. Our food, our drinks, our service and our space are inspired by old and new American traditions. We welcome all to come and feel at home in our brewery, a Benson Local
hoursOfOperation: MONDAY - WEDNESDAY  4PM to 11PM    THURSDAY - SATURDAY  4PM TO 2AM    SUNDAY  10AM TO 8M

name: Bent Brewstillery
description: Craft brewery and small batch distillery located in the great state of Minnesota. We've got great ideas for unique, beer-centric whiskeys and bourbons.

name: Bent Paddle Brewing Co.
description: Bent Paddle Brewing Co.® will be a production craft brewery located in Duluth, Minnesota. Our 30-barrel brewery and Duluth’s first production brewery taproom, The Bent Tap, is expected to open in Winter / Spring 2013. We are excited to use the amazing water of Lake Superior along with the talent of our brewers to make some of the freshest, tastiest and most dependable craft beer possible.

name: Bent River Brewing
description: Unique neighborhood brewery restaurant in "old" downtown historic district. We offer the midwest's best award- winning craft beers, a great selection of pub grub and one of the coolest beer gardens in the Quad Cities.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 3:00 am

name: Bentley Brewing Company
description: Thank you for your interest in Bentley Brewing and the Dark Horse Tavern. This is a family owned pub and brew house located at 12 Crane Street in Southbridge, Ma. Our goal is to offer a warm and inviting atmosphere where you can savor our array of freshly brewed beer on tap. We also offer a fully stocked bar for those wishing a more exotic cocktail. To accompany these libations we have a delectable selection of pub fare for your enjoyment.    As we gear up for the Dark Horse Tavern's grand opening in mid-June, Bentley Brewing, along with the help of our expert brew master, Tim Daley, will begin production of our four signature beers on tap. In subsequent weeks, we will be expanding our offerings to include four additional beers, as well as two cask ales, which will complete our on-site brewing selection.    Located just off Main Street in Southbridge, we are within easy access to major routes I-84 and the Mass Pike. Parking for over 150 cars and handicapped accessible, we offer outside dining on our spacious patio overlooking the scenic Quinebaug River, multiple large flat screen televisions broadcasting the latest sporting events throughout the bar, gaming options that include championship dartboards and a pool table, and live entertainment on Saturday evenings. You can also look into our brewing area where all the magic happens and Tim would be happy to answer any and all questions and we welcome your suggestions for future offerings. We accept reservations to accommodate parties of 30-70 guests in our conference room that includes a private bar and optional catering.    We are confident that after experiencing our locally grown and freshly prepared food, our fantastic brew and the exceptional service of our dedicated staff, you will make Bentley Brewing and the Dark Horse Tavern your favorite destination spot. We look forward to welcoming you and your guests in person at our riverside location at 12 Crane Street.
hoursOfOperation: Sat - Sun: 11:00 am - 5:00 pm

name: Berghoff Brewery, Inc
description: Berghoff’s history as a beer brand goes back over 120 years, and in that time it has developed a reputation of high quality and consistency. The first batch of Berghoff beer was brewed in Fort Wayne, Indiana in 1887 by Herman Berghoff and his three brothers. Herman’s desire to expand the market for the family’s beer led him to sell the product at the Chicago World’s Fair where it received high acclaim. Since then, Berghoff has continued its success and relevance in the Chicago market and beyond.                  As the craft beer market has evolved, the brand has received fresh, exciting updates. Berghoff changed its brewing location and is now proudly brewed at Point Brewery in Stevens Point, Wisconsin. Berghoff has also refreshed itself with updated recipes and packaging. With consulting from brewing experts Randy Mosher and John Hannafan, Berghoff’s new, top-notch beers are ready to satisfy consumer demand. As the brewery looks to the future, Berghoff beer will continue to evolve as trends change, but will always maintain its roots as an authentic German-style brew whose history and tradition will never be forgotten.

name: Berkshire Brewing Company
description: Berkshire Brewing Company Inc. is a regional brewery located in South Deerfield, MA, established in 1994 by Christopher T. Lalli and Gary A. Bogoff, a pair of homebrewers with the vision of being Massachusetts’ local brewery. Our goal is to produce clean, fresh, well-balanced ales & lagers in small batches. At the present time we are capable of producing 580 barrels (17,980 gallons) of fresh beer each week. All of our beer is unfiltered, unpasteurized and contains no chemical additives or preservatives. As craft brewers, we are now producing nine styles of beer year round and seven seasonals.

name: Berryessa Brewing Company
description: Berryessa Brewing Co. is a 20 barrel craft brewery located just outside historic Winters, California. We take pride in producing fresh quality beer available for wholesale or to enjoy at our taproom.    The tap room is located at the brewery, a relaxed atmosphere in a country setting. There we have indoor seating, scenic outdoor seating, games, occasional entertainment, good company and most importantly, excellent fresh beer. We offer full pints, half pints, and sample trays. More often than not, you will find cask conditioned and barrel aged beers drawn off a cask engine exclusively at the tap room. You can also purchase 64 oz. growlers to go of any of our six rotating taps filled with a counter pressure growler filler.
hoursOfOperation: Fri:	3:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat - Sun:	12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Berthoud Brewing Company
description: Berthoud Brewing Co. is a locally owned craft brewery in Berthoud, Colorado. Our brewery is dedicated to produce authentic beers that represent the unique experiences of our friends, family, and community.
hoursOfOperation: Wed:  2:00pm - 9:00pm Thu:  2:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  2:00pm - 10:00pm Sat:  2:00pm - 10:00pm Sun:  1:00pm - 8:00pm

name: Bertrams Salmon Valley Brewery
description: Bertram’s Salmon Valley Brewery, like the town from which it derives its name, is situated in the heart of the beautiful northwestern Rocky Mountains on the River-of-No-Return. Salmon is the portal to the largest wilderness area in the contiguous United States, the Frank Church Wilderness.     Once the center of an active mining, logging and ranching community Salmon has probably been the West’s best-kept secret. However, following the centennial of the Lewis and Clark expedition, this haven for recreationists is fast becoming a popular tourist destination.

name: Berwick Brewing
description: Berwick Brewing is dedicated to providing the highest quality, full-flavored, drinkable, Ales & Lagers with only the highest quality ingredients. Our commitment to freshness and character reflects in each glass. With over 50 years combined experience, we understand what our customers seek in quality brewing and world class products.

name: Beryl's Beer Co
description: Beryl's Beer Co. is dedicated to delivering high quality barrel aged beers to the local community.

name: Bessemer City Brewing
description: Bessemer City Brewing is located just 25 miles west of Charlotte on I85 near the base of Crowders Mountain in historic Bessemer City. The beer is currently brewed and served in the Whisky Mill Bar & Grill known locally for its excellent eats, rubs & sauces. BCB’s focus is to brew high quality craft beer in the style of beers from the United Kingdom & Ireland. We celebrate the pride of our city’s culture and history by naming our beers after original city founders, industries & landmarks.

name: Beta Brewing
description: Established in 2008 by founder, owner, and brewer, K. Kasner as a one man, one barrel operation. We intend to launch our beer in local markets this year (2012) and hope you'll hop on board.

name: Bethlehem Brew Works
description: Established on April 15, 1998 by the Fegley Family, Bethlehem Brew Works successfully captured the essence of Bethlehem's steel industry in a 250 seat brewpub. Signature beers include Steelworkers' Oatmeal Stout, Valley Golden ale, and the award winning Fegley's ESB. In addition, three seasonal taps have been frequented with beers ranging from Pale Ales and Wheats to Pumpkin Ale and Belgian Lambics. Accompanying the six beers brewed right in the restaurant is a full bar specializing in single malt scotches, small batch bourbons, and specialty martinis. Open seven days a week, BBW offers lunch and dinner featuring many items which incorporate the handcrafted beer into their recipes. Golden Ale Hummus, Beer and Cheese Soup, Brewschetta, Diamond Plate Pork, and Beer-Marinated Portabella Napoleon are just a hint of what the menu has to offer.

name: Bettler Brewing Company
description: Bettler Brewing Company, LLC is a brewpub in planning. We are currently looking for a permanent location in the Lake Norman area of North Carolina just north of Charlotte.

name: Bier Brewery & Taproom
description: The Bier Brewery and Taproom is excited to be one of the newest breweries in Indiana.  We are committed to the highest quality and best tasting bier in Indianapolis.  Our small size allows BIER to have the utmost control over the many different variables that go into brewing a batch of beer.
hoursOfOperation: Monday-Tuesday  Closed  Wednesday:  3:00 PM-  7:00 PM     Thursday: 3:00 PM - 7:00 PM  Friday: 3:00 PM - 7:00 PM  Saturday: 1:00 PM - 7:00 PM        Sunday: 12:00 PM - 4:00 PM

name: Biercamp
description: Seasonal varieties of artisan sausage, bratwurst, hot dogs, jerky, bacon, pickled items, nano brews and more hand made fresh in-house.

name: BierWerks Brewery
description: German Style Brewpub with a great outdoor patio.  Always the place to stop on the way back from a day of skiing.

name: Big Al Brewing
description: To share the passion for brewing and the love of beer that we celebrated as home brewers.    We're proud to offer six year-round beers; a traditional irish red, a chocolatey smoked porter, a session pale ale, dry-hopped IPA, an amber just to pair with pizza and an ESB created to celebrate the passion of our very own Emerald City Supporters.

name: Big Alice Brewing
description: In late 2012, Big Alice will arrive in Long Island City as one of its first breweries since Prohibition offering small batch, handcrafted, high quality beers to the neighborhood utilizing local and organic ingredients whenever possible. We look forward to turning pounds of grain into gallons of beer.

name: Big Bay Brewing Company
description: At Big Bay Brewing we believe that life on the water is a little sweeter. And that sweet life is infused in every beverage we create. To us, life on the water means creating and savoring memories and moments that are cherished for a lifetime. And what better way to enhance those memories and moments than with the right beverage to sip and savor.     The founders of Big Bay have a strong fundamental belief that craft brewed beverages and life on the water go hand in hand. Alone, what we drink is just sustenance, but paired with the right sights, sounds and settings, it becomes part of a much larger experience. And we are dedicated to bringing the “experience” back to brewing. After all, our personal life experiences have played a leading role in developing Big Bay Brewing. And as we grow, we invite you to be a part of Big Bay by sharing your experiences with us. In other words, we want you to be a part of the sweet life with us.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Wed: 4:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Thu:	12:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 4:00 pm

name: Big Bear Mountain Brewery
description: The Big Bear Mountain Brewery and Restaurant building on Red Ant Hill is one of the oldest commercial buildings in Big Bear. It was built in 1925 by a renowned pioneer of Big Bear named Bill Knickerbocker. The big pale yellow building was the original home of the Masonic Temple, but now the historic landmark building has a hand-crafted wooden bar and rustic ambience.

name: Big Beaver Brewing Company
description: We are committed to brewing the best beer possible following the Germany purity law which states only water, malted barley, hops, and yeast can be used to make beer. To ensure maximum flavor, our beers are never filtered or pasturized.

From choice cuts of aged beef, including a 20-ounce Porterhouse, or a 9-ounce Filet Mignon, menu selections range from fine steaks, chicken, pork and seafood entrees, to a tempting selection of appetizers. Our chef's daily dessert specials complete your dining experience.  Join our master brewer for a tour of the operating brewery and taste test our newest brew, or visit our Northwoods inspired gift shop for a selection of unusual gifts. Featuring our glass walled, 15,000 barrel capacity brewery, Big Buck offers 8 signature beers along with seasonal specialty brews sure to please the most discriminating palate.   Enjoy dinner or drinks on our deck during the season.  Watch your favorite team or make a presentation on one of our many large screen televisions.  Our child and adult game rooms are available for your pre or post dining entertainment. With advance notice, special hours and special menus, including breakfast menus, may be arranged!

name: Big Choice Brewing
description: Big Choice Brewing is a microbrewery owned by Nathaniel Miller, his wife Andrea and Tyler Ruse, all Colorado natives that want to make great beer for their local communities. Come by the tasting room and see what the Big Choice is all about.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri:	4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat:	2:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sun:	2:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Big Daddy's Brewing Co.

The variety of beers we brew here are all unfiltered leaving in all the good stuff most breweries take out, so that means are beers are better for you (HA,HA). Big Daddy's boasts of having a 250 member exclusive mug club so if you want to join you better sign up way in advance. We also have a variety of entertainment at Big Daddy's on the weekends and some weekdays you just need to check the calendar for who's playing and when. We do offer tours of the brewery if you call ahead we can usually fit you in. You can find our beers at the other Awful Arthur's locations. We hope to be in a bar near you in the future and remember to support your local brewery.

name: Big Dog's Brewing Company

name: Big E Ales
description: Our unique, cozy and family-friendly brewpub is tucked away in a small industrial park in Lynnwood, WA. We have been at this location producing our handcrafted ales since 2005. We take pride in serving our patrons more than just a quick beer or a bite to eat; we want to build friendships that go beyond the bar. Beer to us is something that bonds and brings people together from all walks of life. We specialize in transforming your events and parties either at our brewery or your home into an impressive beer experience. Our dispensing systems are not only innovative and efficient, they will enhance your party and will impress your guests…they will be talking about the amazing beer and the cool “party pig” long after your party. Over the past 5 years we have grown from a small production brewery with a tasting room into a neighborhood hangout. Come in and enjoy one of our handcrafted beverages in our cedar lined pub or out in our beer garden, oh and don’t forget to order our Big “E” Signature Reuben. Next time you are faced with a “Beer Emergency” either personal or with your friends come down to the Big “E” and we will help bail you out.
hoursOfOperation: Tuesday- Saturday 11:00 AM to 10:00 PM

description: Big Elm Brewing is a production brewery in Sheffield, MA. Bill and Christine Heaton, former owners/brewers for Pittsfield Brew Works are canning and kegging their beers which are available all over Berkshire County.

name: Big Head Brewing Company

name: Big Muddy Brewing Co
description: All over the United States, craft breweries are continuing an American tradition which experienced an almost 50 year drought after the repeal of prohibition. Big Muddy Brewing in Murphysboro, Illinois is much like many of these new “microbreweries” all over the country, reinvigorating an industry and continuing a heritage that has skipped several generations.  Until 1940, Murphysboro was the home of a thriving brewery and until prohibition; it was one of the cornerstones of the town’s industry. In 1910, the Stecher Brewing Company produced more than 40,000 barrels of beer a year. However, passage of the Volstead Act in 1919, which ushered in the era of prohibition, began a slow decline to the brewery’s demise.  Big Muddy Brewing’s founder Chuck Stuhrenberg attended Southern Illinois University Carbondale in the 1980s. After graduation, he opened a franchise of Chicago’s Rosati’s Pizza in Carbondale and in 1990, began another venture, Spray Shield Industries.  It was while Stuhrenberg was in college at SIU that he began making his own beer.  Stuhrenberg and his college buddies would homebrew, and as the years went on, he began to take his hobby more seriously.  Stuhrenberg always had professional brewing in the back of his mind, but it stayed a hobby until 2009. In July, 2009, Big Muddy Brewing finally began production, the first brewery in Murphysboro in over 50 years.  The first beer offered by Big Muddy Brewing is Kinkaid Wheat. It was a recipe popular with Stuhrenberg’s family and friends. It was also something he felt would be a good “craft beer transition brew” for those used to the conventional corporate brew (BMC).  Kinkaid Wheat is currently offered on tap and by bottle in bars, restaurants and liquor stores across Southern Illinois alongside of Big Muddy Brewing’s second selection, “Saluki Dunkel Dog”, a dark, amber/dunkel style beer.  The third and newest addition to Big Muddy Brewing’s lineup is an ale called “Big Muddy Pale Ale”, and future varieties include “Logan’s Lager”.

name: Big Rip Brewing Company
description: The Big Rip was founded by two friends who caught the beer and wine making bug years ago and decided to throw in together to start this brewery. We don’t have goals of taking over the world or creating beer that only appeals to a select few. Instead, we want to create unique beers that appeal to both beer-nerds and beer-curious people.

name: Big Rock Chop House & Brewery
description: djoining the restaurant is a 1,950-square-foot brew house, with custom-designed, state-of-the-art equipment. Award-winning Brewmaster Dan Rogers has created four signature beers to complement the restaurant’s distinctive American fare: Norm’s Raggedy Ass Ale, Raymondo El Rojo, Flying Buffalo Stout and Weizenheimer Hefe Weizen. In addition to the four regular beers, Rogers adds a seasonal and specialty brew, which he changes frequently. A testament to their focus on quality, Big Rock Chophouse has been the proud recipient of Gold and Bronze medals at the annual World Beer Championships.       All beer is available to go by purchasing one of our growlers. Tours of the brew house are also available by request.

name: Big Storm Brewing Co.
description: Big Storm Brewing Co. was founded in 2011 by longtime friends Clay Yarn and Mike Bishop. Using their backgrounds in different areas of business to fuel their passion for beer, they built Big Storm from the ground up together. Now proudly serving the Tampa Bay area with good craft beer, Big Storm Brewing Co brings new meaning to the phrase "hand crafted".
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 4:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Fri: 4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat: 2:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sun: 1:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Big Time Brewing Company
description: Big Time's brewery is a 14 barrel JV Northwest system consisting of a gas fired brew kettle, an infusion mash tun with mixer, a hot liquor back, a wort cooler, (5) 14 barrel fermenters, (1) bright beer tank, and (20) 7 bbl serving tanks.      We sell 85% of our beer at the pub but do wholesale a limited number of kegs to a dozen or so Seattle area taverns. We currently brew approximately 1,300 barrels of beer per year

name: Big Top Brewing Company
description: Big Top Brewing Company is a Sarasota based production brewery. Proudly distributed by Coastal Beverage, Gold Coast Eagle Distributing, Great Bay Distributing, and Pepin Distributing Company.    Having lived here all our lives we know the history behind our beautiful town. Typically seen as a tourist destination for beaches, weather and art, Big Top plans to add world renown beer manufacture to those well deserved titles. We look forward to crafting the best beer, in the best town and showcasing it with the best artwork designed by Ringling School of Art and Design graduates.

name: Big Wood Brewery
description: Brewed in Vadnais Heights, MN, Big Wood Brewery is a licensed production brewery that produces distinctive craft brews for distribution throughout MN. Touting its edgy yet playful brand image and unforgettable name among its most distinguishing factors, Big Wood Brewery recognizes that, to stand out in Minnesota, consumers need to be torn away from normalcy. Ambiguity runs rampant among dozens of area breweries, yielding an opportunity for a bold new player to gain notoriety for its brand and its brews.

name: Bike Dog Brewing Company
description: Bike Dog Brewing Company is co-founded by four Sacramentans with a love for bikes, dogs and craft beer. The brewers fell in love with the endless flavor profiles available through brewing and the delicate hop profiles only available in incredibly fresh beer and want to share that love with beer drinkers from all over the Sacramento area.    Bike Dog is West Sacramento’s first brewery and the only one in town with a tasting room. We operate a 3 barrel brewhouse (industry speak for really small) on site. Brewing small batches means the beer will always be amazingly fresh and allows for the flexibility to mix it up a little with new recipes getting brewed on a regular basis. Because it will be brewed in such small batches, much of the beer will be available only for purchase in the Bike Dog tasting room — allowing customers to see the beer go from grain to glass and hobnob with the brewers and allowing the brewers to personally nurture the local craft beer community.
hoursOfOperation: Fri: 5:00 pm - 9:30 pm  Sat: 2:00 pm - 9:30 pm

name: Binghamton Brewing Company
description: Binghamton Brewing Co. was founded in 2011 with the idea to bring craft beer back to Binghamton. We pride ourselves on interesting brews and creating an atmosphere where customers receive the utmost level of service and have an amazing amount of fun while doing so.    Lead by Kristen Lyons & Jason Gardner the vision of Binghamton Brewing Co. is to create a place that is unique and fun. The vision is to use a systemic design to enhance the customer experience and to use technology in a whole new way.

name: Tap Room
description: Birdsong Brewing is Charlotte’s newest microbrewery.  Birdsong was founded in 2011 with a quest for better beer and a 5 gallon soup kettle. Our vision is similar to many of our favorite craft brewing mentors who have inspired us to open our own brewery: We strive to brew flavorful, unfiltered, quality craft beers for distribution in the Charlotte, NC area.       We are located in NoDa at 26th & North Davidson and we started retail distribution and tap room sales in December 2011.  Our goal is to create outstanding beer, to have a low impact on the environment, and to create personal relationships and ties to the local community.      We have 7 owners and an extremely talented brewer - Conor Robinson.      Our inspiration comes from the popular and innovative styles of the West Coast brewers and is fueled by Conor's Passion and ability to construct unique yet sessionable recipes.  We're excited to add to the growing craft beer movement in Charlotte and the Carolinas.
hoursOfOperation: Thursday:  5pm - 10pm  Friday:  5pm - 10pm  Saturday:  2pm - 10pm  Sunday:  Noon - 4pm

name: Brea
description: To brew consistently great beer in a variety of ale and lager styles. That's really what BJ's beer is all about.  	  At BJ's we recognize that brewing is both an art and a science.    We also respect the vast variety of beer styles that the world has to offer - from the delicate balance of German Kolsch to the robust intensity of Russian Imperial Stout.    Our Passionate and talented team of brewers strives toward one simple goal: to brew consistently great beer in a variety of ale and lager styles. That's really what BJ's beer is all about.

name: Black Acre Brewing Company
description: Black Acre Brewing Co. is a new small batch brewery located in Irvington, Indiana. The idea for Black Acre initially was conceived in 2010 due to our love of brewing, great beer, and the beer community at large. We created Black Acre with the goal of contributing delicious and unique beers to the community in which we live.    Black Acre hand crafts its ales using a custom fabricated 3 barrel electric brewing system. The brewery will produce four house beers along with an ever rotating selection of seasonal and specialty beers. Distribution will be primarily though in house tap room sales although there will be limited outside distribution. Our beers are not ready quite yet, but stop by for a glass of one of our delicious guest taps and meet the staff.
