name: Black Bottle Brewery
description: Black Bottle Brewery is a fancy Beer Bar that brews beer on site and has guest taps. The delicious beers are complimented with great small plates/Tapas.    The mission at Black Bottle Brewery is to create world-class and unique handcrafted ales and lagers. Going against the grain of the traditional craft brewing industry, BBB prides itself on the use of radical ingredients, brewing styles, and techniques.    BBB is devoted to providing a unique and innovative drinking environment, enhanced by great food. We are committed to sourcing food and ingredients locally, thus giving back to our community. BBB's staff will focus on customer education and great service, and the Company will employ only those who share our passion for high-quality beer and food

name: Black Couch Brewery
description: The concept for Black Couch Brewery was developed in late 2008 by three close friends, William Cook, Travis Morgan, and Dave Svec. After sampling one of the earliest batches of our flagship product, American Homecoming Pale Ale, we realized very quickly that it tasted better than even the most popular beer brands available in the regional marketplace. We were sure that others would enjoy our beer, and the positive responses from tasters everywhere have reinforced our belief in the quality and taste. We are committed to developing unique and flavorful beers, using the finest ingredients available. We are currently in the planning stages of the brewery and hope to have it up and running in the Washington D.C. area in late 2010 or early 2011.

name: Black Diamond Brewing Company
description: Unwind after a day on the slopes or, more likely, a day in the office, with a hand-crafted Black Diamond brew at our Concord brewing facility. Your taste buds will immediately appreciate the finest of ingredients that go into making our exceptionally refreshing and flavorful beers, and you will feel right at home in our welcoming Tap Room. Sample some of our famous ales and enjoy a tour of our brewery - you will quickly realize why our seasoned Brewmaster is a multiple award-winning brewer. You have worked hard. Give yourself a break. Let Black Diamond Brewing help you and your friends dial down from a day of 'shredding' on the slopes or at the office.

name: Black Dragon Brewery
hoursOfOperation: Tuesday-Thursday 11-7:00pm, Friday 11-9pm, Saturday 10-9pm, Sunday 10-5pm & Closed on Mondays

name: Black Forest Brew Haus
description: The Black Forest Brew Haus is the end result of two great countries combining their greatest attributes. Germany’s rich history and excellence in beer brewing -and consumption- combined with America’s ongoing pursuit for perfection have made us an award winning brewery with a menu to please all palates.    Black Forest’s mother company, Privatbrauerei Hoepfner of Karlsrue, Germany has been brewing since 1798 and shares its knowledge & tradition with the Black Forest Brew Haus including materials, recipes and equipment. All Black Forest beer is fresh brewed on our premises using only the finest imported yeast, hops, malt and the purest filtered water.     Our brew master uses modern technology and respect for German tradition to produce award winning beer for our customers, and creates new recipes that will excite even the most jaded of beer connoisseurs. This is what sets the Black Forest Brew Haus apart from all other brew pubs.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:30 am - 11:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:30 am - 1:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: Black Heart Brewery
description: We are Black Heart Brewery; we are a home brewery located in Binghamton, New York, and we are in the process of becoming a nanobrewery. Coincidentally, these web pages are in the process of becoming our website. We are overhauling the whole thing, adding much more content, as well as many more new sections.     Black Heart Brewery was founded many batches of home brew ago between two high school friends, Brett Martin and Jay Maslar. See what happens when you seat people in alphabetical order? We currently brew 10 gallon all grain batches on our custom, hand made heat exchange recirculating mash system; it is named HERMES. It is capable of fully automated brewing and extremely accurate data display and recording with our cutting edge Brewtroller 4.0.

name: Black Hog Brewing Company
description: Black Hog Brewing started with the story of food, family, and a love for craft beer. Brothers Jason and Tom Sobocinski come from a Polish/Italian family where food and drink is always the focus of every gathering. From Jason’s wedding to his son’s birthdays, roasting a pig has become the favorite way to celebrate any special occasion. Tyler Jones, an old family friend and former brewer of The Portsmouth Brewery in New Hampshire, contacted Jason and Tom with a plan to move to New Haven so his wife and son could be closer to their family. With a plan in the works to form a brewery that would celebrate family and food, they needed to encompass all that they were passionate about. When they celebrate, they roast a hog and the Berkshire hog is the breed of choice, thus Black Hog brewing was born!     Black Hog Brewing (BHB) will have a strong tie to local agriculture with a focus on unique craft brews that are pleasant to drink and pair well with foods of all types. Black Hog Brewing will craft year round and seasonal brews with a seasonal Farm Land Series dedicating a percentage of proceeds to support CT Farm Land. 3-4 pig roasts per year, using CT raised Berkshire pigs fed our spent brewing grains will celebrate the release of our seasonal brews. We hope you’ll enjoy Black Hog Brewing Company at one of our pig roasts soon or whatever occasion brings you together for great beer and food with friends and family.

name: Black Hole Beer Company
description: Our Taproom features a modern yet casual atmosphere where can enjoy a rotating selection of fine craft beer, wine, homemade sangria, whiskey, as well as some light fare. We will be offering special events and live music. Our beautiful outdoor area will feature a covered 12 foot farm table, covered standing bar area, bocce ball court, darts, gas and wood burning fire pits, and a relaxing garden.     We are so excited to announce the arrival of Harley Guy as our new Gastropub chef at the Blackhole taproom. The new menu is focused on seasonal homemade food with a unique point of view. Stay tuned for updated menu items.

name: Black Husky Brewing LLC
description: Making the world a better place one beer at a time, and to promote the joys of jodeling. Hoping to one day have a reality show called "Jodeling with the Stars."

name: Black Lotus Brewing Company
description: Mark Harper, Michael Allan and his wife Jodi Allan (Mark’s sister) founded Black Lotus Brewing Company in 2006.  Their family business formed when Mark (a school psychologist and musician) and Mike (a financial planner and banker) both longed for more creative and spiritual control over their careers.  Disheartened by massive corporate entities serving up inferior products, Mark and Mike, together with Jodi (a high school educator) created the philosophy: “Think Global, Drink Local. “    Under this philosophy Black Lotus is committed to providing quality-handcrafted products to each and every one of its customers.  Furthermore, these products are to be served to the customer with timeliness, friendliness and individualized care.   In addition, Black Lotus is committed to the notion that this care should be extended to the community at large and the world when possible.  This is accomplished by supporting charitable contributions and activities that bring the world more creation, more compassion, more art, more tastefulness, and more peace.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:30 am - 1:00 am  Fri - Sat: 11:30 am - 2:00 am  Sun: 12:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Main Location
description: For Crazy Ed Chilleen, beer was too important to be trusted to outsiders, so, in 1989, he started brewing his own. The beer was good, that the yuppies started driving in from all over to try it. Something had to be done! So, whenever one of them whined for a wedge of lime, Ed put a hot serrano chili pepper into the beer instead. Amazingly, many of them actually liked the stuff.

name: Black Raven Brewing Company
description: The Black Raven is a true neighborhood brewery with a small retail taproom. We are the Eastside’s home to world-class, small-batch brewed ales & lagers. We also feature a continually changing hand-picked selection of other notable Washington State beers. And most importantly, home to local beer lovers who want to be a part of a community that enjoys great beer and great friends.

name: Black Shirt Brewing Company
description: An artisanal brewing company that combines classic and timeless technique coupled with progressive innovation and unwavering commitment to quality to create the very pinnacle of beer. Our hand-crafted, hand-bottled beer will be available in fine restaurants and select retail establishments soon.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Fri: 5:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 2:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Black Sky Brewery
description: Beer.Pizza.Metal. Black Sky has 23 taps featuring in-house and guest brews, and serves a distinct New Haven Style Pizza. Daily lunch specials and happy hours!
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 2:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: Black Star Co-op Pub & Brewery
description: With a special focus on local producers, the basic mission of the Black Star Co-op is to foster an environment in which member-owners, as well as the general public, may realize the principles of co-operative ownership, worker self-management, education and community action through the responsible enjoyment great beer and food.    As the first enterprise of this type, we seek to realize an alternative business model for brewpubs and to help expand the co-operative movement into new and innovative areas — both in Austin and around the world.
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Thursday: 4:00pm - Midnight  Friday - Saturday: 2:00pm - 1:00am  Sunday: 2:00pm - Midnight

name: Black Swan Brewpub
description: From the start, Black Swan Brewpub has been driven to provide its customers with a unique culinary experience, delicious beers and warm hospitality.    Our chef, Nick Carter, has taken the dishes we know and love and incorporated freshness, originality and homemade goodness that cannot be found today in Southwest Indianapolis.    Soon, Black Swan Brewpub will have our brewery in place. In the meantime, while construction is underway, we will be serving a spectacular draught selection of craft beers, many of which are made right here in Indiana.

name: Tap Room
description: Sheridan's award winning brewery in the heart of downtown. Black Tooth Brewing Co has many different beers on tap that are brewed on premise.    Award Winners like  Deer Abbey - Bronze Medal 2011 NABA Awards  Wagon Box Wheat - Silver Medal 2011 NABA Awards    and of course our other favorites...  Bomber Mountain Amber  Indian Paintbrush Ale (IPA)
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Thursday 12:00pm to 10:00pm  Friday – Saturday 12:00pm to 11:00pm  Sunday - 2pm to 7pm

name: Blackberry Farm Brewery
description: Tucked away on Blackberry Farm's 4200 acre estate in the foothills of the Great Smoky Mountains, Blackberry Farm Brewery produces classic Old World - style beers - each one artisan-crafted and bottle-conditioned.

name: Blackhorse Pub and Brewery
description: When The Blackhorse first opened in 1992, our goal was to provide that neighborhood Pub atmosphere where “everybody knows your name.” Since then we have strived to provide the food, service and atmosphere that would make people want to come back. Today the Blackhorse Pub and Brewery has grown into a mainstay in Historic Downtown Clarksville known for fresh brewed, handcrafted beers, gourmet pizza, steaks and other favorites. Clarksville has many casual dining restaurants today. But, there is only one locally owned brewpub serving the freshest handcrafted ales brewed on site daily right in the heart of downtown Clarksville.

name: Blackjack Brewing Company
description: A craft brewery in Raleigh, NC

name: Blacklist Brewing
description: Break the Big Beer Model! Beer brewed with quality, creativity and culture in mind. See our 2013 beer offerings, to the right, and look for our upcoming Kickstarter Campaign for details.    Blacklist is a year long project that meshes local artisans with beer and the brewing process to create fun and unique collaborations. Featuring a different artist and brew each month, we bring you a drinking experience worth sharing and talking about. Available in VERY limited quantities for pick-up in MN only. Look for further details on our upcoming kickstarter.com campaign. Til then, Skal, and stay thirsty for new beers.

name: Blackrocks Brewery
description: At Blackrocks Brewery our mission is to have fun and brew great beer that challenges conventional norms. We offer you a wide variety of beers and rotate them regularly. The Blackrocks experience is: local, unique, and diverse.    Some say we are limited by our small size. We look at it a little differently, located in an old four square house, the brewery and tasting room compliment the small nature of our operation. The setting lends a neighborhood feel and harkens back to a traditional public house where people can meet and play chess or debate politics.

name: Blacksburg Brewing Company
description: Blacksburg Brewing Co. (BBC) is an independent specialty brewer of premium beer.  As mandated by the Reinheitsgebot (German Purity Law), our beer is brewed with only 4 ingredients: water, barley malt, hops, and yeast.  The best beer requires the best ingredients, so we purchase them regardless of the cost.  We pay a premium to import the Cadillac of barley malt from Bamberg, and our hops from The Hallertau are the best that money can buy, period.

name: Blackstone Brewing Company
description: Blackstone Restaurant & Brewery was established in 1994 and was the first brewpub in Nashville. In 2011 we expanded as Blackstone Brewing Company when we opened a brand new state of the art brewery in Nashville.
hoursOfOperation: Sunday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM  Monday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM  Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM  Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM  Thursday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM  Friday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM  Saturday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM

name: Blackwater Brewing Company
description: The Blackwater Brewing Company is a family owned company. The company was formed in 1998 as a natural growth of a sole proprietorship, beginning with approximately four employees. Today we employ 13 local residents and continue to provide a family friendly environment for our patrons. The original owners, Terry Lee and Rosalinde Benson, continue to manage the daily operations here at Blackwater Brewing Company. Blackwater Brewing Company is currently divided into two divisions: food & beverage operations, and malt beverage brewing operations.

name: Blatant Brewery
description: Blatant beers are exceptional. That much is clear from the taste alone.   Here’s what makes us world class:    Blatant beers are forceful, but never forced.   These beers are dynamic and creative.   We work with the brew on its own terms, nurturing and developing its unique personality.   Anybody can throw together an average brew.   Only a true artisan can craft a flavorful and vibrant drinking experience.   No shortcuts. We pay extra attention to what goes in.   We smell, taste and study each of our choice ingredients.   Our brews are born of passion.   Obviously, a love of brewing is the first ingredient in a brew worth loving.     Blatant is new. We aren’t.   We have been in the brewing business for many years—this experience, time and energy spent has earned us a reputation as talented brewers and true artisans.     Yes, our beers are handcrafted.   Yes, we are brew artisans.   And yes, we've got well over 20 years experience in every keg, bottle, and can. But let’s face it: In the end, all that matters is the taste.     Be Blatant!

name: Blind Bat Brewery
description: A one-man, part-time, 3 barrel brewery. The brewery is young, the brewer ain't!

name: Blind Squirrel
description: The Vance Toe River Lodge was originally built in 1919 as the T. B. Vance General Store. After trading hands through the years and seeing its fair share of abuse it was renovated by the Young family and continues to evolve.  With that evolution came the expansion of our  “Lodge Family”.  When Aaron Maas moved to Plumtree, NC in 2009 as an avid home brewer, the dream to open a brewery slowly moved towards reality.  After 3 painstaking years, the brewery finally opened in July of 2012.  We are excited to be able to live in such a wonderful place and still have the ability to follow our passions.  Come out to Plumtree so we can prove to you that we’re nuts about beer!!
hoursOfOperation: Wednesday & Thursday - 11:00am- 8:00pm  Friday & Saturday- 11:00am - 10:00pm  Closed Sunday

name: Blind Tiger Brewery & Restaurant
description: We opened the first brewery in Topeka since the Prohibition era.   It is named after the Prohibition era custom of displaying stuffed tigers in establishments to alert patrons of the availability of bootleg alcohol. These speakeasies were referred to as “Blind Tigers.”   We keep at least six flagships and seven rotating seasonals on tap, to the tune of about 1200 barrels a year. Our brews have gathered 20 national and international awards over the past 14 years.  Our Brewpub is located at 37th & South Kansas Avenue.

name: Block 15 Brewing Company
description: We brew with the finest organic base malt, in combination with top quality imported specialty malts and Northwest grown hops. On tap you will find at least 12, sometimes up to 14 of our own brews representing a fine spectrum of beer styles. On average we have a new beer on tap every 1-2 weeks, recreating classic styles and developing our own unique brews as well.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Thu - Sat:	11:00 am - 1:00 am  Sun:	11:00 am - 11:00 pm

name: Brewpub @ Lennies
description: Philosophy—  Life without labor is guilt.   Labor without art is brutality—John Rusgan    There is a nearly infinite variety of ways to make good beer. At the Bloomington Brewing Company, we make beers that we like to drink. That’s the first rule. Great ingredients and attention to detail is the second. Our intention is not to grow a large brewery operation, our intention is to make great beer that we like to drink and to take care of our community.    We make only ales and they are available only on draft in Bloomington, Indianapolis and the surrounding communities. We do not bottle our beers. We’re not against bottling, and we will assuredly reach a point in the future where we will package our beer, but no matter how good a beer is in the bottle, it can never be better than the beer coming from a well managed tap. Often it will be not nearly as good. Why? Draft beer is fresher; that’s a big one. Packaging beer is a complicated process with lots of potential for bad things to happen. Once packaged, the beer is exposed to its two mortal enemies; Sunlight and time.
hoursOfOperation: Sun - Thurs: 11:00 a.m. - Midnight*  Fri - Sat: 11:00 a.m. - 1:00 a.m.*  *Restaurant closes 1 hour earlier.

name: Blowing Rock Brewery
description: The Blowing Rock Brewery and Ale House Restaurant is located in downtown Blowing Rock. A state-of-the-art brewing system consists of a 5 barrel Mash Tun, Brew Kettle and 10 barrel Fermenters & Brights . The brewery offers an impressive variety of craft beers brewed by master brewer, Ray Hodge. The Blowing Rock Ale House restaurant offers a freshly prepared, seasonally changing menu using local & organic ingredients when available. 64 ounce “growler” fills of freshly brewed beer are offered daily, with brewery tours 1:00-5:30pm Saturdays. We hope you will join us for lunch & dinner, 11am-9pm.    152 Sunset Drive  Blowing Rock, NC 28605-1236  Telephone: 828-414-9600   http://blowingrockbrewing.com/
hoursOfOperation: Brewery tours are available Saturdays 1- 5:30pm.

name: Blue and Gray Brewing Co
description: The Blue & Gray Brewing Co. opened in Fredericksburg on March 17, 2002.  Before that, Fred Red Ale and the Blue & Gray Classic Lager were brewed at other  microbreweries in Virginia. We listened to customer input and perfected our recipes  before we started brewing in Fredericksburg. Blue & Gray Brewing Co. now offers Falmouth American  Pale Ale and Stonewall Stout for a total of four flavors year round. We also offer Spiced  Winter Ale for Thanksgiving through January, Chocolate Raspberry Stout for January-February and  Virginia Hefeweizen Memorial Day through Labor Day.

name: Blue Bee Cider
description: Virginia’s first and only urban cidery, Blue Bee Cider is located in the heart of downtown Richmond’s Old Manchester district at the fall line of the James River. The name for Blue Bee Cider is derived from a common name for one of Virginia’s native bees, osmia lignaria, or the blue orchard bee. These hardworking bees are solitary and wild, emerging early in the cool spring just in time to pollinate apple blossoms.    At Blue Bee Cider, we aim to create balanced ciders true to their Virginia roots from a culinary perspective and true to the fruit from a cidermaking one. Each apple variety ferments differently, creating its own flavors which vary year to year depending on weather conditions. Blue Bee Ciders are never chapitalized (it’s so sunny in the South, who needs to add sugar?) and never watered down. We use raw juice and ferment it straight off the press.

name: Blue Blood Brewing Company
description: Blue Blood Brewing Company is a new craft brewery to Lincoln Nebraska. The day to day operations are run by Brian Podwinski with the help and support of family and friends.    All of our wonderful ales will be named with a three or four digit number simply because numbers are easy to remember. Every beer will have a reason it is brewed and a person who inspired the beer. We feel having inspiration for our beer helps us make even better beer!    Please Consume Our Products Responsibly!!!

name: Blue Corn Cafe
description: Blue Corn Brewery is a mid sized brewpub in Santa Fe New Mexico. All the beer at Blue Corn is brewed on a one manned 7 barrel brew house. There are four 7 barrel fermenters and one 15 barrel fermenter. The 15 barrel is used exclusively for the Road Runner IPA, our most popular beer. Our Head Brewer, John Bullard uses the finest ingredients from around the world to make a wide variety of ales and lagers. Blue Corn Brewery has 6 house beers and 4 rotating specialty beers. Blue Corn Brewery also specializes in Northern New Mexican cuisine.

name: Cerrillos Road
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: Blue Diamond Brewing Company
description: Premium Handcrafted Beer by Blue Diamond Brewing Company of Minnesota use only the highest quality hops, grain and yeast to brew its craft beer - because of these high quality ingredients, we can guarantee you a premium hand crafted product with a consistent taste that you deserve and respect.

name: Main Meadery
description: The oldest beverage on earth just got a facelift. No longer are viking wannabes and medieval enthusiasts the only people who get to knock back a glass of the original liquid sin. Now it’s your turn.    Mead has been around longer than any other drink on the planet, so we’ve had plenty of time to perfect the recipe. Blue Dog Mead is concocted with honey instead of grapes, making it a sweet, refreshing alternative to wine. Not to toot our own horn, but we think with one sip you’ll be hooked.    Our newly designed bottles are made to move, and we don’t just mean off  the shelves. We mean to the beach,in a backpack or while watching a game. You’re mobile and active, so why shouldn’t your drink be? No gimmicks here. Blue Dog just wants to go with you as you grab the   leash and take life for a good long walk.    So leave history to the vikings and the books, grab yourself some Blue Dog Mead and let’s explore the future of this brand spankin’ old drink together.

name: Blue Frog Grog and Grill
description: Blue Frog is committed to producing traditional ales and lagers with a non-traditional twist. We use only the best ingredients to hand craft our balanced food friendly beers. Brewmaster Nick Campbell constantly tastes each batch to ensure its consistency and quality, leaning no beer released before its time. That’s commitment to quality.
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Thu 11:30 am - 10 pm  Fri-Sat 11:30 am - 11 pm  Sun 11:30 am - 9 pm

name: Blue Heron Brew Pub
description: Blue Heron BrewPub, located in the historic Parkin Place, offers the best in pub dining and finely hand crafted, locally brewed beers. Open for lunch and dinner daily*, the BrewPub offers a delightful selection of appetizers, sandwiches, salads, and hearty entrees. If you can't stay, you can arrange to "take out" your order. **    Our beers are brewed by Corey Nebbeling. Corey, who brews exclusively for Blue Heron BrewPub, hails from Michigan. While in college, Corey started brewing for his own pleasure, experimenting with different beer styles and recipes. He was an assistant brewer at the Lander Brewing Company in Lander, Wyoming for a year and then joined Short's Brewing Company in Michigan. Under Corey's direction, we are proud to continue our signature beers, Honey Blonde, Tiger's Eye, and Loch Ness Scotch Ale. Additional beers, such as RYEzome Red, Hub City Lager, Witz End Wheat, and Oktoberfest will continue to rotate through our 10 taps. In addition to these, Corey will be offering a wide variety of newly crafted beers for your tasting pleasure.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	11:00 am - 12:00 am  Fri - Sat:	11:00 am - 1:00 am

name: Blue Heron Brewing Company
description: From Pale Ale to Stout and from Porter to Pilsner, brewing beer  is our passion and as a family we're dedicated to bringing  New Mexico the finest brews.

name: Blue Hills Brewery
description: Beer is our life! Blue Hills Brewery makes great tasting beers inspired by the elements and nature around us; embracing the rich history of the Blue Hills and the South Shore. We do this not only for ourselves but, for our friends, neighbors and visitors to the Boston and South Shore areas.     We want to grow together with the South Shore community and businesses, by being a good neighbor, demonstrating civic responsibility and producing the finest, freshest beers around.     Our brew house has a capacity of brewing 20 barrels at a time, that's about 620 gallons per batch. The beer spends the first 7-9 days in a primary fermenting vessel after which it is transferred to a secondary fermenter. There it is chilled to around 40 degrees for another 7-10 days. At this time it is ready to be filtered carbonated and kegged.
hoursOfOperation: Gift Shop:  Mon-Fri 9:00 am - 5:00pm    Tastings:   Fri:	3:30 pm - 6:30 pm  Sat:	2:00 pm	- 6:00 pm

name: Blue Lab Brewing Co
description: Blue Lab Brewing is a small micro-brewery that produces fresh small batch ales for purchase in 1L and 2L growlers.

name: Blue Mountain Barrel House
description: Blue Mountain Barrel House was founded in 2011 by the Smack family as a sister brewery to the original Blue Mountain Brewery, in Afton (Nelson County). The original Blue Mountain Brewery was created in 2007 by Taylor and Mandi Smack, Matt Nucci and a group of fearless shareholders. Blue Mountain introduced the concept of the rural brewery to our corner of the world and set the standard for great beer in Virginia. As the first production arm of the Blue Mountain family, the Barrel House focuses on the higher-end beers from Blue Mountain that require special processes, special ingredients, and a whole lot of patience.

name: Blue Mountain Brewery
description: Blue Mountain Brewery sits in the shadow of Appalachia's Blue Ridge Mountains in Afton, Virginia. We are a farm brewery, growing our own hops, and proudly craft real American beer inspired by thousands of years of tradition but not limited by convention.    Brewer Taylor Smack, previously head brewer for the Goose Island Brewing of Chicago brewpubs and South Street Brewery of Charlottesville, is now crafting his brews for the central Virginia area at the unique Blue Mountain Farm Brewery.
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Sat 11:30am - 10:00pm  Sunday 11:30am- 9:00pm

name: Blue Mountain Pizza & Brewpub
description: Blue Mountain Pizza restaurant is a true treasure in the quaint town of Weaversville, NC just about 5 miles north of Asheville. Very friendly staff, and a great menu to choose from. We were absolutely delighted with our baked pasta dishes, pizza, and quesadilla. The salads were scrumptious as were the garlic rolls. We shared the cheesecake and cannolis for dessert and thoroughly enjoyed a very entertaining singer/ guitarist. The locals seemed very comfortable in this restaurant which is always a clear sign for travelers.

name: Blue Pants Brewery
description: Blue Pants Brewery was born out of a love of craft beer and craft beer culture. This first brewery is meant to be a gateway to the second and an inspiration to other small brewers that it can be done on this scale with a healthy amount of hard work. We’ve already had phone calls and emails from other brewers who are planning to follow in our footsteps, and we provide any help that we can.     The Brewery will consist of a 1.5 Barrel (or about 45 gallon) brewing system. Initially, distribution will be in 1/4 Barrel kegs to bars around the area, draft only. All the beer will be keg conditioned prior to distribution to ensure that it is at its maximum freshness, finishing the fermentation the moment it is loaded on a refridgerated truck out of the brewery.
hoursOfOperation: Tap Room Hours  Thursday 3-8pm  Friday 3-10pm  Saturday 3-10pm

name: Blue Point Brewing
description: Starting out in 1998 as two guys with a dog, a van, and a dream, Blue Point Brewing Company quickly became one of the nation’s premier microbreweries. After first launching our lightly toasted, complex, full-flavored Toasted Lager, we rapidly gained the respect of beer lovers far and wide. Soon after, we introduced several other brews and were being compared to breweries from noted craft-brewing capitals like Denver, Boston, Portland, and Seattle.    Brewing isn’t just our business, it’s our passion. We’re beer people. We started Blue Point Brewing Company because we wanted to make beer we would drink. To quench that desire, we select only top-quality ingredients and brew all-natural, unpasteurized beer. It’s this approach that put us on the world beer map. From the World Beer Cup to the Great American Beer Festival and the Australian International Beer Awards – we’re becoming noticed the world over. But we believe you should be the judge. Let us know what you think.
hoursOfOperation: Brewery & Tasting Room Hours:  Thursday and Friday 3-7pm  Saturday 12-7pm

name: Blue Republic Brewing
description: Blue Republic Brewing Company is a production brewery located in Shelby County, Indiana.    The brewery is currently in 'start-up' mode, but hopes to be operational in the near future. You can follow our progress here as we take the long journey to that first drop of pure deliciousness. And you know it will be something hoppy!!!

name: Blue Ridge Brewery
hoursOfOperation: WEDNESDAY – SATURDAY: 11AM TO 9PM

name: Blue Ridge Brewing Company
description: Blue Ridge Brewing Co. is an established restaurant and brewery, offering 15 years of experience brewing only the finest of home brews and cooking an extraordinary array of unique dishes. Please, stop on by!    Born in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains, Greenville's Brew-Pub continues to pay homage to one simple creed, to provide our customers the very best we can! We're as proud of Chef Rich's House-Made Menu as we are of Jay's Freshly Crafted Brews!

name: Blue Skye Brewery and Eats
description: Blue Skye Brewery and Eats is a new microbrewery and restaurant built around our cozy wood-fired pizza oven. We serve six varieties of in-house crafted beer along with a complete bar of bottled beer, wine and alcohol. In addition to pizza our menu includes quality sandwiches, salads and pub fare - all made in-house with fresh ingredients.   We are located on Santa Fe Avenue in downtown Salina, Kansas and are dedicated to the development of this historic district. We think you'll find our offerings and atmosphere a unique addition to the current mix of local dining choices. We hope you'll join us for quality food, fresh brew, and the gathering of good friends.

name: Blue Spruce Brewing
description: Brewer, Rick Kane has been brewing beer since the early 90's. After brewing so long he decided to go to school and get a degree in Beer Engineering, which fit perfectly with his science teaching credential. His plan is to have 8-12 beers on tap, along with a couple of local guest taps.   The restaurant will feature taco shop mexican food. There will be appetizers that pair perfectly with beer, along with some sandwich and salad options.   We know that Highlands Ranch and Centennial have been waiting for a local brewery to call their own. Hold on tight, here we come!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed: 3:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Thu: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: Blue Stallion Brewing Company
description: Blue Stallion Brewing Co. is the newest craft brewery in Lexington, Kentucky. We make the finest German lagers and British Ales focusing on traditional brewing techniques and ingredients. We want to bring Lexington an experience in beer not available anywhere else.

name: Blue Star Brewing Company
description: Owned and operated by Joey and Maggie Villarreal of Joey's on N. St. Mary's Street, the BSBC has been open since June 25, 1996. We offer medal-winning beers, an exceptional wine list, and delicious food. The brew pub is located in the Blue Star Arts Complex at 1414 S. Alamo, on the San Antonio river across the street from the Pioneer flour mill. The stainless steel vats and brewing facility are right at home in what was once an old beer storage warehouse. Friendly staff and warm wood decor make for a comfortable, casual atmosphere.

name: BBC East St Matthews
description: The original Bluegrass Brewing Company opened in 1993 at this location, 3929 Shelbyville Road, near Westport Rd., & Chenoweth, & Breckenridge Lanes. It is the city's oldest remaining brewpub and was the first to make a significant mark on the national brewpub and microbrewery scene. Louisville's best beer is made at this location, and large glass windows in the back dining room allow you to witness the brewing operation. The headbrewer is Jerry Gnagy, assisted by Sam Cruz and Cody Mingus.
hoursOfOperation: Sunday -Thursday: 11 AM -11 PM (kitchen closes at 10)  Friday and Saturday: 11 AM -1 PM (kitchen closes at 11)

name: BBC Theatre Square
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Thursday: 11 AM -10 PM  Friday - Saturday: 11 AM -11 PM  Closed Sunday

name: BBC 3rd and Main
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Thursday: 11 AM – Midnight  Friday - Saturday: 11 AM – 1 AM  Sunday: Noon – 9PM

name: Bluejacket
description: Brewery and Tavern in SE Washington, DC. Opening 2013.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri: 11:00 am - 1:00 am  Sat - Sun: 12:00 pm - 1:00 am

name: Bluetick Brewery
description: We are Maryville's first brewery and Tennessee's first brewery cooperative ready to pour this spring, 2014.
hoursOfOperation: Tue: 10:00 am - 6:00 pm  Wed - Sat: 4:00 pm - 11:00 pm

name: BNS Brewing & Distilling Co.
description: Craft Brewery and Small Batch Distillery
hoursOfOperation: Open 7 Days a Week Sun-Mon 12-9pm/Fri & Sat 12-10pm.

name: Boaks Beverage
description: We believe that one beer does not fit all food or all times of year. We will produce beers that will challenge your taste buds and expand your knowledge of pairing beer and food.

name: Boatyard Brewing Company
description: Boatyard Brewing Company is on a journey to create superb craft beers through the exploration of artistic fermentations    We are focused on creating the best possible craft beers while keeping with tradition and adding our own artistic flair. Boatyard Brewing Company is also committed to making a positive impact on our community.

name: Bobcat Cafe & Brewery
description: Located at the heart of the Green Mountains, we have the unique pleasure of serving handcrafted beers along side homemade food that is fresh and creative. Our brewmaster, Mark Magiera, uses high quality grains, hops and yeast strains to create up to a dozen true to style beers. With his unending expertise, Mark is passionate and innovative without losing the tradition behind each style. In the kitchen, we work hard to bring consistency and quality to the table. We focus on local ingredients to enhance our creative comfort food.    The Bobcat Cafe and Brewery opened ten years ago as a community supported business. Today, we strive to support and enhance the community by hosting benefit dinners and by providing a comfortable spot where local people can meet and socialize. Our 100 member Mug Club is a testament to the dedication of our regulars.
hoursOfOperation: Bar opens daily at 4pm    Sunday - Thursday  5:00 PM - 9:00 PM    Friday - Saturday  5:00 PM - 9:30 PM

name: Boerne Brewery
description: We are a microbrewery nestled in the Texas Hill Country. We are small and intend to stay that way. We are from Boerne. We will be brewing in Boerne. Our beer is for the people that live in, work in, and visit Boerne.  We are painfully/cheerfully close to completing construction. We will continue to post updates and pictures as things go along.

name: Bog Water Brewing Co.
hoursOfOperation: Wed:  12:00pm - 8:00pm Thu:  12:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  11:00am - 8:00pm Sat:  11:00am - 8:00pm Sun:  11:00am - 8:00pm  Closed on Monday and Tuesday.

name: Bohemian Brewery
description: The Bohemian Brewery is a Microbrew Brewpub Craft Brewery in the Salt Lake valley brewing traditional European Style Lagers (Czech & German/Bavarian) with a great European style restaurant, patio and tavern serving traditional European dishes. We have a packaging facility onsite where we specialize in quality craft canned lagers.

name: Bold City Brewery
description: Bold City Brewery is locally owned and operated by Brian and Susan Miller (no relation to the Miller Brewing Company, although the money would be nice). They are supported by the rest of the Miller family who all have a hand in the operations whether it be marketing, distributing, ordering supplies, cleaning tanks or doing what's most important, brewing beer. Brian, the Brewmaster started with home brewing in 2002. He was a member of the Local Home Brewers club here in Jacksonville prior to opening the brewery. His mother, Susan, left her job in management at Blue Cross Blue Shield of Florida to join the beer biz. She is primarily responsible for managing the on-site Tavern.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 3:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Sat:	1:00 pm - 11:00 pm

name: Bold Rock Hard Cider
description: A southern guy from Virginia had a farm in the Blue Ridge Mountains and met a top cider maker in the world from New Zealand.  It doesn’t get much more southern than that!  Now the two of them are making hard cider and history.
hoursOfOperation: We're open for Sales, Tastings and Tours 11 am to 6 pm 7 days a week.    We're closed on New Year's Day, Easter, Thanksgiving Day, and Christmas Day.

name: Bolero Snort Brewery
description: We are one of NJ's latest upstart craft breweries. In order to get "No BS...Just Ragin' Good Beer" into your glasses sooner rather than later, we will be contract brewing our beers to start with a full production site planned to open in late 2013.

name: Bomb Beer Company
description: Introducing Bomb Lager from the Bomb Beer Company, New York, NY. Our lager is an easy drinking Bavarian style Helles Lager that is light-bodied, somewhat bready with a restrained bitterness in its finish. We can our beer to ensure the best quality for our product while providing a canvas for our signature artwork.     Better beer deserves a better can.

name: Bombshell Beer Company
description: Bombshell Beer Company’s 5,840 sq. ft building is conveniently located in the heart of Holly Springs within the Omni business park located off N.Main St. The building will house the production brewery, lab and a 1400 sq. ft. tasting room.  Our brewery features a custom designed 15 BBL steam fired brewhouse manufactured by SMT Food and Beverage Systems of Stokesdale NC. Our equipment is crafted by US workers and made of US stainless steel, a key factor of why we selected SMT as our equipment manufacturer. Supporting American workers and American Industry was important to the Bombshell founders.  Bombshell’s brewhouse features a two vessel system consisting of a mash tun complete with rakes and steam jacket for step infusion mashing and a combination brew kettle/whirlpool. A thirty barrel hot liquor tank and dual stage high efficiency plate and frame heat exchanger round out Bombshell’s brewhouse system. Initially two 15BBL and one 30BBL multi zone jacketed fermentation vessels and a 30BBL bright tank will be utilized in the production of Bombshell’s high quality, craft beers.  We will showcase our hand-crafted beers to the public in a new 1400 sq. ft. tasting room scheduled opening is which is planned to be open to visitors in July. The tasting room will offer sample flights, pints, and beer to go in growlers and kegs. Brewery tours and private event programs will also be available.  Bombshell Beer is owned by Ellen Joyner, Michelle Miniutti and Jackie Hudspeth.
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 11:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 6:00pm Sun:  1:00pm - 8:00pm  Thursday: 4pm to 9pm  Friday: 4pm to 11pm  Saturday: 12pm to 6pm  Sunday:  1pm to 8pm

name: Bombshell Brewing Company
description: Bombshell Brewing Company is a family-owned start-up brewery in Philadelphia, producing hand-crafted traditional and not-so-traditional ales and lagers.

name: Bonaventure Brewing Co
description: Local beers brewed on-site on the 4th floor patio of the Bonaventure Hotel. Terrific views of Downtown LA, traditional American food, friendly staff, local flavor.

name: Boneshaker Community Brewery
description: Rocklin's first brewpub. Boldly brewed house crafted beers blended with fresh, scratch-made food. Family friendly open lunch and dinner daily.

name: Boneyard Beer Company
description: Boneyard beer was started with one goal in mind Make a great beer! The major hurdle to overcome, however, was how to do so in large quantities without large sums of money.     The solution was simple - you pull from the boneyard.    Head brewer and co-owner, tony lawrence has been brewing for other major breweries for over 20 years. Additionally he is the owner and president of brewtal ind. A brewery construction and consulting firm.    Every brewery has a "boneyard" of old brewing equipment where old/unused equipment go to rust. Tony along with co-owners clay and melodee storey, opted to revive the equipment and thus...    Boneyard beer was born!
hoursOfOperation: Fri:  11:00am - 6:00pm  Monday - Saturday  11am - 6pm  Sundays 11am-6pm (June 1st through Labor Day)  Cash or Check only !

name: Bonfire Brewing
description: Based in one of the coolest mountain towns of Colorado, Eagle, Bonfire Brewing makes beer (by "coolest" we mean, "neat," "nifty," and/or "fantabulous," not cold. It's actually fairly warm for the most part). We wouldn't describe our beer as face-meltingly good, maybe just face-warmingly delicious. It certainly encourages the use of non-existent adverbs. We started making beer because we needed more friends. Now our friends need more beer. So it goes.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  5:30pm - 10:00pm Tue:  5:30pm - 10:00pm Wed:  5:30pm - 10:00pm Thu:  4:00pm - 10:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 12:00am Sat:  4:00pm - 12:00am Sun:  3:00pm - 8:00pm  Mon - Wed: 5:30 pm - 10:00 pm  Thu:4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 4:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sun: 3:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Nano Brewery
description: Books & Brews is dedicated to serving local, handcrafted products at reasonable prices. Our used bookstore will operate on a buy, sell, trade and a portion of the proceeds will go to benefit Indy Reads, whose mission to to promote and improve literacy in Central Indiana. Our small but flavorful food menu will consist of local meat and cheese plates and a variety of grilled cheese sandwiches. Our tasting room will be small, seating about 30-35. We are focused on promoting the arts and will be running a packed event-based schedule to highlight local musicians, artists, poets, and authors. Look for many other social events at b&b, too - book clubs, parent groups, trivia, sports viewing parties, the list goes on!

name: Boom Island Brewing Company
description: Boom Island Brewing Company opened fall 2011 on the shores of the Mississippi, a hops throw away from of our namesake island. Inspired by traditional Belgian recipes and brewing techniques, our beers are handcrafted using pure Minnesota water and the freshest, natural ingredients. Head Brewer Kevin Welch has won numerous awards for his creations, including our flagship beers, Thoprock, Hoodoo, Silvius and Brimstone.

hoursOfOperation: Wed:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Thu:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  1:00pm - 9:00pm  Wed - Fri: 4:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 1:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Boondocks Brewing Tap Room & Restaurant
description: Great Beer - Great Food - Great Service - Great Friends - Great Value    Boondocks Brewing Tap Room & Restaurant's goal is to provide a fresh, unique and engaging destination that will not only attract new visitors to West Jefferson and Ashe County but will also be a place that residents are proud to call their own.     We are Ashe County's first and only Commercially licensed Craft Beer Brewery and we brew small batches of hand crafted beers weekly that are only available in our Tap Room.    With two fully stocked bars we have over 30 craft beers on tap that are constantly rotating along with a large selection of bottled beers with a strong focus on North Carolina craft beers. You will be hard pressed to find a better craft beer selection.    We have an affordable menu featuring casual-upscale high-quality items using fresh and locally grown ingredients prepared by our talented Chef and kitchen team.    Come and see what all the excitement is about in wonderful West Jefferson.    Committed to Excellence- Dedicated to Community
hoursOfOperation: Lunch Mon-Sun 11:30 - 2::30  Dinner Mon-Thu  5:00 - 9:00  Dinner Fri-Sat 5:00 - 11:00

name: Bootlegger's Brewery
description: Bootlegger's Brewery is a local microbrewery located in Fullerton, California. We are a small artisian brewery established with the mission of providing fresh and unique craft beer to the local community and beyond. Our unique small batch process makes us one of the most flexible breweries in Southern California. We pride ourselves on our ability to deliver a wide variety of styles and flavors in our beer with the highest level of quality.

hoursOfOperation: Tasting room open daily 3-8 p.m.  (subject to change on holidays)

name: Booze Brothers Brewing Co.
description: Two brothers who love to drink and create delicious craft beer.

name: Borderlands Brewing Company
description: Borderlands Brewing Company is a devoted to crafting unique beers using local ingredients and traditional brewing methods. Founded in 2011 by two friends, Borderlands just completed a major expansion and is now providing beer for dozens of bars and restaurants in Southern Arizona. We look forward to sharing a pint with you soon!

name: Borgata Brewery and Distillery
description: Borgata is a craft brewery as well as Omaha's first distillery since before Prohibition. We are located in the heart of the historic Old Market District. Our beers are split into two categories, our Session Series and our Bison Series. We have a tasting room that is open 6 days a week. Please come in for a tour and a beer, whisky or both.

name: Boring Brewing Company
description: Nano Brewery focusing on small batch hand crafted beer.    To provide local beer to accomplish the mission of "think local - drink local"    After 24 years of Homebrewing, I am opening a fully licensed 4 barrel brewery for distribution to neighborhood pubs.

name: Boscos Squared
description: Boscos is a warm, inviting, first-class restaurant with locations in Memphis, Nashville Little Rock, AR. Boscos believes in using only the freshest products and ingredients in our menu and in our hand-crafted beers.    Each restaurant's menu includes a variety of appetizers, salads, entrees or gourmet pizzas, baked in our brick oven. Signature items include fresh salmon baked on a cedar plank in Boscos brick oven, delicious double-cut pork chop, and a prime cut of steak cooked to perfection.    Boscos has been brewing award-winning handcrafted beers for over 22 years. That experience is evident in both the quality and variety of beers we offer, including the light-bodied, golden Famous Flaming Stone, the amber, crisp Bombay IPA, and our robust, full-bodied stouts and porters. Boscos has a beer to match everyone's tastes and to compliment every delicious dish.

name: Bosque Brewing
description: Bosque Brewing Co. has a very simple core value system. Brew beer with flavor and craftsmanship... Three home brewers with an affinity for crafting quality ales and crazy enough to wade into the business of their passion.

name: Boston Beer Company
description: Today, we're a team of about 750 people, and we all share a common passion for bringing great Samuel Adams beers to beer lovers everywhere. We've worked hard and are incredibly proud of the many successes we've enjoyed over the years. The Boston Beer Company has been cited as one of the best companies to work for by Boston Magazine, one of the Best Entry-Level Jobs by The Princeton Review, and our beers have won more awards than any other in history. Jim has been named an "Entrepreneur of the Year" by Inc. Magazine. Our brewers keep amazing us with innovative new brews, including Samuel Adams Utopias and our Samuel Adams Barrel Room Collection.    Jim has believed from the beginning that the more you know and understand about beer, the more you'll appreciate a beer like Samuel Adams Boston Lager. To begin that mission, all new employees go through intensive training on everything from ingredients, brewing, and beer styles, to taking care of the beer once it leaves the brewery. We're all beer lovers and protectors of the beer so we're trained how to identify off flavors and how to troubleshoot the causes. The passion for beer continues with an annual homebrew competition that we all take part in.    One of our wholesalers once asked Jim why he invested so much in training his people, when ultimately they might leave. Jim smiled and replied without hesitation: "What if I didn't train them, and they stayed?"    Each year, usually in January, everyone gathers together. One of the highlights of the meeting is the beer trivia contest. With a culture so steeped in beer education and knowledge, winning is a pretty big deal. Recently, one of the hotel bartenders who was watching as the various teams arrived in costume with music and much enthusiasm and fanfare, said, "I've always known Samuel Adams made the best beer in America, but now I see this is the greatest company in America." When you look around you see that The Boston Beer Company is a team of enthusiastic people who are passionate about beer and who really love coming to work every day to provide American drinkers with the best beer possible.    The Boston Beer Company, Inc. is a publicly-traded company listed on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol, SAM.

name: Main Brewery - Fenway
hoursOfOperation: Monday through Saturday 11 AM until 11 PM    Opens early for Red Sox Opening Day, Marathon Monday and other early Sox/Event Days.

name: Main Brewery and Tasting Room
description: Bottle Logic's mission is to brew the highest quality craft beer available, without compromise. Our state-of-the-art tasting room enhances our customers' knowledge and appreciation of our high quality beer.

name: Boulder Beer Company
description: Boulder Beer Company, Colorado's First Craft Brewery, was founded in 1979 when two University of Colorado professors applied for and received the 43rd brewing license in the United States.  The brewery has a full service pub that's open for lunch and dinner, with a spacious outdoor beer garden offering amazing view of Boulder's Flatirons. Brewery Tours Mon-Sat at 2pm, and Sat at 4pm.

name: Boulder Dam Brewing Company
description: Our beers are 100% natural - no additives or preservatives.   Because we choose to not filter our beers, you may notice a slight beer haze… fear not!    Boulder City brewery, just outside of Las Vegas NV.

name: Boulevard Brewing Company
description: Welcome to Boulevard Brewing Company, the Midwest's home for fine ales and lagers since 1989. Boulevard's mission is simple: to produce fresh, flavorful beers using the finest traditional ingredients and the best of both old and new brewing techniques.

name: Boundary Bay Brewery
description: The Boundary Bay approach to beer is to render excellent examples of classic styles. In some cases--such as with our IPA, Imperial IPA and Imperial Oatmeal Stout--we push the envelope and make a very big and flavorful brew. Put simply, we brew the beers that we like to drink!     We are located in the heart of downtown Bellingham, WA and have been dubbed "Pure Bellingham" by the locals!  We continually win awards for our beer, have been named one of the top 25 breweries in the U.S. (by Steve Johnson, America's Best Brews), were declared the Best Brewery in WA (by the Northwest Brewing News Reader's Poll 2005, 2008, 2009 and 2010) and are the only brewery in Washington to bring home the Alpha King award for our Imperial IPA.    Come have a pint with us.  Cheers!

name: Boxcar Brewing Company
description: Boxcar Brewing Company is a community-oriented brewing company providing fine crafted beer to be enjoyed with family and friends.  The idea for Box Car Brewing Company originated in 2006 in Tennessee at the wedding of two of its chief members Jason and Kristen Kohser. In the mountains of Tennessee gathered a very small group of friends and family including Jason’s cousin Kymberly and her then boyfriend Jamie Robinson. After an intimate ceremony, the entire group enjoyed a reception complete with homemade guacamole and a tub full of crudely marked “homebrews” prepared by Jason. Prior to this, he had been working in high-end restaurants as a general manager, bartender and food server for over 20 years. He spent several years in Northern California learning the fine art of winemaking at a local winery in Sonoma. During this time Jason realized the beauty of brewing beer and his desire to share his creation(s) with others. He’s been brewing out of his kitchen sink for several years now, slowly perfecting his recipes, offering to teach others the art, and, most importantly, making and drinking some real good beer. Jamie, who has yet to find a brew he will not try, immediately was interested in Jason’s creations and quickly started picking his brain on the processes and formalities for creating these “homebrews”. While sucking down a few well-crafted brews in the hot sun, Jamie and Jason talked about their love of beer and the groundwork was laid.    A few months later, Jamie received a phone call from Jason, who had been mulling over the possibility of moving forward with the beer making, he then proposed the idea of moving to Pennsylvania. Jason asked if Jamie would be interested in working together and the dream of opening a brewery was declared. In 2007, Jason and his wife moved to West Chester, PA where many of his family live. Together with the other three members the idea was hatched to get serious and start brewing beer on a larger scale, for the beer lovers in Chester County, PA. Box Car Brewing Company became a reality.

name: Boylan Bridge Brewpub
description: The Boylan Bridge Brewpub has a bright and open atmosphere conducive to conversation, business, and social interaction. The architectural millwork and cabinetwork built downstairs in the shop has made the Bridge a beautiful, durable facility using fine woods, ceramic tile, and canvas covered tackboard on the walls.    The brewing operation is visible from the bar through glass doors, offering an industrial connection with stainless steel tanks and copper piping throughout.    The most popular feature of the place is the outdoor deck. It offers an expansive view of the downtown Raleigh skyline. A wood post and beam pergola structure enclose the space and provides mottled shade without trapping sound, making conversation easy.
hoursOfOperation: Monday-Thursday  4:00pm - 11:00pm  Friday-Sunday  11:30am - Midnight

name: Brainerd Lakes Beer
description: Brainerd Lakes Beer. Giving you a taste of the laidback lifestyle found only in Minnesota's lake country. It has long been said that a beer is only as good as the place it was born. (Okay, so we made that up...but that doesn't make it any less true.) So we (and by we, we mean a couple of local guys) set out to create a Minnesota beer that embodies the laidback lifestyle of one of the greatest places on earth. We want this page to be all about you. We welcome your input, thoughts, feelings, tips on fishing hotspots...whatever you feel inclined to share and discuss. Talk to us about beer, Minnesota beer, Brainerd beer, beer making, beer brewing, IPA, wheat beer, lager, stout (can you tell we like to talk shop?) or anything else that comes to mind.

name: Branchline Brewing Co.
description: Branchline Brewing Company is a production brewery based out of San Antonio, TX. We focus on high quality craft beer utilizing local and regional ingredients whenever possible. Branchline Brewing Company's focus is not only to provide our offering to the extreme craft beer drinker, but also to the casual drinker that enjoys a lighter product.     Handcrafted ales for the independent at heart

name: Brass Cannon Brewing
description: Founded by enthusiastic homebrewers, Brass Cannon Brewing is a new brewery dedicated to the production of high quality brews for sale on tap. We currently offer 4 quality brews at our tap room in Toano, VA.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  12:00pm - 7:00pm Tue:  12:00pm - 7:00pm Fri:  12:00pm - 7:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 7:00pm  Mon - Tue: 12:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: Brasserie St. James
description: We make beers for all palates. A lot of our beers have been lovingly referred to as so finely crafted that they seem to be made for a serious wine drinkers palate. A saying goes in wine making, "it takes a lot of good beer to make good wine...". The point being, we make complex, delicate, nuanced beers, not just the same typical west coast hop bombs or dark extremely high alcohol brews (though we make quality versions of those too). Our goal is to show the whole spectrum of beer, its history, and its evolution. To show beer its proper reverence, as not only "The people's beverage", but one that pairs as well with food as wine, and when it's skillfully crafted and not over hopped to hide the flaws in production, it does. The truth is, it takes more skill to make a delicate lager, than a double IPA. You would be hard pressed to find anyone more passionate and knowledgeable about beer than myself or my brewer Josh Watterson. We welcome you to come down to our weekly brewery tours, and discuss all things beer, food, wine, or whatever be the topic of the day!

name: Bravo! Restaurant and Cafe
description: Our Bravo! Handcrafted beer is made in-house by our award winning chefs. We are one of the only restaurants in Kalamazoo to brew their own beer. We brew beer in small batches using natural ingredients. We never use additives or extracts. Our slow fermentation and use of all grains create the natural malt flavors of high-quality beers. Our beers have refreshing and crisp flavors which our Chef's enjoy pairing with our menu offerings.

name: Brazos Valley Brewing Company
description: BVB was founded in 2013 by a five man team of craft brewing enthusiasts. We make high quality craft beers for the people of Texas and have a variety of styles thoughtfully created using our passion for tasteful ales.

name: Breaker Brewing Company
description: The idea of The Breaker Brewing Company resulted when long time friends, Chris Miller and Mark Lehman, decided it was time to take their interest and appreciation of fine craft beer to the next level. Their intrigue in the complexity of the brewing process coupled with their quest to make a quality product, led to their decision to start creating their own beer.

Some mutual friends introduced the two after learning they both had a desire to leave their corporate jobs in order to pursue their dream of opening a brew pub. They jumped in head first and committed their minimal financial resources and made it happen.

name: The Ale House at Amato's,  Denver
Brenner Brewing Company
description: Brenner Brewing Co. is a microbrewery in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. Founder, Mike Brenner was awarded the title Master Brewer after completing a rigorous international training program at the Siebel Institute and the Doemens Akademie.    Brenner's passion for crafting delicious beer and his lifelong devotion to Milwaukee's arts and music scene, has led to the creation of Brenner Brewing's "12 Ounce Ambassadors." Each style of beer features the artwork of a local artist and comes with a soundtrack featuring the music of local bands. As Brenner Brewing's distribution expands so does the awareness of Milwaukee's incredible arts scene.    Brenner also opened a 25,000 sq ft arts incubator in the building with the brewery which features a 2,000 sq ft contemporary art gallery and 20 artists' studio spaces. Come visit the brewery, tasting room, and art gallery soon.

name: Brevard Brewing Co.
description: The world of beer is increasingly one of two extremes.  While large macro-breweries compete to produce the lightest, most flavorless, adjunct laden beers possible, craft breweries strive to out-do one another by making each beer hoppier, bolder, and stronger than the next.  At Brevard Brewing Company, we have set out to give beer lovers the best of both worlds – beer that is both drinkable and flavorful.  We are the only brewery in Western North Carolina to specialize in lagers.     What’s the big deal about lagers? Lagers are cold-fermented and aged over twice as long as ales.  They are more costly to produce, and take more patience to brew. Unlike the big flavors of ales that hide imperfections, lagers demand a higher standard of quality and care, making them a rare find in the craft beer world.  But the result is worth the attention to detail--this painstaking process creates a beer that is clean, smooth, and crisp as opposed to the bold, complex flavor of ales.  The imported German barley, hops, and yeast delivers delicate and refined beers that are delicious and flavorful, yet supremely drinkable.    While German-inspired lagers are my specialty, I will never forget the wonderful contributions that American home brewers have made to the beer world over the past thirty years.  I typically find myself drinking a cold, smooth, Pilsner, but every now and again, my taste buds crave a bold, hoppy American IPA.  This is why Brevard Brewing Company offers American ales in addition to German lagers.  No matter your mood or what you are craving, we have the right beer for you.

name: Brew Brothers Brewery
description: Named Best Brewpub in America by Nightclub & Bar magazine, The Brew Brothers offers eight custom microbrews and a creative menu, including gourmet wood-fired pizzas, salads, burgers, ribs, sandwiches, homemade soups and complete dinners. The Brew Brothers Reno brewery was also voted “Best Microbrew, “Best Beer Selection,” and “Best Live Music” in the Best of Reno poll and was named the highest selling brewpub in North America. Catch live bands and DJs nightly.

name: Brew Crew Inc
description: This fall 2013 the tasting room & brewing production facility will open for our beers.    The Brew Crew is a group of former home brewers.

description: Plainfield, Indiana's newest brewery....coming 2014

name: Brew Rebellion
description: Andy and Brad have been home brewing for years together and through trial and error have come up with some amazing and tasty brew concoctions. Special recipes like “White Chocolate Raspberry Stout” or the cinnamon and cloves party in your mouth seasonal winter warmer recipe called, “Peace on Earth” or the sitting around the campfire approved S’mores Porter or what about the fruit and honey light taste of “Peach Honey Wheat”.    Brad and Andy have known Ed for some time and the boys knew that an old fart like Ed with a business background made him a good candidate to help them put together a business and marketing plan. Since Ed is a big fan of craft beer, he said, why not? “Let’s build a brewery”.    Brew Rebellion was born.
