name: Carolina Brewing Company
description: "Brewers of Tasty Liquids"    If you request a porter, do you expect someone to carry your bags?  If you were approached by a man carrying a dopplebock, would you run for your life?     You shouldn't     These are just two examples of the more than twenty styles of beer that were commonly available in the United States at the turn of the century. Prohibition and industrialization brought an end to this variety of beer, but now the Carolina Brewing Company is helping to revive these traditional brewing styles.    Unlike some fine wines that get better with age, beer is at its peak when it leaves the brewery. All of our beer is produced in small batches for local distribution to ensure that you get the freshest beer possible.    Purity is one of our top priorities. We use only four ingredients in our beer, malted barley, hops, yeast and water. Our beer does not contain chemicals or additives of any kind and it is not pasteurized.    Our method of brewing is time consuming and our choice of ingredients is expensive. We know it's worth the extra effort and cost, and we think you'll agree. Try our tasty liquids and we know that you will taste the quality.
hoursOfOperation: Fri:  12:00pm - 6:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 4:00pm  Friday: Noon - 6pm  Saturday: Noon - 4pm    Tours are every Saturday at 1:00pm

name: Cartel Brewery
description: There’s no intrinsic value in the adjective micro, so we’re not waving it proudly, like a flag. But that’s a good place to start: Cartel is a micro-brewery.    Woo-hoo.    To interpret: a small group of us are trying to master the craft of brewing beer and, right now, we’re doing it in a microscopic fashion. And we can’t say we dislike it that way.    We’re not caught up in dollars and tradition. We’re just trying to create tasty beverages for those few who will drink them.

name: Cartel Brewing Company
description: Cartel Brewing Company is a small, passionate, and unique brewery that believes everything around the beer is just as important as as what's in the beer.     We want you and the community to be more involved with the beer that you drink and think you should have a say in that.

name: Carton Brewing Co
description: Having decided they had something to contribute to the very exciting conversation going on in craft brewing, cousins Chris and Augie Carton teamed up with their favorite home brewer, Jesse Ferguson, and started Carton Brewing. In the seashore community where they were born and raised, the Carton boys found a turn-of-the-century red brick warehouse and adapted it to accommodate a state-of-the-art N  ewlands Systems 15 barrel brew house. With Jesse at its helm, 6 E. Washington Avenue was turned into an independent craft brewery and their hats were in the ring. Applying a passion for stimulating flavor to inspiration found all around them, they set about their goal: to make tasty beer in the place their tastes were formed.

name: Carver Brewing Company
description: Operating as a brewery since 1988, we are Colorado's 2nd oldest brew pub. We maintain a tap list of 11 house made beers, produce over 20 different beer styles per year and specialize in recreating traditional lager beer styles and hop-centric American-Style ales. Our restaurant offers American fare with an International influence, focusing on healthy, made-from-scratch items that incorporate locally sourced ingredients. We serve breakfast, lunch and dinner seven days a week, 363 days a year.

name: CasaNoVa Brewing Co.
description: The CasaNoVa Brewing Co. will be the first original Arlington, Virginia distribution craft brewery since 1916. CasaNoVa aims to culture Arlington’s community by creating a brand that is focused on them. We hope to become synonymous with art and music by endorsing local artists in creative marketing campaigns. Every endeavor we make will be our sincerest effort to represent the NoVa community through quality, innovation and art via the medium of craft beer. CasaNoVa will source the freshest ingredients from local farmers and suppliers while supporting local businesses whenever possible.

name: Cascade Brewing
description: Cascade Brewing Company was established in 1998 by Art Larrance, who has been involved in Oregon's craft beer industry since its inception. Art co-founded one of the state's first microbreweries, Portland Brewing, as well as the Oregon Brewers Festival, which today is one of the world's preeminent craft beer festivals.     Cascade Brewmaster Ron Gansberg got his start in the Northwest wine industry. He crossed over in 1986 and began an eight-year career at BridgePort Brewing Co., where he honed his brewing skills, then moved on to the equipment and engineering side of the industry. As Engineering Manager at BridgePort, Ron directed the design and installation of the 80 bbl brewhouse that is still in operation.     Together, Art and Ron put their 40 years of beer experience to work, designing and installing Cascade's state-of-the-art 10 bbl brewing system in SW Portland, then creating and distributing well-balanced market-priced ales ranging from Pale Ale to Copper to Blond Bock. As the quality of the beer improved, they began to sell through distributors, increasing production to satisfy the wholesale market.     Cascade Brewery is situated in the Pacific Northwest, a region renowned for its craft beers - the Portland metropolitan area has 42 breweries, more than any other metro area in the US, and is the nation's largest craft brewing market. Even though there are an abundance of breweries in this area, it's highly competitive. To stand out amongst this group, you need to push the envelope and be out there to get to your niche and magic elixir.

name: Cascade Lakes Brewing Company
description: Cascade Lakes Brewing Company started in 1994 by three enthusiastic brothers looking for an exciting business in beautiful, sunny Central Oregon.  They spent many long nights building most of the current brewing equipment by hand and coming up with tasty recipies.  More than ten years later, the long nights and quest for great beer has continued on a much larger scale.  In the winter of 2000, Cascade Lakes Brewing Company was purchased by Rick Orazetti and Doug Kutella.  Recently, Ron Kutella and Chris Justema joined the parternship and what started as one brewing facility in an airport industrial zone has turned into 7th Street Brew House, Tumalo Tavern, Cascade West Grub and Alehouse, and our flagship restaurant in Bend, Cascade Lakes Lodge.

description: Cask & Larder, in Winter Park, Florida, offers southern-sourced seasonal dishes, craft beers brewed on-site and fresh-shucked oysters from our oyster bar.

name: Castle Danger Brewery
description: Castle Danger Brewery is a one-man production brewery located in Castle Danger, Minnesota, 12 miles northeast of Two Harbors off of Highway 61 at Castle Haven Cabins resort.  Clint & Jamie MacFarlane started the brewery journey in March 2010.  Clint brewed his first batch of beer on March 1, 2011.  His love of homebrewing finally turned into a dream-come-true.  He is brewing beer that he loves and knows others will enjoy, too.

name: Catawba Brewing Co.
description: Catawba Brewing Company - WNC's only family owned/operated brewery is 15 years old. Now open in two locations: Asheville and Morganton, NC.
hoursOfOperation: Wed:  5:00pm - 10:00pm Thu:  5:00pm - 10:00pm Fri:  5:00pm - 10:00pm Sat:  2:00pm - 10:00pm  Wed - Fri: 5:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat: 2:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Cathedral Square Brewery
description: Founded in March 2009, Cathedral Square Brewery is located at 3914 Lindell Blvd in Mid-Town St. Louis. With over 200 accounts in Missouri, Illinois, and Kansas, we offer our beers in both draught and 22oz. bottles. Head brewmaster Brian Neville has over 15 years of experience in the industry. Brian has been with the likes of Spanish Peaks Brewing and their flagship Black Dog Brewery. Brian also helped build O'Fallon Brewery & Trailhead Brewery among others.

name: Catskill Brewery
description: The Catskill Brewery is a new venture between an organic fruit nectar importer and the founder of Catskill Mountainkeeper.. The all new 5,300 square foot brewery and office complex brings the various talents together under one roof. The brewery consists of 3,500 square feet for production, including the brew house and milling room, 12 fermentation and conditioning vessels, a bottling line, conditioned storage, and a small tasting area, all in a vaulted, clerestory-lit space. The office portion will serve the clients’ other business needs, with the future expansion of the brewery into this space as a micro-distillery and event space, opening on a German-style beer garden.     The business acumen and technical savvy of the partners are apparent in the branding power of the design and the strategic vision integrated into the plan. Their environmental advocacy is demonstrated by the low-impact systems selected: thermal-bridge free envelope design; natural day-lighting; stack effect ventilation; all-permeable site paving; green roofs; solar photovoltaics and solar hot water systems; ground source heat pumps for heating, cooling and refrigeration; and native plantings.

name: Caution Brewing Company
description: Closest microbrewery to DIA, CAUTION is Denver's premier speciality brewery. Hand crafted, unusually balanced beers are made with amazing and local ingredients. Isn't it time you stopped by?

name: Cavalry Brewing
description: Cavalry Brewing beers are brewed using traditional English methods on American equipment to create fresh and flavorful ales and stouts to entice the most discerning palate. Each product is a balance between the barley and the hops to provide an easy drinking ale or stout.

name: Cedar Creek Brewery
description: Cedar Creek Brewery started as an idea in October 2010 and has become a reality in 2012. Session beers are our passion and we really want that to be the focus of the brewery. Don’t get us wrong we really love those huge hop and malt bombs and will be releasing them as part of our seasonal and specialty lineup but having a few while enjoying the company of friends is the way we love to drink beer. So keeping our beers drinkable and with enough creativity that you want to keep coming back for more is our goal.

name: Cedar Springs Brewing Company
description: Join us in the heart of Cedar Springs at the trailhead of the White Pine Trail for a freshly crafted fermented beverage and a flavorful meal from our sustainably sourced kitchen.    Prost!

name: Cellar Brewing Company
description: We're a microbrewery that does more than just serve fantastic beer, we're also a small winery, and artisan distillery. So, if you would like a refreshing beer, relaxing glass of wine, or great mixed drink give Cellar Brewing Company a try.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  3:00pm - 12:00am Tue:  3:00pm - 12:00am Wed:  3:00pm - 12:00am Thu:  3:00pm - 12:00am Fri:  11:00pm - 2:00am Sat:  11:00pm - 2:00am Sun:  12:00pm - 10:00pm  Mon - Thu: 3:00 pm - 12:00 am  Fri - Sat: 11:00 pm - 2:00 am  Sun: 12:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Cellarmaker Brewing Company
description: Cellarmaker Brewing Company has been in the works for quite some time. Look for our beers to start making their way around better known beer bars and beer focused restaurants in San Francisco starting in September.     We have a tasting room in the same building as the brewery and will offer tasters, pints, and growlers. Some beers may be bottled further down the line but for now it's all draft. The only way you can take our beer away is in the form of a growler - which by the way, is a great way to drink beer!     Look for a focus of plenty of hoppy beers, belgian-style saisons, dark beers, and sour beers. We are huge fans of wine and bourbon barrel aged beers as well so it's only natural for us to have a barrel program. Think bourbon barrels loaded with big chewy imperial stouts, excessively hopped IPAs, fruited sour beers, and funky saisons. This is what we love. This is what we are all about. We hope you are too!    Please follow along for the ride as we build San Francisco's next great brewery.    Cheers!

name: Center of the Universe Brewing
description: Center of the Universe Brewing Company (or COTU for short), will be opening on November 16th. COTU began back in 2009 when Chris Ray and his brother Phil began brewing beer in their houses. The hobby turned into an obsession, and the obsession has led them to open up a craft brewery in Ashland, Virginia. Located in the heart of Central Virginia, it is affectionately known as “The Center of the Universe”. COTU will be brewing an assortment of ales using only whole ingredients, while sticking to the traditional all-natural method of brewing beer.    The meaning of “Center of the Universe” is important to the founders of COTU. With so much emphasis today on globalization and the lack of corporate stewardship, COTU wanted to be a company that truly embraces the local community. “Center of the Universe,” to COTU, is taking pride in where you live and respecting the people with whom you interact. We believe it is our responsibility to understand and appreciate how our actions affect the community that supports us.    At Center of the Universe Brewing Company it all revolves around the beer and the people who enjoy it.

name: Central Coast Brewing Co
description: Serving the Central Coast's craft beer needs since 1998.  Enjoy are hand-crafted beers at the brewery or "Drink Local" at bars and restaurants all over the Central Coast.

name: Central State Brewing
description: Central State Brewing is a brewery coming soon to Central Indiana.

name: Central Waters Brewing Company
description: Brewing since 1998, Central Waters Brewing Company is built on the solid reputation of producing the finest quality beer in Central Wisconsin: Ouisconsing Red Ale, Happy Heron Pale Ale, Mudpuppy Porter, and many more.    Currently, Central Waters Brewing Company services over 200 retail locations in Central Wisconsin, and has expanded its product line to include 18 beer styles. Moving from Junction City to a new facility in Amherst, Wisconsin in January of 2007, Central Waters can better support the growing demand. CWBC continues to build on the solid reputation of producing the finest quality beers in Central Wisconsin.
hoursOfOperation: Fri:  3:00pm - 10:00pm Sat:  3:00pm - 10:00pm  Fri - Sat:3:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Cervecería de MateVeza
description: Cervecería de MateVeza is a cafe and small brewery dedicated to providing locally-sourced, Argentinian-style empanadas paired with creative artisanal beers.

name: Chain O'Lakes Brewing Company
hoursOfOperation: Wed:  4:00pm - 8:00pm Thu:  4:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 8:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 6:00pm  Wed - Fri: 4:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Chain Reaction Brewing Company
description: With every action there is a reaction. For us a strong foundation of dedication to trades such as mechanics, ironwork and carpentry was laid early in life. With the love of these trades the need to create was always a must and that is what brings us to this point of wanting to share our beers with the public. We never focus on pleasing just one style since we love just about all of them and while not every beer we brew will be the perfect student in its category it will be one that will get the craft beer loving palate craving more with each sip.

name: Chama River Brewing Company
description: A multiple GABF medal winning brewpub considered one of Albuquerque's longest standing pioneers of great craft beer in New Mexico.

name: Chameleon Brewing
description: With the start of a new decade, beer lovers are demanding something new. Not another new flavor of a mass-produced, foreign-owned beer, but something local that is new and exciting. That is why Chameleon Brewing is here.    Chameleon was founded by Randy Sprecher of Sprecher Brewing, a local company that Milwaukeeans have grown to know and love for 25 years. Just like Sprecher, Chameleon Brewing supports the local economy and recognizes that innovative American brewing styles are now setting the bar in the international beer world. Chameleon is a company focused on taking brewing to the next level by producing beers that are guaranteed to impress the savviest critic, yet also appealing to a widely diverse group of beer drinkers. Our brews are light bodied and refreshing, complimented by a fine balance of complex flavors and aromas.    Staying true to this principle, Chameleon would like to introduce its flagship beer – Hop On Top extra-pale ale. This aromatic non-bitter brew features a complex bouquet of dried flowers and hops. Easy to drink, Hop on Top has a toasty pale malt finish.

name: Champion Brewing Company
description: Charlottesville's fastest-growing production  brewery and beer-drinking Tap Room located at the foot of the Belmont Bridge.
hoursOfOperation: Wednesday 5-9  Thurs-Sat 4-11  Sunday 1-6

name: Chapman's Brewing Company
description: Chapman's Brewing Company is here because you care about what you drink. Everything we do, from working with orchards in Michigan and Washington to the selection of cans instead of bottles is completely focused on making the highest quality beers and ciders in the Midwest. Please come see us at the brewery in Angola – any Chapman’s employee you meet will also be an owner of the company and wants to hear what you think of our craft.

name: Chappell Brewery
description: Chappell Brewery is a small one man operation created with the help of some friends. For now I only sell tasters and bottles out of the Tasting Room Shop in downtown Mariposa, CA.

name: Charleston Brewing Company
description: Charleston, West Virginia's first and only brewpub, CBC is bringing craft beer brewing to the state's capital. Located in the heart of Charleston's downtown Village District, CBC is a fusion of English and American sensibilities

name: Charleville Brewery
description: Our handcrafted microbeers are brewed on site at Charleville Vineyards. We proudly offer an assortment of ales, lagers and seasonal beers, some of which have already won critical acclaim! Our IPA and Half-Wit Wheat placed first and third in the ale category at the Lift For Life Microbrew Festival at Forest Park in St. Louis in the spring of 2005.

name: Charlie and Jake's Brewery and BBQ
Main Meadery
description: Located in Curtis Bay, Charm City Meadworks is Baltimore's first meadery. We're going to give your tastebuds something to be excited about!

name: Charter Oak Brewing Company
description: In an era of extreme everything, the Charter Oak Tree quietly stands apart as a patriotic symbol of strength and truth. That’s why we chose Connecticut’s beloved tree to be the symbol of our dedication to brewing the most honest, freshest and un-hyped beer possible.  Our ales are handcrafted from 100% natural ingredients: select malted barley, choice hops, special yeast, and using only the purest water for a unique and delicious taste. We never use any adjuncts or preservatives.   Each varietal is carefully brewed to be the ideal balance   of flavors for that style beer.  But also our beer is entertaining and enriching. For the enjoyment of our beer lovers, we have extensively portrayed the true events of the Charter Oak legend. Each variety and seasonal ale will share different parts and characters of this enduring story.  We hope you enjoy our beers as much as we enjoyed brewing it.

name: Chatham Brewing
description: Our beer is so fresh, you don't know whether to drink it or slap it.    We were tired of the generic taste of mass-market beers. So we decided to brew our own. At least once a week. Except when we're on a fishing trip.     Our brewery in in Chatham, NY. You will find us at the end of the alley between 20 and 22 Main Street.

name: Chattahoochee Brewing Company
description: Welcome to the biggest little Brewpub site in Southeast Alabama. We are a small nano sized brewpub sitting on the banks of the Chattahoochee River in Phenix City, AL

name: Chattanooga Brewing Company
description: Chattanooga Brewing Company opened in 1890 and lasted until 1915 and was the choice of beer drinkers in Chattanooga, selling beer in most of the local taverns and in cases of bottles. Among their brands of the day were Imperial Pilsner and Magnolia. Returning to the local beer scene in 2010, they have brought back Imperial Pilsner and many other tasty brews. Many German, English, and American styles are featured throughout the year.

description: Friends Creating Belgian Goodness for the Love of Beer.

name: Chau Tien USA
description: Back in 1985, a Dragon and an Angel visited me in a dream. The Dragon was swirling around the Angel, protecting Her, and blowing fire, turning white clouds into pink and red ones. The Angel then instructed: "Tuan, your destiny is to become a great brewer." The Dragon symbolizes the Emperor and the Angel symbolizes the Queen. It was such a powerful dream that I awoke and scripted the image on a napkin on my desk and it embraces my beer logo. To fulfill that vision, I began my journey in search of the finest brewers in the land. I found Sierra Nevada Brewery in Chico, California, and there... there, America's first Asian beer, Cháu Tiên® Pale Ale was born and brewed until the end of 1987.    From 1988 to 1998 Cháu Tiên® was brewed in Modesto, California and Dubuque, Iowa. Since 1999, Cháu Tiên® has been brewed at Santa Clara County and Mendocino County regional California breweries.    Tuan is seeking upwards of $50 million to build/acquire his own brewery and distribute his beer worldwide.

name: Cheaha Brewing Company
description: Cheaha Brewing Company is a brewpub in the 1885 L&N freight house. We currently serve hand crafted beer produced in Alabama and nearby. Soon, we will begin brewing our own beers and have them on tap. Our beer is paired with uniquely prepared dishes incorporating as much locally produced and all natural food as possible.

name: Cheboygan Brewing Company
description: Back in 2009 a few of us craft beer enthusiasts and history buffs from Cheboygan shared an idea. We dreamed of reestablishing a proud local brewery, one out of production since the wave of prohibition captured northern Michigan like it did the rest of the country. We imagined brewing fabulous beers that respected the heritage of the original recipes and brought time honored brewing techniques and a few brewmaster secrets to the table. We focused on the water. We went after taste.    Now, after 100 years of waiting, Cheboygan Brewing Company is back!

name: Check Six Brewing Company
description: A craft brewery in the making!  CoFounded by Noah Goldman, Tim Hassel and Norm Weiss. With a special thanks to Mike and J.R. Goldman!

name: Check Six Brewing Company
hoursOfOperation: Opening soon

name: Chelsea Alehouse
description: Located in Chelsea’s historic Clocktower Complex, the Chelsea Alehouse Brewery opened its doors in December 2012.  Featuring American and English style Ales, we aim to provide a wide variety of choices for the beer connoisseur and occasional beer drinker as well.    In our pub, enjoy a view of our American-made tanks at the bar, get cozy in a booth or enjoy a pint outside in our beer garden.  Our deli-style kitchen features delicious grilled sandwiches, wraps, housemade hummus and salsa, or try our meat cheese plate featuring local cheeses.    We’re family friendly with menu options for kids and have changing tables in both our restrooms.

name: Chelsea Brewing Company
description: Chelsea Brewing Company, rated the best brewery in New York, is a first class waterfront restaurant and the only micro-brewery in Manhattan located at pier 59.With over 15 years of experience, and 8 National Awards, we are proud to serve up to 27 natural hand-crafted ales and specialty beers using only the finest malts and hops from around the world. We offer beer tastings, brewery tours and group packages.

name: Cherry Street Brewing Cooperative
description: Forsyth's only Brewpub. The Community Brewery. Do You Know Your Brewer?

name: Chesapeake Bay Brewing Company
description: Formerly Rock Creek Brewing. Opened in 2001 by Scott Whitham and Brooke Baldridge, this brewery also carried some of the Rock Creek beers. The brewery and taproom closed in 2003.

name: Cheshire Cat Brewery
description: Location Opened In 2000 by Charlie Sturdavant, Geoffry Bruce and other investors. Closed In 2008.  Was a Brewpub with food and beer in the English-style.  Was sold to the Yak and Yeti Brewpub which continues to use the location and brewing equipment.

name: Chester River Brewing Company
description: The Chester River Brewing Company hopes to be Kent County, Maryland's first modern micro-brewery -- well, OK, nano-brewery -- serving small-batch artisan ales to thirsty townsfolk and tourists.

name: Chestnut Brew Works
description: Chestnut Brew Works, LLC is a small beer brewery nestled in the woods of southern Monongalia county, about 10 miles south of Morgantown, WV. We utilize a 1 barrel (1 barrel=31 gallons) system to produce about 200 barrels per year.  This level of production is extremely small, even compared to “micro-breweries” such as Tröeg’s or Flying Dog.  Our small size allows us to experiment with different ingredients and processes, which highlights the artistic and creative sides of brewing.

name: Chicago Beer Company
description: Chicago Beer Company is in persistent pursuit of producing the finest quality craft beers that will be deemed worthy of their Chicago namesake. Such was the destiny that led to the creation of Chicago Beer Company’s flagship release, Chi-Town Windy City Wheat! On draft and in bottles!

name: Chicago Brewing Company
description: Award winning brewpub featuring a selection of appetizers, pizzas, sandwiches and entrees along with a fully stocked gaming bar. Beer is brewed on premise and has won numerous awards at the Great American Beer Festival and The World Beer Cup.

name: Chick Brewing Co.
description: Chick Beer is America's beer for women!    Chick Beer is a premium craft-brewed light lager that tastes like a full-bodied lager, yet has just 97 calories and 3.5 carbs per bottle, about the same as half of a carrot.

name: Chilly Water Brewing Co.
description: An urban brewpub with super food infused with great music, located in Downtown Indianapolis.

name: Chino Valley Brewery
description: A local nano-brewery making craft beer in small batches! We are now open to the public. We have 5 house beers and usually have at least 4 of them on tap. Stop in for a visit and some fresh craft beer!
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  4:30pm - 9:00pm Fri:  4:30pm - 9:00pm Sat:  1:00pm - 9:00pm  Thu - Fri:4:30 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat:1:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Chocolate City Beer
description: Two friends and avid homebrewers, Ben Matz and Jay Irizarry, had an idea to bring their love of hand crafted micro-brewed beer to the masses via a small scale manufacturing and production facility. No small task when you consider this “dream” was taking form during the latter part of 2008, when the financial markets were set to implode, credit markets were freezing, and good economic news, especially for entrepreneurs and business start-ups, was hard to come by. The two pressed ahead and, with the financial assistance of Brian Flanagan as a third partner and business development specialist Don Parker, launched Chocolate City Beer in November of 2009.
hoursOfOperation: Sat:  12:30pm - 4:00pm  Every Saturday:  12:30pm - 4pm

name: Denver
description: The ChopHouse is a relaxed yet sophisticated bistro with a diverse menu featuring legendary steaks, chops, seafood and mouthwatering, handcrafted ales brewed on-site. Located in Denver, Washington D.C. and Boulder, each ChopHouse & Brewery is housed in a historic landmark building, conveying a unique character and distinction all its own.

name: ChuckAlek Independent Brewers
description: Inspired by our grandfathers, Chuck and Alek, we draw on their legacy and the legacy of those who came before them, striving to brew creative, artistic, and uncommonly good beers. ChuckAlek Independent Brewers is pulling some of the past into the present by recovering, reviving, and recreating heritage craft brews.

name: Chuckanut Brewery & Kitchen
description: Enjoy world class European style, award winning lagers & ales and a local-centric menu of fresh American cuisine including woodstone pizzas, burgers, seafood, salads and more! All ages are welcome everyday starting at lunch and into the night.

name: Church Street Brewing Company
description: The Church Street Brewing Company is bringing lagers and ales from around the world to Chicagoland. Using the finest malted barley and hops from North America, the UK, and Germany, there's something for every beer lover. Using traditional German brewing methods, Church Street will break new ground with beer-lovers by making an expansive range of both new and old beers and ales, pleasing all palates!    While we currently have several year-round beers, our tap rotation will continue to evolve, with special releases and seasonal brews. We love hearing from customers, so let us know what your favorite styles are — we might just try a batch!
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  4:00pm - 7:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 7:00pm  Thursday: 4pm to 7pm  Friday: 4pm to 7pm

name: CIB Brewery
description: A limited production artisanal nano brewery located in Carson, Iowa. Opened December 21, 2011.    To produce full flavored, real beer with the highest quality from local ingredients and sell that beer to our friends and family.    CIB is a small batch, production only nano brewery with an emphasis on flavor, evironmental responsibility, local artwork, ingredients, and distribution.

name: Cigar City Brewing
description: Cigar City Brewing was founded with two goals in mind. The first to make the world's best beer and the second to share with people near and far the fascinating culture and heritage of the Cigar City of Tampa. From its past as the world's largest cigar producer to its Latin roots and the many other diverse peoples that call it home, Tampa draws on many sources to develop its unique culture. At CCB we are fascinated by Tampa's history and suspect you will be too.

name: Brewpub
hoursOfOperation: Sun:  11:00am - 10:00pm, 11:00am - 3:00pm Fri:  11:00am - 11:00pm Sat:  11:00am - 11:00pm, 11:00am - 3:00pm  Sunday – Thursday: 11am – 10pm  Friday & Saturday: 11am – 11pm  Brunch: Saturday & Sunday: 11am – 3pm

name: Cinder Block Brewery
description: When we brewed our first batch of beer we never imagined where it would take us. The passion that was created for brewing these unique full flavored beers became intoxicating to all of us. This dream has been 3 years in the making and took a bit of luck and a lot of hard work.    It’s hard to believe we started small at our homes and have now grown into our 15bbl facility with a full taproom and barrel aging program. We haven’t forgotten our roots as we continue to focus on unique full flavored beers with plenty of character and a whole lot of attitude. We strive to share a truly unique experience in every glass of Cinder Block Beer.

name: Circle Brewing Company
description: At Circle, all of our brews embody the concept of purity through simplicity of design.  You won’t find chemicals, stabilizing or clarifying agents, cheap additives or adjuncts, or even gimmicky fruits or spices in any of our brews.  At Circle, we embrace the German Purity standards of 1516 and continually brew better beer with that in mind.  To us, the circle is a symbol of perfection in its most basic form.  We share that perfection with you in every pint of Circle.

name: Cismontane Brewing
description: Cismontane Brewing Co. was started by two native southern Californians, Ross Stewart and Evan Weinberg. They chose the name Cismontane because the geographical area it represents, coastal Southern California from Santa Barbara to San Diego. As a brewery we are dedicated to creating the finest beers to represent the unique culture and diverse natural aspects of this region. Each beer is named after a local feature that is unique to the area.    The Brewery is located on the side of the largest mountain in Orange County in the city of Rancho Santa Margarita. The great views from Santiago peak and the trails through the canyons provide some of the natural inspiration for the beers and the company.    The brewery is small and accessible to all with a warm and comfortable tasting area. So don’t hesitate to come by when in the area.    (cis-mon-tane)    “This side of the mountains”, in reference to coastal Southern California. This was a common term used for Southern California while it was forming its identity during the gold rush and before prohibition.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Tue:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Wed:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Thu:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 9:00pm Sun:  12:00pm - 5:00pm  Mon - Fri: 3:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: City Island Beer Company
description: Founded in 2011, the City Island Beer Company produces hand-crafted beer inspired by a local ship building tradition of craftsmanship and quality that produced seven America's Cup winning yachts.     Our mission is to bring you the best beer made with the finest ingredients.

name: City Star Brewing Company
description: Small batch ales hand crafted in the heart of downtown Berthoud, Colorado. Taproom open daily.

name: City Steam Brewery
description: Have a blast with our laughs and drafts!

name: Civil Life Brewing Company
description: We hold these truths to be self-evident: that all men are created equal, with certain unalienable Rights, that among these are Life, Liberty, and the Pursuit of fine crafted ales.     We are a local craft brewery situated in the great Tower Grove South neighborhood. We currently have 8 beers on draft a British Bitter, English Best, American Brown, German Wheat, Scottish Ale, Vienna Lager, Black Lager, Munich Dunkel Lager. We built a very traditional pub inside of an old warehouse. Best yet, our beers can be found around town. Head to our web-site at www.thecivillife.com for a listing. Hope you can enjoy a pint sometime soon and check us out. Cheers!

name: Plymouth
description: At CJ's, we're all about the beer. Enjoy our great brews and ales along with a delicious meal.  Watch the brewmaster as he prepares some of the six fresh brews we have on tap daily in the brewing room.  In season, slip out the back door and enjoy your beer and dine on our open air patio. Our menu offers a wide variety of delicious and creative beer- friendly dishes made with the freshest ingredients.

name: Claim 52 Brewing
description: We are a 3 1/2 barrel small-batch craft brewery located in Eugene, Oregon. Our beers are European influenced styles made in the Northwest tradition with the best Northwest ingredients. We focus on quality, flavor, and community.     We love beer, and we love food. And we love what happens when friends get together and enjoy great beer alongside fantastic local food. Our beers will be available at restaurants and bars in the Eugene area that share our philosophy on quality, local ingredients, and community.

name: Clandestine Brewing
description: We are passionate about brewing and united in our quest to produce beer of the highest quality.

With a focus on freshness and variety, CCA has quickly become a favorite watering hole for a clientele that places a strong value on locally-made authentic products.  As CCA grows into the future, we are excited to bring this beer philosophy to a wider audience.

Most of the recipes we use to brew our beer today started out as Dave's own home brewing recipes and all are developed from the style guidelines and are 100% representations of their given style.

name: Climbing Bines Craft Ale Co.
description: Climbing Bines Craft Ale Company is one of New York State's first farm breweries! We specialize in small batch, hand-crafted ales brewed on site with the freshest, estate-grown hops and barley harvested just a few miles down the road.

description: A locally owned and operated brew pub

name: Clown Shoes Beer
description: Founded in December 2009 by beer lovers trying to make work fun again, Clown Shoes has been redefining what craft beer should be. We strive to add our own little creative twists on under-represented styles and styles in need of change.    Our mission now is to produce beer without pretension while being free and a little crazy.

name: Coachella Valley Brewing Co.
description: The Coachella Valley Brewing Co is liquid perfection.

name: Coal Creek TAP
description: Coal Creek turned 21, so naturally, we opened a nano-brewery! Visit us at 108 Grand Ave. located right next door to the downtown Coal Creek Coffee shop. Currently, we have 13 different brews on tap, ensuring that everyone will find something to love. Every beer is hand-crafted on site by owner and brew-master, John Guerin, a long-time business owner and Laramie entrepreneur. At Coal Creek TAP we encourage you to break out of your beer comfort zone and experience something new. And, if you're not ready to commit to a pint, we offer 5oz. and 10oz. pours as well as flights of our beers. We've got something for everyone's palate: a light, fruity and refreshing pilsner; a rich and creamy smoked porter, a variety of pale ales and IPA's, and big, bright and spicy Belgians!

name: Coalition Brewing Company
description: Coalition Brewing was born out of a serendipitous chance encounter between owners Kiley Hoyt and Elan Walsky. Both began as home brewers and received formal brewing education through the Siebel Institute in Chicago.    Their love of beer and the brewing process is the impetus for the Coalator Program, which encourages local home brewers to brew their recipes in the brewery and serve them at the pub.    Coalition Brewing prides itself on highly balanced, drinkable beers.
hoursOfOperation: Open: Tues-Fri 3pm-12am  Open: Sat 12pm-12am, Sun 12pm-10pm  Happy Hour: 3pm-6pm Tues-Sun

name: COAST Brewing Company
description: OAST Brewing Co. is a small, family owned craft brewery - Located across from Noisette Creek on the Old Navy Base.    We believe in utilizing alternative means to brew unique beer. We also believe in choice organic and local ingredients. From our biodiesel fired kettle to our energy efficient process, we forge hand crafted batches on our 7 bbl brewhouse.

name: Coastal Empire Beer Company
description: Artisan ales and lagers.

name: Cobra Brewing Company
description: We know how satisfying it is to enjoy a nice hand crafted beer, that is why at Cobra Brewing Company we brew with only top quality ingredients. All of our crafted beer is brewed locally in Flower Mound, TX.

name: Cocoa Beach Brewing Company
description: Cocoa Beach Brewing Company is a family owned and operated brewery and pub.  We are located in historic downtown Cocoa Beach on Atlantic Avenue (northbound Highway A1A) between 1st Street North and 2nd Street North.  We are proud to be located in one of the oldest buildings in world famous Cocoa Beach.  Built in the 1930s, our building was originally Navy housing for the Banana River Naval Air Station.  It has since been home to a number of commercial enterprises.    Our brewery consists of a custom designed and built 1.5 bbl Brewhouse and three 1.5 bbl stainless steel conical fermentation tanks.

name: Cody Brewing Company
description: Cody Brewing Company is located in Historic Amesbury, Massachusetts on the Powow River. We make hand crafted beer that combines traditional styles with rule breaking ideas to make the best beer possible. We brew on a 7 barrel system, which is just over 200 gallons, to make 1200 barrels each year.    Hand crafted beer that combines traditional styles with rule breaking ideas to make the best beer possible that our customers enjoy. Always.

name: Cold Spring Brewing Company
description: This historical brewery founded in 1874 has a storied tradition and heritage. It all began in the 1500”s. French Canadian trappers traveling west along the famous Red River Trail discovered this natural spring, which had the most refreshing water. Word of this spring spread and became a regular stop for all settlers going west on the Red River Trail. In 1857 Swiss born naturalist Armond DuPont wrote, “it is a water like no other, unique in its ability to refresh.” He noted, “Though seemingly impossible, a year-round frost forms at the base of this amazing spring.”    The brewery was built at the site of the spring and its water became the basis of all the award winning brews for over 125 years. In addition, the brewery has become the #1 energy drink and specialty drink producer in the country. We personally invite you to explore and enjoy our great water, drinks and brews.

name: Cole Street Brewery
description: Enumclaw's first craft brewery

name: College Street Brewhouse & Pub
description: Just a quick drive to the north side of town, you'll find yourself at Havasu's hippest new brewhouse and pub. Here we focus on creating one-of-a-kind handcrafted beers. Revelers will appreciate sipping a smooth, flavorful craft brew while enjoying our rustic cuisine. Our casual atmosphere, outdoor dining, large bar and views of Lake Havasu are sure to become your favorite place to come and unwind.
hoursOfOperation: Hours: Monday-Thursday 11am-10pm, Friday & Saturday 11am-11pm

name: Colockum Craft Brewing
description: It's a brewery. We make beer.

name: Colorado Boy Pub & Brewery
description: Colorado Boy is owned and operated by Tom & Sandy Hennessy (Pictured at right) who have been in the brewing business since 1993, starting with IL Vicino in Albuquerque, Colorado Springs, and Salida, Colorado, and the Palisade Brewery in Palisade, Colorado.    Since 1993, Tom has been pushing the idea of Frankenbrew and publishd a video on how to build inexpensive brewing systems in 1995. Colorado Boy is the culmination of years of owning and operating different breweries. Stop by and see how small and efficient Frankenbrew works.

name: Colorado Brewing Company
description: New Brewhouse/Micro-Brewery in downtown Boulder, CO. What was the Redfish Brewhouse location, the Colorado Brewing Company/Boulder Draft House opened its doors February 20, 2009. We are a Boulder brewhouse serving amazing comfort food that is regionally and globally inspired along with perfectly balanced handcrafted beers for the everyday beer drinker and the micro-brew enthusiast, all served in a friendly and comfortable setting that is enhanced by quality live music several days a week

name: Colorado Cider Company
description: The Colorado Cider Company was founded to produce a fresh hard cider for the discerning Colorado drinker. With a well-developed craft beer market and an educated populace Hard Cider has been a missing choice in the cacophony of craft drinks in local pubs and liquor stores. We hope to remedy that. We're getting out in the market, check out our "Find us" page!

name: Colorado Plus
description: The 1st brew pub in the history of Wheat Ridge, CO.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm

name: Columbia Bay Brewery Restaurant and Pub
Columbia Kettle Works
description: We are Rod Smith and Bill Collister. We have been working together for 13 years at Farason Corporation. www.farason.com We became friends quickly due partly for our love of engineering and automation, as well as, our love and passion for craft beers. Our favorite past time has been traveling around visiting craft breweries, brewpubs and taprooms together, along with our wives, for 10 years now. Rod took up home brewing 5 years ago and has become quite proficient at brewing delicious beers to the delight and enjoyment of his colleagues, friends, and family. Rod's talent for brewing and Bill's business experience seemed like a good match for a brewpub that would allow us to continue enjoying Rod's hobby to its fullest extent and share it with many more fellow craft brew enthusiasts. We expect the creation, operation, and continuing evolution of the brewpub to provide us another outlet for our passions by providing a quality product and environment in which to enjoy it, along with meeting and enjoying the company of many people with the same love and passion for high quality craft beer.    Originally we looked all over for a good location starting within a few miles of our homes and extending out as far as Columbia hoping for a place within reasonable driving distance from our homes. We believed the market would, to some extent, come to us. Over several months we looked at numerous potential sites and due to one reason or another couldn't find an acceptable location. We ran into floor restrictions, ceiling height issues, limited parking, zoning issues and unaffordable rent. When we eventually met and talked with David Doolittle, Doolittle Investments LLC, he showed us two potential sites in Columbia. David seemed very interested in bringing our type of business into Columbia and offered us reasonable lease pricing and an honest willingness to work with us to bring our dream of a microbrewery to reality. The drive is 35 minutes from our homes, but after considering the location as fairly equally distant between Lancaster and York (both of which have more than one brewery), and the fact we would be first in Columbia and nearby Marietta and Wrightsville, plus the proximity to Route 30, we were sold on the location. We have since discovered that Columbia Borough is quite willing to help us establish our business in their wonderful town. We are thankful and grateful for their assistance and cooperation and look forward to being a part of the community.    Our brewing equipment consists of a 5bbl brew kettle, a 5bbl mash tun, and a 5bbl hlt. We will have three 5bbl or larger fermenters. We are ale people so we will have blondes, pale ales, IPAs, Porters/Stoudts, bitters, and a variety of Belgian versions as well. We will open with 4 taps and gradually expand to 8.  We expect to open this winter, Nov/Dec., but that is dependent on receipt of the brewing equipment and completion of the site as tentatively scheduled. We will open quitely and plan for a more elaborate grand opening at a later date. This venture is a new experience for us and the people assisting us so we need to start out slowly. Our initial hours will be 5pm to 9pm Thursday and Friday and 12pm to 9pm on Saturday. We are planning a lite menu using seasonal local ingredients whenever possible.

name: Comanche Creek Brewing Co
description: Comanche Creek Brewing Company is a small family owned microbrewery nestled in the Sangre de Cristo mountains of Northern New Mexico and located just out side Eagle Nest, New Mexico. Comanche Creek Brewing Company offers its take on several tradition beer styles including Alt and Kölsch styles. We utilize the pristine mountain waters of the Sangre de Cristo mountains to bring our customers great tasting beer. We hope you enjoy our hand-crafted beers the next time you are in Northern New Mexico!

name: Commando Brewing Company
description: Hand crafted brews and great food at a fair price.

name: Community Beer Company
description: BEER FOR THE GREATER GOOD.....    Community Beer Company represents many meanings --  all centered on what we feel a great Community represents.    FIRST: Beer is Communal. For ages, it’s been a central part of get-togethers among friends, family, and co-workers to celebrate old acquaintances ... or make new ones.     SECOND: As a brewery, we are passionate about providing quality craft beer to the people within our Community: Dallas, Texas and the surrounding Metroplex.     THIRD: We want to be stewards of our Community by adhering to environmentally sustainable business practices, production, and distribution.     And FINALLY: We plan to become an integral part of our Community by giving back to it through charitable activities and supporting our local artists.     Truly, Beer for the Greater Good!

name: Comrade Brewing Company
description: Welkome to the Party.  That's the motto for Comrade Brewing Company in southeast Denver.  Comrade features "back-to-basics" beers and a tongue-in-cheek nod to Communism.  But the name actually celebrates the camaraderie the craft brewing industry has become known for.

name: Concrete Beach Brewery
description: Concrete Beach Brewery is located in the heart of the Wynwood Arts District, and will begin brewing craft beer in early 2014.

name: Confluence Brewing Company
description: Confluence Brewing Company will be the only commerical micro-brewery in the area offering a wide variety of traditional handcrafted ales and lagers packaged in kegs and 16 oz. cans.

name: Conquest Brewing Company
description: The only production craft brewery in Columbia, SC.

name: Constantine Brewing Company
description: After a terrific couple years of construction and planning, Constantine now has a Brewery/Winery.     We will feature a daily BBQ plate, with rotating appetizers. Sunday features Hot Wings and Pizza! Everything is made here, the beer, the wine and all food from scratch featuring local ingredients wherever possible.   We have 6 handles, with a variety of ales on tap. "Laughing Leaves" Wines are by Char, and made with grapes from our vineyard, and a vineyard in Allegan. Also, fruit wines made with fruit from local suppliers, including Hunts raspberries.    Most weekends will feature Live music by local solo acts, and duos.

name: Conyngham Brewing Company
description: Currently a local microbrewery. In the near future an onpremise tavern will be opening up as well.

name: Cool Springs Brewery
description: Brewpub with a focus on innovation and unique brewing styles. We utilize multiple yeast strains and techniques to develop traditional sours, and Belgian style beer. We also love the hops, and most of CSB's pales represents a PNW hop characteristic.

name: Cooper's Cave Ale Company
description: We'd been brewing up beer in the kitchen at home for a few years. In 1995, we were informed that Ed's corporate employer of eleven years was leaving the area (NAFTA). Not wanting to move, and having had enough of the corporate world, we decided to do some research and see what was out there. At that time there were no breweries, brew pubs or microbreweries in our area. A two week vacation to Nova Scotia was inspirational.    It was the comradery of the brewers, owners and staff members that really sold us on the idea of opening our own establishment.The Micro Brewery people we've met have been generous beyond our wildest expectations, with information, how-to, where to find it, etc.

name: CooperSmith's Pub & Brewing
description: Tucked into the heart of Old Town Fort Collins, CooperSmith's offers a distinct alternative in eating & drinking establishments. We invite you to enjoy both our poolside and pubside.    For a fun, interactive look at all of the beers that they've brewed over the years, check out their Beer Finder at http://www.coopersmithspub.com/beer.
hoursOfOperation: Sunday - Wednesday 11am - 11pm  Thursday 11am - 11:30pm  Friday & Saturday 11am - Midnight

name: Cooperstown Brewing Company
description: The Cooperstown area had a significant impact on American Brewing. It started with the introduction of hop farming which flourished here until the end of the 19th century. Back then, Otsego and the surrounding counties produced most of the hops grown in the United States.    Traveling through the upper Susquehanna Valley towards Cooperstown in July 1898, a visitor would have enjoyed the view of hop farms with those beautiful hop vines reaching toward the midsummer sky. Grandfather Eckler ws a hop farmer and he used to say, "The hop was King in those days!" His hop farm was in Westville, NY only three miles up the Cherry Valley from where our Brewery is now located. When it came time for the hops to be harvested, Grandma Eckler would "put up" a dozen people from "the City' and they would pick the hops for their room and board and a "vacation" in the country. My mother, Cynthia Eckler Hall, said she always loved it when the hop pickers came to the farm. Everyone had a lot of fun during the harvest. When the blight devastated his crop in the early 1900's, grandfather turned to dairy farming.  Settled by Englishmen in the early 1800's, Cooperstown once had two English-style breweries in town. Following that tradition, the Cooperstown Brewing Company was founded in 1994. We brew premium ales, porters, and stouts using the finest two-row English barley malts, West Coast hops and the English Ringwood Yeast.    Grandpa would be pleased if he could see the Brewery. We have hops growing here that survived the devastating blight to New York hop farming and those hops grown here are used to finish our Back Yard India Pale Ale.

name: Copp Brewery
description: Relax.  You shouted. We heard you.  Copp Winery of Crystal River Florida is now Copp Winery and Brewery.     We are proud to be the first and ONLY winery to also hold a brewpub license in the State of Florida!    With that distinction comes a responsibility that we have not taken lightly.  In addition to continuing to offer you the best selection of hand-crafted wines produced on premises from the finest domestic and imported varietals and blends of grapes and juices, our craft microbrewery now produces and offers the highest quality selection of hand crafted beers made on premises from the finest domestic and imported ingredients, like quality English barley malt and the freshest dried hops.     Because our beers are produced in smaller quantities, we can offer not only the highest quality but diversity in our craft beers.  Like our extremely popular True Grit pale ale with corn grits, our brown ale Center Field or our English style porter Inaugabrew.     While some of our craft beers will always be on tap, others will be limited production.  Don't miss out - visit often and enjoy!
hoursOfOperation: Monday & Tuesday: Closed to public  Wednesday & Thursday: 12-9  Friday & Saturday: 12-11  Sunday 1-6  (Please note the kitchen closes 1/2 hour before the Brewpub and the Winery and Wine Bar)    HOLIDAY HOURS / CLOSINGS  Wed., December 26th - CLOSED.  Wed., January 2nd - TBA

name: Copper Club Brewing Company
description: Copper Club Brewing Company is a new local brewing company in Fruita Colorado serving high quality beers in a relaxed and friendly atmosphere. Food can be brought in or have it delivered.
