description: (No longer brewing)

name: Copper Kettle Brewery
description: Copper Kettle Brewery is an up and coming brewery owned by Harold Kerlin and Russ Eisenhuth. We have been independently brewing beer for the past 6 years. In 2006 we won First place in the Sam Adams Longshot contest for the northeast region of the U.S. with our Potbelly Porter. After that we decided to start our own brewery. The Brewery is located in just outside of Laurelton PA. We are a small production brewery using a one barrel brewing system. We hope to produce around 50 barrels a year. At present we are making 4 different styles of beer. A Wheat beer, Porter, Grand Cru, and Belgian Dubbel. All of our beer is unfiltered, and bottle conditioned. Our beers are now available at the Bull Run Inn, Market St., Lewisburg, The Beer Barn, Lewisburg and Wehr's Beverages, Mifflinburg.

name: Copper Kettle Brewing Company
description: Copper Kettle Brewing Company is a locally owned Mom and Pop brewery, established in 2011. Built on the foundation of craft beer, quality ingredients and the idea of re-creating the local neighborhood pub feel that America seems to have lost. Come on in and enjoy a pint or two and take a growler home with you to share with your friends and family
hoursOfOperation: Wed: 3:00 pm - 9:00 am  Thurs - Fri: 3:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat - Sun: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Coppertail Brewing Co
description: Coppertail Brewing Co is a production brewery and taproom in progress scheduled to open in Tampa in late 2013. It was started by local home brewers and craft beer enthusiasts, Kent Bailey and Robb Larson. Brewmaster is Casey Hughes.

name: Corcoran Brewing Company
description: Nestled on the back roads of Waterford is Virginia's only winery and brewery.      After tackling the world of winemaking, Lori and Jim Corcoran decided to expand to include their love of beer as well.  Brewer Kevin Bills was brought in, a plan was made, and here we are.  Currently producing beer 3 bbl at a time, we have up to 12 beers on tap at a time, though plans are in the works to upgrade to a 10 bbl system soon.    We have eleven varieties of hops growing just outside our tasting room and anticipate using them in an all Virginia Harvest Pale Ale soon, using barley grown and malted in Virginia.     Come by the tasting room for a flight of samples, a pint, a growler fill, and Monk's BBQ (voted best food truck in the DC area on WTOP).
hoursOfOperation: Sat - Sun:	12:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Core Brewing Company
description: Every great community needs a local flavor and Core Brewing & Distilling Company is out to be Arkansas’ hometown beer. Our brews are big and innovative rooted in tradition.
hoursOfOperation: Monday: Closed  Tue-Friday: 3-9  Sat-Sun: 1-9

name: Cornel's Brewing Company
description: Beaumont's first Mirco Brewery, located in Bevil Oaks. Look for our tasty brews in a restaurant or store near you!

name: Coronado Brewing Company
description: The Coronado Brewing Company, in beautiful Coronado (located just a few minutes from downtown San Diego) welcomes you to come and enjoy quality handcrafted beers and delicious food in a casual family environment. Join us for a refreshing pint while we make you one of our signature pizzas or calzones in the wood fired oven, or choose from a wide selection of fresh seafood, steaks, pastas and dining specials. The Coronado Brewing Company is perfect for a quick lunch, a relaxing beverage or a wonderful dinner. If you're a sports fan come relax with a cold beer and an appetizer while watching your favorite team on one of our many HD TV's. Open 7 days a week from 11:00 am (until closing) & offering a weekly happy hour (M-F) from (2-5pm).     The Tasting Room is Coronado Brewing Company's newest location located at 1205 Knoxville Street San Diego, Ca 92110. Come hang out at our production facility and bar! Choose from 20+ beers on tap while you take in the scenery of our facility. You may even catch our brewers hard at work! Our hours are Sunday-Thursday 11am-9pm and Friday-Saturday 11am-9:30pm with happy hour Monday-Friday 1pm-6pm! We even have rotating food trucks for our foodies out there!

name: Tasting Room
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Fri: 1pm – 9pm  Sat: 11am – 9:30pm  Sun: 11am – 8pm  Happy Hour M-F: 1-6pm

name: Cortland Beer Company
description: Welcome to the Cortland Beer Company, the start of something new in Cortland, NY. We are located at 16 Court Street, in the heart of Downtown Cortland, NY. Our tasting room is open and we are selling growlers and kegs at this time. You may also call ahead and pre-order your growler to go. We will do our best to have it packaged and ready to pick-up when you stop in. Keep your eyes open in the next few months for Cortland Beer Company beers at your favorite local pub’s and restaurants, and ask them to put it on tap.

name: Cosmic Frog Handcrafted Ales
description: Nanobrewery in Buffalo NY currently in the licensing phase of start up. We look forward to serving handcrafted ales that we feel are both creative and a solid contribution to the craft beer renaissance.     To enhance the culture of craft beer and quality of life of our community and customers by providing handcrafted, artisan ales created with thought, passion and attention to detail provided in an atmosphere that aspires to create mutual engagement.

name: Costal Extreme Brewing Company
description: The Coastal Extreme Brewing Company was started in 1999 by four graduates of Colby College. During his college days the head brewer, Derek Luke, reaquired a homebrewing kit he had given his sister and quickly went to work brewing and passing his knowledge along to the company's president, Brent Ryan. As Graduation grew near and the cold reality of post-collegiate life set in Luke and Ryan knew that they could turn their affinity for beer and their new found ability to make it into a viable alternative to unemployment or sitting at a desk answering to "The Man". Of course, they couldn't do it by themselves, so after very little convincing, they got roommate and friends, Mark Sinclair and Will Rafferty to join them.    On Father's Day in 1999, after almost two years of planning and preperation, the first batch of Hurricane Amber Ale was brewed. By July 2nd the first kegs had been shipped to three Newport Restaurants and were quickly tapped and emptied. A little over a month after the release of the first kegs, 6-packs of Hurricane Amber Ale began to hit the shelves. Since then we have expanded our product line and our distribution territory but continue to brew up a storm in our Middletown Brewery.

name: CoStar Brewing
description: CoStar Brewing is Pittsburgh's newest nano-brewery. Our brews can be found in some of your favorite eating and drinking establishments in the East End.

name: Cotton Brewing Co.
description: An LLC started by Brett Cotton and Krista Cotton in January 2011. The microbrewery license was issued to Cotton Brewing Company in August 2012. Build out of the brewery has been completed, inspections are finished, and we have begun building our tap room on Oak St. in Adrian.    Cotton Brewing currently has a production facility that is not open to the general public. Beer may be purchased directly from the production facility by appointment only.

name: Cottrell Brewing Company
description: Cottrell Brewing Company is a Connecticut-based micro brewery, manufacturing delicious craft beers a fine New England tradition.    Our flagship brew is Old Yankee Ale, which is a medium bodied, American Amber Ale, that has a great up-front malt taste with a refreshing hop finish.    More recently, we launched Mystic Bridge, which is a great example of a year ‘round New England IPA.  A mild earthy IPA with hints of citrus, this beer is great for paring with foods or for session drinking.    We believe in drinking local and thinking global!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri:	9:00 am	-	4:00 pm

name: Council Brewing Company
description: Council Brewing Company, established in 2013 and opened in 2014, is a small batch brewery, located in the Kearny Mesa area of San Diego.     Our tasting room has been deliberately crafted to create a destination for people from all walks of life to come together, converse, and fellowship over truly fine craft beer. The name "Council" was chosen because it conveys this sense of community; a place where peers come together to deliberate, debate, and make decisions. The tasting room has a warm, inviting feeling, with green, tan, and rustic red toned walls, soft brown flooring and rich Mahogany bar tops. Careful thought was placed into the low music sound levels and decision to not install televisions in order to promote conversations.     We place a tremendous emphasis on creating exemplary beer, crafted to the highest standards. We brew beers that are unique and extremely flavorful, focusing on Ales hailing from American, Belgian, and English origins. No matter what the style, we focus on creating intense aromas and flavors that are very well balanced and drinkable. Click over to "Our Beer" to find out more about our beer offerings.    Council Brewing Company is owned and operated by Curtis & Liz Chism and you can usually find them at the tasting room serving up freshly crafted beer.

name: Council Rock Brewery
description: Handcrafted Beer & Hearty Food
hoursOfOperation: Open: Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday 4 PM to 8 PM  Friday- 12 noon to 10 PM  Saturday- 12 Noon to 10 PM  Sunday-12 Noon to 7 PM

name: Country Boy Brewing
description: Country Boy Brewing was founded in late 2011 by three country boys who like beer and had a similar goal of making and drinking good beer.
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Wed: 4PM - 10PM  Thu-Fri: 4PM-Midnight  Sat: Noon - Midnight  Sun: 1PM - 9PM

name: Crabby Larry's Brewpub Steak & Crab House
description: In 1990 Larry came up with the idea to sell produce from the corner of Rt. 463 and Lower State Road. He took Dani and the three kids to meet the owner of the property, Al Walters. Mr. Walters took an immediate liking to the Jones family and allowed Dani and Larry to sell produce from his corner. Being a farmer, he even started growing corn and other vegetables for them. One day, Larry's father showed up with a bushel of live crabs and left them with Dani to sell. The crabs sold so fast that they picked up more crabs, shrimp, and other types of seafood too. In 1994, Mr. Walters passed away and Dani and Larry had to move on to bigger and better things. They rented a space in the Chalfont Village Shopping Center and opened a restaurant and fresh fish market. Dani and Larry did all the cooking. Larry would go to the fish market daily to ensure the freshest seafood. And with the help of loyal family and friends, Jones Family Seafood became a popular seafood restaurant in the area.      Early in 2001, Larry received a mailing, the kind we all ignore, advertising "Brew your own beer". He was immediately hooked. After convincing Dani that this was a good idea, they met up with a "brew master", ordered the equipment, and they were on their way.

name: Crabtree Brewing Company
description: The Crabtree Brewing Company is dedicated to serving the environment, the community, our customers, and our valued employees.  Requiring the best ingredients to support unique premium beers.  Keeping a dynamic business mind while remaining modestly profitable.   Employing technology, embracing ethics, growing to meet the needs of our customers and employees, and having fun doing what we love - Making Great Beer.    The Crabtree Brewing Company, ltd. is a Colorado based company providing premium ale, wheat, stout, and lager style beers. Established in 2006, this is the first micro-brewery located within Greeley, Colorado.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 1:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 1:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sun: 1:00 pm - 5:00 pm
Sunday: 12pm (Noon) - 6pm  Mon-Thurs: 1pm - 10pm  Fri-Sat: 12pm (Noon) - 12am (Midnight)

name: Craft Brewing Company
description: The Craft Brewing Company is a partnership of four home brewers who wish to generate more interest in crafted beers. Come by to take a taste of our brew on tap and then grab a growler to take some home.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 4:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri: 4:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm  Sun: 1:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Crafty Ales and Lagers
description: Nano-Brewery in the Finger Lakes
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Fri: 4:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 1:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 3:00 pm

name: Craggie Brewing Company
description: Our passion is to locally produce quality craft beers and to foster community involvement with commitment and integrity.
hoursOfOperation: Hours: Wednesday-Thursday: 4-9p  Friday-Saturday: 4-10p

name: Crank Arm Brewing Company
description: Welcome to Crank Arm Brewing! We are a craft brewery with tasting room located in the heart of the warehouse district in downtown Raleigh, North Carolina. Our mission is to provide fresh artisan beer while utilizing green transportation methods.
hoursOfOperation: Monday-Wednesday: 4pm-Midnight  Thursday-Friday: 4pm-2am  Saturday: Noon-2am  Sunday: Noon-10pm

name: Cranker's Brewery
hoursOfOperation: Monday-Wednesday 11:00am-12:00am  Thursday-Saturday 11:00am-1:00am  Sunday 1:00pm-10:00pm

name: Crazy Mountain Brewing
description: Crazy Mountain Brewing Company was founded in January 2010 by Kevin and Marisa Selvy in the heart of the Rocky Mountains.  After a chance meeting in the Anchor Brewing Tasting Room, Kevin and Marisa decided to follow their crazy dreams and move to Colorado, Kevin's home state, and brew.  With a combined passion for craft beer, Kevin and Marisa founded the Vail Valley’s first production brewery.  Crazy Mountain was built with love from the ground up in a gutted warehouse, shipping in tanks and equipment from around the globe. Their first beer was poured at a beer festival in Vail in January 2010.  Using the highest quality ingredients, Crazy Mountain handcrafts each brew for beer enthusiasts across the United States, Japan, Hong Kong, and Sweden.  We say crazy is as crazy does, so drink up and live the life you want!

name: Creede Brewing Company
description: Brewery, Brew pub and Tap Room.

name: Creek Bottom Brewing
description: Creek Bottom Brewing was started by a group of folks with a passion for good beer. We thought the Southwest Virginia area needed a good brew, so here we go!

name: Creekside Brewing Co
description: Hand-crafted ales, pub-style comfort food, scenic patio dining, local wines, full bar, banquet room and catering available

name: Cricket Hill Brewing Company
description: We believe that New Jersey is starting to learn what the rest of the country already knows; that local microbrews are some of the best beers in the world! Finally, curious beer drinkers are stepping out from under the mind-numbing barrage of large brewery advertising and deciding for themselves what they like. Our beers are designed for those curious drinkers. The large breweries use fillers in their beer; Corn or Rice are the most frequently used. Most good beer should be all Barley, in the same way that good hamburgers are all beef. Barley is expensive and the more fillers that are used, the better the profits! Cricket Hill Beers are 100% Barley as are most great beers. Please take the time to taste different local beers. I am certain that those who decide not to let television dictate what they drink are ready for a wonderful adventure into the world of Beer!

name: Crispin Cider
description: Classically refined, but not styled as a traditional "sweet beer" beer alternative, Crispin ciders are crisp and clean, not sweet and sticky and never sacrifice superior quality refreshment satisfaction for overbearing complexity.    Always true to the apple, Crispin Hard Ciders naturally fermented in the USA use fresh pressed apple-juice, not from apple juice concentrate, from a premium blend of US West Coast apples, with no added malt, grape wine or spirit alcohol. Crispin’s unique USA produced ciders are smoothed with pure apple juice or from natural sugar sources like organic honey or organic maple syrup, and contain no added colorants, sorbate or benzoate preservatives.    Crispin ciders have 7 different varietals - Original, Light and Brut; classic European styled crisp clean ciders, Browns Lane; an imported classic English dry cider, and our line of Artisanal Reserves; Honey Crisp, The Saint and Lansdowne - unfiltered "cloudy" ciders, ground-breaking "craft beer" uniquely American ciders.    Crispin ciders are all Gluten Free for the wheat-intolerant person.

name: Crooked Fence Brewing
description: Craft brewery located in Garden City, Idaho (Boise). 15 BBL brewhouse with a tasting room and gift shop. Makers of Rusty Nail Pale, 3 Picket Porter, Derby Oatmeal IPA, Hole Wheat American Wheat, Sins of Our Fathers Imperial Stout and the Grim Reaper Black IPA.
hoursOfOperation: Thursday: 4 - 10PM  Friday: 4 - 10PM  Saturday: 12-11PM

name: Crooked Letter Brewing Company
hoursOfOperation: Free tours Saturdays 1-3pm and Tuesdays 5:30- 8 pm A tour starts every 30 min.

name: Brewery/Bar
description: Crooked Run is a nano-brewery brewery located in historic Market Station in Leesburg.  Crooked Run offers unique and well-crafted American and Belgian style ales, many made with locally-grown ingredients.  Beers can be purchased by the glass at the brewery bar or growler fills to go with bottles coming soon.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Thu: 4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri: 4:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sat: 1:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sun: 1:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Barrel Cellar & Taproom
description: Crooked Stave is a progressive, artisan brewery that strives to blend brewing science and art, through creativity and following our passion. We are based in Denver, Colorado while the unique beers we produce draw inspiration from worldly adventures. All our beers are produced from the highest quality ingredients, using contemporary and historic brewing techniques aimed at evolving ones perception of what beer is and focused on delivering the best possible drinking experience.
hoursOfOperation: Fri: 4:00pm - 8:00pm  Sat: 12:00noon - 8:00pm

name: Brewery & Taproom
hoursOfOperation: Daily: 12:00noon - 11:00pm

name: Brewpub
description: Crop believes in simplicity…..    We believe food is at its most flavorful, its most creative, its most passionate, when it’s at its freshest.    We believe food is at its best when it highlights the care and craftsmanship of those who bring it from the field to your plate.    We believe food is community, a series of connections between farmers and chefs and guests.    Seasonal, local flavors, hand-crafted ales and inventive libations, lovingly prepared and cheerfully served…Come and share the bounty of Crop.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:30 am - 10:00 pm

name: Brewery & Restaurant
description: If you could be doing whatever you want right now, what would you be doing? For Ken Landin and Janine Bennett the answer to that question would always be "listening to live music and drinking craft beer." Fueled by their outrage over the political and corporate disaster that unfolded on the nightly news, and frustrated by the thought that their lifestyle may contribute to the problem, they were at a crossroads. And so began the plan for Crossroads Brewing Company.     There was many years of discussion, research, paperwork, rejection, and searching for the perfect property.  After having deals fall through and the economy taking a turn for the worse, their hopes were fading. Then, in December of 2008, the Brooks Opera House in Historic Athens was discovered by accident. After leaving a restaurant just 2 miles from home they noticed a for sale sign on the deteriorating building and it's just like the old saying goes............when you know, you know.     It was quickly realized that when a community believes in what you are doing and puts it's support behind you, great things can happen. So they were off and running from the first turn of the key. Restoring a Historic Opera House from 1893 was not part of the original plan but with hard work and their secret weapon, Janine's brother Jimmy, things are coming together. Ken, Janine, Jimmy and Janine's Dad, Jim, have had their hands on just about every square inch of this 15,000 square foot building. Little by little, this grand and unique property will be restored to it's former glory.      Everyday seems to bring a new challenge but the ultimate goal remains clear. This building was once the hub of this sleepy riverside village and Ken and Janine intend to return it to the community. The second floor, where the Opera House once was, will get a new stage for plays and musical performances of all kinds. Athens is surrounded by hard working farmers so looking any further for meats and produce just doesn't make sense.  From organic menu items to earth friendly building materials the environment is a factor in every decision that is made along the way. They hope to eventually have the brewery running "off the grid" as well.     Ken, Janine, Brewer Hutch Kugeman and Chef Paul Parillo invite you to come visit the pub in Athens, NY.  There's 10 craft beers on tap and a menu that showcases the small farms of the Hudson Valley.   Cheers!
hoursOfOperation: Mon, Wed & Thurs.: 4:00 pm-9:00 pm  Friday: 4:00 pm-12:00 am  Saturday: 1:00 pm-12:00 am  Sunday: 1:00 pm-9:00 pm  Closed Tuesdays

name: Crow Brewing Company
description: Crow Brewing is a Southern California based brewing company pioneering locally produced 100% organic high quality craft beer. We focus on West Coast style ales and lagers using the highest quality organic malts and hops. We are headquartered in San Diego County and our beer is currently being produced in Orange County. We are back to looking for a brewery site.    CROW BREWING~ Great beer that happens to be organic.

name: Crow Hop Brewing Co
description: Local Handcrafted Beer in the Heart of Downtown Loveland.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 3:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri: 3:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat: 1:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Crow Peak Brewing Company
description: Crow Peak Brewing Company began on March 9, 2007. The brewery is located in Spearfish, South Dakota at the foot of the beautiful Black Hills.    We began in a small tap room with a 5 barrel system. Word got out about Crow Peaks great beers starting a dedicated fan base. With the popularity of the beer growing, so did the brewery.    In December of 2009 we opened the doors to our new building and 30 barrel brewhouse.    Crow Peak beers can be found on tap and in cans throughout South Dakota, North Dakota, Omaha, NE, and Eastern Wyoming. We are proud to distribute  11th Hour IPA,  Pile of Dirt Porter and Canyon Cream Ale, as well as a number of seasonal offerings.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 4:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 2:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Crown Brewing
description: When the Crown Brewing Company opened its doors in 2008 we had one goal in mind, "Craft the Best Beer Period!" In 2010 our Industrial Porter won a Bronze Medal in the World Beer Cup, Brown Porter category.    We offer a selection of six to eight of our hand-crafted beers, fresh and on tap year round. In addition to our foundation beers, we brew special seasonal beers throughout the year. So, stop on in and see what's new!

name: Crown Valley Brewing & Distilling Company
description: Crown Valley Brewing & Distilling features handcrafted brews made exclusively at the Coffman location by Brewmaster, Jeremy Gilbert. All beers are produced in the state-of-the-art 15-barrel microbrewery.  We strive to produce small batches of great beer.

name: Crux Fermentation Project
description: Crux brewmaster Larry Sidor is always in pursuit of the next great beer—beer that defies taste profiles with its complexity and creativity. We’ve designed our brewery to allow for non-traditional brewing methods like decoction mashing, open fermentation, oak barrel aging, wild yeast strains and experimental hops.    Initially, we’ll only have a few thousand hectoliters of capacity. With added fermenters and bright beer tanks, we could push that to 11,000 hectoliters (or around 9,000 barrels). But we kinda like being small. It makes us nimble and free to experiment in ways that just aren’t possible with larger batch sizes.    Housed in a former transmission shop and mill supply store, Crux Fermentation Project was built by a community of beer lovers. To everyone who contributed ideas, materials, sweat and support, thank you. And cheers.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Sun: 11:30 am - 10:00 pm

name: Crystal Ball Brewing Company
description: Crystal Ball Brewing Company is a microbrewery located at 1612 West King Street in West York, Pennsylvania. After years of planning and months of construction, this production facility is now open.     Using the finest and freshest ingredients possible, combined with traditional brewing techniques and the latest technology, our intent will be to produce world-class beer. Our brewers love good beer and know its social potential for creating and sustaining a tasteful social experience. Every batch will be carefully crafted with passion, vision, and fun. Our brews range from traditional offerings to the more experimental, for adventurous drinkers. With a great product, and community engagement, we see in our future the potential to become the largest production brewer of hand-crafted beer in the region. And while we cannot predict everything, we can make one guarantee. CBBC will make the best possible beer, with offerings that will appeal to all who Seek the Finest.

name: Crystal Lake Brewing
description: We love craft beer, and Crystal Lake Brewing is all about the beer. We love drinking great beers, we love making them, and we can't wait to share them with you. Our goal is simple, to produce world-­class beers right here in Crystal Lake.    Starting this summer, you'll be able to enjoy Crystal Lake Brewing Co. beer at restaurants and bars throughout Illinois, but we'd also like you to come visit us in person in our on-­premises tap room. Here, you can sample our beers in an open, relaxed space, then sit back and enjoy a pint or two of your favorite, all while admiring the brewhouse.    The Crystal Lake Brewing Co. is a production brewery, and we're totally focused on producing top-­notch beers. We won’t be serving any food in the tap room, but you'll be welcome to bring it in with you or order delivery from one of the nearby eateries. From time to time, expect to see a food truck parked just outside the front door, where you can grab a casual bite.    The tap room will always be pouring our best known beers, but you'll always find "pilot" brews, too. These unique beers will be brewed in smaller quantities and will be available only here at the brewery. Something new will always be on tap.    Of course, brewery tours will be offered, too.    Look for "CLB" beer at your favorite tavern or restaurant this summer, or at a local summertime festival. Don’t forget to come on in and visit us in the tap room. We’ll have a pint waiting for you. Cheers!

name: Crystal Springs Brewing Co
description: We make good beer, plain and simple. If you are looking for unique, small batch beers painstakingly created under the watchful eyes and hands of our brew master, look no further. You have found something unique to pour into your favorite glass. Our brewery is named after the original Crystal Springs Brewing and Ice Company, founded in 1875 in Boulder, Colorado. We brew craft beer you must try. Each of our beers begin with a simple theme: to create memorable beers - ones that our customers will savor and want to share with close friends. Drinking great beer is our aspiration, making great beer is our passion.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Th: 4:00 PM - 9:00 PM  Fri: 3:00 PM - 9:00 PM   Sat: 1:00 PM - 8:00 PM  Sun:  11:00 AM - 6:00 PM

name: Cugino Brewing Company
description: Cugino Brewing Company closed operations in 2004

name: Culture Brewing Co.
description: We can all agree, it’s a great time to be a beer lover. There are more quality beers to enjoy than ever. More new flavors and interpretations of styles. And more people dedicating their lives to the craft of brewing. Culture Brewing Co began with their own long-time passion for beer. Culture’s three owners, John Niedernhofer (Owner), Steve Ragan (Owner/Brew Master) and Dennis Williams (Owner) began brewing together long ago. From their earliest brainstorms about taking things to the next level, the goal was always to create more than just great beer. Bringing their approachable style to the already rich community of the craft beer industry, they opened their brewery in February 2013.    Our modern and rustic microbrewery is the ideal showcase for our beer. The brewery is our tasting room, with everything you need and nothing you don’t. The tasting room features an inviting beer service counter, ample indoor and outdoor space for visitors with an ocean breeze. The tasting room’s 12-tap serving system (including Nitro) allows us to deliver a large variety of our crafted beers. The on-site Brewhouse is equipped with a 10 barrel Premier Stainless System including a boil kettle, mash tun, 5 fermenters and 3 brite/serving tanks. With our beers gaining fans every day, we couldn’t be more excited about what we’ll brew next, and who we’ll get to share it with.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 3:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Cumberland Brewery
description: Giving new meaning to the term microbrewery, Cumberland Brews may be one of the smallest eateries in town, with a half-dozen four-top tables and a short bar with nine stools making tight quarters of what used to be the White Mountain Creamery. (Techically, it's not a microbrewery but a brewpub - a restaurant that makes its own beer on the premises - but I'm not one to quibble in the face of a good pun.) It's usually packed, too, earning its crowds the old-fashioned way by providing very good food, friendly service, and the sine qua non for a brewpub: extremely high-quality hand-crafted artisan beers. Hand-crafted offerings are produced by Head Brewer Cameron Finnis.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	 4:00 pm - 2:00 am  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 2:00 am  Sun: 1:00 pm - 2:00 am

name: Custom Brewcrafters, Inc.
description: Custom BrewCrafters introduced to the market in 1997 an innovative micro-brewing concept in which they have partnered with dozens of local restaurant and tavern owners in offering unique signature craft-brews custom designed for each establishment.    In addition to adding this new dimension to the Western New York beer market, Custom BrewCrafters opened a tasting room and gift shop at the brewery in Honeoye Falls, where we introduce the public to the many unique custom brews as well as educate them on craft beer and microbrewing.
hoursOfOperation: Monday	12:00–8:00 pm  Tuesday	12:00–8:00 pm  Wednesday	12:00–8:00 pm  Thursday	12:00–8:00 pm  Friday	12:00–8:00 pm  Saturday	10:00 am – 6:00 pm  Sunday	12:00–6:00 pm

name: Cutters Brewing Company
description: Cutters Brewing Company is a start-up, small scale nanobrewery operated by Emma Inman, Chris Inman, Monte Speicher, & Amanda Speicher.

name: Cycle Brewing
description: Downtown Saint Pete's Craft Beer Brewery and Tasting Room.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 3:00 pm - 12:00 am  Fri - Sat: 3:00 pm - 3:00 am  Sun: 12:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Cypress Street Station / Abilene Brewing Co
D9 Brewing Company
description: Proudly serving Fanatical Ales in North Carolina since 2013.    D9 Brewing Company is a craft microbrewery located in North Carolina with the purpose of brewing and sharing outstanding beer that unites people. First envisioned in July 2009 over a pot of boiling wort, the founders believe every person, and beer, has a story and decided to start a brewery where both could be shared.    Our goal is to always keep our community (that's you) as our central ingredient (In a 'sit back, relax and have a beer' kind of way, not the creepy 'To Serve Man' way)!    D9's name is derived from the 9th Congressional District of North Carolina as a nod to the roots that we've grown by both living and working in the Charlotte area over the past decade.

name: Dad & Dude's Breweria
description: We are a small pizzaria/brewpub making fresh batches fresh food and ales each and every day
hoursOfOperation: Sun - Thurs: 11am - 10pm  Fri - Sat: 11am - 11pm

name: Dahlonega Brewing Co. / Carusos Italian Restaurant
Dale Bros. Brewery
description: Dale Bros is a craft brewery and tap room in Upland, CA. We brew the kind of beer we like to drink. Beer that’s smooth, balanced and that pairs up well with food. Turns out other people like to drink it, too. Sometimes, they even like it enough to give it a gold medal (or two.) We’re not brewing beer to put trophies on our mantels, but it’s nice to be appreciated.

name: Damascus Brewery
description: The Damascus Brewery is focused on providing high-quality beer and customer satisfaction - we will do everything we can to meet and exceed your expectations. With a variety of beer to choose from, we're sure you'll find a style and flavor that compliments your meal or activity.

name: Dangerous Man Brewing Company
description: Dangerous Man Brewing Company’s mission is to be a destination tap house brewery in Minneapolis, focusing on high-quality small-batch production beers. With ever-changing taps, we will be the hub for lovers of beer and those seeking everything from the traditional to the extreme in their glass.
hoursOfOperation: Friday: 3pm-Midnight  Saturday: Noon-Midnight

name: Daredevil Brewing Co
description: Daredevil Brewing Co. is an independent, central Indiana based craft brewery that was founded by two award winning craft brewers, Bill Ballinger and Michael Pearson, and a talented craft beer enthusiast, Shane Pearson, to bring their  flavorful interpretations of craft beer to market. We know from experience that brewing eclectic, aggressively fun beers is not for the timid. Fortunately, the only thing we like better than a challenge is drinking the end result.

name: Dark Horse Brewing Company
description: Humble beginnings gave way to lessons learned of brewing in the shadows of the residence hall; steering clear of the landlord and having your ass handed to you by the almighty dollar are now consumed by the glory bells of success and the daily grind - a dichotomy of sorts… Should a young madman have to bend and be Ned Beatty’d to sell and serve to please the public eye’s nerve endings from the very beginning? Not this time around.     A brewer slowly climbed from the lowest points of business life with a sore ass, as he ascended to a new level. Hark! The horse of the dark nature holds the scales where the wheat and barley feedeth, not taketh from the mouths of man. A non-filtered view of hard work, careful perseverance of expansion, sticking to what is believed to be the right way and the only way to stay true to high quality, and also, the vague understandings of possible humor; blurring his family’s, employees’ and customers’ drinking experience and vision between a no-bullshit approach to brewing big, outstanding beers and selling nonsensical imagery and haberdashery…Proven to the masses as a Darkhorse trademark for the man behind the reigns.     Can true patrons of quality, time and devotion deal with the inner workings of a mad-man’s psyche as he speaks of visions of smacking Umpa Lumpas with snow shovels, or allows the obscure drawings of lawn jarts and tinker toys to be hung on the walls of his establishment? They seem to…A madman’s passion for brewing comes out in strange ways indeed; where his employees and fellow brew house boys may know not how to deal with his tongue twisted ramblings and contortions of the face at first; where the same can definitely scare away newcomers.     True patrons know how to accept the obscure humor. Some have lent a hand in some way or another. They know what “pour to the line” means; they have been to every annual crawfish boil and some find the passion within themselves to put the Darkhorse name to skin…still they barely understand the immature drawings created in the brewery… True patrons know the hard work the brewers put in to create and keep the Darkhorse name in the lead.     Some things in life are easily read and some things keep you guessing. Should we take turns consuming garage sale items and vomiting them on the walls or should we follow the square, straight and narrow? Slip into the pub and look around. Go out and buy a six-pack, and read the holder the beer comes in. Read the back of your growler. When you’re done, you’ll either get it or you won’t. No matter, as you’re drinking some of the best fuckin’ beer made in the great state of Michigan. Period!

name: Darkside Fermentation
description: Come in and try some our great beer brewed in-house. A instant hit, we have many seasonal flavors to choose from.
hoursOfOperation: 7am-4pm Tuesday-Sunday & 6pm-10pm Thursday, Friday, and Saturday

name: Brewpub
description: Darwin Brewing Co. is a production brewery with a beer tasting room.  Co-owner and Brewmaster Jorge Rosabal is in charge of the brewing operation.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Tue: 5:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Wed - Thu: 5:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Fri: 5:00 pm - 1:00 am  Sat: 5:00 pm - 1:00 pm  Sun: 5:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Das Bierhaus
description: Das Bierhaus tap beer is brewed on premise in strict accordance with the Bavarian Reinheitsgebot of 1516 by our award winning Bavarian Braumeister.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	4:00 pm - 2:00 am  Fri - Sat:	11:00 am - 2:30 am  Sun:	11:00 am - 2:00 am

name: Davidson Brothers Restaurant & Brewery
description: "We’re not real fancy, we believe in great food, exceptional beer and having a good time. Honestly, it’s why we went into business. We’d never owned a restaurant and had no idea how to brew beer, but we were experienced beer tasters and knew plenty about going out to eat.  Granted, this isn’t the salesiest pitch, but we let the food, beer and atmosphere speak for themselves. We stick to the beer guarantee and greeting our guests."

name: Day Block Brewing
description: Day Block Brewing is a brewery-restaurant located in Downtown Minneapolis, Minnesota.  Their local beers are brewed in house using 100 percent locally sourced hops.  From IPAs to lagers and more, Day Block has a variety of unique brews to satisfy many tastes.

name: DC Brau Brewing Company
description: The fact that D.C. has become a world-class beer town is undeniable. The choices available to the local beer nerdery are staggering and ever expanding. The neighborhood corner stores continue to add microbrews to their stock and it seems that a dynamite draft selection is essential to any new bar that opens. Restaurants regularly hold beer dinners featuring multi-course food and beer pairings and for seven days in the spring, during DC Beer Week, the number of beer-themed events can make the head spin. At a handful of downtown brewpubs the beer enthusiast can sample a variety of house made brews. What D.C. has not had in over 60 years, however, is a brewery whose product is available in local stores and on tap outside of its site of production.
hoursOfOperation: *Hours are typically 1-4pm, Saturdays. Follow us on Facebook & Twitter for schedule changes.  Tours will be held at 1:30, 2:30, & 3:30.

name: De Garde Brewing
description: We are a small rural brewery specializing in many diverse styles of ales, but with a focus on spontaneous fermentations inspired by the European farmhouse traditions.
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  3:00pm - 7:00pm Fri:  3:00pm - 7:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 7:00pm Sun:  11:00am - 5:00pm

name: De La Vega's Pecan Grill and Brewery
De Steeg Brewing
description: De Steeg Brewing - A micro brewery in the Highlands providing quality craft beers to the Metro Denver beer enthusiasts.
hoursOfOperation: Thur: 4 - 11 PM  Fri: 4 - 11 PM  Sat: 2 - 11 PM  Sun: 2 - 8 PM

name: Declaration Brewing Company
description: Dedicated to constantly challenging what is possible in craft beer, Declaration Brewing Company will strive to write its own chapter in the celebrated history that humanity and beer share.  Through continual evolution of the status quo, Declaration Brewing Company aims to expand upon established craft beer culture, practices, and expectations.

name: Deep Ellum Brewing Company
description: A business is brewing in Deep Ellum, Texas... Dedicated to making extraordinary beers and supporting all things local. Drink the Deep!

name: Deep River Brewing Company
description: Deep River Brewing Co. is committed to using local Grains and Hops, and ingredients in our beers whenever possible. "beer geeks making beer for fellow beer geeks" is our mantra.
hoursOfOperation: Fridays:  4-8pm   Saturdays:  2-8pm (Tours)

name: Defiance Brewing Company
description: Defiance Brewing Company is a soon to be up and running production craft brewery (not a restaurant/brewpub) located in Hays, KS. The brewery will offer a wide variety of new and fresh beer that we have all been craving.

name: Defiant Brewing Company
description: Features a good range of beers, from the hoppy Muddy Creek to the malty Chocolate Porter.  Defiant also offers delicious bbq wings made on-site.

name: Deja Brew
description: Deja Brew is a Brew-on-Premise (BOP) that offers you the opportunity to brew your own beer or wine in a retail environment. We provide the recipes, ingredients, brewing kettles, and knowledge you’ll need for a rewarding brewing experience.  Best of all….. We clean up the mess!!  No matter if you have a beginners interest or are an experienced home brewer, Deja Brew has something for you. We offer over 65 beer and 12 wine recipes. If you already have a favorite recipe, we may be able to duplicate it. We use the finest ingredients so you’ll craft a high quality, chemical free beer or wine.  Read about our brewing process, look at our beer and wine offerings, then grab the directions, and we’ll see you soon!

name: Del Mar Stuft Pizza and Brewing
Del Norte Brewing Company
description: Del Norte is the only U.S. brewer specializing in authentic Mexican-style beers. Brewed locally in small batches with traditional ingredients, our beers capture the styles and flavor of the oldest brewing heritage in the Western Hemisphere.
hoursOfOperation: Fri:	3:30 pm	 - 6:30 pm  Sat - Sun: 3:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: Delafield Brewhaus
description: The Delafield Brewhaus features in-house brewed craft beers and original menu selections. We can accommodate up to 200 guests in our Banquet Facility. We are conveniently located between Milwaukee and Madison.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:	3:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Tue - Sat:	11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Sun:	9:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: Deluxe Brewing Company
description: Deluxe Brewing Company is a production brewery located along the Willamette River in Albany, Ore. Deluxe Brewing produces fine German-style lagers. Its lineup includes a Pre-Prohibition pilsner, Amber Lager and Schwarzbier and seasonals.   Come in and sample! Deluxe Brewing’s Tasting Room hours are Fridays 4 to 8 p.m. and Saturdays 12 to 6 p.m.  Deluxe Brewing is located in the Borden Building, 635 NE Water Ave. For more information on Deluxe Brewing visit www.deluxebrewing.com.

name: Camden Yards
description: In celebration of the ballpark’s 20th Anniversary season, Delaware North Companies Sportservice, the food, beverage and retail partner of the Baltimore Orioles, has partnered with beloved former Oriole Rick Dempsey to create Dempsey's Brew Pub & Restaurant.   The longtime catcher, a member of the Orioles Hall of Fame and 1983 World Series MVP, is also a member of the Orioles broadcast team and will make frequent appearances at Dempsey’s.   The full-service brew pub, with a décor featuring plenty of Rick Dempsey and Orioles memorabilia, accommodates 150 in the dining area, 100 at the bar,   and another 80 in outdoor seating on its Eutaw Street patio. We serve lunch and dinner seven days a week, year-round, featuring broad menus that are sure to hit every taste.   And then there’s the beer! Dempsey’s features more than 20 bottled beers, including 10 local and regional craft brews, as well as four distinct draft beers brewed onsite, all featuring baseball-themed names.  Please stop in and see us for lunch, dinner or to host a special celebration.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm

name: Denali Brewing Company
description: Denali Brewing Company is Talkeetna, Alaska's local craft brewery. In addition to serving the community of Talkeetna through our tasting room and sister establishment, Twister Creek Restaurant, our beers are on tap at an increasing number of killer bars and restaurants in and around the Mat-Su Valley and Anchorage, Alaska.    At Denali Brewing Company we use only the finest ingredients to handcraft the kinds of honest beers you like to drink.

name: Denizens Brewing Co
description: Denizens Brewing Co. is a craft brewery serving European-style lagers, American-style ales, Belgian-inspired beers, sour beers, and barrel-aged beers to both the craft beer aficionado and those new to high quality brews. We are located steps from the Metro in downtown Silver Spring and are opening in Summer 2014.

name: Denver Beer Company
description: Denver Beer Co. was born in our garages with a few batches of homebrew and a love for the craft of brewing. Serving only premium artisan ales and lagers, we utilize fresh ingredients and embrace both innovative and old world styles of beer. Similar to a farmer’s table, our beer selections change with the seasons. By brewing in small batches, we can ensure that a few old favorites are always on tap, but new goodies greet visitors each month.    Our brewery is founded on passion for high quality, flavorfully crafted beer and the belief that the best pints are those shared with good company. Drawing inspiration from beer gardens of Bavaria, we designed Denver Beer Co. to be a place where new and old friends can share a table and pint out of doors.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 3:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sun: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Denver Pearl Brewing Company
description: Located in the Platt Park neighborhood near the University of Denver, Denver Pearl plans to offer five flagship and five seasonal beers.  "We want to take old styles and put creative new twists on them."

name: Depot Deli and Lounge
description: Inspired by the everyday family cooking that we grew up with, you’ll feel at home while savoring a great meal in our casual and relaxed dining room in a restored Railroad Depot.  Experience our attentive service, Micro Brewed Beer, and friendly unique atmosphere; come see what makes us one of the most popular restaurants not only in Shenandoah, Iowa but also regionally.  Your headquarters for The Wabash Trace Nature Trail, Everly Brothers Memorabilia, local history and great food.  Established in 1983.

name: Der Blokken Brewery
description: Woman Owned. Woman Run. Woman Brewed.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:30 am - 11:00 pm  Sun: 11:30 am - 7:30 pm

name: Deschutes Brewery
description: Founded in 1988, Deschutes Brewery began as a brew pub in downtown Bend, Oregon and is known for such brands as Black Butte Porter, its flagship brew and the nation’s number one selling craft porter, and the popular Mirror Pond Pale Ale. In addition to its original Bend pub, this family and employee-owned brewery opened a second pub in Portland’s Pearl District in 2008. The company’s main brewing facility is located on the banks of the Deschutes River and is the nation's 6th largest independent craft brewery, distributing in 26 states and two provinces. Deschutes Brewery was named one of America’s Best Places to Work in 2013 by Outside Magazine.

name: Desert Eagle Brewing Company
description: Desert Eagle Brewing Company, the brainchild of brewmaster and co-owner Joe Campbell, was founded not only upon his passion for home brewing while in college, but also upon his German heritage and inherent knowledge of quality beer.     After perfecting the process of creating a great craft brew, this dream finally became a reality in 2011. Partnering with co-owner Jeff Bryant, the team became committed to creating great Craft Beers. Vowing to maintain the integrity of their product by using the best ingredients possible, they include whole cone hops in every step of the brewing process. Seizing the opportunity to participate in the downtown revival, which is slotted for light-rail expansion, Desert Eagle Brewing Company saw the opening of its taproom in October 2012 in Downtown Mesa – an important location of focus for the two Mesa residents.     Desert Eagle’s commitment to both quality, and its patrons, is a true testament of the team’s mission and dedication to serving great beer in an even greater community.

name: Desert Edge Pub and Brewery
description: The Scene – Whether you call it Desert Edge or the Pub, you only have to visit once to call it home away from home. In the last few years, it's become more family-friendly--kids are welcome--but college students and professionals are the main patrons. – – The Food – Known for its daily pasta salads and lunch menu that gets better after 2pm, the kitchen serves the usual pub sandwiches with fruit, pasta and salad sides as well as other traditional pub dishes. Customer favorites include the Szechwan chicken pasta salad (served on Tuesdays), nachos and the French onion…

name: Normal
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  11:00am - 10:00pm Tue:  11:00am - 10:00pm Wed:  11:00am - 10:00pm Thu:  11:00am - 10:00pm Fri:  11:00am - 11:00pm Sat:  11:00am - 11:00pm Sun:  10:00am - 9:00pm  Reservations, call-ahead seating and   walk-ins are accepted for Lunch or Dinner.     For parties of 6 or greater, please call us directly to make your reservation.

name: Champaign
