For parties of 6 or greater, please call us directly to make your reservation.

name: Detroit Beer Company
description: Opened in September 2003, the Detroit Beer Co. occupies the first two floors of the recently restored Hartz Building on Broadway in Downtown Detroit just steps from Comerica Park and Ford field making it the best spot for pre & post event. The historic setting, combined with state-of-the-art brewing technology and 21st century finishes provides a unique dining experience. Seating is available on both floors and can be reserved for special events.        The menu features a broad selection of eclectic American cuisine, all prepared with the freshest ingredients. From delectable appetizers, fresh salads, pizzas and pastas to delicious entrees and unique sandwiches, the menu has something for everyone and a kids menu is available

name: Device Brewing Company
description: Device Brewing Company is a small microbrewery in Sacramento, CA specializing in premium ales, stouts, and barleywines.

name: Devil's Canyon Brewing Company
description: Devil’s Canyon Brewing Company, located in the heart of the San Francisco bay area peninsula, produces award-winning, handcrafted beer and root beer centered on the most premium ingredients. Brewed in Belmont, and delivered fresh to 33 (and growing) counties throughout California.    The brewery’s name is derived from the original Spanish name for the City of Belmont. Prior to the 1780’s the canyon portion of Belmont and San Carlos was known as “la Canada del Diablo” or Devil’s Canyon. Since opening their doors in 2001, Devil’s Canyon Brewery has won over 28 awards for their craft beers and received the 2009 “People’s Choice” award at the San Francisco International Beer Festival.

name: Devils Backbone Brewing Company
description: 2012 GREAT AMERICAN BEER FESTIVAL SMALL BREWPUB and SMALL BREWPUB BREWER OF THE YEAR & 2010 WORLD BEER CUP CHAMPION BREWERY & SMALL BREWPUB, the award winning Basecamp Brewpub is situated in the majestic valley of the Blue Ridge Mountains with a lodge style atmosphere. We brew authentic craft beer in our brewhouse with a traditional German style brewing system and pour fresh brews daily from 16 taps in the pub area. Our menu specializes in oak wood -fired smoked dishes and local fare. We offer children their own special menu too!  Basecamp is open daily: 11:30pm serving lunch & dinner.

name: Devils Backbone Brewing Company - Outpost
hoursOfOperation: Wednesday & Thursday open 1pm - 7pm.  Friday & Saturday open 1pm - 8pm.  Sunday open 1pm - 6pm

name: Diamond Bear Brewing Company
description: Diamond Bear Brewing Company is Little Rock's first production brewery in over 15 years. Diamond Bear started brewing on September 21, 2000, and started distribution on October 17, 2000 with the Flying Saucer (Downtown River Market District) being the first establishment to carry our product. We currently distribute our beer throughout Arkansas and Mississippi. Our styles of beer are produced in the old time honored traditional methods of European brewers, using only two-row malted barley, hops, yeast and great Arkansas water. Being brewed locally gives the beer a great advantage in "freshness" while still capturing some of the worlds most famous styles of beer without the use of adjuncts or preservatives!    You may be wondering where our name came from. Diamond Bear is brewed in Arkansas which is the only state to have a diamond mine. This is where the first part of our name came from. As for the bear portion of Diamond Bear, Arkansas was once home to a large population of bears. In fact, during the pioneer days Arkansas was known as the "Bear State." Therefore, we combined the two to create a name that is distinctly Arkansan, Diamond Bear!
hoursOfOperation: Tuesday - Thursday 11am-9pm  Friday - Saturday 11am-10pm  Sunday - 11am-9pm  Monday - CLOSED

name: Diamond Knot Brewery & Alehouse
description: Diamond Knot Brewing has been handcrafting great NW ales since 1994!      With four convenient locations in Mukilteo, WA & Camano, WA we offer a unique dining experience along with our handcrafted beers.  Our original brewery & alehouse is located on the beautiful Puget Sound, and if you are looking to relax with the family, check out Diamond Knot Lincoln Ave for our family friendly calzone & pizza house.  At Lincoln Ave, you can enjoy a craft beer as your children can construct their own pizza right at the table.  If you are out exploring the islands, check out Diamond Knot Camano Lodge.  Or if you want to experience all the magic of craft beer, check out our Production Facility & Taproom.     Explore the Diamond Knot and experience all we have to offer.

name: Dick's Brewing Company
description: Dick Young started brewing as a home brewer in 1984 and sold homebrew supplies at his business, Northwest Sausage & Deli.  When he wasn’t busy handcrafting smoked summer sausage and pepperoni at the deli he was handcrafting small batches of beer.  Dick built from scratch a three barrel brew house (which we still use today as our pilot system) to start designing and creating recipes in the back of the deli. The beer was so popular among Dick’s friends that he soon found himself exceeding the annual production limit for homebrewers.  In 1992 Dick decided to make his hobby a business and started the application and permit process to create Dick’s Brewing Company.  After two years and many batches brewed, and many beers drank, Dick’s Brewing Company became a reality.    Dick quickly realized he would need more space for his growing passion and built a 2,100 square foot building adjacent to the deli.  He started with the three barrel system and would brew once a week yielding 6 kegs.  Initially he focused solely on three beers: Pale, Porter and Dick Danger.  Dick Danger Ale, is still our best selling beer to date.  When asked why he started the brewery Dick always answered, and I quote, “I started brewing beer for one reason, I was thirsty”.   And we are all so grateful he was.    The brewery was located behind the Deli on Prather Road from 1995 to 2008.  Over those 13 years the brewery grew from 200 bbls in sales in one state to over 3000 bbls in 6 states.   New uni tanks and bright tanks were added along with a brand new bottling line to keep up with demand, and Dicks creative passion for brewing also grew, starting with three recipes in 1994 to over twenty different styles in 2009.  Life was good and  Dick’s Beers were flying out the door.  In 2006 Dick set his sights even higher, and he started construction on a new brewing facility. After two long years of work  we moved into the brand new 18000 square foot brewing facility on Galvin Road in Centralia.    Dick wore many hats and he was so many things to so many people.  In 2009 we lost a brewmaster, a friend, a dad, a partner, a son, a teacher, a rebel, an electrician, a plumber, a carpenter, a craftsman, a joker, a complete and unique leader.  He will always be remembered and by doing so his vision and his dream will forever live on in every bottle or keg that gets shipped from the warehouse to someone that is thirsty.    Today, the Dick’s Brew Crew is led by Dick’s daughter, Julie Young.  With the new brewing facility producing 23 different styles and with plenty of room for growth, we feel that the sky is the limit when it comes to Dick’s legacy.  All of us here at Dick’s are proud to continue the dream that our founder started, and we are proud to have you all along for the ride.
hoursOfOperation: Fridays 3pm - 7pm

name: Dickersbach Brewing Company
description: A long long time ago, in a far away place called North Carolina it all started. My great friend, and then neighbor, Randy and I decided it was time to start brewing beer since we could not longer get our then favorite brew in the stores. Our first beer was aptly named "Girly Beer" and was light and refreshing.    From there the brews continued until we were out of storage space. Our paths separated, but we each continued brewing. My brother Mike, soon took to brewing also and has been an avid brewer for many years now.    Background experience comes from homebrewing, being head brewer at Hal and Mal's in Jackson, MS, and head brewer at Riverhorse, in Lambertville, NJ.

name: Dillon Dam Brewery
description: The Dillon Dam Brewery is the Largest Brewpub in the Colorado Rockies and one of the largest Brew-Pubs in the nation as well as one of the best family restaurants in Summit County, Colorado.    We serve signature, seasonal, session and big beers -- primarily ales and lagers -- and we brew over 1,700 barrels per year. WE have a 13-tap system. This makes us the 37th largest Brew-Pub in the nation (out of nearly 1,000). That's a lot of Dam Beer™.    We are an American-style restaurant serving lunch, dinner, and a kids menu. Our extensive menu has over 70 items to choose from. We serve the families of and visitors to Dillon, Silverthorne, Frisco, Keystone, Breckenridge and Copper Mountain.    We are also an easy stop-off for those traveling west to Vail, Steamboat Springs and Aspen or east to Denver. In fact we are a great stop for anyone traveling I-70.

name: Dirtbag Ales LLC
description: Dirtbag Ales was originally conceived amongst friends who had a love of great beer and a quest for fun.  We were brought together through our love of country, stayed together for the love of beer. Dirtbag Ales has tapped their curious imagination, combined blood oranges with a traditional kolsch recipe, and brought this crisp ale to new heights. For the refined tastes of the modern man.

name: Dirty Bucket Brewing Company
description: Dirty Bucket Brewing Co. started over exactly that...a dirty bucket. Brewing in the garage and pondering the idea of creating a place where we can share our beers and passion for creating them. After we took that leap of faith towards brewing as a profession we needed a name. Holding true to our "Home Brewing" roots the name Dirty Bucket Brewing Co. was tossed up and the more we thought about it the more we realized there truly was no other name that better describes our passion.    By creating smaller batches we are able to maintain an intimate level of craftsmanship and rotate different styles of beers more frequently giving our customers a wider range of beers to choose from
hoursOfOperation: Friday:  4:00pm - 9:00pm  Saturday:  12:00pm - 7:00pm  Sunday:  Closed

name: Dirty Hands Brewing Company
description: The road to the creation of Dirty Hands Brewing began during those halcyon days of college where Grant (UCLA) and Phil (University of Utah/University of Wyoming) started developing an appreciation for great beer. They first met during graduate school at the University of Minnesota where the fates would have it, they joined the same chemistry research group.  The guys spent many a night proving the adage of their PhD (piled higher & deeper) advisor, “The true test of running a scientific instrument is being able to operate it after a few beers.”  After graduation, Grant and Phil pursued different career paths, Grant went the academic route, while Phil initially started out in the chemical industry, but then wised up and conned people into hiring him as a beer then wine chemist.  After a few years of chasing the academic and corporate dollar, the boys wised up and decided to strike out on their own.  They landed in Vancouver, WA (which was the first Vancouver, by the way) and started up Dirty Hands Brewing Company.  From the start, their goal was to brew full flavored beers that were both balanced and highly drinkable.  So, they set to work, getting their hands dirty renovating the space that was the old Columbian Newspaper building to a working brewery and taproom.  Speaking of the newspaper, that’s how the name came about.  Think of reading a hard copy paper and how your hands would look from getting newsprint all over them!  The brewery also strives to honor the working past of Vancouver and Washington state by using locally sourced ingredients in the beer and food that we serve.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  12:00pm - 10:00pm Tue:  12:00pm - 10:00pm Wed:  12:00pm - 10:00pm Thu:  12:00pm - 10:00pm Fri:  12:00pm - 10:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 10:00pm  Closed on Sundays.

name: Discretion Brewing
description: Discretion Brewing is a family-owned brewery dedicated to producing handcrafted organic beer of consistent high quality. We are known for quality and elegance in both our products and our presence in the community. Our name speaks to our desire to be wise and full of care as we go about our business. We encourage the notion that we all have the freedom to decide what we consume.     We have defined "Discretion" with the words, "wisdom," "wit," and kindness." These are qualities that we hope will define our interactions with each other, our customers, and our community.     Choose Goodness. Have Discretion.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:30 am - 9:00 pm

name: Dixon's Downtown Grill
description: (No longer brewing)

name: Do Can
description: The Do Can Brewery in Lowell, MA was founded to provide great beer and an even better beer drinking experience. With so many great beers being brewed throughout the country it wasn't enough to make another clone of this scripted style or that trendy brew.

name: Dock Street Brewery
description: Founded in 1985, Dock Street Brewing Co. was the first microbrewery in Philadelphia and one of the first in the country.  Today, Dock Street is a small artisanal brewery that finds its home in a magnificent historic firehouse on the corner of 50th and Baltimore Ave., in a progressive, eclectic and counter-culture neighborhood that reflects Dock Street's philosophy.  Dock Street has a rich brewing history, a reputation for exceptional quality, innovation and brewing distinctive beers.  Dock Street continues to experiment and push the boundaries of the movement it helped build.

name: Dodging Duck Brewhaus
description: The Dodging Duck Brewhaus is located in Boerne, Texas, in the Texas Hill Country. We have an eclectic menu of international and local favorites, from Thai Lettuce Wraps to Chimichurri Grilled Beef Tenderloin to Bratwurst & Sauerkraut. Best of all, we brew great beer! We've already won three gold and three silver medals at the World Beer Championships!

name: Dogfish Head Craft Brewery
description: Dogfish Head Craft Brewery makes off-centered ales for off-centered people.  Since 1995, Dogfish has brewed with nonstandard ingredients such as raisins, chicory, maple syrup, and grapes, changing the way people think about beer.  Dogfish believes beer can have as much flavor, complexity, diversity, food-compatibility and ageability as the world's finest wines.  To discover your favorite off-centered ale, visit www.dogfish.com

name: Dogfish Head Brewings & Eats
hoursOfOperation: Open 7 Days, Year Round! Open at noon for LUNCH everyday, & we serve DINNER every night!

name: DFH Alehouse, Gaithersburg
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Wednesday: 11:30am to 11:00pm  Thursday: 11:00am to 11:00pm  Friday-Saturday: 11:00am to 12:00am  Sunday: 11:30am to 10:00pm

name: DFH Alehouse, Falls Church
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Thursday: 11:30am to 11:00pm  Friday - Saturday: 11:30am to 12:00am  Sunday: 11:30 am to 10:00pm

name: DFH Alehouse, Fairfax
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Thursday: 11:30am to 11:00pm  Friday - Saturday: 11:30am to 12:00am  Sunday: 11:30am to 10:00pm

name: Dolores River Brewery
description: Dolores River Brewery was founded under the premise that everybody needs somebody, and every community should have a comfortable place to hang out with that somebody!  We strive everyday to create that place.  A place where you can meet old friends and new ones over a beer, and some good food.  A place where you can kick your shoes off and let your hair down, a place where you can experience joy and laughter to occasional live music, and a place where no one is the fool, because everyone is!

name: Doodle Brewing Company
description: The Doodle Brewing Company was started by Nick Vaughn in 2008. Nick graduated from the University of Missouri-Columbia with a degree in Chemical Engineering. After graduation, Nick got a call from the Harpoon Brewery in Boston and they were willing to give him a shot. While he was working out east, he enjoyed the superb beer culture and variety of beers available in New England. But he knew that he would one day return to Missouri. Finally, after three years, probably too many beers, and the addition of his son, Nick finally got his chance to come back to Missouri. He worked at a small brewpub in Kansas City called The 75th Street Brewery where he was able to experiment with many different beer styles and brewing techniques. Again after a few years, Nick grew restless. While working at a brewpub was fun and enjoyable, it just had too many other distractions from his true passions... Brewing beer, drinking beer and spreading the word about craft beer.  So he started the Doodle Brewing Company with every intention of brewing beers and beer styles that explore the boundries of flavor. He's probably sitting in front of his brewhouse right now with a beer enjoying what he's doing because he's making beer for you.

name: Doomsday Brewing Company
description: Doomsday Brewing Company is a premiere small batch craft brewery located in Vancouver, WA. We want to bring the beer we love to everyone. We make small batches of quality beer with an emphasis on local ingredients. Malt from the oldest malting company in the western United States, Great Western Malting Co, in Vancouver, WA. Hops locally grown in Yakima, WA from Hopunion and yeast from Wyeast Laboratories Inc in Odell, OR.

name: Door County Brewing Co.
description: Door County Brewing Company is inspired by our surrounding; our friends, our families, our landscape. Our mission is to create beers that lead to a gathering of community and friends where ever you are. We promise to create only the best tasting, thought provoking, carefully sourced, eco conscience beers that are constantly pushing the edge of imagination and senses.    What you will find in our beers is music, food, friends, family, travel, trees, soils and flowers—not just ingredients.

name: Dos Desperados Brewery
description: Dos Desperados Viven: We Will Live, We Will Enjoy Life

name: Dostal Alley Brewpub & Casino
description: Dostal Alley - A Brewpub and Casino, serving the best Pizza in the county for over 18 years. Now open 24/7 Never closing!! A family owned and operated business located in the heart of Central City's Historic Main Street.

name: Double Barley Brewing Company
description: Hand-crafted brews in Johnston County, NC
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Fri: 4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat: 1:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sun: 1:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Double Dizzy Brewery
description: We started with a man and his dream. Our founder, Leigh loved sampling beers but felt that something was missing. After some encouragement from his friends, and a loving and understanding wife, he decided to start making his own. As it turned out, he was a natural Brewmaster. That was 3 years ago.     Today, the brewery has grown from a single pot on a stove, to a three vessel BCS system and continues to expand.     ?At Double Dizzy we’re passionate about making beer and drinking beer!

name: Double Horn Brewing Company
description: Double Horn Brewing is a family-friendly restaurant serving lunch, dinner and a kid's menu. Double Horn is also the only brewery in Burnet County.
hoursOfOperation: Mon: 4:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Tue - Thu: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: Double Mountain Brewery
description: Matt Swihart and Charlie Devereux founded Double Mountain in 2007 with a clear mission: make great beer for craft beer fans. Ours is a "brewers' brewery", with an uncompromising focus on beer quality.     From the beginning, our goal was to make beers that we liked to drink. All of our beers are served up unfiltered and long-aged, to deliver maximum flavor and character. The beers can be very complex and assertive, but with the ultimate goal of proper balance. We aim to satisfy both the hardcore aficionados and the more casual craft beer fan, all in the same glass.     In June of 2013, Matt purchased Charlie's shares of Double Mountain, vowing to continue the good work the two partners created.

name: Double Take Brewing Company
description: Take a sip and do a Double Take!  This premium craft beer is sure to grab your attention and leave you wanting more.  Crafted with finesse and brought to you in style, Double Take beer flirts with balanced hops and malts to keep your palate aroused.    With just one taste, you'll know it's a head snapper!

name: Doubleheart Brewing
description: Doubleheart evokes the love of all things that come in pairs in our life, Tara and I, our two dogs Jake and Shay and our love of both Chicago and Harbor Springs. Doubleheart’s beers are a reflection of these dualities.

name: Down Easy Brewing
description: There are few enemies on a porch swing, and there are no strangers in a bar. Slide up with a few friends because good beer goes Down Easy!

name: Downeast Cider House
description: Downeast Cider House was founded by Ross Brockman and Tyler Mosher during their senior year of college. Through their travels abroad, they took notice of the large presence of hard cider in bars, restaurants, and liquor stores. Upon evaluating the disappointing landscape of hard cider in the United States, Ross and Tyler have made it their goal to build New England's first and largest craft hard cider company, and restore hard cider to its rightful place in American culture.    Downeast Cider House currently produces one type of cider, Original Blend. The Original Blend is made from freshly pressed Maine apples because we believe in making the best product we possibly can, while also supporting local agriculture. We use Red Delicious, McIntosh, Cortland, and Gala apples in our cider. The Original Blend, currently packaged in kegs, is distributed through Pine State Trading Company (Northern Maine), Nappi Distributors.(Portland and Southern Maine), L. Knife & Sons (South Shore Mass), Seaboard Products (North Shore Mass), and Craft Brewers Guild (Mass minus north and south shores)

name: Doylestown Brewing Co
description: Doylestown Brewing Company at first wanted to brew a specialty beer for a event which is held every year by the Doylestown Porch Society called Rib Feast. But soon we realized that the Doylestown bars, pubs and restaurants needed a local flavor and style they could call their own.    DBC opened its corporate office on Union St right here in downtown Doylestown and it soon became clear and obvious choice for the name of our Flagship IPA, Union St IPA.     DBC is making the finest craft beers, and we plan on putting a brand and style that is a bit different than most. With flavors like Fountain House Light, R5 Lager and Union St you are sure to find a style and flavor that you will think has been specially brewed for you

name: Draai Laag Brewing Company
description: Traditionally, all goods were made or sold locally.  Butchers, bakers, farmers and even brewers, made their products for local consumption.    Founded in 2009, Draai Laag began as a way to introduce beer with creative flavors into the market, offering a bit of variety in a world of Pilsners, Pales Ales and Porters.    Here at Draai Laag we use old world methods, such as bottle conditioning by aging our ales on lees.  We brew in small batches and use several strains of yeast to produce our beers.   The drinker may notice slight nuances from batch to batch.  But, you will find that all our ales are aged and, just like a fine wine, can be laid down for extended periods.   This results in a unique drinking experience each time a bottle is opened.    Here at Draai Laag we like to cater to those that want something respectful of tradition, but ultimately different.  Those who are not satisfied drinking the norm.  Most importantly, we get our biggest enjoyment and fulfillment not from profit, but from your smile after the first sip.    This company was built on the dream of doing what we love and following our passion.  For those who understand us, we thank you and hope you enjoy what we have to contribute.

name: Draft Line Brewing
description: Draft Line Brewing Co. was founded by Scott Palmieri and Scott Wood.     Sharing a passion for great beer, we began like most home-brewers several years ago brewing five gallon increments in the Palmieri family kitchen. Soon enough we realized that we needed to make a lot more beer. The home-brew setup morphed into 40 gallon increments...     Once the operation began to resemble a nano-brewey we decided to forge ahead with creating a microbrewery in the heart of North Carolina.     We like getting friends together and having a great time. Let us share our vision for what a great beer can be -- stop by our taproom in historic Fuquay-Varina, NC, now open!
hoursOfOperation: Wed-Thurs: 4PM-10PM,   Fri: 4PM-11PM,  Sat: Noon-11PM,   Sun: 1PM-8PM

name: Dragonmead Microbrewery
description: We strive to offer 35-45 different styles of beer on tap in our pub, including nitrogen-dispensed beers and two cask ales. We source all of our ingredients for each beer style from the country of origin. Our draft and bottle distribution market includes the entire state of Michigan. Final Absolution (Belgian Style Trippel) is our flagship and our most award winning beer. Our brew house is a three barrel system from Heavy Duty Products in Ontario, Canada. Last year we produced 2,400 barrels of beer. We also serve a small selection of meads and wines in our pub.  In November of 2013 we installed a brand new 20 barrel brew house fabricated by Craftwerk located in Michigan.  This new system will help us meet the growing demand in our state.

name: Dragoon Brewing Company
description: Dragoon Brewing Company was founded with a simple goal in mind: to increase the quantity and quality of local beer in the Arizona market. To that end, we’ll stay true to the spirit which spawned this goal — the idea that in sharing a creative endeavor with another person, you can’t help but share a bit of yourself. For DBC, that creative endeavor is craft beer, and we’re proud of the passion, integrity, and soul that we pour into every pint.    It almost goes without saying: we’re about good beer first and foremost. But there’s more to it than that. Our vision for this brewery includes the community. We aren’t setting out to compete head to head with the biggest breweries around, we’re here to produce beer that Tucson can be proud of.
hoursOfOperation: Our taproom is on site and open for tastings and tours. We don’t serve food, but we usually have a food truck parked outside, and you’re more than welcome to bring anything your heart desires.    Hours:  Wednesday (4-8 pm)  Thursday (4-8 pm)  Friday (3-9 pm)  Saturday (2-8 pm)

name: Drake's Brewing Company
description: Drake’s Brewing Company is an urban craft brewery operating in San Leandro, California since 1989. Drake’s brewers have set the standard for West Coast Style ales with their unflinching dedication to brewing clean, high-quality, innovative, and often unapologetically hoppy beers.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Thu: 3:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: Draper Brewing
description: Welcome to Draper Brewing. Draper started  in 2010 located in Tenmile, Oregon nestled between the wineries of the beautiful Umpqua Valley.    The original Draper brews were done on a one barrel system which has since been replaced by a 5 bbl system. All current brews are fermented in an open primary fermentor in old world tradition. All bottled beers are naturally carbonated by means of a secondary fermentation in the bottle. Every bottle is  sanitized, filled, capped and  packaged by hand.

name: Draught House Pub & Brewery
description: We are an onsite brewpub that brews great ales and lagers.  If your looking for a fun, friendly casino with great award winning craft beer Dostal Alley is your place.    Ask about special parties. We have become famous for our birthday parties. We host many special holiday events. Watch our face book page to get the latest news.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	5:00 pm - 2:00 am  Fri - Sun:	1:00 pm - 2:00 am

name: Drop In Brewing
description: We'll be producing a flagship beer that a lot of people will love to drink. We'll also be producing a range of beers that a few people will enjoy sipping.    We operate a tasting room for beer samples and growler fills. You can stand in one place and see the whole brewery but if the brewer is there the door is always open
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat:	11:00 am - 7:00 pm  Sun:	12:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Drunk Monkey Brew Werks
description: Drunk Monkey Brew Werks is dedicated to making hand crafted artisan beers for the central Pennsylvania area.    We are a 'nano' brewery that is founded on the idea of bringing beers of all styles to the market as dictated by our customers.  We brew what our followers want and what we like. There is no style of beer we won't attempt, but we will always have our standards on hand. We take pride in being a local business and being eco-responsible. This is all about enjoying life and having fun.

name: Druthers Brewing Company
description: Life’s all about choices.  Given our Druthers, we (Chris, a lawyer; George, a bio-chemist; and Brian, a financial analyst) are choosing to brew choice beer for good-humored, freethinkers that would rather do it their own way....Rewarding those that put their life, work, and convictions to the test. Given your Druthers, what will you choose?
hoursOfOperation: Open 7 days a week  Lunch - 12:00 p.m. to 3:00 p.m.  Dinner - 5:00 p.m. to 10:00 p.m.  Beer and Cocktails - 12:00 p.m. to 12:00 a.m.

name: Dry County Brewing Company
description: Hand tossed pizza and hand crafted beer. What could be finer?
hoursOfOperation: Wed/Thur/Sun  4-9 pm    Fri/Sat  Noon-9 pm

name: Dry Dock Brewing Company
description: Dry Dock Brewing Company was founded in October 2005 when owners Michelle and Kevin DeLange leased an 800 sq ft space next to their homebrew shop, The Brew Hut, in Aurora, CO. The tiny brewery quickly got people’s attention the next spring when Dry Dock won Gold at the 2006 World Beer Cup for its HMS Victory ESB (now Amber Ale).    Expanding in 2009 and again in 2011, Dry Dock currently runs a 7 BBL brewhouse including a tasting room with 180 seats and 16 taps at its original location on Hampden Ave. in Aurora.    In January 2013, Dry Dock opened a production facility with a 40 BBL brewhouse and canning line in a second, 30,000 sq ft facility, to produce beers for distribution throughout Colorado. Dry Dock’s production has grown from 300 barrels in 2006 to 3,200 in 2012. With the new facility, they will produce about 11,000 BBL in 2013. They have also continued to win medals at both the World Beer Cup and the Great American Beer Festival, including Small Brewing Company of the Year in 2009.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 12:00 am - 9:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 am - 11:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: Brewery
description: Wondering about us? That’s very flattering.    DryHop Brewers is a brewery and kitchen. The craft beer we brew is only available here in Lakeview, Chicago. Yes, we do tend to focus on hop-centric ales. Everything that comes out of our kitchen is prepared from scratch and, when the seasons allow, is locally sourced.    Hanging out at DryHop is all about being in a brewery; feeling connected to the craft brewing and culinary worlds; and most importantly, feeling a personal connection to a community of craftsman. You’ll soon discover the absolute perfection of drinking a craft beer at the source.
hoursOfOperation: Sun - Fri 11am – 2am / Sat 11am – 3am

name: Dubina Brewing Co.
description: Jared and Jim Dubina are a father and son team that had the dream to start their own brewery after a trip to Prague, Czech Republic. Their family heritage is from the Czech Republic and immigrated to the United States in the early 1900's. Jim's family settled in Chicago, IL but moved to Phoenix, AZ in the 60's. Jim's grandfather owned five taverns in Chicago and his father owned one in Phoenix off Indian School rd. You could say that beer runs in our family blood.    Tradition is important to the Dubina's. While Jared has a fun and creative side, the Dubina Brewing team feel that staying traditional and incorporating the worlds beer history in their beer is just as important as creating new brews. We plan on bringing a year round lager to our list of beers on tap while also enjoying may other great beer like IPA's, stouts, ales and porters.

name: Dubrue
description: Duluth is an old industrial city and a thriving tourist destination. A city that used to boast 3 major production breweries among its ore docks, wheat granaries, and timber barons is now home to at least 5 microbreweries and brewpubs. Maybe it’s the water – fresh, cold, and right outside our door.       Dubrue is building on this rich and local brewing history with a 15 bbl system located in the heart of downtown Duluth. And we’re brewing in the established tradition: start with great ingredients – fresh water, barley, and hops – and end with a satisfying brew. Our Duluth roots, combined with west-coast training and 10 years of brewing and building recipes, help us focus on consistency in our flagship beers: an irresistibly drinkable Pub Ale, and a hoppy and inspired India Black Ale.

name: Bel Air
description: At DuClaw Brewing Company, we are very proud of our beers. Our beers have received their fair share of recognition over the years, but even though we put quality first, fun is never far behind ... just look at the names of our beers. How do we come up with them? All we have to say is that there is a whole lot of creativity in those vats of beer just dying to come out, and we never stop till we get it right.
hoursOfOperation: Sun & Mon	:   Dining Room: 11:00am - 10:00pm Pub:11:00am - 12:00am     Tue - Thu:  Dining Room: 11:00am - 10:00pm  pub: 11:00am - 2:00am    Fri & Sat:  Dinning Room: 11:00am - 11pm  Pub: 11:00am - 2:00am   	   We serve lite fare for one hour after the dining room closes each night.

name: Arundel Mills
hoursOfOperation: Sun & Mon:  Dining Room: 11:00am - 10:00pm   Pub: 11:00am - 12:00am   	   Tue - Thu:  Dining Room: 11:00am - 10:00pm  Pub: 11:00am - 2:00am   	   Fri & Sat:  Dining Room: 11:00am - 12:00am  Pub: 11:00am - 2:00am    We serve lite fare for one hour after the dining room closes each night.    ** No lite fare on Fri & Sat nights

name: Bowie Town Center
hoursOfOperation: Sun & Mon:  Dining Room: 11:00am - 10:00pm   Pub: 11:00am - 12:00am   	   Tue - Thu:  Dining Room: 11:00am - 10:00pm  Pub: 11:00am - 2:00am   	   Fri & Sat	   Dining Room: 11:00am - 12:00am  Pub: 11:00am - 2:00am   	   We serve lite fare for one hour after the dining room closes each night.    ** No lite fare on Fri & Sat nights

name: BWI Airport
hoursOfOperation: Sun -Sat: 7:00am - 10:00pm

name: Due South Brewing Company
description: Due South is a distributing brewery with beer in bars & restaurants from Orlando to Key West FL. The brewery taproom is a great place to watch the latest batch getting brewed, order a pint, or pick up a growler to go. We cannot serve food, but we do encourage people to bring in take out or order delivery to the taproom. We also have food trucks onsite sometimes too. We're located in the warehouse between Boynton Marble and Sherwin Williams. Park and enter in the back.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu:	12:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat:	12:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Sun:	12:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Dukbone Brewing Co.
description: Dukbone Brewing was founded with a love for craft beer and a whole lot of ambition to bring more quality brews and excitement to the Charlotte, NC beer scene. This brewery has an "everything is game" approach and will brew anything and everything at least once. We aim to be experimental and push the limits of brewing. The brewery will feature an onsite taproom, brewery tours, and special events. Our goal is to produce high quality hand crafted ales, while giving the community a brewery they can be proud of. Currently, we are looking for space in the Plaza Midwood community. We hope to be able to open our doors to the world in late 2013 and we can hardly wait until then!
hoursOfOperation: Sunday 12.00pm-6.00pm  Monday 4.00pm-9.00pm  Tuesday 4.00pm-9.00pm  Wednesday 4.00pm-9.00pm  Thursday 4.00pm-9.00pm  Friday 5.00pm-10.00pm  Saturday 12.00pm-10.00pm

name: Dunedin Brewery
description: As the oldest microbrewery in Florida, we are committed to two great challenges: satisfying our thirst for a well-crafted brew and fulfilling the need to contribute to a strong, vibrant community. Dunedin Brewery is founded on values that make these goals a reality; like yourself, we value the integrity to stand for a cause, the stability gained from working hard, and the experience of connecting with good people—our dedicated staff of beer enthusiasts or our loyal guests. There’s plenty of things to do in Florida- even plenty of things to do in Tampa Bay, but we strive to be more than just a place and more than just a beer; we strive to meet the challenge of creating an amazing city and an amazing craft brew. Sláinte!

name: Duneland Brewhouse Pub and Restaurant
description: (No longer brewing)

name: Dunsmuir Brewery Works
description: Micro Brewery, Restaurant, and Pub. Serving hand crafted ales and fine food using the freshest ingredients the kitchen is open from 11 am to 9pm but we keep serving until everyone has had dinner.    Come in and enjoy our delicious food and drinks.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Sun:	11:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: Duo Brewing
hoursOfOperation: Nano-brewery with no tap room. Tours and growler fills by appointment only. Tap locations on our website.

name: Durango Brewing Company
description: Durango Brewing Company is the third oldest microbrewery in Colorado. Brewing since 1990, our heritage dates to 1886 when Durango Beer and Ice Company became Durango Brewing Company. Our beers are hand crafted using the finest barley, hops, and yeast along with water born high in the San Juan Mountains of Southwest Colorado.    Presently our beers include Durango Amber Ale, Durango Dark Lager, Durango Wheat Beer, and Durango Golden Ale. We also brew Derail Ale, 2007 and 2008 Gold Medal Winner at the Great American Beer Festival (Other Strong Beer Category), and various seasonal beers. Seasonal selections include Blueberry Wheat, Durango Pale Ale, Durango Winter Ale, and 2009 GABF Gold Medal Winner - Colorfest, our fall seasonal.    In November 2007, we added our new Tap Room which has features inspired by the Narrow Gauge Railroad and the history of our town. The Tap Room is open seven days a week for all to relax and enjoy the Flavor of Durango. Stop by and try a sample or enjoy a fresh pint of any of our award winning beers. Our unique growlers are always available for carry out along with all our packaged products.

name: Dust Bowl Brewing Company
description: Welcome to Dust Bowl Brewing Company located in Turlock, Ca. We are a small brewing company in the Central Valley of California. Our size allows us to have a very personal and passionate connection to each of our beers. We are continuously testing new flavors and styles to develop our selection of beers. Our goal is to help create a thriving beer culture in the Central Valley.    Our company is a tribute to the strong-willed, gritty people of the Dust Bowl and Great Depression era. Inspired by the families who came west in search of a new start as well as those who stayed behind to weather the storm. This is great beer born of hard times. Storm’s comin’!

name: Duvall Springs Brewing
description: Duvall Springs Brewing is Duvall, WA. first brewery! Deep in the woods of Duvall, a secret shed is producing some of the heartiest and unique beers, using local Washington State products.    Started by three friends with a passion for all things beer, we hope to be in a fine establishment near you as soon as possible.
hoursOfOperation: We would love to have you all out to raise a pint, but unfortunately the brewery is a little too hard to get to and for now we are keeping it closed for tastings.    The road is a little bit too steep and narrow for traffic and would probably be a bit worse after a few of our strong beers. But there’s nothing to fear! Our beer is always on tap now at the Duvall Tavern. You’ll find our Burn Ban Porter year round there as well as a rotating tap of our seasonals.

name: The Duvall Tavern
hoursOfOperation: Open Daily 11am – Close

name: DuVig Brewing Company
description: DuVig Brewing Company opened May 17th. Onsite, we offer tastings and tours, sell growlers to the public, and supply our beer to CT restaurants and bars.

name: Eagle Creek Brewing Company
description: Eagle Creek Brewing Company is the first production brewery in Statesboro, GA. You can visit us @ eaglecreekbrewingco.com

name: Eagle Rock Brewery
description: As the first brewery with operations based in Los Angeles in over 60 years, we're dedicated to the production of unique artisanal beers using the best ingredients to promote the ongoing development of the beer community in Los Angeles.    Our microbrewery is attached to our public tap-room, where fellow beer lovers can gather to relax, refresh, and enjoy our unique beers. As we do not serve food, we encourage patrons to bring your own food or make a visit to the local food trucks/vendors that we have outside. Guests visiting our taproom need to be *21 and over to enter - no exceptions.
hoursOfOperation: Wednesday–Saturday 4-10pm  Sunday 12-6pm

name: EagleMonk Pub and Brewery
description: EagleMonk Pub and Brewery features craft beer, wine, soda and pizza. We also make our own Pizzas, Paninis, and Salads!
hoursOfOperation: Tuesday thru Thursday: 3PM - 10PM  Friday and Saturday: Noon - Midnight  Sunday: Noon - 7PM

name: Earth Bread + Brewery
description: Earth Bread + Brewery is an earth-friendly place that puts respect for the environment and the comfort of our guests above all else.  From the green-minded details of our build out, to our choice of vendors and the way we treat our colleagues, you will find Earth an enticing place to visit.  We support local agriculture, local breweries and small producers from around the world.

name: East Coast Beer Company
description: Established in 2007, Point Pleasant, New Jersey based East Coast Beer Co. (ECBC) was founded by passionate individuals with a belief that the great American traditions of creativity, diversity, and accessibility apply equally to building a great beer company. Pouring onto the scene in Summer 2010, East Coast Beer Co. will release its first Classic American Pilsner (CAP) – Beach Haus, whic...See More

name: East End Brewing Company
description: If you don’t already know, let me say right up front that we are a microbrewery in the true sense of the word, and not a brewpub. We leave the serving to the experts at the fine establishments who pour our brews around town. So please, don’t take it personally if we don’t ask you to come on over for a beer. It’s not you, or that shirt you’re wearing that puts us off. It’s because there’s really no place inside our brewery for you to sit down, have a sandwich and enjoy a fresh pint of tasty brew – though, I personally have been known to do this very thing from time to time. When you have your own brewery, maybe you can do this too.      That said, for those that want to get a closer look, you can always come out during our "Growler Hours" . We can show you around the place a bit, and you can even take some beer home with you. Here's a map to help you find the place.

name: Eastern Shore Brewing Co
description: Eastern Shore Brewing opened it's doors September of 2008 by owners Adrian and Lori Moritz.  Both had an entrepanerial passion, but never thought of a microbrewery as their business.  "The decision was made for us.  Make a business out of something you love to do and you will never work another day in your life" the couple states.  A lot of hard work and a love for good beer motivates the business.   We decided to open Eastern Shore Brewing after talking with friends from St. Michael's Winery, and were told that the town was in need of a microbrewery.  After some discussion (less than you may think), we agreed and were on our way.  With some trials along the way in year one, year two proved to be the pinicle of change.  An increase in brewery size promoted an increase of staff.  Randall Marquis came on board as brewmaster in March of 2009 and has made his presence known.  An undergratudate of Franklin Marshall College, and a brewing certificate holder from UC Davis, Randy is a large portion of the success of Eastern Shore Brewing.  Three beers took home medals in the Maryland Govenor's cup competition (Bronze for Lighthause Golden Ale, Silver for the Duck Duck Goose Porter and a Silver for the St.ichael's Amber ALe) on October 9th.  And although happy with the medals, Eastern Shore Brewing's goals are to continue to grow the busines and improve their products.  Distribution ranges from Cambridge to Kent Island on the Eastern Shore of Maryland, and recently moved into Ellicott City, Maryland.  A new fermenter will be arriving shortly after the new year, which will increase capacity even further.  There is more to come....
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Friday 12 till 5 PM  Saturday 12 till 7 PM  Sunday 12 till 5 PM

name: Eastwood Brewing Company
description: Eastwood Brewing Company, formerly Double Barrel Brewing Company, is a family owned nano brewery located in the Eastwood neighborhood of Syracuse, New York. Using a one barrel brew system, owner Pete Kirkgasser is able to create a unique variety of specialized craft brews. Pete's beers are only available locally at the Eastwood Brewing Company location. Customers are able to visit our tasting room and purchase beer in growlers seven days a week.    With a $3 tasting fee, patrons will receive 8 samples of fresh, craft beer. Growler fill prices vary depending on style and growler size. 64 or 32 ounce growlers, pint glasses and other merchandise is available also.    Cheers, and thanks for the support!
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  4:00pm - 7:00pm Tue:  4:00pm - 7:00pm Wed:  4:00pm - 7:00pm Thu:  4:00pm - 7:00pm Fri:  2:00pm - 7:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 7:00pm Sun:  12:00pm - 4:00pm

name: Echo Brewing Company
description: Echo Brewing Company is a small family run brewery nestled between the towns of Firestone and Frederick in the heart of Colorado’s Carbon Valley.  Founded by twin brothers who have a passion for brewing the best beer possible.  Homebrewers of eight plus years they keep their brewing concept at Echo similar to their homebrewing history: brew one fine beer followed by another while sharing them with the local community.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 2:30 pm - 9:00 pm  Fri: 2:30 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 8:00 pm

name: Ecliptic Brewing
description: Over the coming months, John’s new space on N. Cook St. near Fremont and Mississippi will be transformed into John’s vision of a destination restaurant and brewery. His goal is to push the limits of creativity in the brewhouse, and create a sense of place in both the restaurant and the beer he builds.     John’s background is one steeped in Oregon’s rich history in craft brewing. He spent his first two years, from 1986-1988, as a brewer at McMenamins’ breweries; his next four were at Deschutes, where he created the recipes for Mirror Pond, Black Butte Porter and Obsidian Stout; and John spent the next 20 years of his illustrious career as a brewmaster at Full Sail. He is now starting the next chapter with the creation of Ecliptic Brewing.

name: Eddyline Restaurant and Brewing Company
description: Eddyline Brewery has been brewing in the heart of Collegiate Peaks in Buena Vista, Colorado since 2009.    All beer are brewed with inspiration from our wild surroundings. Crank Yanker IPA is the best beer for cruising single track all over the valley. River Runners Pale Ale is the greatest all day suds sipper on the river and beyond. Come visit and have a great time in the Colorado Wilderness!

name: Edenton Brewing Company
description: Previously Chesapeake Bay Brewing.    Opened in 2003 by Brian Baker, who relocated to Raleigh from Edenton, NC rather than suffer the massive expense of moving ChesBay's brewing equipment to his building in Edenton, especially considering the local Raleigh customer base that was already in place after the demise of ChesBay.    In 2007, Baker sold the business to Geoff Lamb, who ultimately renamed the brewery after Edenton's most-popular label.

name: Edge Brewing Company
description: Edge Brewing Company is a collaboration of several diverse individuals, each of whom have their own strengths and above all a passion for craft beer...    By blending this passion, knowledge and experience, we intend to produce an exciting and innovative range of beers to the treasure valley and beyond.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 6:00 pm

name: Edmund's Oast
description: Why Edmund's Oast?    The “Edmund” in the name comes from Edmund Egan, who began producing beer in Charleston after emigrating from England in the 1760s. "Oast” is a kiln used in the drying of hops.     Edmund's Oast!

name: Taproom & Grill
description: Once an old lumber mill, we brew in our  brewing facility in Scotia, California.     Our tap room and grill in Fortuna, California offers all of our beers as well as an extensive menu featuring local and organic products. Check out the "Pub Specials" tab for information on daily specials at our pub.
hoursOfOperation: 11am to 11pm	This is the physical brewery address  7 days a week

name: Brewery
hoursOfOperation: While we do provide brewery tours, please call in advance to schedule an appointment.     Tastings are at the Taproom & Grill Location

name: Egan and Sons
description: We are a family business for 30 years that have strived to connect with the community we serve, "The Neighborhood". We are part of a wave of pubs with good food - "Gastro Pubs"; informal, inexpensive fun, yet with high standards.

name: Ei8ht Ball Brewing
description: Ei8ht Ball, named after the streets we got our  credit from, we are humble yet proud. Local but not  influenced. We might not move mountains, but we will  push the envelope. We will test theories and create  moments through our liquid in which tones and times  are our muse. We will brew and flow with poise and  confidence. We will rush for no one, yet hesitate for  nothing. We strive to please but make no apologies. No  billboards, neon lights and flashy text, it’s not our speed.  Make us part of your flight or enjoy us with a meal and  the mission is complete. For all of those in search of  something diverse, unique, improved and fresh, look  into, behind, under and around the Ei8ht Ball. What you  will find is what you never thought you were looking for.  This is Ei8ht Ball Brewing, the proof is the glass.

name: Eight Bridges Brewing
description: Production microbrewery and taproom

name: EJ Phair Brewing Company and Alehouse
El Segundo Brewing Company
description: El Segundo Brewing Company was created out of a love for beer. Well, hoppy beer at least. Rob Croxall, proprieter and brewer, was a longtime aerospace finance guy who left a cushy corporate job to risk it all on craft beer. He says all the time, “My worst day here, still beats my best day there.”  By our measure.. THAT is success.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Fri: 5:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 2:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun: 2:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: El Toro Brewing Company
description: Geno and Cindy Acevedo founded El Toro Brewing Company in the summer of 1992. After much planning, research and construction business was begun in March of 1994. The brewery is a small 17-barrel (527 gallon) batch system and operates on the Acevedo's rural residential property.  Within seven months of opening El Toro Brewing Company received its first national recognition at the 1994 Great American Beer Festival (GABF). One of its flagships El Toro Oro Golden Ale won a coveted Gold Medal for English Pale Ale. At the 1996 GABF Poppy Jasper Amber Ale, the brewery's other flagship beer, won a Silver Medal for English Brown Ale. It is a mild yet robust brown ale. The 1997 GABF saw El Toro garner another Gold Medal for the American styled wheat beer named after the brewer's father-in-law, William Jones Wheat Beer.  After 16 years of planning, Geno and Cindy Acevedo of Morgan Hill finally opened a brewpub on November 25 2006. El Toro Brewpub is a two floored building with patio. Inside is the world's only Poppy Jasper Bar. Featuring over 45 feet of gorgeously inlaid and polished Poppy Jasper rock into its surface. To the back of the large mirrored bar you will find over 25 beers and handcrafted sodas on tap. We also have a gleaming copper Pub Brewing system 3 BBL (100 gallon) brewery. Live music and dancing will also be a regular nighttime happening at the brewpub consisting of mostly local bands playing cover type and original Rock, Blues, Jazz and Reggae.

name: Electric Brewing Co
description: Arizona's first microbrewery.. 30 bbl home built gravity system, located on the edge of scenic Bisbee. We are generally closed to the public, however our beers are on tap and in bottles everywhere in Bisbee and some lesser locations in Phoenix and Tucson.    Brewery was Purchased by Beast Brewing.

name: Element Brewing Company?
description: Element Brewing produces unique hand crafted beer that just has to be tasted. We fuse styles and flavors together and break the style barrier.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Tue: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm  Thu - Sat: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Elevation 66 Brewing Co
description: Uniquely crafted beers and fresh local foods for the bay area.

name: Elevation Beer Company
description: Four friends; Carlin, Christian, Sheila, and Xandy, started Elevation Beer Co. on a cool Colorado night over a few beers and a backyard BBQ.    We all had the same dream of starting a brewery that brewed the highest quality barrel aged and specialty beers we could imagine. At the same time we all dreamed of living in an area of Colorado that would allow us to sneak out of the brewhouse to catch a four-pound trout, hike a 14,000-foot peak, or slash through some of Colorado’s famous powder. In the winter of 2011 we made our dreams a reality and took the leap and started brewing in Poncha Springs, Colorado.

name: Elizabeth Street Brewery
description: Since 2003, the residence of Alyson and Richard Brewer-Hay has been known to family and friends as The Elizabeth Street Brewery. Located in the family-oriented San Francisco neighborhood of Noe Valley, the ESB is a pub for the people, by the people.

name: Elk Creek Cafe and Aleworks
description: Head Brewer Tim Yarrington makes beers that people want to drink.  With over 12 years brewing experience under his belt, founding the brewery operations at Long Valley Pub & Brewery in New Jersey and resurrecting Time Square Brewery in Manhatten, Brewer Tim brings a good sense of what beers people enjoy drinking to Elk Creek Aleworks.  Winning Gold and Bronze medals for his Porter and Bitter at the prestigous Great American Beer Festival attests to the fact that his peers also think he makes great beer. Drawing inspiration primarily from traditional English ale brewing, Tim makes balanced beers, giving both malt and hops prominence in every pint.  In addition to our rotating selection of seasonal brews, we offer six outstanding House Standards year 'round.  Without doubt, there's a pint for you!

name: Elk Mountain Brewing
description: Elk Mountain Brewing, Inc., established in April of 2009, is owned and operated by Tom and Marcia Bell. Elk Mountain Brewing is a small scale microbrewery located in the industrial area of Parker, Co, serving truly unique handcrafted microbrews with award winning recipes. Tom Bell is the head brewer with nearly 20 years of experience. Although he brews a variety of beers, his specialty is German beers with a twist. For those non-drinkers we will have homemade Root Beer on tap.

name: Elk Street Brewery & Tap Room
description: Elk Street Brewery Offers Hand-crafted, Premium Micro Brews Using  Locally Grown Hops. Our Brews Are Designed For Maximum Flavor, Smoothness, & Drinkability

name: Ellicott Mills Brewing
description: Here at the Mills we have a very simple, yet demanding approach to producing Alpenhof beer. We use the very best ingredients available. We are efficient and precise in production method, yet we allow the product to age to its full maturity. Balance is the key to our beer.  Alpenhof beer is not created to challenge the senses. It is not created to be a complex beer. Well balanced for Alpenhof means smooth and easy-drinking. The way a beer should taste.  To achieve this well balanced taste, only the finest ingredients are used. We import our malt, hops, and yeast from Germany. (For true German style Lager beer, authentic ingredients are essential!) We might spend more for our ingredients, but it is well worth it. This is an expense you can actually taste!

name: Ellicottville Brewing Company
description: To date, EBC is considered one of the finest craft brewers and has received no less than THREE International World Beer Championship Awards.    The Ellicottville Brewing Company is the result of the desire to open a family business. Inspiration struck during a ski trip to Vail, where other craft brewers began. There was the realization that Ellicottville, sometimes referred to as "the Aspen of the East", would be the perfect location for a craft brewery & grill.    After 10 years of building a successfull brewery & restaurant in Ellicottville, our team ventured to open a second location where we could build on our brewing & culinary talents. EBC West opened June 1st, 2005 in the fun-filled college town of Fredonia, home to SUNY Fredonia.

name: West Seattle
description: Elliott Bay Brewing Co. is a family owned company of high quality neighborhood brewpubs in communities throughout the Seattle area.  Owners Todd Carden and Brent Norton met in 1994 while working for the iconic Maritime Pacific Brewing Co. They forged a friendship and explored their common goal and dream of owning and operating their own brewpub. They also met Head Brewer Doug Hindman at Maritime Pacific.  Todd and Brent incorporated the company in November of 1996.   In March 1997 they signed their first lease and began construction of a brewpub in the historic “Junction” of West Seattle.  They opened for business on July 11, 1997.  Doug joined the ranks in September of 1997 and has been Head Brewer ever since.  Over the past thirteen years in West Seattle, Elliott Bay Brewery & Pub has been a leader in sustainability, philanthropic support, and instumental in creating an amazing sense of community in the neighborhoods which it serves.  Elliott Bay Brewhouse and Pub, the companyís second brewpub, opened in Burien in March of 2007.  The Burien Brewhouse, like its West Seattle sibling, supports a progressive company culture and socially responsible business practices.  - See more at: http://www.elliottbaybrewing.com/about/about-us/#sthash.v5ZoitjL.dpuf
hoursOfOperation: Monday-Saturday: 11 AM – 12 midnight  Sunday: 11 AM – 11 PM

name: Elysian Brewing Company
description: The Elysian was founded in 1995 by principals Dick Cantwell (President/Head Brewer), Joe Bisacca (CFO/Head of Operations) and David Buhler (Sales & Marketing Director). Our first Seattle location, a 220-seat beer hall and our main brewery, opened in 1996 on Capitol Hill, Seattle’s most populous neighborhood. In 1997 Elysian was chosen to operate a pub and small brewery at Gameworks—a large entertainment complex owned by Universal Studios, Dreamworks & Sega. Elysian left this partnership in 2002 upon expiration of the five-year contract. A short year later Elysian opened TangleTown, an 80-seat neighborhood brewery/bistro. With a 3-bbl pilot brewery, Elysian-TangleTown acted as the brewers' test kitchen, fueling the creative fires and helping cement Elysian's reputation as Seattle’s top brewpub. The most recent addition to the Elysian empire, Elysian Fields, opened in August 2006. Perched next to Seattle’s two sports arenas, Fields seats 400 and packs the house at lunch and on gamedays. It is typical for us to offer over twenty different Elysian beers between the three locations.

name: TangleTown

name: Emerald City Beer Company
description: An American Lager Brewery located out of the Old Rainier Brewery in Seattle, WA.

name: Emerald Coast Beer Co
description: The Emerald Coast Beer Company was started in 2006 with the goal of building a brand of beers to satisfy the taste of the southern beer drinker. There are four beers under the brand.

name: Emmett's Tavern & Brewing Co.
description: Established in 1999, Emmett's Brewing Company is comprised of three brewpubs in the Chicago suburbs. Tradition, craftsmanship, and the highest standards in beer and food are our passion. We believe in using only the finest ingredients in what we make, whether they are destined for your pint glass or your plate. Our original pub is in West Dundee and houses our copper-clad, seven barrel JV Northwest system. There, we produce about 600 barrels per year, including all of the company's barrel-aged and cask-conditioned ales. We opened Downers Grove in 2004 and brew on a 15 barrel Specific Mechanical system to make about 850 barrels per year. The 10 barrel DME system at Palatine is our newest brewery and is also the home of our bottle and draft packaging operations. Our beer can be found in chain and independent retail stores, bars, and restaurants throughout the Chicago-land area.

name: Empire Brewing Company
description: Empire Brewing Company began as a contemporary Microbrewery & Restaurant in Syracuse, New York. Established in 1994, we have served our national & international award winning ales & lagers exclusively to the craft beer pallets of Central New York.  In 2010, we expanded our proprietary brewing practice to Brooklyn, NY. We are excited to offer you the fruits of our labor in a pint glass. Thank you for your patronage & please enjoy responsibly.    Cheers!  empire brewing company
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thurs: 11:30 am - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:30 am - 11:00 pm  Sun: 11:30 am - 9:00 pm

name: Empirical Brewery
description: Empirical Brewery is a startup brewery in Chicago Illinois.  Our mission is to create high quality craft beers that exceed your expectations.  We are focused on innovation and exploration of unique flavor profiles.  Our customers come first and have a direct impact on brewery operations.  The advantage of a craft brewery is that it can respond to changing market tastes.  To that end, we will endeavor to gather feedback from you and incorporate it into our brewing.  For updates on the brewery, follow us on Twitter, Facebook or our blog. Look for our beer to be available early next year.

name: Empyrean Brewing Company
description: It began with a dream that we could brew full-flavored beer in the great state of Nebraska. In late 1990 that dream became our state’s first brewpub, Lazlo’s Brewery & Grill. Since then demand for our beer has grown, so we expanded our pub and Empyrean Brewing Company was born. Today we still dream big even while we hand craft our beers in small flavor–filled batches. So enjoy an Empyrean beer, the taste of dreams come true.

name: Engine 15 Brewing Company
description: Engine 15 Brewing Co. was born of the need for great beer!  Way back in 1988, Luch Scremin was a Freshman in college and became interested in brewing his own beer.  Since the internet did not exist, Luch was forced to order a “beer kit” from an ad in the back of an issue of Popular Mechanics.  Suffice it to say that what resulted was indeed beer but was far from great.    Fast forward twenty years and the love of beer and the desire to brew it had matured over years of home brewing and an insatiable appetite for delicious brew.  Luch traveled the world with his job in the airline business and was treated to many delicious beer styles and beer culture.  In 2008 while planning to open a beer bar and brewpub,  Luch met his future business partners Andy and Sean.  The three were soon making the business a reality.    All that was left was a name.  They soon decided they would name the brewery for Luch’s 1962 Ford Fire Engine – after all, they just don’t make them like that anymore.  It represents all that Engine 15 Brewing Co. is about. Camaraderie, old school know how, determination and a simple but serious dedication to the cause.  As of 2011, Engine 15 Brewing Co. has enjoyed success and was even voted best Pub and Brewpub  in Jacksonville by the Folio Weekly readers poll.  At Engine 15 Brewing Co. you’ll find a friendly atmosphere where you can enjoy a dizzying array of beers, both brewed in house and imported from the far reaches of the globe, eat a tasty meal and even brew your own beer!    Engine 15 – Eat, Drink, Brew!
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm

name: EnglishSetterBrewing
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Sat: 3:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: ENKI Brewing
description: ENKI Brewing is the 20+ year culmination of the friendship between two beer lovers. John Hayes and Dan Norton met working for NIKE in the early-80s. Training and competing in track and road running events brought them together. They soon found another shared interest--experiencing the world of beer. The two made many friends spending spare evenings in New England pubs offering European beers, which, before the emergence of American craft beers, were the best beers available. The two often discussed their dream of opening their own brewery over the years. In August of 2012, John and Dan decided to take the keg into their own hands, and ENKI Brewing Company was born. Just a few months later, their dreams came to fruition at 7929 Victoria Drive. ENKI’s mission is to “Make the World a Friendlier Place – Two Beers at a Time” just as John and Dan have been enjoying and sharing beers with old and new friends, alike.

name: Enlightenment Ales
description: We are a nano-sized artisan brewery specializing in the bière de champagne style. Look for “Enlightenment Brut” on shelves in the Spring of 2012!

name: Eola Beer Company
description: Welcome to Eola Beer Company! We are located in the mountains of North Carolina in the beautiful and artistic city of Lenoir. Eola Beer Company features handcrafted artisanal beers made with local ingredients of the highest quality using malted barley, fresh whole cone hops, Appalachian Mountain waters and fresh cultured yeast. All Natural, Organic Beer with No additives, No extracts, and no shortcuts to provide you with the finest, freshest beer . We are also a Gastropub , Chef Stephen Loe uses local and seasonal ingredients to create an ever-changing menu of exciting , flavorful dishes from around the world. Influenced by many chefs, and culinary styles Loe focuses on Southern American, French, Cajun -Creole, and Indian. Stephen Loe has won many awards for his cooking and beers and is a graduate of the prestigious Culinary Institute of America in Hyde Park NY. He has worked at many fine restaurants in New York , Emerils, Sonoma California Bistro, Barringtons, and Artisanal before starting his own. Eola is a great mountain destination with great food, great beer, souvenirs,gifts,live music and a fun , friendly atmosphere with outdoor seating in the historic downtown area. Please come make Eola your North Carolina Mountain tradition! Cheers

name: Eola School Restaurant, Brewery and Lodge
Epic Ales
description: Epic Ales is Seattle brewery founded in early 2009. Master Brewer, Cody Morris, started the brewery with the hope of providing the Seattle area with a slew of strange and wonderful brews.

name: EPIC Brewing Company
description: EPIC Brewing Company opened in May 2010 with six fermentation tanks, but an increase in space and brewing capacity has given brewers the flexibility to create beers that have yet to be imagined. Epic has doubled is capacity twice in the past three years and in the summer of 2013 opened an additional brewery in Denver, CO.      In only a few short months after opening, Epic began earning medals for its beers domestically and internationally. Now brewing over 35 distinctly different beers we believe there is an Epic brew for your tastes, at the right place and the right time. At Epic, everyone is here to help you make the perfect beer match.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 10:00 am - 11:00 pm

name: Taproom & Brewery
hoursOfOperation: The taproom hours are Monday through Thursday, 12:00 pm – 9:00 pm, Friday and Saturday, 12:00 pm – 10:00 pm and Sunday from 11:00 am – 8:00 pm. Brewery tours are held Thursday and Friday at 3:30pm and Saturday and Sunday at 12:00, 2:00, 4:00 and 6:00.

name: Equinox Brewing Company
description: The most common question we get is, why Equinox Brewing? The equinox, and the intrigue of equal night and day, has deep roots in history and ritual. But, at the same time, the equinox marks the changing of the season, and forces us to look toward the future. We find it interesting that the two days out of the year that have perfect light and dark balance also show the balance between the past and the future, tradition and innovation. Beer contains similar elements. Sure, there’s the balance of flavors in a beer; sweet and bitter, rich and simple…    We find another aspect of beer’s balancing act fascinating. Historically, beer styles have developed because of limitations in local ingredients and the necessity to make do with what you have. However, due to global trade and modern shipping methods, limitations on ingredients have been removed. We can get any ingredients we want. While most modern brewers recognize the importance of beer styles and learn from the brewers who made them, they certainly don’t limit themselves to making beers that fit into traditional definitions.    On one level our beers fit into some traditional styles, but we put our own twist on them. We want our beers to capture elements from the past and incorporate new ideas, ingredients and techniques into them. We’re not afraid to try new things.    As a brewer, its playtime and work, balanced.

name: Erie Brewing Company
description: Erie Brewing Co. is a microbrewery that offers award winning craft beers to the Erie community and along the East Coast. You can stop in for a tasting and tour or find one of our 10 beers at your local bar, 6 pack shop, or beer distributor.

name: Esser's Cross Plains Brewery
description: Arriving in Madison, Wisconsin on May 11, 1852 from a village in Germany called Ichendorf, George Esser possessed little more than the clothing on his back, a talent for masonry, and a taste for good, traditional German beer. Esser started producing lager in a small brewery he bought in Monroe for $1,500. In 1863, he purchased 2 1/2 acres of land in Cross Plains. The original building had two cellars below and several rooms above to house Esser's family. The beer, known as Esser's Best, was first brewed in October, 1863. He was joined in this enterprise in 1881 by his son Jacob. At that time, the brewery had a capacity of 2,000 barrels. A barrel of beer cost $7, and a case containing 36 pint bottles was priced at $1.75. Jacob and his sons, primarily Werner (W.B.) and Peter (Spundt) began delivering beer to the surrounding communities, often starting out as early as 3 a.m. Werner acted as Brew master from 1907 to 1910. It was increased competition from the larger breweries that forced him to become a distributor. The first beer that he handled as a distributor was Hausmann's originally brewed in Madison in 1920, Werner became the distributor for Blatz Near Beer. Following Prohibition in 1933, the company again to distribute beer. It should be noted that during prohibition, Werner and his brothers were kept very busy taking care of the beer needs in the area, mostly doing business at night. In 1937, Werner's eldest son, Roman, became a partner. At this point, the company began to handle Old Style products out of La Crosse, Wisconsin. The family tradition continued when Del Esser, Werner's youngest son, joined the firm in 1948. In 1988, Roman's son, Wayne, took over the business. In 1990, Wayne was joined in the business by his son, Larry, which made six generations of Essers in the bee business. It should also be noted that the Essers were distributors of Blatz and Old Style products until they sold the distributorship in January 1998 to Frank Beer in Middleton, Wisconsin. Frank beer is currently the distributor of Esser's Best in the area.

name: EST Brewing Company
description: Seasonal, food-inspired, small batch beers coming to NYC taps Spring 2013 from the team behind Brooklyn Brew Shop

name: Estes Park Brewery
description: The original Brewing equipment which consisted of a 4 1/4  Barrel Brewhouse was moved to Estes. For the first summer the Event Center kept the main floor as a stage and dance floor. For the first summer we offered four beers:  Estes Park Porter, Estes Park Renegade, Longs Peak Raspberry Wheat and Estes Park Pale Ale.  In the fall of 1994, Gordon Knight decided to sell his half of the business. When Gordon left, Eric Bratrud took over as the head Brewer. The Brewery also expanded to a 14 BBL Brewhouse and moved out onto the main floor where is now located. In 1995 we started packaging our beers in 12 oz bottles, which expanded our market. By this time we had added a number of beers including Trail Ridge Red, Estes Park Gold, Stinger Wild Honey Wheat and Samson Stout. 1995 was also the first year of the Best of the West Brewfest held in the Brewery parking lot. Since '95 we've continued to evolve both in our restaurant and with our brewing operations. In 2003 Tyler Lemirande and Eric Bratrud took over as owners.

name: Eternity Brewing Company
description: A microbrewery in the works. We will brew craft beer in Howell, Michigan. :-)

name: Eventide Brewing
description: Eventide is a start-up brewery in Atlanta, GA. It was founded on the idea that great beer doesn’t have to be complicated and good beer should be enjoyable. We are also focused on bringing sessionable craft beer to everyone. The biggest trend, and subsequent impediment, in craft/micro brewing is the almost obsessive need to make the biggest, hoppiest, strangest beer possible, which is great for advancing the boundaries of what can be done with beer but does not satisfy a daily thirst. We pride ourselves on making great beer, with all the flavor one could want, that people will actually want to drink whenever and with whatever. Again, great doesn’t have to be complicated.    Another of our fundamental ideas is that brewing is free, and should be open. So, with this in mind, we will share as many of our “secrets” as possible with everyone so that they too can make great beer at home. If you ever have questions please reach out, we are more than happy to share what we know! (Seriously, we will talk about brewing and all of it’s components for hours…love this stuff.)

name: Evil Czech Brewery Culver
description: Evil Czech has been operating since 2011 and just opened it's doors to a new 20 barrel facility this year. Head brewer, Scott Ciampa, brews up a little bit of everything, ranging from pilsners to barrel-aged sours, all rotating through the brewpub's tap list...    ... sometimes for beer to be good, it has to get evil.

name: Evil Genius Beer Company
description: The Evil Genius Brewing Company is an Independent Craft Brewery located in Pennsylvania, owned by Luke Bowen, Trevor Hayward, and Mark Braunwarth. We are committed to making great beers which anyone can enjoy. Each beer is designed by Mark, our Master Brewer, using the highest quality ingredients and locally sourced water to ensure that you, our customer, will experience the same great taste over and over again. Our company is committed to supporting the local craft brewing movement in the tri-state region.

name: Evolution Craft Brewing Company
description: Our mission is to produce the finest local ales in the Mid Atlantic Region. We are a Craft Brewing company focused on producing well balanced handcrafted ales.

name: Excel Brewing Company
description: Excel Brewing Company runs a 20 BBL brewhouse. The brewery is a division of Excel Bottling Company. Once up and running, we will offer co-packing for the St. Louis regional craft beers.    Excel Bottling Company was founded in 1936 by the Meier Family. The company bottles more than 10 flavors of old-fashioned sodas including “Ski” soda. Each soda flavor is manufactured using pure cane sugar and most often packaged in eco-friendly, returnable glass bottles. In 2012, Excel Bottling Company embarked on a new bottling venture in the craft beer business serving Illinois and Missouri. Excel Bottling Company is headquartered in Breese, Ill. Visit www.excelbrewing.com for more information.

name: Excelsior Brewing Company
description: Our mission is to celebrate the rich history of Lake Minnetonka and historic Excelsior by delivering superior brews hand-crafted in their image. We are a locally-based employee-owned brewery committed to stewardship of the Lake and dedicated to serving her surrounding communities. Our brew was created to honor lake life, and ultimately, to complement it.    A Lake Minnetonka inspired microbrewery, right in the heart of Excelsior. The brewery is a full production brewery offering several unique brews. The brewery offers tours, growler sales and trucker caps. Stop by and let’s get to know each other, neighbor.

name: Exile Brewing Company
description: Inspired by the countless immigrants who have made our country what it is today, Exile Brewing Co. is a hand-crafted brewery fueled by the passion of a burn-bright lifestyle, and driven by a unique sense of gratitude for the customer, community and future of our land.

name: F.X. Matt Brewing Company
description: F.X. Matt Brewing Company is an American family-owned brewery at the foothills of the Adirondack Mountains in Utica, New York. It is the fourth oldest family-owned brewery in the United States after D. G. Yuengling & Son (1829), August Schell Brewing Company (1860), and Straub Brewery Inc. (1872). Its most popular product is the Saranac line of beers, although soft drinks such at Root Beer and Ginger Beer are also produced by the company.

name: Faction Brewing
hoursOfOperation: Wed-Sat 12-7   Sun 12-5

name: Factotum Brewhouse
description: Mission Statement: Factotum Brewhouse assists homebrewers in creating a highly-drinkable product by providing professional brewing equipment, guidance and education, and a beer-loving community defined by mutual support, unbiased opinion, and a philosophy that anybody can brew.    Who we are: We are a sibling-owned brewhouse in the Sunnyside neighborhood of Denver. Our German-American upbringing has instilled in us a passion for beer and our background as professional educators compels us to impart our brewing knowledge to the community.    The brewhouse: Factotum Brewhouse is a brewery for the people, by the people.
