The drinks you enjoy in our taproom were conceived and created by homebrewers and other beer lovers under the tutelage of our head brewer in an effort to guide and teach our customers in the art of making great beer. Drink a beer, make a beer—at Factotum Brewhouse, the choice is yours.     Twitter: @FactotumBrew   4735 Lipan Street, Denver, Colorado 80211

name: Fair State Brewing Cooperative
description: Fair State Brewing Cooperative will brew beer with a focus on quality, community, and cooperation.    Our cooperative will focus on sustainable business practices that empower employees as part of the broader brewing community to produce the finest beer without compromise.

name: Fairhope Brewing Company
description: The Fairhope Brewing Company will serve the craft beer needs of Lower Alabama by operating a taproom in the brewery and selling our beer throughout Baldwin and Mobile counties.
hoursOfOperation: Thursday-Saturday 5:30-8:30pm

name: Fairport Brewing Company
description: We're a small brewery providing hand-crafted beer in small batches. We sell our variety of beer in growlers from our brewery in Fairport, NY.    We're located in the business park at 1000 Turk Hill Road, right on the historic Erie Canal. After you enter the business park, drive past the buildings and park in the lot in the back. Walk back between the buildings, and look for Building 8 on the right. Use the “Classroom Entrance” and take the stairs or elevator on your left. You’ll find us on the second floor down the hall and to the right.
hoursOfOperation: Fri: 4:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Sat: 1:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Fall River Brewing Company
description: At Fall River Brewing Company, we create handcrafted ales and lagers. We brew our beer on a small 1/2 barrel system which allows us to put our personal touch into every pint. We hope you enjoy our beer as much as we enjoy brewing it for you. Cheers!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 3:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sun: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Fallbrook Brewing Company Inc
description: Fallbrook Brewing Company is a small craft brewery in the ‘Friendly Village’ of Fallbrook. FBC prides ourselves on brewing, serving and living the craft beer movement. Our nano brewery includes a tasting room to serve those who are looking for a delicious and local handcrafted beer. FBC caters to the craft beer enthusiast as well as the novice converts. Our small four barrel brewing system allows us to be creative and offer our customers an amazing array of staple beers and variety of specialty offerings.    FBC will strive to utilize local ingredients whenever possible and is looking forward to having a positive impact on our local community.    Cheers!
hoursOfOperation: Thu: 4:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri: 3:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Falling Down Beer Company
description: Falling Down Beer Company (FDBC) is the newest craft brewery in the state of Michigan. Continuing the tradition of Michigan and Craft brewers before us, we will create unique hand crafted Ales and Lagers, that will challenge expectations and ideas of what great beer really is. With a focus on premium quality, handmade Ales and Lagers, FDBC will present a new unique product to the Detroit area.    Made in Michigan and the U.S.A.    One of the missions of FDBC is to create jobs and spur the economy in Michigan and the U.S. in general. At opening we plan to have 18 positions available with that number doubling year to year. Our long term goal is a bottling factory and additional restaurants that will employee hundreds of local workers.    Keeping with our philosophy of locally sourced goods and services, we will purchase from local companies whenever possible. On the food side this includes local fish markets, meat markets and bakeries; and on the brewery side designing beers that will be made using Michigan grown hops and malt. And it doesn’t stop there! We are actively negotiating and designing the brew house, promotional materials, general construction and website operations with Michigan companies.    Where it is not possible to source a product or service locally or in the State of Michigan, we will be looking first to keep our business in the Mid-West and then United States. We call this an inside-out sourcing philosophy. First source at the city level and slowly work out by county, state, region and country. We feel this benefits everyone in this endeavor where we support the community that is supporting us. A Win-Win for everyone!    It’s All About the Beer!    We are going to be creating quality; handcrafted beers that we believe will be some of the best beer you have ever tried. We are also going to push the envelope and make beers with unique and far-out ingredients that will invite you to be different and maybe live a little on the edge. We already have over 20 recipes waiting for people to try and enjoy.

name: Brewing House
hoursOfOperation: Sun-Wed: 11am-12am  Thur-Sat: 11am-1am

name: Pourhouse and Delicatessen
hoursOfOperation: Sun-Weds 11am-12am  Thurs-Sat 11am-1am

name: Falls City Brewing Company
description: Falls City Beer is back! An old Louisville favorite has returned with a whole new recipe. Falls City Original Pale Ale is now available at dozens of local bars and restaurants. The new brew is made in the style of Falls City Pale Ale from the 1930’s. Falls City began as a craft beer in 1905, made in small batches with only the finest ingredients. As we start again, 105 years later, we are once again a craft beer with a commitment to quality and taste.

name: Fanning Brewing Company
description: Fannin Brewing is a hometown brewery in a real place - beautiful Blue Ridge, GA. We combine our love for German beer, our experience making wine and our passion for the mountains to create world-class beer with a local focus. Local isn't just a word - we use local ingredients,name our beers for the beauty around us, and support our local community.
hoursOfOperation: Fri:  5:30pm - 7:30pm Sat:  1:00pm - 5:00pm

name: Fantasy Brewmasters, LLC
description: Fantasy Brewmasters develops real beers inspired by the magical worlds of dwarves, wizards, and dragons. Our talented and growing team of artists, writers, and brewers are truly passionate about the genre; we strive for excellence in every aspect of the process.    Our brews are brought to life through detailed stories, rich artwork, and authentic recipes. We often look to history and mythology for inspiration, and round it out with a modern touch and professional presentation.

name: Far West Ireland Brewing
description: (No longer brewing)

name: Fargo Brewing Company
description: Fargo Brewing Company is a microbrewery starting up in Fargo, North Dakota. The four founders are Fargo natives who care about bringing hand crafted, artisan beer to the heartland.    Opening in 2011, the brewery will be devoted to crafting a premium product from bushel to bottle.    Join Fargo Brewing Company at their local events for free beer tastings and more information.

name: FarmHouse Brewery
description: FarmHouse Brewery wil be located in Newark Valley, NY, where we will operate as a Farm Brewery, growing and processing our own hops and grains grown here in Tioga County, NY. Come tour our on-site malthouse and learn how local handcrafted beer is engineered from ground to glass.    A NYS "Farm Brewery" with a Tap Room location in Owego, NY and a malthouse/brewery location in Newark Valley, NY. In our Tap Room we offer craft ales, hard cider, old-fashioned sodas and revolving taps for other NYS "Farm Brewery" libations.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Thu: 3:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Fri: 3:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Sun: 1:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Farnam House Brewing Company
description: Farnam House Brewing Company is an exciting new brewpub located in Midtown Omaha at 3562 Farnam St. Farnam House specializes in farmhouse ales and barrel aged beers and offers a diverse food menu made with locally-sourced ingredients and beer-infused creations.

name: Fat Bottom Brewing
description: Fat Bottom’s full-flavored brews are bigger and more exciting than other beers in town. Our signature brews represent a sophisticated array of styles perfected over many years, with a few unique twists. Ben has refined each recipe and sourced the highest quality ingredients for every batch of specially crafted Fat Bottom beer.    Our beer is unfiltered, so you can savor the unique cloudy appearance and subtle flavors that truly bring craft beer to life. We like the bolder hops flavors, distinct body of aromas, and the beautiful color compounds that come from the natural grains. Unfiltered beers also have more nutrients from yeast and barley malt, including B vitamins which have been shown to reduce the effects of hangovers… a little added benefit for those of us who seriously love beer.
hoursOfOperation: Tues - Sat: 4:00pm - 10:00pm  Sat: 2:00pm - 10:pm

name: Pittsburgh
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat: 11:00 am - 1:30 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 12:00 am

name: Fate Brewing Company
description: We do things a bit differently at Fate. Our beers are brewed in small batches, which means you'll find steadily rotating traditional favorites, experimentals, seasonals and cask conditioned ales on tap exclusively at the brewpub. At Fate you'll be offered a nifty opportunity to develop and expand your taste profile with our ever changing distinctive beers and wood-fired pizzas. Join us for a pint and a pie at Scottsdale's very own micro brewpub and put Fate in your hands!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: FATE Brewing Company
description: FATE Brewing Company is Boulder’s first brew-bistro and your new place to enjoy chef-inspired, gourmet creations with unique, handcrafted microbrews. Local ingredients are featured on the lunch, brunch, and dinner menus and the full bar with 30 taps feature house drafts and rotating guest beer. Stop by for a pint and a bite at 1600 38th Street and Arapahoe Road (one block west of Foothills Parkway) in Boulder, Colorado.
hoursOfOperation: Lunch 11am-4pm Mon-Fri  Dinner 4pm Seven Days a Week   Brunch 10am-4pm Sat-Sun  Happy Hour 3-5:30pm Mon-Fri  Sunday Brewery Tour 4pm

name: Fathom & League Hop Yard Brewery
description: Fathom & League Hop Yard Brewery is dedicated to the first brewers in the Pacific Northwest.  On May 5, 1792, the intrepid crew of the HMS Discovery rowed ashore about 5 miles from our brewery.  They brewed a spruce tip beer and enjoyed a day off from their exploration of the Strait of Juan de Fuca and Salish Sea.  We are proud to carry on the tradition of brewing beer in this remarkable corner of the world. Cheers!

name: Faultline Brewing #2
description: (No longer brewing)

name: Sunnyvale
description: FBC opened its doors in December of 1994 and has been supplying the Silicon Valley with spectacular hand-crafted beers and delicious cuisine ever since.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri: 11:00 am - 10:30 pm  Sat:	5:00 pm 10:00 pm

name: Faust Brewing Company
description: The Faust Brewing Company features an array of house brews, including Faust Golden Ale, Altered States German Altbier and Mike Crowe IPA and Walter's Ghostly Pale Ale, as well as a variety of seasonal favorites. Leading the production is Ray Mitteldorf, a professional brew master with 17 years experience. For a complete experience, the pub features a tapas-style menu, created by Chef Chris Kilisz....See More

name: Feather Falls Casino Brewing Co
description: In December 2010, Mooretown Rancheria unveiled this elegant addition to the area’s original gaming facility.  The décor features rich woods, plush fabrics and copper accents throughout the airy dining room.       Visitors are taken with the view of gleaming brew tanks behind the bar, and the frequent sight of Brewmaster Roland Allen measuring ingredients and testing batches.  With seven craft beers and a rotating menu of seasonals, beer connoisseurs can always find a new taste on tap.    The 350-seat full service restaurant’s $1 million kitchen includes the only fresh sushi bar in the area.  Hand-crafted pizza with beer-infused crust is also available.  Diners enjoy an outdoor seating area with a custom shade lattice.  Food service extends to the balcony level, which boasts large leather chairs and a private bar.  Three luxury VIP suites are available to rent for group functions or private parties.    Entertainment is a major focus of the brewery, as well.   With a host of video poker machines and big-screen TVs, guests find plenty of activity to accompany the excellent food and drinks.  The dining room turns into a showroom at night, complete with live music on an elevated stage.  The state-of-the-art sound and light system enhance the concert experience.    Feather Falls Casino Brewing Company serves food and beverages 7 days a week, so make a point to visit the next time you’re in Northern California!

name: Feather River Brewing Co
description: Brewed and bottled in the rugged foothills of the Sierra Nevada Mountains of Northern California by Masterbrewer Roger Preecs.    We use our own brewing style which produces a smooth, clean, less-bitter beer than the English Style ales produced by most California micro-breweries. We feel our beer, made with fresh ingredients and mountain waters, appeals to more consumers who enjoy this surprisingly smooth, yet rich, full bodied ale.

name: Federal Brewing
description: Serving the finest ales in pints at the tasting room, as well as in growlers and grumblers to go.
hoursOfOperation: Mon: 3:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Thu: 3:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 3:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sun: 3:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: Fenton Winery & Brewery
description: The Fenton Winery & Brewery just relocated to a new, beautiful, 5 acre property in Fenton Township. At over 1 acre, the beer garden is one (if not the) largest in the state. The taproom is located right alongside the brewery and is around the corner from the winery - all in full view of patrons. The FWB specializes in crafting balanced wines and beers that maximize flavor and originality. Food is available - from tasty specialty meat & cheese plates, to    delicious sandwiches and specialty pizzas. Definitely worth a stop (or three). Cheers!

name: Ferguson Brewing Company
hoursOfOperation: Mon: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm  Tue - Thu: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: FERMÆNTRA
description: Located in a former bicycle shop adjacent to the University of Denver campus, FERMÆNTRA will offer hand crafted ales and lagers to the DU community and surrounding neighborhoods.

name: Primary
description: Ryan and Christa Kilpatrick plan to combine their love of good books and good beer at Fiction Beer Company, which they'll open on the first floor of the Phoenix on the Fax apartment building in east Denver, a part of town that is desperately lacking in craft breweries.  Fiction will include a seven-barrel brewing system, six beers on tap and a patio out back.  The beer styles will be categorized into genres based on the couple's favorite works of fiction, including classics, like an IPA; mystery and adventure; and fantasy/sci-fi.  Opening July, 2014

name: Fiddlehead Brewing Company
description: Fiddlehead Brewing Company is located on Route 7 in beautiful Shelburne, Vermont. Our mission is to produce high quality beer, use as many local ingredients as we can, and create recipes with the true beer connoisseur in mind.  We use a 15 barrel brewery and will distribute in the regional market.

name: Fifth Quadrant
description: The 5th Quadrant is the latest addition to the Lompoc Family. The most northerly of all of the Lompocs, the 5th Quadrant (or 5Q as it is commonly known) is also surprisingly the warmest of all the Lompocs, a benefit not lost on the bald-headed patrons who frequent the establishment.

name: FiftyFifty Brewing Company
description: Founded by Andy and Alicia Barr, FiftyFifty is located in Truckee at 11197 Brockway Road, between Hwy 267 and downtown Truckee. Open seven days a week from 11:30 a.m. to 2 a.m., FiftyFifty serves both lunch and dinner to complement their variety of beers brewed on the premise. FiftyFifty also features a full bar, seasonal outdoor seating on the patio and live music and entertainment.

name: Buellton Taproom
description: Regional Craft Brewery and Tasting Room.  Central Coast Brewery based in the Santa Ynez Valley. Capturing the essence and taste buds of the region.
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Thurs 1pm-9pm  Fri-Sun 11am-9pm

name: Santa Barbara Taproom
hoursOfOperation: 11am-11pm Daily

name: Figure Eight Brewing
description: Figure Eight Brewing is a small craft brewery located just an hour southeast of Chicago in Valparaiso, Indiana. We believe in making great beer and enjoying life to its fullest.    Our mission is to make great beer and share it. Utilizing the best ingredients while synthesizing classic and innovative brewing styles and techniques, riding on the edge of where beer has gone and where beer is going.
hoursOfOperation: Wed & Thr 5-8p   Fri 3-8p, Sat 12-6p   Sun 12-6p   Sunday Carryout

name: Fin City Brewing Co.
description: “I HAVE AN IDEA!”  That is how it all started.  Two years ago at our annual Brews on the Beach Beer Festival, Hooper’s was approached by a local gentleman named Vince Wright.  He had recently won first place with his “garage brewed” Pumpkin Ale at the infamous Pumpkin Chunkin.  With the growing trend and demand for hand crafted beers, and the fact nothing tastes better to wash down great crabs and old bay, we not only jumped, but dove head first into the world of craft brewing.  We created the brewing equipment, devised a system and here we are today.  With the help and guidance of a few experts along the way Hooper’s brings to you Fin City Brewing, Ocean City’s Oldest Brewery.

name: Finback Brewery
description: Our goal is to make great beer following our passion for richness and complexity from quality ingredients and small batch artisanal brewing. We focus on pushing American styles and brewing flavorful, unique beers to drink. We like it hoppy and complex to roasty and smokey, strong and sippable to session and gulpable. Most importantly we like it happy and enjoyable. Something to drink with friends, in the backyard, at the beach and at the bar. We make beer because we like to drink and we like to smile.

name: Finger Lakes Beer Company
description: Finger Lakes Beer Company was established in the fall of 2009 by Partners, Wayne Peworchik & Mark Goodwin. Both Wayne and Mark were avid homebrewers for many years. Mark continued on with his brewing education by completing the Web-based Concise Course in Brewing Technology at the Siebel Institute of Technology World Brewing Acadamy from which he obtained his Certificate.   We selected our location nestled in the heart of the beautiful Finger Lakes Region of upstate New York for its close proximity to Keuka Lake and the availability for lake water for brewing. Our building offered a spacious workable layout, ample parking and room for future expansion. We began our building renovations and equipment installation in early 2010,  received our license in the fall of 2010, and on November 11th, 2010 opened our doors for tours, tastings, and growler fills.     Our Brew Room features a matched Ripley 7 Barrel Stainless Steel Brewing system. The Brew House includes a Boil Kettle, Mash Tun and Hot Liquor Tank. The Brew Room also features 3 double wall digital temperature controlled fermentation tanks, grain mill, filter, and other assorted brewing equipment. Adjacent to the brew room is a walk-in cooler containing 8 - 7 Barrel Stainless Steel Serving Tanks and assorted keg filling and dispensing equipment.     The entrance way and tasting room offer large windows for great views of the Brew Room  as well as a large comfortable area for you and your friends to relax and visit while enjoying your favorite brews offered fresh daily. We offer tastings and growler fills of fine crafted ales and root beer all brewed on premises as well as guided tours on non-brewing days. Have your own growlers, we fill your clean growlers. Don't own one yet, no worries we have 1 and 2 liter in several styles with our logo on them.
hoursOfOperation: Sunday 12:00 - 5:00                                         Monday 12:00-6:00                                    Tuesday       CLOSED                                  Wednesday 12:00-6:00                                       Thursday 12:00-6:00                                            Friday 12:00-6:00                                             Saturday 12:00-6:00

name: Finkel & Garf Brewing Co.
description: Brewing high quality craft beer in Boulder, CO. Check back for info on our opening date. You can also follow us on Instagram, @finkelandgarf.

name: Finnegans
description: MAKING THE WORLD A BETTER PLACE ONE PINT AT A TIME.  In the same spirit that buys a pint for a lad down on his luck, we believe in helping those in need. That's why we donate every single penny of our profits to the Finnegans Community Fund. What better reason to raise a pint or two? Or twelve    Finnegans is available in more than 500 restaurants and bars and 570 liquor stores throughout Minnesota, North Dakota, South Dakota and Wisconsin. If your favorite place doesn't carry Finnegans, ask them to order it.     Finnegans and the Finnegans Community Fund does not accept any government or foundation grants of any kind – we are out there doing it for ourselves and so we invite you to join us! Do you have ideas that can help us do more? Bring it on – we would love to hear from you!

name: Fire Island Beer Company
description: Fire Island Beer Company has emerged from the handiwork of two brothers and a cousin who developed their taste for craft beer and home brewing during the summers they spent on Fire Island, the naturally beautiful barrier island just off Long Island's south shore. The relaxed island has attracted families, artists, partiers, weekend beach-goers and outdoor sports lovers for generations, yet it refuses to allow cars, pretention and the frantic pace common to NY-metro area culture. This led us to coin it “The Other New York”, a concept we find very refreshing.

name: Firefly Hollow Brewing
description: At Firefly Brewing, our mission is to express our collective pursuit of happiness through our shared passion for beer. We are a conglomerate of creative minds who believe we can make the world a better place by providing an atmosphere and a product conducive to creative expression. It is our sincerest hope that the beer we create helps you further your own creative journey and propels you down your own road to happiness. Our slogan, “Get Lit” is a testament to spreading our inspiration, because it takes more than one firefly to enlighten the world.

name: Firestone Walker Brewing Company
description: Founded in 1996 by Adam Firestone (aka the Bear) & David Walker (aka the Lion), Firestone Walker Brewing Company began as a small brewery with roots in wine country on California’s Central Coast. Now a regional brewery, our singular purpose remains – to craft ever better beer.  Passionately in pursuit of the perfect beer…and never satisfied.
hoursOfOperation: Tour Schedule:    Friday at 10:30am, 11:30am, 12:30pm, 1:30pm, 2:30pm, 3:30pm    Saturday at 10:30am, 11:30am, 12:30pm, 1:30pm, 2:30pm, 3:30pm    Sunday at 10:30am, 11:30am, 12:30pm, 1:30pm, 2:30pm, 3:30pm

name: FireWheel Brewery Co.
description: FireWheel Brewing Co. (FWBC) is run by locals, born and raised in the North Dallas area. We brewed our inaugural homebrew in January of 2010. Originally starting as away to have great tasting beer to share with family and friends, the demand quickly outstripped the supply. We expanded our equipment to over double, then triple, and continued to keep all the fermenters full and active.

name: Fish Brewing Company
description: From our home in beautiful Olympia, Washington, Fish Brewing Company has been hand-crafting ales of Northwest proportions since 1993. Then, using a system cobbled from brewing and dairy equipment, we brewed for our neighbors up and down Puget Sound. Growing steadily since, Fish is now an award-winning craft brewer with distribution throughout the Pacific Northwest and beyond.

name: Fitger's Brewhouse
description: Fitger's Brewhouse is located in the ancient Fitger's Brewery, in Duluth. We serve our own award winning hand-crafted ales and lagers brewed on premise by Fitger's Brewhouse Master Brewers. North Shore style ales and lagers, brewed with fresh Lake Superior water.    Fitger’s Brewhouse opened in 1995, after its founders took a western-states ski trip and came back inspired by that region’s brewing scene. Combining the relaxed ambience of a high-mountain brewery with uncompromising dedication to quality, Fitger’s Brewhouse established a tradition of handcrafted beer, fantastic food and excellent entertainment on Lake Superior’s North Shore.    In 2012 Fitger's Brewhouse won a bronze at the Great American Beer Festival for their Fitger’s Framboise. In 2013 they have received multiple honors including “Best Reason to Save the Growler” by the Minneapolis Star Tribune, “Best of the Lake” by Lake Superior Magazine, and “Best Brew” by Duluth Superior Magazine.    This year Fitger's Brewhouse will produce more than 80 styles and nearly 3000 barrels of handcrafted beer. Our stage hosts eclectic local and touring entertainers six nights a week.
hoursOfOperation: Mon: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Tue - Thu: 11:00 am - 1:00 am  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 2:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 12:00 am

name: Fixture Brewing Company
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 5:00 pm - 2:00 am  Fri - Sat: 5:00 pm - 2:30 am

name: Flagstaff Brewing
description: Flagstaff Brewing Company was opened in July, 1994 with the mission to provide craft-brewed beer to a thirsty mountain town, and to break the mold that has typified the atmosphere, structure and goal of brewpubs for all too long.    Beer lovers, dancing deadheads, and outdoor enthusiasts congregate to share their latest adventures while enjoying the brewery's latest creation. So sit back, pull up a pint, and take pleasure in the casual pub atmosphere of FBC.

name: Flat Branch Pub & Brewing
description: From great seasonal beers like an imperial stout, pumkin ale, or maibock to all-year ales, lagers, and stouts, this micro-brewery has it all!

name: Flat Earth Brewing Company
description: After years of careful planning  and mortgaging everything  the Flat Earth Brewing Company was brought to life in 2007 by head brewer Jeff Williamson and his wife Cathie. In search of a calmer life and an even better beer, Jeff turned his passion for brewing into a career. After a temporary stint at Northern Brewer and a job as an assistant brewer at Minneapolis Town Hall Brewery, Flat Earth opened in Saint Paul and set out to create beers not normally found in the upper Midwest. Flat Earth's distinctive brews are often inspired by the couple's travels and time spent in conversation with family and friends. The company's brewing on the edge philosophy is reflected in its stylish interpretation of traditional brewing assumptions. Today, Flat Earth Brewing produces a variety of artisan ales and lagers every month. As the beers roll out of the brewery, you're sure to see a theme develop around their names  a hint of conspiracy, perhaps. The names are meant to get people thinking and talking. Whether you enjoy Flat Earth beers at home or out with friends, there are no secrets when it comes to good beer.

name: Hamm's Building
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat: 12:00 pm - 6:30 pm

name: Flat Tail Brewing Co
description: Started in 2010 in Corvallis, OR, home of the Oregon State Beavers, Flat Tail Brewing started with a small 6 barrel system. 4 years later Brewer/Owner Dave Marliave is creating some of the best beers in Oregon.  From his flagship Tailgater Kölsch, an authentic German Style Ale, to his creative and eclectic barrel aged brews, this 25 year old wiz kid is taking Oregon by storm.  In Aug 2013, Flat Tail installed a brand new 15 barrel system and will be available all over Oregon and many more locations very soon.  Try some Dam Good Beer today!
hoursOfOperation: Open Daily 11am - 11pm

name: Flat Top Brewing Company
description: Flat Top Brewing Company is one of the highest breweries on the east coast in Banner Elk, NC at over 3000 ft. above sea level. Specializing in fine craft beer. Our beer is refreshingly elevated.

name: Flat12 Bierwerks
description: Flat12 Bierwerks is a production craft brewery based in downtown Indianapolis, USA. Flat12 brews beers for quality, consistency and tradition - with a twist. Our classic line-up includes the Upside Down Blonde, Half Cycle IPA, Pogue's Run Porter and Flat12 Amber Ale. Specialties and seasonals will feature herbs, spices and other experimentations, always geared toward flavor, taste and well-orchestrated subtlety.     Inspiration: The Flathead 12-cylinder engine - a nod to the automotive and craft brewing heritage of our neighborhood and the early 1900s era when both thrived.
hoursOfOperation: THURS 4 pm – 7 pm  FRI Noon – 8 pm  SAT Noon – 6 pm  SUN Noon – 4 pm

name: Flesk Brewing Company
description: Nano, meaning extremely small. Where we may be small in production, we are huge on flavor and personality. Brewing has begun!

name: Flix Brewhouse
description: Flix Brewhouse America’s Cinema Brewery - the only first run movie theatre in the world to incorporate a fully functioning microbrewery. By combining these concepts, Flix delivers to your theatre seat three of America’s great loves - craft beer, great food and the latest movies! All six of our stadium seating “dining rooms” are outfitted with the latest high-definition digital projection and sound technologies, wall-to-wall curved screens and feature our revolutionary Easy Glider moveable table top. We brew six beers of our own and offer 42 other draft beers for guests to enjoy. The Flix Mix lobby bar and cafe is open seven days a week to public, no ticket required, so you can come in and grab a bite to eat or have a locally brewed beer anytime!

name: Florida Avenue Ales
description: Brews that can be enjoyed rain or shine...from hot summer months to mild winters on the beach....  During hurricane season we bring the party...no matter what walk of life or Noreaster that brought you to the Sunshine State...once it hits your lips all you can think is: "Gotta Have A Florida Ave"©

name: Florida Beer Company
description: Headquartered in beautiful Cape Canaveral, FL. Florida Beer Company is Florida's state of the art brewery. With 17 years of brewing tradition, Florida Beer Company produces some of Florida's finest craft beer from its new 60,000 sq.ft. facility. Locals and visitor's to Florida's East Coast can enjoy handcrafted favorites like Swamp Ape DIPA, Florida Lager, Devil's Triangle IPA and Sunshine State PILS.

name: Flossmoor Station Brewing Company
description: Is it a family restaurant, or a world-renowned brewery? Flossmoor Station has no identity crisis — it carries both titles with panache! Named “Best Brewery in Chicago” by Chicago Magazine (August 2002), Flossmoor Station features a gleaming glass-enclosed brewery where guests can watch how its fine handcrafted beers are made. (Tours are available upon request). The brewery has won dozens of local, national and international brewing industry honors in only ten years – a distinction not lost on micro-brew aficionados.     Some of its more notable awards include being named Best Small Brewpub and Best Small Brewpub Brewer in America at the 2006 Great American Beer FestivalTM and winning gold, silver and bronze medals. Gold and silver medals were also awarded at the 2006 World Beer Cup. In addition, Flossmoor Station Brewery consistently receives top honors and recognition from the Real Ale Festival, Festival of Barrel Aged Beers and the Chicago Beer Society.    Produced entirely on-site, Flossmoor Station Brewing Company’s beers are handcrafted from the finest ingredients available, brewed in small batches with close attention to detail, and transferred to storage tanks in Flossmoor Station’s beer cellar until its flavor is at its peak. When a customer orders a pint of beer   upstairs at the massive oak bar, that lucky patron is assured of getting the freshest pint of brew money can buy.     Eight different beers round out the selection of “The Great Eight House Beers” which are offered on a regular basis at Flossmoor Station. In addition, beer enthusiasts look forward to the “Brewmaster’s Specials” which are offered in limited batches, including some seasonal favorites. Many of the brewery’s awards have gone to these more unique concoctions which have stood up to the best beers in the world at international competitions.

name: Flounder Brewing Company
description: Flounder Brewing Co. is a home grown, soon-to-be nanobrewery located in Hillsborough, New Jersey. Originally started as a hobby by Jeremy "Flounder" Lees, he was quickly joined by his brothers Michael and Daniel. With your support, we are confident that Flounder Brewing Co. will become a New Jersey favorite!

name: Fly Creek Cider Mill
description: The Fly Creek Cider Mill & Orchard is a historic, water-powered mill on the banks of Fly Creek in the heart of beautiful Central New York just minutes from Cooperstown. For more than 150 years visitors have witnessed the pressing of fresh, sweet and delicious cider creating an experience that has become a tradition shared by generations. The Mill Store Marketplace is the heart of activity with sampling of over 40 specialty food products, many made right at the Mill. Daily tastings include apple salsa, zesty salad dressings, hot sauces, preserves, aged cheddar cheese and Mill-made fudge. From the Farm Winery you can taste Hard Ciders and Apple Wines, another feature of the New York cider making tradition.

name: Flying Bison Brewing
description: For more than 800 years, brewing beer has been regulated by laws in Germany. A long tradition that all the German brewers still obey to: In 1165 the first fine for serving bad beer was imposed in Augsburg. From 1487 onwards every brewer in Munich had to confirm on an oath to the ducal Rentmeister of Upper Bavaria, stating that he would not use any ingredients but barley, hops, and water to brew beer. Originally, this oath was valid in Munich only. In 1987 it was renewed by the Munich brewers.

name: Flying Dog Brewery
description: The Flying Dog Legend begins in 1983, and like every good legend there are several versions of this tale. The villains of the peace in this story are two non-conformist, 'not likely to take it lying down' ranchers named George Stranahan and Richard McIntyre.    As George tells it, he and 11 of his closest friends and family decided to embark on what they called an “amateur mountaineering expedition” to climb K2 in the Himalayas. Under-qualified and unprepared, they started their journey with a Sherpa, a donkey, and a suitcase full of contraband. Naturally, half way through the trip the contraband was gone and the Sherpa and donkey had run off, leaving George and his group to fend for themselves. Luckily, everyone managed to make it off the mountain alive, and with a new outlook on life.    Horn Dog Denver Colorado BeerLike any good beer drinker would at the end of an experience like that, George and his group found a local Pakistani hotel bar to have a drink in. Now, alcohol is banned in most Muslim nations, but if you sign an affidavit stating you are the son of a Christian, it’s like a license to drink. George gladly signed away and got down to some serious drinking. That’s about the time he noticed a painting in the Flashman Hotel of a Flying Dog hanging on the wall that had been drawn by a local artist. Now, we all know dogs don’t fly, but nobody told this particular dog it couldn’t fly, just like no one had told George and his friends they couldn’t make this extraordinary journey. The Flying Dog became a symbol that George and his group used to describe what had happened to them with the mantra, “it is amazing what you can achieve if nobody tells you that you can't.
hoursOfOperation: Tours are offered every Thursday and Friday from 4 to 6 pm, along with two sessions on Saturday (12 to 2 pm and 2:30 - 4:30 pm).

name: Flying Fish Brewing Company
description: When Gene Muller founded Flying Fish Brewing Co. in 1995, he did so first on the World Wide Web - making it the world's first virtual microbrewery. That early Web site helped generate positive press coverage and helped attract the investors needed to make the virtual brewery a real one. Muller said the idea was to make the Web site “This Old House meets the World Wide Web”—letting people go behind the taps and see the thousands of details needed to put a microbrewery together.    He also wanted to give beer lovers a chance, via their computers, to roll up their cyber-sleeves and help build the brewery. The site let beer lovers help select and name beers, design t-shirts and labels, volunteer to be a taste-tester and even apply for a job as a brewer. Visitors to the Web site can sign up for FlyingFishMail a monthly e-mail newsletter which now boasts more than 12,000 subscribers.    Muller, who got into the brewing field to become a brewer, trained at Chicago's Siebel Institute of Technology, America's oldest brewing school. He quickly realized someone was going to have to run the day-to-day business of the brewery and now serves as President and Head Janitor (though not necessarily in that order).    Flying Fish Brewing Company is located in Cherry Hill, New Jersey, approximately seven miles east of Philadelphia. In a state that once boasted 50 breweries, it is the first microbrewery in Southern New Jersey and the first new brewery built in that part of the state in more than half a century. From its opening in late 1996, Flying Fish has tripled its capacity and become the largest of the approximately 20 craft breweries in the state.

name: Flying Mouse Brewery
description: Secluded in a hollow of the Blue Ridge mountains, the Flying Mouse Brewery brings a new craft beer experience to Botetourt County, Virginia. Our brewery is focused on the experience and enjoyment of craft beer as part of an active outdoor lifestyle, whether it be a cold draft after a long hike or a pint over conversation at dinner after a day of cycling. Join us in celebrating Virginia’s spirit of invention and the thirst for adventure. Go beer!
hoursOfOperation: Friday and Saturday 4:00pm – 9:00pm and Sunday 2:00pm – 6:00pm.

name: Flytrap Brewing
description: At Flytrap Brewing, we are dedicated to brewing high quality, hand crafted ales. Our equipment is designed to brew small batches, allowing us to ensure your glass is full of the freshest beer every time. Our goal is to consistently offer a wide range of flavorful, balanced beers in our tap-room.     From day one, The Flytrap has been created as a community centered business with a neighborhood feel. This makes the Brooklyn Arts District the perfect home for our brewery and tap-room. Along with hand crafting tasty, small batch beers, we strive to positively influence our community and Wilmington’s craft beer scene.     Our Brewery is named for the Venus flytrap, a carnivorous plant whose only native habitat in the world is within a 60 mile radius of Wilmington, NC. We are proud to call this our home town and to be associated with such a unique and impressive member of our environment.     Our equipment is on order and we are beginning construction soon. We look forward to seeing you at The Flytrap!

name: Fogbelt Brewing Company
description: Paul Hawley and Remy Martin both grew up in Sonoma County along the fog belt where the redwoods meet the vineyards. Paul and Remy have over thirty years of combined experience in the wine industry. The old saying, "it takes a lot of beer to make wine" rings especially true for these long-time friends who have been brewing together since 2004, when they worked the grape harvest in New Zealand. Remy went on to study brewing at UC Davis and has experience working at a number of local breweries. Paul has been working at his family's winery in Dry Creek Valley since 2005.    Sonoma County was once one of the largest hop growing regions in the nation, but all that remains today are the ghostly shells of old hop-kilns. Paul has been experimenting with growing hops for years. This year, Paul and Remy hope to harvest 500 vines from hop yards in Sonoma County.
hoursOfOperation: Thursday 2-8pm  Friday and Saturday 11-10pm  Sunday 11-8pm

name: Foggy Noggin Brewing
description: We are brewers of great English Styled Ales on a very small 1/2 BBL system. We are one of the world’s smallest production breweries. We take great pride in every batch to bring you consistent high quality brews year-round. You are able to get our fresh beers at our tasting room, located at our brewery in Bothell, WA and at several accounts that rotate our beers thru their line-up.
hoursOfOperation: Most Saturdays 1-4pm

name: Foggy Ridge Cider
description: Foggy Ridge Cider combines English, French & American apples to create fabulous hard cider. Visitors welcome to taste all five varieties dry to sweet.

name: Foley Brothers Brewing
description: Foley Brothers Brewing is part of the family-run Neshobe River Brewing Company located in Brandon, VT.

name: Fonta Flora Brewery
description: Fonta Flora Brewery integrates the soul of agriculture with the artisanship of zymurgy to create a menagerie of rustic and savory libations. With an emphasis on seasonal flora, Fonta Flora brings English tradition and Belgian inspiration to the Appalachian mountains of North Carolina. Fonta Flora utilizes local artists to help conceptualize the notion that fermentation is yet another medium for creating art. This uniquely artisan approach to beer yields a sustainable product filled with culture from our very own community.
hoursOfOperation: Mon: 5:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Thu - Fri: 5:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: Foolproof Brewing Company
description: Foolproof Brewing Company in Pawtucket, Rhode Island, produces high-quality, hand-crafted beers. Each of our beers is designed with a specific experience in mind.

name: Foothills Brewing Company
description: Welcome to FOOTHILLS BREWING.  Foothills Brewing began in 2004 in Winston-Salem, NC, and has evolved into one of the top craft brewing operations in the southeast United States. Ranked among ratebeer.com’s 100 best breweries in the world, Foothills has garnered numerous awards for their beers, including seven Great American Beer Festival medals and three World Cup Beer medals, more than any other North Carolina-based brewery.    Foothills brews more than twenty year-round and seasonal offerings, including best sellers Hoppyum IPA and Carolina Blonde. Year-round brands also include People’s Porter, Torch Pilsner and Jade IPA; seasonals include Cottonwood Pumpkin and the highly anticipated Sexual Chocolate Imperial Stout. Foothills, Cottonwood and Carolina brands are distributed by a network of top-level distributors in North Carolina, South Carolina, Tennessee, Virginia, and Washington D.C.

name: Forbidden Root Brewing
description: Forbidden Root is introducing a new line of craft botanical beer using natural ingredients including herbs, spices, barks, roots, honeys, stems, seeds, nuts, vanilla bean and cacao beans. We brew our beers in Chicago, IL with all natural ingredients and inspiration from early American brewing – when native plants and botanicals were a natural part of the rich, delicious beers of that forgotten era.

name: Fordham Brewing Company
description: You have to hand it to Queen Anne; she knew way back in 1703 that you couldn’t start a colony without good local brews.  That’s why she asked young Benjamin Fordham to start a brewery in the new port of Annapolis. Benjamin’s passion and dedication to making the highest quality brews were evident in every pint and the colony flourished!    Almost 300 years later, Fordham brewing was re-born in the heart of Annapolis in 1995.  With the ever-increasing demand, this frothing Fordham giant was more than our small brewery could handle. In an effort to provide more people with our brews, our plucky staff grabbed our recipes and moved Fordham to its new castle in Dover, Delaware…a brand new stainless steel castle of opportunity!    Despite geographical changes, our brewery is happy and healthy in Dover, and more productive than ever before. Fordham Brewing remains true to its roots, its recipes and Annapolis heritage.

name: Forest & Main Brewing Company
description: Nestled in a victorian-style house dating from the 1880s, Forest & Main, Brewery & Pub, in Ambler, Pa. creates old world style ales, and seasonally inspired dishes.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Sun: 4:00 pm - 12:00 am

name: Forge Brew Works
description: Forge Brew Works is a Northern Virginia Micro Brewery opening in Summer of 2013

name: Forgotten Boardwalk Brewing
description: Forgotten Boardwalk Brewing exists to spark curiosities through our craft beer and folklore. We will be offering a high standard of beer with an artisanal attention to detail. Forgotten Boardwalk and our beer will engage your curiosity by empowering the drinker to learn more about the process, its ingredients, and with tall tales to match.    Forgotten Boardwalk Brewing will be opening its doors in May and all are welcome.

name: Former Future Brewing Company
description: Former, meet Future.  It’s simple, really.  We take historical recipes, deconstruct them, and place our own futuristic interpretation into them.  We reconstruct them, but in ways you may not expect.  Our taproom displays our brewing process from laboratory to tap.  The Former Future staff is service and beer focused.  All of our friendly, down-to-Earth employees are certified by the Cicerone program and are card-carrying beer geeks.
hoursOfOperation: Wed-Thu 4:00pm-10:00pm  Fri 2:00pm-10:00pm  Sat noon-10:00pm  Sun 11:00am-10:00pm

name: Fort Bend Brewing Company
description: Fort Bend Brewing, Fort Bend's First Craft Brewery, combines creativity, the Texas state-of-mind, with high quality ingredients to make exquisite craft beers.

name: Fort Collins Brewery
description: The Fort Collins Brewery is a family-owned, handcrafted brewery in Northern Colorado. FCB resides in a new 30,000 square foot facility with a full-size restaurant; Gravity 1020 Modern Tavern, offering a locally sourced menu and open seven days a week.     For more information, visit fortcollinsbrewery.com or call 970-472-1499.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed: 11:00 am	 - 6:00 pm  Thu - Sat: 11:00 am - 7:00 pm

name: Fort George Brewery
description: The Fort George Brewery + Public House was the original settlement site of Astoria founded in March 1811 by Captain Jonathan Thorn. In its heyday, Astoria was the Pacific Fur Company's primary fur trading post in the Northwest. Under temporary British authority it was renamed Fort George after King George the 3rd. In 1924 the Fort George Building was erected to house an automotive repair facility until the late 1990's. Briefly abandoned and sadly neglected, the Fort George building has been recently revitalized as a home to the Blue Schorcher Bakery and our brewpub. We are honored to play a part in the Fort and Astoria's renaissance.

name: Fort Myers Brewing Company
description: Lee County's first microbrewery. Award winning craft ales brewed 7 barrels at a time.

name: Fort Point Beer Company
description: Fort Point Beer Company is a New American brewery - the product of a thriving American craft beer culture, shaped by deeply San Franciscan values: quality craftsmanship and a spirit of innovation. We create balanced, thoughtful beers that reference traditional styles but are by no means bound to them. For us, brewing is the confluence of creative expression and refined technique. We want our beers to tell a story, inspire an idea, and be thoroughly enjoyable.    Fort Point Beer Company was founded in 2014 by brothers Tyler and Justin Catalana in the Presidio of San Francisco. The brewery resides in an historic Presidio building that was formerly used as an Army motor pool. Being situated in this iconic landscape reinforces our pride in San Francisco and in the beer we brew. Head Brewer Mike Schnebeck has developed a deft and impassioned brewing style over the past years at Mill Valley Beerworks and leads the pioneering spirit of our beers.

name: Fortnight Brewing Company
description: We believe that beer is a social beverage and good beer should be enjoyed with good friends. That is why we aim to bring a line of clean easy-drinking English inspired ales that everyone can enjoy to the Triangle area in late 2013.     We love beer with extreme flavors or high alcohol content as much as the next guy, but that's not for everyone, which is why we will be producing extremely balanced and flavorful beers at a lower alcohol level that will be easily approachable and everyone will be able to find a beer that they enjoy in our lineup.    Fortnight Brewing is a true partnership of local and English flavors. The company's ownership consists of both English citizens and North Carolina natives, and our beers will utilize premium English malts and hops as well as locally-grown ingredients.     Fortnight Brewing will be located in Cary NC with plans of opening in Summer or Fall of 2013. Keep your eyes open for a list of upcoming tasting events at your favorite area bottle shops, bars and restaurants!

name: Fossil Cove Brewing Co.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Thu: 4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri: 4:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Sat: 2:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Sun: 2:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Founders Brewing Company
description: Founders Brewing Company, founded by Mike Stevens and Dave Engbers produced its first beer in November of 1997. Built out of a dream and a passion for home brewing, what started out as a hobby quickly became a thriving business.  As the years have passed, Founders has built its brewery on the exploration of recipe development and brewing techniques. We are not the standard micro-brewery, rather we have traveled a path that breaks from the standard craft-brewer.    Carving a niche out of the craft industry, Founders Brewing Company has built its reputation on producing very unique beers. Our focus is to offer our wholesalers, retailers and consumers a product that stands alone on the shelf and offers a true drinking experience to our friends, the consumer.  As the years have passed, Founders has built its brewery on the exploration of recipe development and brewing techniques. We are not the standard micro-brewery, rather we have traveled a path that breaks from the standard craft-brewer. Carving a niche out of the craft industry, Founders Brewing Company has built its reputation on producing very unique beers. Our focus is to offer our wholesalers, retailers and consumers a product that stands alone on the shelf and offers a true drinking experience to our friends, the consumer.

name: Founding Fathers Brewing Company
description: Did you know that the best selling beers in America are produced by foreign-owned companies?    As Americans we believe the values and ideas that motivated our Founding Fathers are worth conserving.    By developing a brand name that is associated with these same principles and beliefs, Americans will be able to pave the direction of our great Country with the purchase of the New American beer, Founding Fathers Lager and Light.    50% of all profits will be donated back to the families of our troops. Better Beer, Better Cause.    When you see a Founding Fathers label in your local grocery or watering hole, you will associate it with the level of excellence that has made America the greatest Country in the World.

name: Fountain City Brewing Co / Monarch Public House
Fountain Square Brewing Company
description: Back in the Summer of 2011, we got the crazy idea to startup a brewery, not because we wanted to be on the bandwagon, but because we wanted something different, something our talents and passion for beer could make happen. Out technical background in Microbiology, Chemistry, and Automation, made up the perfect storm needed to produce quality beer with a higher level of consistency and with improved shelf stability. Our passion for beer and diversity of tastes allowed us to craft carefully refined recipes that we know will delight you.    We chose Fountain Square because of the community. Since we will be the first to admit our creativity and talents exist on a side of the brain that has little capability to draw, we have this admiration and attraction to those whose talents reside in the arts. We have connected to this community over the past year and look forward to being a vehicle for expressing its artistic nature. Fountain Square is a community of hard working, creative, fun loving, and genuine people. They are probably the most helpful people we've ever met. We are truly honored to be a part of the community and will strive to be worthy ambassadors and stewards.
hoursOfOperation: Thursday - 4pm to 9pm  Friday - 4pm to 10pm  Saturday - 2pm to 10pm  Sunday - Noon - 6pm

name: Four Corners Brewing Company
description: The story of Four Corners Brewing Co. is simple. We’re Dallas natives and we’re craft beer fans. Most importantly, we are a dedicated team of brewers with the goal of offering handcrafted beers that pair well with the food, music, art and culture in our hometown. Refreshing and soulful, it’s what we call “local flavor” and we proudly raise a glass to that!     Flavorful and satisfying   “All Day” Ales…that’s what we’re brewing.

name: Four Fathers Brewing, LLC
description: Not All Beers Are Created Equal
hoursOfOperation: Thursday 4pm to 9pm  Friday 4pm to 9pm  Saturday 12pm to 9pm  Sunday 11am to 6pm

name: Four Friends Brewing
description: We have conceived, created, and built, from the start; a meaningful brewery in the heart of Charlotte to celebrate your growing demand for hand crafted quality beer. With a focus on the revival of artisan brewing, we strive to create the highest quality products available.    Brewing techniques as timeless as beer itself are used to create a uniquely handmade product. We craft the finest possible beer in small batches normally not found in the industry today which is typically dominated by mega mergers of international breweries. Is this difficult and more time consuming? Yes. Does it require more manual labor? Yes. Is it worth it? Unequivocally, YES. As beer is a “living, breathing” product made from precise strains of active yeast cultures, it just makes good sense to nurture the product in very manageable small batches. We believe that the extra care and attention devoted to each batch produces the best possible result and you as our friends deserve no less.    We hope that you will have the opportunity to experience the limited quantities of hand crafted beer that we produce in Charlotte. When you do, please notice the complexities of the aroma, the silkiness of its body, and the explosion of flavors as the grains merge artfully with the yeast cultures and noble hops blended meticulously for each variety. Join us in celebrating the pleasures of hand crafted beers and life in the Queen City finally merged into this moment in time and allow yourself the pleasure of enjoying a uniquely Charlotte experience.
hoursOfOperation: Saturday: 3pm - 7pm

name: Four Horsemen Brewing Company
description: Micro-Brewery producing handcrafted Ales and Lagers. Four Horsemen Brewing Company offers a tasting room opened to the public weekly on limited hours/days.
hoursOfOperation: Friday & Saturday: 4PM - 11PM

name: Four Peaks Brewing Company
description: Beer: the Final Frontier...these are voyages of the Four Peaks Brewing Co., our ongoing mission: to create delicious new brews, to seek out new styles and new types of ingredients, to boldly brew what no one has brewed before...

name: Four Saints Brewing Company
description: Four Saints Brewing Company will be a new nanobrewery located in Asheboro, North Carolina. Please join us on our adventure of becoming the first brewery ever in Randolph County!

name: Four Seasons Brewing Company
hoursOfOperation: Mon: 2:00 pm - 6:00 pm  Tue: 1:00 pm - 5:00 pm  Thu: 3:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Fri: 4:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat - Sun: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Fox & Crow Brewery
description: While Fox & Crow Brewery started out as a home brewery in Wilmington, NC, the head brewer and founder, Chip Bulla, actually began dreaming of turning what began as a hobby into a profession back in 2002. It was at that point he brewed his first extract batch and from then on he was hooked. After a few years, like many other home brewers, he moved into all-grain brewing and never looked back. Since then, he has been dedicated to perfecting both his craft and the quality of his beers. Now armed with an arsenal of hand-crafted recipes, he and his two partners, Andy Kerkhoff and Ashby Armistead, have decided to venture into the commercial arena and turn the dream that began in 2002 into a reality. In 2014, Fox & Crow Brewery will begin its journey and we invite you to like our page, share with your friends, and follow us on our path as we strive to share our passion for beer and brewing with a larger audience. Cheers!

name: Fox Barrel Cider
description: Fox Barrel Cider Company was founded by Sean Deorsey and Bruce Nissen in 2004. Both tired of the corporate life, in the accounting & sales arenas, Sean and Bruce decided to start their own business. Sean has been crafting ciders since his days at Santa Clara Universityand believes that "it's much better to crunch apples than to crunch numbers." Along with his wife and two young daughters, Sean resides in Auburn, California.    Bruce has worked in sales, marketing and business management roles over the past several years. He had been interested in developing an organization and had become smitten with cider since introduced to it several years ago. Along with his wife and their young son & daughter, Bruce resides in Colfax, California.    After looking throughout the Sierra Foothills, the pair chose a location in the historic railroad town of Colfax, California. The cidery originally sat in the historic Fruit Growers Exchange Association, a building that once was a storage and packing facility for the abundance of fruits grown in the area. It seemed appropriate to use this space, bringing it back towards its original use. After two years in that location, the cidery outgrew the space and moved to a much larger facility less than a mile down the road.

name: Fox River Brewing Company
description: Dating back to 1846, the city of Oshkosh has deep roots in brewing fine beers http://oshkoshbeertimeline.blogspot.com/. Fox River Brewing Company opened on the Fox River in Oshkosh, late 1995. Under the name of Fratellos (meaning brothers) and Fox River Brewing Co., the Supple Brothers, long-standing restaurateurs, dove into the brewing industry.

name: Franconia Brewing Company
description: With a brewing heritage that dates back to the 1800's, Franconia Brewing Company is more than just a local brewery, it's the essence of the true Bavarian brew. By combining the local accessibility of North Texas with our German/heritage/history we are going to provide the fine people of North Texas with a taste of some of the most genuine and freshest Bavarian beer available.     Franconia Brewing Company not only delivers the freshest brews to your favorite restaurants, pubs, and taverns, we also have adopted many green practices to help improve the environmental concerns in North Dallas.

name: Frankenmuth Brewery
description: Frankenmuth’s founding fathers brought the traditions of brewing to the Mid-Michigan forests in 1845. John Matthias Falliers founded Frankenmuth’s first brewery in 1857. Cousins William Knaust and Martin Heubisch opened the Cass River Brewery just north of the Fallier property in 1862, where the Frankenmuth Brewery continues to stand today.    The Cass River Brewery was purchased by Johann Geyer in 1874, and renamed Geyer’s Brothers Brewing Co. For the next 112 years, the facility operated under many names including the Frankenmuth Brewing Co. Ferdinand “Fred” Schumacher from Duseldorf, Germany, purchased the brewery one year before a fire destroyed most of the structure in 1987.    The microbrewery continued operation following ownership acquisition by Randall E. Heine in 1990. The nation’s second oldest microbrewery was at peak production in 1996, distributing more than 30,000 barrels of locally produced microbrews across 25 states, when a F3 tornado struck our facility, causing several million dollars of damage. A brew pub was opened in 2003 and closed three years later.    Our Frankenmuth Brewing Company, housed in the historic four story, 28,000 square foot building is an exciting destination for food lovers and beer aficionados alike.

name: Franklin Street Brewing Company
description: As a small batch craft brewery, we believe in providing a rotating range of styles of high quality beers that would not normally be available in the region. Each month we will offer six or more different styles of beer for your enjoyment.    With our 20 gallon system (and years of experience), our beers progressed from “drinkable” to award winning! Our IPA recipe won 2nd place in the Iowa State Fair home brewing competition in 2012 in the Imperial IPA category and 3rd place in the IPA category. Our Blonde Ale also took 3rd place in its category.

name: Franklin's Restaurant, Brewery & General Store
description: Franklins is located in the heart of historic Hyattsville in a landmark building built in the 1880’s as a blacksmith and carriage shop. Starting in 1910, the building housed the Hyattsville Hardware Co. which stayed in continuous operation until 1992. In its heyday, the hardware Co. was the center of community activity, selling everything from pots and pans to remedies for livestock maladies, chicken feed and of course, nuts and bolts. Many people bought their first washing machines and iceboxes here. Trains from Baltimore stopped right out back and delivered loads of lumber, stacks of seed, even whole houses from the Sears catalog. Neighbors gathered and talked about the weather, the schools, rising prices and changing times

name: Freak'N Brewing Company
description: Freak'N Brewing Company has been established to bring quality craft beer to Phoenix's west valley and beyond. We are committed to brewing quality beers in unique & creative styles that are not typically found in brewpubs and resturants. We are a brewery that loves not only the science of brewing, but also the art of making a great beer. If you are a beer enthusiast, like we are, then come on out have a Freak'N Brew!!

name: Frederick Brewing
description: Facilities of Frederick Brewing company were bought out by Flying Dog

name: Fredericksburg Brewing Company
description: We began our operation in 1994, within months of the passage of legislation allowing brewpub operation in the state of Texas. We found a public eagerly awaiting the enjoyment of our cold, freshly brewed beers along with our freshly prepared, flavorful foods.    Today we are the oldest brewpub in Texas, and have been proclaimed by numerous publications, as the "Best in Texas". Our reputation is confirmed by our award winning brews in both U.S. and International Competitions. Most importantly, is the reinforcement that we are doing things right, shown by the repetitive visits of our loyal guest from both near and far.    Fredericksburg Brewing Company claimed a gold medal at the 2008 Great American Beer Festival Competition, the largest national beer competition that recognizes the most outstanding beers produced in the United States today. We have been in operation since 1994 and have twice been proclaimed as the Best Brewpub in Texas, by Texas Monthly. In addition to the 2008 gold medal for our Hauptstrasse Helles (Mainstreet Light), previous silver and bronze medals have been received for our Porter and Red Ale.    We are located at 245 East Main Street which is in the heart of the historic, downtown shopping district in beautiful Fredericksburg, Texas. To house our operations, we restored a great two story 1890s building to historical standards. The first floor of the building provides space for our dining area, our large air-conditioned biergarten, and a lager room with retail space.The second floor provides space for our unique "Bed & Brew" facilities. There are twelve rooms with baths, each decorated in a different theme.    In our fair little town, sidewalk consumption is allowed, so that you can take our cold brews on your sidewalk stroll.

name: Free Range Brewing
description: Free Range Brewing, a brewpub currently in its final planning stage, will blend farmhouse tradition, modern sustainability and an industrial flair to create an experience unlike any other in Charlotte. With a passion for creating curiously good beers, Free Range will offer artisan brews that pair harmoniously with its farm-to-table dishes. Free Range will offer an intimate and intriguing dining space that merges with the brewery itself for a uniquely urban-farmstead feel. Beer-lovers will also be able to enjoy Free Range draughts at select area bottle-shops, bars and beer-centric establishments. The brewpub will take advantage of both the culinary and cultural resources from the region to create a product and experience that is distinctly homegrown.

name: Free State Brewing Company
description: “Because without beer, things do not seem to go as well.”  In 1989, Free State Brewing Company became the first legal brewery in Kansas in over 100 years. Since opening the doors at our Mass Street HQ, we’ve been working day in and day out to be a haven for beer lovers, where good beer and good food can inspire lively conversations and memorable experiences.    Our 14-barrel brewhouse is made up of some of the best equipment available to the small brewer, but we still think the most important ingredients are the care and respect that our enthusiastic, knowledgeable staff has for each and every beer that we make. And now that we’re producing bottled beers in our expanded bottling facility, our attention to detail and dedication to great taste and quality can be experienced by people all over Kansas and Missouri.

name: Free Will Brewing Company
description: We are a production brewery located in bucks county PA.  Look for our beer on tap at finer bars and restaurants throughout eastern and central PA. We strive to create unique and delicious beer using traditional ingredients.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Thu: 4:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Fri: 4:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 7:00 pm    Tastings are held Thursday-Friday 4-7pm and Saturdays 12-4pm.   Saturday tours are at 1 and 3pm.

name: Freedom Brewery
description: Established in 1995, Freedom Brewery is a pioneer of premium craft lager brewing in the UK. Now one of the leading brewery’s in this sector, Freedom’s range of beers have won over 25 International and National awards in the last 4 years alone.    All Freedom Beer is bottom fermented in closed, pressurized vessels. Lager is fermented at a lower temperature than ale and therefore takes longer – between 7 to 14 days, in contrast to 4 to 5 days. During fermentation, the beer naturally carbonates itself as a result of the breakdown of sugars to alcohol.    After the fermentation stage, the ‘young’ beer is transferred to maturation or storage tanks, where it’s stored at -1 ?C. Freedom Brewery has a minimum maturation period of 4 weeks; this improves both the beer’s flavour profiles and naturally increases its stability, removing the need for chemical intervention. The verb ‘Lagerun’ is German for ‘to store’ – ironic as the majority of mass produced ‘lagers’ are brewed within days, with little or no maturation time at all.    Freedom Brewery sterile triple filters its beers to remove any remaining yeast and protein cells. This is instead of pasteurisation which, whilst being a cheaper process, carries the risk of ruining the beer’s natural flavours. Freedom’s first sterile filtration uses diatomaceous earth in contrast to isinglass, which is a substance obtained from the swim bladders of fish. As a result, all Freedom Beers are certified by the Vegan Society.

name: Freedom's Edge Brewing
description: Stop in and enjoy one of our hand crafted beers. Come out and enjoy one of our hand crafted ales and take a trip back in time.    The Tivoli Building was built in 1892 and was operated by the Richardson brothers as a saloon (and reportedly a brothel) during the period when Cheyenne was known as the "Paris of the west".     The Tivoli has been completely restored and is ready to once again become one of the finest establishments in Cheyenne Wyoming.
hoursOfOperation: Monday: CLOSED  Tuesday - Thursday: 3PM-9PM  Friday:   3PM-11PM  Saturday:   11AM-11PM   Sunday:   CLOSED

name: Freehouse Brewery
description: Brewing Belgian and Anglo-American style ales on the banks of the Ashley River. Purest ingredients. Bold flavors. Sessionable, digestible beer.

name: Freetail Brewing Company
description: #1 rated brewpub in Texas (rated by BeerAdvocate.com) located at NW Military Highway and Loop 1604. Winner of the San Antonio Express-News 2009 Critics Choice and 2010 Silver Medalist for "Best Place for a Cold Beer" & San Antonio Magazine's Best of the City "Best Place for a Beer" for two years running (2009, 2010).  Winner of Draft Magazine "Top 25 Beers of 2010" in the smoked beer category for "Rubio Fumando".    Named after the official Texas flying mammal, the Mexican Free-tail Bat, Freetail opened its doors Thanksgiving Weekend 2008 and has been cranking out highly rated, fresh, off-the-wall brews ever since.    We feature fresh craft brews from in house and around the state of Texas in addition to artisan pizzas, sandwiches, salads, appetizers and desserts made from the highest quality ingredients.    Join the friendliest staff in town for happy hour M 4-7 andW-F 3-7 with $5 apps and $1 off beer and wine!  Or try us on Tuesdays for Pint Night where Freetail pints are $2.50 all day, or Mondays for $10 pitchers.  Enjoy Freetail brews and guest beer from microbreweries around the state in our spacious open seating, or large outdoor patio with bar service, and catch the game on one of our nine high-definition TV's and two 100"+ screens.free_wi_fi_spot_copy.gif  Free WiFi for customers.
hoursOfOperation: Sunday: Noon-Midnight  Monday: 4pm - Midnight  Tuesday - Saturday: 11:30am to Midnight or Later

name: Freewheel Brewing Company
description: English-style cask conditioned session ales brewed on site. Our taproom is comfortable & eclectic—part brewery, pub, and beer garden.

name: Fremont Brewing
description: Fremont Brewing was born of our love for our home and history as well as the desire to prove that beer made with the finest local ingredients – organic when possible --, is not the wave of the future but the doorway to beer's history. Starting a brewery in the midst of the Great Recession is clearly an act of passion. We invite you to come along with us and enjoy that passion -- because beer matters.    Known as the Center of the Universe, Fremont is industrial and sleekly postmodern -- home to artists, fisherpeople, tradespeople, technology geeks, and lots of beer lovers. And, for those who don't know, Washington state is home to the second largest hop growing region in the world.
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Wednesday: 11:00 - 5:00pm  Thursday: 11:00 - 8:00pm  Friday: 11:00 - 8:00pm  Saturday:   Noon - 8:00pm  Sunday: Noon - 5:00pm

name: French Broad Brewing Company
description: Since opening our doors in 2001, our goal has been to create traditional European style beers while maintaining the unique flavor that is Asheville. Our tasty creations can be found all over North Carolina, South Carolina, Georgia, and Tennessee, with new territories coming soon.
hoursOfOperation: 1p-8p Mon-Sat

name: Frey's Brewing Company
description: Frey's Brewing Company is a small, Farmhouse Brewery in Frederick County, Maryland. Frederick County is home to several wineries and craft breweries. A small farmhouse brewery such as ours fits in the area nicely.    We received our Maryland Beer Manufacturer's Class 5 license on February 1st, 2013. We are allowed to sell beer for off-premise consumption directly to customers that have taken a tour of the brewery - but the amount is limited to 288 ounces. We are currently not allowed to do tastings at our facility, nor allow on-premise consumption of alcohol (unless it is part of a scheduled event). As of July 1st, 2013, we can refill growlers - so bring in your clean growler and we'll fill it up!

name: Frog Level Brewing Company
description: Our brewery is named for its location and its attitude. Until the railroad came in 1884, Frog level was swampland.  By the 30’s and 40’s Frog Level was the hustle & bustle in Waynesville. This was the place where blue collar folks worked hard in factories and warehouses to raise families…to do their part to make Haywood County what it is today.    Ours beers are distinct in their attitude and ingredients, by brewing as much “Haywood County” as possible into each batch!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed: 2:00pm - 6:30pm  Thur - Sat:  2:00pm - 8:30pm

name: Front Range Brewing Company
description: Lafayette's first craft brewery is here. We feature a variety of styles from American to Belgian with some barrel aging.    Stop by our tasting room to enjoy a pint then fill up a growler to enjoy at home.
hoursOfOperation: Mon: 3:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Wed - Thu: 3:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Fri: 3:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 5:00 pm

name: Front Street Brewery
description: Front Street Brewery, nestled beautifully along the bank of the Mighty Mississippi, has served the fine community of Davenport, Iowa for over 17 years. Front Street Brewery prides itself on embracing the local brewing history by providing some of the finest hand-crafted beers and ales in the area. This along with a relaxing dining atmosphere surley makes Front Street Brewery a must stop.      Front Street Brewery, a locally owned and operated business, is committed to continuing this legacy of providing great service and a friendly environment. After all, “We Are the Beer that Makes People Hoppy!”

name: Front Street Brewery
description: Located in Historic Downtown, the Front Street Brewery is Wilmington’s only Restaurant with its own Brewery. Our staff takes pride in offering fresh modern American cuisine, ranging from gourmet burgers to fine entrees and everything in between, at a reasonable price.    Front Street Brewery focuses on traditional beers as well as stretching the limits from time to time with various oak aged beers, sours and experimental styles throughout the year.
hoursOfOperation: Open daily for lunch, dinner and late night.

name: Frothy Beard Brewing Company
description: The Frothy Beard Brewing Company is a nano-brewery set in Charleston, South Carolina focusing on producing full flavored ales and lagers for the region.
hoursOfOperation: Wed: 5:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Thu: 6:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri: 5:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Sat: 11:00 am - 2:00 pm

name: The Full Moon Cafe
description: The Full Moon Brewery specializes in British and Irish style beers. We use Marris Otter malt as our base and then add various combinations of Black Patent, Brown malt, Crystal malt, and Roasted Barley depending on the individual beer. We use Fuggles, East Kent Golding and Challenger hops. Our brew house is a one barrel RIMS system filling one and two barrel fermenters.

name: Full Pint Brewing Company
description: Full Pint Brewing Company is a collaborative brewery featuring some of the Pittsburgh area’s finest brewers and beer nerds.

name: Full Sail Brewing Company
description: Specialists in the liquid refreshment arts since 1987.    Independent and employee-owned, the Full Sail brewery is perched on a bluff in Hood River, Oregon, overlooking the most epic wind and kite surfing spot in the world. Swing by and sample our awarding winning brews, grab a bite, and soak up the view. Guided brewery tours free of charge daily at 1, 2, 3 and 4 PM. Open Daily @ 11:30 am Serving Lunch and Dinner.    Brought to you courtesy of the mad brewing skills of the Full Sail Crew, makers of Full Sail Amber, Pale, IPA, Session Premium Lager and Session Black Premium Dark Lager, available year round.     Seasonally we feature our Limited Edition (LTD) brews and Wassail. We also brew an ever changing line of Brewmaster Reserve beers that range from super hopped bitters to barleywines.

name: Full Tilt Brewing
description: In this time of exploding craft brewing around the country you really need to step up your game to stand out in the crowd. No shortcuts. No easy way outs. When we brew, we brew with the best ingredients, the best equipment, and complete devotion to making the best beer we possibly can.    We believe in the exploration and advancement of all things craft brew. We refuse to cut corners and are always looking for new ways to improve on our products. We strive to be the best and until we are we will never stop attempting to blow your minds!

name: Fullsteam Brewery
description: Fullsteam is a Durham, North Carolina brewery inspired by the agricultural and culinary traditions of the South.    Our mission is to craft a distinctly Southern beer style using local farmed goods, heirloom grains, and Southern botanicals. Like what, you wonder? We're making beer with sweet potatoes, corn grits, summer basil, and malted barley house-smoked over hickory. Other successful "plow to pint" experiments to-date include beer brewed with scuppernong grapes, persimmon, paw paw, rhubarb and more.     Ultimately, our vision is to craft a year-round, sustainable, scalable, and distinctly Southern beer brewed 100% with local ingredients. That's the quest. We're a long ways from realizing this vision, but we hope you enjoy the adventure as much as we expect to. Interested? Read more about Southern-style beer.
hoursOfOperation: MONDAY: 4pm to 10pm  TUES, WED, THURS: 4pm to 12am  FRIDAY: 4pm to 2am  SATURDAY: 12pm to 2am  SUNDAY: 12pm to 10pm

name: Fulton Brewing Company
description: The Fulton Brewing Company is a local craft brewery located in Minneapolis, Minnesota. Brewing professionally since 2009 (and out of a garage since 2006), this small team of brewers have created a line of beers that has been in high demand among bars and pubs in the Minneapolis/St. Paul area. Since moving to a new location in 2011, the Fulton Brewery is the only production brewery operating in Downtown Minneapolis. A taproom at the brewery is currently under construction with a planned opening in March 2012.
hoursOfOperation: Fridays 3 - 7  Saturdays Noon - 4

name: Brewpub
description: Delicious Food and Fermented Beverages.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Thu: 3:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri: 3:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sat: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: Funk Brewing Company
description: Avant-Garde brewers dedicated to the innovation of hop accentuated ales and the revival of rustic farmhouse style beer.

name: Funkwerks
description: In 2007 Gordon Schuck’s recipe design and brewing skills resulted in a gold medal-winning Saison at the National Homebrew Competition.
