name: Sparks
description: Great Basin Brewing Co. makes fresh hand-crafted beer right before your eyes using the finest American & European grains, hops & yeast. The rugged beauty and free spirit of this region have inspired the creation of the brewery and the beers that you enjoy. We invite you to celebrate our heritage with us.

name: Great Bear Brewing
description: No longer brewing.    There is now another brewery on the same site though.

name: Great Crescent Brewery
description: The Great Crescent Brewery beers are made with all malt, fresh hops and whole ingredients. Every beer is hand-crafted in small batches using traditional brewing methods. We package our beer in self-pressurizing mini-kegs that hold the equivalent of a case of beer, half–gallon refillable growler bottles and 1/6 barrel (5 gallon) kegs that can be used in commercial and home draft systems. Some of our specialty beers, like our Cherry Ale, will only be available in limited quantities.  We are a production brewery that sells beer right from the premises. Although we don’t currently have a tasting room where we can sell beer by the glass – we will be offering samples to help you decide which beer to purchase.    We are open to the public Wednesday-Friday 2pm to 7pm, Saturday 12 (noon) to 7pm and Sunday 12 (noon) to 4pm. You can purchase our beers outside of the brewery at The Pour House in Aurora, Indiana, Bakers Discount Liquors in Rising Sun, Indiana and Whitey’s in Lawrenceburg, Indiana. We are also available on draft at Bourbons Bar & Grill in Lawrenceburg, Indiana.
hoursOfOperation: Friday 1PM to 6PM  Saturday Noon to 6PM  Closed Sunday through Thursday

name: Great Divide Brewing Company
description: These beers have landed an impressive amount of acclaim: Great Divide beers have earned 18 Great American Beer Festival medals and 5 World Beer Cup awards. Great Divide was also ranked 8th in Ratebeer.com’s 2010 “The Best Brewers in the World” and was ranked 7th in Beer Advocate’s 2009 “All-Time Top Breweries on Planet Earth.”    But why take their word for it? Crack open a bottle and decide for yourself.

name: Great Flood Brewing Company
description: Louisville craft brewery located in the heart of the highlands with a rotating offering of ales.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 4:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sat: 2:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sun: 1:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Great River Brewery
description: Great River Brewery started in October of 2004 as a Brew Pub in Iowa City.  In December of 2008 we moved our entire brewing operation to Davenport, Iowa with hopes of starting our lifelong dream of packaging our beers.    In February 2009 we brewed our first batch of beer in our new Location.  Packaging started in May of 2010, with our 483 Pale Ale and Roller Dam Red Ale in 16 oz. cans.   Great River Brewery’s history is still being written each and every day.

name: Great Sex Brewing
description: Great Sex Brewing (GSB) began as an idea in the early 1990's when Doug Talbot and some friends attempted to purchase an old historic building near Vail, Colorado for micro-brewing purposes. Doug's intent was to use the name as it appears now.    After a number of twists, turns, bumps and grinds Jeff Talbot became involved and GSB was eventually incorporated in California at the turn of the century. Our main office is in Redding, CA, so you might say Redding is "The Home of Great Sex!"

name: Great South Bay Brewery
description: GSB is a Craft Brewery in Long Island, NY, Specializing in American, Belgian & German Beers, with much added creativity.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri:	3:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat:	12:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Great Storm Brewing
description: About Great Storm Brewing    Just like you, we love beer. We've been making beer for many years now and wanted to share our love of beer with as many people as we could. With that in mind, we founded Great Storm Brewing in 2010, and opened our doors and our taps to the public in March 2012.    Our name? Well, for us, there's a lot of anticipation in tasting a new beer. The way the foam settles in a glass of dark stout, or the raining effect you can see in a pint of IPA served on nitro... they remind us sometimes of the expectant feeling we get watching powerful storms roll in over the mountains in our home town of Colorado Springs. Yes, we tend to wax poetic over a pint glass. I told you we love beer. But anyway, that was part of the inspiration. The other part was our beloved half Husky, half Aussie brewdog, Storm. He's a little... wild. Like our beers.      We hope you'll find the same passion for drinking our beers as we do for making them. Come in and see us, we'll be pleased to pour you a pint.    And maybe wax a little poetic about it.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu: 1:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: Green Bench Brewing Co.
description: In the early 1900's St. Petersburg was known as "the Green Bench City". At their height some 2,500 benches lined the downtown sidewalks inviting passers-by to slow their pace and make friends of strangers. In the same way Green Bench beer will serve as a catalyst for community and cheer. People will gather around a pint (or two) to share in both good times and bad, to discuss business or tell a joke, to reminisce about life or dream about the future, to get up and dance to the music or to just sit back, relax, and enjoy the brew.

name: Green Door Brewing Company
description: Green Door Brewing is a nano-brewery based in Attleboro MA. We specialize in pre-prohibition American style ales & lagers, and other eclectic zymurgic stylings.

name: Green Flash Brewing Company
description: A small company with big ideas.    Mike and Lisa Hinkley took their interest in the craft beer industry to a new level in 2002 when they founded Green Flash Brewing Company. Former pub owners, Mike and Lisa jumped into brewing, and in 2004 renowned brewmaster Chuck Silva joined the team.    With Chuck on board we began brewing premium style beers, modern twists on traditional styles, and our beers began to develop a following. Cutting edge brews, Green Flash Brewing Company’s beers don’t fit traditional guidelines, instead we let our hybrid, benchmark beers blaze their own trail.    Located in San Diego, CA, we specialize in brewing assertive and distinctive beers, such as our West Coast I.P.A.: an award-winning beer whose wide acceptance has helped define a category. We also brew seasonal, collaborative and barrel-aged beers.    Our award-winning beers are on draft and bottled and are available throughout the United States in bars, restaurants and retail outlets.

name: Green Lion Brewing Company
description: What is Green Lion Brewing Company?    GLBC is the manifestation of twelve combined years of experimentation in fermentation. More than this it is the product of passion and drive to improve community resilience, bolster local agriculture, and support local businesses.     Through our journey into brewing and fermentation we have discovered a world of endless possibility with beer. The spectrum of beers available today are just a fraction of a taste of what's possible. Beer has been around for thousands of years and with this come thousands of recipes, tales of yore, ancient forgotten knowledge, and a myriad of spices, herbs, and unique brewing styles that have been enjoyed throughout the ages. One of our goals is to rediscover these long forgotten recipes and styles and modernize them for today.    Our passion for knowledge and drive for quality keep us enthralled with the world of fermentation. It is our pleasure to craft quality beer not only for the palate but also to create beer for the mind.

name: Green Man Brewing Company
description: The ancient legend of the Green Man influenced our brewery's inception in 1997. As one of Asheville's oldest breweries, we are proud to craft some of the beer scene's most iconic ales. Loyalty to traditional brewing techniques while creating innovative ales is Green Man's constant quest.
hoursOfOperation: The tasting room is open seven days a week at 4 o'clock, or maybe earlier

name: Green Room Brewing
description: Microbrewery now open at 228 3rd Street N Jacksonville Beach, FL. Now on tap, Florida Brewed Craft beers. Coming soon, 6 in house brewed beers with 10 guest taps for other florida breweries.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Fri: 4:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sat: 12:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sun: 2:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Green Room Burgers & Beer
description: People around here love a local, handcrafted beer, and that is what we aim to provide. Bringing you the freshest local ingredients we can get our hands on, we strive for flavor and good prices.
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Tuesday: 11:00 AM - 11:00 PM  Wednesday - Saturday: 11:00 AM - 1:00 AM  Sunday: 11:00 AM - 10:00 PM

name: Green Wolf Brewing Co.
description: Green Wolf Brewing Company is a microbrewery located in scenic and historic Schoharie County. Our uncommon ales are crafted with love and attention to detail, using local ingredients whenever possible. Green Wolf strives to create an interconnected web of farmers, local businesses, and beer enthusiasts within New York State’s Capital Region, so that we can build a thriving market for our artisan ales. We are slated to open in May of 2014.

name: Greenbush Brewing Co
description: Good ideas often start over beer. Always looking to take a good thing too far, we sat down and over a beer (or two) decided that beer itself was a good idea. Of course, not just some easy-drinking institutional prole beer, but stuff like the beers we'd had at great bars. We had frequented places with extensive and varied beer lists. Places with lists 180 items long, all of which we tried twice (not in one night). In short, we wanted beer with flavor. Complexity. Character. Intensity. Not words found in the mass market lexicon.    So with a banjo burner, a bunch of industrial kitchen sized pots and as many buckets as we could find, we jumped in feet first. Once a week, every week. We tried to emulate the beers we liked, but soon we were adding a little of this, or some of that and after a while we started having a hard time pegging our beer in a style category. Our first success was a Porter that was mainly porter, slightly stout. We ran it blind with our friends against the porters we liked and people liked it. "We're on to something", we thought. Twenty iterations, modifications and tweaks later it is Distorter, and is still our favorite beer.    This led to twice a week brewing and handing out bottle after bottle to everyone we knew. Along the way we screwed up a wheat beer by accidentally making it into sort of a copper ale with a few too many hops. And so Red Bud Ale was born. We had some extra noble hops and threw them in the IPA, and with some tinkering we most certainly had a one-of-a-kind IPA. You get the picture. All of this has firmly cemented our "anything goes" approach to beer making. Our inability to ever get quite within the style guidelines means we may never win an award, but we're ok with that.    Now, several years later and with a 90% super-cool/10% Rube Goldberg 7 bbl version of our banjo burner and kitchen pots, we're befuddling the beer judges and converting the masses. One pint at a time.    Stop in the storefront and try our mainstays, seasonals and small-batch runs. Not to mention our lab beers, where we continue to screw up one thing or another in search of the next great beer.
hoursOfOperation: Sunday - Thursday: 12-8  Friday and Saturday: 12-10

name: Greenport Harbor Brewing Company
description: The idea began a long time ago over … well … a pretty terrible beer.  You see we (John from NY and Rich from Boston) met in college and had to drink what beer we could afford in those days.    As the years went by, the better the beer we consumed, the more we were consumed by it.  We tried every beer imaginable.  We read about beer. We talked about beer. We began making our own beer.  And finally we started talking and dreaming about opening a brewery on the North Fork.    In the Spring of 2008 the dream became a reality when Rich heard about an old firehouse for sale in the Village of Greenport.  Driven by thirst more than brains, we bought the building in the middle of what has been called a Global Economic Meltdown.  Next we started the renovation.  Did we mention Global Economic Meltdown?  We tried to do most of the work ourselves and luckily got a lot of help from some good friends and family.   The promise of beer can be powerful. Our luck continued when on a snowy January day, with no roof on our brewery, we got a visit from DJ Swanson and his 2 young children. No one in their right mind would have joined us. DJ did and agreed to be our new head brewer. In April with roof replaced, windows installed, and drains dug, our brew house arrived and the idea of making Greenport Harbor beer began. Four months later in July of 2009 we were officially shipping (hand truck and family cars) our beer.    Today our beer is served in over 200 places on Long Island (thank you Justin) and NYC.    We’re proud to say that since summer of 2009 we have been singled out for nearly every beer we have brewed from the Village Voice to the Tasting Table to TimeOut NY to Newsday to NY Examiner to Wall Street Journal to countless beer and food blogs.  We have a total of 13 employees if you include our forklift and delivery truck, which we do. We hope to add to this number in the next few months when we grow by 66 and 2/3’s percent by adding 2 new tanks. We are the only local brewery that brews 100% of our beer. We are small but hungry…we mean thirsty.
hoursOfOperation: Open for Tastings/Growlers/Retail:  Fri & Sat 12-7pm  Sun 12-6pm

name: Grey Sail Brewing of Rhode Island
description: Grey Sail Brewing of RI is southern Rhode Island's newest microbrewery.    Proudly located in the seaside city of Westerly, Grey Sail Brewing of RI is southern Rhode Island's premier microbrewery equipped to produce up to 4,000 barrels of handcrafted beer per year.
hoursOfOperation: Sat: 1:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Griesedieck Brothers Brewery
description: Griesedieck Brothers Brewing Corporation has a long and distinguished tradition in Saint Louis and the Midwest.  From two brothers - young emigrants from Stromberg, Germany in the 1870s - came generations of brewers who have been dedicated to crafting high-quality beer.  We hope you enjoy our product and continue to make Griesedieck Brothers your beverage of choice.

name: Griess Family Brews
description: Griess Family Brews is a micro brewery located in Grants Pass, Oregon. They have just recently opened a taproom, Griess Family Brews & Taproom located at 220 SW H Street, Grants Pass, Oregon.

name: Griffin Claw Brewing Company
description: Griffin Claw Brewing Company is a Michigan based Microbrewery focusing on top quality beer production using state-of-the-art equipment and technology. The first brewery to commision a Muera Micro Mash Filter to test the extreme efficiency and flexibility of the cutting edge technology already offered at Macro scales.

name: Grimm Brothers Brewhouse
description: Grimm Brothers Brewhouse is a craft brewery in Loveland, Colorado! They feature German style beers and other unique flavors. Grimm Brothers Brewhouse is devoted to the art and science of beer and brewing. A passion for brewing and sharing of exciting flavors of beer are at the heart of this brewery’s values. Grimm Brothers Brewhouse was founded by avid home brewers and beer enthusiasts who love producing quality, flavorful beers.
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Thursday: 1:00 PM to 8:00 PM  Friday: 12:00 PM to 9:00 PM  Saturday: 12:00 PM to 9:00 PM  Sunday: 1:00 PM to 5:00 PM

name: Grist Brewing Company
description: Grist Brewing Company is located just south of C-470 and Santa Fe Boulevard across the street from Shea Stadium.    Our focus is simply to make ales and lagers that are of the highest quality, approachable, and true to style. We certainly will experiment, it’s in our nature. However, the primary focus at Grist will be to make consistently great beers to be enjoyed year round.  We balance creativity with science to make great beers.    While striving to make exceptional beer is our passion, we are equally committed to making a positive impact in our community. Rather than saving a couple dollars, Grist made a significant investment in our economy by purchasing a new, American made 20 barrel brewhouse. We feel it’s important to support the community and economy that is going to support us.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 2:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Fri: 2:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Grist House Brewing
description: Pittsburgh's newest microbrewery and tap house will be opening in late 2013 and is located in Millvale, just 5 minutes from downtown.      Grist House Brewing features high quality, "salt of the earth", American and English style ales.  Our passion for the art of brewing comes through in our beers and we hope you enjoy drinking them as much as we enjoy brewing them.    Grist House Brewing: Grinding Out Great Beers!

name: Grizzly Peak Brewing Company
description: Welcome to Grizzly Peak Brewing Company, Ann Arbor’s landmark brew pub and premier place for families, students, and friends to gather.

name: Groundswell Brewing Company
description: So here’s what you need to know. We are brewers and culinarians.    We want our beer to taste good, but we also want it to taste good with food. We don’t want to blow-out your palate, we want you to explore the hidden flavors and understand the complexities of the taste.    We love beer. We want you to love beer.    We will focus on crafting beers between 4.5% and 7.0% ABV. Our goal is a well-balanced, well-crafted, session beer. We’ll do the hop-thing too, but always with an exciting and culinary-focused angle.    Here’s the other thing. We’re adventurous. San Diego is the brew capital of the world (are we exaggerating here… NO!) There’s lots of great brewers. We found a few of them and held them down, twisted their arm really hard and asked them to brew something new and out there for us. Then, we found a few chefs who thought brewing was good sport. We helped them with the technical stuff and set them loose with the brew equipment.    You’ll see their brew in our taproom…they may have other gigs in the city, and we support their efforts there too. Beer is beer. Drink it here. Drink it there. Drink it anywhere (with apologies to Dr. Seuss).

name: Growlers of Gaithersberg
description: Growlers of Gaithersburg is a restaurant and microbrewery located in the heart of Olde Towne Gaithersburg, MD. Growlers features great food, excellent home brew, and always entertaining live shows.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:30 am - 1:00 am  Fri - Sat: 11:30 am - 2:00 am  Sun: 11:30 am - 1:00 am

name: Guadalupe Brewing Company
description: Guadalupe Brewing Company is a new locally owned Craft Beer manufacturer in New Braunfels, Texas. Our goal is to provide the freshest possible product and use the highest quality ingredients available. We will use organic ingredients whenever possible and it is our goal to minimize energy and water use to be responsible stewards of our environment. It is also our goal to give back to the community in the form of support for natural resources and parks of Texas.    Look for our beer in finer restaurants and pubs in the Texas Hill Country.

name: Guest Brewing Company
description: Guest Brewing is currently a group of friends dedicated to the art of brewing beer. There are 4 of us, and we brew about 1.5 batches a week. We all know and love beer, and enjoy learning and experiencing more through our own craft. We are big fans of sharing beer and have friends over during the brew to sample previous batches, or other craft beer.    Our goal is to continue to hone our skills at brewing and prepare to launch a brewery. We do this by brewing, talking, and thinking beer often. We share beer with friends often and always welcome feedback. We will also be launching an official Beta Tasting program soon that will offer free beer in exchange for some consumer feedback.

name: Gun Hill Brewing Company
description: A new brewery located in the Bronx serving hand-crafted beers both on-site in our tasting room and at bars/restaurants throughout the NY Metropolitan area.

name: Gunpowder Falls Brewing
description: We are a small brewery that brews authentic German-style lager beer in New Freedom Pennsylvania - where Gunpowder Falls begins    Please come visit us at our tasting room with food provided by Juliana's in the Village.    You can also buy six-packs, cases, and kegs to go.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 4:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat - Sun: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Guvnor's Brewery
description: Great beer and fantastic food in South Norwalk!
hoursOfOperation: Tue: 4:00 pm - 1:00 am  Wed - Thu: 12:00 pm - 1:00 am  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 2:00 am  Sun: 12:00 pm - 1:00 am

name: Hailstorm Brewing Co.
description: Hailstorm Brewing Co. is a brewery located in Tinley Park, IL. Our brewery will feature a variety of ales and barrel-aged beers.
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Saturday: 12:00 Noon to 7:00 pm

name: Haines Brewing Company
description: For years friends trekked across tide flats and through coastal forests to our home, for the taste of Paul's fine brews. Then with the encouragment of local folks, and growing from those homebrew recipes, we took the leap to open the brewery. Starting off with dairy tanks from the midwest for fermenters, we scrubbed off the old butter and Paul started brewing. We grew quickly, exchanged the dairy ...See More
hoursOfOperation: 1pm - 6pm : Monday-Saturday

name: Halcyon Brewing Company
description: Halcyon Brewing Company is coming soon to the taps and glasses of the craft brew lovers of Colorado and beyond. Our projected opening is 2013. Why so long you ask? Well, great beer takes time.    We're currently looking at property in the Highlands area and DU area. Stay tuned for updates!    Cheers!

name: Hales Ales Brewery and Pub
description: Founded by Mike Hale in 1983, Hale's Ales is the Northwest's 3rd oldest and longest running independently owned brewery in the Northwest. Hale's built its long standing reputation by brewing small batch, full flavored ales using traditional English brewing methods.    An innovator from the start, Hale's was the first craft brewery to introduce Seasonal, Cask Conditioned and Nitrogen Conditioned ales to the region. Hale's goal is to stay true to what the craft brewing "revolution" is all about: crafting fresh, locally brewed ales of the very finest quality. Cheers from Hale's Ales!

name: Half Acre Beer Company
description: Half Acre Beer Co. is a brewing company in the Northcenter neighborhood of Chicago, IL. We built a brewery in the middle of the city where we brew small batch beers, and have a store & tasting area where we sample our beers and sell them to go in all package styles.     We make different beers throughout the year, some we brew all the time and some are only around for a very short period. Our focus is to expand our abilities and enjoy our work.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Fri:	12:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat:	11:00 am - 7:00 pm  Sun:	12:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Half Full Brewery
description: The Half Full Brewery is a “lifestyle” brewery and the concept behind our brewery is as simple as its name and motto sounds:  whether your glass is literally or figuratively “Half Full”, you can “look forward to more…”   What makes Half Full different is the “…” because that ellipsis is unique to you.  It can be anything in the world and most often, it has something to do with what drives you, your passion.  For me, it is very simple — I always look forward to more of my dream, Half Full, and spending time with the people that have inspired me to take this journey.  Passionate beer and passionate people, is there any better pairing?    What’s your “…”?  If you don’t know, then it’s time to step back like I did four years ago (story to follow in the near future), have a beer with a friend, and figure it out because life doesn’t get any more rewarding and exhilarating than when you pursue what you are most passionate about, when you pursue your “…”

name: Half Moon Bay Brewing
description: Half Moon Bay Brewing Company is a warm oceanfront restaurant and brew pub at Pillar Point Harbor in Princeton-by-the-Sea Calif., four miles north of Half Moon Bay and 30 miles south of San Francisco.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri: 11:30 am - 9:00 pm  Sat - Sun: 9:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: Half Moon Brewery & Restaurant
description: At the Half Moon we pride ourselves in making great tasting, fresh beer using the finest traditional ingredients.  Our beer is hand crafted in our state of the art 3.5 barrel all grain brewery.  We use the choicest 2-row malted barley and wheat, domestic and imported hops, as well as select strains of brewer’s yeast.  There are no preservatives or artificial ingredients added.
hoursOfOperation: Open Daily at 11am for Lunch & Dinner

name: Hall Brewing Company
description: We are a traditional farmhouse brewery based in Parker, Colorado. Everything we do–from building our brewery to making the beer–we do with our own hands. We make true craft beer. We take pride in not only producing the best craft beer but also putting enough in it to suit our custom four-thousand-square-foot building we made from Colorado beetle-kill pine. That means big, ornate beer. And why not? The best isn’t always for everyone!    We are a family-owned business. Under the guidance of master brewer and construction engineer Aubrey Hall, our family has pulled together to make something special.

name: Hamburg Brewing Company
description: The Hamburg Brewing Company is going to specialize in great beers brewed right here on our new 20 barrel brewing system. You will be able find our beers in local bars and restaurants as well as our beautiful taproom.     In addition to the brewery, our grounds will have a hop yard that will be growing 3 varieties of hops. We will be using these hops in our own brewing process with future plans to sell to local home brewers as well. The grounds at HBC will also have the capacity of growing 20+ acres of barley to help increase New York's farm brewing output.    The brewery will be located in one of the most unique buildings in Western New York and when we are ready, we will be giving tours of our facility.     We ask for your patience during our start up. Great things are coming!

name: Hamburger Mary's
description: Opened in 2006, Hamburger Mary's Chicago is a classy-kitsch American diner serving gourmet half-pound burgers with a side of sass.  Mary's expanded in 2009 and added a small brewery, making her the oldest nano-brewery in Chicago.  Mary's motto is "an open-air bar & grill for open-minded people,"  where all are welcome to "Eat, Drink.. .and be MARY!"

name: HammerHeart Brewing Company
description: HammerHeart Brewing Company is a new brewery in Lino Lakes, Minnesota that opened to the public on August 2nd 2013. Our brewery is built in the honor and recognition of the old Nordic and Celtic cultures, rich with experience and wisdom, literature, and life. HammerHeart represents who we are today because of who came before us.
hoursOfOperation: Wednesdays, Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays from 2-10pm.

name: Hangar 24 Craft Brewery
description: Hangar 24 Craft Brewery began with a true passion for good beer, the absolute love of flying and the pure enjoyment of being around great friends. Founder and Master Brewer Ben Cook and his buddies used to meet at hangar 24 after an afternoon of flying to trade stories, talk aviation, play music and share a few cold ones that Ben just finished brewing at home. These days, the location of where these fine beers are brewed has changed, but the quality time spent enjoying a delicious, handcrafted beer and conversation with friends is the same as ever. Cheers.

name: Hank Is Wiser Brewery
description: Hank is Wiser Brewery is a small family owned and operated brewpub located in the middle of downtown Cheney, Kansas.  The first house brewed beer was served on April 1, 2005 at their grand opening, just mere hours after Hank Sanford retired from a 22 year sales career in Wichita.  It was 35 years earlier that Hank had purchased his first beer sign.  Collecting brewery advertising, visiting over 300 breweries across the country, homebrewing for the last 15 years, and of course tasting well over 2000 different beers all lead to the dream and finally the reality of opening Hank is Wiser Brewery.

name: Happy Valley Brewing Company
description: A brewery and restaurant located in a restored wood-beamed structure in State College, Pennsylvania, the home of Penn State University.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 2:00 am

name: Hard Knocks Brewing
description: Life is hard. At the end of a tough day, there's nothing quite like that first taste of cold craft beer hitting your throat. We're brewing for you.

name: Hardywood Park Craft Brewery
description: Our Mission is to become one of the most respected brewers in the United States through integrity in our ingredients and in our business practices, through respect for brewing heritage, and through the inspired creation of extraordinary beers.
hoursOfOperation: Public hours vary, but the tasting room opens at least once a week for sampling, growler fills, tours, etc. - visit www.hardywood.com/tasting-room for details.

name: Harmon Brewing Company
description: This 15 barrel microbrewery and restaurant is a perfect place for large groups and families to gather. Located in the Tacoma's downtown University and Museum District - it's a favorite place for locals and tourists alike. The comfortable and coziness of the historic building, decorated to look and feel like a mountain lodge, features a fabulous sampling of northwest food, and of course you will always find Harmon's 5 flagship ales, along with several seasonal ales, on draught for you to enjoy.

name: Harmony Brewing Company
description: A neighborhood brew-pub for Eastown. A comfortable place where conversation is the primary entertainment. Offering our own beers, as well as a full bar. Our menu consists of wood fired pizzas that will knock your socks off! Cheers!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 12:00 pm - 12:00 am

name: Harper's Restaurant & Brewpub
hoursOfOperation: Everyday: 11:00am-2:00am

name: Harpoon Brewery
description: We started the Harpoon Brewery in 1986 because—like today—we loved beer and wanted more quality choices.      There was only one problem: we were beer lovers, not brewers. We knew what we wanted to drink, but we needed some help actually brewing it. So we enlisted our first brewer, took over some warehouse space on the Boston waterfront, and began introducing fresh, local craft beer to Boston drinkers. We tried to do it in a way that captured the spirit of fun that had brought us to beer in the first place. From that warehouse, surrounded by fish companies on the docks of South Boston (neighboring what is now the Seaport District), we couldn’t imagine that craft brewing would become what it has today.      We still remember our days on the other side of the bar, and have spent as much time spreading the joy of beer drinking as we have focusing on recipes, ingredients, and brewing equipment. Hopefully our sense of gratitude is reflected in both the quality of the beer and the spirit of fun and enjoyment surrounding our beer and breweries. We invite all of you to visit our Boston brewery, where it all began, and our beautiful brewery in Windsor, Vermont.

name: Harriet Brewing
description: At Harriet Brewing we emphasize intention as the primary component in recipe development. It's what makes good beer special. We take pride in using our knowledge of traditional beer styles, our open minds, and eclectic pallets to brew both unique and traditional beer styles. Our goal with every recipe is authenticity… to develop a particular character that allows the beer to stand out and be remembered. It's authenticity that we crave as beer drinkers; so, it's authenticity that we strive for as brewers. We study beer, determine what we want, then manifest it! For most of us here, it's not just in brewing; it's a way of life.

name: Harvest Moon Brewery and Cafe
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Wednesday  Lunch 11:30-5:00 pm  Dinner 5:00-10:00 pm  Late Nite Menu 10:00-11:00 pm    Thursday - Saturday  Lunch 11:30-5:00 pm  Dinner 5:00-11:00 pm  Late Nite Menu 11:00-Midnight    Sunday  Lunch 11:30-4:00 pm  Dinner 4:00-9:00 pm  Late Nite Menu 9:00-10:00 pm

name: Haverhill Brewery
description: Founded in 2003 as the TAP brewpub in downtown Haverhill Massachusetts, the Haverhill Brewery has quickly been increasing its local distribution to Bars and Liquor stores throughout the Massachusetts and Northern Rhode Island Area.    Since opening our Restaurant/Brew Pub The TAP in 2003, we Have been providing Massachusetts with award winning hand-crafted ales and lagers. In late 2005 we began to branch out and distribute our beers throughout eastern Massachusetts. Currently our beer is available throughout the state as well as northern Rhode Island

name: Haw River Farmhouse Ales
description: Haw River Farmhouse Ales will handcraft traditional French- & Belgian-style ales with a little southern flair, using local and organic ingredients where possible in each of our beers. Located in Saxapahaw, NC, opening Memorial Day Weekend, 2012.

name: Hawai'i Nui Brewing
description: At Hawai‘i Nui Brewing, we’re passionate about craft beer. We brew small batches of our all-natural ales and lagers from the finest barley malt, wheat, hops and yeast.  We are committed to local production in Hawai‘i.      Our uniquely well balanced Island Style beer is perfect for your time in Paradise!    What is Island Style? To those of us who call Hawai’i home, it’s all about balance. Working hard, sure. But when pau hana time comes, it’s about friends and family. Heeding the call of the sun and sand, surf and sea. Tasting freshness. Celebrating music. Stopping at sunset. Resting easy at night. Appreciating life’s detours–what we call holo holo time. Living life as it should be.

name: Hawcreek Brewing Company
description: We strive to make delicious, fresh, hand-crafted beer and refuse to produce anything less. we are looking forward to becoming your brew of choice when we open late this fall.

name: Hawks Brewing
description: (No longer brewing)

name: Haymarket Pub & Brewery
description: Specializing in classic Belgian and contemporary American beer styles, Pete will be producing an array of brews for every beer palette. Crowley, a highly decorated brewer has won over 50 local, national and international awards for his brewing creations including medals from the World Beer Cup, Great American Beer Festival and Festival of Wood and Barrel Aged Beer. Varieties will range from refreshing Pilsners to hoppy ales to rich Imperial Stouts aged in whiskey barrels in our own cellar, a brewing technique that has put Crowley on the national beer map for his pioneering work with the specialty. Our impressive array of 32 tap handles behind the bar will feature more than 10 house brewed varieties with space to offer other craft beer selections.

name: Headlands Brewing Company
description: Headlands Brewing Co. was founded by people that play outside.  We have a sense of adventure and embody the spirit of the place that we live, celebrating the bay, the history, the trails and the mountains that surround us. Outside the brewery you can find us surfing and swimming in the beautiful waters in our backyard or cycling or running through the valleys, parks, hills and mountains surrounding our bay.     Patrick Horn (formerly of Pacific Brewing Laboratory) and Phil Cutti (Southpaw BBQ) create classic beers along with seasonal and experimental brews that push the envelope.

name: HeadStrong Brewery
description: Welcome to Douglas, Wyoming and the upstart of HeadStrong Brewery. Over the last couple years, we have been gradually developing a plan and product to bring to our community.  Craft Beers!      Our promise to our customers is that we will not compromise on the quality and ingredients we put into every batch of beer we brew.    Our selection of materials will emphasize the Wyoming and Douglas experience while bringing ingredients from around the world to our customers.  Each of our craft beers will be highlighted and served in it's own special glass that will enhance the look, feel and flavor of the brewed product.

name: Healdsburg Beer Co
description: Founded in 2007, Healdsburg Beer Company is an independent and family owned brewery. We produce limited quantities of artisan cask ales using only the finest ingredients in laboriously attended to small lots. Seriously.   Annual production for the brewery is less than 1,000 gallons and we sweat the details on each pint. Our brewing philosophy is grounded in the idea of balance. We strive to create beer that balances the flavors that we find in the malt, hops and yeast and create a layered, nuanced and flavorful beer that is still an easy drinking and friendly pint.   Living in Sonoma County, it is difficult to think of any beverage without also thinking of food. Sonoma has an incredible food culture that includes some of the world’s finest artisan purveyors and restaurants. All of Healdsburg Beer Company’s beers are purposefully crafted to be friendly and complementary to a broad range of food.

name: Heartland Brewery
description: Founded in 1995, Heartland Brewery is a NYC-based restaurant group with 7 locations, all with their own distinct identities. What they share in common is our award-winning locally brewed beer and a commitment to great food and warm, friendly service.

name: Heater Allen Brewery
description: We are a small artisan brewery located in McMinnville, Oregon.  We specialize in producing distinctive all-malt lager and other German and Czech style beers.  We use only the finest, most appropriate malts, hops, water and yeast in our beers.  While our lagers are similar to those made in Germany, they are our own unique interpretation of the style.     Lager beers are fermented at lower temperatures than ale, using yeast that has adapted to cooler fermentations.  Low temperature fermentations create fewer “yeasty” aromas, esters, and flavors that are so common in ales.  We brew lagers because we enjoy their smooth malty and hoppy character.
hoursOfOperation: If you'd like to stop by the Brewery, either come by on a brew day, usually Tuesdays and Fridays (check the calendar for a complete list of brew days) or call us during the week (we rarely check messages on the weekend) to schedule an appointment.

name: Heathen Brewing
description: Heathen Brewing is a small craft brewery that was created from the soul of home brewing. The realization that we as a people want to break the corporate strong hold on the beer industry and get back to using local ingredients in small craft batch brewing has demanded the formation of Heathen Brewing. At Heathen Brewing we make small batches of "Progressive Ales for the Promiscuous Palate". It all ...See More
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 4:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Sat: 1:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: Heavy Seas Beer
description: Heavy Seas Beer is brewed by Clipper City Brewing Company, in Baltimore, Maryland. The brewery was established by Hugh Sisson in 1995. Previously, Sisson operated Maryland's first brewpub, Sisson's. The brewery is named for the famed Clipper ship - first developed and built in the home port of Baltimore. While the name of the company remains Clipper City Brewing Company, all of its beer falls under the Heavy Seas brand. Heavy Seas is located at 4615 Hollins Ferry Road, Suite B, in the Halethorpe section of Baltimore. Heavy Seas currently offers a variety of beer styles in approx. 18 states within the United States.    Heavy Seas mission is to bring back the local brewery, and to do it in such a way that we are more than just a fringe player, but a positive part of our area. To accomplish this mission we have created a broad portfolio of products with enough diversity that we have at least one beer that can appeal to everyone. Whether your preference is for a classic American style lager beer, or a big, challenging Hop Cubed Ale, we have a something that will suit your taste. We believe in bringing beer drinkers the quality and flavor of a handcrafted beer while supporting the local communities we serve.

name: Heavy Seas Alehouse
hoursOfOperation: Open noon Monday-Sunday

name: Heavyweight Brewing
description: Heavyweight Brewing closed in 1996.

name: Hedge House
description: The Hedge House is truly a community gathering place located in the heart of the Division/Clinton Street Neighborhood.    Since opening in December 2003, the Hedge House has been a place for families and friends to gather over a pint of great Lompoc beer and a meal of hearty pub grub.    Our menu features great sandwiches, salads, and appetizers. We feature six regular taps of Lompoc beer, along with our seasonals.    We’re known for our huge patio and deck outside the 1912 craftsman-style bungalow. On sunny days it seems the entire neighborhood comes down to enjoy the evening.    Kids and dogs are welcome.

name: Heinzelmännchen Brewery
description: In a microbrewery in downtown Sylva, NC, German-born brewmaster Dieter Kuhn and his wife Sheryl Rudd are creating light and refreshing German beer made with wholesome grains, fresh hops & no preservatives. All beers are keg conditioned and non-filtered, making them smooth and lighter in body.  Enjoy pints or flights in our taproom then take home your favorite in one of our unique, German 2-liter growlers. We have snacks available and you are welcome to bring in food from local restaurants (some will deliver) or your picnic!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 7:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: Heist Brewery
description: It’s going down right now. There’s a Heist happening in Charlotte. Except at this robbery everybody’s going to get their share of the loot, er…brew. After over two years of planning, Charlotte will now be called home to the Heist Brewery.

name: Hellbender Brewing Company
description: Hellbender Brewing Company was created out of a true love for the art, culture, history, and science of craft brewing.  Just taste the beer we produce, and you will see the difference.  We have created every recipe as an artistic interpretation of an existing style, and refined it with years of tasting and fine tuning.      All of our flagship beer ingredients come from American brewing supply companies that source ingredients from the American midwest and northeast.  The majority of the hops that we use are grown in Oregon and Washington State, but some of our specialty beers will be brewed with hops from our very own farm in upstate New York.

name: Helltown Brewing
description: Helltown Brewing is a craft brewery located in Mount Pleasant, Pennsylvania- a small town situated in the the foothills of the Laurel Highlands.  The brewery, named in homage to our home town, will be brewing a variety of exceptional beer from IPAs to the traditional lambic styles

name: Helm's Brewing Co.
description: Helm's Brewing Co. is a community brewery. It's a place where people stop by after work to check out what's new on the menu and have a quick taster before heading home. Our facility is a place to take the edge off while enjoying a fine beer with neighbors and friends. Helm's Brewing Co. is a place where everyone is welcomed.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri:	3:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat:	12:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun:	12:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: HenHouse Brewing Company
description: Founded in 2011, we crank out awesome beers 2 barrels at a time in uncompromising and fearless pursuit of our goal: creating new and interesting kinds of delicious. HenHouse is the work of our hands, hearts and brains and we hope you enjoy the beer as much as we enjoy making it.     We love beer, people, and Petaluma.

name: Henneberg Brewing Co.
description: We are a real Farm Brewery. We grow hops, we also grow and malt our own barley. Stop by our tasting room for samples of our great beers!

name: Henry Weinhard
description: Henry Weinhard's Private Reserve and Blitz-Weinhard are brands of beer first brewed in 1856 in Portland, Oregon, United States. The brewery was owned by the brewer Henry Weinhard of the Weinhard family, who also made a line of soft drinks which survives to this day.    The Blitz-Weinhard brand was among several regional Pacific Northwest beers which were staples in the Northwest market during the decades following the repeal of Prohibition until they began losing market share to the national brands in the 1960s and 1970s.

name: Herbert B. Friendly Brewing
description: Uniquely Northwest, Herbert B. Friendly Brewing delivers delicious, cold, refreshing beer made by hand with natural ingredients. Each batch is created from scratch for your enjoyment. Quality brews of different styles ranging from the classic to the unconventional. We celebrate our love affair with beer and hope to share it with you. Herbert B. Friendly. Small town beer, made Friendly!    Started in 2010 as a brew club between two friends, Herbert B. Friendly Brewing went nano in August on 2012 and opened its doors for business in January of 2013. We’re a small family business looking to express ourselves creatively though beer and share it with our local community.
hoursOfOperation: Sat:  1:00pm - 5:00pm  Available by appointment.

name: Hereford & Hops Restaurant and Brewpub
description: Hereford and Hops opened in downtown Escanaba, on the first floor of a historic 1914 five-story former hotel. The restored building has two dining rooms, a pub and two brick open grills. Since 1994 Hereford and Hops has specialized in a do-it-yourself style of dining with the choice to grill your own steak, seafood or chicken. With grill chefs on duty, you can always choose to have your entrée professionally grilled.

name: Heretic Brewing Company
description: Be a Heretic. Don't drink ordinary beer. Embrace your inner heretic and join us to push the boundaries of beer flavors. We are crazy about beer and passionate about making it. Wanna be a heretic too? There’s always room for one more.

name: Heritage Brewing
description: Founded in 2013, Heritage Brewing Co. is a 20-barrel brewery set in the heart of Manassas, Virginia. Heritage Brewing is excited to bring great fresh and unique craft beer to our fellow Americans. From our 20-barrel brew house and oak aging program, to our 1/2 barrel artisan batches, we look to only produce the finest beer. We can't wait to share our passion for great beer with America.

name: Hermitage Brewing Company
description: Hermitage Brewing Company (HBC) is a Silicon Valley native.  In the few years HBC has been distributing, we have won multiple awards and accolades for our beer, including Hoptopia, Maltopia, Ale of the Imp, Ale of the 2 Tun, and our Single Hop Series.

name: Hess Brewing
description: Hess Brewing has the distinction of being San Diego’s first licensed nano-brewery. Nano, as in small, not Nanu, Mork’s signoff. We truly brew in small hand-crafted batches, one point six barrels at a time (that’s just 50 gallons each batch). Stop by our tasting room and taste it for yourselves. Great Beer. No Exceptions. No Excuses.

name: Hi-Wire Brewing
description: At Hi-Wire, we really want to embrace our craft and be as independent and authentic as possible, while also managing to maintain an approachability to our product, as we feature highly drinkable, hand-crafted brews.    We’re fortunate to be able to be a part of one of the Craft Capitals of the country. Located in Asheville's "Brewery District", Hi-Wire's brewery and tasting room are within walking distance of six other local breweries in a few block radius. Come visit us in June, 2013.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 4:00 pm - 12:00 am  Fri: 2:00 pm - 2:00 am  Sat: 12:00 pm - 2:00 am  Sun: 2:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Hideout Brewing Company
description: Originally opened in early 2005, the company was named for both the location and for the feel of pre-prohibition era local brewery. Taken over in early 2012 by new owners Scott Colson and Nick and Theresa Humphrey, the Hideout’s footprint has grown quite extensively. Now distributing to much of the southern half of the Lower Peninsula, they are adding new regions regularly. Coming soon will be bottled beer!    In the taproom, the selection recently increased to 25 taps directly behind the J shaped bar. The upper loft has darts, shuffle board and three big screen TVs. Behind the building you will find a Beer Garden including horseshoe pits and ample seating.    Menu beers available year round are Promiscuous Pilsner, Tommy Gun Red, Gangster IPA, and Smuggler’s Hazelnut Stout. Other offerings vary throughout the year including Wine, Seasonal and Specialty Beers, Hard Cider, and Mead.

name: High & Mighty Beer Company
description: High & Mighty Beer Company began in 2006 as an offshoot of Shelton Brothers beer importing company. Will Shelton took his idea for a novel German-style ale to Paper City Brewery in Holyoke, Massachusetts, and Beer of the Gods was born, to extraordinary commercial success, critical acclaim, and unabashed adoration from beer geeks the world over.    Eventually, Will discovered that he enjoyed selling the beer he made even more than he did the splendid beers that Shelton Brothers imports, and in June 2008, he abandoned his brother to focus on making American beer that added an American attitude to the best of European beer styles. The beer is still lovingly made at Paper City, but look for High & Mighty to open a brewery of its own in 2010.

name: High Desert Brewing Co.
description: After years of recipe development, remodeling, and parking lot paving, the High Desert Brewing Co. opened it's doors in July of 1997 and has quickly become one of New Mexico's premier brewpubs. Our selection of hand crafted lagers and ales are produced on premises using the finest grains and hops. We brew small batches of about 100 gallons, ensuring that each beer is served at the peak of freshness. Our brews are available by the glass, pint, or pitcher and to-go in 1/2 gallon growlers and 5 gallon kegs. We make every attempt to keep all of our beers on tap at all times but once in a while one or two may not be available for a few days. These times are the perfect opportunity to stretch your taste and try something other than your favorite. Please let Bob or Donna, or any of the High Desert Brewing Co. staff know how you think we are doing.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat:  11am - Midnight  Sun:  Noon - 10pm

name: High Falls Brewing Company
description: High Falls Brewing Company, located in Rochester, New York, is the fifth largest brewing company in America, and the brewers of JW Dundee's Honey Brown Lager, Michael Shea's Irish Amber, Genny Light, the Genesee Family of brands and Koch's Golden Anniversary. High Falls distributes its fine products across 41 states and Ontario, Canada.    High Falls also brews beer for other beer companies, such as the Boston Brewing Company (makers of Sam Adams beer). As much as 50% of the output of High Falls' brewery is for other firms. High Falls also distributes beer for other companies, some as far away as New Zealand, which may explain why trucks bearing the brands of other breweries (such as Coors) are sometimes seen on their premises.

name: High Hops Brewery
description: Here at High Hops we brew with the very Hops we grow in our fields. We do not limit ourselves to one style of beer. We like to brew all types of beers for all types of people. Enjoy this magical beverage comprised of Hops, Barley, water and yeast. Cheers!!    We are here to make excellent beer, to push the brewing limits ,and to exceed your taste buds expectations.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu:	2:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri - Sat:	12:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun:	12:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: High Noon Saloon & Brewery
description: During the late 1800’s our building housed the Great Western Manufacturing Company which produced cast iron stoves for pioneers heading west. Today, the High Noon Saloon & Brewery is a Leavenworth landmark, serving honest food, fresh made beer, quality entertainment and a whole lot of FUN!    We have a lot going on! We’re a big, family-friendly restaurant featuring Steaks, Burgers, Sandwiches, Entrée Salads, BBQ, Wild Salmon (flown in FRESH not frozen), Buffalo Burgers (locally raised, hormone & anti-biotic free) and so much more. We also feature daily Lunch, Dinner and Drink Specials!    We are also Leavenworth’s hometown brewery, serving fresh made, award-winning hand-crafted beer from our on-site copper clad brewery. Our silver medal-winning Annie’s Amber Ale is available throughout Kansas in 6-pack 12oz. cans! The Kansas Department of Commerce has recently awarded High Noon & Annie’s Amber Ale the “Simply Kansas” label as a quality product made exclusively in Kansas!

name: High Point Wheat Beer Company
description: High Point Brewing Company was founded in 1996 as the first exclusive wheat beer brewery in America. The founder and driving force of High Point is award-winning homebrewer, Greg Zaccardi. After working as a brewer in southern Germany, Greg returned to the US to open his brewery.    Ramstein beers are made with the same care and precision that Greg learned in Germany. In fact, the wheat, barley, hops and yeast used to make Ramstein Beers are all imported directly from Bavaria.    Greg found a special brewer’s yeast used only by a small brewery in Bavaria. He was able to get the brewery to let him use the special yeast exclusively at High Point. The unique, complex character of Ramstein beers is a result of this private yeast and of course, High Point’s careful and proper brewing methods.    The name Ramstein was adopted from a town in Germany with a large American population. The town surrounds the U.S. Ramstein Air Force Base. High Point wanted the name of its beers to reflect a marriage of German tradition and American innovation.    Today High Point Brewing Company expanded beyond wheat beers and brews 11 different wheat beers and lagers.
hoursOfOperation: Gift Shop & Tasting Room Hours:   M-F 9am - 6:30pm   Sat 1pm - 4pm

name: High Sierra Brewing Company
description: In the mood for a great Micro Brew and an enormous Pizza? Come down to Carson City's only Brewery & Restaurant and indulge in our savory Deep Dish Pizzas while throwing back a pint of our OMG IPA or our Honey Ale! Don't forget to bring the Kidos! We have a kids menu with lots of goodies and hand crafted Root Beer and Orange Cream Soda.Get Brewed!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 2:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: Highland Brewing Company
description: Highland Brewing Company began in the basement of Barley's Taproom in downtown Asheville, North Carolina in 1994. Through the years the company has grown from a three person operation to a staff of almost 50, from about 4,000 to 35,000 square feet, and from a capacity to brew 2,000 barrels annually to almost 40,000. Those of you who saw the old brewery may remember the retrofitted dairy equipment we used. We held on to two of those tanks in our move to the East Asheville location. Alongside them, we have new fermentation and brite beer tanks to go with our 50-barrel brew house. Our pilot brew house is a brewer's playground for developing new seasonal beers, high gravity brews, and whatever else the brewers dream up. Highland currently supplies both Carolinas, Georgia, Tennessee, Florida, Alabama, Ohio, Kentucky and Virginia. Thanks for your support!
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Friday 4-8pm, Saturday 2-8pm. Tours are daily at 4pm and 4:45. Additional tours at 2:45 and 3:30 on Saturday.

name: Highlands Hollow Brewhouse
description: Highlands Hollow is located on the road to Bogus Basin and is a favorite place to meet for skiers, cyclists and hikers alike. Just what you would expect from a brewpub, Highlands Hollow Brewhouse serves up great comfort food, and their handcrafted ales are some of the finest in the Northwest. The “Hollow” offers Happy Hour everyday from 3pm-6pm, daily lunch and dinner specials, along with live music by local artists on special occasions. Open 7 days a week with deck seating during the warmer months.

name: Highway 1 Brewing Company
description: A unique brewpub located on California's beautiful Highway 1, with ocean views from the bar and dinning room. Specializing in local ingredients and unusual combinations, in a relaxed coastal atmosphere.
hoursOfOperation: Sunday, Monday &Thursday 11-8p  Friday & Saturday 11-9p

name: Hill Farmstead Brewery
description: Hill Farmstead Brewery is the culmination of travel and insight, of friendships and explorations, and of realizing a sense of one’s place.  Upon the hand hewn land of our forebears, we honor eight generations of Greensboro ancestry by thoughtfully engaging with our heritage and with our distinctive beers. This offering is our effort to revive, diversify, and prolong the memory of the Hill Farmstead. Share. Consider. Enjoy.

name: Hillcrest Brewing Company
description: The Hillcrest Brewing Company (HBC), The World’s First “Out and Proud LGBT Brewery " is set to open in June of 2012 in time to celebrate the 43rd anniversary of the Stonewall Inn Uprising. We specialize in handcrafted beer and stone oven pizzas with bottles, growlers & kegs to-go.     The restaurant, managed by Joey Arruda, serves paired pizza that is perfectly orchestrated with a focus from the water and flour to create its crust, to the fresh Italian Roma tomatoes with fresh toppings and cheeses before it is fired in stone lined ovens.   We are located at 1458 University Avenue, in the colorful and vibrant LGBT community of Hillcrest in San Diego. HBC features four initial microbrews with plans for up to twelve more to come. Pouring only grains and grapes- our 24 beers on tap and assorted selection of wines are paired with specialty pizzas, by our talented breweristas. The remainder of the taps pours “Guest” brews from other local micro breweries.     Our tap-room, designed in-house features an open ceiling with sealed concrete floors and a 15 foot chandelier made with 97 sustainable 22oz beer bottles that will hang within a 23 foot copula. Additional clusters of hanging beer bottle chandeliers give life to a total Frankenstein set up, with much of the equipment home-made including a steam punk style bottling machine built from scratch by David White, Brewmaster/Artist/Mad-Scientist who lives, breathes and dreams beer. A 13 foot garage door opens to an L-Shaped outdoor patio with cushioned keg barrel seating and planters with local varietal hop bines (hop vines) that can grow up to 25+ feet along horizontal trellises.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri:	4:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sat - Sun:	12:00 pm - 12:00 am

name: Hilliard's Beer
description: We opened our doors in October, 2011 with focus on beer in cans.  Founded by Ryan Hilliard and Adam Merkl, we now have a much larger crew and even more beer.    We self-distribute canned and draft beer to bars and restaurants within Seattle and have a 1 case minimum.  Please contact Adam Merkl at 206-915-3303 or adam@hilliardsbeer.com for info.  Off-premise sales within Seattle as well as on and off-premise sales of our canned beer outside Seattle is handled by our distributor, Noble.
hoursOfOperation: Monday-Friday 9 am until 5 pm

name: Hinterland Brewery
description: Hinterland is a small artisinal brewery devoted to brewing world class beer. Founded in 1995, by Bill & Michelle Tressler, Hinterland makes it's home in a turn of the century meat packing warehouse. Our award-winning beer can be found throughout Wisconsin's finest restaurants, taverns, grocery stores or anywhere craft beer is sold.In addition, Hinterland beer is served at our restaurant attached to the brewery in Green Bay as well as Hinterland Erie Street Gastropub in Milwaukee's Third Ward District and at our affiliated restaurant The Whistling Swan Inn & Restaurant in Fish Creek, WI.

name: Historic Brewing Company
description: Historic Brewing Co. is a Flagstaff, AZ based brewery. We believe in making damn good craft beer and bringing the local community together. As a family company established in 2013, Historic Brewing Company is proud to brew in the woods of Flagstaff and celebrate craft beer with local ingredients and a kickass attitude. We are a company rooted in passion, quality brewing methods, and good ol' fashioned hustle.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Fri: 5:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Hitchhiker Brewing Co.
description: Hitchhiker Brewing produces high quality, unique and distinctive beers for the craft beer lover. Our beer is hand crafted on site and you will always be guaranteed a quality beer.     Our brewpub is located in the heart of Mount Lebanon. We have an inviting space where you can take a growler of our fresh beer to go, or come in and stay for a pint. Our knowledgeable beer staff will guide you through a great beer experience. We are committed to brewing the best beer possible with the lowest environmental impact.
hoursOfOperation: Sunday: 12pm - 6pm  Monday: Closed  Tueday: Closed  Wednesday: 3pm - 11pm  Thursday: 3pm - 11pm  Friday: 12pm - 11pm  Saturday: 12pm - 11pm

hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Thu: 11:00 am - 1:00 am  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 2:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 12:00 am
