hoursOfOperation: Sunday 12p-12am  M-W 11am – 12am  Thursday 11am-1am  Fri & Sat 11am – 2am

name: Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm

name: Hogshead Brewery
description: Hogshead Brewery and Tap Room has been designed and developed to provide a variety of beers with an emphasis on English ales in a warm and inviting atmosphere with a neighborhood friendly feel.    The Slo-Hi location was developed to allow a local clientele, as well as beer aficionados and lovers of good times a central spot in Denver to enjoy a proper pint and have a chat. We will always have three to four great beers on tap via CO2 pressurized kegs and plan to maintain properly conditioned Real Ale from naturally carbonated casks served from beer engines for those that enjoy this traditional British libation.
hoursOfOperation: Monday-Wednesday: 4pm-9pm  Thursday: 2pm-10pm  Friday-Saturday: 12pm-10pm  Sunday: 12pm-8pm.

name: Hogshead Brewery and Tap Room
description: Hogshead Brewery and Tap Room has been designed and developed to provide a variety of beers with an emphasis on English ales in a warm and inviting atmosphere with a neighborhood friendly feel. The Slo-Hi location was developed to allow a local clientele, as well as beer aficionados and lovers of good times a central spot in Denver to enjoy a proper pint and have a chat. We will always have three to four great beers on tap via CO2 pressurized kegs and plan to maintain properly conditioned Real Ale from naturally carbonated casks served from beer engines for those that enjoy this traditional British libation. The brewing system and associated cellar has been custom designed with an integrated control system, that allow the brewer to process from one to ten barrels in a batch process and ferment in temperature controlled Stainless Steel vessels. Each of the beers have been formulated from carefully selected malted barley, treated water, multiple varieties of hops, and a specific yeast strain to produce the flavor, mouth-feel, alcohol content, aroma and bitterness, as well as the complex flavor profile according to the time and temperature recipe intended by the brewer. In addition to the attention to detail required for consistent and repeatable brews the brewmaster and support personnel follow a disciplined regiment of cleaning manually, and automatically with Clean-In-Place Systems (CIP) to exclude off-flavors, contaminants, and other undesirables in our beers. Every beer we serve has been naturally processed without the assistance of filtration which is why we are intensely focused on the highest quality ingredients, temperature controls, and finish aging to serve a quality product that we hope you enjoy as much as we do.

name: Hollister Brewing Company
description: Hollister Brewing Company (HBC) was established in May 2007 with a vision of creating a fun, relaxing establishment offering handcrafted beer to complement handcrafted food.    We are a locally owned and operated brewpub and our goal is to provide and maintain a comfortable, unpretentious environment that appeals to our local clientele as well as beer and food aficionado’s from around the country. We’re here to exceed expectations, to introduce people to things they may not have had before, and to do it in a fun and educational way.    HBC was born of a devotion to quality, craft, and community. We strive to raise the bar in terms of what people eat and drink, how it was made, who made it, where it came from, where the ingredients it came from came from, who grew those ingredients and how. From the materials used to build HBC and the artisans who built and installed them, to our eclectic music mix, to our efforts to minimize our downstream impact, we are striving to champion the artist, the artisan and the environment. While we are certainly far from perfect in our application of these ideals, they are our core and what we aim for.

name: Holly Springs Nano Brewing
description: A funky little brewery in planning, in an old bank bldg, deep in the heart of the urban jungle of downtown in Holly Springs.

name: Hollywood Beach Brewing Co
description: Hollywood Beach Brewing Company was founded by Chris Hanson and Jeff Brown, two long time high school buddies, in the summer of 2005.  Brewing began as a hobby on the kitchen stove and soon became a passion border lining a hobby gone mad.

name: Holy Brew Brewing Company
description: The inner battle of good and evil was never more apparent than when one takes that first cleansing sip of HolyBrew. While your "good" nature will definitely be aroused by this cool, spirit-raising refreshment, your inner evil will soon begin to feel less inhibited, allowing initial laughter and fun to soon require an internal battle of self-restraint.    History - Since the dawn of mankind, we have struggled with the battle of good and evil. To drown in guilt or sorrow is unhealthy and seen by some as wasted emotions. In opposition, to live our lives completely without impure influence and to be seen by all as “up-tight” without the ability to cut loose on occasion is viewed in equally a negative fashion. Until now, there has never been a respectable or enjoyable solution to this life long struggle.  HolyBrew is a positive channel for cleansing one’s mind, body and spirit of unwanted or unnecessary guilt, doubt or unhappiness. Through a recently discovered magical formula, believed to be created from the gods themselves, HolyBrew has formulated the “Liquid Confession”. What better way to cleanse one’s soul than to partake of this succulent brew, confess one’s sins and erroneous ways and let the weight of their guilt be lifted and their thirst quenched simultaneously.  Join the movement in guilt-free pleasure and refreshment. Have your liquid confession today and enjoy life to its fullest.

name: Holy City Brewing
description: Holy City Brewing, established July 20, 2011, is a craft brewery located in North Charleston, SC. We strive to create hand crafted ales and lagers with our 15bbl system. We are proud to be a part of the Charleston community and look forward to providing you with great beer.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Tue:	4:00 pm - 6:00 pm  Wed - Fri:	4:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Sat:	12:00 pm - 4:00 pm

name: Home of the Brave Beverage Co
description: Since 1991 Hawaii's Home of the Brave has proudly supported and honored our United States military. Join our continued mission to serve our troops by opening Hawaii's first Brewseum. We want to provide our troops and all Americans with the finest locally crafted beer. With your support, together we can make it a reality. Support America - Support Our Troops - Buy Home of the Brave.

name: The Brewseum
hoursOfOperation: The Brewseum is a brewpub celebrating the history of beer in Hawaii. Enjoy some of the best beers in Honolulu at an incredible one-of-a-kind spot!

name: Homer Brewing Company
description: If you haven’t had the oppor- tunity to visit Homer, Alaska, we are located 220 miles south of Anchorage where the road ends and Kachemak Bay begins.    Homer is known as "The Cosmic Hamlet by the Sea," and once you’ve been here, you’ll understand why. We are also known as the halibut capital of the world and that, too, is proven when you see a 300 pound fish hanging by its tail.    Our home is often referred to as the crown jewel of the state, and its beauty is defined by the land and seascape of the area.    If you need another reason to visit Homer, beer could be what brings you. Open since 1996, Homer Brewing Company has been welcoming both locals and visitors to the brewery every day of the year, with the exception of Thanksgiving, Christmas, New Years and Mardi Gras day.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat:	12:00 pm	-	7:00 pm  Sun:	12:00 pm	-	6:00 pm

name: Hometown Beverages
description: Hometown Beverages’ mission is to create traditional American lagers with flavors that are unique to the palate of beer drinkers in their respective area. Try new Hometown Light, Pennsylvania Lager, New Jersey Lager and New York Lager!    Hometown Beverages is America’s best new brewer of what they call "specialty" session beers. You know the kind you can drink one after another - after another - and not get filled up.     Hometown currently brews four different beers, namely - Hometown Light, Hometown Pennsylvania Lager, Hometown New Jersey Lager and Hometown New York Lager.     Chris Curylo and Bob Selsky, aka The “Hometown Boys,” are the owners of Hometown. They brew their beers in beautiful Wilkes-Barre, PA.

name: Hood Canal Brewery
description: Hood Canal Brewery opened its doors in September 1996 in an 800 sq. Ft. pole building at the home of Don Wyatt, owner and brewer, just north of Poulsbo, Washington. Don had five years experience in home-brewing and worked at the Thomas Kemper Brewery before its closing. When Kemper's closed its doors, he decided to follow his passion and strike out on his own.     Distribution of Hood Canal Beers started in Kitsap County. He later expanded his sales to the Seattle area via Odom Distributing Corporation, and now he personally distributes to bars, pubs, and grocery stores in Kitsap and surrounding counties.     Our Tasting Room is on Bond Road between Kingston and Poulsbo. It's about the ten minute drive from the Kingston ferry terminal or from Poulsbo.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Thu: 2:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: HooDoo Brewing Company
description: HooDoo Brewing Company makes world class ales, right here in the heart of Alaska. Come by for a glass of beer, and take a growler to enjoy at home! Prost!
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Fri: 3:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat: 11:00 am - 8:00 pm

name: Hook & Ladder Brewing Company
description: At Hook & Ladder Brewing we believe in great beer in the company of good friends, so we bring you three great beers for your drinking pleasure (please drink responsibly). Each of our beers is carefully crafted with the finest quality ingredients for a distinctive taste we know you will enjoy. Try one tonight, you just might get hooked. Through our own experiences in the fire and rescue service we have chosen the Hook & Ladder as a symbol of pride and honor to pay tribute to the brave men and women who serve and protect our communities.

name: Hoosier Brewing Company
description: A regional brewery with the finest in craft beer made with the best ingredients. We are the proud manufactures of redFLYER Irish Ale, & other brews!

name: Hoots Roller Bar & Beer Company
description: Let it be known that the HOOTS BEER CO. is a mysterious brotherhood which concocts blue collar brews of unmatched character. Combining beer’s old world elements with fair dosages of dark secrets, imagination, and old fashioned rock and roll, H.B.C. are boundless in ambition and highly attuned to Winston-Salem’s industrious spirit and local community. The faceless and nameless conjurers of HOOTS are hellbent on fulfilling one age-old prophecy: You will enjoy the beer you were born to imbibe.

name: Hop Alley Brew Pub
description: Georgia's newest Brew Pub. Providing Alpharetta, Ga and surrounding communities with excellent beer, brewed in-house, served right off the tank, along with pouring beers, brought in from world renowned breweries. All while serving fresh, delicious, food provided by local farmers.

name: Hop Dogma Brewing Company
description: Hop Dogma Brewing Company is proud to bring you creative hand-crafted ales and lagers made from the highest quality ingredients. We specialize in small batches and adventurous brews! Come on by and taste the difference!

name: Hop Farm Brewing Company
description: Local Beer, local hops. We have been brewing and growing hops in Pittsburgh for over 6 years and are glad to finally offer our beers on a larger scale.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Fri: 4:30 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Hop Valley Brewing Co.
description: Founded in February, 2009, Hop Valley is the first craft brewery in Springfield, OR.  With a 15 barrel system and a restaurant that compliments the fine hand crafted beer, Hop Valley has grown into one of Springfield's largest businesses.  Distributing beer throughout the State of Oregon.  Based on that success, and significant pent up demand for their beer, Hop Valley has just opened a new facility at 990 W.1st Ave in Eugene at which they have built a new, much larger, 60 barrel production brewery.  This facility will be capable of producing up to 100,000 barrels per year, in stark contrast to the system in Springfield, that is maxed out at about 4000 barrels produced in 2012.  Our state of the art equipment and the facility are all built with every opportunity toward a green foot print, including the most efficient lighting, boiler, solar heating, etc.. available today.  The new facility has a large tasting room and outdoor patio and also has limited food service, to allow customers to enjoy all of our craft brews in a very comfortable setting, and with enough parking and outdoor area to support large parties!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 1:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm

name: Hopcat
description: HopCat was envisioned, designed, stocked and staffed with one mission in mind: to bring you great beer.

name: Hopothesis Beer Company
description: We’re relentlessly focused on making great craft beer that delivers a flavorful, approachable, balanced drinking experience for geeks and non-geeks alike.

name: Hopped Up Brewing Company
description: Hopped Up Brewing is located on E. Sprague Avenue in Spokane Valley. The brewery includes a tasting room with seating, open Wednesday thru Saturday 2 pm to 9 pm.  Ask us to Hop Up your private events.  Steve Ewan, the owner/brewer at Hopped Up Brewing, is a fan of hot rods. The name Hopped Up is a reference to his love for beer as well as his appreciation of hopped-up cars. And then there’s the building. Hopped Up Brewing is located in a former International House of Pancakes (IHOP).  It’s all Hopped Up!!!  Steve has brewed up several different beers. Quality Cream Ale, High Performance Porter, and Raspberry Champale to name a few. We started out by pouring beer at the tasting room exclusively but but now distribute to local  establishments as well.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Sat: 2:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Hoppers Grill & Brewing Company
description: Hoppers opened its doors in Midvale, UT December 16th, 1996 becoming the first brew pub in the south end of the Salt lake Valley. Since its inception, Hoppers has offered both tradition and non-traditional bar food from our famous beer battered fish and chips, and homemade soups and burgers to our complimentary sticky buns served with weekend brunch. We also craft our award winning beer in our onsite brewery.     While Hoppers is just one location, we compete with the best nationally. To date Hoppers has won 34 Medals for our hand crafted brews at the North American Brewers Association and the Great American Beer Festival. While modern beer styles have limited brewers by putting everything into categories, our Brewmaster, Donovan, finds inspiration in history and takes beer back to its roots and then gives it a twist without taking away the quality of a good beer.     You can see innovation, passion and devotion in everything we do. That is why we are where locals go to “chill” in south end of the Salt Lake Valley.     Hoppers Grill and Brewing Company – Your Local Chill

name: Hoppy Brewing Company
description: We are a brewpub in Sacramento, CA that bottles a bit too. This year we celebrate 20 years of great food, awesome beer, and cool people. You can find our products in many of Sacramento's finest establishments as well as other notable locations throughout northern California.

name: Hops & Grain Brewery
description: Hops and Grain is a local Austin brewery that produces hand-crafted ales and handmade dog treats. We are very passionate about our craft and strive to create sustainability in everything that we do

name: Golden
hoursOfOperation: 11am to 11pm daily

name: Matthews
hoursOfOperation: 11am - 11pm daily

name: Littleton
hoursOfOperation: 11am to 11pm daily

name: Alexandria
hoursOfOperation: 11am to 11pm daily

name: Hopshire Farm and Brewery
description: We have been growing hops for 6 years and are very excited about hops farming coming back to New York. Our craft ales will feature NY hops and other agricultural products in a variety of beer styles. The Hopshire brewery building is a recreation of a 19th century NY hop house built with modern techniques for a high performance building.
hoursOfOperation: Wednesday – Friday 4 to 8  Saturday 11 to 6  Sunday 1 to 6  Monday and Tuesday Closed

name: Hopworks Urban Brewery
description: HUB is Portland's first Eco-Brewpub to offer all organic handcrafted beers, fresh local ingredients, and a sustainable building with a relaxed and casual atmosphere. Brewmaster Christian Ettinger has spent the past year and half constructing his dream brewpub.  HUB incorporates all aspects of sustainability.  From composting to rain barrels, and from pervious pavers to hand dryers, we have made every effort to protect our future with a thoughtful alternative.  Hopworks has four distinct areas including a family friendly restaurant with play area, a vibrant bicycle bar, banquet mezzanine, and outdoor beer-garden.  Our 20 barrel brewery produces 3000 barrels a year and provides our restaurant with ten different HUB organic beers on tap and two cask ales at all times. We have parking for seventy cars, eight motorcycles and up to fifty bikes.  Our world-class beer, New York style pizza, and wonderful staff are some of the best you will find anywhere.

name: Horny Goat Brewing Company
description: We’re often questioned about the origin of our name. Our story has it that “Spanish Fly Brewing” sounded too clumsy. Another says it was a bet at a card game. A third we’ve been advised by our lawyers not to discuss. While each rendition may have some truth to it, what it really boils down to is quite simple: Beer is fun. Brewing is fun. Drinking beer with your buddies is fun. So, why not a name that’s fun? After all, we’re in the business of helping people enjoy life. And we take our business very seriously. Our beers are craft-brewed for Old World taste and new world refreshment. Savored, slammed or sipped,these beers are also brewed to be sold and we plan on selling a lot of them. Aggressive marketing campaigns are in place to make sure Horny Goat Beers are on the radar of beer purchasers in select markets. Radio commercials, point-of-sale, guerilla tactics, swag, social media, you name it ‘cause we plan on growing, and growing large quickly. Kind of like a horny goat. So prepare yourself, the world is about to become a much hornier place.

name: Horse & Dragon Brewing Company
description: Work & family, hops & malt, Horse & Dragon. We craft high quality, great tasting beers sustainably and build community in the heart of Northern Colorado, the Napa Valley of Beer.

name: Horse Heaven Hills Brewery
description: Our beers are well balanced and finish smooth. During the brewing process, we utilize meticulous attention to detail while creating a balance between select malts, hops, and yeast. From the standard favorites to our new brews, Horse Heaven strives to create hand crafted beers that fit our friends flavor profiles. The hardest decision to make  is which beer to taste first!

name: Horsefly Brewing Co
description: Horsefly Brewing Company decided they wanted the name to represent something “local”.  They couldn’t spell Uncompahgre so they settled on Horsefly, which is a peak 10,000 feet high on the Uncompahgre Plateau west of Montrose.    In April of ’09 Horsefly Brewing Company started brewing recipes and fine tuning them.  In May ’09 construction began on the current location.  After lots of sweat and tears, (from watching the bar top drip on the floor) and with the help of a lot of friends and family, the doors finally opened September 9th, 2009.   09-09-09 was supposed to be lucky someone said.    In September of ’10 the doors opened at our new & current location. This was a 4 month adventure into remodeling the building to suit as brewery.

name: Horseheads Brewing
description: Horseheads Brewing broke ground on June 2006 and opened it's doors for business on July 3rd, 2007. The Master Brewer, after "home-brewing" for 8 years, received his education and certificate of concise brewing technology from the Siebel Institute in Chicago.
hoursOfOperation: Monday 12-6 PM  Tuesday	12-6 PM  Wednesday 12-6 PM  Thursday 12-6 PM  Friday 12-7 PM  Saturday 12-7 PM  Sunday 12-4 PM

name: Horseshoe Bend Brewing Co.
description: Horseshoe Bend Brewing Co., is a micro-brewery located on "the Bend", of Lake of the Ozarks, a 7-mile long peninsula. It's named after its horseshoe like shape, as the lake follows it's natural shoreline.     Chris and Carrie Case transformed a Firehouse from the 70's into a 7-barrel brewhouse.  Carrie had some roots in the Ozarks, but both moved from Colorado with a passion for craft beer. Chris worked previously as a Chef for over 20 years and Carrie with many years of Marketing and Graphic Design experience.  They figured that should be a good start for owning their own brewery.  Come to find out, Chris was really good at developing flavors and Carrie was really good at finding out what people liked...and several years of practice in the garage helped too!      They focus on traditional brewing methods along with new techniques to produce distinct full-flavored beers!
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu: 2:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 2:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun: 1:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Hosanna Brewing Company
description: Hosanna Brewing Co’s Brewpub is the greatest place to enjoy beer, wine and coffee with friends. It’s the best escape from normal life in the Triangle. If you’re looking for a great night out you’ll be glad you spend it at Hosanna Brewing Co.

name: House of Pendragon Brewing Company
description: House of Pendragon Brewing Co. focuses on handcrafted artisan made ales and lager.    Nothing is off limits at House of Pendragon Brewing Company. Here, we embrace the flavor. We use modern brewing techniques and the latest ingredients. With no restrictions holding us back, we’re not just thinking outside the box, we’re breaking it down and recycling it!    What does Pendragon mean?   Pendragon is the last name of the famed Arthur Pendragon, otherwise known as King Arthur and The Knight’s of the Round Table. The translation of the name Pendragon literally means "head dragon" or "chief dragon".

name: Howard Brewing Company
description: Howard Brewing Company is a brand new craft brewery opening in Lenoir, North Carolina at the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains.    We will be opening in a great old building downtown on West Avenue alongside the Carolina Distillery and a new pub-style restaurant. We are working on some great ideas at the building including rain water recapture, solar power, and renovating the building so the dining experience literally overlooks the brewery and distillery operations. We are excited to bring our beer to you as soon as we can and are acquiring our brewhouse and swinging the hammers as you read this...

name: Hub City Brewing Co
description: Set in the heart of the Midwest, the Hub City Brewing Company is located five miles east of the historic town of Oelwein, Iowa. Founded in 1872 on a plot of land nestled amongst the fields, the city served as a hub for three major branches of the Chicago Great Western Railway, earning it the nickname of "Hub City" during the heyday of the railroad. Our beers pay homage to this historic Iowa town and the romantic era of the iron horse.

name: Humboldt Brewing Company
description: In 1987 a new direction in craft beer took flight from the redwoods of Northern California, helping set the pace for the craft brew revolution.   Founded in Humboldt County as one of California’s pioneering microbreweries, Humboldt Brewing Co. has been making waves for decades with our innovative brewing techniques and award-winning flock of delicious brews.     We have experienced quite a journey in our 26 years. Today, we are independently owned by Total Beverage Solution and brewed on California’s Central Coast by Firestone Walker. We continue to craft the finest all-natural brews from the California Coast, giving you a taste of the Humboldt spirit in every sip.

name: Humboldt Brews
description: Humboldt Brewing Company was founded in Arcata, California in 1987. They brewed the famous Red Nectar and Hemp Ale until 2000 when they moved the brewing process to Firestone Walker Brewing Company in Paso Robles, California. In 2003, the Humboldt Brewing Company stopped all operations and closed it’s doors.  At that time, the majority of the employees formed Humboldt Brews LLC and opened for business in March 2004 as employee owned. In 2007 we had a major remodel to our building and at that time revamped our menu as well.    In 2009, with the old Humboldt Brewing space still vacant, we added our HUMBREWS Next Door music venue and banquet room. On November 12, 2009, The Mother Hips played to a full room. Since then we have hosted many entertainers and have held countless of events establishing ourselves as one of the premier live music venues in the North Coast.  Humboldt Brews is looking forward to celebrating 10 years of business in March 2014!

name: Humboldt Regeneration Brewhouse
description: Our Mission is to raise awareness about the importance of re-localization and building a healthy community.  We aim to serve as yet another example of a small local business directly supporting our local food-economy.  By growing our own ingredients, distributing directly to community members, and having an educational focus pertaining to craft brewing and sustainable agricultural practices we hope to help build a more resilient community.
hoursOfOperation: Friday - Tuesday  11:00-7:00pm

name: Addison
description: The first Humperdink's opened on Greenville Avenue at Southwestern in 1976 as the Original Dallas Sports Restaurant & Sports Bar. We soon opened in Addison followed by Las Colinas (now relocated at West NW Hwy in Dallas) then Richardson in 1991 and Arlington at Six Flags. We began Brewing our own Beer in 1995 when the Arlington Restaurant opened and now offer our award winning beers at all locations. Humperdink's has the local flavor Texans love in a casual yet upscale atmosphere.    Fun, sports-oriented lounges are perfect for gatherings & celebrations.    Locally owned & "humpin' to please" since 1976!! Large parties welcome, gift cards available.    Our Mission is simple and dedicated:    We are a casual and fun Restaurant group emphasizing quality food, drink and service with positive attitudes providing for satisfied guests.
hoursOfOperation: Monday through Saturday 11am-2am  Sunday 11am - Midnight

name: Hunter Gatherer Brewery and Alehouse
hoursOfOperation: Mon: 4:00 pm - 12:00 am  Tue - Fri: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Sat: 4:00 pm - 12:00 am

name: Hunter's Brewing
description: Hunter's Brewing is a nanobrewery located in Chesterton, IN. Brewed by hand on our one-barrel system, Hunter's Brewing beers focus on flavor and range from the traditional to the creative.    Owner-brewers Justin Reisetter and Amy Gentry take a thoughtful approach to brewing and are delighted to bring high-quality, small-batch boutique brews to the Duneland region.      We offer 32 oz half-growlers to go.
hoursOfOperation: Thursday 5-9pm, Friday 4-9pm, Saturday noon-9pm and most (not all) Sundays 1-6pm.

name: Huske Hardware House Restaurant and Brewery
description: Fayetteville North Carolina's only downtown brewery with live entertainment!  Enjoy first-class Custom Brewed beer in a casual, sophisticated atmosphere!    Huske Hardware is proudly brewing 6 unique Custom Craft Beers - never filtered and always using the highest quality import and domestic malts and hops.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Tue:	 11:00am - 10:00pm  Wed - Thu:  11:00am - 12:00pm  Fri - Sat:  11:00am - 2:00am  Sun:  11:00am - 9:00pm

name: Huss Brewing Company
description: We are a Quality Lager and Aleworks Brewery with focus on American Craft Beer.  We are located in the now defunct Rio Salado Brewery in South Tempe.  We have a Tap Room with 20 revolving handles of the beers made on site along with the best beers available in Arizona.    Two people with a lot of passion for Craft Beer.  Owned and operated by husband and wife team Jeff and Leah Huss.  Together they have 20 years experience in the Craft Beer Industry.  Jeff “Ginger” Huss graduated from the Siebel Institute of Brewing Technology and was the Head Brewer for BJ’s Brewery in Chandler Arizona for over Seven years.  Leah Huss graduated from Scottsdale Culinary Institute with a degree in Culinary Arts and has been the Managing Partner at the Papago Brewing Co. in Scottsdale since 2001.  Both share a love and passion for American Craft beer and it’s culture, and look forward to sharing their knowledge and experience with you!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 3:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri: 3:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 2:00 pm

name: Hyde Park Brewing Company
description: Hyde Park Brewing Company

name: Hydro Street Brewing Company
description: Our brewery is in central Wisconsin just outside of Madison, which is thankfully vibrant with craft breweries, and now even distilleries. (the Napa valley of micro beer? love it) Our goal as a small business is first to provide high quality food, beverage, and service to all; and second to support our community.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 9:00 am - 11:30 pm

name: I & I Brewing
description: We are a very small brewery located in Chino, CA. We are starting out as basically just homebrewers with an outlet to share our beers with others. We brew in very small batches and currently the only place to get our beer is directly from our brewery. This allows us a great deal of freedom in variety of style and recipe selection.     One of the main reasons we started I & I was because it was hard to find good fresh beer around. Although there are many great breweries in the surrounding counties, San Bernardino County had very few so we decided to open our own.
hoursOfOperation: Tuesday 4 PM to 8 PM  Wednesday 4 PM to 8 PM  Thursday 4 PM to 8 PM  Friday 4 PM to 10 PM  Saturday 2 PM to 10 PM

name: Ice Harbor Brewing Co
description: Established in 1997, Ice Harbor Brewing Company is dedicated to producing award-winning beers for people who love beer.

name: Icicle Brewing Company
description: We are a Production Brewery and Tasting Room located in Leavenworth, Washington. We produce fresh, delicious craft brews!    Our tasting room overlooks our craft brewery where our head brewer, Dean Priebe has masterfully combined the pristine waters of the Icicle River with only the freshest ingredients to craft fresh and flavorful ales and lagers for your enjoyment.

name: Idle Hands Craft Ales
description: Based in Everett, Massachusetts, Idle Hands Craft Ales is the Boston area’s only nanobrewery.  We hand craft our beer with a nod towards belgian styles mixed with new world ideas. Founded in 2010, we recently received our federal license only days before the new year and are currently planning to produce our first commercial beers by late Winter/early Spring 2011.

name: Idyll Hounds Brewing Company
description: Idyll Hounds is a small craft brewery located in northwest florida. The white sand beaches forever blue sky and warm waters of florida give inspiration to the carefully crafted fresh tasty brews. Whether it's the tropical crispness of the Divide N Conch'r DIPA, the refreshing beachablility of our Man O' Wheat or the unique flavors of our seasonal line you can know our beer is responsibly brewed with the freshest and finest ingredients. At Idyll Hounds we brew for the beer enthusiasts and the novice beer drinkers alike. With a local first mind set concoctions are brewed with poetic attention to detail and memories that easily inspire lines of prose.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri: 9:00 am - 5:00 pm

name: Iechyd Da Brewing Company
description: Local microbrewery/pub. Brew house on premise with a 70 seat pub. 10 rotating taps and 2 handpulls. Simple and delicious menu includes fresh made pizza, oven-baked sandwiches and snacks made in house! Get some Great Local Beer!!!!
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu: 3:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Imperial Oak Brewing
description: Imperial Oak Brewing is a Micro brewery focused on brewing high gravity beers with many barrel and wood aged offerings. We'll have some incredible session-able beer in there somewhere too.

name: VA Beach
description: We are a small brewery on the outskirts of Gig Harbor fueled by impulse. When the urge strikes, be sure to "Satisfy Your Impulse".

name: Indeed Brewing Company
description: Indeed Brewing Company has a penchant for adventure, both in the beers we brew and the way we go about brewing them.     We offer two flagship beers: Day Tripper Pale Ale & Midnight Ryder American Black Ale. We also brew seasonal offerings like Shenanigans Summer Ale, and Stir Crazy Winter Ale.     Visit our taproom to to buy 10, 16, or 20-oz. beers, or take home 750 mL bottles of beer. Our tours are available on Saturday's, to sign up, visit our website at IndeedBrewing.com.    Indeed Brewing was founding in Feb. 2011, and began production in July 2012, and opened taproom in August 2012.    We distribute kegs, 12-oz. cans, and specialty beers in 750 mL bottles.

name: Independence Brewing Company
description: Rob and Amy Cartwright embarked on their dream to brew flavorful, delicious beers for the people of Austin in October 2004. Armed with their love of beer, years of brewing experience, an intrepid spirit, and their trusty dog Jasper, they founded Independence Brewing Company.    Located in southeast Austin, amongst tech companies and warehouse park entrepreneurs, Independence Brewing is a true reflection of the creative energy and pioneering spirit that makes Austin great.    What started with a married couple and their dog, has blossomed into a crew of nineteen and a community of beer drinkers who enjoy drinking fresh, handcrafted beer.

name: Indian Joe Brewing, Inc.
description: Welcome to Indian Joe Brewing. We are a taste experience pushing the boundaries of flavor and limitations on our beer. We brew a variety of handcrafted beverages such as Ales, Witbiers, Stouts and Hefeweizens. We are continuously changing our line up. So, stop on by and check us out!

name: Indian Wells Brewing Company
description: Proudly producing fine ales & lagers since 1995. One of California's favorite microbreweries!

name: Indiana City
description: It’s our mission to brew innovative beers for craft beer lovers in Indy. And that is that. We’re focused on Indy. We’re doing all we can to add to the beer culture right here. We’re filling growlers at our taproom near downtown, and we’re on tap at select craft beer bars in Indy.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Thu: 4:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 2:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 4:00 pm

name: Infamous Brewing Company
description: The team at IBC hails from a diverse background spanning multiple industries who have settled in ATX from other parts of Texas and from both the East and West Coasts.   We have been home brewing for quite some time and now we are taking that passion to the next level by offering our creations to as many people as possible.  We are currently in the initial stages of development and hope to begin production by year end. Given the strict licensing process, it will probably be sometime in early 2013 before we can share our beers with the rest of Austin, but we are working hard to make that happen as soon as legally possible.  Much more information will be coming on our planned initial beer selection. In the meantime, continue to check back for updates and continue to spread the word!

name: Infinity Brewing
description: 7 barrel brew operation.  Hours of operation for tasting room and retail outlet are currently Thursdays and Fridays from 4pm until 8pm and Saturdays from noon until 6pm.  Summer Sunday hours are noon until 4pm for tastings.
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  4:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 8:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 6:00pm Sun:  12:00pm - 4:00pm

name: Infusion Brewing Company
description: Located in the heart of the "Benson Beer District" in Omaha, Nebraska, and built in the historic former home of Olson's Meat Market , Infusion Brewing Company brews up great hand crafted beers with a locally sourced twist! Our beers are available through our on-site tap room and in the Omaha and Lincoln areas on draft only.

name: Inland Empire Brewing Company
description: Inland Empire Brewing Company was formed in 2007 by three long time friends.  We had all been home brewers for approximately five years prior to stumbling upon a really good deal on some used 7 BBL brewing equipment. We all three decided that we had what it takes to go big, and sell our beer to the public!    After about two years of work with Government agencies, permitting and construction, we opened our doors to the public on February 20th, 2009!  While we are now down to two owners, we continue to grow at a comfortable pace.    We’ve recently (early 2012) added four 15 BBL State of the art conical fermenters, which has improved fermentation times, consistency and quality.  We are also working on other new projects, yet to be announced.

name: Innovation Brewing
hoursOfOperation: Mon: Closed  Tues - Thurs: 4:00pm - 11:00pm  Fri: 4:00pm - 12:00am  Sat: 12:00pm - 12:00am  Sun: 2:00pm - 11:00pm

name: Institution Ale Company
description: We are a family owned and operated micro-brewery dedicated to crafting uncompromised and unfiltered American style ales. We are committed to producing and serving world class beer to our local community. Our Camarillo based brewery has an on-site tasting room and our beer is available at select local bars/restaurants.

name: Intangible Ales
description: Brewer of eclectic, rustic and wild ales based in South Central Pennsylvania.  Intangible Ales is a new project combining Terry Hawbaker's passion for brewing and Kristen Mullen's passion for photography (Watch for Kristen’s cool label art!)  Most releases will be in bottles, however there will be some occasional draft as well.     Style is subjective. Art is an ale.

name: Intercourse Brewing Company
description: "May your spirit be light and may you always enjoy Intercourse."    Affectionately named for the town in Lancaster County, PA Intercourse Brewing Company began production in June 2008.

name: Intergalactic Brewing Co
description: We are a San Diego Based Pilot Brewery, currently operating on a Nano-Scale brewing system.

name: Iowa River Brewing Company
description: Iowa River Brewing Company is a craft brewery specializing in small batch beers. The brewery feature a tasting room and sells beer for take out in growlers or for consumption in the brewery. Beer is available for sale in kegs to restaurants, bars and for special events. Iowa River Brewing is also planning to offer private label brewing.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Sat: 3:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Ipswich Ale Brewery
description: Always Fresh and Local Since 1991    Makers of Ipswich Ale, Stone Cat Ales & Lagers, and Mercury Soda Pop. Located in historic Ipswich, Massachusetts, one of America's oldest towns. Proudly brewed since 1991.    What sets our Ales apart is our brewing process. We produce styles which are totally unfiltered and unpasteurized. Through this natural brewing style the result is ale which maintains a greater level of freshness, mouth feel, and full flavor.

name: Iron City Brewing Company
description: Iron City Brewing Company is Pittsburgh born and brewed. We've been a Pittsburgh tradition since 1861. That was the year a German immigrant by the name of Edward Frauenheim founded Iron City Brewery and began a legacy of producing quality beers and lagers in the city of Pittsburgh. Today, the new Iron City Brewing Company is poised to carry on a tradition that is synonymous with pride, innovation and the Western Pennsylvania region. The new Iron City Brewing Company is committed to its employees, its customers, and the community. We have an experienced team with deep resources that is dedicated to making Iron City Brewing Company a successful brewery that the region can be proud to call its own.

name: Iron Fist Brewing Company
description: Iron Fist Brewing Company is a family owned brewery located in Vista, California, smack-dab in the middle of the exciting San Diego craft beer scene. Our passion for the best hand crafted beer prompted us to make a lot of it. However, we quickly realized we were making a bit more than we could drink ourselves, so we decided to sell whatever we don't drink to you. So do yourself a favor; start a little revolution. It's ok. We won't tell on you. Put the 500 pack of light lager back with all its buddies and rule your taste with an Iron Fist!

name: Iron Goat Brewing
description: Iron Goat brews are now being served in some of Spokane's best bars and restaurants. Taproom will be open the first week of June.
hoursOfOperation: Tue:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Wed:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Thu:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  2:00pm - 9:00pm

name: Chestnut Hill
description: Welcome to Iron Hill Brewery & Restaurant, where you'll find fine handcrafted beers, creative yet informal cuisine, and friendly, attentive service in a casual, upscale atmosphere.    We're passionate about producing distinctive, full-flavored handcrafted beers, accompanied by fresh–from–scratch New American cuisine in a comfortable, casual atmosphere. Our goal has always been to provide food and beer that is inspired, consistently crafted and presented by a knowledgeable and courteous service staff.    Our commitment to support the communities in which we do business goes to the heart of what differentiates Iron Hill from other restaurants. But it is because of you, our guests, that we have been able to make this all happen.
hoursOfOperation: Opening late 2011

name: West Chester
hoursOfOperation: Sun:  11:00am - 11:00pm Tue:  11:00am - 12:00am Wed:  11:00am - 12:00am Thu:  11:00am - 12:00am Fri:  11:00am - 1:00am Sat:  11:00am - 1:00am  Kitchen Hours  Sunday – Wednesday: 11:00 am – 10:00 pm; Lite Fare after 9:00 pm  Thursday – Saturday: 11:00 am – 12:00 am; Lite Fare after 10:00 pm  Sundays – Prime Rib Dinner: 1:00 pm – 9:00 pm    Reservations  Reservations and Call-Aheads are accepted for Lunch and Dinner

name: Iron Horse Brewery
description: The Iron Horse Brewery that opened its doors in December of 2004 was a bit different than today. It had a very mom and pop feel, and featured a look that was as traditional as it gets. Those who knew of it visited regularly, but the regulars were few. For many, the brewery was a thing shrouded in mystery... college students-which comprise a fair percentage of Ellensburg's population for most of the year-would occasionally see a bottle on a store shelf and ask where it came from. The likely response:    "Yeah, I think some dude makes that in his basement or something..."    The word just wasn't getting out, and things didn't look good for the tiny brewery that made exceptionally tasty ales.   Well, a couple of hoodlums in their late-twenties jumped on the opportunity to own and operate their own brewery, and what resulted is the Iron Horse Brewery you know and love today. They tweaked some recipes, changed some names, threw some ridiculous theme parties to encourage locals to actually see the brewery with their own eyes, and good things started to happen. Locals started to dig what the guys were doing. A few bars took a chance and put Iron Horse back on tap, and the beer started flowing.     The word started getting out.

name: Iron Springs Pub & Brewery
description: Brewpub in the heart of Marin County.

name: Ironfire Brewing Company
description: Ironfire Brewing Company was founded in 2011 by John Maino and Gregory Webb. The two spent many years working/brewing together at Ballast Point in San Diego before venturing off on their own. They plan on a Spring 2012 opening.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Fri: 3:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Ironwood Brewing Co.
hoursOfOperation: Wed-Sat 4-9PM  Sun 1-4PM

name: Island Brewing Company
description: Island Brewing Company has been brewing in Carpinteria, CA since July, 2000 and has steadily gained a following of enthusiasts along the Santa Barbara coast. Owner and brewer Paul Wright began his brewing adventures after receiving a homebrew kit for Christmas in 1991 in Novato, CA. He joined the local brew club and started winning awards for his beers. Soon he found himself president and heading up the Marin County State Fair competitions, and after burning out all the burners on the stove, he was banished to brewing outdoors. A certified beer judge, he worked at Marin Brewing Company before starting off on his own, moving south to Carpinteria. Now a family run brewery, Island Brewing Company has won awards on both the state and national level. We serve local bars, restaurants, and retail outlets and have five and fifteen-gallon kegs and 22-ounce bottles available for weddings, caterers, as well as for thirsty individuals that happen to come our way. We’ve now opened a new brewery in beautiful downtown Carpinteria and hope you’ll stop by to visit soon.

name: Island Hoppin' Brewery
description: Our Island Hoppin' crew consists of Becca Gray, Jim Parker and our brew master Nate Schons.     Everyone of us brings something else to the brewery. We truly believe that to make an excellent brew you need to put a lot of heart and soul into your work.   We love brewing and it shows in every pint poured.

name: Isley Brewing Company
description: Isley Brewing Company is a new microbrewery coming to Scott's Addition area of Richmond VA. Our large tasting room will be great for relaxing with friends and family while enjoying an ever changing variety of artisanal beers. We will update this page with our progress.

name: ISOB Brewing Company
description: A small 2 BBL. production brewery located in Manhattan IL. Believed to be the first brewery the town has ever had.

name: Ithaca Beer Co.
description: Ithaca Beer Co.,established in 1998, has a mission to brew delicious beers for the purpose of making life more enjoyable. We strive to make this company better and build our brand name and good reputation among our customers.    Over the last decade we have worked hard doing just that, and we have had lots of fun in the process!  From our friendly staff to the award-winning beer to our community outreach, Ithaca Beer continues to brew beers for the purpose of making your simple moments worthwhile.  Take a moment to look around our brand new site and learn about more about Ithaca Beer as a company, the beers we brew, and our involvement in Ithaca, NY.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Sun  12pm - 9pm

name: Ivory Tower Brewery
description: The Ivory Tower Brewery - where it's all academic!    We are proud to be partnered with Academic Affairs and be the home of the brewing class here at Appalachian State University. Headed up by Dr. Brett Taubman and Dr. Shea Tuberty this class provides a rigorous coverage of the chemical, biological, and physical processes that go into brewing malted beverages, including coverage of the hops, malt, and yeast varieties and how they are combined to produce specific styles and flavors of beers. The class also covers the history of fermented beverages as well as the business side of beer and brewing. Students enjoy a "hands on-minds on" approach to brewing basic styles of beer during class at the Ivory Tower Educational Brewery in the Broyhill Events Center.

name: J Wells Brewery
description: Long time Home brewer using the best ingredients from all over the world to bring the finest brews to you.    4 legged friends always welcome, can book for private events on hours or days I am usually not open, growlers available and food is allowed to be brought in. I do have peanuts available.
hoursOfOperation: Tuesday – Thursday: 3-9  Friday: 3-10  Saturday: 12-10  Sunday: 12-8

name: J. Fargo`s Family Dining / Coyote J Brewing Co
J.J. Bitting Brewing Company
description: Established in 1997, J.J. Bitting Brewing Company was the first brewery to operate in Woodbridge Township, New Jersey, since the repeal of prohibition in 1933. Our spacious 3 story restaurant resides in a beautifully restored 100 year old brick building that once housed The J.J. Bitting Coal and Feed Depot.      During your visit, indulge in the finest American Grill Cuisine and Handcrafted Beer and Ales offered by our chef and master brewer while soaking in the vibrant and rustic environment the restaurant that has awarded us the distinction of “#2 Brew Pub In America” by BeerAdvocate.com and "Best Hot Wings" by besthotwings.com

name: Jack Pine Brewery - Taproom
description: Most homebrewers, at some point, begin to dream of starting their own brewery.  I had always liked my beer, but I realized that there tends to be a brewer’s bias towards their own beer.  A great deal of time and effort goes into making a batch of beer, so the brewer is bound to speak highly of their own goods.  It turns out, I’m my own worst critic.  I’m constantly searching for ways to improve the beer.  Whenever I shared brews with others, they always liked it as well, but who doesn’t like free beer?  For me, the seed was planted quite a few years ago when I started winning homebrewing awards statewide.  It was then I began to realize that I was making more than just pretty good homebrew.  I was making some damn good beer!  I began volunteering to judge at homebrew competitions and making an effort to get out and sample more of the beers not available in northern Minnesota.  I quickly realized that there was much more to explore in the world of beer than I realized.  I studied and tasted everything I could find regarding brewing science and beer styles.  In the midst of all of the studying and research, I took the Beer Judge Certification Program test and obtained a National rank in the BJCP.  I now had some credentials to back up my knowledge of good beer and brewing.  It was clear that this was starting to become more than just a hobby, so I began to put a bit more time and effort into the dream of starting a brewery.    So, after all this research and planning, what’s the plan?  Start small.    Jack Pine Brewery is starting very small.  Nanobrewery small.  Brewing forty gallons at a time small.  Did I mention the brewer is small?    This little brewery serves as a pilot system for the eventual build-out of a full scale production brewery.  It provides the opportunity to test the waters before sinking a boatload of cash into a warehouse full of stainless equipment.  Best of all, it gives YOU a chance to TRY THE BEER!  I’ve been my own worst critic for the past 12 years of homebrewing.  Now it’s your turn.  With your help, we can build a brewery to provide our friends and neighbors with delicious locally-brewed beer.    So, stop in and give it a try!
hoursOfOperation: Friday 4-7pm  Saturday 4-7pm

name: Jack Taylor's Brewery and Public House
Jack's Abby Brewing
description: Jack's Abby Brewing was formally founded in January of 2011 by three brothers, Jack, Eric and Sam Hendler, who grew up in a family business. The ideas behind it, however, date back over ten years to when Jack was still in college experimenting with home brews. After graduating, Jack became the head brewer of one of the largest brewpubs in the eastern US. He earned joint diplomas in Brewing Technology from Siebel Institute of Chicago and Doemans Academy of Munich. Currently he is a member of the Master Brewers Association.

name: Main Cidery
description: Jack’s Hard Cider is produced and canned by Hauser Estate Winery just 8 miles west of Historic Gettysburg, Pa. Our cider is produced from apples native to our home, Adams County Pennsylvania.  Featuring our farm fresh flavor, never from concentrate, Jack’s Hard Cider is part of the growing craft cider revolution.    The partially solar-powered, completely under-ground, naturally cool (55 degree) winery & cidery, churns out thousands of gallons of Jack’s Hard Cider per year. Each batch starts as apples skillfully grown and tended to by our farm manager Lee Wagner. Their juice is then carefully crafted by our Cider-maker and is filtered slowly to maintain flavor and a high level of smoothness for which our product has been noted. Jack’s Hard Cider awaits maturity in state of the art stainless steel tanks, and finally is canned on-site.

name: Jackalope Brewing Company
description: Jackalope Brewing Company is owned by Bailey Spaulding and Robyn Virball, two young ingénues with an affection for beer. They met in September 2002 in the tiny Scottish village of St. Andrews, Scotland. Bailey was a Harvard student doing a semester abroad and Robyn was beginning undergrad at St. Andrews. They bonded over being put into the worst dorm for overseas orientation and teaching Danish people how to play beer pong. Though after three months Bailey went back to Cambridge, you can't break the bonds that are made when teaching Europeans drinking games and a true friendship was born. During the next eight years, they both graduated, Bailey went off to Vanderbilt Law School, and Robyn entered the working world, but both thought they were meant for much bigger and more alcoholic things.
hoursOfOperation: Thursday: 4PM - 8PM  Friday: 4PM - 8PM  Saturday: 4PM - 8PM

name: Jacob Leinenkugel Brewing Company
description: Leinenkugel’s. The brand born in Wisconsin’s Northwoods 143 years ago, shares a powerful story of adventure, family and brewing heritage. A story of fifth generation craft brewers. And a portfolio of 11 distinctive, flavorful beers. No other brewer more passionately shares its family history or connects with its fans like Leinie’s.     The Jacob Leinenkugel Brewing Company produced its first beer in 1867 for the thirsty lumberjacks inhabiting Wisconsin’s Northwoods. Based in Chippewa Falls, Wisconsin, the brand has continued in the rich European tradition of brewing crisp, refreshing, and delicious craft beers.

name: Jaden James Brewery
description: All new micro brewery open at Cascade Winery
hoursOfOperation: Happy hour from 4-7 on Thirsty Thursdays. $1 off draft beers and glasses of wine.

name: Jagged Mountain Brewery
description: Jagged Mountain Craft Brewery is a unique, innovative, and distinctive brewery based out of Denver, Colorado.
hoursOfOperation: WED, THURS, 4PM-10PM  FRI, 4PM-11PM  SAT, 12PM-11PM  SUN, 12PM-6PM

name: Jailbreak Brewing Company
description: We are a production craft brewery located in Laurel Maryland. In addition to serving our beers to hundreds of restaurants, bars and retailers across the state, we also operate a tap room with a capacity of 150ppl. We offer 8-12 different styles of beer for purchase by the pint, sample flight and growlers to go. Food trucks are present onsite during normal business hours.

name: Jailhouse Brewing Company
description: Some often tell me that the old Hampton Jailhouse was the overnight home to many a drunken guest through the years. It seems only fitting that beer is being brewed in this quaint little two-story brick structure built in the 1920's. It's had its history as the jail, fire station, courthouse, mason lodge, and last but not least a sandwich shop that made those little sandwiches you can buy in gas stations. You know the triangle packaged ones that have mystery meat in them? Don't lie, you've had one. Today it is home to JailHouse Brewing Company and we are brewing hand-crafted beer not punching out license plates.
hoursOfOperation: Saturday's 2-6pm

name: Jaipur Restaurant and Brewpub
description: We are a two barrel (64 gallon) brewery located within the restaurant. All of the brewing process takes place right here! Our beers are created to compliment the cuisine. The beer we serve is fresh because it is made with all natural ingredients. Malted barley is added to water and boiled for nearly an hour. Fresh hops are added throughout the boil to add both flavor and aroma. This un-fermented beer is called wort and is pumped from the boil room to one of the three fomenters we have in the restaurant.
hoursOfOperation: Sunday - Thursday 5:00 - 9:30 pm  Fridays & Saturdays 5:00- 10:30 pm    Thursdays & Fridays 11:00 am - 2:00 pm

name: James River Brewing Company
description: The James River Brewing Company grew organically from a simple weekend experiment. It started with the age-old temptation to harness the process of fermentation and concoct our own ideas and flavors. Our first try intrigued us so much that we had to try again and this time share it with our friends and neighbors. We then realized that this could be more than a pastime, but a part of our small, local community. The only way we would do it is if we could make more than just a beer, but a revival.

name: Jamesport Brewing Company
description: Jamesport Center is a late Victorian six storefront complex. The earliest section was completed in 1890 and was occupied by the Red Andrews Saloon and the Central House Hotel. It was built by August Tiedemann, a noted local builder and architect, for two Swedish brothers, "Red" Andrew Johnson and Axel Johnson. It largely served sailors of the Great Lakes during the booming days of logging in Western Michigan.  In 1892 a second structure with decorative cast iron columns was added.(Now, entrance to Sunset Bay Antiques.) It served as the lobby of the Central House Hotel and provided a dining room, upstairs parlor rooms and additional bedrooms.  In 1905 the final four storefronts were added to provide apartments for the employees of the recently completed Star Watch Case Co., then located on nearby Rath Street. The ground level store-fronts of the buildings have been used for a wide variety of trades over the past 120 plus years, including a butcher shop, a millinery, a theatorium, a dry cleaners, a hardware store, a clothing shop, various furniture stores, the State Liquor Control Commission store, a bicycle shop, the local headquarters for the National Maritime Union, and currently, Sunset Bay Antiques and Jamesport Brewing Company

name: Jamul Brewing Co.
description: Jamul's Local Brewery is now serving our community's restaurants and pubs!! Stay up to date on where you can find the Jamul Brewing Co.® Brews!

name: Jasper Murdock's Alehouse / The Norwich Inn
description: In 1993, this Vermont brewery tradition was revived at the Norwich Inn when Jasper Murdock's Alehouse began producing traditional English-style ales in 5-gallon glass jugs. By 1995, an historic livery building was renovated and outfitted with a new four-barrel brew house, enabling 125-gallon batches. Though the vessels are now larger, we remain one of the smallest breweries in America.

name: Jasper Ridge Brewery
description: Established in 1996, the Jasper Ridge Brewery produces  beer made from all natural ingredients such as malts, hops, yeast, and water and creates beer that is bursting with individual flavor, color, and aroma. We provide it to you fresh from our 10-barrel all-grain brewing system on our property. We've rediscovered the rich, enjoyable flavor of fresh brewed beer.

name: Jaxons Restaurant and Brewing Co
description: Established in 1973, Jaxon's Restaurants & Brewing Co. has been providing the very best Southwestern food for over 30 years. Jaxon’s specialties include signature homemade Potato Green Chili and Tortilla soups, Santa Barbara Beef, a specially seasoned grilled sirloin served sliced with Jaxon’s own barbeque sauce; unique appetizers, fresh salads, gourmet hamburgers, hand-cut steaks, and much more! Jaxon’s “King” Margaritas and signature cocktails are acclaimed as the best in the region. Jaxon’s Brewery, the fourth oldest brew pub in the state of Texas, pours a variety of award-winning handcrafted ales and lagers. In addition, Jaxon’s offers FREE wireless Internet access and a wide range of multimedia services for business meetings and special events.

name: Jdub's Brewing Company
description: JDub's Brewing Company, located in sunny Sarasota, FL, is dedicated to Quality, Innovation and Culture. We celebrate our beer, our community, and life.

name: Jekyll Brewing
description: Produce the highest quality beer with passion. Bring people together. Give back to special causes. Exercise corporate responsibility. Have fun!

name: Jester King Craft Brewery
description: Located in the beautiful Texas Hill Country, Jester King Craft Brewery is an authentic farmhouse brewery committed to brewing artisan ales of great depth and character. At times drawing influences from the world beyond traditional brewers’ yeast, Jester King’s beer is not rushed to market but allowed to mature – often in oak barrels – to create the most enjoyable, interesting and exciting beer we can make. An additional layer of complexity is added to Jester King’s bottled beers by allowing a second fermentation to take place in the bottle. As part of its commitment to sustainability, the slow food movement and Texas, Jester King beer uses as many organic and local ingredients as possible and will soon be brewed with harvested rainwater.

name: Johansson’s Dining House and Restaurant
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat: 11:00 am - 1:00 am  Sun: 10:00 am - 1:00 am

name: John A. Huber Brewing Company
description: The John A Huber Brewing Company is a family owned and operated business. Here, brewing is family    "The concept for John A. Huber Brewing Company was set in motion in 1984 with the dreams of Missouri farmboy John Huber as he tasted his first home-brewed beer. In 2003, John received a home-brew kit for Christmas from his wife and sons. It was at that moment the Huber Brew or "Hubrew", the Company's flagship beer, was born. In 2009, he opened up Homebrew Supply of Southeast Missouri, LLC in Jackson, Missouri. In 2011, the John A. Huber Brewing Company took root in Fruitland, Missouri. The Company is a family owned and operated business. John's sons, Matthew and Chad, assist their father in the Company's operation. John and his family have lived in Southeast Missouri all their lives. They want to share their passion for brewing, their sense of community and their comradery. Come join them."    Hubrew is a packaging brewery. We do not currently have any onsite sales or tours.

name: Cambridge
description: John Harvard’s boasts and extensive list of brews, ranging from the tried and true All Amrican Light Lager to the rich, roasted Dry Irish Stout. In addition, we carry a full-line of seasonal brews, so you’re sure to find the perfect beer any time of year.    When you come to John Harvard’s, please check with your server to find out what specialty beers are available, as well. Our award winning brewers offer a range of beer styles from around the world.

name: Jolly Pumpkin Artisan Ales
description: Welcome to a land of open fermentation, oak barrel aging, and bottle conditioning. At Jolly Pumpkin Artisan Ales we are dedicated to more than the traditions of old world craftsmanship. Everything we do is designed to create ales of outstanding art and flavor. Focusing on traditional rustic country style beers brought to life through labor and love, we strive to create beers to lighten the spirit, and soothe the soul. Sharing our joy to the betterment of mankind is the most that we could hope for.

name: Jolly Pumpkin Cafe & Brewery?
hoursOfOperation: Main Floor  Monday - Thursday 11am - 11pm Friday 11am - midnight   Saturday 10am - midnight   Sunday 10am - 11pm    Upstairs  Sunday - Wednesday 4pm - midnight   Thursday - Saturday 4pm - 2am    Rooftop Deck  Monday - Wednesday 4pm - 11pm   Thursday - Friday 4pm - 1am   Saturday - noon - 1 am  Sunday - noon - 11pm

name: Jolly Pumpkin Restaurant, Brewery, Distillery
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Thursday 12pm - 10 pm  Friday 12pm - 11pm  Saturday 12pm - 11pm  Sunday 12pm - 9pm

name: Joseph James Brewing Co. Inc.
description: Southern Nevada Craft Brewery Specializing in Craft Beer and Gluten Free Ales

name: Josephbrau Brewing Company
description: Brewed by Gordon Biersch Brewing Company and is also know as Trader Joe's Brewing Company.

name: Joshua Huddy's Brew Pub and Grill
description: (No longer brewing)

name: Joyride Brewing Company
description: A craft brewery across the street from the banks of Sloan's Lake in Edgewater, Colorado. Hop On!

name: Junkyard Brewing Company
description: Junkyard Brewing Company was conceived as I brewed my first batch of homebrew in college. I still remember that batch; it was a five-gallon recipe with eight pounds of dark malt extract powder and eight ounces of chinook hops for the boil with a packet of dry yeast to ferment it. I "bottled" this first batch in pint-sized canning jars and judged when the natural carbonation had taken place by the "plink, plink" noises of the lids buckling upward under pressure. Friends suggested names for my first brew, and a couple stand out in my mind: "Junk's Trunk" and "Junkyard" beer. It was  nicknames like these that helped guide me toward choosing the name "Junkyard" for our brewing company when the time came to  attach a name to my idea.
hoursOfOperation: Wed: 4:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Fri: 4:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: Jupiter Brewing
description: Jupiter is the East Bay's most popular beerhouse, locally owned & operated, serving its own handcrafted beers & ales along with wood-fired pizzas. Housed in an old livery stable from the 1890's, Jupiter exudes a European atmosphere found in the heart of Berkeley, California. (The design was inspired by the oldest bar in Berlin.)

name: Jurnee Brews
description: Jurnee Brewing Company (JBC) is a craft brewing partnership founded in 2010. Jurnee Brews has locations in Centreville, Virginia and Ewing, New Jersey.  This microbrewery is a collaboration of two men who themselves are on an exceptional journey to bring what was once an idea to your local watering hole. Jurnee is more than what is in the bottle, it's about how it came together...the journey. Just like in life, we have experiences throughout time that form who we are as people, it just so happens our journey culminates in a bottle.

name: Just Beer Brewing Co.
description: Brewer of american grown beer.
hoursOfOperation: Store Hours: Saturdays from 11am to 5pm. Tastings, growler fills, bottle sales.

name: Justice Brewing
description: Established as Justice Brewing, LLC in 2009 I set out to open a small scale craft brewery. Having spent a few years as a homebrewer and always wanting to work for myself I attended Craft Brewing classes at Chemeketa Community College in Salem, OR and read as many books as I could on brewing. I searched for a long time trying to find a suitable place to open up and could be licensed as a Microbrewery. I finally found the location in 2011 and started the move. Then finally in 2012 went through all the legal red tape of opening Everett’s first Belgian Style brewery.    Due to current regulations in the City of Everett we are not open for retail sales. You can make an appointment if you would like a tour or make arrangements for a delivery.    Among other things we now brew AWARD WINNING BEER! Thats right our recipes are now the recipients of not only numerous Blue & Red Ribbons at the 2012 Evergreen State Fair but our “White & Nerdy” Belgian Wit won Best of Show.

name: Kaktus Brewing Company
description: This is a nano-brewery   ??Producing 500 barrels yearly   With 6-to-8 beers on tap    We shipped in German Made equipment to set ourselves apart in the local industry allowing us to specialize in lighter style lager beers while keeping the favorites such as Porter's, ESB's, IPA's and other classic Ales.    ??  ?O?ur reverse osmosis water purifier allows us to control the quality of water during each and every brew. ???  ?  ?Mike Waddy, our brew master, has over years of experience creating beer recipes and hand crafting beers consumed by many New Mexican beer enthusiasts.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:30 am - 8:00 pm  Fri - Sun: 11:30 am - 10:00 pm

name: Kalona Brewing Company
description: We, at Kalona Brewing Company, are passionate for quality, are uniquely offbeat-but substantial, creative, warm and inclusive.     We believe you will find that reflected in both the products we brew and in the restaurant atmosphere we create for your dining and drinking enjoyment.   One of our goals is to be Kalona’s living room – a place where people can come to relax, relate, and have some recreation playing scrabble or dominos by the fireplace in the sofa area of the restaurant. Plus we have a fantastic beer garden to enjoy during the warmer weather.    Kalona Brewing Company and Eatery is strategically located in beautiful downtown Kalona at 405 B Avenue, a half hour drive south from Iowa City.    The brewery is home to a fifteen barrel brewing system from Newlands Systems Inc., which includes a three vessel brew house, four 15bbl fermenters, two 30bbl fermenters and two 15bbl bright tanks.

name: Kamala Brewing at the Whip In
description: We’ve been retailing here since 1986, the Topiwala family with mom and pop and three brothers as well as the help of a handful of invaluable staff members. Pop started in the recession years of Reaganomics, thru the boom of Clintonia and still strong despite George II & the current class wars. Starting as a convenience store & gas station, we’ve been evolving from pretty much day one, trying to offer quality and service like our friendly Travis Heights neighbors and fellow Austinites deserve.    We are committed to sustainable, local, and organic & natural produce and groceries with our offerings on the shelf as well as our kitchen menu (No high fructose corn syrup or MSG!!!) With 72 taps of beer available, we are quite picky on what we present with only quality brews that go with our food.    We also enjoy giving back to the community with nonprofit fundraisers and support for grassroots organizations.    We serve our very own authentic and unique Gujarati-style Indian food, mom approved.    Beer by the pint & wine by the glass make it that much more of a yummy pairing.    Our own brews are specifically designed for our menu items!    Also enjoy live music in our unique intimate and awesome music room, or at least our staff selections of eclectic tunes.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 10:00 am - 12:00 am

name: Kane Brewing
description: Kane Brewing Company is a new craft brewery located on the coast of New Jersey. Our focus will be on American style and Belgian influenced ales. All of our handcrafted beers will be unfiltered and brewed locally in our custom built two-vessel brew house located in Ocean in Monmouth County. Our beers will be self-distributed and available on draft at restaurants and bars in coastal and northern New Jersey. We plan to launch in the spring of 2011.

name: Kannah Creek Brewing Company
description: Our journey began in 2005 in Grand Junction, Colorado, when we opened a small brewpub Kannah Creek Brewing Company.  During the first seven years of brewing our focus was always on quality as we developed seven traditional beer styles and multiple seasonal and specialty beers.  With several awards to our name and a growing demand for our beer, we took a huge leap and expanded into a brand new 12,000 square foot 30 barrel production facility in the south downtown area of Grand Junction near the Colorado River.  This new restaurant that also houses our production facility is known as Edgewater Brewery.    Throughout our growth we have invested our time, energy, and resources reflecting our passion and devotion to maintain the highest standard quality.  We currently bottle three of our mainstays in additional to seasonal selections.  Plus limited release bomber bottles of a select variety.  We pride ourselves in making beer that is true to its style, pleasing to the palate and very drinkable.
hoursOfOperation: SUN - THURS 11AM - 10PM  FRI - SAT 11AM - 11PM  Phone: 970-263-0111

name: Kansas City Bier Company
description: Authentic German-style lagers and ales available in local taverns, restaurants, and the brewery tasting room.

name: Karbach Brewing Company
description: We like beer. A lot.     Our background is in the beer biz. Everything from distribution and importing to German training and brewery operations. A few years ago we had an opportunity that would allow us to open up our own brewery. We jumped on it.    We’re extremely excited about this project, and we think it shows in everything we do. This is just plain fun for us. The day it starts to feel like a job is the day when lightning shall strike us dead. Cause, hey, at the end of the day we're making beer. And beer is fun.    Join us, it should be a kick ass ride with some cool stops along the way!

name: Karben4 Brewing
hoursOfOperation: Sunday: Closed  Monday-Wednesday: 3pm - 10pm   Thursday: 3pm - 12am  Friday: 3pm - 2am  Saturday: 11am - 2am

name: Karl Strauss Brewing Company
description: Karl Strauss Brewing Company has pioneered the San Diego beer scene since 1989 with innovative beer releases like Big Barrel IIPA, Wreck Alley Imperial Stout and Mosaic Session Ale. The brewery has won 64 medals over the past four years and its Red Trolley Ale is one of the most award winning beers in the world. The company is currently ranked #41 on the list of the country’s top craft breweries with sole distribution in California. 2014 is on pace to be another exciting year of double-digit sales growth, with the main brewery tasting room and newly remodeled brewery restaurant in Sorrento Mesa now open. For more information visit www.karlstrauss.com or call the brewery at (858) 273-2739. Share it. Cheers.
