name: Kassik's Brewery
description: Kassik's Kenai Brew Stop is housed in a small warehouse, nestled in a clearing in the woods, adjacent to the Kassik’s home in Nikiski.   Frank's passion for brewing began when his wife Debara, bought him a home brew kit for Christmas. Frank was hooked and soon became a proficient home brewer.  They built a 36 X 50 shop in hopes to someday have a brewery.  In May of 2005 Kassik's purchased a used seven barrel system, and then remodeled their building to accommodate the equipment with the help of family and friends.  The brewery opened Memorial Weekend 2006 with their first brew Beaver Tail Blonde, their Moose Point Porter was on tap a few weeks later.    Kassik’s has 8 brews on tap.  We are open 6 days a week during the winter, and daily during the summer (May - August).
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Sat:	12:00 pm	-	7:00 pm  Sun:	12:00 pm	-	5:00 pm

name: Kauai Beer Company
description: Opened in 2013, the Kauai Beer Company is a neighborhood microbrewery producing artisan batches of high-quality craft beer to enjoy in a welcoming atmosphere. Our beer is available in our tasting room, as well as for sale to-go in durable, refillable growlers.

name: Kauai Island Brewery & Grill
description: Located in downtown Port Allen, “The Worlds Westernmost Brewery” and Kauai’s only brewpub, Kauai Island Brewery & Grill is open for business and eager to serve the Island of Kauai’s craft beer drinkers!    Kauai Island Brewing Company (KIBC) has its origins in Waimea Brewing Company, which had been located on the historic Waimea Plantations. When the lease was up, owners Bret and Janice Larson, along with their brewmaster Dave Curry and his wife Christina, decided to come together and become co-owners of their newly created Kauai Island Brewing Company, moving locations to Port Allen where they would have more space to brew the delicious beers they were known for.     After eight months of renovation, Kauai Island Brewing Company has its home in the industrial building complex of Port Allen Center, with an industrial theme to go along with both its surroundings and purpose of crafting quality beers. Its 35-foot high corrugated metal ceilings and walls give it an open and spacious feel. The retro atmosphere with chandelier lights hanging from the ceiling, a catwalk leading to the second story mezzanine over the entrance, and picture perfect views of the sunset over Port Allen bay from the second story window makes it hard to say goodbye to this beautiful place.    We offer up to 10 of our own handcrafted in-house beers as well as several guest microbrewed beers, all on draft. If you can't stay for a pint, that's okay! We sell 64-ounce growlers that you can fill and take with you, as well as kegs available for customer pickup.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 9:30 pm

name: Kaweah Brewing Co.
description: Kaweah brewing Co. is a small scale hand crafted brewery! Every batch is made with finest ingredients available!

name: Keegan Ales
description: Keegan Ales was founded in early 2003 when Tommy Keegan learned about an empty building in Kingston that nobody would buy because there was a defunct brewery stuck in it! (Although the building was built in the early 1800?s, the building was most recently home to the Woodstock Brewing Company.)    After months of cleaning and rebuilding, Keegan Ales brewed its first batch of beers on August 1, 2003(Tommy’s mom’s birthday) and set out hand-selling beer to local bars and restaurants early September. The first kegs of Old Capital, Hurricane Kitty and Mother’s Milk went to competition at Hunter Mountain that month. Mother’s Milk took home a gold medal and Old Capital was honored with People’s Choice: Best of Show.    After getting the brewery up and running selling draft beer, the crew at Keegan Ales turned their attention to the defunct bottling line. It had been left broken and literally in hundreds of pieces. It took months of pounding, tinkering and countless scratching of heads, but by the summer of 2004, Keegan Ales was available in 12 ounce bottles!

name: Keg Creek Brewing Company
description: Keg Creek Brewing Company is a microbrewery located in Glenwood, IA that produces small batch craft beer.     We will have an on-site tasting room, serving pints and offering growler purchase and refill. Additional products offered for sale at our location will include 5 gallon kegs, 22 oz bottles, T-Shirts and Caps. Our beer will also be available at many bars and wineries in the local area. Opening planned for August 2011.

name: Kellys Caribbean Bar and Grill & Brewery
Kelsey Creek Brewing Company
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Sat:	12:00 pm	-	8:00 pm  Sun:	12:00 pm	-	6:00 pm

name: KelSo Beer Company
description: Brewing extraordinary lagers which highlight the simple beauty of well crafted, local beers since 2006.

name: Kenai River Brewing Company
description: Kenai River Brewing Company is a microbrewery specializing in handcrafted ales.  Compliment your adventure, whether fishing, hiking, snow machining, or just relaxing, with freshly brewed beer.    Support locally brewed beer by asking for Kenai River Brewing Company at your favorite bar or restaurant.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat:	12:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: Kennett Brewing Company
description: Kennett Brewing Company believes that everyone deserves extraordinary beer. This philosophy and attitude stems from our founders’ personal journey in craft brewing. Years of pursuing excellent traditional and inventive beers led to the discovery that enjoying the greatest beers was not easily achieved. Ours was a flavor odyssey, searching for representative and unique beer from around the world and bearing whatever cost necessary. Ultimately, the founders of KBC decided to make these great beers themselves. Together they dedicated over 13 years of research, practice, and achievement to develop their own beers to the category of extraordinary. Through a combination of replicating traditional styles and creating innovative interpretations, KBC provides a tasting experience like no other. Our customers have the opportunity to affordably enjoy the finest beers flavors from around the world at a single location. From traditional English styles to the groundbreaking innovations of America’s West Coast, customers explore flavors that may take a lifetime to enjoy. At Kennett Brewing Company, everyone drinks extraordinary beer.

name: Kern River Brewing Company
description: The Kern River Brewing Company (KRBC) brings people back to the magnificent simplicities that life has to offer.    From its beginnings, Kernville has been a wild-west town.  Established as a mining settlement in the mid 1800's and continuing as a ranching community through the 1900's, Kernville remains a town of adventure, offering a wide variety of outdoor activities.  On any given day, the outdoor enthusiast enjoys activities ranging from the excitement of whitewater rafting, kayaking, downhill skiing, cross-country skiing, snowmobiling, horseback riding, attending rodeos, windsurfing, water-skiing, mountain biking and climbing.  If a more relaxing day is preferred, people can enjoy fishing, hiking, camping, sailing, antiquing, and bird watching or simply kicking back and taking in the spectacular views of the Sierra Nevada mountain range.

name: Keuka Brewing Company
description: Keuka Brewing Co., LLC opened its doors to the public in the fall of 2008 is overlooking beautiful Keuka Lake, the brewery’s namesake, in the heart of the Finger Lakes. It is the first Microbrewery on this breathtaking lake and the only microbrewery on the Keuka Lake wine trail. Surrounded by some of New York State’s best wineries, Keuka Brewing offers an alternate world-class epicurean experience for wary wine drinkers and beer connoisseurs alike.     Keuka Brewing is owned and operated by Linda & Richard Musso. Bringing years of home brewing experience to the business, Keuka Brewing uses only premium ingredients of malted barley, wheat, and a variety of hops to produce a wide array of top grade hand crafted ales and delicious beers to this unique region.

name: Keweenaw Brewing Company
description: Keweenaw Brewing Company is the hops-induced vision of Dick Gray and Paul Boissevain. Dick, a Michigan Tech graduate was looking for a way to return to the Copper Country. Paul, meanwhile, was introduced to - and seduced by - the crystal clear waters of nearby Lake Superior, the beauty of the surrounding area, and the small-town charm of Houghton, Michigan. The two men, whose passion for beer runs as deep as Superior, are the driving force behind Keweenaw Brewing Company.

name: Kilted Dragon
description: Kilted Dragon’s New location will continue to provide a unique line-up of hand-crafted beers in Garden City and can be found at other pub and restaurant locations around the Boise region. Kilted Dragon joins the Boise craft beer revolution with a new spectrum of flavor.  Partnering with businesses in the Boise area and beyond, Kilted Dragon Brewing is a part of the hand-crafted beer community, the Boise Business community and regional art and music groups. In addition to excellent beer, you’ll find live music, art and food as a standard sustenance feature at the Tap House Tasting room in Garden City.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Kinetic Brewing Company
description: Kinetic Brewing Company is the premier microbrewery in Lancaster, CA, located just 50 miles north of Los Angeles in the heart of the historic and newly gentrified downtown, The BLVD.  Featuring international pub cuisine and fine American craft beer from Southern California and beyond.
hoursOfOperation: Monday 4PM - 10PM  Tuesday 4PM - 10PM  Wednesday 4PM - 10PM  Thursday 12PM - 11PM  Friday 12PM - 12AM  Saturday 12PM - 12AM  Sunday 12PM - 9PM

name: King Harbor Brewing Company
description: We brew classic styles with a California coastal twist by sourcing unique ingredients to emphasize flavor profiles and the drinking experience - hoppy pale ales that use subtle fruit additions to brighten hop character, an American style brown ale blended with a cold press coffee, and a Saison brewed with locally sourced lemon verbena and lemon peel.      And when we are not brewing we can usually be found on the beach, at Dodgers or Kings game, or shooting birdies on the links.  For us, an awesome beer is part of an awesome experience.
hoursOfOperation: Wed:  4:00pm - 8:00pm Thu:  4:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 9:00pm Sun:  12:00pm - 6:00pm

name: King Street Brewing Company
hoursOfOperation: Tap Room Hours!  Monday: 3-8  Tuesday: 3-8  Wednesday: 3-8  Thursday: 3-8  Friday: 3-8  Saturday: 12-8

name: Kingdom Brewing
description: Kingdom brewing is the Northern most Brewery in the state Of Vermont. Located withing Seconds of the Canadian Border . Half way between the equator and the North Pole.
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  3:30pm - 6:30pm Fri:  3:30pm - 6:30pm Sat:  3:30pm - 6:30pm

name: Kinky Kabin Brewing Company
description: Kinky Kabin Brewing Company LLC, Founded in October 2011, is a microbrewery that combines the love of craft brewing with the love of seduction and naughtiness. We promise that it "goes down good".    Our beer celebrates lowering inhibitions of people, so that they get into a frisky, naughty, seductive, flirty, sexy mood. Both men and women will love it. The taboo of keeping sensuality hush-hush is being overwritten. We encourage people to become lustful yet classy, and our marketing strategy will be seductive and classy as well.

name: Kinney Creek Brewery
description: Kinney Creek Brewery started out as a love for beer, and a lack of quality brewed, right priced beer.  After making home brew for a small test group,  things got bigger and bigger.  Now we are making several varieties of beer to accommodate the need for great Midwest Brewed beer.  We source as many of our ingredients that we can from our local neighbors to bring you the very freshest and eco-friendly beer on the market.,   Currently we are expanding our facility, increasing our advertising, expanding our exposure to local bars & restaurants, and introducing our product to new customers.  So please watch for us in your neighborhood.

name: Kirkland Signature / Costco Wholesale Corporation
description: Contract brewed by Gordon Biersch, CA and The Matt Brewing Company, NY.

name: Kirkwood Station Brewing Company
description: Kirkwood Station Restaurant and Brewing Co. is located just a block north of the historic train station in beautiful downtown Kirkwood Missouri, a southwest suburb of St. Louis. Established in 2009, we are building a tradition of taste, quality, service and charm. With our award winning craft beer, exceptional food, and fabulous live music, the focus is on our guests and great times! Sit back with friends and enjoy the wonderful food and craft beer as you play billiards, throw darts, watch the game, or dance the night away. Whether it’s a small gathering or a party of 275 guests, Kirkwood Station wants you to enjoy the ride.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat:	11:00 am - 1:30 am  Sun:	11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: Production Facility
description: Knee Deep Brewing Company is known for brewing big, hoppy West Coast style brews. We love hops and love finding ways to create excellent beers by blending our Humulus lupulus friends together.

name: Brewery & Tap Room
hoursOfOperation: Monday thru Thursday: 3 to 8 pm.  Friday: 3 to 9 pm.  Saturday: 1 to 9 pm.  Sunday: 1 to 8 pm.

name: Kokopelli Beer Company
description: Kokopelli Beer Company is a small brewpub located in the Solaire Shoppes at 8931 Harlan Street in Westminster Colorado, just across from the future Westminster Mall renovation. We enjoy brewing quality handcrafted ales and meeting new folks, so we decided to put them together. As a brew pub, we offer a small menu to compliment our ales with items such as pizzas, sandwiches, salads and more.

name: Kona Brewing Company
description: Kona Brewing Company was started by father and son team Cameron Healy and Spoon Khalsa. The pair had a dream to create fresh, local island brews made with spirit, passion and quality. Their love of Hawaii, and a desire to protect the pristine environment here, brought them to the Big Island to fulfill their vision. Kona Brewing continues to be headquartered right where it began, in Kailua-Kona on Hawaii's Big Island.

name: Kootenai River Brewing Company
description: Kootenai River Brewing Company is a local family owned restaurant and brewery with a strong sense of community and enthusiasm for its customers! Located in beautiful downtown Bonners Ferry, ID. we offer a lunch and dinner menu complete with homemade soups and desserts. The KRBC sits alongside the banks of the Kootenai River with spectacular views of the mountains from both inside the restaurant and outside on our deck (open seasonally). We offer a variety of wines in addition to our hand-crafted beer which is brewed on sight. The restaurant is family oriented and we love sports! Three flat screen televisions broadcast football, hockey, soccer, basketball, etc. depending on the season. Please join us daily at 11 a.m., 7 days a week for a terrific dining experience.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: Krash Brewery
description: KrashBrewery was created to make the best beer in the World.

name: Krogh's Restaurant and Brewpub
description: The area where Krogh's Restaurant & Brew Pub now stands was a beautiful meadow with a meandering stream until the early 1920's. By the end of the decade, the dream had been fulfilled, the dam was built and Lake Mohawk was formed.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat: 11:30 am - 10:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Kuhnhenn Brewing
description: Founded in 1998, Kuhnhenn Brewing Company began as a homebrew supplies shop in the family's former hardware store while buildout on the brewery was taking place.     The company has been producing countless award-winning beer, mead, and wine out of their 8-barrel brewery since 2001. In 2012, Kuhnhenn took home the Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup in the IPA category for their flagship offering, DRIPA, or Double Rice IPA.    The brewery  has expanded to capacity over the years, with only limited distribution in Michigan, New York City, and parts of Europe, in addition to taking part in festivals throughout the world. Construction is underway on a production brewery and second taproom in nearby Clinton Township, which will allow the brewery to get closer to meeting demand by increasing capacity more than 1500% overnight.     Visit the brewery taproom for to-go sales of some of their award-winning products.

name: Kulshan Brewing Company
description: We are a new brewery on James street in Bellingham Washington. We have a lovely tap room you can come and visit, as well as a dart board and a nice sitting area. For us, it’s all about the beer. Come in and try some! Or you can visit one of the many establishments around town that are already carrying our brews.
hoursOfOperation: Sun - Thur: 11am to 10pm  Fri - Sat: 11am to Midnight

name: La Cabra Brewing
description: Over the next few years, our headbrewer will develop both the business and brewing skills to establish a nanobrewery outside of Philadelphia. From Manayunk to West Chester, this swathe of land boasts some of the most well-informed, enthusiastic, and--frankly--fanatical beer fans. It would be our honor and pleasure to provide them fresh, small batch, artisanal beer with an emphasis on seasonality and occasionality.    La Cabra is a nanobrewery in the planning, a porfolio of beers over the last 7 years of homebrewing. Small-batch, labor intensive, and patient brewing produces ale and lager styles of distinct quality, integrity, and creativity.

name: La Cumbre Brewing Company
description: La Cumbre Brewing Co. is what happens when two people take one thing altogether way too seriously. Beer is what we do. It’s all we do.     The best beer money can make; the best beer money can buy. Simple as that.     Sure, we could tell you about the quality ingredients, the state of the art equipment, the commitment to traditional brewing methods… But all you really need to know is that our brewer is the pickiest SOB on earth, especially when it comes to the beer he drinks.     Well, this is the beer he drinks.     And we guarantee that you won’t find better beer anywhere.
hoursOfOperation: Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 12:00 am

name: La Quinta Brewing Co.
description: Located in the Greater Palm Springs area, La Quinta Brewing Co. opened it's doors in 2013 and is served in over 100 bars/restaurants throughout the desert.
hoursOfOperation: Tue:  2:00pm - 8:00pm Wed:  2:00pm - 8:00pm Thu:  2:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  2:00pm - 8:00pm Sat:  2:00pm - 8:00pm

name: La Verne Brewing Co.
description: La Verne Brewing Company is a local brewery centrally located next to the Pomona Raceway and Brackett Field Airport. It all started with backyard brewing, the love of craft beer and has turned into a passion we want to share with the world.
hoursOfOperation: Fri: 4:00 pm - 8:30 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Ladyface Ale Companie
description: Ladyface Ale Companie was established in late 2009 along with its restaurant Ladyface Alehouse & Brasserie. Named LA Weekly’s 2013 Best Brewery in LA, and an international RateBeer.com Best Brewpub, Ladyface is known for their award-winning Belgian, French and American style ales.  La Blonde, La Grisette, Blind Ambition Abbey Ale, Trois Filles Tripel, and seasonal ales such as La Trappistine® Belgian Dark Ale, Bluebelly Barleywine and Dérailleur® Bière-de-Garde are brewed onsite. Ladyface is one of Los Angeles County’s first modern day microbreweries, and the first brewpub in the Conejo Valley. Visit www.ladyfaceale.com for more information on Ladyface beers, tours and special events.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat: 11:30 am - 12:00 am  Sun: 11:30 am - 10:00 pm

name: Lagunitas Brewing Company
description: From our earliest days of striving to make consistently good beer, and instead making beer that ranged from vile, to barely drinkable, to wonderful, to elegant, to questionable-at-best. From being castigated by our West Marin neighbors to finally suffering an 'eviction' by our West Marin septic system. From landing in the welcoming arms of Petaluma, and actually getting our beer into bottles, onto the streets, and into the hands of sympathatic beer geeks, to steadily losing less money each month. From all this and more, Lagunitas Brewing Company is emerging as a battle-tested brewery capable of making great beer out of goat's milk, brambles, and asphalt on the surface of the Moon, if need be.    As the poet once said, 'Where, but for the grace of God and the kindness of strangers, go I'. Where go we indeed, whatever that means.
hoursOfOperation: Wed thru Friday 3:00-9:00.  Sat & Sun: 1:00-7:00

name: Laht Neppur Brewing Company
description: We couldn't have said it better ourselves. Laht Neppur Brewing Co., located in Waitsburg, WA, offers premium handcrafted ale by the glass or pitcher in our tap room. Sampler trays are highly recommended for first time visitors. We also have Mason Jars, Growlers, and Party Pigs to go.    After home brewing for more than 20 years, Chiefton Brewer Court Ruppenthal, came to the Walla Walla Valley to learn the art of wine making. He quickly realized that what the valley really needed was beer - good beer. After all, winemakers in the valley are often heard saying, "It takes a lot of beer to make good wine." So he decided to open his own brewery, and opened the doors to the public on June 3, 2006.    All Laht Neppur beer is produced on site and is available in our tap room. There are no macro-brews here! Families are welcome, and we offer an outdoor seating area.

name: Lake Bluff Brewing Company
description: We're a quaint craft brewery in the Chicago's North Shore suburbs. We strive to create the finest beer while minding the rich traditions of brewing.

name: Lake Chelan Brewery
description: Lake Chelan Brewery is a nano-brewery located in downtown Manson, Washington that was created for the love of beer! We brew delicious and diverse beers and welcome the beer community and beyond.    At LCB, we currently produce 4 house beers-- Manson Beach Blonde, Mackinaw Red Amber, Devil's Backbone IPA and Imperial Prize Fighter Irish Stout. These tasty brews are created in-house, using only the finest ingredients and Lake Chelan’s glacier fed water.    Make Lake Chelan Brewery your vacation destination. Relax and sample some of our beers, or grab a snack and growler to bring with you on the boat!
hoursOfOperation: Opens daily at 10am

name: Lake Drum Brewing
description: Lake Drum Brewing is a small batch brewery operated by Victor Pultinas and Jenna LaVita in the heart of downtown Geneva, NY.

name: Lake Effect Brewing Company
description: Our name, Lake Effect, is inspired by the weather phenomenon we experience on the Great Lakes, most famous for creating legendary snow storms. The lake effect also produces longer growing seasons that yield some of the highest-quality grains, fruits and vegetables in the world. Most importantly, our central ingredient – the water – is from our great lake.

name: Lake Louie Brewing
description: Lake Louie Brewing started out as a mid-life crisis for owner Tom Porter.  He had spent 20+ years in the Engineering field and was looking to make a change in careers and a change in outlook.  Having been homebrewing for a couple of years, Tom wrote a ‘cartoon’ of a business plan that stated that a 3 barrel brewery could make a profit (in the first year, no less!).    Armed with said business plan and a cashed in 401k, Tom and his wife DeAnn proceeded to convert a metal storage shed on their property into a nascent brewery.    Lake Louie Brewing is located on 18.5 acres of land purchased from Tom’s uncle Louie Carpenter (hence the name ‘Lake Louie’) near the small town of Arena, Wisconsin (population: not too many, traffic lights: zero).  Lake Louie was the skinny dipping pond for area youth (including Tom in his day).    At the end of one full year’s brewing, Lake Louie has produced the astounding sum of 106 barrels of beer.  2001 year end totals:  276 barrels.  A 258% increase in one year (lookout Bud!).

name: Lake Norman Brewing Company
description: Lake Norman Brewing Company is a family owned and operated microbrewery located in Mooresville, NC. We specifically chose the name “Lake Norman” due to the Lake’s prominence and the vitality it represents to the population that thrives around it. Whether you love Lake Norman as your home or get-away, for the boating, the sunsets, the watersports, the swimming or the fishing, we are excited to be part of phenomenon known to the locals as   the “Lake Life”.
hoursOfOperation: Tuesdays and Thursdays 4 pm - 7 pm  Saturdays 2 pm - 8 pm

name: Lake Placid Pub & Brewery
description: It began, like many microbreweries, with a homebrew kit and a love of beer. Not just a love of drinking beer but a real respect for the craft, the history, the art, and the industry, as well as a love for the brewing process itself. Today, Lake Placid Pub & Brewery has been brewing award-winning ales for 14 years and has expanded rapidly due to its popularity and quality, earning the respect of the brewing community.    In 1996, Christopher Ericson and a college friend purchased P.J. O'Neill's, a pub in the small, Adirondack village of Lake Placid. They renovated the upstairs into a pub and restaurant, installed a seven barrel brewery, and began brewing. Chris' brewing experience included Federal Jack's / Shipyard Brewing in Kennebunkport, ME and The Shed Restaurant and Brewery in Stowe, VT.  The Lake Placid Pub & Brewery soon became a popular spot both for locals and visitors to the Lake Placid area.

name: Lake Superior Brewing
description: A multi-award winning micro-brewery located in Duluth, MN.
hoursOfOperation: Growler sales, M-F, 8am-4pm

name: Lake Superior Brewing Company
description: Welcome to the Lake Superior Brewing Company, the place to be when you're in Grand Marais.  From our handcrafted beers to our delicious brewpub cuisine, we know you're going to want to come back again and again.  Nestled near the shore of Lake Superior we know that our unique atmosphere is unparalleled.  Steeped in the history of a harsh environment and life in Michigan's Upper Peninsula, the LSBC reflects bygone days while blending in its own contemporary identity.

name: Lakefront Brewery
description: Milwaukee’s own Lakefront Brewery Inc. started in 1987.  The industrious and inventive microbrewery located on the Milwaukee River has become a Milwaukee landmark.  Its rich history includes partnerships with local taverns, preservation of local historical pieces, unique tours, family style dining options and most importantly, great beer.
hoursOfOperation: See Website: http://www.lakefrontbrewery.com/details_details.html

name: Lakewood Brewing Co.
description: From our origins home brewing out of a garage in the east Dallas neighborhood of Lakewood, to quickly becoming one of the fastest growing craft breweries in North Texas, we stay true to our vision of local beer for local folks. We're dedicated to using the highest quality ingredients to produce internationally inspired and locally crafted beers.  Brewery tours are offered every Saturday from 12:00 Noon to 3:00pm. Schol!
hoursOfOperation: Brewery tours every Saturday from noon to 3:00pm.

name: Lancaster Brewing Company
description: We brew our beer in the heart of Lancaster County, Pennsylvania with great respect for the old traditions of brewing. Our master brewer, Christian Heim, has a strong commitment to quality and uses advanced brewing techniques to produce a consistent and high quality beer. Savor the hopped aromas as they come alive and accentuate the wholesome malt flavors in our ales and lagers.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	11:30 am - 12:00 am  Fri - Sat:	11:30 am - 2:00 am  Sun:	11:30 am - 12:00 am

name: Lander Brewing Co
description: The beer brewing process began in Lander with the original Lander Brewing Company located just across the river from its present location. One hundred and ten years later, Lander Brewing Company is back, providing tasty locally brewed beer that we can call our own.     The award-winning Lander Brewing Company is located in the newly remodeled Cowfish Restaurant. The brewery won four national awards in its first year of operation, and has continued to win awards each year. Our Rock Chuck Rye has won gold medals in both the Great American Beer Festival and the World Beer Cup.     While sampling tasty brews in the stylish pub and inhaling the hoppy aroma of beer-brewing in progress, you can can enjoy tasty food from the Cowfish menu. In the summer our outdoor decks provide a beer garden like atmosphere under the shade of a hundred year old pine tree or this year’s crop of cascade hops. Looking for something more casual, order your beer next door at the historic Lander Bar while feasting on one of the Gannett Grill’s signature burgers or hand tossed New York style pizzas.    Our brewmaster Ted Briggs got his start at the Tun Tavern in Atlantic City, then moved west. Chris Erickson, former “brewmaster of the year” shared his knowledge and recipies with Ted and the results are amazing. If you spot Ted stirring his elixir in the copper tanks with his wooden paddle, checking his dials, ask him for a tour of the brewery. You will be sure to come away with a new appreciation for beverage with a thousand year history that gives this small town in Wyoming a world class taste.

name: Landmark Brewing Co
description: We are a small producer of craft beers located in the Central New York city of Syracuse. We currently brew two year round beers, Landmark Vanilla Bean Brown Ale and the Landmark India Pale Ale.

name: Lantern Brewing
description: Lantern Brewing is a very, very small brewery in the Greenwood-Phinney neighborhood of Seattle, Washington State, USA.    Our passion is beer, its enjoyment with food, and the history and culture that goes with it.    Our goal is to create beer that will enlighten the drinker; it will refresh and nourish, it will complement your food and bring to light new flavors, it will enliven the ambience and provide a delicious and memorable experience with each passing sip...    We will focus on highest-quality ingredients, sourced as locally as possible.  We will nurture the beer carefully through the brewing process, allowing it to change, mature, and to come into its prime; once it's ready, we'll make sure it finds its way to you!

name: Las Cazuelas Mexican Grill and Brewery
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  8:00am - 9:30pm Tue:  8:00am - 9:30pm Wed:  7:00am - 10:00am Thu:  8:00am - 9:30pm Fri:  8:00am - 9:30pm Sat:  7:00am - 10:00am Sun:  7:00am - 10:00am

name: Lassen Ale Works
description: Northeast California's only brewpub-- Lassen Ale Works--  Located in uptown Susanville, CA at the historic Pioneer Saloon.  21 and over only, ID required. On-site brewery.  Six house beers on draft, plus seasonal specialties and guest taps.  Full bar offers good selection of wine by the glass and craft cocktails, single malt scotch and premium liquors. Fine pub fare is prepared in house, from scratch. House specialties include beer battered fish with hand cut chips, lamb dip and fresh salads. Weekend lunch and dinner specials. Pool tables.
hoursOfOperation: Mon: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm  Tue - Thu: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: Last Frontier Brewing Company
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	11:00 am - 9:00 pm  Fri - Sat:	11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Sun:	11:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: Latitude 33 Brewing Co.
description: Regardless of the people and events, however, Latitude 33 is always synonymous with “Adventure” — which is also our brewing philosophy. We’re on an exploration that involves taking a few risks, trying new things and injecting a little of the unexpected into the world of craft beer. If you’re up for it, we’d like to invite you to come along. Just meet us at Latitude 33.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 3:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Latitude 42 Brewing Company
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: Laughing Dog Brewing
description: At Laughing Dog Brewing, what began with a dream for brews with more hops has turned into an insatiable desire to craft beers of all flavors, with a focus on quality, purity, and fun. Today, Laughing Dog brews has brewed over 15 distinct beers, including seasonals like our Huckleberry Ale and Winter Ale, and our award-winning IPA's and Stouts. But despite our success and growth, our motto remains the same as the day we started, to create... "Fetchingly Good Beer"!

name: Laughing Sun Brewing Company
description: Laughing Sun Brewing Company is all about freshly hand-crafted American ales. We feature live music and local art.  Our regular tap selections include Strawberry Wheat, Whippin' Post Pale Ale, Hammerhead Red ESB, Feast Like a Sultan IPA, Black Shox Porter, and Sinister Pear. We also have seasonal selections, and one-time tapping events throughout the year.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 4:00 pm - 12:00 am  Fri - Sun: 2:00 pm - 12:00 am

name: Laurelwood Brewing Company
description: Hi, my name is Mike De Kalb, and I’m the co-owner of Laurelwood Public House & Brewery in Portland, Oregon. My wife Cathy and I started Laurelwood in 2001 because we wanted a place where family and friends could meet in a fun and relaxed atmosphere. My restaurants are non-smoking and family-friendly.    And the beer? World class. Brewing Portland’s first certified organic beers, and a host of other tasty brews. We’ve received a number of awards including Champion Brewery at the 2004 World Beer Cup. Led by Brewmaster Vasilios Gletsos, our brewers create all our beers using only the finest ingredients. Stop by one of our three public houses and or one of our two Portland airport locations for a pint and a meal.   Make sure when you are out and about that you ask for Laurelwood beer at your favorite Oregon or Washington pub.

name: Lavery Brewing Company
description: Lavery Brewing Company was founded in 2009 by husband and wife Jason & Nicole Lavery. Jason Lynch joined the quest in 2010 to build our own 10 barrel production brewery. Born and raised around Erie, PA, we are all excited to bring something new and dynamic to the local beer culture - Brewing Innovative Ales in Small Batches!    By the way, it's pronounced 'Lav-ry' not 'Lave ry', a soft 'a' in the middle. Similar to 'have', not 'gave', thank you very much.

name: Lawson's Finest Liquids
description: Lawson’s Finest Liquids, LLC is based in Warren, Vermont and distributes small, custom batches of unique beer through their exclusive wholesale distributor, The Beer Guy, LLC. Sean Lawson, founder and brewer, has been an avid home brewer for nearly twenty years, with numerous award winning recipes. Lawson’s Finest, with a small batch system, can custom craft specialty beers for establishments and events. Limited in availability by design, these rare beers can only be found near the Mad River Valley of Vermont.

name: Lazy Hiker Brewing Co.
description: Lazy Hiker Brewing Co. is opening in Spring 2015 at the old Town Hall in Franklin, NC. The production brewery features a taproom on the corner of Porter and Main St. and a 15bbl brewhouse out back in the old 5-bay garage.    Come visit us in the Spring or follow us on Facebook, Twitter, & Instagram as we transform a great little spot in the mountains of North Carolina into a fully functioning brewery.

name: Lazy Magnolia Brewing Company
description: Founded in September of 2003, Lazy Magnolia is Mississippi's first brewery offering locally brewed beer to Mississippians and visitors to our state at all of their favorite restaurants. Located in the Bootleg capital of Mississippi, we break with tradition by offering legal brew to our customers!    Lazy Magnolia is dedicated to providing the best possible products through our tireless efforts, our superior motivation, and our Southern heritage. We offer our customers a line of refreshing beverages, made in true Southern Style, complementing the traditions of the South and remaining true to Southern tastes.
hoursOfOperation: Every Saturday at 10:30am. No reservation required.  After the tour, we'll give you a list of great local places to try our beer! No beer samples at the brewery. It's the law, in Mississippi anyway.

name: Lazy Monk Brewing
description: Lazy Monk Brewing LLC was created out of desire to serve local people with good quality beers. We specialize in brewing Bohemian and German Lagers but we do not shy away from British or American beers.    Craft Brewery that will be focusing on Bohemian and German beer styles but will not shy away from ales.

name: Leech Lake Brewing
description: Leech Lake Brewing Company is a production (packaging) brewery located just outside of downtown Walker in the Chippewa National Forest.

name: Leelanau Brewing
description: We do not pitch any wild yeasts into our alchemy. Our magic is performed the old fashioned way.    Each and every beer is hand-made in small batches, using age old techniques of open fermentation, barrel aging and bottle conditioning.

name: Left Coast Brewing
description: Left Coast Brewing Company was formed in 2004 with a capacity of 5,500 bbls.  Since then, we have expanded our operation to 13,000 bbls with our current tanks.  Our main focus for the Left Coast are Hoppy Beers, Stouts, and German Lagers. We do however add new styles as part of our seasonal program and have one Belgian tripel ale.    We brew, bottle and keg everything in house at our San Clemente facility and our team is dedicated to the perfection of our product.

name: Left Hand Brewing Company
description: Left Hand Brewing Company has been brewing world class, award winning beers since its founding in 1993. They see their beers as a wonderful liquid food to complement meals and social occasions. They strive for the perfect balance and harmony between malt and hops in every beer, from a golden crisp Polestar Pilsner to a roasty, black Wake Up Dead Imperial Stout,  —allowing a truly unique and flavorful with every glass.

name: Lefty's Brewing Company
description: Lefty's Brewing Company is owned and operated by Bill “Lefty” Goldfarb in Bernardston, MA. This nano-brewery is a home brewer's dream come true. Bill, who has been a roofer by day and a home brewer by night for almost a decade, has finally decided to provide his popularly sought-after product to the public. He has traveled as far as Wisconsin to obtain equipment for his two barrel brewhouse. He is excited to finally put down the hammer and dedicate his full attention to commercially brewing his fine-tuned recipes. Bill, who firmly believes a local, family business offers the best service and product, is proud to have a family-run business operated by only him and his girlfriend. His product is hand-bottled and labeled. As of now, the beer is available in Franklin County, MA, with a wider distribution area in the future. Lefty creates high quality beers using only the finest quality ingredients available. He focuses on the simple pleasures of the traditional and time-tested European brewing techniques. Lefty looks forward to sharing 6 year-round beers, with seasonal and specialty batches offered throughout the year.

name: Legacy Brewing Company
description: Legacy Brewing Co. is committed to handcrafting unique, high quality beer by employing brewing techniques learned from European and American brewers. The complexity of flavors comes from a combination of high quality imported malts and our hopping methods which includes the use of whole flower hops. The Legacy team includes a creative collection of brewers, engineers, a microbiologist and our friends in the arts community; all with a passion for innovative products. Legacy...we brew pure pleasure!

name: Legacy Brewing Company
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm

name: Legend Brewing Company
description: Legend Brewing Company is a commercial microbrewery providing true premium beers to many of the best pubs and restaurants in Richmond and other areas of Virginia since January, 1994. Our mission is to bring to our customers the finest and freshest brews as flavorful alternatives to mass-marketed mainstream products. We're one of the few craft breweries in this region producing both lagers and ales, which require different yeasts and maturation conditions. All Legend beers are unpasteurized and made from only two-row and specialty barley malt, hops, water and yeast.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	11:30 am - 11:00 pm  Fri - Sat:	11:30 am - 12:00 am  Sun:	12:30 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Legends Brewhouse & Eatery of Green Bay
Lengthwise Brewing Co
description: Lengthwise Brewing Company was established in 1998 in order to follow the Great American Dream of turning passion into product. Initially, the creative partners divided their time between their "day jobs" and what is now regarded as Kern County's most popular micro-brewery. The production system includes a 14 Barrel Liquid Asset brewhouse and four 14 Barrel fermenters. Long hours and no pay almost never discouraged the inspired from taking a risk to pursue their heart's desire.    Childhood friends, Jeff Williams and Darin Schwicker, are transplants from California's Central Coast. Forged by a friendship of competitive swimming and unsuccessful fishing, the two vowed to create a brewed product "true" to their Lengthwise philosophy. Jeff's worldwide experience of designing and setting up breweries in such remote locations as the Caribbean, Ukraine, Russia and Japan certainly contributed to his vision for developing a brewery.

name: Lenny Boy Brewing Co.
description: Lenny Boy was founded in 2011 with an interest in a healthy lifestyle, a passion for fermentation and an obsession with brewing. The company started off producing non-alcoholic kombucha with one 7 bbl fermenting tank. In 2012, we stumbled upon our current facility in the historic SouthEnd district in Charlotte, NC. In January of 2013 Lenny Boy became the only Certified Organic kombucha producer in the Southeast! In September 2013, we took it a step further and became a licensed microbrewery.  In doing so, we became the only certified organic brewery North Carolina! The new license allowed us to diversify our product line, which now includes kombucha, wild ales, and traditional beers. We currently produce 100 bbl of kombucha every month and have a 7 bbl traditional beer brewing system. Our kombucha can be found from Virginia to Alabama and our beers are currently within North Carolina.  ENJOY!

name: Lexington Avenue Brewery
description: Good times await in Asheville at the Lexington Avenue Brewery. Relax a while on our open air patio. Enjoy a craft beer and an incredible meal at the 92’ curving bar or a custom built dining table. Our historic downtown Asheville building provides the perfect atmosphere. The front stage regularly entertains LAB guests during dinner hours.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Tue:	11:30 am - 12:00 am  Wed - Sat:	11:30 am - 2:00 am  Sun:	12:00 pm - 12:00 am

name: Lexington Brewing Company and Wine House
description: Think Globally, Drink Locally    Located in historic Lexington, MI the winery offers many award winning wines AND CRAFT BEER for samples, by the glass, and by the bottle. Wine makers Connie Currie and Steven Velloff have created a warm and inviting atmosphere  "Where the past meets the present and good friends come to meet."
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 4:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Fri: 4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 6:00 pm

name: Myrtle Beach
description: Liberty means many things to many different people. It's a celebration of the great American farmer and the rich bounty he puts on our plates.  It's a celebration of America's rich ethnic cooking styles. It's a celebration of the resurgence of the handcrafted-brewing style of the pre-prohibition small American brewery.  Liberty Steakhouse & Brewery is based on America's rich ethnic cooking styles, complimented by finely hand-crafted beers, tantalizing starters and perfectly seared steaks. We've got something brewing you're sure to like. Liberty is also a celebration of life, family and the pursuit of happiness. So bring us your hungry, your thirsty and fun-loving, we'll send you home refreshed and fulfilled.

name: High Point
hoursOfOperation: Open 11am Daily

name: Liberty Street Brewing Company
description: Liberty Street Brewing Company began in concept back in 2006, and finally became a reality in the fall of 2008.  We provide an elegant atmosphere where people can enjoy a fine, hand crafted beer in Plymouth, Michigan’s historic Old Village.    Our focus is to provide a large assortment of crafted, small batch ales and lagers through an exceptionally service oriented waitstaff.  We also offer a short list of regularly available food items during all hours of operation, and have special food items to be served during happy hour, weekends and special occasions.  Several local restaurants  deliver other fresh meals right to your table – just ask us for their carry-out menus.    The Upper Hall at the brewery can be reserved for private parties for up to 70 people.  It is a large area with separate restroom facilities, and a small service bar.  The Upper Hall has a sound and video system that can be used for business presentations, home movies, etc.  Inquire for details.

name: Lickinghole Creek Craft Brewery
description: Lickinghole Creek Craft Brewery is a water-conscious, biologically friendly farm brewery carefully crafting Belgium-style beers and growing hops, barley and other adjuncts. See our Farm Plan 2014 and read about the barley, hops, strawberries, pumpkins and the upcoming new additions of figs trees, blueberries, herbs, sunflowers, additional pumpkin terraced fields and a hardy orange tree grove.  Farmer Russell has ordered our new additions and will be breaking ground this February. We operate on a beautiful working farm in the heart of Virginia.    Lickinghole Creek is a water-conscious brewery.  We brew with well water drawn from the deep.  Our wastewater is purified on site and returned to the Lickinghole Creek watershed.    Our name pays homage to Little Lickinghole Creek, which runs through the farm’s rolling hills.  Since precolonial times the creek has been known as the Lickinghole where wildlife stopped to drink from the nourishing waters.  May the tradition continue.
hoursOfOperation: Fridays 3:00 p.m. – 7:00 p.m.  Saturdays 12:00 p.m. – 7:00 p.m.  Sundays 12:00 p.m. – 7:00 p.m.

name: Lift Bridge Brewery
description: Welcome to Lift Bridge Beer Company. Our mission is simple: to create fine beers for you to enjoy! It is our pleasure to supply you with what you need to help you slow down and enjoy life. Whether that is a Farm Girl Saison®, Crosscut Pale Ale™, an American Pale Ale or any of our other seasonal specialties, we want to brew it our way! We hope that through every bottle and tap pull, you can taste: the history of our City, the pride and fun we have in its creation, the uncompromising natural ingredients and brewing process utilized, and ultimately our sincere hope that we have given an experience that makes you proud to be a beer drinker.

name: Lightning Brewery
description: Our fine hand crafted European style beers have a distinctive Lightning Finish: a crisp, clean aroma, pronounced maltiness and a prolonged and slightly bittering finish. Our beers are good to drink on their own, and great with food. We have proven that you don’t need to travel to Europe to enjoy beers of these styles and of this caliber!    At Lightning we brew “Better Beer Through Science.” We believe that good beer can be the result of chance and that great beer is the result of an in-depth understanding of the beer making process. We take care to control each stage of the brewing cycle, never skimp on how long each step takes and only use the highest quality ingredients: malted barley, hops, yeast, plus a healthy dose of science.
hoursOfOperation: Tasting Hours:  Friday 1:30pm - 5:30pm  Saturday 1:00pm - 5:00pm    Tasters cost $1 each or $5 for 6.   Please bring less than 6 people with you. We cannot accomodate large groups!

name: Lily's Seafood Grill & Brewery
description: Lily's Seafood has been delivering exquisite seafood in a relaxed and comfortable environment since 1999. The Morton brothers opened the restaurant with a passion at heart to bring unique, quality food, perfectly crafted micro-brews and a cozy, relaxed, family friendly atmosphere to downtown Royal Oak . That passion is evident in every dish and pint they serve.    It is in the spirit of the Morton brother's grandmother Lily A. Strange, a Scottish immigrant who brought to this country her love of family, sense of style, and appreciation of fine food that Lily's was created. The Morton brothers have recreated the feeling of their grandparent's home inside the walls of Lily's, tucked into Royal Oak 's vibrant downtown. Lily's is a place to gather and to share not only fine food and drink, but laughter, love, conversation, and fond memories.

name: Lincoln Court Brewery
description: Lincoln Court Brewery is a two partner owned/operated Incorporated Nano-Brewery located in San Jose serving the local community with custom made beers.

name: Lion Brewery Inc.
description: With a proud brewing heritage dating back to 1905, The Lion Brewery merges rustic architecture with state-of-the-art brewing technology, a contrast typified by the gleaming stainless steel aging tanks that sit alongside the traditional copper brew kettle. Our brewing process utilizes the traditional English method of upward infusion mashing in our combination mash lauter tun to create lagers and ales inspired by old world values, but with modern quality and consistency. The staff at The Lion Brewery is dedicated to producing true handcrafted beers, made right here in our century-old Brewhouse. All of our premium beers are made using only the four basic ingredients allowed by the Reinheitsgebot, or German purity law. Under the skillful supervision of our Master Brewer, Leo Orlandini, each of our lagers and ales are brewed in small batches using only the finest hops and malts available to guarantee the highest quality and freshness. Each product we brew is an original recipe especially created to deliver a fuller flavor than ordinary beers, yet with an approachable style and character. As a result, our beers have garnered numerous medals from the Great American Beer Festival and the World Beer Championships in recent years.    In 1974 the Lion Brewing Company bought the Stegmaier Brand.

name: Lion Bridge Brewing Company
description: Lion Bridge Brewing Company is a 10-barrel brewery located on the property of the former Fritz’s Food Market at 59 16th Avenue SW (Czech Village in Cedar Rapids, Iowa).

name: Little Egypt Beer
description: A tiny start up brewery in Southern Illinois (Egypt) specializing in recognizable stylistic beers.

name: Little Giant Brewery
description: A Fledgling Brewery in the Friendly City. Opening fall of 2013

name: Little Toad Creek Brewery
description: Little Toad Creek Brewery & Distillery is a craft producer of beer and spirits. The Brewery currently produces Amber Ale, Stout, Porter, and IPA. The Distillery produces vodka, silver rum, & spiced rum, green chile vodka, and whiskey (in limited quantities!)    Our new tasting room has just opened in downtown Silver City serving craft beer, spirits, and fine pub food.

name: Live Oak Brewing Company
description: Live Oak Brewing Company is truly a home-grown Austin enterprise. Two of Austin's own homebrews, Chip McElroy and Brian Peters, literally hand-built the brewery and were the two main brewers, keg washers, delivery persons, and proselytizers. Live Oak has grown since then, but we are still just as passionate about providing delicious old-world style beers that are rarely commercially available. Our special beers are brewed in limited quantities in a small east Austin brewery and are available in fine pubs and restaurants in Austin, Dallas, Houston, Alpine, Marathon, San Marcos and San Antonio.

name: Living The Dream Brewing Co.
description: We are a Denver area small batch craft brewery creating unique beer recipes available at our brewery & taproom in Littleton, Colorado.    Six beers brewed year long to quench your thirst during any activity. From a vigorous game of badminton to an afternoon of rev-ing your 2-stroke noise maker at a Nascar race, we've got ya covered.

name: Local 315 Brewing Company
description: A craft brewery located in the 3-1-5 supporting local products and local people

name: Local Option
hoursOfOperation: Bar: Sunday-Friday 12pm-2am; Saturday 12pm-3am  Kitchen: Tuesday-Thursday 3pm-10pm; Friday – Sunday 12pm-11pm

name: Rancho Cordova Production/Tasting Room
description: Welcome to Lockdown Brewing Co., the “Home of the Folsom Prison Brews.”  Lockdown Brewing Co. brews craft ales for the enjoyment of beer lovers of all levels from the true connoisseur to the weekend beer lover.   The beers of Lockdown Brewing Co. are hand crafted with all natural ingredients without adjuncts such as cereal, rice or fillers. Our beers are superior because of the brewmaster's attention to detail, his complete love of brewing and the freshness of the beer.    The beers are named in the spirit of the history of Folsom, CA. Lockdown Brewing Co. exhibits the rich history of Folsom and the Folsom Prison through its identity and labeling.  Folsom was home to many firsts.  It was the home to the first Railroad in the West and the first city to transport electricity over the wire over several miles, 22 to be exact. The prison is California’s second oldest and has been made famous thru media like Johnny Cash’s “Folsom Prison Blues” and the movie "Walk the Line".    We invite you to sample our fine ales and enjoy the great taste and absorb the long history of Folsom.
hoursOfOperation: Wednesday-Friday 4-8pm

name: Folsom Tasting Room
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Tue 11-3pm  Wed - Thu 11-10pm  Fri - Sat 11-12am  Sun 11-6pm

name: Lodi Beer Company
description: At the Lodi Beer Company, most days you’ll find the staff minding your pints and quarts. Our old world atmosphere and the friendly, fun personalities of the people who work here, give the wood, stone and steel architecture the warmth of a bygone era. Since opening LBC it has been a place for families and friends to relax, eat lots of great food and have a pint of beer. To add to all of that we also have a full bar ready to accommodate the non beer drinkers, we know you are out there so don't be shy and give us a try.

name: Hickory
description: Loe's Brewing Company  is a small craft brewery located in Hickory North Carolina. We specialize in handcrafted artisanal lagers and ales. We are one of the smallest breweries in North Carolina and also one of the smallest in the country. We have a 1.5 bbl brewhouse , 1 and 3 bbl fermentation tanks. Being so small we can afford to take more time and effort into our beers. We utilize many ingredients from all over the world, selecting only the finest grains, cultured yeast, fresh whole hops, and  our mountain water that is perfect for producing the best beers possible.  Another advantage of being small is that we can produce a wide variety of styles so our selection will always be changing. We will produce beers that fit the season and year round classics. Loe's Brewing takes pride in producing the finest handcrafted beers, and we are sure that once you try our beer you will agree that bigger is not always better , and will notice the difference that craft beer has to offer.  Cheers- The Loe's Brewing Team
hoursOfOperation: Our taproom hours will be Fri, Sat, Sun  2pm -10pm.  Longer hours available on request.

name: Logan Shaw Brewing Company
description: First and foremost, we're all beer lovers! Having said that, the Logan Shaw Brewing Company (LSBC) brings a team of managers who are experts in business, construction, beverage alcohol, retail, science, and finance. The majority of the team is from the Maryland area and has created many business and personal relationships throughout the region, which will be an integral component to the company since acquiring Wild Goose Ale.

name: Logsdon Farmhouse Ales
description: Small farm brewery located in the upper Hood River Valley, OR.    We strive to create unique and intriguing beer. In the farmhouse brewery spirit, we use certified organic ingredients such as whole leaf hops, barley and wheat malts, groats(whole oats), and several strains of yeast. These are combined to make a product of uncompromising quality.

name: Lompoc Tavern
description: The New Old Lompoc opened on May 6th, 2000. But the Old Lompoc Brewery (as it was formerly know) has been producing handcrafted ales and lagers since December 1996, while the tavern has been open since 1993.    The name originally came from the movie ‘The Bank Dick’ starring W.C. Fields and Mae West. Most of the movie took place in the ‘Old Lompoc House’, which was the local watering hole as well as a boarding house.    Our food menu is an excellent array of Northwest pub fare with a great selection of entrees, soups and salads. We have also remodeled the patio and added a sun deck.

name: Lone Tree Brewing Company
description: A craft brewery and tasting room: Small and family friendly, with an emphasis on sampling small-batch brews and sharing the experience with fellow beer lovers.

name: Lonerider Brewing Company
description: We opened our doors on January 23rd, 2009 and since then we have been impressed with the enthusiasm of craft beer aficionados we meet daily. The craft brewing industry is booming and you can find a tremendous variety out there. North Carolina has undoubtedly become the Southern State for beer with Asheville reigning supreme and Raleigh/Durham/CH not far behind. We hope you continue to support the variety and encourage new brewers to experiment with and craft new styles for everybody’s pleasure.    "Effect change; don't be an audience. Walk your own path, and instead of thinking outside the box, imagine if there was no box."

name: Lonesome Valley Brewing
description: Lonesome Valley Brewing began as a dream of high quality craft brews, and a place where neighbors can get together and enjoy life in the heart of Prescott Valley. LVB is committed to serving the local community, and we want the  local guest to know that as soon as they hear our name. Our slogan embodies our mission, "Our Beer is Our Bond." We plan to keep the distance between  the brewer and the guest as small as possible to stay responsive to the changing needs and tastes of our community.

name: Long Ireland Beer Company
description: Long Ireland Beer Company began a little differently then most businesses. Two friends had a crazy idea to go out and start a business because they wanted to do something they truly enjoyed. DRINK BEER!
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 3:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Sat - Sun: 1:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Long Trail Brewing Co
description: Long Trail Brewery is a microbrewery located in Bridgewater, Vermont, USA. It was opened in May of 1989 by Andy Pherson, who now serves both as the company's president and brewmaster. The company's first brewery was located in the basement of the Bridgewater Woolen Mill in Vermont's Green Mountains, but by 1995 the company had become popular enough that it was able to relocate to a state-of-the-art brewery and visitor center (featuring an open-air deck overlooking the Ottaquechee River) in Bridgewater Corners, VT.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 10:00 am - 7:00 pm

name: Long Valley Brew Pub at Restaurant Village
description: Our award-winning brewer and outstanding culinary team develop a wide variety of unique beers and culinary creations to appeal to the diverse tastes of patrons.

name: Longleaf Brewing Company
description: Longleaf will be Greenville's first and only microbrewery. Longleaf will be a full and active member in the Uptown Greenville community by serving as an arts and entertainment staple in Greenville while catering to the increased demand for local craft beer and showcasing regional artwork and music.

name: Lookout Brewing Company
description: Freshly brewed beer. Made with love here on the front porch of Western North Carolina's Blue Ridge Mountains. Our little city in the clouds expects a lot out of our beer. In order to make sure we produce the best, our beer is sophisticatified with Mozart in full-effect during the fermentation process. With creativity and tradition combined, we are working hard to bring you the tastes you love. We can't wait to raise a glass and welcome you in for a cold beer.

name: Loomis Basin Brewing Co
description: Serving Handcrafted Premium Ales
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu: 3:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 3:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Loop Brewing Company
description: Enjoy the historic building, unique atmosphere, fresh brick oven pizza and smooth craft beer. Loop Brewing Company is the perfect place to dine with your family and friends. Share a pint of fine, handcrafted beer within sight of the very brewing tanks that produced it.    Loop Brewing Company was established in 2011 in McCook, Nebraska. The brewery is situated along the railroad tracks that shaped the town nearly 130 years ago. Loop Brewing Company pays homage to its roots through an age-old tradition of quality, handcrafted brewing. Our beer is as rich as our heritage
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm

name: Loowit Brewing Company
description: Established in 2012 by longtime Vancouver residents Devon Bray and Thomas Poffenroth, Loowit Brewing Company is the latest significant addition to underpin a revitalized downtown Vancouver, Washington. The company specializes in brewing small batch, hand crafted ales that are developed with a thoughtful approach balanced by a Pacific Northwest flair.

name: Lore Brewing Company
description: We are a full service homebrew, vintner and soda supply store that has all of the ingredients and equipment you need to make great beverages at home.  Our microbrewery will be opening sometime in late 2011.  10% discount on most supplies and equipment for AHA members, Police, Fire and Active Duty or Retired Military!

name: Los Gatos Brewing Company
description: You'll be greeted and seated within the stylish, elegant decor encompassing fine glass and woodwork chic furnishings, rich mahogany wood and oak arvhes salvaged from a historic St.Luis brothel pub.

name: Los Oasis
description: Brewing our own Beer will be a staple here at Los Oasis. Head Brewmaster Mike Kasian has plans of producing Latin Lagers and Ales which are inspired by some of Mexico's and South America's favorites. There will be 5 house brews on tap as well as a wide variety of wines from Spain , Chile, and Argentina.

name: Lost Coast Brewery & Café
description: Founded in 1989 by Barbara Groom, the Lost Coast Brewery is one of the only female-owned and operated breweries in the U.S. Lost Coast is famous for its delicious and award-winning beers: Great White, Downtown Brown, Indica IPA & Tangerine Wheat!

name: Lost Duck Brewing Company
description: Fort Madison is one of the few places where the river actually runs east to west instead of the normal north to south. Many waterfowl follow the river on their migratory flights and they seemingly spend quite a lot of time circling in this area, as if confused over this natural phenomenon. Thus the name "The Lost Duck Brewing Company" was born. Take a tour of our website to find the current brews available, our pub-style foods and the events happening at the Duck.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Sat:	3:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Lost Highway Brewing Company
description: Belgium's oldest tradition comes to Colfax!

name: Lost Nation Brewing
description: We are located at 254 Wilkins St (Just off Route 100) in Morrisville, VT. Slightly off the beaten path, we are proud to offer some of the most finely crafted beers in the great state of Vermont. Pair any of our fine selections with any of the house made, locally sourced items off of our delicious menu and we have no doubt that you will leave satisfied!
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Sun: 11:30 am - 9:00 pm

name: Lost Province Brewing Co
description: Authentic and Innovative Craft Brews, Wood Fired Pizza, and Local Foods. Opening Summer 2014 in downtown Boone, NC.

name: Lost Rhino Brewing Company
description: Lost Rhino™ is a new craft brewery in Ashburn, VA with deep roots in Loudoun County. Brewers Matt Hagerman and Favio Garcia, formerly of Old Dominion, are back together and now creating some of the finest beers found in the local area!    The name Lost Rhino™ represents the strength and attitude of the rhinoceros. The five species of rhino each has its own distinct persona, ranging from laid back to aggressive. Our brews will also span a range of personalities from hoppy Pilsners to rich, malty IPAs.    "Rhino chasers" are big wave surfers on a continuous journey to find the next perfect wave. At Lost Rhino™, we are on a similar journey to create a continuing line of distinctive, enjoyable, memorable beers.

name: Lost River Brewing Company
description: The Lost River Brewing Company is an artisan craft brewery and pub located in the West Virginia Potomac Highlands.    We are excited to open in this historic building, which is over a century old. Built in 1885, the first floor originally hosted a Frye Dry Goods store and blacksmith shop. Legend has it the second floor saw the first meetings of the local Masons. The Steinway piano prominently displayed in the pub was originally brought into the building in 1899. It has never left the building, and is the same piano that was used during the early 20th century to accompany silent films. During our extensive renovations of the building, we elected to preserve the original walls of the first floor, to honor the history of this building and the Frye Brothers themselves, the original builders.       We are grateful for the opportunity to establish our business in historic Wardensville and proud to become a part of the local community.     We hope that our artisan craft ales and delicious old-fashioned foods will add a little something special to the unique flavor of the beautiful Potomac Highlands.
hoursOfOperation: Thursday & Friday 5:00PM to closing  Saturday & Sunday 12:00PM to closing  Closed Monday, Tuesday & Wednesday

name: Main Meadery
description: Louisville Mead Co. is a locally owned small-farm winery that produces several varieties honey-based alcoholic beverages known as mead.

name: Loveland Aleworks
description: Loveland Aleworks is an independent, family-owned brewery offering a selection of small batch handcrafted beers.    We are passionate about brewing ales that we, and our customers, believe in — quality ales, made well, using the best ingredients. A simple combination.    We don't limit ourselves to brewing a certain style of ale. We brew what we like, but we're sure to share the rewards.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 2:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Low Brau
description: Low Brau LLC is a Washington, DC based nano brewery created by Steven Sorrell in response to the current American Craftbrewing atmosphere. After visting breweries around the world, Steven noticed a lack of crisp refreshing session style beers brewed here in the US, so in 2010, the seeds of Low Brau were planted.     With a background in the food industry and many years of beer research, it was only natural for Steven to start brewing at home, and wasn't long before he started creating his own recipes. Now a year later, Low Brau continues to move forward, with plans to open it's doors within the District in the next year.     Low Brau's beers are German inspired, following the guidelines set fourth by the Rheinheitsgebot Purity Law and high quality ingredients. Each beer is hand crafted and brewed in small batches to maintain quality over quantity.     Low Brau strongly believes in "Embracing Simplicity".

name: Lowdown Brewery + Kitchen
description: LowDown is the culmination of 20+ years of professional brewing experience. LowDown owners Scott and Phil have won numerous awards, including accolades from The Great American Beer Festival.  We don’t just stop at great beer, we serve great food too.  We only serve the best seasonal menu items with quality ingredients.    LowDown understands what it means to give back. We know that we reside in a neighborhood many people call home. Making our neigborhood and everything around it better is part of our mission.    From our casual environment to educating our staff, we're redefining the brewery experience. At LowDown we're passionate about quality beer, great and sustainable food, and making memories with good friends.
hoursOfOperation: Sun-Thur: 11:00AM - 12:00AM  Fri & Sat: 11:00AM - 1:00AM

name: Lowercase Brewing
description: We’re a beer company.  We got our start in Seattle making stuff in our basement and seeing what our friends thought of it. After a little trial and a lot of error, the beer started to taste pretty good.
hoursOfOperation: Thurs/Fridays 4–9  Saturdays 12-8  Sundays 12-6

name: LTD Brewing Co.
description: Using an 8 barrel brewing system makes us one of the smallest production breweries in Minnesota.  We focus on providing constant innovation and imagination to the craft beer enthusiast. Having a small, flexible system allows LTD Brewing to challenge the taste-buds of people who dream for a great beer. We are not bound by a style of beer, ingredients or a predetermined idea of what a beer drinker would expect. We are committed to re-inventing the way beer is brewed and providing an experience, not a drink.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - 4:00pm - 10:00pm  Thurs - 3:00pm - 10:00pm  Fri - 2:00pm - Midnight  Sat - Noon - Midnight

name: Lucette Brewing Company
description: Lucette is hand-crafted by guys and brought to life by the artistry of a woman. Don’t be offended or embarrassed by her voluptuous curves or stunning assets--she isn’t. Lucette is an image of revolution and evolution, much like experiencing a non-macro beer for the first time. And what’s more, she is created from the finest ingredients by the hands of our own brewers, at our own brewery, and not by some mysterious brewery far away from "home". In other words, she is not fake, diluted, or overproduced --she is 100% Lucette.

name: Lucid Brewing
description: In July 2010, over a craft beer at a local restaurant, Eric Biermann and Jon Messier had a Lucid thought – “Let’s throw away the ties and the corporate ladders.  Let’s start a craft beer brewery!”  That Clarity in Thinking, led to the successful launch of Lucid Brewing.    In June of 2011, with a year of planning already completed, they realized jumping headfirst into the brewery was the only way they could make their dream a reality.  They quit their day jobs.      With that leap of faith – and a ton of support from many friends and family – they started building their brewery from the ground up.  Through the sweltering heat of the 2011 summer, many friends labored side by side with Jon and Eric.  They did it all, start to finish, from digging trenches to assembling the last tank.  So of course they needed a refreshing and light drink to quench their thirst while they toiled away.  They found just the right recipe and brewed their first beer – AIR.  A beer made to get the job done.  Its slight citrus aroma and flavor, lower ABV and crisp dry finish made this their favorite “go to” beer.      By October the brewery was complete and cooking.  And in the spirit of the season, Eric and Jon gave thanks to the Brew gods when they made their first deliveries to their first three customers the week of Thanksgiving… in Jon’s car.  Lucid was on its way!    Always keeping an eye on the demand for high quality while quickly catching the craft beer lover’s attention, Lucid assembled a team of dedicated employees and introduced brews to quench their customers’ demands.   AIR, DYNO, FOTO and DUO, along with seasonal and small-batch brews, are quickly becoming Minnesota favorites at local bars and restaurants.      Great success has followed them after throwing away the daily grind for the daily brew.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 5:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Lucky Bucket Brewing Company
description: After years of working a local brewpub and experimenting in the garage, three guys decided to take their know-how and passion for great beer and bottle it.    Lucky Bucket Brewing Company is Nebraska's newest craft brewery, growing almost as fast as we can brew it. Our first release, Pre-Prohibition style Lager, is getting some welcomed praise for representing the true character of beer, reminiscent of a time when beer actually had flavor. Keep an eye out for our latest releases including a very floral and flavorful American IPA and our first barrel-aged release, Certified Evil.
