name: Ramapo Valley Brewery
description: Ramapo Valley Brewery New York was established in Hillburn New York in 2000. The company was the result of a small micro brewery that first started brewing in 1997.    Their unique brewing process and Recipes, along with the use of the valley spring waters, resulted in award winning beers. Over the next three years , the demand for their beers grew at such an astounding rate that the founders, decided to make the transition to a formal brewery, and Ramapo Valley Brewery was born.    RVB is the only Kosher certified brewery in the United States , and certified to produce Kosher for Passover beer.

name: Ramblin' Road
description: Ramblin' Road is a small family-owned brewery located in beautiful Spokane, WA. We brew funky Belgian and hoppy NW style ales. Our 10 BBL direct-fire brewhouse allows us to produce just enough beer to satisfy thirsty patrons in our taproom and select local establishments. Our small batch ales often find their way into used wine and spirits barrels for additional aging and second fermentations to produce wild and sour ales!    We believe that the craft of brewing beer should be pursued just as you would embark on any great adventure – with an appreciation for history but without the shackles of convention. We approach beer as an artistic medium that offers endless opportunities for creativity, independence and innovation. While we do brew some traditional ales, we refuse to brew just the status quo.    Whether you are at our brewery in Spokane, a remote campsite in the mountains, or somewhere in between, we hope our beer brings your friends and family together to slow down and enjoy the simple pleasures of life.    We invite you to taste the road less traveled.
hoursOfOperation: Wed:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Thu:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  1:00pm - 9:00pm Sun:  1:00pm - 6:00pm

name: Randy's Fun Hunters Brewery Restaurant and Banquet Center
Ranger Creek Brewing & Distilling
description: Ranger Creek is a combined brewery/distillery proudly located in San Antonio, TX. We make beer and whiskey in our “brewstillery”, and we make it by hand one batch at a time with lots of love and attention. As a combined operation, we use much of the same equipment to make both our beer and our whiskey, and we can do this because there are a lot of similarities between the two processes. It’s actually a really cool process to see, and we invite you to come take a tour and learn about it for yourself.

name: Rapp Brewing Company
description: Welcome to Rapp Brewing Company!  Home of hand crafted small batch artisanal Ales and Lagers.  Our goal is to bring you the finest examples of traditional beer styles using the best available ingredients.  We also offer you intriguing variations of traditional styles as well as exploring styles from past ages.  We use our creativity in the art of brewing and invite you to join us in that adventure.

name: Raquette River Brewing
description: Racquette River Brewing is 2 bbl production brewery located in Tupper Lake, NY. We brew small batch, hand crafted Adirondack Ales.
hoursOfOperation: Fridays 4 to 7  Saturdays 11 to 5

name: Rare Bird Brewery
description: Situated in a beautiful 1931 red brick building, Rare Bird’s mission is to provide an unsurpassed dining and drinking experience in Traverse City. From our intimate reclaimed wood booths to the cozy and cool lounge and German bier hall style seating made from massive wood slabs that Nate and Tina sustainably harvested, we have a space for everyone to feel comfortable. The food menu features simple, familiar items served with a unique and exciting flair. Our ingredients are sourced locally when possible. Keeping with the local theme, our beer ingredients will include malt and hops grown in Michigan whenever possible. All of these qualities together make Rare Bird stand out in the crowd.
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Wed 3pm-12pm  Thurs-Sat 3pm-2am  Sun 3pm-10pm

name: Rat Hole Brewing
description: Rat Hole Brewing is a start up Nano Brewery in Central Oregon housed in a barn on 10 acres of rural ranch land southeast of Bend. A short walk from the brewery is the owners’ residence. The owners Al and Susan Toepfer, with Asst. Brewer & Marketing Guy Ken Deuser, and many more family members have spent two years taking a very run down barn that sits atop a 20,000 gallon cistern, into the great little brewery you see and taste today.     Rat Hole will be brewing Red Ales, Porters, Browns, IPA's, Pilsners, Wheat and Specialty Beers. Some of the Specialty Beers will be seasonal brews such as Pumpkin Spice Ale, Hazelnut Brown, and Vanilla Porters as example. Other specialty beers will be a Summer Lemon Wheat, Saison, and a Blueberry Ale    Rat Hole Brewing handcrafts its beers in small batches under the close personal attention of their Head Brewer Al Toepfer & Asst. Brewer Ken Deuser. Using traditional brewing methods, Al & Ken ensure a "most excellent" taste consistently. We package our beer in bottles & draft kegs.     Prior to becoming a commercial brewer, Al was a home brewer for many years. Ken Retired after serving 25 years in Navy traveling the world, and of course, tasting World Beers.

name: Rat Hole Brew Pub
hoursOfOperation: 12:00 Noon to 10:00 PM  Tuesday through Saturday

name: Real Ale Brewing Company
description: Welcome to the Texas Hill Country - the home of Real Ale Brewing Company, where a dedicated team of brewers produces quality handcrafted ales. Utilizing a 60-barrel stainless steel brewing system, we incorporate 100% malted grain, domestic and imported hops, and crystal clear water into our unique recipes. We've been brewing since 1996, and now you can find Real Ale all over the Lone Star State. If you don't see us at your favorite stores, bars, and restaurants, make sure to ask for us by name! Cheers and thanks for your support!
hoursOfOperation: Fri: 2:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Realerevival Brewing
description: Bringing craft brews back to Cambridge this summer. Built on the belief that people should have a say in the beer they drink.

name: Recess Brewing Company
description: Recess Brewing’s facility will consist of a three vessel 5-barrel brewery, 3 fermentors, and 6 brite/serving tanks. We will start operating with four year round beers, slowly working in a rotation of seasonal and specialty beers. The brewery will occupy the back 2/3 of the building and will be closed to the general public. Tours will be offered once we are up and running so stay tuned for this.    The other 1/3 of the building will house the taproom and will be open to everyone. The taproom will be able to seat about 50 people at a time and will be the only place to purchase Recess beer. In the taproom, customers will be able to sit and enjoy a beer with some friends or they can take a growler home with them. Food will not be served but patrons are more than welcome to order from an outside source or bring their own food.    A main focus at Recess will be the Community Supported Brewery program. This program will function similarly to community supported agriculture, in which consumers pay for weekly or monthly boxes of fresh-from-the-farm produce. Instead of produce, Recess will be providing fresh-from-the-brewery beer. For more details on the CSB program and what the benefits of becoming a member are, head over to the CSB page.

name: Red Brick Brewing Company
description: As the southeast's oldest brewery, Red Brick recently celebrated their 20th Anniversary. This milestone not only exemplifies their continuing commitment to amazing craft beer, but also signals a shift in focus for the brewery towards more innovative recipes and concepts.    Headed up by a small group of impassioned beer lovers including head brewer Garett Lockhart, Red Brick is determined to lead the charge in the south, putting out excellent beers such as "Hoplanta" IPA and the upcoming winter release "Sacred Cow" chai milk stout. They also take time to push the limits of brewing with the "Brick Mason" series, which the staff sees as their continuing masterpiece. Highlights from this series include "The Lost Years" old ale, "Black-Eye Rye" American black ale, and the most recent release "20th Anniversary", a 10% Imperial stout that was aged in Buffalo Trace bourbon barrels. Early accolades have already compared it to the hallowed KBS.    The future keeps looking brighter and brighter for this brewery, and the next couple years will see them growing and experimenting with diverse styles, collaborating with fellow breweries, implementing a new barrel program, and continuing to raise the bar for themselves in all aspects. After all, craft beer isn't just a product; it's a journey.

name: Red Brick Station Restaurant and Brewpub
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm

name: Red Castle Microbrewery and Distillery
description: Carbon Counties only MIcro Brewery is now in Downtown Lehighton. Amazingly fresh brews with rich tastes and unique flavors. Stop by for your growler fills!

name: Red Dragon Brewery
description: The beers of the Red Dragon Brewery are inspired by the Celtic heritage of the Evans family whose ancestral roots are in Ireland, Scotland, England, and, most especially, Wales. It is in Wales that Evans is the fourth most common surname. The red dragon appears on the national flag of Wales, and has symbolized this Celtic nation for more than a millennium. So, it is with pride in this heritage that the Red Dragon Brewery is committed to producing the very finest of craft beers.

name: Red Ear Brewing Company
description: Red Ear Brewing is a small craft beer brewery based in Northern Kentucky. As we are locallyowned and operated it is our goal to support other businesses within the Greater CincinnatiMetropolitan area and utilize local products and services to bring you what you are looking for.  Quality craft beer!    You can be certain only the finest hops and grains are used in every batch of Red Ear beer and it isour goal to provide you, our family, friends, and neighbors, only the best tasting locally brewed  beer. This we can promise not only because we are the owners of Red Ear Brewing but moreimportantly because we love beer ourselves and are honored to produce it in our backyard wherebeer is a time honored tradition and not a fad.

name: Red Eye Brewing Company
description: Our craft beers are produced in small batches, by experienced brewers, using only the highest quality ingredients. Our brewers view these beers as a painter would his "palette", through which they manipulate grain, hops, yeast, and brewing techniques. We also encourage our brewers to add a little of their own creative flair.

name: Red Hare Brewing Company
description: Situated in an 11,000 sq. ft. warehouse, Red Hare Brewing Company has a 20 barrel brewhouse with a 120 barrel fermenting capacity. Making every day beer for beer fans everywhere, Red Hare’s flagship beer is Long Day Lager. Other year round Red Hare beers are Gangway IPA and Watership Brown. Keep an eye out for our Rabbit’s Reserve Series, limited edition, one-off batches that will be released four times a year.
hoursOfOperation: Our taproom is open:  Friday: 5:30 pm - 7:30 pm  Saturday 3:30 pm - 5:30 pm

name: Red Jacket Brewing Company
description: Michigan House Cafe & Brewpub is located in the heart of Historic Downtown Calumet across the street from the Vertin Building - the new home of Miskwabic Ed Gray Studio, Abbey Art Glass Studio, and an ever growing list of other artists.  The Sixth and Oak intersection is also conveniently located two blocks from snowmobile trails and Swedetown ski trails, and 11 miles from Mt. Bohemia.  The street level offers a full service restaurant and a vintage pub. Overnight lodging is available on the second floor (once the Hotel Michigan) with two suites that have been rehabilitated in historic fashion.  Red Jacket Brewing Company, Michigan's newest Brewpub, is beginning operation on the ground floor as well - following the historic Bosch Brewing tradition.

name: Red Leg Brewing Company
description: Red Leg Brewing Company was established to provide the highest quality craft beer to honor the Men and Women who currently and formerly served in The United States of America. Our craft beers are developed with the utmost care, using only the highest quality craft beer ingredients. The craft beers that leave our facility will have the reputation that we strive for, continuing our service by providing those who serve with a craft beer they can be proud of.

name: Red Oak Brewery
description: Red Oak Brew Pub was opened in February of 1991. In addition to brewing according to the Law of Purity, we decided not to filter or pasteurize our Bavarian Lagers to ensure the vitamins remain whole for that rich, mellow taste. Within months of opening the pub we began selling Red Oak to other accounts in the Greensboro area. In no time the 6 original aging tanks were maxed out so we added on to the building and installed 13 new tanks. By 2001 Red Oaks popularity had grown so much that we were brewing 24/7...and out of aging capacity. We began the search for a location to build a larger brewery with space to accommodate future growth.  After settling on a 12 acre tract along I 40/85 between Greensboro and Burlington in 2003...we began discussions with 3 Bavarian Brewery fabricators. Rolec of Cheming, Bavaria was chosen to supply the new brewery; and in 2005 construction began on the building to house it.  By the summer of 2007 Red Oak was ready to open the nation's most modern computerized brewing facility...consistently producing the Freshest, Purest, Bavarian Lagers in America.
hoursOfOperation: Brewery Tours are every Friday at 3:00 pm (21 and up only). The tour is $10/person. This price includes a newly designed collectable brewery glass for you to keep.

name: Red Rock Brewing Company
description: Over the years, Red Rock has proven itself in the brewing community bringing home many medals from the annual Great American Beer Festival and a whopping 9 from the international competition, World Beer Cup. Other outstanding accomplishments include 20 medals from the North American Beer Awards and being named “Brewpub of the Year” by Brewpub Magazine in 2000. In 2007 Red Rock won "Large Brewpub and Large Brewpub Brewer of the Year" at the Great American Beer Festival.

name: Red Star Brewery & Grille
description: The Red Star Brewery & Grille opened for business October 19th, 1998.  We had only five beers on tap, the Golden Light, American Pale, English Brown, Irish Dry Stout, and a Seasonal brew.

name: Red Wing Brewery
description: Continuing the brewing tradition in beautiful Red Wing, Minnesota, the Red Wing Brewery produces a variety of hand-crafted styles, including historic Red Wing beers and our own root beer.

name: Redbeard Brewing Co
description: Specializing in small batches of big beers. We are located at 120 S Lewis Street in the Wharf district of Staunton VA. Our “Brewers Notice”, the federal license to produce beer, was approved by the Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau in Feb. 2013. We began making capital improvements to the leased space and assembling our equipment in October 2012. Our opening brewhouse size will be ~1.5 ba...See More

name: Redhook Ale Brewery
description: In 1981, Gordon Bowker and Paul Shipman started Redhook Ale Brewery in an old transmission shop in Seattle. Early missteps led to a cult following and eventually led to widespread acclaim that inspired countless craft brewers. Still, more than 25 years later, no brewery has been able to achieve the pure, unqualified Liquid Goodness of Redhook.

name: Red Rock Brewing
description: Our brewers are always looking for inspiration. It comes in many ways and leads to many great brewing innovations, like ur award winning Red Rock Rêve, barrel aged Belgian-style triple; the unique, dandelion-based Paardebloem created in conjunction with New Belgium Brewing Company; and Secale, a Bavarian-style doppelbock lager created with High West Distillery and aged in their rye whiskey barrels for six months.  From our wide variety of beers to our hand-crafted sodas, Red Rock's brewers brew it right.

name: Redstone Meadery
description: David Myers, known as 'Chairman of the Mead', founder of Redstone Meadery, is a romantic and wants to see mead once again enjoying the glory days of yesteryear. He started the Boulder, Colorado company with the 'natural philosophy' that he produce the highest quality honey wine on the market.    Because of this 'philosophy of mead', Redstone does not cork (to avoid oxidation) but instead uses swing top bottles. This ensures the mead will not breathe while cellaring plus offers a much longer shelf life once the bottle has been opened.    In keeping with the 'natural' approach, Redstone does not add any sulfites, a known allergen, as honey is it's own natural preservative. Redstone only pasteurizes the must (unfermented mead) and never boils. The company strives to feature the flavors of the fermentable as much as possible.    In 2003 Redstone Meadery brought the International Mead Festival (www.meadfest.com) to Boulder, Colorado and with that helped to establish mead as its own beverage category. Also at this time Redstone spearheaded the creation of the International Mead Association (www.meadfest.org) to help promote and educate the masses about the world's first fermented beverage.    Currently, Redstone products are distributed to 20 states across the U.S., making it the widest distributed wine from the state of Colorado and one of the most widely distributed meads in the country! From the Northwest to the Southeast, Ask for Mead!

name: Redwood Brewing Co
description: Brewpub that offers upscale dining in a casual atmosphere. Our lodge themed restaurant features: smoke free dining, award winning beer, woodfire pizza oven, steaks, wild game, live music, outdoor dining and much more. 2008 Great American Beer Fest Small Brewpub of the Year.

name: Redwood Curtain Brewing
description: We desire to share our passion and interest in craft beer with everyone from the first time sipper to the seasoned enthusiast. Providing academic and hands on experiences are a big part of this desire to help people expand and trust their own senses.    All of our handcrafted artisan ales are served and properly aged, to deliver maximum flavor and character. Our expressive beers can be very complex and assertive, but the with the ultimate goal of proper balance. We only use premium domestic and imported malts and hops, Humboldt County water and our multiply yeast strains. You will not find any artificial additives or preservatives in our beers.    We trust that our craft beer and brewing techniques convey our philosophies concerning family, friends, community, education and living life to its fullest. Cheers!

name: Refuge Brewery
description: The brewery is currently set up to brew 10bbl (310 gallons) of beer at a time. It may seem like a lot of beer (and it is!), but brewing on this relatively small scale allows us to maintain quality at a finite level that would be increasingly difficult on a larger system. However, our five fermentors, with a capacity totaling 80bbl, allows us to maintain a variety of beers on tap all year long.     The tasting room is situated right in the middle of the brewery and allows people to experience beer and what goes into producing it. Often times patrons of the tasting room get a front row seat to the actual brewing process as our brewers are working!
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Fri: 4:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat: 1:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sun: 1:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Regimental Brewing Company
description: We are a husband and wife superduo (emphasis on the duo, less on the super) who are building a brewery from the ground up. Stay tuned!

name: Regulator Brewing Company
description: Regulator Brewing Company is committed to the support of local farms, the spirit of rebellion, and, of course, great beer.

name: Releta Brewing Company, LLC
description: The Olde Saratoga Brewing Company in Saratoga Springs, NY, is the wholly owned subsidiary of Mendocino Brewing Company in Ukiah, California, and has been bringing you the highest quality, fresh, traditional, all malt craft-brewed lager and ales since 1997. Brewing the five legend ales, the Mendocino Brewing Company was established in 1983 as the first brew pub in California and the second in the USA. The Olde Saratoga Brewing Company now brews, bottles and kegs of these famous ales for the entire East Coast.  In the year 2001, the Olde Saratoga Brewing Co. began brewing Kingfisher Premium Lager for the USA, joining three other countries worldwide who brew Kingfisher. Kingfisher Premium Lager is enjoyed in over 55 countries and is the world's #1 selling Indian beer. Olde Saratoga Brewing is the sole brewery for Kingfisher in the Northeast United States.  Alt Names: Olde Saratoga Brewing Company

name: Relic Brewing Co
description: We are a small batch brewery creating fresh, seasonal and unique ales and lagers. Looking to open early 2012.
hoursOfOperation: Check Website

name: Renegade Brewing Company
description: ffensively Delicious? Yes, that’s what our beer is. Always creative and always packed with flavor. This is beer for those who do the don’ts and don’t the dos, the Renegades. We don’t care about traditional styles, or following the trends, we care about making f’ing delicious beer that we are proud to serve.    Renegade was founded by Brian and Khara O’Connell in the summer of 2011 in the Santa Fe Arts District of Denver. Brian brought his offensively delicious brews, developed in his backyard, to Denverites to encourage social interaction and friendship. Ryeteous, the flagship beer of Renegade, was packaged in cans for the first time in the summer of 2012. Come down to our taproom, or ask for us at your favorite bar, restaurant or liquor store. Whatever you do, don’t be something you’re not, be Renegade.

name: Republic Brewing Company
description: RBC brews and serves world class beer in community minded little pub.  Four local restaurants deliver to your table. Enjoy the outdoor beer garden, hand-crafted sodas and sip award winning beer.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Thu: 2:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: RePublic Brewpub
description: We're a couple of friends who tried to open a small brewpub in Sun Prairie, WI. We failed to raise enough money, but we hope this website will serve as a useful resource to future brewery owners.

name: Retro Beer Company
description: We are three-retired friends who believe that giving back to others is life's greatest virtue. We were raised on these basic ideals: Love for Community, Importance of Generosity, and the Need for Sustainability. History tells us that the invention of beer inspired the idea of community. When people come together to enjoy beer, amazing things happen: Friendships are sparked, stories are shared, ideas are cultivated. Beer is simply a social vehicle for people to discuss what really matters in life. Together we can be a driving force in giving back to a cause in your community. 20% of this beverage’s proceeds go to [insert charity]. With your help we can shift the purpose behind beer to generously give back to the community

name: Reuben's Brews
description: We are a small family ran brewery in the Ballard district of Seattle, crafting tasty small batch brews.    Our story by grace!    Although only a month old at the time, our clever, thoughtful son, Reuben, came up with the idea of giving Adam a homebrewing kit for his birthday.  When Reuben and I took Adam to Bob’s (our friendly, neighborhood homebrew supply store) to pick up his kit, I was expecting to pick up a little tin of “beer mix” and a bucket to brew.  We were a bit surprised and overwhelmed by the seriousness of this beer-brewing business.  I thought, “Oh great, there’s more storage space gone once Adam gives up on this little hobby in a month’s time.”  Even though I rarely admit to being wrong now that we’re married, I couldn’t have been farther from the mark thinking that this would be an easily discarded hobby.  The first brewing system has been dwarfed by the upgraded and supersized brewhouse, and there has been no chance for the mash tun, brew kettle, or hot liquor tank to gather any dust!  Adam’s hobby turned into full-blown obsession, and in tribute to the little man who started it all, Reuben’s Brews was born!

name: Reunion Brewing Company
description: Reunion Brewing Company, Bringing the world together two beers at a time....

name: Revival Brewing Company
description: Brewers of fine malted beverages headed up by award winning brew master Sean Larkin.

name: Brewpub
description: Revolution Brewing is Chicago's new hometown craft brewery. Our brewpub in Logan Square is a bustling, neighborhood institution where friends and families meet to enjoy the freshest beer in town. Opening our brewery has been a labor of love. We think you can see that in everything we do ranging from the details of our carved fists holding up our mahogany bar to the pungent hop aroma of our Anti-Hero IPA to our creative dishes like our bacon-fat popcorn.    The growth of craft breweries in the U.S. has been nothing short of a revolution and we're proud to be standing tall in this new crowd. The changing tastes of beer drinkers demand bigger flavors and more variety. That's exactly what we give you at Revolution Brewing. Our brewpub produces about 50 different beer styles each year. We've got session beers like Workingman Mild, hop-bombs like Double Fist and more bourbon barrel aged beers than you can shake a stave at. We have fun doing what we do and invite you to come in and join us.
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Fri: 11am-2am  Sat: 10am-3am  Sun: 10am-2am

name: Revolution Brewing Co
description: At Revolution Brewing, our beer is made by humans for humans using only the finest grains, hops and water. It has not been pasteurized, centrifuged or filtered. There are no chemical additives or artificial ingredients.    We craft brew this beer just for you.

name: Revolver Brewing
description: Revolver Brewing is located thirty-five minutes southwest of Fort Worth in historic Granbury, TX. We are a Texas family owned business founded by father and son, Ron and Rhett Keisler, along with seasoned Master Brewer and Cicerone, Grant Wood. We don't take ourselves too seriously, but we take extreme pride in our craft. We believe we can brew world-class beer in the Texas countryside. We start with fresh water from our own Trinity Aquifer well and brew our beer incorporating seasonal local ingredients. We brew on custom made equipment built for us in the U.S. by proud craftsmen. We oversee our beer to the tap to ensure you are drinking the same beer we are. We believe that our knowledge of brewing, hard work and attention to each detail is evident in every beer we craft.

name: Rhodell Brewery
description: Our bar carries 9 of our hand-crafted beers on draught and also one cask conditioned beer on a traditional British hand pump.    Our Scottish brewer brews over 30 different beer styles throughout the year, ranging from American style Wheat beers to Belgian Dubbels and Tripels and of course Scottish Ales.    Unlike other microbreweries - Our beers do not compromise on flavor!
hoursOfOperation: Tuesday - Thursday: 3:00 p.m. - 10:00 p.m.  Friday: 3:00 p.m. - 12:00 a.m.  Saturday: 2:00 p.m. - 12:00 a.m

name: Richbrau Brewing Company
description: This brewery went out of business in 2010.

name: Ridgebrook Brewery
description: Ridgebrook Brewery began with a love for beer. Not the typical light lagers we’ve all had throughout the years, but craft beer; beer that focuses on flavor, aroma, color and taste. Craft beer opened up a whole new world of exotic tastes that, once discovered, prohibited our return to the standard light lager of our youth.

name: Riff Raff Brewing
description: Founded in 2013, Riff Raff Brewing Company opens in downtown Pagosa Springs, Colorado, in May 2013. The brewery—Pagosa Springs’ first downtown brewery—features artisan ales handcrafted in Riff Raff’s historic Victorian building.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri: 3:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat - Sun: 12:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Rifle Brewing Company
description: All of our microbrews are brewed on premise with the highest quality of craftmanship. We offer four core brews year round.  Our brewer is constantly switching up our selection so make sure to come in often for his newest creation.  You'll leave happy every time - guaranteed.
hoursOfOperation: Monday thru Thursday: 5 PM - 9 PM  Friday thru Saturday: 5 PM - 9:30 PM

name: Right Brain Brewery
description: Hailed as One of the "Top 5 Local Breweries In The Nation", Right Brain Brewery is known for our culinary inspired beers using only whole ingredients, like Asparagus, Cherry Pies, or smoked Mangalitsa Pig Heads. When we're not busy fending off pirates on the Boardman Lake we like to throw art shows, concerts, and even yoga classes in our brewery. Some people love us, some people hate us, and others just don't understand, but we just want to teach you how to Beer No Evil!©
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed: 12:00 pm - 12:00 am  Thurs - Sat: 11:00 am - 1:00 am  Sun: 12:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Right Proper Brewing Company
description: Right Proper Brewing Company will be a locally owned neighborhood brew pub in a Washington DC neighborhood    Washington, DC, needs at least two things: more affordable neighborhood restaurants, and at least one locally owned brewpub.   Our objective is three-fold: We want to create a neighborhood gathering place that makes and serves well-priced delicious food and amazing fresh beer; we want to help our neighborhood thrive by investing in the community and its residents; and we want to anchor Washington, DC on the map as a destination for craft beer. Our business will invest in the growth and development of our employees as well as of our community.    We’ll take an innovative approach to small scale, “yeast-forward” craft brewing to produce artisanal ales and lagers in a comfortable, expertly designed casual old-world tavern. Serving fresh beer and affordable, high-quality American food, Right Proper will be a focus of pride for its neighborhood.
hoursOfOperation: TUESDAY - THURSDAY: 5PM - 11PM  FRIDAY - SATURDAY: 5PM - 12AM  SUNDAY: 5PM - 10PM  MONDAY: CLOSED

name: Riley's Brewing Company
description: A bunch of guys and gals that have been brewing for years together decided to go for it.  They brew like true craft brewers on what would seem like a giant home brew system.  You can tell its all made with love and hard work.
hoursOfOperation: The Brewery is open from Monday to Thursday 7am to 5pm.

name: Rinn Duin Brewing
description: Formerly Blackthorn, Rinn Duin Brewing is crafting characteristically traditional, yet distincive English, Irish and Scottish Ales in the heart of the Jersey Shore.

name: Rio Grande Brewing Company
description: Rio Grande Brewery and Sierra Blanca Brewery - one brewery - two great brands!    Located just outside Albuquerque, in Moriarty NM, our craft beer is brewed in the wild west and is out of this world! We are excited about our craft and excited to offer fellow beer enthusiasts the best in locally made flavors
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	11:00 am	-	5:00 pm  Fri:	11:00 am	-	8:00 pm  Sat:	11:00 am	-	5:00 pm

name: Rip Current Brewing
description: We believe Rip Current is the right name for our brewery as it reflects our vision for the brewery being a strong force that goes against the conventional beer style flow so as to change the entire beer landscape. We plan to brew uncompromising, assertive flavored ales and lagers bringing maximum variety to the southern California beer community.    At Rip Current Brewing, we plan to listen closely our customer’s preferences and use this to drive the wide variety of beer available at our tasting room and keg accounts. We will challenge drinkers’ pallets to enjoy new flavor experiences while not losing sight of what beers people demand on an ongoing basis. Our tap room will feature a rotating selection of seasonal and experimental styles complementing San Diego favorites like the IPA, Imperial IPA and hoppy amber. Rip Current will lever our extensive recipe library of award winning beers to maximize our customer’s enjoyment.

name: Ritual Brewing Co.
description: Fresh and Flavorful Craft Beer in Redlands, California.

name: River City Brewing
description: Making quality beer is always job number one. Everything else comes after that.

name: River City Brewing Co
description: River City Brewing Co. Is located in the heart of the Old Town district of downtown Wichita, and opened its doors in 1993. Since then, we've strived to push the envelope in brewing styles and seasonal offerings for your enjoyment. We offer 5 flagship beers, and 11 rotating seasonal offerings. We have a full bar and awesome menu, as well as live entertainment on Fridays and Saturdays. Come check us out and see what's brewing in Kansas! Cheers!

name: River City Brewing Company
description: The River City Brewing Company in Sacramento, California is a fusion of brewing expertise, culinary artistry, experienced & friendly staff and relaxing yet vibrant ambiance.    The beers brewed here are traditional and innovated. With over 22 different ales and lagers brewed throughout the year, you are assured of a great selection and a satisfied palate. Visit our "Beer Offerings" page to view the current quiver of ales and lagers.    The California cuisine at RCBC is extraordinary, but don't take our word for it, we will let you make up your own mind after you try our signature Eggplant Napoleon appetizer or the Asiago Garlic Crusted Chicken or any of our Wood Fired Pizzas!    The open and spacious architecture with 20' ceilings creates a lively and fun atmosphere, or you can enjoy a more quiet tone in our banquet room that seats up to 50 people. If you want to, you can perch your party on our mezzanine (holds up to 25 people) for a view of the whole restaurant.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thurs: 11:30 am - 9:30 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:30 am - 10:30 pm  Sun: 11:30 am - 8:30 pm

name: River Dog Brewing Company
description: Founded in 2012 by the Gray Family, River Dog Brewing has managed to make a splash in the rising tide of the Southern craft beer scene. Under the direction of Brewmaster Dan Baker, we’ve created an exceptional menu of beers, from Belgian ales to sours to one of the largest barrel aging programs in the South.  When you visit the South Carolina Lowcountry, you know that it’s more than just a place. It’s a way of life. Incredible people. Amazing food. Exceptional beer – brewed in Bluffton.

name: River Horse Brewing Company
description: You don't have to be in a dead end job to feel like you aren't going anywhere.  That's the way we felt before River Horse.  We were finance geeks living in a world without soul.  Grinding it out everyday for a fee, wearing suits and kissing butt.    Then this brewery chose us...she forced us to ask ourselves, "Is this desk job really how I pictured my life?"  We answered that questions by taking over River Horse in 2007 and have not looked back.  We may not end up as the greatest success story on earth, but at least we had the balls to try.  Sometimes, for better or worse, your dreams get the best of you.    Just remember, it's a big world out there and cubicles don't have doors, so you can walk out anytime.  Come see us when you can.  We are located in Lambertville, NJ on the banks of the Delaware.  Thanks for supporting the cause.  Hope you enjoy the beer...
hoursOfOperation: Friday through Sunday, 12-5

name: River House BrewPub
description: Located along the banks of the beautiful Susquehanna River just across the river from Lewisburg, PA. Stop by and relax with a pint of one of our award-winning local brews and a plate full of delectable authentic Italian cuisine.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Thu: 4:00 pm	-	10:00 pm  Fri:	4:00 pm	-	11:00 pm  Sat:	11:00 am	-	11:00 pm  Sun:	11:00 am	-	9:00 pm

name: River North Brewery
description: River North Brewery is located just north of downtown Denver at 24th and Blake St in the ballpark neighborhood, at the southern tip of the up-and-coming River North Art District (RiNO for short). We focus on brewing Belgian-style ales and American style ales with a Belgian twist, but the truth of it is that we just brew the kind of beer we like to drink!    The brewery was founded by Matt Hess (with a lot of help from his wife Jess). Matt is a former engineer who now spends his time engineering the latest recipes for River North.
hoursOfOperation: Mon/Tues   3-9pm  Wed/Thurs   3-9pm  Friday   3-10pm  Saturday    1-10pm  Sunday    1-7pm

name: River Rat Brewery
description: Quality crafted beer for good hard working people. Don't float alone, bring a River Rat to the party...Mission subjected to change at any bend in the river...

name: River Time Brewing
description: Welcome to River Time Brewing!     We are a small-batch brewery located in wonderful Darrington, WA on the bank of the majestic Sauk river.    Our objective is to provide a family-friendly atmosphere with fantastic beers, complementing the wonderful outdoor lifestyle that is Darrington and our Baker National Forest.
hoursOfOperation: The River Time brewery is open Saturday and Sunday from 12:00-Whenever. If you see us there and the Open sign isn't up, stop by and we'll be happy to serve you a tasty beer!    If you are planning on staying a while, bring some food. We are happy to fire up a grill for you!

name: River's Edge Brewing Co.
description: River's Edge is Milford, Michigan's, microbrewery and gathering place! We're located in a distinctive building on the Huron River and across from downtown's Central Park. We'll be providing several delicious craft beers on tap, as well as cask-conditioned ales, and a selection of our house-made wine! Come on in and pull up a chair at our bar or a seat on our patio overlooking the park and river. We're looking forward to seeing you!

name: Riverport Brewing Company
description: Riverport Brewing Company will put the flavor back in your beer. Even though your first experience with beer probably wasn't as pleasurable as the hype made it sound—you persevered and learned to enjoy it anyway. The American beer industry has spent years and countless dollars on advertising trying to persuade us how our beer should taste. Now we invite you to find out what beer was meant to taste like. Using only the finest grains, hops, and water we are sure that once you’ve tasted our fresh craft beer you’ll discover beer all over again!    Riverport Brewing Company is nestled beneath the grain-rich rolling hills of the Palouse in Clarkston, Washington, near the confluence of Idaho's Clearwater River and the mighty Snake River.

name: Rivers Effortless Dining
description: (No longer brewing)

name: Rivertowne Brewing
description: If you have not been in to visit us yet, we look forward to meeting you. Otherwise, we appreciate having you as a patron. For those of you who didn't know, we have 4 exciting locations. Experience dining in or spend an evening with us enjoying your favorite hard-to-find beer.    Our Mission is to build genuine relationships with our guests, and to make a positive impact on the community. We further desire to offer excellent service, great beer and food made with TLC to our guests.

name: Riverwalk Brewing
description: We are a microbrewery located in Newburyport, MA dedicated to producing unique rustic beers. All of our beers are unfiltered, unpasteurized and bottle-conditioned to maintain the fullest flavor possible.
hoursOfOperation: Fri: 3:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 4:00 pm

name: RJ Rockers Brewing Company
description: RJ Rockers Brewing Company became Spartanburg's first brewery in 1997, when owner and brewer Mark Johnsen set out on a mission to provide the people of the Upstate with the best microbrewed beer they had ever tasted. Mark, a New Jersey native, had loved brewing beer for his friends and family for years.    Following his service in the 1991 Gulf War, Mark was stationed in Germany as a member of the United States armed forces, and he took this opportunity to learn as much as possible about brewing from the experts. By the time he was honorably discharged from the service, he was ready to take his beer to the public.
hoursOfOperation: Tours & Tastings are every Thursday between 5pm and 7pm with tour offerings every half hour.

name: Roadhouse Brewing Company
description: Located in historic Jackson Hole, Wyoming, The Roadhouse Brewing Co. brews beer as bold as the Tetons. Our brewers started out as homebrewers and we remain true to our roots. We’re passionate about our beer, the brewing process, history and culture and embrace the many flavors and styles from around the world that define the craft beer family. The same thirst for adventure and exploration that brought us to the Tetons resides in every batch we brew. Beer by beer we strive to cultivate and enhance the local craft beer experience in Jackson Hole and our neighboring communities. Beer to the people.

name: Roanoke Railhouse Brewing Company
description: "When it comes to making great beer, Roanoke Railhouse has a 1 track mind."      Anyone can brew beer. Brewing great beer, however, requires science and technology and we have what it takes.    Our brewmaster, Ryan Worthington has an International Diploma in Brewing Technology. He is a graduate of the World Brewing Academy/Siebel Institute of Technology in Chicago and the   Doemens Academy in Grafelfing, Germany    Our optimized, custom built brewhouse gives our Brewmaster the right tools to brew great beer. This combination of talent and tools is our recipe for success.

name: Roaring Fork Beer Company
description: Roaring Fork Beer Company was launched in 2013 by Chase Engel, a long time professional brewer with a dream of producing creative beers to match the changing seasons. From our home base in Carbondale, Colorado we brew and package exceptional beers for distribution throughout the Roaring Fork Valley. We are dedicated to producing fresh, approachable, and flavorful beers, while continuing to push the envelope with experimentation and barrel aging on a small batch scale.     Tasting Room Open M-Sat 2p-8p with brewery tours by appt.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  2:00pm - 8:00pm Tue:  2:00pm - 8:00pm Wed:  2:00pm - 8:00pm Thu:  2:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  2:00pm - 8:00pm Sat:  2:00pm - 8:00pm

name: Roc Brewing Company
description: When Roc Brewing Co. began in the crisp cellaring walls of a suburban Rochester basement, they never imaged the future that was set forward. The ever infectious brewing bug had bitten both homebrewers Jonathan Mervine and Chris Spinelli. From the time the yeast was pitched it was unanimous this was their future. Joined by the emboldened encouragement of Chris’ mom and third partner Patty Spinelli, she was hooked by first sip. The new family began their many trials and tribulations of brewing, three tier law, legalese and to much to their chagrin ROC Brewing Co. was founded.
hoursOfOperation: Brewery Production  Monday – Saturday: 8am – 4pm    Tasting Room/Tap Room  Thursday – Friday: 5pm – 11pm  Saturday: 3pm – 11pm

name: Rochester Mills Beer Company
description: The Rochester Mills Beer Co. opened in 1998 in Downtown Rochester. Located in the historic Western Knitting Mill, the brewery is located on Water Street, just two blocks east of Main Street. Preserving the original character of the building, the brewery features original hardwood floors, columns, beams and exposed brick walls. The menu features a broad selection of eclectic American cuisine, all prepared with the freshest ingredients. From delectable appetizers, fresh salads, pizzas and pastas to delicious entrees and unique sandwiches, the menu has something for everyone and a kids menu is available. Special amenities include an outdoor patio, pool tables,  Greenhorn Music Night every Thursday starting at 9pm, and live entertainment every Friday, and Saturday nights starting at 10pm. The Martini Lounge is available for private parties.
hoursOfOperation: Monday:	11:30am-12:00am  Tuesday:	11:30am-12:00am  Wednesday:	11:30am-12:00am  Thursday:	11:30am-1:00am  Friday:	11:30am-2:00am  Saturday:	11:30am-2:00am  Sunday:	12:00pm-12:00am

name: Rock & Run Brewery
description: We are a local brewpub making making hand crafted beers and wood-oven fired pizzas in the Northland. We anticipate being in operation by the end of the summer, 2013.

name: Rock Art Brewery
description: Matt began the brewery in the basement of our home in 1997. Wow! I can't believe I let him do that! His first beer was Whitetail Ale. A nice crisp refreshing golden ale. I was really enjoying wheat beers at the time. I guess that's why I let him start Rock Art! The Brewery was ready to leave home and move to it's own place down the road in Morrisville, VT in 2001. We are still located there and now have a terrific space for people to come and visit. Come on by and say hello!    Our Mission is to offer our friends and family a wonderful beer at the end of the day!
hoursOfOperation: 9:00 until 6:00 Monday-Saturday    TOURS: We have a wonderful viewing area upstairs and are happy to bring people up for a tour at 2:00 & 4:00 daily with a special tour at 11:00 a.m. on Saturday.     TASTINGS DAILY until 5:30

name: Charlotte
description: Our brewers eat, drink and sleep beer. They’re equal parts scientist, artist and beer geek. So, while every Rock Bottom brewer is passionate about their craft, they also put their own signature into every beer.    In other words, there is a unique beer menu at every Rock Bottom in addition to our core line up of consistent flavor profiles that you can expect at any Rock Bottom you visit nationwide.    But, you’re thirsty and want to know what beers you can expect down here, right?
hoursOfOperation: Sun: 11:00 AM - 11:00 PM  Mon-Sat: 11:00 AM - 2:00  AM

name: Rock Bridge Brewing Company
description: We are a small production brewery in Columbia, Missouri focusing on brewing both classic and new styles.  We are currently only available in Mid-Missouri on draught but are expanding and will be adding a canning line in the fall of 2013.  Check out our facebook and Twitter pages for the latest news and updates on our new brewery.
hoursOfOperation: Tuesdays-4-6  Saturdays-2-4  By appointment only rest of the week.

name: Rock Creek Brewing Company
description: Formerly Pale Ale Brewing - segued into Chesapeake Bay Brewing in 2001.

name: Rockaway Brewing Company
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Fri:	4:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat:	11:00 am - 4:00 pm

name: Rocket Republic Brewing Company
description: Making beer in Huntsville, Alabama! The Rocket City!    We are receiving some help from our friends at Blue Pants Brewing Brewery and will be contract brewing to start. We intend to move to full production soon thereafter!

name: Rockford Brewing Company
description: 200 Prairie Street  Rockford, IL 61107

name: Rockford Brewing Company
description: RBC produces world class beers using traditional and innovative brewing techniques and ingredients. As a company, we strive to create unique beers with influences from countries around the world including the United States, Belgium, Germany, the United Kingdom, and the newest emerging craft beer location that has the world watching; Michigan. Part of our niche is working closely with West Michigan farmers and local ingredients on a seasonal basis. We love to incorporate West Michigan agricultural products into our offerings!
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Sat 11am-11pm  Sun 11am-9pm

name: Rockslide Brewing Co
description: When you need a burger and a beer, you better get to the Rockslide brewpub in downtown Grand Junction, Colorado. We’ve got handcrafted brews that keep our loyal local crowd coming back for more, and a menu for comfort food fans.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Tue: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Wed - Sat: 11:00 am - 2:00 am  Sun: 9:00 am - 12:00 am

name: Rocky Mountain Brewery
description: Good local brewery that is only interested in creating great beers.  The whole team here is a solid group who enjoy the different flavors available.  They are best known for their award winning cherry beer - Da Yoopers.  Prices are cheap and the beer is good!    This place embodies the true nature of home brewing by encouraging its staff to design and brew their own beer to sell.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:	5:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Tue - Wed:	12:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Thu - Sat:	11:00 am - 11:00 pm

name: Rocky Point Artisan Ales
description: Brewing artisanal lagers and ales in Rocky Point, Long Island.

name: Rockyard Brewing Company
description: Douglas County, Colorado's oldest, and Castle Rock's onliest Brew Pub. Serving up American Grill and Crafted Beer since 1999.

name: Rogness Brewing Company
description: Rogness Brewing Company specializes in creating small, handcrafted batches of beer. As decade long owners of a successful homebrew supply shop in Austin, TX, Forrest and Diane Rogness have experimented with many special hops and exotic ingredients. They are ready to share some of their more unique recipes with the world. Look for Rogness beers on draught, in cans, and bottles this Spring.  Forrest and Diane have been married for 13 years and have a 7 year old daughter named Anna. Forrest started brewing in 1990 and purchased Austin Homebrew Supply in 1999. He holds a degree in Photography.  Diane is originally from Iceland. She met Forrest at the University of Iowa and holds a degree in Art History.  The rest of the team is Dan Wheeler, David Heath, David Ebel, Mark Tovar, Tony Bailey, and Daron White. Including Forrest, they have over 65 years of brewing experience.

name: Rogue Ales
description: Rogue Ales was founded in 1988 by Jack Joyce, Rob Strasser and Bob Woodell, three corporate types who wanted to go into the food/beverage industry. Rogue's first brewpub was located in Ashland, Oregon and was a 10bbl brewsystem. Rogue opened a second brewpub, 15bbl brewsystem, in May 1989 located in Newport, Oregon. Rogue closed its Ashland operation in 1997, after the great flood destroyed the place. In 1991, the 15bbl system, named Howard after John Maier's former boss, from the Newport brewpub was transferred across the bay to the current brewery and upgraded to a 30bbl system. In 1998 Rogue bought a 50bbl brewsystem, named Kobe. Kobe is the only brewsystem in use. Tours: We offer brewery tours every day at 3 pm (followed by a distillery tour at 4pm). Go up to the bar inside the brewery (Brewers on the Bay) and check in with the bartender and the tour will commence. Please call ahead if you have a large group and or to verify the tour time...Brewer's on the Bay phone is 541-867-3664. The view from Brewers on the Bay includes the marina (outside), and the bottling line and brew kettles (inside).

name: Rogues' Harbor Brewing Company
description: Locally Sourced Globally Inspired Cuisine, Our Own Craft Brewed Ales & Elegant Lodging in an 1830s National Landmark Inn
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 5:00 pm - 12:00 am  Fri - Sat: 4:00 pm - 1:00 am  Sun: 4:00 pm - 12:00 am

name: Rohrbach Brewing Company
description: The Rohrbach Brewing Company has been brewing handcrafted ales and lagers in Rochester for over a decade! Loyal Rohrbach customers from near and far continue to prove that there is a market for premium high quality lagers and ales.    All of our ales and lagers are made with only the finest ingredients available worldwide; two-row malted barley from Belgium and the freshest hops from Europe and the Pacific Northwest . Our lagers and ales are delivered cold and fresh, with no artificial preservatives or flavor deteriorating pasteurization, which insures that your customers enjoy them at their peak freshness.

name: Rök House Brewing Company
description: Created by Co-Owners Lars Bennett, Brandy Friday, Mark Heffernan, and Sue Heffernan, Rök House Brewing Company is pleased to be finally serving you, our loyal Rökmeisters, the craftiest brews we can muster!
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  2:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  1:00pm - 9:00pm Sun:  1:00pm - 6:00pm

name: Rolling Meadows Microbrewery
description: Rolling Meadows Brewery began as an appreciation of good beer and a desire to create a fine product utilizing the abundance of natural resources on our family farm. When Caren Trudeau and her son, Chris Trudeau established the brewery in 2011, they drew upon their combined experiences of homebrewing, craftsmanship and design detail to create the Rolling Meadows brand. Together with Connie and Dustin Regan they have been crafting Rolling Meadows' signature beers- Lincoln's Lager, Springfield Wheat and Abe's Ale- and bringing them to the Springfield area.

name: Brewery
description: Rooftop handcrafts its beers in small batches under the close personal attention of our brewers. Our highest priority is brewing high quality and consistent craft beer, with an eye towards innovative and unique beer recipes.
hoursOfOperation: Thursday - 5pm to 9pm  Friday - 5pm to 10pm

name: Roosevelt Brewing Company
description: Roosevelt Brewing Company and Public House is eastern New Mexico's premier craft brewery. We specialize in craft ales and lagers, served up alongside delicious wood-fired cuisine. There's something for everyone at Roosevelt Brewing Company.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: Rooster Brew
description: Paris Kentucky's FIRST Micro Brewery located in the heart of the downtown business district in an restored 1880 Main Street Mercantile Store Front.

name: Rooster Fish Brewing
description: Roosterfish Brewing’s history begins in 1990 when the Wildflower Café was founded by owner Doug Thayer.  A microbrewery was in the original plans for the business but was not feasible at the time due to the high cost of equipment and space.  The Wildflower Café had enormous success, which helped the inspiration for the Crooked Rooster Brewpub’s opening in 1998, again founded by Doug Thayer.  Throughout the running of these side-by-side businesses, Doug always had brewing on his mind and began to experiment in 2002 with home brewing.  Receiving excellent feedback on his brews from several beer aficionados, Roosterfish Brewing’s first official beer, Black Walnut Nut Brown Ale (now known as Original Nut Brown Ale) was unveiled at the Crooked Rooster and Wildflower Café in 2004.  This was shortly followed with the Butternut Pale Ale, now known as Dog Tooth Pale Ale.  The drastic name changes occurred because the originals were rejected due to “implied ingredients” that weren’t actually present in the beers.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:30 am - 12:30 am

name: Layton
description: Opened in 1994, Kym and Pete Buttschardt opened the first Roosters Brewing Company on Historic 25th Street in Downtown Ogden. Roosters in Layton opened in 2005.

name: Roscoe Beer Company
description: Roscoe, New York; also known as Trout Town USA is internationally recognized as one of the best outdoors town in the world. It has received awards and honors from numerous publications including World Fishing Networks, Ultimate Fishing Town in 2011.    The people that make up the Roscoe Beer Company are folks that enjoy the great outdoors, embrace their community and value all the great things our great country has to offer. We are business owners, mothers, fathers, fishermen, Hunters, bikers, horsemen, educators and hikers. We work hard, play hard and absolutely enjoy a great beer when the time is right! We all have very strong ties to Roscoe and believe that a town as all American as ours deserves a beer of its very own!

name: Roscoe's Hop House
description: Harkening back to old world brewing styles, Roscoe’s Hop House uses the highest quality malts and hops to bring forth this smooth, bright-flavored Amber Ale. With a nod to the past, this nicely balanced, true ale is brewed using traditional brewing methods for a unique flavor profile.  The password to our best kept secret is found inside the bottle.  This is brewed by Genesee Brewing Co.

name: Roseville Brewing Company
description: We are a beer production facility with a tap room. You can purchase beer by the pint or take a growler home. Also, coming soon you will be able to pick up a keg for special occasions.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  5:00pm - 8:00pm Tue:  5:00pm - 8:00pm Wed:  5:00pm - 8:00pm Thu:  5:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  5:00pm - 8:00pm Sat:  2:00pm - 6:00pm

name: Roslyn Brewing Company
description: The Roslyn Brewing Company has been brewing hand-crafted and full-flavored beers in the old world tradition since 1990. Our beers are excellent, full-bodied, German-style lagers reminiscent of those brewed by the immigrant miners in our hometown of Roslyn, Washington at the turn of the century. We use only the finest ingredients, including malted barley grown in the Northwest, hops grown in the Yakima Valley, and ice cold snow-fed water from the heart of the Cascades, to produce a full-bodied brew with a flavor that some say has been missing in domestic beers since the enactment of Prohibition.  Our goal is to continue Roslyn's tradition of brewing excellence and bring it to beer lovers everywhere. Try one of our signature lagers today in our taproom or at your local watering hole. We think you will agree that you can taste the tradition of quality.
hoursOfOperation: Thursday, 1:00 PM - 6:00 PM, Friday and Saturday, 12:00 Noon - 8:00 PM, and on Sunday from 12:00 Noon until 5:00 PM .

name: Roth Brewing Company
description: Founded in December of 2008, this company has been working hard to develop beers that can take the world by storm. Before there was a Roth Brewing Company, the guys started as most new breweries do, with homebrewing. After hearing endless rave reviews of their beers, they decided to jump in head first and open this amazing company. It might be said that prophecies were fulfilled on the day that they took up brewing, but only time shall tell..
hoursOfOperation: 4pm - 10pm Tuesday through Saturday, 1pm - 5pm Sunday

name: Rough Draft Brewing Company
description: We like beer. And word on the street is you do too. So you’ve been petitioning with your boss for beer breaks instead of smoke breaks, and trying to get a tap handle installed in the lunch room. There’s nothing wrong with that. That’s thinking outside the box right?     Here at Rough Draft, we like to reward that forward thinking with handcrafted beers that are as unique in character as those who drink it. We favor style over perfection and take joy in sharing our great-tasting creations with those who simply love to try new beer.     The beers that prove to be winners in our tasting room will be the ones we put into distribution.
hoursOfOperation: Wed:  3:00pm - 7:00pm Thu:  3:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  3:00pm - 8:00pm Sat:  1:00pm - 6:00pm Sun:  1:00pm - 4:00pm

name: Round Guys Brewing Company
description: Round Guys Brewing Company, located in Lansdale, PA, developed from the ghastly mind of chief Round Guy and head brewer, Scott Rudich. Looking for a quick exit out of the treacherous confines of the corporate world, Round Guys Brewing Company jumped onto the scene in late 2011, early 2012 and hasn't looked back.     In 2013, Round Guys Brewing Company made waves by brewing up a now renowned BerlinerWeiss (Featured in Draft Magazine 10/13 and scored a 91. Featured on Brewers Network). In 2014, Round Guys Brewing Company received city wide recognition for placing a top 3 beer in the Philadelphia region's Beervitational during Philly Beer Week with Fear of a Brett Planet, a 100% Brettanomyces fermented Pale Ale.     Other beers in its portfolio include Round Guys Brewing Company's goto Sundown Saison and the ever beloved Kiss Off IPA.     The brewery features a full menu on site, including 1 specialty cask beer along side four seasonal, monthly, and rare offerings.
hoursOfOperation: Monday: 5pm-Close  Wednesday: 5pm-Close  Thursday: 5pm – Close  Friday: 5pm – Close  Saturday: 12pm – Close  Sunday: 12pm – 8pm

name: Roundabout Brewery
description: Small small brewery focused on quality craft beer. Growler sales only at this time.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Fri: 4:30 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 1:00 pm

name: Routh Street Brewery and Grille
description: (No longer brewing)

name: Roy Pitz Brewing Company
description: Where we make the good stuff…  The building where the brewery is located was built in the early 1900?s. It is located on North Third Street within two blocks of the historic square and Franklin County Courthouse in Chambersburg. A three-story, industrial all-brick building consists of 20,000 sq. ft in total area. The brewery is currently located in the basement and is 5,500 sq. ft. of classic brick and old pine timber, which has been restored to its original look and texture.    The brewhouse that christens this humble abode traveled from Anchorage, Alaska. It is a 7 BBL JV Northwest Electric System and is paired with three 20 BBL fermenting tanks allowing Roy Pitz to brew twice a day. At this point, the brewery can brew up to 180 kegs per month at maximum capacity.
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Fri 4 pm - 8 pm  Sat 1 pm - 5 pm

name: Royal Oak Brewery
description: The Royal Oak Brewery opened in 1995 in trendy downtown Royal Oak, Michigan. Located one block east of Main Street, it has become an area institution. The comfortable atmosphere and hometown feel make it a destination for locals and visitors alike. The brewery serves 6-7 fresh beers on tap daily.    The Royal Oak Brewery brews our award winning ales and lagers on a 14 Barrel Specific Mechanical system. The brewing system was custom fabricated to fit precisely behind our large bar where our guests can interact with our brewer, Tim Selewski, and enjoy a pint at the same time. With the design of our brewhouse and our state-of-the-art beer delivery system, the Royal Oak Brewery can offer up to 7 house beers on tap at any time. To continue to produce the best possible product, we use only the 4 basic ingredients in our beer: water, malt, hops and yeast. We purchase the highest quality ingredients from around the world to produce the freshest and finest beers available in Oakland County. For more information about our brewery or to setup a tour, please contact our brewmaster, Tim, at the Royal Oak Brewery.

name: Rubicon Brewing Company
description: For 22 years, the Rubicon Brewing Company has been a jewel of a capital city culture. It’s not just because of the award-winning fine ales and great food served up by the Rubicon. Within the past four years, under the auspices of owner Glynn Phillips, the Rubicon has become renowned for its community outreach and philanthropic efforts. It’s support for Sacramento kids and various people in need that has transformed the Rubicon into a vital cog of Sacramento life.    “This pub is part of the community, and I don’t just mean geographically,” said Glynn Phillips, owner of the Rubicon since June 2005. “It’s important for us to give back as much as we can to show our appreciation. I really feel like we’re connected with the people and that they can trust that they’ll feel at home here.”    Brewmaster Scott Cramlet has felt so at home that he’s stayed more than two decades. In October 2006, he experienced a thrill very few craft brewers achieve in their careers: stepping on stage to receive a gold medal at the Great American Beer Festival. Cramlet won for his Winter Wheatwine, and followed that achievement with a silver GABF medal in 2009. In the craft brewing industry, consistent victories in the respected blind-panel tasting contest bring international acclaim.    “We’ve gone through so many different phases during my time here, but we’re very happy with things right now,” he said. “There is a lot of hope for future and expanding our business. We hope to double our capacity and get more of our products in bottles and more of a market presence -- not too huge but bigger than we are now. I’m certainly very proud to work for a place that has been around so long and has its place in history. We are not the new kid on street. I tell people how long I’ve been at the Rubicon, and I hear people say, ‘Wow, that’s impressive.’”    In some ways, the transition from founder Ed Brown to Phillips was more than a decade in the making. Brown had known Phillips since the 1970s as the good friend of Brown’s nephews in the Bay Area town of Moraga. As Phillips paid his dues in the craft brewing industry – first at Great Basin Brewing in Sparks, Nev., and next at Marin Brewing in Larkspur – Phillips kept in close contact with Brown. Buoyed by his management experience at Marin Brewing, Phillips was confident that he could handle the passing of the baton at the Rubicon.
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Thrusday: 11am to 11:30pm  Friday & Saturday: 11am to 12:30am  Sunday: 11am to 10pm

name: Ruckus Brewing Company
description: Ruckus Brewing Company brews products of exceptional quality, re-invigorates brands of historical significance, and services a growing craft brew market with products that satisfy the most discerning pallets."    With Ruckus Brewing you’ll find a commitment to produce high-quality, full-flavored beer by applying both European and American brewing processes. Our line of ales, lagers, and IPAs contain a unique blend of whole flower hops, Belgian grains, selects malts, and the finest spices to satisfy the taste buds of even the most inexperienced beer drinkers.

name: Ruddy Duck Brewery and Grill
description: Our philosophy is simple:  Create a fun and exciting atmosphere  Serve authentic made from scratch food  Provide gracious and hospitable service  Deliver it all at a great value    To guarantee excellence we buy the highest quality ingredients and prepare them to bring out the best flavors in every dish. Our chicken wings are cooked fresh daily to ensure our signature taste. Fresh and never frozen chicken breast, pork, mahi and salmon are delivered daily.    We buy only grass fed "all natural" steaks and hamburgers to ensure the highest quality. We support local farmers by purchasing our seafood and produce locally whenever available. Our desserts, pizza dough, and house specialty "Chipas" are made daily from scratch as are all our sauces, dressings and soups.    We promote friendly, unobtrusive service delivered with a smile. Most important to us is you, our guests. We strive to be a neighborhood restaurant where families with children, professionals on business, or couples out on a date can all feel welcome and comfortable.

name: Ruhlman Brewery
description: Craft brewery focused on ales.

name: Rumspringa Brewing Company
description: Set between Intercourse and Bird-in-Hand, PA, and located on the second floor of the Lancaster Beer & Wine Gallery, Rumspringa Brewing Company offers the best in craft-brewed beers in the heart of Lancaster County. The area’s first nano-brewery produces tastes to satisfy everyone from a citrusy IPA to a robust Stout.     Rumspringa offers the best in craft-brewed beers in the heart of Lancaster County. Located on the 2nd floor of the newly remodeled Lancaster Beer & Wine Gallery, there’s a taste to satisfy everyone from a citrusy IPA to a robust Stout. Visit the Barn Cafe for all your favorite Rumspringa beers on tap, plus Mount Hope Wine flights and delicous Lancaster County favorites.    Sow your wild oats at Rumspringa Brewing Company in Intercourse, PA!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat:	10:00 am	-	5:00 pm  Sun:	11:00 am	-	5:00 pm

name: Rupert's Brew House
description: "Where Good Friends Meet" located in the historic Oakland Pharmacy in Kalamazoo, MI    We're a small boutique brewery featuring over 8 hand-crafted beers on tap. We're unique by offering live entertainment 6 nights a week and never a cover. BYOF (Bring Your Own Food) or order in for delivery by one of the many local food joints.    Experience the down home, relaxed atmosphere where the beer pours freely and there's never a cover. Make sure you visit Captn Stooby our mascot.
hoursOfOperation: 2 pm - 2 am

name: Rush River Brewing
description: Rush River Brewing Company  in River Falls, WI provides locally brewed ales throughout Wisconsin and Minnesota. Owner/Brewers Nick Anderson and Dan Chang started the company in 2004 with the help of a third partner, Robbie Stair after relocating to Minneapolis from Seattle. Robbie owned a farm in scenic Maiden Rock, WI just above the confluence of the Rush River and Lake Pepin. After converting a pole barn into a fully functioning brewery, the trio produced a limited quantity of draft-only beers while steadily building a reputation  for brewing high quality ales. After two and a half years of growth, it became evident that bottled beer was the next move to be made. Luckily, the town of River Falls, WI came to the table with an offer to build a custom building for a brand new brewery. In 2007, the new facility opened its doors with the addition of a refurbished bottling line, and additional fermenters. The new Rush River brewery was now poised to increase production and distributorship. We now have ten distributors in two states and produce nine brands including seasonals. Our small size still allows us to experiment with new styles, while the larger capacity for brewing and storage keep our regular brands flowing out the door.

name: Rushing Duck Brewing Company
description: Rushing Duck brewing Co. is a small craft brewery based out of Orange County, NY. Our plan is to produce a wide variety of tasty beers. Hoppy, malty, American-styled, Belgian influenced, barrel aged, sours, you name it. First and foremost we will be brewing beer that we like to drink. We hope you do too.

name: Russian River Brewing Company
description: In 1997, Russian River Brewing Company (RRBC) was founded by Korbel Champagne Cellars in Guerneville, California. Vinnie Cilurzo was hired as the Brewmaster. At the Great American Beer Festival in 1999, RRBC and Vinnie were awarded "Small Brewing Company of the Year" and "Small Brewing Company Brewmaster of the Year." In 2002, Korbel decided to leave the beer business and sold the brewery to Vinnie and his wife, Natalie. The brewery is now located in Santa Rosa, California    At Russian River Brewing Company we focus on traditional aggressively hopped California style ales, Belgian style ales, and barrel aged beers. We brew a full line up of ales and lagers for our pub and for limited distribution.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	11:00 am - 12:00 am  Fri - Sat:	11:00 am - 1:00 am  Sun:	11:00 am - 12:00 am

name: Rusted Mill Artisan Ales
description: Welcome to the first brewery in Gaston County. Respect Your Heritage.

name: Rustic Road Brewing Company
description: Kenosha's Oldest Brewery  Stepping in to Rustic Road Brewing Company is a unique experience, right in the heart of downtown Kenosha. We make our own beers right on site in small batches in the old Wisconsin artisan style. We pride ourselves in being unique enough to stand out, but unassuming enough to be enjoyable by everyone. We love great beer and love to share it with Kenosha!

name: Rusty Beaver Brewery
description: Well this story starts about twenty years ago when Me and the Mrs. were a just a little younger. See the city life didn’t do it, neighbor’s too close or just plain freedom of the country, Something got us seeking a different path? We moved out from the Capital city to our new Beaver dam address, 30 acres with an old barn and a pond near here is home and home is good. Wouldn’t trade it for another pond anywhere! Peaceful country living, it feeds the soul, drink some in as you spend a little time with us.     We got busy, raised the little ones up, built a business and worked hard on the old homestead remembering to be grateful each day for the life we have carved out. What a long strange trip it has been so far! We have learned ambition and hard work get you where you want to go, it just takes some time and a lot of patience!     Austin and I Started brewing several years ago, we loved cooking together and drinking too so it was a natural progression. Brewing and sharing with friends our fresh all grain brews became an obsession for us. Our passion is to brew great local beers by sourcing the finest quality ingredients available and creating craft recipes that highlight the best qualities of those ingredients. Please stop by our brewery to enjoy the freshest beer available. After you have tried one we hope you will agree,“You never forget your first Beaver”
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Thu: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Rusty Nickel Brewing Co.
description: Western New York's newest craft brewery specializing in hand crafted brews that are just a little different

name: Ruth McGowans Brewpub
description: The vision of Mary Ann and Mike Brigham – creating a neighborhood pub featuring hand-crafted beers brewed on site in gleaming copper tanks. The vision became a reality when the Brigham’s opened Ruth McGowan’s Brewpub in 2002. Since opening, Mary Ann and Mike remain hands-on owners    There are copper tanks which have become part of the Pub’s unique and cozy ambiance. Everyone who walks through the Pub doors is immediately made to feel at home by the friendly staff. The beers brewed on site have won many awards. All the elements of Mary Ann and Mike’s vision.    Brewmaster, Tim Gallagher, supplies the Pub with a selection of beer for any taste preference. Since Tim started brewing, he has created new popular beer recipes, production has more than doubled and their signature Cloverdale Ale has skyrocketed in popularity. CLOVER- DALE beer is now served on tap at several venues around the county, as well as sold in bottles at a number of retail outlets.    The Pub’s team (service staff, kitchen staff, Tim, Mary Ann and Mike) is dedicated to brewing the best hand-crafted beers, serving good food and keeping the atmosphere friendly.    Expansion is in the future to keep up with the demand for Ruth McGowan’s beer.

name: Sackets Harbor Brewing Company
description: Since 1995 Sackets Harbor Brewing Company operates one of New York State’s oldest continuing microbreweries featuring both a working brewery and dining establishment situated on the shore of Lake Ontario.

name: Saddlebock Brewery
description: Welcome to Saddlebock Brewery - the first production brewery in Northwest Arkansas. Since 2012, we've been brewing fine, European-style beers in an environmentally friendly facility. Saddlebock Brewery was named by Yahoo Travel as one of the coolest craft brewery tours in America, and Steve Rehbock, our founder, was recognized this year as an Arkansas Eco-Hero.
hoursOfOperation: Mon: 5:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Tue - Fri: 3:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sun: 1:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Sailfish Brewing Company, Inc.
description: The Sailfish Brewpub is located in downtown Ft. Pierce in the 'Edgartown' Neighborhood. It is on the west side of the street between AE Backus Ave & Ave D.     Stop by and sample our beers then stick around and enjoy a pint, or two…    The Brewpub is 21 and over only and please drink responsibly!
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Fri: 4:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Saint Archer Brewing Company
description: Saint Archer Brewing Company was founded on a unique strain of creative talent: World-class brewers. Artists and musicians. Surfers, skateboarders, and snowboarders…. All coming together with passion and commitment to express our collective true love — handcrafted beer. Saint Archer's been a long time in the tank and we hope you taste our appreciation and gratitude in every sip.

name: Saint Arnold Brewing Company
description: Saint Arnold Brewing Company, located in Houston, is Texas' Oldest Craft Brewery. Our goal is to brew world class beers and deliver them to our customers as fresh as possible making them the best beers in Texas and Louisiana. Our customers are beer lovers - people that appreciate great, full-flavored beers.    Our small crew does everything at the brewery: brew the beer, filter the beer, keg the beer, bottle the beer, sell the beer and drink the beer. For us, this is a passion, not a job. We believe that this comes through in the beers we make. Our beers have soul.    We brew several different beers; some are year round, some are seasonal and a few are single batch brews. They are available in bars, restaurants, grocery stores, liquor stores and warehouse stores throughout Texas and Louisiana.    Our first keg of beer was shipped on June 9, 1994. Founded by Brock Wagner and Kevin Bartol, we chose Houston because, other than living here, this was the largest city in the country that did not have a microbrewery. Brock was a longtime homebrewer and had considered opening a brewery as far back as college, although that was quickly dismissed as a silly idea. Seven years after graduating, Brock revisited the idea, enlisted Kevin's help and the brewery was off and running. Kevin has since left the business after a bitter battle. (Just kidding - but don't you wish people wrote that when it was the truth?).    Please visit us if you are in Houston. We have a public open house every weekday at 3:00 PM and every Saturday starting at 11:00 AM.    Cheers!

name: Saint Benjamin Brewing Co.
description: Saint Benjamin Brewing Company is a nano-brewery which is expected to open in Fishtown, Philadelphia in 2011. Look for our beer on tap at beer bars in Philly then.

name: Saint Patrick's Brewing Company
description: World-class Artisan Lagers
hoursOfOperation: Tuesday and Thursday 2-5pm

name: Saint Somewhere Brewing Company
description: Saint Somewhere is a small batch brewery, located in Tarpon Springs, Florida. We specialize in traditionally brewed, hand crafted Belgian Style Ales. Our first offerings are... Saison Athene , a bottle conditioned Saison with a spicy and moderately hoppy profile true to the traditions of the farmhouse ales of Wallonia. Lectio Divina,  brewed in the spirit of the abbey ales of Belgium. Brewed with the same care and attention to the Art of Brewing that is practiced in the monastic breweries of Belgium. Pays du Soleil, brewed with palmetto berries and hibiscus should be out this fall!

name: Salem Beer Works
description: When you're in the area for a visit or a resident of the NorthShore, Salem Beer Works is the spot to enjoy Bold American Food and Award Winning Beer. Along with the stellar service, warm inviting interior, seasonal patio and proximity to the Salem waterfront, Salem Beer Works will make your day or evening a memorable one.    Salem franchise of Boston Beer Works.

name: Salish Sea Brewing
description: Salish Sea Brewing Co. is focused on providing the best the region has to offer in fine hand-crafted ales and lagers.    Jeff and Erika are regular people with real dreams. Erika and Jeff were friends in early college years who found each other later, dated, got married, started a family, then asked each other, “What do you really want to do in life…(when you grow up)?”  They liked beer, liked making beer, liked having a good time, and liked sharing their likes with others.    Their first homebrew settings were humble: Jeff’s nose sticking deep into a carboy of fermenting beer in a friend's small apartment.
