They evolved from the stove top with extract batches, to setting up a small, all-grain batch brewery (8 gallon kettles - Thanksgiving turkey frying pots -  on propane burners with converted coolers for mash tuns) on the back porch,  to bigger and bigger goals.  From a 5 gallon pot on the stove (with a batch of extract syrup), to a 10 gallon converted cooler (with cracked grain), and kegs turned to kettles, to working on a 15 barrel brewery creating batches that go state to state, national, international...  They made batches at home for themselves, their friends, for weddings, parties, etc..  and realized this is what they wanted to do for a job.   Jeff apprenticed with a professional brewer (local celebrity Skip Madsen of Pike, Boundary Bay, American, etc…) and learned the pro angle of the trade.   They have seen the evolution, gone through it, appreciate it, and are happy to be where they are today.    Salish Sea Brewing Co. is a 10 bbl (310 gallon per batch) establishment.  We hope to brew twice a week, offering a variety of ales and the occasional lager and pilsner.     Jeff and Erika have a  6-year-old little girl and a 2-year-old son.  They are family oriented and hope for the brewery to be family approachable.   Families are welcome, but this is a brewery with a tasting room, not a playground (we do not cater to children).  Please respect our space and the space of others.  Minors must be accompanied by an adult.     Our roots are solid, our goals are lofty, but our dreams, aspirations, and hopes are high.  We want to create a place to showpiece our beers, invite your friends and families, and for you all to have a great time.    The Salish Sea Brewing Company is the real deal!    We have three 10bbl fermenters in place, the 10bbl bright tank, kettle, and mash up and running!  Please join us for a beer soon.
hoursOfOperation: Wed:  3:00pm - 10:00pm Thu:  3:00pm - 10:00pm Fri:  12:00pm - 11:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 11:00pm Sun:  12:00pm - 8:00pm  Closed on Mondays.

name: Salmon Creek Brewery & Pub
description: We are located in downtown Vancouver, WA. The brick building is covered with ivy and has an open patio where, in warm weather, you can relax and enjoy one of our many fine hand crafted brews. Salmon Creek Brewery has brewed exceptional handcrafted ales since 1994. Starting as a small brewery and distributor in Woodland, WA, Salmon Creek Brewery now continues to offer artistically handcrafted  beers of European inspiration with a personal touch given by our Master Brewer. Over the years, Salmon Creek has maintained its commitment to innovation, exceptional quality and customer service.
hoursOfOperation: Tuesday – Saturday: 3pm to 10pm

name: Salt Creek Brewery
description: Salt Creek Brewery in Bedford, Indiana is Lawrence County's first and only craft brewery. Located in a comfortable and uniquely converted service garage north of Bedford on East Trogdon Lane.    This state of the art brewery was once a popular service garage. The former "alignment pit" at Salt Creek Brewery now serves as what may be the only open pit brewery in the U.S.

name: Saltwater Brewery
description: Saltwater Brewery is more than a craft brewing company, it's a way of life. We are a team of native Floridians whose roots and values spur from a lifestyle that revolves around the Ocean.  This attachment and desire to maintain the world's greatest wonder, is what drove us to pursue a way to give back while continuing to refine our taste for our unique quality craft beers.

name: Sam Choy's Breakfast, Lunch, Crab & Big Aloha Brewery
San Diego Brewing
description: We are a multi-tap brew pub, pouring 8-10 house brews along with 40 guest brews.  We offer a pub style menu to accompany our great tap list.   We offer the NFL, MLB and NBA sports viewing with a multitude of large screen tv's.

name: San Luis Valley Brewing Co
description: The San Luis Valley Brewing Company began with a desire to offer the finest in craft brews and fine food in an inviting atmosphere -- a place where community thrives. Scott and Angie Graber create the brews on the premise, our culinary staff prepares wonderful food, and local designer Kris Gosar has created a setting where it is easy to savor both. The Brewery opened in March, 2006. We invite you to browse around our website and learn more about us.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 9:30 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: San Pedro Brewing Company
description: The San Pedro Brewing Company is owned and operated by James Brown. James opened the restaurant in November 1999, after four months of construction to expand the former John T's Tavern, which had been in operation from the early 1990's until its closure in 1998.    The restaurant features great food, fresh ales and lagers brewed on the premises, live entertainment weekly, the finest in spirits, a kids menu, catering and party facilities, and the friendliest staff in San Pedro! Please take some time to browse our web-site. Come visit us soon and let us know what you think!

name: Sanctum Brewing Company
description: The two founding members of this amazing endeavor began as homebrewers. They ate their barley, smelled their hops and eventually grew up to be big and strong! After winning a few awards and having accolades from just about every single person who ever drank their beer (they wish), they knew it was a calling and not just a hobby.   ?  Sanctum is the natural extension of the way Jason and Scott live their lives. Their value for community, giving back to those who need it and pursuing excellence in all their endeavors is reflected in Sanctum as a company. "Why can't we use beer to help the world?" has been a common thought throughout the building process. And that's why they have decided to consistently give a portion of proceeds to charity. Every pint. Every keg. Every brew . Now every Sanctum drinker can boldly proclaim they are the most generous beer drinkers in the world!  ?  Sanctum exists to be a light in the dreary world. To look mediocrity in the eye and say "no sir, I don't like it!" To push the limits of what being a craft brewery means, and to look spiffy doing it!
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  4:00pm - 9:30pm Fri:  4:00pm - 9:30pm Sat:  2:00pm - 9:30pm

name: Sand Creek Brewing Company
description: The Sand Creek Brewing Company began on a dairy farm in Downing, Wisconsin, about 20 miles northwest of the city of Menomonie. After homebrewing on the family farm for years, brewmaster Cory Schroeder teamed up with Jim Wiesender to found the brewery in 1999.    Using equipment scrounged from various industries, such as a converted pudding tank for the brew kettle, the pair launched a successful business, brewing the beer just steps away from the chicken coop and a busy dairy farm.    Their Sand Creek Golden Ale and English Style Special Ale, available only on draft and in half-gallon growlers, soon developed a reputation throughout Wisconsin's many brew fests. With a capacity of only about 150 barrels per year, the brewery, now with a third owner on board, quickly outgrew the little farm shed converted into a brewhouse.    Hoping to remain in the Dunn/St. Croix counties area, the company looked for a suitable place to relocate, but came up empty handed. Then opportunity knocked in the form of a phone call one evening from their friend in Black River Falls, Pioneer brewmaster Todd Krueger. The brewery was for sale.    In March of 2004 the combined forces of the two breweries officially formed the new Sand Creek Brewing Co. of Black River Falls, Wisconsin.

name: Sanitas Brewing
description: Founded in 2013, Boulder’s Sanitas Brewing Company is regarded for their signature blend of tradition and innovation as well as their use of only the finest ingredients. With a passion for exploration, Sanitas epitomizes the wild spirit of Colorado with a variety of premium beers.
hoursOfOperation: TUES thru FRI 3PM-10PM  SAT NOON-10PM  SUN NOON-8PM  CLOSED MONDAYS

name: Santa Clara Valley Brewing
description: Santa Clara Valley Brewing is a brewery in San Jose, CA.  Currently brewing under contract, we will be building our brewery early in 2014.

name: Santa Cruz Aleworks
description: Located in beautiful Santa Cruz, Santa Cruz Aleworks makes some of the BEST beer.

name: Santa Fe Brewing Company
description: The Santa Fe Brewing Company is a small operation with just a handful of friendly employees. Next time you are in the neighborhood, stop by, grab a cold one and say hello.    We are located in sunny Santa Fe, New Mexico right at the "top of the Turquoise Trail."

name: Eldorado Taphouse
hoursOfOperation: Open 7 days a week. Monday - Friday, 3:00pm - 10:00pm, Saturdays 2:00pm - 10:00pm, and on Sundays 2:00pm - 9:00pm

name: SanTan Brewing Company
description: In 2007, the historic Valley National Bank, in Downtown Chandler was transformed into a destination for Craft Beer and food lovers alike with the opening of SanTan Brewing Company. Our goal at the brewpub is to provide a neighborhood spot where family, friends, and colleagues can gather and enjoy a cold pint of freshly brewed beer using only the finest malts, hops, and barley!    In addition to our core beers on draught year round, Brewmaster Anthony Canecchia keeps things exciting for SanTan fans by releasing specialty seasonal beers, small batch specialty beers, a weekly Cask Conditioned Ale as well as guest beers from brewers both local and around the nation. Like the Brewmaster says “Craft Beer for Beer Drinking”.

name: Sante Adairius Rustic Ales
description: Sante Adairius Rustic Ales is a small, but daring, brewery located in the coastal city of Capitola, CA, just south of Santa Cruz.    Sante Adairius is a brewery founded on respect for quality and authenticity. We focus our attention on producing well-constructed beers with an eye towards simplicity and character. SARA takes liberty in emulating those memorable beers, their brewers, and the experiences they foster, never forgetting those giants on whose shoulders we stand.    Our approach to beer making is one of whimsy, highly inspired by the Belgian tradition, but also in harmony with brewers all over the world who push against boundaries of style with a nudge, not a shove. Often our beers are barrel-aged, usually in wine barrels, with various yeast and bacteria. As often as not though, Sante Adairius brews beers more approachable and traditional in nature, yet no less flavorful or distinctive.    Owned and operated by us, Adair Paterno and Tim Clifford, Sante Adairius Rustic Ales is our attempt to bring people together over great beer. SARA is an expression of our many years of beer geekery, the rabbit hole of tasting every beer we could get our hands on, and trusting we could contribute to the canon of those beers of the highest esteem. We believe great beer comes first. We stay true to our brewing roots. We take seriously the fact that we are brewing for you, and for ourselves. We appreciate your interest in our efforts. Sante!

name: Sapphire Mountain Brewing Co
description: Our original location at Sapphire National Golf Club offers over 80 Micros, Imports/Belgiums and Domestic beers, wines and our Award-Winning piping hot Wood-Fired Pizza cooked in our very Rustic Mountain setting. Our scenic views of mountains, lakes are the best in the area! We offer a full menu including rustic pub and casual food, chef specials, daily specials while enjoying our many TVs throughout our restaurant. We have Live Music on select nights and many theme events.

name: Sasquatch Brewery
description: A comfortable neighborhood brewpub with a focus on classic NW handcrafted ales and quality food.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 3:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sun: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Satulah Mountain Brewing Company
description: First brewery in Macon County.
hoursOfOperation: Tue:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Wed:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Thu:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  4:00pm - 12:00am Sat:  2:00pm - 12:00am Sun:  2:00pm - 10:00pm

name: Saucony Creek Brewing Co.
description: Saucony Creek Brewing Company is a forward-thinking craft brewery proudly fashioning hyper-local beers from farm to pint in an effort to keep glass-clinking camaraderie alive and well. We’ve recognized that a truly spectacular beer possesses the power to erase all boundaries and unify individuals no matter what their differences may be.    In an industry where newbies continue to emerge and strive for originality, Saucony Creek Brewing Company is destined to break the mold with authentic, small-batch creations accented by an open-minded, “say we won’t” type of attitude. Despite our tiny town presence, there’s a world of passion and experience dripping from each Saucony sip.    It was a professional X Games and action sports career that sent a younger version of Saucony Creek Brewing Company’s current Founder and Owner, Matt Lindenmuth, hopping from country to country where artful inspiration, diverse cultures and unique individuals prevailed around every corner. He soaked it all up and particularly felt fascination for craft beer at the age of thirteen in Belgium. Fast forward through US Snowboard Team training, Guinness World Records, NBC’s Gravity Games and a collection of injuries,  it was time to leave behind one crafty career and begin another one. With some newfound free time, Matt took his long standing hobby of home brewing to the next level and began the formal process of launching Saucony Creek Brewing Company.

name: Saugatuck Brewing Company
description: Saugatuck Brewing Co. is a traditional Irish style pub that features quality beer, wine, food, and service. We have twelve unique brews made by our Brewmaster that are served in the Pub and bottled and distributed throughout the mid-west.     We feature the only brew-on-site facility in West Michigan. With five copper kettles, an array of natural ingredients, and over 100 recipes, we invite you and your friends to be the Brewmaster for a day. Create your own unique ale and return in two weeks to bottle 5 cases of fresh beer with a custom label of your choice.    The Bier Hall is our multi-purpose banquet facility complete with stage and lights. This venue can be rented for weddings, receptions, reunions, corporate events and concerts. The Bier Hall can accommodate up to 200-seated guests. Catering and bar services are included.

name: Save the World Brewing Co.
description: Artisanal Belgian style ales making you feel good on so many levels.    After years of perfecting our recipes and with the use of only the best grains, hops and yeast, we feel our beers are raising the bar to the next level for the craft brewery movement. Grab a bottle of one our beers and decide for yourself, knowing that you're helping to Save The World one beer at a time!     We offer beer brewing classes and tasting parties by appointment only,

name: Saw Works Brewing Company
description: Traditional Beers Brewed For Today! Knoxville, Tennessee    Marble City Brewing Company became Saw Works in May 2012.
hoursOfOperation: Wednesday-Friday 4-8pm and Saturday 2-8pm

name: Sawtooth Brewery
description: Sawtooth Brewery is Ketchum's local brewery. Come see us in the tap room for a pint from one of our 13 craft beers on draft!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri: 4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat - Sun: 2:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Branford
description: Welcome to SBC Restaurant & Brewery, where culinary excellence and brewing expertise has been a Connecticut staple for 11 years. We are more than a restaurant; we’re a friendly neighbor with your comfort in mind. We are more than a brewery; we are a stylish escape with endless possibilities.

name: Scantic River Brewery
description: Established in 2012, The Scantic River Brewery introduced the crowd pleasing Hampden Pale Ale. This year will bring plenty of excitement to beer lovers, with the introduction of our new line of IPA's, "The Trail Ale IPA" series. With several months of testing and sample runs, we have finally finished and fine tuned the first of four IPA varieties.

name: Scarlet Lane Brewing Company
description: Scarlet Lane Brewing Company’s mission is to be your humble brewer promoting knowledge and continued betterment in the art of beer making. We will have fun while being excellent stewards to the community, the environment and our employees.     Beer Cultivates Wisdom and Friendships

name: Scars & Stripes Brewing Company
description: The name really says it all. Four Army veterans got together one day to brew beer and talk about movies, music, video games, and life which then turned into a regular home brewing event. Not too long afterwards, it was noticed that the city of Waco, Texas didn't have a microbrewery to call its own to accommodate a growing music scene and its relaxed college atmosphere. It only seemed obvious what the next move would be.    Even though the brew-masters and owners are Army Veterans, the name Scars & Stripes stands as tribute all military veterans as a thank you for the sacrificing that has been done so everyone can live free. The mentality behind this company is not your Captain America patriotism, but rather one that embraces Independence and freedom for all with no judgement for lifestyle choices.    We will be Waco's only micro brewery! Our beer will be self distributed around various stores and restaurants in the Central and Northern Texas area but we will also have regular taste testings for anyone who is of legal drinking age to take a tour of the brewing facility and to get a free try of the craft beer we are creating. Shirts, glasses, stickers, and growlers will be available for purchase.

name: Schmohz Brewing Company
description: Two words: cool & dark. Schmohz Ales and Lagers, like many quality craft beers, are not pasteurized. While this helps them taste fresher and more full-flavored, it also means that extended exposure to warm temperatures may cause them (especially if they are unfiltered) to taste, well, less fresh. So keep 'em cool! As for the dark part, let's just say that sunlight can negatively affect some brews (it makes 'em smell "skunky"). That's why we put our beers in light-blocking brown bottles and take extra caution to keep them out of the way of direct sunlight.

name: Schooner Exact Brewing Company
description: In 2006, homebrewing pals Marcus Connery and Matt & Heather McClung decided to take their hobby to the next level and go pro. Purchasing a half-barrel system, they began brewing a keg of beer at a time out of an ActivSpace unit under the West Seattle Bridge. Beginning in January 2007, they distributed their beer to restaurants and taprooms all over the city of Seattle.    As demand for their beers increased, the Schooner EXACT founders expanded into a larger, 10 -barrel system. The brewery moved to the South Park neighborhood in early 2009, and to its current SODO location on 1st Avenue in 2010. After Marcus Connery passed the reins of the brewery over to Heather and Matt to pursue the next chapter in his beer adventures by opening a beer broker/ consulting business, Matt and Heather quit their teaching jobs to pursue their brewery dreams full time.

name: Schubros Brewery
description: Create great craft beer and build experiences surpassing the ordinary through education, responsible community interaction, and sustainable business practices    The craft-connoisseur's utopia. Flawless representation of the most influential styles. Plus a full portfolio of permanent, perennials, and limited editions that ever-explore our globe's limitless range of brew styles and accents.     So set aside any preconceived notions about beer, and Raze Expectations!

name: Schubros Brewery
hoursOfOperation: Thursday & Friday 4-8pm  Saturday 11-5

name: Scorpion Brewing
description: Scorpion Brewing is a startup brewery in Calvert County Maryland.  Our beers should be ready in 2013!     Brian Dailey has had a passion for brewing and beer for many years and since the world will end in 2012 I figured, hey lets just start brewing and selling my craft beers to the great people of southern Maryland.

name: Scratch Brewing Company
description: Scratch Brewing Company is a farmhouse brewery located 5 miles from the Shawnee National Forest in Ava, Illinois. The brewery focuses on farmhouse beers and other styles enhanced by the innovative addition of local ingredients, including: nettle, elderberry, ginger, dandelion, maple sap, hickory nuts, wild carrot seed, cedar, and others.

name: Scratchtown Brewing Company
description: Scratchtown Brewing Company is a start-up craft brewery in Ord, Nebraska. We are currently constructing a new facility in downtown Ord. We expect to be operational by mid-year 2013.    Our passion is making and drinking great beer. Our mission in Central Nebraska, like Central Europe, is to craft a local beer culture that celebrates the wonderful variety of beers and build a viable industry in rural Nebraska.    In Ord, we are blessed to live among some of the most fertile land in the world, with access to some of the freshest, cleanest water on the planet - the Ogalala Aquifer. Our climate helps make our home an ideal brewers paradise, much like the old country.    We're fond of the Bohemian and Polish heritage that built Ord and the Loup Valley. We brew a wide variety of beer, but will always brew with a nod to the heritage of our home.

name: Clearwater
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Sun: 11:00am- 2am

name: Orlando
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Thurs: 4:00pm- 1am  Fri-Sun: 11:30am- 2am

name: Hull
hoursOfOperation: Monday & Tuesday  Closed    Wed - Thurs  11:00 am - 12:00 am    Fri - Sat  11:30 am - 1:00 am    Sunday  11:00 (Reggae Brunch) - 11pm

name: Seabright Brewery
description: All of our carefully hand-crafted, brewery fresh ales are made using only water, malt, yeast, and hops. Our brewmaster uses the finest two-row Harrington pale malted barley, specially roasted barley malts, hops from Oregon and Washington, and select brewers yeast to produce our beers right here on the premises.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:30 am - 11:30 pm

name: Seapine Brewing Company
description: Opened in 2012, Seapine is dedicated to brewing classic styles and we strive for perfection in every pint. Stop by and grab a pint, fill a growler, or just say hello!
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  4:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  3:00pm - 8:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 8:00pm Sun:  12:00pm - 4:00pm

name: Seaside Brewing Company
description: We are brewers, musicians, surfers, lovers, fighters, gardeners, mechanics, star gazers, dog lovers, tide watchers, loud laughers, fish catchers, and triple dog dare-ers.  We also have the best bonfires on the planet.        We believe that the only thing in the world better than drinking Oregon brewed craft beer is drinking Oregon brewed craft beer in an awesome place like Seaside. Fill out our contact info section and we'll keep you updated on what we're up to.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	12:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sun:	11:00 am - 11:00 pm

name: Second Salem Brewing Company
description: Second Salem Brewing Company is a one barrel brew house we're opening for transitioning our beers from homebrewing to commercial production. We have extensive experience in beer production, retail and consumption.

name: Selin's Grove Brewing Co.
description: Excellent beers in this small brewpub located on the lower level of a former Penna. Governor's Mansion.  A small space and limited food menu is more than made up for by the excellent brews.   Known as the 'Pub' by our locals. Great premise made beers, small healthy menu with veggie friendly items, friendly staff and loyal regulars. no tvs!

name: Selkirk Abbey Brewing Company
description: Why open a Belgian themed brewery in North Idaho? Well, we live here. We love it here and we’re not moving. Second and most importantly, we love Belgian beers. From a refreshing, spicy Saison to a tongue twisting sour or a rich malty Trappist and everything in between, Belgian beers have something for every palate.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 3:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 1:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Seminar Brewing
description: Seminar Brewing, LLC is a small, dedicated group of craft beer brewers in Florence, South Carolina. Our brewers include Bryan Fisher, John Mattheis, and Travis Knowles. Our business manager and founding partner is Dave Peters.

name: Seneca Lodge Craft Brewing
hoursOfOperation: Seasonal Check Website

name: Sentinel Peak Brewing Company
description: To provide a constant variety of exceptional, hand-crafted beers in a casual setting where families, friends, and neighbors experience consistent quality and engage in worthwhile conversation.  Sentinel Peak Brewing Company is a 3 BBL (that’s 90 gallons at a time!) nanobrewery which will offer a rotating selection of craft beers along with a few house favorites. Our inspiration comes from many sources including, but not limited to, travels we’ve had and suggestions from friends. We look forward to sharing our brews with you soon!
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Sat: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: Tower District
description: Sequoia Brewing Company Bar & Grill was started in October  of 2003 by Scott and Michele Kendall who purchased Butterfield Brewing Company in February 2000. Butterfield's started in the Spring of 1989 with award winning Brewmaster Kevin Cox in the heart of the historical Tower District, Fresno, California. The Micro Brewing Company and Restaurant is known as a neighborhood icon in Fresno. Scott and Michele changed the name to wholesale their beer throughout the United States.    Kevin continued on as Sequoia's Brewmaster, putting together a creative mix of 11 unique ales and lagers on tap brewed with the finest ingredients including monthly special beers, wines, specialty drinks, and their homemade Root Beer. Recently, Rick Bouke took over as Brewmaster, and is responsible for the high quality and craft beer character our customers have come to expect. Sequoia's menu offers great food with the freshest ingredients, serves Certified Angus Beef, prepares their sauces and items from scratch and offers fresh daily fish.    Sequoia offers a menu for all ages in a warm and comfortable atmosphere, where everyone knows your name. Sequoia is a hot spot for live music featuring the best local bands and a private party room. A second location with a mountain lodge atmosphere, rock fireplace and a patio was opened in Northeast Fresno in July of 2005 at Piazza del Fiore. Along with the same great beers on tap, there is a full bar at the Champlain location.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed 11am - 10pm  Thur 11am - 11pm  Fri - Sat 11am - Midnight  Sunday 10am - 10pm    HAPPY HOUR  Mon - Fri 3pm - 6pm  Sat 1pm-4pm  Sun 10am - 12pm. 1pm - 4pm

name: North Fresno
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed 11am - 10pm  Thur 11am - 11pm  Fri - Sat 11am - Midnight  Sunday 10am - 10pm    HAPPY HOUR  Mon - Fri 3pm - 6pm  Sat 1pm-4pm  Sun 10am - 12pm. 1pm - 4pm

name: Service Brewing Company
description: We are a veteran owned and operated craft brewery, in Savannah Georgia, dedicated to honoring those that have put their lives at risk and their country and community first.    We will donate a portion of our revenues to assist charities that support service.     Our dedication to this cause is unique and our approach to craft beer is equally unique.    While brewing our year round beers on a large scale we maintain a small batch Research and Development division to enable experimentation and innovation using locally available ingredients to connect our farmers and consumers with our beer and our mission.
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  5:30pm - 7:30pm Fri:  5:30pm - 7:30pm Sat:  2:00pm - 4:00pm

name: Seven Brides Brewery
description: Silverton, Oregon has much to offer. Known for its beautiful landscape of Silver Falls State Park and home of the Oregon Garden, it is rich with color and flavor. The town is lined with antique and coffee shops, restaurants and murals, but no micro-breweries, until now.    Seven Brides Brewing is changing that!    Several years ago, three dads and two uncles would gather on a Saturday in one of their garages to master the art of home brew. Before long, the salesman of the group said, “You know, this is good enough to sell.” So the friends set out to do just that.    The name “Seven Brides” actually came from the dads’ kids. Between three of them, they have seven daughters. With the rising cost of wedding nuptials, the guys decided they needed to sell enough beer to pay for their daughters weddings. Each of the girls has a beer named after her.

name: Jacksonville
description: Located in Southside Jacksonville, Florida, Seven Bridges serves a wide variety of fresh seafood, steaks, chicken, salads and pizza. The restaurant features a working brewery, bar, championship billiards, as well as semi-private dining areas for groups and parties. The outdoor heated patio is a favorite gathering spot after a long work day, or even a relaxing day at the beach.
hoursOfOperation: Sun: 11:00 AM - Midnight	  Mon-Thurs: 11:00 AM - midnight  Fri- Sat: 11:00 AM - 2 AM

name: Seward Brewing Company
description: Seward Alaska's only Brewhouse and Restaurant serving award winning beers by Consultant Brewer Kevin Burton and great Alaskan food by Matthew Zimny.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 4:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Fri: 4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: Shade Tree Brewing Co.
description: We make good beer without regard for profits, share holders, or market shares. We will never sacrifice quality simply to make a buck.  So grab a brew, pull up a patch of grass, and join us in the shade.

name: Shades of Pale Brewing Company
description: Shades of Pale beer is all about the recipes, and adding subtle twists to classic styles.  Our goal is to create uniquely-brewed, handcrafted beers, with a consistent quality that brings people back.

name: Shadows Pub and Grill
description: The Shadows Pub & Grill comprises the East wing of the historic Cheyenne Union Pacific Depot, built in 1886 and widely acknowledged to be one of the most beautiful railroad stations in North America! For a light bite to a full meal or just something cold to drink . . . Join us at Shadows Pub & Grill!
hoursOfOperation: Monday-Thursday 11:00am -11:00pm  Friday and Saturday 11:00am - 1:00am  Sunday 11:00am - 9:00pm

name: Shamrock Brewing Company
description: At the Shamrock we take pride in brewing fresh craft brewed beer with influences from around the world.  Adhering to traditional German, English, Irish, Belgian, and American styles, we use the best ingredients available to produce the highest quality product.  As an American craft brewery, we occasionally brew outside the box, creating new and unique beers that push the envelope.    Our beer recipes are formulated and brewed in house, using premium domestic and imported malted barley and other grains such as wheat, oats, and rye.  Our base 2-row barley is the freshest around, malted right here in southern Colorado by Colorado Malting Company.  We use the choicest hops from the Pacific Northwest and yeast strains carefully chosen by our brewer.  We never use additives, preservatives, or pasteurization in our brewing process. We also never filter our beer. Enjoy

name: Shannon Brewing Company
description: At Shannon Brewing, we are passionate about great beer—all natural, beautiful, wholesome, easy-drinking beer! Shannon Brewing Company’s great beer comes from a profound commitment to our “old-world” brewing process, the best natural ingredients available and a VERY patient aging process.

name: Gem & Keystone
description: True to nature, true to the craft    It's the motto of ShawneeCraft, a summary of our philosophy, and the ideal to which we aspire. We call it the fidelis philosophy.    We’re true to nature because environmental impact is a consideration in every decision we make. We honor the nature of materials that we work with. No shortcuts, no artifice. We’re true to the craft because we honor traditions of workmanship perfected by centuries of well-trained hands.    The Fidelis Philosophy took root in the fertile soil of Shawnee-On-Delaware, Pennsylvania. Our village, bounded by wooded hills on one side and the Delaware River on the other, enjoys a mild and varied climate, plenty of water and sun, abundant plants and wildlife and friendly, talented people. We are captivated by this nature and its possibilities. And our location- less than 100 miles from both New York City and Philadelphia- makes it only natural for us to broadly share the Fidelis Philosophy.    In a world of mass-production, our products are handmade. In a world of homogeneity, our products represent a defiant individuality. In a world without roots, our products embody a tangible sense of place. We aspire to eat what we grow, to drink what we brew, and to build what we use. And we’d like you to experience a taste of this lifestyle yourself- in the form of ShawneeCraft beer.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:30 am - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:30 am - 12:00 am  Sun: 11:30 am - 10:00 pm

name: ShawneeCraft Brewery
hoursOfOperation: Tasting Room Hours:  Wednesday - Sunday: 12:00 - 5:00 and Thursdays until 10:00    Tours:  Wednesday - Sunday: 12:00

name: Shebeen Brewing Company
description: Shebeen Brewing makes craft beers in Connecticut from fresh local ingredients like hops and concord grapes. Stay tuned for a grand opening in Spring 2013.    Shebeen Brewing Company was founded and operated by Richard Visco from Marlborough Connecticut and Patrick Lacerra from Yonkers New York. Rich originally hails from Derry Northern Ireland and part of the McGettigan Clan. Our Shebeen Brewery is currently located along the shores of Lake Terramuggus Connecticut. Shebeen or Sibin in Irish is defined as "An unlicensed establishment or private house selling alcoholic liquor". Richard has been brewing beer for the past 20 years.
hoursOfOperation: Wednesday:  5-8  Friday:  5-9  Saturday:  12-5  Sunday:  12-5

name: Sheep Mountain Brewery LLC
description: Sheep Mountain Brewery is a nano brewery at the foot of Sheep Mountain in southeast Wyoming. Find our beer at O'Dwyers Public House in Laramie Wyoming.

name: Shenandoah Brewing Company
description: The brewery consists of several areas within a total floor space of 5600 square feet. The areas on the main floor include the pub, brew house, bottling area, fermentation and conditioning rooms, and the warehouse. The pub, brew house and bottling areas are open to the public. There is a mezzanine level on which our business office, lab, and grain mill are located. The mezzanine level also contains a customer seating area.    The pub is located in the front of the brewery. There is seating for 7 at the bar, 22 at the tables on the main floor and 20 at tables on the mezzanine. The brewery, BOP (the acronym for brew-on-premises), and pub are open the same hours, so beer and food is always available during our open hours and while you are brewing.

name: Sherwood Brewing Company
description: Sherwood Brewing Company opened its doors on August 31, 2006 in the Hayes Center Shoppes plaza on Hayes Rd. north of Hall Rd. (M-59) in Shelby Township, Michigan.    We serve only the finest hand-crafted beer, wine, and sodas, all made in our on-site brewing facility.    Sherwood Brewing Company is proud and honored to be the recipient of WDIV's "4 the Best" award for Best Brewpub for four consecutive years (2007 - 2010) as voted by you, our customers.

name: Sherwood Forest Brewers
description: Sherwood Forest Brewers...enchanting today’s Merry Men and Women with a taste of Merry Olde England – in Merry Ole New England! Cheers!

name: Shine Brewing Company
description: Shine Restaurant & Gathering Place is a place for us all to nourish ourselves through food, community, dance, education and celebration. It is hub for us all to share our gifts, to explore, and to have fun doing it. It truly is a place where we can all Shine.    The Blissful Sisters, previously of restaurant and music venue Trilogy have been in the creative process of Shine for the past few years. So much in their individual life experiences and the amazing people they have connected with over the years have been a huge inspiration for the concept. They feel that NOW IS THE TIME where we need a sense of community — to eat, heal and live well — it is so important to our well-being. Shine is a gift for all of us.

name: Ship Bottom Brewery
description: Our humble beginnings started in the Summer of 1995 in Ship Bottom, NJ. Back then we made our first batch of beer using a home brew kit that consisted of a plastic bucket, large spoon, bottling bucket and some bottle caps. We hardly knew what what would be ahead of us 16 years later! We learned a lot over the last 16 years and feel that we really refined our craft. We are a small (Nano) brewer...See More

name: Ship Inn Brewpub
description: On January 3rd, 1995, The Ship Inn was proud to become the first brewpub in New Jersey to brew beer since prohibition. Nestled in the scenic Delaware valley, The Ship Inn provides a comfortable pub atmosphere to enjoy the British inspired foods with locally sourced and ecologically responsible ingredients, and craft-brewed ales. The Ship Inn building

name: Shipwrecked Restaurant and Brewery
description: Welcome to Shipwrecked Restaurant, Brew Pub & Inn, Door County’s Only Microbrewery!    Stop in for one of our hand crafted ales while you’re in Egg Harbor or ask for 6 packs at your favorite retailers throughout Northeastern Wisconsin.
hoursOfOperation: OPEN EVERY DAY:  May - October    OPEN WEEKENDS ONLY:  November - April

name: San Francisco
description: Shmaltz Brewing Company is an American craft brewing company that hand crafts He'brew Beer. Shmaltz is known for blurring beer styles and using puns, art, history, and pop culture in every aspect of its products.     Founded as the first and still only "Jewish-celebration beer," proprietor Jeremy Cowan established the company in San Francisco in 1996 with the first 100 cases of He’brew Beer hand bottled and delivered throughout the Bay Area in his Grandmother’s Volvo. He’brew now sells across 37 states, through 40 wholesalers and nearly 5,000 retailers.     After 17 years of being an outspoken cheerleader for contract brewing, Shmaltz recently broke with tradition and opened its own New York State production brewery in Clifton Park, NY, 10 minutes north of Albany’s capital district. Shmaltz’s new home boasts a 50-barrel brewhouse with 20,000 barrels of annual capacity. The new brewery packages 12 and 22 ounce bottles and kegs of their diverse core and seasonal favorites, and hosts fans and beer tourists in their new tasting room for tours, barrel-aged previews, and special releases.

name: Shoreline Brewery
description: Shoreline Brewery is a brewery and restaurant located near the shores of Lake Michigan in Michigan City, Indiana. Twelve beers are always on tap, including the World Beer Cup Award winning Beltaine Scottish Ale and Singing Sands Oatmeal Stout, and seasonal beers such as Samuel Jacksons Black IPA, Bavarian Bombshell Black Lager, and the Barrel Aged Imperial Stout Lost Sailor. In the eight years of existence, Shoreline Brewery has evolved and grown into so much more than just a brewery.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 2:00 am

name: Short's Brewing Company
description: In April of 2004 we opened the doors to Short’s Brewing Company in the quaint Village of Bellaire.  Beer was the mission, and liberation was the movement.  With a lot of elbow grease, blind ambition and a little luck, the quest to create a community pub in Northwest Lower Michigan began to take shape.  The philosophy was to bring an appreciation of craft beer to the north with product education and creativity.  The process of appreciation through education we call beer liberation.    Today Short’s Brewing Company continues the effort to educate and liberate consumers.  We take pride in our hands on, mom and pop approach and the energy we put into the quality of our beer, food, staff, customers and facilities. We believe in the power of the smallness.   We intend on remaining a smaller, state wide beer distributor and focusing our energies close to home (the SBC Michigan stimulus package).  Our goal is to get to a comfortable production volume, enjoy what we do and love life in Northern Michigan.
hoursOfOperation: Sun - Thu: 11:00 am – 11:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 12:00 am

name: Shrub Steppe Smokehouse Brewery
description: Shrub Steppe Defined:     "Shrub" refers to the most abundant plant species that grows in this ecosystem.     "Steppe" is a Russian word that means a vast treeless plain.  Shrub steppe is a type of natural grassland with a discontinuous overstory layer of shrubs such as low lying sagebrush; distinguishable by elevation, climate, and other unique characteristics. Prior to urban development, shrub steppe historically dominated the landscape in eastern Washington. When fortunate enough to find an undisturbed section of these perennial grasses, sagebrush, and rimrock outcrops, a shrub steppe will overwhelm you with its sweeping vistas and stark beauty.

name: ShuBrew
description: Nano brewpub located north of Pittsburgh in the historical town of Zelienople, PA.  We offer a wide selection of beers & full menu completely from scratch.  If the Shu Fits, Drink It.

name: Sick N Twisted Brewing Co.
description: Sick N Twisted Brewery selects local ingredients for our unique beers. Join us and relax on our patio with your friends or sit by the fire and indulge in some twisted fun!! Come lube your palate with us; after all Micro Brews are the new Social Lubricant...
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri: 10:00 am - 6:00 pm  Sat: 10:00 am - 7:00 pm  Sun: 10:00 am - 5:00 pm

name: Side Project Brewing
description: A 100% barrel-aged, mostly barrel fermented, gypsy brewing project.

name: Sidebar
description: Visit our tasting room - The Sidebar - adjacent to the 5th Quadrant. Enjoy a variety of barrel aged and seasonal specialty beers, available in limited quantities and only in the tasting room.    The Sidebar is open Fridays from 4pm to 10pm and Saturdays from 2pm to 10pm. Stop by to taste some of our fine ales, buy a bottle or two of our ales to go, or purchase a keg for those special occasions.    The Sidebar is the venue of choice for most of our release parties. Want to join in the fun? Sign up for our newsletter, or follow us on Facebook/Twitter and be in the know.    Keep the Sidebar in mind for meetings and get-togethers. The Sidebar is available for private parties and special events Sunday through Thursdays.

name: Sierra Blanca Brewing Company
description: Located in Moriarty, New Mexico and also known as Rio Grande Brewing Company. We currently brew during the year 10-12 of our own Brews.    We  Bottle 9 different beers for distribution.     Leading at the Brewing Helm is the owner and Brew-master Richard Weber and as of last year our Assistant Brew-master Ben Couger. Staffed with a total of 9 people including office staff we anticipate brewing about 8500 barrels this year.     Our Brewery is open 6 days a week and always ready to offer up a cold pint or give a tour of our Brewery.    Come on by and see what may be brewing or being bottled.     We also do contract brewing for Abbey Beverage, Premier Beverage (Isotopes Amber and blonde), Guns & Oil Brewing and Rodeo Cold Brewing.     Always a good time here at Sierra Blanca Brewing/ Rio Grande Brewing Company!!

name: Sierra Nevada Brewing Company
description: The Sierra Nevada Brewing Company was established in 1980 by homebrewers Ken Grossman and Paul Camusi. Camusi retired in 1998 and sold his share in the company to Grossman.    Located in Chico, California, Sierra Nevada Brewing is one of the most popular craft breweries currently operating in the United States. Its Pale Ale is world renowned, and the brewery produces almost 700,000 barrels of beer per year. Sierra Nevada's Pale Ale is the second best-selling craft beer in the United States, behind the Boston Beer Company's Samuel Adams Boston Lager.    Sierra Nevada's specialty brews include the winter seasonal Celebration, which is similar to the pale ale, but hoppier; and Summerfest, a lager which is citrusy and sunny.

name: Sietsema Orchards
description: Jerry Sietsema Sr. operated his orchard and family farm from the Grand Rapids location from 1934 to 1995. After that time Sietsema Orchards moved to 8540 2 Mile Road in Ada Michigan, where it resides today. Although the farm was fully operational and proving to be a success, the goods produced were sold on mainly a wholesale level to a Grand Rapids area packing house. Beginning in, 2010, we decided to expand our business and our dream. This is where the 3rd, 4th, and 5th generation of Sietsema Orchards & Cider Mill hope to thrive and grow. We are committed to providing quality produce, and by opening our doors to the public, providing a family farm experience that we hope you enjoy here in West Michigan.
hoursOfOperation: September Hours:  Thursday & Friday 10am-6pm  Saturday 9am-6pm    October Hours:  Tuesday-Friday  10am-6pm  Saturday  9am-6pm    November Hours:  Thursday & Friday:  10am-6pm    Saturday:  9-6

name: Silver City Restaurant & Brewery
description: Steve and I got into business together in 1990 when we opened our first restaurant, Top Notch Burger, in East Bremerton. We operated with a menu of fresh, made-to-order hamburgers, fresh cut French Fries and real ice cream shakes. Our 2nd location was here at our Silverdale location. We had fun and we still have Silver City Guests ask us about 39 cent hamburgers and grilled onion burgers. We miss 'em too, but we proved it's real hard to put the big hamburger chains out of business. It isn't as easy as it looks.    In 1996 we decided to switch gears and get into the Brewpub business. We sold our Bremerton location and remodeled the Silverdale location into what it is today.    We operate today on the same principles as we did when we opened our first Top Notch Burger. We work hard at making sure each Guest leaves happier than when they arrived. We work hard side-by-side with our staff and train them to treat their Guests like you would treat a Guest in your own home.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thurs: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: Silver Creek Brewing Co
description: Established in 1999, Silver Creek Brew Company formed from a local home-brewers’ club. We opened our brewpub in Cedarburg’s historic grist mill in 2002, and have been brewing our own craft beers, based on the club’s recipes, in-house since 2004. We currently brew four year-round beers and four seasonals, plus our classic blonde root beer.

name: Silver Gulch Brewing Company
description: Silver Gulch Brewing and Bottling Co. has been in operation since February 1998 in the small mining community of Fox, Alaska, located about 10 miles north of Fairbanks on the Steese Highway. Silver Gulch Brewing grew from brewmaster Glenn Brady's home-brewing efforts in 5-gallon batches to its current capacity of 24-barrel (750 gallon) batches.
hoursOfOperation: Monday-Thursday 4pm-10pm  Friday 4pm-11pm  Saturday 11am-11pm   Sunday 11am-10pm

name: Silver Moon Brewing
description: Silver Moon Brewery is a craft brewery, restaurant and live entertainment venue located in downtown Bend, Oregon. We serve a variety of hand-crafted micro brews and a tasty pub menu in our fun and casual taproom.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 12:00 pm - 12:00 am

name: Silver Peak Brewery And Restaurant
description: The Silver Peak Restaurant and Brewery was born from a friendship and a dream. We came up with the concept in the late 80?s, about seven years after we met.  We’d been talking about opening a business together for years. We eventually narrowed the field down to the idea of an upscale, modern-version of the classic brewpub. Then in 1991 the idea became a goal. That goal was to create a unique place in Reno; a restaurant and brewery where the service was as good as the food and the beer was worth coming back for; a place where locals could meet friends after work, or treat their dates and clients to original and delicious dishes.

name: Silverton Brewing Company
description: Our beers are hand crafted in small batches on a five-barrel system. The volume we produce allows a hands-on approach to every beer we create.    The Tap Room has 6 brews on draft during the summer season. Our canning line is running and we are in production year-round. You will find our canned beer at liquor stores throughout the western slope of Colorado.    At the beginning of 2011, we expanded our distribution to the entire state of Colorado.

name: Sin City Beer Company
description: Sin City Brewing Co. is a Las Vegas-based microbrewery launched by long-time Gordon Biersch Director of Brewing Operations Richard Johnson. Produced to satisfy both the microbrew savvy drinker and those with a preference for a traditional domestic style beer, Sin City beers accentuate the indulgent nature of Las Vegas. The beers are brewed in small batches (100 kegs at a time) using traditional methods, premium raw materials and a strict adherence to the Rheinheitsgebot, the 1516 German beer purity law that differentiates Sin City beers from the big guys. Sin City beers are brewed and distributed exclusively in Las Vegas.Sin City Brewing Co. also features a popular retail line that is available through its online store and its branded microbrew bars at Miracle Mile Shops, The Grand Canal Shoppes and Flamingo Las Vegas.

name: SingleSpeed Brewing Company
description: Our mission is to brew beers built for the venturesome beer drinker, those unafraid to stray from the beaten path of simple flavors established by breweries much larger in size but not in creative energy.    As our name implies, we will be brewing at a slower rate of production than any of these monstrous breweries-designing and creating our hand crafted ales at one relatively slow pace, our "single speed", allowing each to emerge as a small artisanal batch formulated from recipes that include fresh, local, seasonal and organic ingredients.

name: Sisyphus Brewing
description: Craft beers, brewed without a purpose, for a greater purpose. One need not imagine Sisyphus happy, especially when his stomach is filled with beer.

name: Six Rivers Brewery
description: Six Rivers Brewery is the brew with a view! Live music nightly, happy hour daily and don't forget, when it rains we pour...it's always happy hour when it's raining!
hoursOfOperation: Mon: 4:00 pm - 11:30 pm  Tues - Wed: 11:30 am - 11:30 pm  Thurs - Sat: 11:30 am - 12:30 am  Sun: 11:30 am - 11:30 pm

name: Old Plant No. 1 Pub
description: Six Row Brewing Company produces quality ales from the site of the old Falstaff Brewery at 3690 Forest Park Ave., in the Midtown area of St. Louis, near St. Louis University. Our Old Plant No. 1 Pub is open to the public and features our craft brewed beers along with selections from other craft breweries and wineries. Stop by and enjoy a pint soon! Then, take home a growler to enjoy one of St. Louis' finest craft beers till your next visit!
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Wed:11:30 to 9:30  Thu:11:30 to 10:30  Fri:11:30 to Midnight  Sat:Noon to Midnight  Sun:Closed

name: Six Ten Brewing
description: Six Ten Brewing is a locally owned and operated brewery opening soon in the Town and Country neighborhood of Tampa. With over 20 years of brewing experience we produce craft beer in a variety of styles which we will proudly serve in our tasting room while guest can enjoy a front row seat to view the brewing process.

name: Sixpoint Brewery
description: Sixpoint Craft Ales was founded in 2004 by Shane Welch, a former homebrewer that originally grew up in Milwaukee. The microbrewery is located in a 7,000-square-foot (650 m2) factory in in Red Hook, Brooklyn that formerly manufactured filing cabinets. Sixpoint began business by only distributing kegs to local bars and restaurants; instead of bottling its beer, filling growlers at bars were the only way for customers to drink the beer at their homes.     In 2011 Sixpoint launched initial canned  offerings of 16 oz, year-round styles Sweet Action, Bengali Tiger, Righteous Ale and The Crisp.  Further releases have included the 12 oz Resin and 3Beans, as well as 16oz seasonal offerings such as Apollo and Autumnation.

name: Ska Brewing Company
description: Characters Brewing Beer With Character Since 1995
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri: 9:00 am - 8:00 pm  Sat: 11:00 am - 7:00 pm

name: Skagway Brewing Company
description: With roots dating back to the Klondike Gold Rush of 1898, the Skagway Brewing Company first opened its doors in 1897 to serve the thirsty prospectors who had abandoned everything to head North and strike it rich in the gold fields. During its heyday, the Skagway Brewing Company and its brew master Herman Barthel, the most technologically adorned brewer on the West coast, produced up to 30,000 barrels of beer per year and had a bottling operation on site. Multiple breweries operated out of Skagway during the peak of the Gold Rush and by 1900 competition was fierce amongst them. With the Skagway economy on a decline due to the fervor of the gold rush ending and growing prohibition support, the Skagway Brewing Company closed its doors in 1904. In 1916, the “Alaska Bone Dry Law” was passed effectively ending the making and consumption of alcoholic beverages in the Territory of Alaska.    In 1997, a local entrepreneur reopened the Skagway Brewing Co. in the Golden North Hotel until 2002 when it again ceased operations. With the brewing tanks collecting dust and locals thirsty for microbrews, South Dakota native and long time Skagway resident, Michael Healy spotted an opportunity and bought the equipment in 2007. Operating in a brand new building, the Skagway Brewing Company again fired up the brew tanks and on July 4th, 2007 opened its doors once again much to the pleasure of locals and visitors alike. This bustling business keeps growing, frantically brewing to keep up with the high demand of its brews and quality-dining menu. We invite you to stop by 7th and Broadway for a fresh pint, delicious food, and a good time.

name: Skull Camp Brewing
description: Craft beer is exploding across the nation and across our own state of North Carolina. Skull Camp Brewing is very excited to bring the love and passion of craft beer to the Elkin area.

name: Skull Coast Ales
description: Incorporated in December 2011, the Skull Coast Brewing Company, Inc., is a new entity formed for the express purpose of brewing and distributing handcrafted artisan ales, and whose history has yet to be written. Prior to its formation, Dave Fox launched and operated the Skull Coast Ale Company, a limited liability company (LLC.), located in Fort Mill, South Carolina, organized in 2009. Without the investment dollars needed to start his own brewery, the Skull Coast Ale Company operated as a “Contract Brewing” or “Beer Marketing” company, in craft beer terms. For those unfamiliar with the terminology, the company contracted with other breweries to produce its beer recipes, and marketed the products under the Skull Coast name.    After months of recipe development and searching for a brewery to contract with, Dave Fox brewed Skull Coast's first beer on St. Patrick's Day, 2010, in Virginia. The result was Maelstrom IPA; a true west coast style India Pale Ale, aggressively hopped with seven different Northwest hops. After months of traveling back and forth between South Carolina and Virginia to brew and transport kegs (roughly seven hours each way), Dave sought out a second contract brewing relationship closer to home. Unfortunately, every Carolina brewery Dave approached was at or near capacity. Undeterred, Dave created his own capacity. In the first of its kind contract model, Dave purchased his own 60bbl fermenter and bright tanks, and placed them in another brewery.    The Skull Coast Brewing Company is the continuation of a lifelong dream. The brand was born in a small Charleston library after looking at a local map drawn in the 1700's, during the Golden Age of Piracy, with the words "Skull Coast" etched along the Carolina coastline. The Skull Coast products matured and our understanding of the beer business was developed during our contract brewing experience, under the Skull Coast Ale Company. Now, with a new entity, our own facility and unrestricted in our growth, the Skull Coast Brewing Company hopes to become a lifelong part of your history.

name: Sky High Brewing & Pub
description: You've noticed the sky reaching beams coming out of the old Avalon Cinema building... You noticed that the street was blocked all day as we installed our brew tanks... You've noticed Sky High Brewing & Pub!    The Tasting Room is officially open on the mezzanine level; we will open the whole space in sections as each new level is ready. We plan to install as many bike racks as we can... and encourage two-wheeled transportation. :)
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed: 4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Thu: 4:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Fri: 4:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sat: 2:00 pm - 12:00 am

name: Slanted Rock Brewing Company
description: Slanted Rock Brewing Company, LLC was founded in Meridian, Idaho on June 2011 by Bob Lonseth and Vincent Melchor. The Partners and additional investment from John E. MacCrisken has financed the start-up of this venture.    Slanted Rock plans to start Operations in Fall 2012 with a 15 BBL Brewhouse, 2-15BBL Fermenters, 1- 30BBL Fermenter, 1-15BBL Brite Tank and 1-30BBL Brite Tank. Production volume will be packaged in kegs initially with hopes of adding bottle or canning in the future.    Keg Sales will be self-distributed initially, with future distribution outside of Idaho. Retail Customers can buy kegs and pick-up direct from the location at a discounted keg price. Individuals can also purchase kegs in the following sizes: ½ BBL, 1/6 BBL    The brewery location will open a tap room where Slanted Rock and other selected craft brewers will be on tap. Sample flights, pints, half pints & growlers will be available for sale.
hoursOfOperation: Tues-Thurs: 4:00pm-9:00pm  Fri & Sat: 12:00pm-10:00pm

name: SlapShot Brewing Co.
description: SlapShot Brewing Co is a startup brewery in Chicago. We will be brewing on our 3.5bbl brewhouse with a focus on beers brewed with locally sourced ingredients. Brewing small batches will allow us to bring you a line of unique session ales as well as some pretty awesome seasonals.

name: Slate Creek Brewing Co.
description: Slate Creek is a little know tributary to the St. Joe River deep in the mountains of North Idaho. Hidden by steep rugged canyon walls, Slate Creek has long been a secret spot for anglers and whitewater explorers. Slate Creek Brewing Co., like the mountain stream it is named after, is a secret spot for craft beer explorers, serving up adventurous, rugged and beautifully hand crafted ales for those daring enough to explore the un-trampled path. Discover the secret spot in your own backyard.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Sat: 2:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Sleeping Lady Brewing Company
description: The Snow Goose Restaurant and Sleeping Lady Brewing Company is located in downtown Anchorage, Alaska. It overlooks Cook Inlet, with the second highest tide in the world (38 feet) and the active industrial port of Anchorage. On clear days, North America's highest peak, Denali (Mt. McKinley) stands majestically to the north. To the west sits our brewery's namesake, Sleeping Lady (Mt. Susitna). Please join us for our fine hand crafted beers and Alaskan influenced entrees!    The Goose was one of the first Brew Pubs in Anchorage. We have won numerous national and international awards for our finely craft ales. Our dining room is sandwiched between our award winning brewery and our wonderful views to the north. Our upstairs Pub has two walls of windows extending the views. On a cold day, you can sit by a warm fireplace with a hot meal and a cool beer. Our two outdoor decks off of the Pub offer mountain views, radiant sunsets, military aerobatics, and an active port.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	11:30 am	-	11:00 pm  Fri - Sat:	11:30 am	-	12:00 am  Sun:	12:00 pm	-	10:00 pm

name: Sleepy Dog Brewery
description: Established in 2009, Sleepy Dog Brewery has been brewing hand crafted beer for wholesale distribution throughout the state of Arizona. Our commitment to brewing consistent, quality beer with meticulous attention to detail has helped us consistently grow our distribution every year. Our products can be found throughout the state of Arizona and soon in Southern California. We supply beer to hundreds of bars and restaurants and most all major grocery and retail chains.

name: Sleepy Owl Brewery
description: Sleepy Owl Brewery is a nano brewery, located in Historic Downtown Kingsport, Tennessee.

name: Slippery Pig Brewery
description: A small brewery with an outdoor tasting area specializing in odd beers. Each beer features an ingredient grown either at the brewery or from a local farmer. Best known at this time for their rhubarb IPA, stinging nettle pale, and dandelion bitter. A truly unique experience!

name: Sloop Brewing
description: Sloop brewing is a true nano brewery located in the Hudson Valley region. A Nano brewery is a licensed brewery using a brewing system of less than 4 barrels.  Brewing at this level allows us to spend more time crafting each and every beer to be exactly as it should be. Additionally, our local distribution ensures that every Sloop beer you drink will be fresh out of our brewery.

name: Sly Fox Brewing Company
description: A full production brewery and accompanying restaurant opened in 2004 by the owners of Sly Fox Brewhouse & Eatery in nearby Phoenixville. The 20bbl brewhouse packages a wide range of beers in 12oz cans, 22oz bottles and 750ml bottles. Pikeland Pils, a multiple GABF Gold Medal Winner, and O'Reilly's Stout, a nitro-poured, draught-only beer named after brewer Brian O'Reilly's grandfather are among its most popular beers, on and off premises, as are such Belgian-style delights as Incubus Tripel, Ichor Quadrupel, Saison Vos & Black Raspberry Reserve. Sly Fox is also noted for its Bock Beers (see listing for the Phoenixville pub for more details) and annual Christmas Ale.

In addition to it’s own brew, this neighborhood brewery serves up some food and boasts a pretty good gust tap list. If you live in Redmond and love craft beer, there’s no doubt you’ve already stopped in – but if you are passing thru, or visiting the town, stopping in is a must!  Cheers!

description: We are a locally owned company and group of friends who are very passionate about Texas BBQ, good Texas craft beers, and live music. We've had a vision of a business that could bring the very best in these things together, and now our vision has become reality. Smoke 'n Hops will brew our own beer on site, smoke our own Texas-style BBQ, and bring in prominent musicians as well as local acts with ties to the community. It is very important to us to tie these things in with a fun, family-oriented environment. Therefore we have installed a playground so the younger ones are having fun while the older ones are at play.

name: Snake River Brewing
description: America's most award-winning small brewery since 1994 offering a wide array of lagers and ales with hand-crafted cuisine. Locals and tourists alike co-mingle in a friendly and casual environment.    Make yourself at home at Snake River Brewing in the heart of the Teton Mountain Range. All roads, trails, bike paths, climbing routes and ski runs lead to “The Brewpub”! After a day in the great outdoors how can you not partake of a tasty malt beverage and a delicious meal

description: Walk between six tall lodge poles that flank the entrance of Snipes Mountain Brewery & Restaurant, push open the big double doors, and come on in. A unique pub and dining experience is waiting for you.    Find a seat at the oak bar, in front of the fireplace, or on the wrap-around patio.    Designed to reflect the surrounding countryside, there's plenty of wide open spaces for everyone. Separate banquet rooms are also available and children are always welcome!
