name: Snitz Creek Brewery
description: We are a group of people with a passion for beer, the outdoors and for having a good time. Currently under construction, we hope to be open by Christmas.

name: Snoqualmie Falls Brewing Company
description: We are a small private company, located in historic downtown Snoqualmie, Washington.  Founders Pat Anderson, David McKibben, Dave Eiffert, LeRoy Gmazel and Tom Antone did not have the sense to know that you had to be crazy to start a brewery in 1997, when most of the rest of the world thought the craft brewing industry was going down the tube, so 13 years later, here we are.    Our products are now available in 22 oz bombers at the brewery and in an ever increasing number of stores between Bellingham and Olympia, as well as in eastern Washington and northern Idaho.

name: Snow Eagle Brewing
description: Idaho Falls' newest and finest brewing and grill establishment.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat:	11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: Snowbank Brewing CO
description: A departure from the traditional, Snowbank Brewing focuses on innovation and a passion for the Colorado lifestyle.

name: Snowshoe Brewing Company
description: Snowshoe Brewing Co. was founded in early 1995, with a mission to brew great beer and create a diverse menu of good food. Our brewpub & restaurant was opened in Arnold, Calaveras County, in the former location of The Meadowmont Inn, overlooking the golf course.     Our brewers have created award-winning ales that have ale lovers throughout Central California and the Sierras asking for a Snowshoe at their favorite pubs and restaurants. The staff at our restaurant wants to ensure that your meal is enjoyable… served with our Snowshoe hospitality!    The beer is bottled in Calaveras and brewed using a 15-barrel brewhouse, three 15-barrel fermenters and three 30-barrel fermenters. Our specialty beers include India Pale Ale, Westridge Winter Ale, Cutthroat Strong Ale, Oktoberfest, Irish Red, Porter, Midnight Moon Oatmeal Stout.

name: Snowy Mountain Pub & Brewery
description: The Snowy Mountain Brewery is located in beautiful Saratoga, Wyoming and is the anchor brewpub for the Saratoga Resort and Spa.  The Saratoga Resort and Spa consistently draws people from all over Colorado and Wyoming due to its unique offering of a variety of amenities in one location--such as an on-site brewery, mineral hot spring pools, great food, western-styled rooms, jeep, ATV and snowmobile rentals, a golf course and a full-service spa.      The Snowy Mountain Brewery is gaining in exposure and was featured recently in Travel Pulse’s “5 Unique Beer Vacation Spots in the U.S.!”  The name Snowy Mountain is fitting for the brewery as it sits adjacent the majestic Snowy Range Mountains, in southern Wyoming. Boasting 8-10 different craft beers throughout each season, the Snowy Mountain Brewery is one of the fastest growing breweries in Wyoming and surrounding states. The famous brewpub, with a throw-back to the wild west, is adorned with big game mounts and bar-stools made with six-shooters and patinated saddles and features a full pub menu with selections that compliment Saratoga's finest craft beers.
hoursOfOperation: Hours: 3 PM â€“ 9 PM

name: Soaring Wings Vineyards and Brewery
description: A combination Winery and Brewery located on a high hill on the South Side of Omaha. From light American style lagers to barrel aged Imperial Stouts there is a great variety of beer to sample brewed here on our premise. Great music venue with seating up to 2000 and live music year round.

name: SoCal Beer Company
description: Hand crafted California beer by using quality ingredients and traditional European methods, while striving to promote health and wellness of humanity in our world.    We strive to produce top quality craft beer by using traditional European methods merged with the California flare and style; beers that Californians would be proud to call their own and to be enjoyed by all around the globe. As the core mission of our company, we also plan to contribute to local, regional, national and international organizations involved with preventive care and promotion of human health and well-being.

name: Societe Brewing Company
description: Societe Brewing Company is a production brewery founded in San Diego, California by fellow professional brewers Travis Smith and Douglas Constantiner.  In 2012, Societe Brewing Company began production and opened its doors to a warm welcome from the San Diego craft beer community.  The brewery and tasting room occupy a 16,000 square foot facility in Kerney Mesa, in the eastern part of San Diego.  Societe Brewing Company focuses on hoppy Out West ales, Belgian-inspired Old World ales, and dark and flavorful Stygian ales.  The brewery also features a 3,000 square foot barrel room, and there are intentions to release a line-up of barrel-aged sour beers in the future.  Societe’s beers are available locally throughout San Diego, and also available at the tasting room.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	12:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Fri - Sat:	12:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sun:	12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Sockeye Brewing
description: Founded in 1996 on Federal Way, the brewery originally crafted beers for local restaurants. As our passion developed we moved to up onto the Boise bench in 2002. Our humble beginnings started with just a four barrel brewing system. In 2009 we upgraded to seven barrels. In 2012 we opened Our new production brewery on Fairview and Cloverdale which is 12,000 square feet, with a twenty barrel brewing system in place. That allows for 12,000 barrel production per year.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: Solemn Oath Brewery
description: Debuting in 2012, Solemn Oath Brewery features an array of American, Belgo-American, traditional, wood-aged and experimental beer styles. We're excited to join our Illinois craft brethren in providing you with another quality-focused, local option to satisfy your craft beer needs.
hoursOfOperation: Thursday 12-9  Friday 12-9  Saturday 11-7  Sunday 11-5

name: Solera Brewery
description: The brewery resides in an historical building that was built and operated as a movie theater from 1930 to the 1950's. Come join us for a pint, delicious food and the most spectacular view of Mt Hood's craggy North Face from our back patio.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Tue: 4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Thu: 4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sun: 12:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Solid Rock Brewing
description: We brew our beers to fit like your favorite pair of jeans.

name: Somerville Brewing Company
description: Slumbrew is all about the synergy between craft products and every day consumption. Well conceived, locally-sourced, quality products should be an every day part of our lives – not a unique occurrence. This is the spirit of Slumbrew.    Slumbrew is the research & development brand and concept of Somerville Brewing Company. Our mission is to brew unique, ingredient-driven beers that challenge common notions of what a beer should taste like. It is the result of nearly 15 years of beer travel and research by Caitlin Jewell and Jeff Leiter; and a decade of Jeff’s homebrewing recipe formulation.    We produce a lot of small-run, pilot beers at the Slumbrew Beerlab, but only a small number make their way to commercial production. The Somerville Brewing Company contracts with regional breweries to make the best recipes for wide-spread commercial release, but each recipe is an evolving process of refinement. This model for beer production provides an opportunity to experiment with innovative local ingredients to produce craft beers that stand apart from typical formulations.

name: Sonoma Cider
description: Bringing you handcrafted, delicious hard ciders from Healdsburg, CA! Organic & Gluten Free.

name: Sons of Liberty Aleworks
description: We are committed to producing excellent quality craft beer as well as providing interesting historical narratives to augment your tasting experience.  We have three screens with a Direct TV sports package for all the games and we are open for Monday night football with great food and $4.00 Imperial pints.
hoursOfOperation: Wednesday:  2 - 9  Thursday: 2 - 9  Friday: 2 - 10  Saturday: 11 - 10

name: Soo Brewing Co.
description: It is the mission of Soo Brewing Company to produce beer that the people of Sault Ste. Marie can be proud of – beer that meets and exceeds the highest standard, our own. Our products will be unique and innovative, yet hold true to the old-world brewing traditions of our ancestors. The product will be affordable, allowing everyday people the opportunity to enjoy great hand-crafted beer.    The profits made by Soo Brewing Company will be put back into the community whenever possible. Employees of Soo Brewing Company will be treated like family, paid a livable wage and given the opportunity to advance through hard work. All employees will be fully knowledgeable about the product, the process and culture of beer and will treat customers as they would guests in their own home.    Soo Brewing Company will strive to promote beer culture and responsible enjoyment of the product, and will be relentless in our effort to improve the quality of the product and the efficiency by which it is produced. Soo Brewing Company will be a shining example of corporate ethics and social responsibility, and above all, enjoy what we do every day.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thur: Noon - 10 PM  Fri - Sat: Noon - 11 PM  Closed Sunday

name: Sound Brewing
description: Our tasting room is located inside the brewery complete with all the sounds, aromas, sights and sensations of a working production brewery. We have up to 11 of our beers on tap for $4/glass as well as non-alcoholic, small-batch Ginger Ale made right here in the brewery.    We have snack food such as smoked salmon and cheese from Crimson Cove Smokehouse, cookies from Mirracole Morsels and peanuts from CB's Nuts. If you have a big appetite, you are welcome to bring in food of your own or order something for delivery while you are here.    Children are welcome in our tasting room.
hoursOfOperation: Tasting Room Hours:     Mon-Tues: 2:00-6:00pm     Wed-Fri: 2:00-9:00pm     Sat: Noon-9:00pm     Sun: Noon-7:00pm

name: Souris River Brewing
description: A North Dakota Brewing Company. Locally owned brewery, bar, and restaurant.

name: South Austin Brewery
description: South Austin Brewery was established in January of 2014. Currently South Austin Brewery has three flagship beers. We introduced the line up to the market in early May of this year  Texas Pale Ale, the state’s first Texas-style IPA is an everyday IPA. Kol’ Beer is our Kolsch style beer and quickly becoming a local favorite and go to beer for Texas craft beer drinkers. The Luckenbock is our traditional German style bock beer and is an alternative to Shiner and Zigenbock in the Texas marketplace. We will be  adding two additional beers, Six-String Saison and Crossroads Coffee Stout, to the line up in both cans and kegs.  The Saison is a Belgian-style brew and helps round out our portfolio.

name: South Bend Brew Werks
description: Our mission is to “Build a stronger community, one brew at a time.” That means the community of brewers, of craft beer drinkers, of foodies, of local food producers, and of course, South Bend. We plan to celebrate and support South Bend, honoring its long heritage of brewing and food producing by making great beer and backing it up with locally sourced food. Sustainability is hard at work in South Bend and it’s a core tenet for us. Adaptive reuse is a philosophy we’re embracing fully and you’ll see it throughout our pub. We are fiercely proud of this city and it is an honor to have it as part of our name and be part of its renaissance.

name: South County Brewing Company
description: South County Brewing Co. is located in beautiful southern York county PA.   Brewing handcrafted Ales and lagers on a production system with an onsite taproom for retail sales.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Fri:	5:30 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat:	11:00 am - 3:00 pm

name: South Shore Brewery
description: The South Shore Brewery is dedicated to producing flavorful, innovative products. We use the best of traditional techniques and tap the resources of originality from our professional staff.

name: South Street Brewery
description: The South Street Brewery was founded in 1998, and is housed in the renovated H. H. Hankins Hay and Grain warehouse built in the late 1800’s. Old brick walls, hardwood floors and thick timber pillars provide a striking setting for our custom built brewhouse and a spacious, welcoming atmosphere in which to enjoy our fresh, handcrafted ales and lagers as well as our seasonal fare.  Our commitment to on-premises brewing ensures that only the highest quality ingredients are used and that the beer is always fresh. This commitment has earned us regional and international praise but more importantly, results in a wide selection of styles and new, creative recipes that we hope will continually have our customers discovering new favorites.  Our menu also reflects our dedication to originality and fresh ingredients. We offer a seasonal menu as well as nightly specials, including an eclectic sampling of Contemporary American, Asian-Pacific, Continental, Creole, Caribbean and regional Southern dishes.  Our cuisine and libations are all served in a friendly, relaxed manner that challenges the idea that excellence necessitates pretense. We hope you enjoy your visit to South Street and that you return soon.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	 4:30 pm - 2:00 am  Fri - Sat: 11:30 am - 2:00 am  Sun:	11:30 am - 8:00 pm

name: Southampton Publick House
description: The word about the quality of our beer began to get around the metro New York region as soon as we turned on the spigots and started to serve it in our Southampton restaurant. Almost from day one, leading restaurants, pubs and taverns have requested our crafted brews for  their own patrons. Our Brewmaster, Phil Markowski  has personally directed the flow of our ales and lagers into the finest outlets. Our Mission is to offer a wide variety of specialty ales and lagers.  Our small batch brews range from classic farmhouse styles to traditional sessions beers to be enjoyed year-round.

name: Southbound Brewing Company
description: Southbound Brewing Company is the first production microbrewery located in Savannah, Georgia. Southbound released our first brew on May 15, 2013, and we aspire to become the most innovating and exciting yet. We want to use our backgrounds, skills, and insights to shed light on the beauty of the craft beer industry to our local community. By bringing the American beer revolution to Savannah's back door, we hope to cater to the tastes of the South by tantalizing your taste buds and keeping things interesting!

name: Southern Appalachian Brewery
description: We are a local micro brewery based in Hendersonville, North Carolina (about 20 miles south of Asheville). We look forward to seeing you in the tasting room!
hoursOfOperation: We’re open Wednesday – Sunday  Wednesday – Friday 4pm-close  Saturday & Sunday 2pm-close

name: Southern Hops Brewing Company
description: We are a locally owned and operated brew pub in Florence, S.C.. Our focus is to use local products, promote local bands and give people in Florence a place to call their own. So if your a local this place is for you. If your from out of town come in and see exactly what Florence has to offer.    Southern Hops offers handcrafted beer accompanied by great food and live music, as well as a level of service that defines southern hospitality.

name: Southern Oregon Brewing Company
description: Then we invite you to sample the hand-crafted brews of the Southern Oregon Brewing Company.  Brewed with uncompromised standards in Medford, Oregon, we’re dedicated to producing a full line of tantalizing brews using old-world brewing techniques and only the finest natural ingredients.    Served at discriminating restaurants and bars, one sip and you'll know that you've discovered something quiet extraordinary… beer that has been crafted by beer lovers for beer lovers.  As a Southern Oregon owned crafted brewery, we’re dedicated to the highest standards of quality and returning a percentage of our profits to the local community.

name: Southern Pacific Brewing
description: At the helm of Southern Pacific’s 15 barrel specific mechanical system is Andy French, whose clean, dry, true-to-style beers are the main features of a drinks lineup that boasts many attractions, including unique guest brews and high-caliber specialty cocktails
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Thu - Sat: 11:00 am - 2:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 12:00 am

name: Southern Pines Brewing Company
description: Southern Pines Brewing Company is a craft brewery that produces the highest quality beer for your community.

name: Southern Star Brewing Company
description: Located in Conroe, Texas, Southern Star Brewing Company will provide Texans(and others) new craft beers to enjoy from our 10,000 square foot warehouse.     Production began in March of 2008 with our signature beer of Pine Belt Pale Ale which is in our distinctive 16oz can or in kegs. This has now expanded to include Bombshell Blonde(12oz cans) and Buried Hatchet Stout(12oz cans), but both are also kegged. These will just be a few of the ales we will be offering as we expand into seasonal batches, plus we just started our PRO-AM line of brews where home brewers can compete to have their recipe produced at our brewery(with the help of the creators if they desire). The winning entry will also be entered into the GABF.     Thanks to the help of our five distributors, we are able to get our brews to a variety of locations(including grocery stores, beverage shops, pubs and restaurants) throughout Texas and a few other states including Alabama, Florida, Indiana, Kentucky, Ohio, and South Carolina. Unfortunately due to laws in Texas we can't tell you where you can buy our beers, but we are working at trying to get them to as many of your favorite craft beer establishments as possible.
hoursOfOperation: We hold tours every Saturday at 1pm

name: Southern Tier Brewing Company
description: Southern Tier Brewing Company was founded in 2004 by Phineas DeMink and Allen Yahn with the vision of bringing small batch brewing back to a region rich in brewing tradition. In 2003 Skip and Phin purchased the defunct Old Saddle Back Brewing Co. in Pittsfield, Massachusetts. All the equipment was removed and brought back to Lakewood, New York and set up at its new 10,000 square foot home, The Southern Tier Brewing Company. The Brewery began operations in February 2004 distributing regionally. By 2005 sales covered the majority of the New York State and the eastern half of Pennsylvania. In the beginning their two Flagship brands were a Pilsner and Mild Ale. Oh yeah they also brewed IPA! As it turned out the flagships were a flop and the IPA was a huge success. They next launched a line of seasonal beers which have gained great success. Since the beginning, Southern Tier has experienced steady growth, currently distributing to over 25% of the United States. Multiple expansions have been made to keep up with demand and the brewery continues to be innovative by producing new products.  Keep a look out for new products coming to stores near you.

name: Southport
description: Welcome to SBC Restaurant & Brewery, where culinary excellence and brewing expertise has been a Connecticut staple since 1997. We are more than a restaurant; we’re a friendly neighbor with your comfort in mind. We are more than a brewery; we are a stylish escape with endless possibilities.    Our Branford, Stamford, Southport, & Milford locations offer tasty menu selections for brunch, lunch and dinner. Dining out should be a unique experience, and the staff at our five restaurants will ensure excellent service, delicious food and a memorable time. So bring in your family and friends and share in the SBC experience. Your table awaits...    SBC’s 27 home-brews are processed with the finest natural ingredients and will satisfy all patrons - from the casual taster to the sophisticated connoisseur. We invite you to sample our incredible selection in our comfortable dining rooms or distinctive taprooms.

name: Speakeasy Ales and Lagers
description: In a typically foggy San Francisco summer in 1997, we were determined to bring our unique West Coast-style beers from the underground to the masses. Defiantly producing small batches of beer in a secret warehouse in San Francisco’s long forgotten Butchertown District, we quickly gained a fiercely loyal following with bold, complex beers and striking 1920’s imagery. Starting with a single, iconic beer that immortalized the spirit of the bootleggers who persevered when America’s taps ran dry—a bold, hoppy amber ale known as Prohibition Ale—we now brew a wide array of acclaimed beers from hoppy pale ales to stouts aged in whiskey barrels. After 16 years of making great beer in the Bay Area, we have grown by leaps and bounds, yet we still produce many of our beers on the original steam-fired brewhouse that started it all.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	9:00 am - 10:00 am  Fri - Sat:	12:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Spellbound Brewing
description: Our mission is to brew the finest ales in the Northeast. We want to make sure that our beers are approachable to people just starting in the craft beer world, yet with enough complexity for the beer geek. Our goal is to brew several year round beers with a diverse lineup of seasonal and one time beers.

name: Spider Bite Brewing Co.
description: Beers are being distributed around Long Island and the city now. We will be posting new locations as the beers go on tap so keep checking back.

name: Spinnaker Bay Brewing
description: Spinnaker Bay Brewing is a woman founded, built, owned and run brewery.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Fri: 5:00pm - 9:30pm  Sat: 3:00pm - 7:00pm

name: Spiteful Brewing
description: Spiteful Brewing was founded in January 2010 by Brad Shaffer and Jason Klein. While the brewery is new, we have known each other since we were kids. It was a friendship that started instantly following a spiteful incident during a hockey game on the pond. Initially home brewing in the kitchen on a stove, we’ve slowly upgraded our system as we gained experience and understanding of the brewing process. We now have a Brew-Magic system by Sabco, which is a 13 gallon semi automated pilot brewery.     As a nanobrewery our goal is to supply a few great bars in Chicago with kegs that we will hand deliver. Our beers are made with the freshest malts, hops, and yeast purchased locally. This provides much more flavor compared to typical light beer massed produced today. We have moved into our new commercial space located just south of the Ravenswood neighborhood and have approval from the federal government. We are currently working towards our state permits.

name: Spoetzl Brewery
description: Spoetzl was founded in 1909, and claims to be the oldest independent brewery in Texas. A group of businessmen incorporated Shiner Brewing Association and placed Herman Weiss in as the company's first brewmaster. In 1914 a German immigrant brewer named Kosmas (or Kosmos) Spoetzl co-leased with Oswald Petzold with an option to buy in 1915. Spoetzl had attended brewmaster's school and apprenticed for three years in Germany, worked for eight years at the Pyramids Brewery in Cairo, Egypt, and then worked in Canada. He moved to San Antonio in search of a better climate for his health, bringing with him a family recipe for a Bavarian beer made from malted barley and hops.

name: Sprague Farm & Brew Works
description: Here at Sprague Farm & Brew Works we practice the "mixed mashall arts."   We embrace untamed and extreme brewing ideas along with our common sense philosophy:   "Approach your day (and your beer) the Sprague way!"

name: Sprecher Brewing Company
description: Established in 1985, Sprecher is Milwaukee's Original Microbrewery. We brew over 20 different beers as well as 8 gourmet sodas, including our world famous Sprecher Root Beer.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 6:00 pm

name: Spring House Brewing Company
description: Located in Conestoga, PA in the heart of Lancaster County.

name: Taproom
hoursOfOperation: Mon: 4:00 pm - 12:00 am  Tue - Sat: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Sun: 12:00 pm - 11:00 pm

name: Springfield Brewing Company
description: An anchor to the re-birth of downtown Springfield since 1997, Springfield Brewing Company is a must-visit destination for beer and food enthusiasts traveling the area. Springfield Brewing Company is truly a wonderful facility, staffed with a great group of individuals. We bring together the finest brewing ingredients in one of the world’s best small brewing facilities to brew excellent beers. Local before local was cool, our kitchen matches our brewers passion for craft brewed beer with their made-from-scratch dishes with local products. We have no hatchet men or Madison Avenue suits on our staff; just a group of hard-working local business owners in search of excellence. Our mission is to brew inspired beer, produce excellent food, offer a superb facility while arming SBC with a personable staff. Cheers!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Tue: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Wed - Thu: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Fri: 11:00 am - 1:00 am  Sat: 7:00 am - 1:00 am  Sun: 7:00 am - 12:00 am

name: Square One Brewery & Distillery
description: The Square One Brewery & Distillery began operations as a brewery /restaurant in February of 2006. In August of 2008 Square One became the first microdistillery restaurant in the state of Missouri and one of the first in the country. We believe that our approach to the alcohol beverage program is unique and very different from that of other restaurants. We believe in crafting the products we serve whether it is spirits, beer or food. By combining the expertise of our distiller, our master brewer, and our chef we are committed to creating an amazing array of flavors and tastes for our customers.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat: 11:00 am - 1:30 am  Sun: 10:00 am - 12:00 am

name: Squatters Craft Beers
description: Although much has changed (now three locations and a microbrewery), we remain firmly dedicated to our original goal; provide our customers world-class handcrafted beer and food in a warm, friendly environment.    As Squatters grew we embraced the Triple Bottom Line philosophy of People Planet Profit. We source healthy ingredients and use environmentally friendly products and services from within our local eco-region. We develop long-term relationships with farmers, growers and suppliers so we know exactly what is, and is not, in the products we buy. We choose to support local non-profit organizations. We buy BlueSky wind power and are continuously working to reduce our carbon footprint.    We believe these and other practices contribute to a healthy community and environment, locally and globally, making our city a better place to live, work, and drink world-class Squatters beers.
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Thu 11:00am to 12:00 Midnight  Fri 11:00am to 1:00am  Sat 10:30am to 1:00am  Sun 10:30am to 12:00 Midnight

name: Park City
hoursOfOperation: Sunday - Thursday 8:00am to 10:00pm  Friday 8:00am to 11:00pm  Saturday 8:00am to 11:00pm

name: Salt Lake International Airport
hoursOfOperation: Daily 7:30am to 9:00pm

name: St Elias Brewing Company
description: We are a brewpub located in Soldotna, AK. We specialize in handcrafted ales and stone fired pizza.    At St. Elias Brewing Company, we believe in handcrafting innovative, high quality, world class beers. Our beers match the personality of our business, fun and lively, yet historic and eclectic. Brewing on a 7 barrel brewhouse, we promise our product will arrive fresh in your glass, as beer was intended. Why should your beer travel across the country to your glass, when you can get one fresh from across the room?
hoursOfOperation: SUMMER HOURS:  Sunday – Thursday 12pm-10pm  Friday & Saturday 12pm-11pm

name: St. Ambrose Cellars
description: Meadery/Winery in northern Michigan producing a full line of still meads 12% abv and draft meads 6.5% abv.

name: St. Boniface Craft Brewing Company
description: Saint Boniface Craft Brewing Co is a nano-brewery located in Ephrata, Pa. After years of brewing and competing with each other for kudos in their local community, Mike Price and Jon Northup decided to join forces and produce the best beer that we—using our combined brewing experience—could produce.    Saint Boniface is the name of the patron saint of brewers, the saint also associated with converting Germany to Christianity. St. Boniface saw the unconverted Saxons worshiping Thor and knew something must be done. The humble saint took an axe to the massive Thor Oak, which was sacred to the Saxons, in order to show them that his God was mightier than theirs. With fierce and repeated blows he leveled the massive tree; those around him feared God and were converted to Christianity.    The deed of Boniface provides an elegant analogy for our own mission at Saint Boniface Craft Brewing Co. Mike and Jon have witnessed many beer “pagans” worshiping the false gods of the big beer industry and see that it is time to take a Boniface-like swing at converting some of those people to a better way of life, one full of rich, tasty, more satisfying brews.
hoursOfOperation: Thurs: 6:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat:	9:00 am - 4:00 pm

name: St. Brigid's Brewery
description: We like to keep things as locally as we can.  The hops we use come from one hop farm in the Yakima Valley.  The brewers grains are from the Okanogan Valley and the yeast comes from Hood River, Oregon.       Come taste what our taproom in Moses Lake offers.  St. Brigid's Brewery Taproom: "Because beer should taste good!"
hoursOfOperation: Thu:  3:30am - 9:30pm Fri:  3:30am - 9:30pm Sat:  3:30am - 9:30pm

name: St. Florian's Brewery
description: To introduce ourselves to you…    Amy: a former Silicon-Valley sales and marketing manager, turned stay-at-home mom, had an itch to share her husband’s delectable brews with the masses, while simultaneously contributing philanthropically...    Aron: our Windsor Fire Captain & hero is dedicated to artfully creating very gratifying brews...    St. Florian's Brewery donates a minimum of 5% of our profits to fire-related & community-based organizations. We parent two toddlers who love St. Florian’s Brewery as much as we do.  Our young lads cannot wait to take over the family business someday & do all that they can to contribute to its success today.  We proudly teach them the ropes of the brewing process & the importance of strong business ethics at their young age. Together we are St. Florian’s Brewery: determined to have the happiest of customers & most delighted imbibers.

name: St. Francis Brewery
description: Saint Francis Brewery opened in the Spring of 2009 to great popularity and success.    Known for our hand-crafted beers,  Brewmaster Scott Hettig has built upon our foundation of five beers:  Kolsch, Amber Ale, Nut Brown Ale, Weiss and Oatmeal Stout to feature a Bohemian Pilsner, Double Red Ale, Belgian Triple and many more.    These wonderful beers are complimented by the great food Executive Chef Ron Wolf creates.  When you stop in, make sure you try our ribs!  They are made with our signature Oatmeal Stout BBQ Sauce

name: St. George Brewing Company
description: From humble beginnings as a "Brew on Premises" BOP establishment located in a store-front in a strip mall in Virginia Beach in 1991, B. A. Brewmeister has come of age as a brewery of craft beers with its 'brew haus' and 'celler' sharing a 10,000 square foot facility located at 204 Challenger Way in Hampton, Virginia. B.A. Brewmeister currently trades as The St. George Brewing Company & Olde Richmond Ale Company.

name: St. Lawrence Brewing Company
description: Bringing craft beer to the North Country!
hoursOfOperation: Taproom Hours: Mon. 8-12; Wed. & Thurs. 5-9; Fri. & Sat. 5-10; Sun. 1-6  Brewery Tours: Fri. & Sat. 7-9

name: St. Petersburg Brewing Co.
description: St Pete Brewing Company is the home of St Pete Orange Wheat and will be producing more beers once we open our downtown location.

name: Stadium Brewing Company
description: Stadium Brewing Company is known as much for our fantastic food as we are for our magnificent micro brews and fabulous cocktails! Anytime you come in you'll be treated to delicious appetizers and a full bar with skilled servers and bartenders who can make you anything you desire.    Stadium Brewing Company offers a unique experience setting it apart from all other restaurants! Our uniqueness is defined by the combination of a brewery, sports bar and fine dining with a great ambiance.    Try one of our hand-crafted brews by acclaimed Brew master, Greg Schneider or our pepper crusted ahi tuna from Executive Chef, Octavio Montoya, renowned teacher at the Laguna Beach school of Culinary Arts, known for creating a fusion of multi-cultural classic dishes prepared with a creative twist.

name: Standard Brewing
description: A small brewery in Seattle. About as small as you can get, actually.
hoursOfOperation: Wednesday 4pm-8pm  Thursday 4pm-8pm  Friday 4pm-8pm  Saturday 2pm-8pm  Sunday 2pm-8pm

name: Standing Stone Brewing Company
description: Ashland's only full service brewpub is housed in an historic building with a light industrial character. We offer our own freshly brewed handcrafted ales and lagers, including seasonal and other specialty brews.  All Standing Stone Ales are made here at the brewery in ten barrel batches using over 80% organic malts.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri: 11:30 am - 12:00 am  Sat: 8:00 am - 12:00 am  Sun: 11:30 am - 12:00 am

name: Starkey's Lookout
description: Starkey's Lookout is a new concept tasting facility located about nine miles north of Watkins Glen at 5428 State Route 14 in Starkey, New York. Starkey's will feature SencaHayes and Twisted Screw wines, G.C. Starkey beer, and a variety of appetizers and hor 'doeuvres that will pair well with one or the other.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat: 11:00 am - 6:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Starpoint Brewing
description: Nestled in the pine forests of Carrboro NC, Starpoint Brewing is bringing the freshest and best tasting ales and lagers to the locals. We are looking forward to serving the triangle and beyond!!!

name: Starr Hill Brewery
description: In the mid-90’s, Master Brewer Mark Thompson returned to his native Virginia from Portland, OR, having learned two things: first, that the craft of artisanal brewing was one part science and one part art; and second, that making delicious beer was a lot cooler than anything he had ever done as a biology student. After several years of apprenticing with other master brewers, Mark was ready to begin crafting beer using his own recipes.    He found the perfect spot in Charlottesville, VA; a historic storefront on Main Street that was once home to the state of Virginia’s first craft brewing operation. In September 1999, Mark re-opened the doors and introduced the Starr Hill Brewery. Named after the local neighborhood, the brewery shared its historic building with the legendary Starr Hill Music Hall, and it was there that Mark's delicious craft beers became a favorite to visiting beer lovers, musicians, and music fans from around the world. Nineteen prestigious awards later, Mark’s brews continue to be a hit at beer and music festivals nationwide.    In 2005, in response to the growing demand, Mark moved from this small brewing operation to a larger brewing facility several miles outside of town, nestled in the rolling foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Starr Hill's core and seasonal brews are now enjoyed in restaurants and music clubs throughout the Mid Atlantic and Southeast, and are also available at many grocery and convenience stores in the region.    Mark is proud of the awards his microbrews have earned, and the experts agree that he is among the best craft brewers in the country. But at the end of the day, what still matters most to Mark and his team of brewers at Starr Hill is giving people the gift of great beer.

name: Starrlight Mead
description: After several years as home mead makers, we are thrilled to be opening Starrlight Mead. We have had a fantastic time making mead and meeting mead drinkers from all over the world, and now its our turn to share our love of mead with all of you!    Becky Starr, Owner, Sales/Tasting Room Manager  Ben Starr, Owner, Wine/Meadmaker    We first discovered mead in CA at the Southern California Renaissance Pleasure Faire. Several years later, we found friends that were home brewing mead with good results. We decided to try our hand at it too.    In February 2006, we entered our first competition and took Best in Show out of over 210 entries in the home mead-maker category at the International Mead Association’s Mead Festival. The competition was judged by seven professionals in the mead industry; including Ken Schramm, author of The Compleat Mead Maker, and meadery owners from around the world. The Best in Show prize was selected from the gold medal winners in nine categories. Our “Starrlight Mulled Apple Cyser” was awarded not only the gold medal in the cyser (mead made with apples) category, but was also selected as the best overall representation of mead making. It was at that point we decided to try creating a business from our love of mead.    Ben shares his expertise and love of brewing by conducting demonstrations and workshops on mead making in the local community. We also organize and conduct the local Mead Day celebration each August (since 2005) and are a key part of the product tasting team for mead reviews on Gotmead.com. Becky worked with Chatham Hill Winery for 2 years learning tasting room and wine club management. We are members of the Chatham County Beekeepers Association, and the NC Winegrowers Association.
hoursOfOperation: Regular Hours  Thursdays and Fridays from noon til 6 pm    Saturdays from noon til 6 pm  Meadery tours at 1 pm, 3 pm & 5 pm.    Sundays from 1 pm til 5 pm  Meadery tours at 2 pm & 4 pm.

name: Station 26 Brewing Co.
description: Denver fire station turned brewery + taproom    5280's 2014 "Best New Brewery"     Westword's 2014 "Best Taproom - Ambience"

name: Steadfast Beer Company
description: Steadfast Beer Co. proudly produces delicious, Gluten-Free craft beer! Look for our first offering, Steadfast Sorghum Pale Ale, in the Gluten-Free section of your favorite Capital Region beer stores! If you want your local bar or restaurant to carry our beer, please tell them to email us - we'll take care of the rest!    We are dedicated to producing Gluten-Free beers that are high in quality and full of flavor. Every day, more Americans are switching to craft beer because IT TASTES GOOD! For those folks who follow a Gluten-Free diet by choice or by necessity and still want to experience the taste of craft beer, Steadfast Beer Co. thinks outside the box, while thinking about what's inside the bottle. Creatively-written recipes and attention to detail make Steadfast a Gluten-Free beer that you can trust!

name: Steam Plant Grill
description: Welcome to the Steam Plant, home to Stacks Restaurant a premier restaurant and the Steam Plant Brewing Co. and Pub. Located in a completely renovated historic landmark in the heart of downtown Spokane! Just look for the twin smokestacks!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 3:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 3:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Sun: 3:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Durango
description: Steamworks Brewing Co. opened its doors in Durango in September 1996. A favorite watering hole for locals and visitors alike, our brewpub has much more to offer than award-winning craft beer. Known as a town meeting place, Steamworks enjoys a bustling, fun environment.    Steamworks’ culinary program is unmatched in the region in both breadth and quality of offerings. Our “gastropub” fare includes regionally-raised meats and sustainable seafood. Healthy salads, delicious pizzas, spicy Southwestern-style dishes, and vegetarian & gluten-free offerings provide something for everyone who’s hungry.  Stop by to discover what’s “on tap.” Hang with the locals. Catch a game.  Enjoy a fresh beer and outstanding food. Every day promises a screaming deal and fun to be had!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Thurs - Sat: 11:00 am - 2:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 12:00 am

name: Steel String Brewery
description: Steel String Brewery is coming to Carrboro, North Carolina. A small brewery committed to producing consciously crafted, locally committed, superior quality ales.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 5:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sun: 5:00 pm - 12:00 am

name: Steel Toe Brewing
description: Here at STB we believe in working our ass off for what we believe in, following our passion, giving back to and working with the community that supports us, being conscious of the world around us, producing the best quality product we can and kicking back with great beer at the end of the day.    We are a small MN craft brewery with big dreams of staying small.

name: Stem Ciders
description: At Stem Ciders, we are committed to creating ciders of the highest quality that honor the purity and complexity that is inherent to the apple. We can’t wait to introduce you to your perfect cider match. We are dedicated to reviving the cider tradition, which goes far beyond what you enjoy in your glass. We hold our growers in the highest regard, and by fostering relationships with them we reward their hard work and promote the regrowth of heirloom apple cultivation. We love our home-base in Denver, and embrace the Colorado lifestyle that makes us lug a bottle to share up a mountain to enjoy a drink with a view. Most importantly, we love nothing more than seeing that smile on your face when you have your first sip of one of our crisp, refreshing ciders.
hoursOfOperation: Wed–Thu: 4pm–10pm  Fri: 4pm–11pm  Sat: Noon–11pm  Sun: Noon–6pm

name: Sterling Beer Company
description: In its heyday, Sterling Beer was a premium Pilsner beer in the American standard style. It was available in bottles, cans and on draft. Its market area included Indiana, Illinois, Kentucky (very popular in Greater Louisville), Ohio, Tennessee, Georgia, Alabama, Mississippi and occasionally a few other states. Sterling Beer was brewed continuously from 1863 until the early 2000s when its latest owner, Pittsburgh Brewing Company, stopped making it after the company emerged from bankruptcy. The brand is in limbo and it will probably come back some day.

name: Steuben Brewing Company
description: Steuben Brewing Company is a farm brewery that produces New York State labeled beer. We utilize ingredients that are grown and produced in New York State. We strive to make great beer that supports local farmers.

name: Steve and Clark's Brew Pub and Sausage Co. #2
Stevens Point Brewery
description: The Stevens Point Brewery is steeped in a history that has transcended the trials of the Civil War, the Great Depression and Prohibition. More than 150 years later, the Stevens Point Brewery continues to successfully brew quality beer, just as the brewery’s founders, Frank Wahle and George Ruder, did in 1857. This undeniable endurance is a testament of why the Stevens Point Brewery, in Stevens Point, Wisconsin, is the 5th oldest continuously operating brewery remaining in the United States. Today, the Stevens Point Brewery is proud to be Wisconsin-owned and independently operated.

name: Stewart's Brewing Company
description: Established in 1995, we are New Castle County's 1st brewpub.    It has always been our goal to provide the best handcrafted beer, fresh food & impeccable service.
hoursOfOperation: Open every day from 11:00am-1:00am

name: Stillwater Artisanal Ales
description: "A sincere artist is not one who makes a faithful attempt to put on to canvas what is in front of him, but one who tries to create something which is, in itself, a living thing." -Sir William Dobell    The goal of Stillwater Artisanal is just that, living art. Although packaged within a medium often overlooked for its artistic merits, our desire is to offer something new and intriguing. We present more than just a fine crafted beverage, rather an occasion that evokes an emotion and inspires contemplation. For art is not a sum of actions but rather an approach to life. We draw our inspiration from the world around us, whether that be a season, location, or even humanity itself. Our intent is to encapsulate this muse exhibiting an artistic rendition to the best of our abilities.

name: Stone Brewing Co.
description: Founded by Greg Koch and Steve Wagner in 1996, San Diego-based Stone Brewing Co. is the 10th largest craft brewer in the United States. Stone has been listed on the Inc. 500 | 5000 Fastest Growing Private Companies list nine times, and has been called the “All-time Top Brewery on Planet Earth” by BeerAdvocate magazine twice. The multi-faceted company will be the first American craft brewer to independently own and operate facilities in Berlin, Germany and also has plans to open operations east of the Mississippi. Known for its bold, flavorful and largely hop-centric beers, Stone has earned a reputation for brewing outstanding, unique beers while maintaining an unwavering commitment to sustainability, business ethics, philanthropy and the art of brewing.

name: Stone Brewing World Bistro & Gardens - Liberty Station
Stone Cellar Brewpub & Restaurant
description: 1989 was the year this particular brewery was established. At the time, it was Wisconsin’s third Brewpub. Since that time #1 and #2 have vanished leaving Stone Cellar Brewpub the oldest, continually running Brewpub in the state of Wisconsin. All this in a building built 151 years ago to house a brewery!    We brew in 7 barrel (217 gallon) batches on an old, yet reliable brewhouse and can produce up to 1,000 barrels per year. We also have a small bottling line which allows us to sell bottles of our beers right from our bar.    Stone Cellar beer to go!  6 packs and growlers of Stone Cellar beer can be purchased in our bar area to enjoy at home!
hoursOfOperation: Mon: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm  Tue - Sat: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: Stone Corral Brewery
description: Stone Corral Brewery is a craft nano brewery located in Huntington, Vermont. We be opening in August. Our goal is to provide our local community with fresh, great tasting beer. Check out stonecorral.com for information about our beer

name: Stone's Throw Brewing
description: Stone's Throw Brewing is the creation of four guys who met in the local home brew club, the Central Arkansas Fermenters.

name: Stonecutters Brewhouse
description: Stonecutters Brewhouse is a 4 barrel brewhouse located in central Vermont in the small town (pop. 9000) of Barre. Barre is the sister town to Montpelier, which is the capital of Vermont. Stonecutters is a locally owned and operated.

name: Stonefly Brewing Co
description: Stonefly Brewing Company (AKA Stonefly Brewery) has been a staple of the Riverwest neighborhood since 2006. With an onsite dedicated beer geek brewing staff, Stonefly has released a number of festival award winning brews and gained a very great respect among local and national beer drinkers alike. Stonefly's kitchen also has reason to boast with an amazing Friday Fish Fry, and a weekend must brunch menu that will more than satisfy any taste. And last but not least is Stonefly's consistently entertaining stage lineup. Stonefly always keeps the stage hot with bands and entertainment for all ears and eyes.

name: Stony Creek Beer
description: Here at Stony Creek Brewery, we think there's nothing better than drinking a true craft beer. Craft beer is an adventure and a destination. It tells the story of our local flavor. You see, it's not just a beer to have, it's a beer we’ll have with you.

name: Smithfield
description: Smithfield, VA    It will be the first brewery in Western Tidewater that produces European-inspired craft beers, using locally-raised hops and grains when possible. The tasting room will have a European flare, giving our guests a relaxing, family-friendly place to enjoy their favorite ales, lagers and stouts.    Storm Forge's tasting room is hoping to achieve Gemütlichkeit, a German word that refers to a situation that induces a cheerful mood, peace of mind with connotation of belonging and social acceptance, coziness and unhurry.

name: Storm Peak Brewing Company
description: Consider our taproom your new living room. Watch a live show on one of our music nights or catch a game on one of our big-screens. Order some food from our list of delivery companies or share a bowl of popcorn from our snack collection. Make yourself at home.     Our beers explore a wide range of styles and dimensions from our light, crisp, Golden Ale to our dark and intriguing Black Ale. Aside from our staple brews, we offer a range of seasonal styles that explore the beautiful and ever changing seasons of the Yampa Valley. Have a style you’re really craving? Let us know and we just might make it!

name: Stormbreaker Brewing
description: Look for our beers across town starting in January. Come have a beer with us at our location in February!

name: Stormcloud Brewing Company
description: Now open just two blocks from Lake Michigan in the lakeside town of Frankfort, MI, a small brewery crafting ales within the time-honored Belgian brewing tradition of ignoring time-honored brewing traditions.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 11:00 pm

name: Stoudt's Brewery
description: Over 26 years, Stoudt's Brewing Company has grown and evolved from a small brewery with limited draught distribution, to a packaging regional microbrewery with distribution in 17 different states, producing over 10,000 barrels a year. Even with the growth over the years, one thing has always remained constant, and that is the attention to detail that goes into every batch of handcrafted beer that is traditionally brewed, packaged and sold with passion by our small team of hardworking dedicated employees. A tradition that was started by Ed and Carol Stoudt who both continue to spread the gospel of craft beer!
hoursOfOperation: Ed Stoudt's free tour: Sat. 3 pm and Sun. 1 pm

name: Stoup Brewing
description: Stoup Brewing – The Art and Science of Beer    At Stoup, our craftsmanship is a testament to our commitment to the art and the science of beer. As scientists, we hold the microorganisms and chemical processes that create beer in the highest esteem. As artists, we revel in a good pour. The dual disposition honors traditional styles perfected by earlier brew-masters as well as elevates craft brewing by continually seeking a better pint.    Our brewery will communicate a respect for both the art and science of beer by cultivating a warm and communal environment – a place for friends to gather and for enthusiasts to chat with the brewers over a well-fashioned, delicious beer.
hoursOfOperation: Monday11:00 AM — 11:00 AM  Tuesday11:00 AM — 11:00 AM  Wednesday11:00 AM — 11:00 AM  Thursday11:00 AM — 11:00 AM  Friday11:00 AM — 11:00 AM  Saturday11:00 AM — 11:00 AM  Sunday11:00 AM — 11:00 AM

name: Straight to Ale
description: Located in the historic Lincoln Mills, we are working hard to provide our hometown of Huntsville, Alabama with top quality, full flavored beer in styles ranging from English brown ales to American Imperial IPA’s and everything in between. You can find our beer on draft at many local restaurants and bars. If we’re not already on tap at your favorite hang-out, please ask them why not!    Straight To Ale’s products are distributed throughout our great state of Alabama by our friends at Alabama Beverage.
hoursOfOperation: The Tap Room is open Wednesday through Saturday from 3pm until 8pm.    FREE brewery tours are given on Saturdays at 2PM.  Weekly tour is limited to 20 people and you must be 21 or over. Reservations are required.

name: Strand Brewing Co
description: Strand Brewing Co is located in Torrance, CA - along the southern coast of Los Angeles County - nestled in and amongst the sleepy beach communities collectively known as The South Bay.      We currently distribute our beers throughout Southern California via Wine Warehouse.  Though our focus is currently on the greater Los Angeles and Orange County areas, we can be found as far south as San Diego and as far north as Sacramento     It is with great pride that we continue to be part of the growing craft beer culture here in L.A.  We hope to produce outstanding beer for years to come.

name: Strange Craft Beer Company
description: Strange Brewing Company, opened in May of 2010, was Denver's first successful nanobrewery, brewing on a one-barrel homebrew setup. Though we have expanded to a 10bbl system, we kept our original setup and brew a 1bbl experimental every Wednesday. With 12 taps in our Tasting Room, you're sure to find something you like.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 3:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun:  1:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Strangeways Brewing
description: Think Strange. Drink Strange.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Fri: 4:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 2:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Strawn Brewing Company
description: Welcome to Strawn Brewing Company! If you work hard and enjoy great craft beer like we do you have found the right place. Join up with the brothers Strawn and see what it takes to build a microbrewery.    Two brothers who work hard and love making beer are opening a local microbrewery in Fairburn, GA. Check back often to see how a brewery gets built.

name: Strike Brewing Co
description: Knowing fellow competitors, adventurers, and explorers seek beers with flavor and character, we founded Strike Brewing. Our goal is to create distinctive beers for active individuals who can’t just stand on the sidelines. Enjoy Strike’s unique session beers with friends in conversation and celebration. These beers were brewed to reward hard work and fuel the “fire within.”

name: Stroh Brewery Company
description: A name as important to the success of Detroit as Ford or Chrysler, the Stroh family began with humble roots, brewing beer in a family-owned inn during the 18th century in Kirn, Germany. In 1848, during the German Revolution, Bernhard Stroh, having apprenticed at his father side, immigrated to the United States. He established his own brewery in Detroit in 1850. Stroh named his new company Lion's Head Brewery, adopting the Lion's Crest logo from the Kyrburg Castle in Germany – the same crest that adorns Stroh beers today    After establishing the brewery, Bernhard's son, Bernhard Jr., continued its expansion. A firm proponent of tradition and quality, he introduced the European method of fire-brewing to America. The fire-brewing process uses a direct flame rather than steam to heat beer-filled copper kettles. The resulting higher temperatures intensify the aroma and body of beer, resulting in a more flavorful brew.    During Prohibition, the Stroh family operated the business under the name The Stroh Products Company, producing near beer (beer with its alcohol extracted), birch beer, soft drinks, malt products, ice cream, and ice. Though production of most of these items ceased when Prohibition ended in 1933, Stroh Ice Cream can still be enjoyed at parlors today.    The Stroh Brewery grew alongside the other titans of Detroit industry. In 1964 the company made its first move toward expansion when it bought the Goebel Brewing Company, with an eye towards national distribution. As other national brands began to enter the Detroit market, Stroh began to aggressively pursue other markets.    In 1973, Peter Stroh's willingness to depart from years of tradition enabled Stroh's to survive, but the changes were hard to swallow for many Stroh's employees. Stroh broke the company's tradition of family management and recruited managers from other companies. He also introduced a light beer, Stroh's Light.    Though the brewery encountered many difficult times, the tradition and quality of Stroh's has never changed, and the quality of Bernhard's family-owned beer continue today, with Stroh's and Stroh's Light.

name: Strong Arm Brewing
description: We love beer! We have a passion for brewing it, sharing it with our friends and of course drinking it. We wanted to do something we love, a dream turned into reality and strong arm brewing was born.     We have spent the last few years perfecting our brews and now you can enjoy the fruits of our labor with us. When you are as committed as we are to the process, use the best ingredients and understand beer like we do the end result is nothing short of wonderful.     So join us by gathering a few friends and tilting back a chilled pint glass filled with one of our signature brews. We thank you for doing so and know you will love it as much as we do.
hoursOfOperation: Wed:  5:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  5:00pm - 8:00pm  Also open some Saturdays.

name: Strong Rope Brewing
description: Strong Rope Brewery, owned and operated by Head Brewer Jason Sahler will create distinctive American Ales. From classic American styles to Wild American ales and unique seasonal offerings that use the freshest vegetables, fruits, herbs and spices. While serving many of the ales on Draft, the brewery will also have a strong cask and bottle conditioning program, showcasing all the nuances of the full American flavors in the more subtle cask and bottle conditioned environment. Building on the local movement, StrongRope will feature regional ingredients and focus on distribution within 200 miles. In addition, the brewery will serve as a learning center, aiming to educate consumers on the qualities of true craft beer, with frequent classes and events.

name: Stubborn Beauty Brewing
description: Stubborn beauty brewing company is committed to brewing unique, full flavored beers that enrich the lives of our consumers and to being a positive presence within the communities we serve.    Through creativity, innovation and experimentation stubborn beauty produces a diverse line of beers. while respecting brewing tradition we also employ a healthy dose of both revolution and evolution. to revolt is to be american. we are bound only by the limits of our own imagination.

name: Stumblefoot Brewing Co.
description: Stumblefoot Brewing Co. has set out to make some of the most interesting styles of beer we can think of. We want our beer to be an artisan experience of local flavor.     Stumblefoot Brewery is in its second year of joining the ranks of new breweries. We have setup in San Diego's North County - in San Marcos, CA. This area has become known as a mecca for beer. And all you need to do be a part of it is ... Represent!    Stumblefoot is a name that personifies the boot strap and prototyping format we have gone about creating our brewery. The name pays tribute to our willingness to experiment.    We decided to come up with a definition that incorporates the essence of our experience:  Stumblefoot – \’st?m • b?l • fut\ (noun)   1) The art and science of gaining new knowledge through the happenstance of interesting encounters. Fortune favors the prepared.  See also: Organic, sharing, open-minded, kismet, lucky
hoursOfOperation: Thu: 4:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri: 3:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat: 2:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Sun: 1:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Sturgeon Bay Brewing
description: (No longer brewing)

name: Sudwerk Brewing Co.
description: With a foundation of over 25 years of brewing authentic German-style craft lagers, Sudwerk focuses on hand crafted beers that showcase the nexus of German tradition and West Coast brewing innovation.

name: Sullivan's Black Forest Brew Haus & Grill
Summit Brewing Company
description: Summit Brewing Company is a regional craft brewery in St. Paul, Minnesota that brews a wide selection of popular beers. It is sometimes mistakenly believed to be a microbrewery, even though Summit's output is in the top 50 of breweries in the United States, approximately 80,000 barrels of beer per year. Their flagship beer, an American pale ale (branded Summit Extra Pale Ale) is especially popular in the Twin Cities area.
hoursOfOperation: Tours  Tues. & Thurs. at 1:00pm AND Sat. at 10:30am & 1:00pm ALL tours require reservations. Visit summitbrewing.com to book online or call 651-265-7800 for reservations.

name: Sun King Brewing Company
description: Sun King Brewing Company is an Indianapolis-based craft brewery with a focus on continually creating traditional seasonal and unique specialty beers.     Sun King rolled its first keg of beer out the door in July 2009 and since that time has grown into the second largest brewery in Indiana, producing over 21,000 barrels of beer in 2013. Sun King's beers have been awarded multiple medals at the Great American Beer Festival and World Beer Cup.    Located in a downtown Indianapolis warehouse, Sun King was the first full-scale production brewery in Indianapolis since 1948. Sun King beer can be enjoyed at fine bars/restaurants and liquor stores throughout Indiana or in their Tasting Room, located in the brewery at 135 N. College Avenue.
hoursOfOperation: Retail Hours (Carry-out Only)  Tuesday - Noon - 6  Wednesday - Noon - 6  Thursday - Noon - 4    Tasting Hours  (Carry-out and Sampling)  Thursday - 4 - 7  Friday - 12 - 7  Saturday 1 - 4

hoursOfOperation: Wed:  5:00pm - 9:00pm Thu:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  3:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  12:00pm - 9:00pm Sun:  12:00pm - 5:00pm

name: Sunriver Brewing Company
description: We love our beer. In a region that has taken microbrews to a whole new level, we pride ourselves on brewing awesome craft beer that includes the lighter side of brewing as well as the killer hoppy fare.    We’re just as proud of our outrageous service. Great beer needs to be shared. We’re positioned to do just that here in Sunriver and beyond. Whether we’re serving customers in our brewpub or working with our distributors and their outlets, our awesome beers are brewed to be relished. You’ll crave our high-quality, easy-drinking beer and we’ll do whatever it takes to share the love.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: SunUp Brewing
description: The seven barrel system that looms behind the floor to ceiling glass in our Brewer’s Den is the fruits of our labor and February 14, 2006 marked a new chapter in our history. You see, this was the day that the first three beers brewed on site flowed. We know we are biased, but in our minds the beer had never tasted as good as it did that day.face of the “Big German” Uwe Boer that we all know and love. He works magic in his craft and the passion that he shows for brewing fills the glasses as his award winning beer dispenses from our taps. We now boast our own regular taps but his innovation in our seasonal ales and distinct brewing style is what keeps our bar stools full and the place hopping. We can hardly keep his cask conditioned ale on tap as our customers are known to consume the kegs in record time.    “Great Beer, Great Food and Great Service” became our motto as we plugged through the first few years and now the slogan is what we live by. Our fantastic customers and great staff are what makes us who we are and how we stand out in the sea of new restaurants that pop up daily. It is our great customers that made it so easy to push forward into brewing and our loyal staff that helped to smooth over the transition. We continue to grow and change over time just as any business wants to do but it is remembering the little things that have gotten us to where we are today. After all in today’s crazy hectic world it is the little things in life that make it all worth it.
hoursOfOperation: Sunday - Thursday 11:00am - 11:00pm  Friday and Saturday to Midnight  Happy Hour: 3:00 - 6:00 PM Daily

name: Surf Brewery
description: Located less than five miles from Surfer’s Point, Ventura’s Surf BreweryTM. The only craft microbrewery kegging and bottling their own beer in Ventura County. Tasting room and HomeBrew supplies as well.

name: Surly Brewing Company
description: While you're enjoying the full-bodied flavor of the beer, remember that it was more than 10 years in the making. We think it was worth it. We hope you agree.     Surly: The anger fueled by the inability to find good beer.    "We brewed beer for people who didn't know they wanted to drink it until they had it." - Omar Ansari

name: Susquehanna Brewing Company
description: Susquehanna Brewing Company delivers prosperity and enjoyment to our Northeastern Pennsylvania (NEPA) customers and consumers through our quality, craft beers made locally in an environmentally responsible fashion.    We’re beer people. It’s in our blood. 6th generation and going strong. Back before it was hip to brew beer, our grandfathers’ grandfathers spent time crafting the perfect, drinkable beer right here in northeastern Pennsylvania. The beer brewing torch has been passed down, and now it’s our turn. To make the kind of beer you can enjoy all day long, if you’re so inclined. And we have to admit, someti...See More
hoursOfOperation: Free Daily Tour Monday- Friday 3PM and 5PM, Saturday 2PM

name: Sutter Buttes Brewing
description: Sutter Buttes Brewing is an excellent local brewery, quick to become your favorite place to grab a bite or a crisp drink at the end of the day.  The light atmosphere and friendly staff make it a nice place to relax while still presenting itself as a fine local eatery.  It is a microbrewery and taproom, offering good beers and ciders as well as both lunch and dinner.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Sun: 11:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Swamp Head Brewery
description: Founded in 2008, upon the foundation of our great state, we raised our roof to brew world-class beers and establish ourselves as Florida’s brewery. Having travelled through lands far and close, and finding inspiration along the way, we are proud to be here, proud to be Inherently Floridian.    It has been our mission since day one to be Florida's brewery. We love our neighbors, but we're focused on providing our state with the beer it deserves.    That's only a small part of it.    Have a look around, from our brewery, to our logo and branding, to our beer, you can see that we live, love and are Florida. From now until the horizon, Swamp Head Brewery is Inherently Floridian.
hoursOfOperation: Wednesday, Thursday, Friday: 4pm to 8pm

name: Swamp Rabbit
description: 10 Barrel Brewery & Taproom by Brewmaster Ben Pierson

name: Swashbuckler Brewing Company
description: Enter Mount Hope Mansion where the year is 1899 and the 20th century is emerging. The greatest minds of the time have gathered to discuss new ideas and inventions that will impact future generations forever. However, some are willing to do anything to ensure their greatness, even commit murder. Join the great Sherlock Holmes and his faithful friend Dr. Watson at the Murder Mystery Dinner Theatre for this interactive “who-done-it.” Who will be the victim and who will be the assassin? It’s elementary, my dear!

name: Sweet Mullets Brewing
description: Creating Oconomowoc's first brewpub just off Old Hwy 16, behind Schwefel's in the industrial park. New home of award-winning beer of Mark Duchow. Planning to open late 2011 if we can get through all the permits and inspections.    Providing highest quality craft beer complemented by small plate fare highlighting, baked, steamed and fresh food. Wisconsin wines and distilled products available.
