name: Sweetwater Merrifield
hoursOfOperation: Sunday - Monday: 11:00am-10:00pm  Tuesday - Thursday: 11:00am-11:00pm  Friday - Saturday: 11:00am-12:00am  The bar closes one hour after the dining room.

name: SweetWater Brewing Company
description: February 17, 1997 marked the official beginning of SweetWater Brewery, and a new style of brewing and selling beer in Atlanta as the boys wandered around Atlanta in an old van with Freddy's dog Badger. After ending up on the wrong side of the tracks a few times, they were finally pointed in the direction of Virginia-Highlands and found a few bars willing to take a chance on them. "We'll give you a shot as long as your dog stops begging for leftovers on our patio" was the cautious approval they needed to get the brand rolling.    SweetWater's second and current location is in Midtown Atlanta, adjacent to Ansley Park, in the Armour Circle Industrial Park just off of Piedmont and Monroe. The boys saved all of their pennies to buy the 25,000 square feet of brewing goodness and smack in the middle of all the action. Since the company began we've wanted to be closer to our homes, the bars and stores that sell our beer, and all the good folks that drink it. Fortunately seven years of great growth gave the company that opportunity. We learned a lot from that location and left all those mistakes behind as we built our new home. SweetWater Brewing Company has been here since 2004 and it feels good to be settled in. Our new home has enough capacity to brew 100,000 barrels of beer a year (A few more years at this rate.)

name: Switchback Brewing Company
description: Located in Burlington, Vermont, Switchback Brewing Company was founded in 2002 by a formally trained master brewer and his friend, the vision was to concentrate limited resources into making just a few beers to achieve the highest quality possible. The success of Switchback Ale beer has driven constant expansion for over 7 years and made the release of three Rotating Specials, Roasted Red Ale, Porter, and Slow-Fermented Brown Ale possible. Thank you for your support!    As in the beginning, Switchback continues to rely on word of mouth to increase sales, which have expanded into New York, New Hampshire, and Southern Maine. Switchback now brews several thousand barrels of beer each year, but its beer is only available on draught or in 1/2 and 1/6 barrel size kegs.
hoursOfOperation: Mon: 6:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Tue: 10:00 am - 3:00 pm  Wed: 4:00 pm - 5:00 pm  Thu: 7:00 am - 8:00 am, 2:00 pm - 6:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 7:00 pm    FREE TOURS EVERY SATURDAY AT 1 and 2PM!

name: Switchyard Brewing Company
description: Switchyard Brewing Company is coming to Bloomington and we are really excited about it. Keep up with the project, news updates, FAQ's and connect with us.

name: Sycamore Brewing
description: We have proud roots in home brewing and North Carolina, and we have been humbly perfecting some of our favorite recipes over the last 10 years.  We are incredibly excited to share them in the months to come.  Justin was born and raised here in Charlotte, and we couldn’t be happier for our brewery to become part of the city's dynamic and growing craft beer scene.      If you love good beer as much as we do, we can't wait to have you join us in the taproom for a pint or two.  It's not long until we're pouring.

name: Syracuse Suds Factory
description: The Syracuse Suds Factory was founded on January 19th, 1993. It is located in the historic Amos Building in downtown Syracuse, New York. The Syracuse Suds Factory became the first commercial brewery in Syracuse after 31 years. Our first beer was brewed on March 20, 1993 and first tapped on April 17, 1993. At this time we were the only brewery in Syracuse, New York.    The Syracuse Suds Factory also has the claim of being the first brewery, in Syracuse New York, in 31 years to commercially ship its product to other outlets. On May 7th 1995 we shipped our first keg to Jack London's, a pub in Sidney New York. From that point on we have shipped to other accounts outside of Syracuse as well as local accounts.

name: T.W. Pitchers'
description: When Wilson Barr and Tommy Hester met at Williams College in 2007, both were pitchers on the Varsity baseball team. However, they quickly realized their love of baseball was more than equaled by their love of a good drink. Despite the desolate landscape of college get-togethers where there was a strong emphasis on a drink's quantity over quality, Wilson and Tommy were able to find a shared interest in the craft beer industry. When they started an alcoholic beverage company, their adventurous attitudes translated into a desire to create a product that was truly new and exciting. The result was T.W. Pitchers’ Snake Bite®.    While in college, Wilson lived in Europe and discovered that generations of British pub-goers have enjoyed blending lager and hard apple cider. He was astonished to learn the popular concoction had only sparingly made its way across the pond to the United States. Ready to undo this injustice, he returned from his trip and founded W.G. Barr Beverage Company. Tommy was brought on board, and the dynamic duo got to work bringing Snake Bite – a bottled blend of lager and cider - to the thirsty people of America. T.W. Pitchers’, which stands for "Two Williams Pitchers’," or "Tommy and Wilson, Pitchers," was immediately settled on as the brand name.    After months of hard work and many late nights spent taste testing, Wilson and Tommy launched T.W. Pitchers’ Snake Bite in San Francisco. Armed with their Airstream office, a little bit of know-how, and a whole lot of gumption, Wilson and Tommy are committed to quenching your thirst, one bottle of Snake Bite at a time. Cheers!

name: TableRock Brewpub and Grill
description: It is a great time to be a Beer Lover in Boise and TableRock Brew Pub is proud to have been serving this community since 1991.  We are dedicated to our beers and committed to our beer lovers.  We invite you to taste, experience and enjoy our authentic, full-bodied, hand crafted Beers.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Tues: 11:00 am - 9:30 pm  Wed - Thurs: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 9:30 pm

name: Tacoma Brewing Company
description: Featuring small, handcrafted batches of beers. Specializing in beers that apeal to non-beer drinkers, beer drinkers, and foody types.    Our promise to you is to not make boring beer! We are located within the Amocat Cafe in downtown Tacoma.
hoursOfOperation: Fri: 5:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Tahoe Mountain Brewing Company
description: We are a craft brewery in Truckee and Tahoe City, CA. Our brew pub is in downtown Tahoe City, right on the shore of Lake Tahoe across from Commons Beach. In addition to our specialty ales and lagers, we have a full bar and full menu featuring smokehouse BBQ meats, wood-fired flat bread pizzas, fish, pasta, gourmet and traditional pub faire as well as innovative dishes such as our Cajun Seared Ahi Nachos. We have vegan/vegetarian options, the pub is family friendly and has a kids menu. The pub also has outdoor patio seating, a full bar and a great rustic interior set among our collection of french oak barrels with aging beer.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 12:00 am

name: TailGate Beer
description: TailGate Beer was founded by a 21-year-old homebrewer, Wesley Keegan. The story goes, Wesley was approached by his father, Tim, one day about what he was going to do with his life. As an ocean lifeguard and co-owner of a bar, Wesley thought he had it made. His dad informed him of a trademark he had won in 2004 and subsequently protected in contest from Anheuser Busch. The name was TailGate Beer.    Tim thought TailGate Beer was something special. As an avid sports fan and tailgater, Tim implored Wesley to take his homebrews that people loved drinking and brew TailGate Beer! Wesley, having put himself through college at San Diego State University, grew up modestly. The gift of TailGate Beer was a generous one but, unlike some tales of entrepreneurism, didn’t come with startup funds.    They both agreed the name was solid and the marketing would one day be fun, but Wesley was emphatic that the beer had to be excellent. From there, Wesley took what he liked to brew, and brewed in Southern California. All initial beers were brewed and packaged in kegs and glass bottles. Wesley entered into the Great American Beer Festival in 2007 and although no formal awards were won, TailGate Beer was a hit! This drew lots of attention from beer fans from all over the country. The common response was “great beer!” and “great name!” So with confirmation of Wesley’s biggest apprehension – people loved the beer – TailGate Beer was born.

name: Tall Tales Brewery
description: We are a small, premium brewery based in Parsonsburg, MD. It is with pride that our brews are themed on folk lore. Tall Tales have been told for years, stories of real and fictitious people who do unbelievable and amazing things. These stories have become part of our culture and heritage. The legends of Paul Bunyan, Blue Ox, Calamity Jane, John Henry, Red Headed Step Child, Annie Oakley, Buffalo Bill and Excalibur. These are just a few of the legendary stories that have been told over the years. Stories that have been passed down from generation to generation. Our brewers have carefully developed beers that would be worthy of each legendary tall tale. These brews appeal to many different tastes. We are certain you will find something to delight your palette!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed: 3:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Thu - Fri: 3:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat - Sun: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Tallgrass Brewing Company
description: The decision to found Tallgrass Brewing Company was made by Jeff Gill and his wife Tricia on April 8, 2006. Tricia had asked Jeff THAT question: “What do you want to do with the rest of your life?” Jeff had been thinking about that exact question quite a bit. “I want to start a microbrewery!” Jeff answered. He had been an avid homebrewer for six years and loved to brew beer that people enjoyed. At that point, he and Tricia made a commitment to start a new microbrewery in Kansas. It would mean moving from where they lived at the time, Jeff giving up his career as geologist, and Tricia changing jobs.
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Friday: 11am - 5pm  Tours Saturday

name: Tampa Bay Brewing Company
description: Our family founded the Tampa Bay Brewing Company in 1996 to satisfy Tampa Bay’s thirst for a better beer and great food at a reasonable price. It’s still a family affair, with mother and son serving as general manager and brewmaster respectively.  Our original location was a two-story brick building that used to house horses on 15th Street here in the historic Ybor City district.  Needing more space for our ever-growing fan base, we moved to our current location on the plaza level of Centro Ybor in 2006 with both indoor and open-air patio seating.
hoursOfOperation: Weekdays: 11am to 11pm  Fri and Sat: 11am to midnight  Sunday: Noon to 11pm

name: Tanglewood Branch Beer Co.
description: South Fayetteville's friendly neighborhood pub featuring fine house made ales and slow cooked seasonal pub cuisine.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 2:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Sun: 5:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Taos Mesa Brewing
description: Taos Mesa Brewing is a microbrewery, restaurant and indoor/outdoor venue on the spectacular Taos Mesa. We feature our own hand-crafted beer on draught, wine, delicious homemade food, premier live music and the best mountain-view sunsets in Taos.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat: 12:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm

name: Tap Brewing Company
description: Formerly 2 separate entities (The Haverhill Brewery & the Tap Brewpub) we have decided it's in everyone's best interest to consolidate into one, singular brand. That is why as of October 1, 2012 we became The Tap Brewing Company!    The Tap Brewing Company is located inside a nearly 120 year old mill that at one point was the epicenter of Haverhill's massive shoe manufacturing industry. High ceilings, dark grain wood, exposed brick and rich character. We highlight the history of the building without it becoming an intrusive element. Our style is simplistic and straight forward, both in atmosphere and menu. We're right in the middle of a bustling downtown that sits along a beautiful river which our large deck overlooks for an incredible outdoor dining experience in the Summer months. Or heck, a pint during a snowstorm. Our hope is to provide you with a great meal, great beer and outstanding service in a laid-back atmosphere. A mellow, all-encompassing brewpub experience.
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Fri, 8am-4pm

name: Tap It Brewing Co
description: Here at Tap It Brewing Company, located in SLO Town, USA in the heart of the Central Coast, we’re true to our roots and true to our word. We like to take a laid-back approach to almost everything we do. But there’s one thing we’re absolutely serious about – our beer.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm  Thu - Fri: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat - Sun: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Tap Room No. 21 Brewing Company
description: A tribute to “The Noble Experiment”, Tap Room No. 21 embodies an American spirit of perseverance. During the heyday of the Roaring Twenties, corruption was rampant, lawbreakers became icons and speakeasies replaced saloons. As an ode to the repeal of Prohibition, our best kept secret and most cherished contraband is available for you to enjoy among your crew of notorious bootleggers.     The ban has been lifted -- Drink openly, rest easily, and pay no heed to “speak easy”.

name: Tapistry Brewing
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm

name: Taps Fish House & Brewery
description: Brewmaster Victor Novak brews approximately 1700 kegs, or 26,000 gallons of beer for TAPS on an annual basis. His repertoire includes 31 to 35 classic styles of European and American alesand lagers, of which seven are currently on tap, plus one cask ale (see below). Victor also provides two beers for the Manzella family's second restaurant venture, The Catch, in Anaheim.    From the extraordinary leadership of General Manager Chris Snyder, our extraordinary culinary team, the expertise of Brewmaster Victor Novak, to a dedicated wait staff, our people are genuinely passionate about providing exceptional service. With all this going for us, it's not surprising that TAPS has grown into the leading dining destination in Orange County.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Tues: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm  Wed: 11:00 am - 9:00 am  Thurs: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Sun: 10:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: Taxman Brewing Company
description: Taxman Brewing Company is dedicated to crafting small-batch, artisanal beers influenced by the various styles found in the US and Europe, all the while pushing the limits on what is currently available in the local microbrewery scene.

name: Telegraph Brewing Company
description: Early American brewers adapted traditional European brewing techniques to the unique ingredients, climates, and tastes of the New World. At Telegraph Brewing Co., our beers are handcrafted in that same manner at our brewery in Santa Barbara, California. Making use of as many locally grown ingredients as we can, Telegraph's ales embody our philosophy that a local brewery should reflect the traditions of its region. Our goal is to produce uniquely American beer styles that are imbued with a spirit of invention and creativity, but always with a nod toward history.

name: Telluride Brewing Company
description: The mission of Telluride Brewing Company is to produce premium hand-crafted, artisan ales that embody the spirit, culture and pride of Telluride for the enjoyment of the most discerning beer lover.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 12:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: Brewery
description: It’s taken almost one hundred years, but Evanston can once again call itself home to a Temperance movement. But this time there’s beer. In fact, this one is all about the beer. Aside from that tiny detail, Temperance has always been about making life better in ways big and small. We think that’s a worthy goal, and one that only comes about by being open to the possibilities. It’s something we think about with the beers we brew and the things we do. (And when you join us, you will too.)  Welcome to a new Temperance movement.

name: Ten Fifty-Five Brewing
description: Ten Fifty-Five Brew Works was founded in 2011 by a couple of local Tucsonans, who share a few core beliefs. We'd like to share those with you.    So...we like beer, and we really like good beer. We want to put good beer in reach of those that want to enjoy it, and help nurture the developing brew culture in Tucson. We want to make beer for beer drinkers like us; adventurous beer drinkers that are just as likely to try something new as they are an old favorite. We are committed to the idea of the local nano-brewer; a small batch company using fresh ingredients and open minds to make some great tasting brew. Look for us soon, we'll be looking for you.

name: Ten Ninety Brewing Co.
description: Our mission is to brew unique and flavorful beers that break through traditional style guidelines and enhance the beer-drinking experience. Come along with us as we explore new flavors and create new styles that will have us all celebrating the good days.    Craft beer transforms four simple ingredients into something great. At Ten Ninety, we further this transformation to produce refreshing yet complex and challenging beers from unique ingredients and processes. As we reach beyond traditional combinations of water, malted grain, hops, and yeast, we are unapologetically proud to say that we brew extraordinary small batch beers meant to be thoughtfully enjoyed. Simply put, Ten Ninety is craft beer elevated.

name: Ten Pin Brewing Co.
description: Ten Pin is a brew pub located in Moses Lake WA.  It co exists inside of Papa's Casino and Sports Lounge.

name: Ten Sleep Brewing Company
description: Ten Sleep Brewing Company is located in the Smith Family barn snuggled at the base of Signal Cliff, one mile west of Ten Sleep, Wyoming.    Yes we are in a barn… so don’t be surprised to see chickens pecking at spent grain, brew cats sawing Z’s, or a herd of deer headed by on their way to an evening dinner.  Our facility features a 7 BBL stainless brew house in a beautiful rural setting. We produce high quality craft beer in a variety of flavors, and feature a tap room on site where locals and visitors come to view brewery operations while enjoying a pint and possibly some chow. We opened for business in the Fall of 2013, and our beer is currently on tap in many fine establishments across Wyoming. We believe Ten Sleep Brewing Co. is the first brewery in a barn in Wyoming and we would love for you to come visit!
hoursOfOperation: Tue:  2:00pm - 10:00pm Wed:  2:00pm - 10:00pm Thu:  2:00pm - 10:00pm Fri:  2:00pm - 10:00pm Sat:  2:00pm - 10:00pm Sun:  2:00pm - 10:00pm  Closed Mondays.

name: Tenaya Creek Brewery
description: Tenaya Creek was established in 1999 by Tim Etter and his brothers and sisters. Tim's background in brewing started in his college days at the University of Utah in Salt Lake City. In early 1993, his roommate at the time introduced him to the art of making beer. This smalltime hobby of making beer in a tiny apartment blossomed into a fulltime career, brewing commercially. Towards the end of 1993, Tim attended UC Davis in Northern California to study Fermentation Science. Upon returning to Salt Lake, he aligned himself with a startup brewery called Uinta Brewing Company. The concept for this startup was to brew the freshest beer available in the State of Utah while limiting the alcohol percentage to 3.2 by weight (4% by volume). It was wildly successful, providing locally made beer for the ski areas and the many tourists that visited Utah.
hoursOfOperation: Daily: 11:00 a.m. to 2:00 a.m.  Closed on Independence Day, Thanksgiving and Christmas.

name: Tennessee Brew Works
description: Dedicated to producing & enjoying high quality craft beer, while appreciating music & the many other fine traditions & charms of Tennessee, U.S.A.
hoursOfOperation: Th-Fri 4-8pm  Sat 2-8pm

name: Tequesta Brewing Company
description: Microbrewery with great tasting room and growler filler insanity!
hoursOfOperation: Tues - Sun: 12:00 pm 11:00 pm

name: Terrapin Beer Company
description: Terrapin Beer Company was born when two brewers met while working together at a microbrewery in Atlanta. Looking around at what other breweries in the SE were doing, Spike and John felt they could make a contribution. Realizing that anyone could make just another pale ale, brown ale or stout, Spike and John set their sights on crafting beers unlike any that were currently available in the SE.    Terrapin introduced its first beer, the Rye Pale Ale in April of 2002. Six months later while only available on draft in Athens, Terrapin’s sole offering won the American Pale Ale Gold Medal at the 2002 Great American Beer Festival.  Only six months old, Terrapin had arrived in style!

name: Texas Beer Refinery
description: Texas Beer Refinery is a new Brewery concept seeking to change the game of craft beer brewing and distribution by offering a unique approach to selling high quality and custom beers across Texas. Our plans are to open a BrewPub in Kemah, TX where our beers will be brewed onsite. We look forward to serving you soon. Cheers!

name: Texas Big Beer Brewery
description: The Texas BIG BEER Brewery is a small brewery located in Southeast Texas out in the woods just South of the Big Thicket. Owned and operated by John & Tammy McKissack, our goal is to start up a small debt free brewery with no pressure to brew more beer, just to make more money to pay to some bank! Brewing great beer is a craft, which should be appreciated, enjoyed and savored. We believe that if we live a simple life, make wise decisions, put in an honest days work and brew the best craft beer we can, the bottom line should take care of itself.
hoursOfOperation: Brewery Tours every 1st Saturday, from Noon to 2pm. Visit the Brewery and see how we Brew BIG BEER in Southeast Texas!

name: Texian Brewing Co
description: We are a Texas brewery that promotes the rich heritage and storied history of the Lone Star State.

name: TG Enterprises, Inc
description: Just Who Are "Those Guys"?    "Those Guys" represent the anonymous many among us all. Those guys built our bridges and our skyscrapers. Those guys built the roads we travel on, the airplanes we fly in, the cars we drive, and the houses we live in. Those guys serve their country, protect our children, put out our fires, and collect our trash. Those guys work in our offices, teach in our schools, raise our food, and serve us in restaurants.    Reaching stores in 2010, Those Guys Beer, an all-natural, all-malt lager, brewed and bottled in the U.S.A. is now available to all 'Those Guys.'

name: THAT Brewery & Pub
description: THAT Brewery, just off the Arizona Trail in Pine, AZ is a place for people who like beer! We like beer – like to drink it, brew it, tip it and sing songs about it. Opened June 2012. THAT Brewery craft brews are available in many of your local pubs. Come up to Pine to see it all in action - great craft brews (THAT Brewery concoctions and other locally brewed guest craft beers), food, wine, volleyball, horseshoes and good times in the great Northern Arizona cool air. It’s a beautiful drive along the Mogollon Rim with an awesome destination - great craft beer from the source! By the way, we're good people too - actively a part of many charity groups in the area including: Friends of Tonto Natural Bridge, Mountain Village Foundation, Pine Strawberry Business Community, Pine Strawberry Fuels Reduction, AZ Trails Association, RiffRaff Club and the Justice McNeeley Foundation (childrens medical needs charity). We reach out and do all that we can in order to help these and many more groups in the area with fundraising, donations, organizing events and are always happy to give our time!  Cheers!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 8:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 8:00 pm

name: The Alchemist
description: The Alchemist is a 7 barrel brew pub specializing in hand-crafted  beer and casual pub fare.  All of our ales flow directly from our  basement brewery, which was designed and installed by our brewer and  co-proprietor John Kimmich.   We use only the finest imported malts and  domestic hops available to bring you the tastiest and finest selection  of beers in Vermont!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 7:00 pm

name: The Ale Apothecary
description: Producing the finest hand made beer using our own innovative brewing process, which melds the ancient art of brewing with traditions of wine & champagne production. With great ambition and intention, we open the window to mystery with every fermentation!

name: The Angry Minnow
description: When the Rasmussens purchased the building, they thought it would be the perfect place for a brewery. They decided to put the brewery in the basement of the building, allowing for guests to look down into it from the dining room or tour it.    Jason Rasmussen has worked countless hours perfecting the beer and learning the ways of a brewer. He enjoys creating new flavors and learning as much as he can about the art of brewing.    Brewery tours are offered upon request. Or, you can just come taste them all with one of our samplers or growlers!

name: The Arbor Corner Brewery
description: Welcome to the Corner Brewery and Beer Garden! Our operation is sort of like a reverse mullet - with the party up front and the business in the back.  Our public space is a sunny bar and tasting room with a big outdoor beer garden and a covered deck. Behind the scenes, we are a production brewery producing and bottling Arbor Brewing Company brand beers for distribution throughout the state.     In addition to the beers we brew for distribution, we usually have a few special treats available only on tap at the Corner.

name: The Austin Beer Garden Brewing Company
description: brewery/venue/restaurant/   /good people  /nice place to hang  /creative community    --beer makes it better.

name: The Barber Shop
description: The Barber Shop brewpub is located in downtown Dripping Springs, Texas in a historic building that began life in 1924. In its earliest life, the building served as a garage before later becoming a barber shop. In addition to a well-considered selection of popular local, national, and international beers and wines, we have a tap or two of our own special brews!
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Fri: 3pm – 11pm  Sat: Noon – 11pm  Sun: 2pm- 8pm

name: The Barking Duck Brewing Co.
description: The Barking Duck Brewing Co is a NEW brewery to open in Charlotte, NC! Providing a new and fresh approach to craft brewing!

name: The Beer Company
description: The Beer Company is a locally owned restaurant and brewery. Our hand crafted brews have fresh ingredients and a great, rich taste. We brew just feet away from where you'll enjoy your quality beer and delicious meal. If you appreciate quality, you'll love The Beer Company.
hoursOfOperation: Open Everyday: 11:00am– 2:00am

name: The Beer Diviner Tap Room & Market
description: New York Farm Brewery Tap Room and Market    I brew small, controlled batches using Brew Magic's advanced Recirculating Infusion Mash System (RIMS). The result is smooth, delicious pale, red, stout and medieval gruit ales - or any beer you care to custom order. Each bottle is filled by hand and conditioned at optimum temperatures. In 2012, I received my licenses for Bly Hollow Brewery, d.b.a.The Beer Diviner.
hoursOfOperation: Friday 1pm - 8pm

name: The Beer Research Institute
description: The Beer Research Institute is a gathering place where people can meet over a pint and a good meal. The tap list will be ever changing and the food is made from scratch. As the name implies, we will be innovative in our brewing and in the kitchen.    Our focus will be specialty runs of craft beer focusing on aggressive West Coast style American ales and Belgian style ales. We're just a couple of Beer Geeks who like to make great beer! Our kitchen will offer scratch made craft food that will pair perfectly with our unique beer offerings.

name: The Beer'd Brewing Co.
description: The Beer'd Brewing Co. is a nano brewery located in Stonington, Connecticut. We will welcome visitors into our tasting room to sample our offerings and purchase half gallon growlers for takeaway. Also an exclusive selection of local bars and restaurants will offer our ales on draft.
hoursOfOperation: Fri: 5:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat - Sun: 1:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: The Big Cheese Pizza Co. & Brewery
description: The Big Cheese Pizza Co. and Brewery is one of the few pizza places in Southern California that brews its own beers. We currently have eight different beers. We also have seasonal beers that will make their debut throughout the year.The preliminary restaurant to sample our product would be the Riverside, CA location which is where we brew our fine product.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: The Black Abbey Brewing Company
description: “St. Anne, help me! I will become a monk!” Thus cried Martin Luther as a summer thunderstorm bore down on him in Stotternheim, Germany in 1505. These words marked the beginning of a momentous shift in religious history, but as you’re about to see, they led to some great beer, too.
hoursOfOperation: Tasting Room Hours:  Thursday and Friday, 3:30pm – 8:00pm  Saturday, 2:00pm – 8:00pm

name: The Blind Pig Brewery
description: An English style pub with it's own built-in brewery. Four kinds of beer brewed just a few feet from where it's served. Plus hundreds of local and craft beers on cask, tap or bottle.

name: Brewery
description: The Brew Gentleman Beer Company is a microbrewery located in the historic steel town of Braddock, PA. Our goals are to create an ambitious variety of high-quality beers, operate a comfortable taproom and lounge in which to serve them, and to be a part of the ongoing reinvention of Braddock.

name: The Brew Gentlemen Beer Co.
description: An experimental microbrewery for the Pittsburgh region and beyond. Creating exceptional craft beers for a growing community of people that share our constant sense of curiosity.

name: The Brew on Broadway
description: Craft Brewery and Coffee House with a great south faced Brew Garden that is  Dog friendly
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu: 7:00 am - 9:00 pm  Fri: 7:00 am - 10:00 pm  Sat: 8:00 am - 10:00 pm  Sun: 8:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: The Brewer's Cabinet
description: Our small batch brewery allows us the flexibility not to be limited by popular fads, current trends or industry pressure in crafting our beers.    Our Brew Masters have been fully empowered so that there are no limits on creativity or style. We only ask that they do what they do best and brew with passion and love. We will also be featuring an impressive selection of guest draft handles and bottle selection to help compliment our own beers.    With a small kitchen onsite, we will be creating a fresh and local menu for our customers with an emphasis on quality ingredients that pair superbly with our brews. We want to create a comfortable and relaxed atmosphere for our customers, so that they can enjoy the environment no matter what time of the day, nor what the occasion is.    The Brewer’s Cabinet will focus on spreading awareness of the local brewing community. We hope to feature local commercial breweries and their great beers, which we hope will lead to a series of collaborative projects in creating new beers. We want a strong local home brewing community, that is part of the brewery, with the invitation to come in and help design beers with our brew masters. We truly want to be a “Brewer’s Cabinet” for the Reno area!
hoursOfOperation: Monday	11:00 am – 11:00 pm  Tuesday	11:00 am – 11:00 pm  Wednesday	11:00 am – 11:00 pm  Thursday	11:00 am – 11:00 pm  Friday	11:00 am – 11:00 pm  Saturday	11:00 am – 11:00 pm  Sunday	11:00 am – 11:00 pm

name: The Brewerie at Union Station
description: We are Erie’s exclusive brewpub & restaurant serving up fresh handcrafted ales paired with a unique menu of exceptional quality. Come & join us for a meal in the breathtaking Rotunda. Grab a booth or pull up a stool in the old Tap Room. Maybe you’d like something a little more intimate? How about private balcony seating for two? Or perhaps it’s a thrill you’re seeking? Then join us for summers in the Trackside Beer Garden where you can enjoy a pint of ale as the trains go barreling by.

name: The Brewing Lair
description: Lets have fun with beer outdoors, because we don't have much room in the brewery. So come play Disc Golf, Walk in the woods or hang out on the patio where you can enjoy a fresh brew and surf the net.

name: The Bronx Brewery
description: We're a small craft brewery in the South Bronx, New York and have a maniacal love for two things in this world: beer and the Bronx. Cheers!    The Bronx Brewery is a craft brewer and distributor based in the South Bronx. It launched in 2011 by a small team with two things in common: a maniacal focus on creating high-quality beer and a passion for the Bronx. Its traditionally-crafted ales use only premium and minimally-processed materials to create fresh, bold beer from a borough known for its own uniquely bold character. The team is enthused to bring a rich brewing tradition back to the Bronx and craft a beer that the people of the Bronx and New York City can be proud to call their own.

name: The Bruery
description: A boutique craft brewery located in Orange County, California specializing in experimental and barrel aged beer. Our name is a fusion of 'brewery' with our family name, Rue.    Our calling is to create beers with character and depth using the simplest and purest of means. We do not filter or pasteurize our beers. Most of our bottled beers gain carbonation through bottle conditioning, allowing carbonation to naturally occur through a secondary bottle fermentation. We strive to use unconventional ingredients, and we will proudly state what we put in our beers.
hoursOfOperation: Friday & Saturday: 4pm - 10pm  Sunday: 12pm - 6pm

name: The Cannon Brewpub
description: If the Cannon Brewpub had an old man, it would be Jim Newman. A U.S. Army Ranger, Jim had just returned Stateside from Haiti when he attended a party hosted by Dr. Jack Blalock. At the soiree, he was introduced to a kindred soul named William Gantt. Their conversation soon turned to the quality of beer in Columbus. Needless to say, the tone was bitter and the language seasoned with expletives. When Jim explained that in Oregon, where he came of age, there was a vibrant scene of restaurants and bars that housed their own microbreweries that crafted their own distinct beers that could only be enjoyed at the source, Gantt understandably replied, "$#@*!".    What began as a conversation soon became an obsession and, in 1996, the firm Warner and Worth was incorporated to see their shared dream come true.

name: The Church Brew Works
description: Nestled in historic Lawrenceville, this turn of the century cathedral church turned Brewpub offers a heavenly atmosphere! Enjoy our award winning handcrafted brews and American "Eclectic" cuisine.

name: The Commons Brewery
description: The Commons Brewery is a small craft brewery located in Southeast Portland, Oregon. We are inspired by European brewing tradition and Northwest grown ingredients. We take a very hands-on approach to brewing our small batch beers.    The Commons was born as Beetje Brewery in the garage of Mike Wright on a 1 barrel nano system. It did not take long before Mike was dreaming of expanding the operation and upgrading to a true commercial system. That dream was realized with a new space and a new 7bbl system.
hoursOfOperation: Th & Fri: 5-9-ish   Saturday 2-9-ish   Sunday 2-6

name: The Corner Cafe & Brewery
description: At The Corner Café and Brewery we are much more than a business that serves great meals.  We are a comfortable corner restaurant with a terrific and unique menu and our own brewery.  Patrons enjoy creative breakfasts, lunches, dinners or excellent wines and amazing hand crafted beers.     The atmosphere incorporates an eclectic and warm interior with local Lighthouse Center of the Arts member’s paintings.  Our cast of characters at The Corner Café top off the genuinely relaxed and fun experience at this unique and quirky restaurant.

name: Rochester
description: The Distillery is an award winning high energy bar and restaurant that offers fantastic ambiance and service for any drinking and dining occasion whether it's business, pleasure or a celebration.     We created a restaurant that offers a large selection of draft beers, a diverse menu of American fare, non-stop sports viewing entertainment and play a heady selection of classic rock music on a state-of-the-art audio system to ensure that all the bases are covered. On December 11th, 1980 the original Distillery Restaurant opened on Mt Hope Avenue in Rochester, New York. It quickly became a spot for locals who met over good food and cold beer to discuss the various issues of the day, catch up with friends, make new acquaintances and celebrate life.

name: The Distillery (Rochester)
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  11:00am - 2:00am  Bar  Mon-Sat: 11am - 2am  Sunday: 12 Noon - 1am  Kitchen  Mon-Sat: 11am - 1am  Sunday: 12 Noon - 12 Midnight

name: Greece
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  11:00am - 2:00am Tue:  11:00am - 2:00am Wed:  11:00am - 2:00am Thu:  11:00am - 2:00am Fri:  11:00am - 2:00am Sat:  11:00am - 2:00am Sun:  12:00pm - 1:00am  Bar  Mon-Sat: 11am - 2am  Sunday: 12 Noon - 1am  Kitchen  Mon-Sat: 11am - 1am  Sunday: 12 Noon - 12 Midnight

name: Henrietta
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  11:00am - 2:00am Tue:  11:00am - 2:00am Wed:  11:00am - 2:00am Thu:  11:00am - 2:00am Fri:  11:00am - 2:00am Sat:  11:00am - 2:00am Sun:  12:00pm - 1:00am  Bar  Mon-Sat: 11am - 2am  Sunday: 12 Noon - 1am  Kitchen  Mon-Sat: 11am - 1am  Sunday: 12 Noon- 12 Midnight

name: Victor
hoursOfOperation: Wed:  11:00am - 1:00am Thu:  11:00am - 1:00am Fri:  11:00am - 1:00am Sat:  11:00am - 1:00am Mon:  11:00am - 12:00am Tue:  11:00am - 12:00am Sun:  12:00pm - 12:00am  Mon, Tue: 11am - 12 Midnight  Wed - Sat: 11am - 1am  Sunday: 12 Noon - 12 Midnight  Kitchen  Mon, Tue: 11am - 11pm  Wed - Sat: 11am - 12 Midnight  Sunday: 12 Noon - 11pm

name: The Duck-Rabbit Craft Brewery
description: We are a small packaging microbrewery located in Farmville, North Carolina. We sold our first beer in August of 2004. We specialize in beautiful, delicious, full flavored dark beers. When we brew, we’re happy and we dance. During fermentation, we sing softly to the yeast. Please try our beer and enjoy a taste of contentment!
hoursOfOperation: Friday: 3:00 p.m. to 7:00 p.m

name: The Dudes' Brewing Co.
description: We're just three dudes who love craft beer, and that's why we're here. Our brewery is located in Torrance—the heart of Southern California's craft beer phenomenon. The Dudes' are focused one creating amazing beers made of the best ingredients we can get our hands on. Thirsty? Let's start a session!

name: The Filling Station Microbrewery
description: The Filling Station Microbrewery is located in the historical railroad depot with beautiful views of the Boardman Lake and directly on the T.A.R.T. bike trail. Our flatbreads and microbrews use the freshest ingredients available. David Cannizzaro, head brewer, uses a 10bbl & 3bbl brewing system which allows him the freedom to create small batches of craft brews in a variety of styles.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 12:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sun: 12:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: The Gem and Keystone
description: We are proud to offer a twist on the classic brewpub; serving handcrafted ales and lagers brewed on premises, providing “food lovers dining” which emphasizes a seasonal menu using local and sustainable ingredients and consistently delivering exceptional service. What more can you ask for?    Also known as Shawnee Craft Brewery

name: The Granary 'Cur & Brew
description: We strive to make fresh, handcrafted, honest beers that can be enjoyed by all.  All of our beer is made within the four walls of our restaurant, which means that when it hits your glass it is the freshest beer you can get.   Our beers are never filtered or pasteurized and are always full of character and flavor.  We brew styles from American and Belgian to anything in between.  We typically brew our beers with four ingredients: malt, hops, yeast and San Antonio water.   However we have been known to add things like coffee, fruit, spices, and anything else that might catch our fancy.    At The Granary we love beer as beer helps to enrich our lives.  We take our beer and food seriously and we hope to politely challenge people’s perspective of how beer can be paired with food.  We believe that every meal that is served can be made better when paired with the right style of beer.  This is not your grandma’s beer.
hoursOfOperation: Lunch from Tuesday - Saturday:  11:00am- 2:00pm    Tuesday - Thursday:  6:00p.m - 10:00p.m.  Friday - Saturday:  6:00p.m. - 11:00p.m.

name: Fitchburg
description: The Great Dane Pub & Brewing Company was established by college friends Eliot Butler and Rob LoBreglio. The two dreamed of starting a Brewpub that offered many varieties of house-brewed ales and lagers and hearty made-from-scratch pub fare to accompany the beers. The original Downtown location opened in November 1994 and expanded with the addition of a pool hall in 1996. The wild success of the first Great Dane led to the decision to open more pubs in the Madison area.    The Fitchburg Great Dane began operations in 2002 and the Hilldale pub followed in 2006. In 2009, the Hilldale pub expanded its brewery and opened a 4,000 square foot pool hall. Additionally, in May of 2009, the first Great Dane outside of the Madison area debuted in Wausau, Wisconsin. The Wausau Great Dane added a 100 seat beer garden and outdoor bar in the spring of 2011. In November 2010, the fifth Great Dane began operations in Grandview commons, off of Cottage Grove Road on Madison's east side.
hoursOfOperation: Monday- Thursday 11AM-2AM, Friday-Saturday 11AM-230AM, Sunday 10AM-2AM

name: Downtown
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Thursday 11AM-2AM,Friday 11AM-2:30AM, Saturday 10AM-2:30AM on Farmer's Market and Home Football Saturdays,11AM-2:30AM other Saturdays, Sunday 10AM-2AM

name: Eastside
hoursOfOperation: Monday-Wednesday 11AM-12AM, Thursday 11AM-2AM, Friday-Saturday 11AM-230AM, Sunday 10AM-12AM

name: Hilldale
hoursOfOperation: Monday- Thursday 11AM-2AM, Friday-Saturday 11AM-2:30AM, Sunday 10AM-2AM

name: Wausau
hoursOfOperation: Monday-Thursday 11AM-2AM, Friday-Saturday 11AM-230am, Sunday 11AM-2AM

name: The Industrial Revolution Brewing Company
