name: The Lab Brewing Company
description: Beer. Food. Music. It is based on these fundamental ingredients - the trifecta of entertainment - that The LAB Brewing Co. was born.  We take them all -- our beer, our food, and our music-- equally seriously. And we take great effort to combine them all to create a haven for all who share our appreciation for drinking, eating and being merry.    Beer lovers rejoice. With more than 25 handpicked microbrews on tap we have you covered. And that’s before adding our house brews, handcrafted by our brewmaster on site to the mix. From the aggressively hopped IPA Bad Influence to the oh-so-strong Take Her Home Belgian Tripel, our house brews not only pack a punch, but they are sure to awaken your taste buds. Beer aficionados and casual drinkers are encouraged to seek out our head brewer Roger for a tour of the premises or to talk shop.    Large stunning copper fermentation vessels align the restaurant and contribute to a unique dining experience. The setting is a perfect match for our eclectic American cuisine. Menu favorites include BBQ duck quesadilla, white lasagna and Alaskan cod in a hazelnut sage brown butter sauce. No, this isn’t your typical “bar food” – though the LAB Burger is to die for. Everything is fresh farm to table.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 2:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: The Library Restaurant and Brew Pub
The Livery
description: Over one hundred years ago, the building known as the Palace Livery provided a vital service making it a unique gathering place for residents of and travelers to Southwest Michigan. This former horse stable has been brought back to life as The Livery. Located at 190 5th street, in the Arts District of downtown Benton Harbor, Michigan, the Livery features 12 taps of "Hand-Forged Microbrew", 2 Real Ale taps, an outdoor bier garden, free WIFI, and a Café serving great food. Music and other live entertainment are regularly featured in The Upper Livery entertainment venue. You must be age 21 or older to enter The Livery. People under age 21 must be accompanied by parent or legal guardian.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 4:00 pm - 12:00 am  Fri: 11:30 am - 1:00 am  Sat: 12:00 pm - 1:00 am  Sun: 12:00 pm - 12:00 am

name: The Lost Abbey
description: Founded in 2006, Port Brewing and The Lost Abbey produce an extensive line-up of continental and American- inspired ales and lagers. Under the direction of visionary brewmaster and co-founder Tomme Arthur, the brewery has garnered dozens of awards in its seven-year history including the 2007 Great American Beer Festival Small Brewery of the Year, The 2008 world Beer Cup Champion Small Brewery and the 2013 Champion Brewery at the San Diego International Beer Festival. The company’s beers, many of which are aged in oak barrels for 12 months or longer, are universally recognized for their complexity, unique flavors and bold boundary-pushing styles.

name: The Lost Borough Brewing Co.
description: The Lost Borough Brewing Company is the realization of a dream for three life long friends Dave Finger, James Meyer and Dan Western in search of the perfect pint of craft beer brewed right here in the Rochester. After years of experimentation with all styles of artisan beers we have decided to leave our mark by opening a local brewery where we can share our passion with others and provide truly difference craft beer experience.

name: Restaurant & Brewery
description: A family-friendly restaurant featuring Prime beef burgers, thin-crust pizza, and craft-brewed beers, including 6 brewed on the premises.    When you name your restaurant after Trappist monks who've spent centuries perfecting their craft, you're serious about your beer. That's why we hired a master to craft our house brews, and why our beer list spans the globe. With everything from refreshing pilsners that match the lightness of our thin-crust pizza to dark, rich ales that stand up to our decadent burgers, you're certain to find a new favorite at The Lucky Monk. We're sure that our Prime beef burgers — served with hand-cut fries — will be the juiciest you've ever had. Our other house specialty, pizza, is crisp and generously topped with fresh ingredients. And we round out our menu with vibrant, flavorful salads; a handful of classic, satisfying American entrées; and some sweet surprises.    Whether you're settling in at our bar or relaxing with your friends and family in our comfortable dining room, our delicious food and drink and warm welcome are sure to elevate your soul.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Fri - Sat:	11:00 am - 12:00 am  Sun:	11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: The Mash House Brewery & Chophouse
description: We use no preservatives and only the finest ingredients at our on-site microbrewery: malted barley, hops, yeast and pure water. Our beer begins in our grain silo out front, is converted into "mash" with the addition of water, then ferments and ages in our custom-designed brewhouse—assuring our customers will receive the freshest pint possible. And there are seven ways to try our award-winning brews: by the pint (16 oz.), by the half yard (25 oz.), by the pitcher (64 oz.), by the hopper (116 oz. mini-keg), by the Mini Mash (any four beers on tap), by the Mondo Mash (4 oz. glasses of each of our 9 drafts), or by the Growler (take it to go!)
hoursOfOperation: DINING ROOM & PATIO  Sun:  12pm - 9pm  Mon-Thurs:  5pm - 10pm  Fri:  5pm - 11pm  Sat:  12pm - 11pm    BAR  Mon-Fri:  4pm - 12am  Sat:  12pm - 12am  Sun:  12pm - 12am

name: The Mitten Brewing Co
description: The Mitten Brewing Co. is a new, vintage baseball-themed nanobrewery that expertly pairs handcrafted beers with gourmet pizzas.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Sat: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Sun: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: The North Brewery
description: We brew a variety of beers ranging from classic to extreme. We also have a home brew supply shop at our place that has the best prices in town. We will also special order for you.

name: Restaurant & Brewery
description: Inspired by the traditions of Wisconsin taverns and supper clubs, The Old Fashioned exists to pay tribute to the foods and spirits that make our state famous.    Here, that means so much more than beers, brats, and cheese. Don't worry, we take all those things very seriously, but we're equally committed to preserving the unique heritage that defines our way of life. When you walk through our doors, you'll not only experience what Wisconsin was, you’ll taste what it always will be.
hoursOfOperation: 7:30 am - 10:30 pm am Mon-Tues  7:30 am - 2:00 am Wed - Fri  9:00 am - 2:00 am Sat  9:00 am - 10:00 pm Sun

name: The Olde Mecklenburg Brewery
description: The Olde Mecklenburg Brewery (OMB), located in the heart of south Charlotte, produces premium, all natural beer and delivers it fresh weekly to bars, restaurants and retailers in the region. OMB uses only the finest ingredients available worldwide and employs traditional, intensive brewing methods to transform them into world class beer that’s full-flavored yet amazingly refreshing. Although our methods are more costly, we think you’ll agree the results are worth it. Look for OMB on tap throughout the Charlotte region, in growler bottles at your local retailer or just come straight to the brewery and taste the difference.

name: The Onion Pub and Brewing Co
The Other Farm Brewing Company
description: It’s what life’s all about afterall, right? The Other Farm Brewing Company is a nano-brewery located in Boyertown, PA. What was once a sleepy little cafe has grown, little by little, into a community centerpiece, focused on what we think are the things that connect us all. Community. Drink. Music. Food.

name: The Peekskill Brewery
description: As a restaurant, brewpub and beer bar we are all things craft, seasonal, local and BEER! Providing exceptional quality, value and service whether you enjoy our lively pub or the more laid back atmosphere of our dining room, we look forward to your patronage.

name: The People's Pint
description: Located at 24 Federal Street in Greenfield, The People's Pint has been open since January 1st, 1997. Since then, we've offered delicious food, quality ales & lagers, and friendly service. The Pint is open daily at 11 a.m. for lunch. The dinner menu is available from 4 - 10 p.m. and we have a late night menu from 10 p.m. - Midnight. We do not take reservations. All ages are welcome.

name: The Perch Pub & Brewery
description: The Perch is something you have to see to believe. With panoramic views of Downtown Chandler on our roof top bar. Or are lush garden landscape in our courtyard that hosts over 50 tropical rescue birds. We have the most unique and breathtaking setting, and we feature 30 beers on tap, including five of our very own brand new house brews, and a full menu of beer-infused food created by our chef and his team of culinary masterminds. Anytime is the perfect time to treat yourself to an unforgettable experience at The Perch. CHEERS!

name: The Phoenix Ale Brewery
description: The Phoenix Ale Brewery is Arizona's newest craft brewery.  We brew unfiltered, English style ales.  Currently, we have three beers to choose from.  Fretzy's Unfiltered Ale, Camelback IPA & Watermelon Wheat.  Come see us on the northeast corner of 30th Street & Washington in Phoenix!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat: 12:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: The Post Brewing Co.
description: The Post Brewing Company brews beers that are gosh darn delicious, memorable, and something you will want to put in your mouth repeatedly. Bryan Selders, Brewmaster, has purposefully designed these beers to pair perfectly with your meal. The GoodBird Kitchen, run by Chef Brett Smith, serves you delicious comfort food cooked with the love of your grandma and the skill of passionately trained chefs that is meant to be shared like a family supper.    Pull up a chair, order some vittles and get after it!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 4:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Sun: 4:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: The Prodigal Son Brewery and Pub
description: Pendleton, Oregon. A small agricultural town located at the foothills of the beautiful Blue Mountains. And now home to some of the best beers in the state. We’re passionate about fermentation and it shows in our brews. Whether it’s a dry-hopped Northwest IPA or a malt-heavy Porter, the Prodigal Son is dedicated to exploring the possibilities of grain, hops and yeast. Creativity is something we value in our Ales and it’s our goal to incorporate regional ingredients into beers that go beyond convention. Brewing to style is not our objective; we prefer to focus our explorations on the potential of beer.    But we’re more than just brewing, we’ve got good food to boot. The Prodigal Son features a menu that combines traditional pub fare with scratch cooking. Here you will find regional ingredients incorporated into handcrafted cuisine. We have a bona fide chef with an artist’s muse- and his work is truly the product of inspiration. Our food is unique –you might even say it has character.    We’re proud to be back home, here in Eastern Oregon. Come visit anytime, and stay as long as you like. We hope you will join us on our journey to beervana. Lucky for you, your efforts will be rewarded with good beer.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Brewery and Tasting Room
description: We are an all-sour beer company in Berkeley, CA

name: The River Company Restaurant and Brewery
description: The River Company Restaurant and Brewery is located in beautiful Fairlawn, VA and are mere minutes away from Radford University and Virginia Tech.    We specialize in all natural beef which we dry age in house to produce a distinctly tender and flavorful steak. We have a wide range of flavors on our menu and feature nightly specials.    Our Chief Brewer produces all our draft beers in house, offering a wide variety of flavors to please every palate. Not a beer person? Be sure to ask for our extensive wine list!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sun:	11:30 am - 10:00 pm

name: The Root Cellar Cafe and Brewery
description: We are the first and only brew pub in San Marcos, Texas.    Meet our brewer, Robert Brushaber. He has been homebrewing since the 90?s, and has graduated from the American Brewers Guild with a Craft Brewers Apprenticeship (CBA) in 2010. He apprenticed at the Real Ale Brewery in Blanco, and began brewing at the Root Cellar in 2012. The house beers brewed by Robert are Alison’s Ale, Cream Steam, Santa Fe Stout, and a Gluten Free IPA.    Alison’s Ale - A highly complex, clean and refreshing taste with a blend of six different malts and three different hops.    Cream Steam - Steam Beers are in a category all their own. Is it a lager? Is it an ale? Actually, it’s a lager brewed at ale temperatures. This higher temperature fermentation produces a beer with more “fruity” qualities than your average lager. The hops are 100% Northern Brewer, but Robert has lowered the hop bill to make this Steam Beer a bit more creamy and smooth.    Santa Fe Stout – This dry Stout, moderately bittered with Kent Golding hops, has flavor notes that remind me of a cup of dark coffee sipped from a warm mug on a cold Santa Fe morning.    Gluten Free Beer - Made with Sorghum, Honey, and Hops.

name: The Round Barn Winery & Brewery
description: With more than 30 years of fermentation experience and an award-winning reputation in the industry, our line of hand-crafted brews embody the satisfying bold taste you've come to expect from The Round Barn.

name: The Saint Louis Brewery
description: Schlafly is the brand name of beers produced by the Saint Louis Brewery, Inc. Currently, all beers produced by this brewery are under the Schlafly brand. Located in St. Louis, Missouri, it is widely available in Eastern Missouri and Southern Illinois. Schlafly brand beers are distributed to the following states: Missouri, Kansas, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Tennessee, North Western Mississippi, North Virgina, and Washington, DC.    The Saint Louis Brewery, Inc. was incorporated in 1989. It was founded by Dan Kopman and Tom Schlafly,[1] a lawyer and nephew of political activist Phyllis Schlafly, although she is not involved with the brewery in any way. Their goal was to create quality local microbrew beer.

name: Schlafly Bottleworks
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Tue: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Wed - Sat: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: The Spencer Brewery
description: Spencer Trappist Ale, America's first and only Trappist beer.

name: The Stable
description: The Stable is a brewpub and micro-distillery proudly located in the Benton Park Neighborhood of St. Louis on the northeast corner of Cherokee and Lemp. The StableOur building was where the draft horses for the historic Lemp Brewery were kept, thus the name. We are honored to once again be brewing beer on these grounds for the first time since Prohibition. In addition to our own brews, we serve up the best craft beer from across the country and the world. We have 36 rotating taps so you'll always have new selections to choose from each time you visit. We also serve great appetizers, sandwiches, and some say the best pizza in St. Louis. We hope to see you soon.    Our Brewery: We specialize in brewing traditional German lagers, using only the finest barley malt, hops, and yeast from Germany. Our styles include Helles, Marzen, Dunkel, Rauchbier, and Zoigl. All of our beer is brewed and served right on site. The person having a beer next to you at the bar may be one of our brewers.

name: The Terminal Brewhouse
description: The Terminal BrewHouse is a locally owned and operated business; as such we go to great lengths and expense to utilize local products and services whenever available. It is our goal to be a contributing member of our neighborhood and city for years to come. In order to achieve this goal, we have instituted many green practices and initiatives. That being said, the kitchen and brewhouse are the heart and soul of what we do and why we are here. Only the freshest foods and finest hops make it into the Terminal and our passion is that only world-class beer and exceptional food make it to your table. We sincerely thank you for coming and promise this is as serious as we will ever get.    Cheers, The Terminal Gang
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Sunday 11 AM - 12 AM

name: The Victor Brewery
description: A microbrewery celebrating hand-crafted beer.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 4:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Sat: 1:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: The Wild Rover Brewery
description: In an attempt to bring the character and feel of an old English pub to Tampa, father and son team Derek and Ricky Wells founded The Wild Rover Pub & Brewery as a local place for people to come and socialize, while enjoying a finely crafted local beer. It is a place were everyone is welcome; where a communal bond is formed.   The in-house 4 barrel brewing system will service as a means of providing quality beer for you and your neighbor. In the last decade, the demand for better beer has been on the rise, and the customer is becoming more discerning in their tastes. Our aim is to provide a local craft brew that we, as a community, can be proud of, and to showcase some of the ever increasing number of great Tampa area breweries!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 4:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Fri: 1:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sat: 7:30 am - 12:00 am  Sun: 7:30 am - 9:00 pm

name: The Workshop Brewing Company
description: The Workshop Brewing Company: we sustain nature, build community, and honor craft. We do this by creating honest, traditional beers and wholesome, delicious food using ingredients sourced as locally/organically as possible, served with genuine warmth and enthusiasm, in a setting that is welcoming and fun.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: Thimble Island Brewing Company
description: Thimble Island Brewing Company was established in Branford, CT in 2010. Our founders are beer enthusiasts who set out to create well balanced, traditionally crafted beers.    Prior to Prohibition, the United States was home to over 2,000 craft breweries; by the 1980s barely 100 breweries remained. Thimble Island Brewery seeks to recreate the American tradition of having a local brewery that the community can enjoy. Our American Ale is full-flavored yet refreshing enough to be enjoyed year round.    Thimble Island. Serious beer for serious beer lovers.

name: Third Street Aleworks Restaurant & Brewery
description: The Third Street AleWorks’ philosophy about beer and brewing is simple – use the best ingredients possible; never cut corners; and keep it fresh!
hoursOfOperation: Sunday-Thursday: 11:30 AM - Midnight  Friday-Saturday:  11:30 AM - 1:00 AM

name: Third Street Brewhouse
description: The Third Street Brewhouse is a state-of-art craft brewery. Great facility, great brewers, great ingredients combine for great craft beers.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 7:00 am - 5:00 pm  Fri: 7:00 am - 6:00 pm  Sat: 11:00 am - 2:00 pm

name: South Monk
description: Asheville's Premier Craft Beer Bar
hoursOfOperation: Daily 4pm - Midnight  Sunday 2pm - 9pm

name: Thirsty Nomad Brewing Company
description: Thirsty Nomad Brewing will be a small craft brewery and tap room in the Charlotte Metro Area. We'll have plenty of taps serving a variety of craft beer, much of it local, some of it our own. Thirsty Nomad will be an operating brewery. Since we're focused on beer, we plan on tapping in to the great food scene and partnering with local restaurants and other food vendors.

name: Thirsty Planet Brewing Company
description: We at Thirsty Planet Brewing believe our purpose is multi-faceted. It begins with just good, old-fashioned passion. Beer is our passion. We enjoy the history of beer, its humble, but amazing beginnings, the way it brings people together, and it’s unbelievable versatility. We truly believe you should follow your passion and enjoy life. How better to do that than open Thirsty Planet Brewing Company.    Our purpose then morphs into doing the right thing. For us, this includes being environmentally conscious. We have laced filters in our drains for run-off water, so we can use that water to irrigate our lawns and plants. We also plan to purchase solar panels for our brewery. We recycle, and you will quickly learn that after visiting our beautiful tasting room. Check out our bar, you will see what we mean.    Another important aspect of doing the right thing is through charitable donations. We have been truly blessed in life and want to give to those who are in need of a blessing. A portion of our Yellow Armadillo Wheat sales will go to a local cancer research/support foundation, and a portion of our Thirsty Goat Amber sales will go to help purchase farm animals (maybe goats?) for needy people in third world countries. So, not only can we feel good for helping people, you can feel good every time you purchase Thirsty Planet beer. It’s a win-win situation!!!
hoursOfOperation: Sat:	11:00 am	-	2:00 pm    The tasting room is open from 11-3 every saturday by reservation ONLY.

name: ThirstyBear Brewing Company
description: ThirstyBear Brewing Co. is San Francisco's only certified organic brewery.  ThirstyBear hand-crafts beers of every description: ales, lagers, barrel-aged, Belgian-inspired, cask conditioned, wet-hopped, dry-hopped - all inspired by tradition and modern creativity. Our brewery crafts only organic beers, ensuring that the beers you consume are good to you and good for our earth.  Our restaurant pairs its beers with Spanish inspired tapas and paellas sourced from the plethora of local and often organic farms that grace our region.  As the only San Francisco certified green brewery-restaurant, we promote the business of sustainability. Founded on September 13, 1996, ThirstyBear is now the oldest brewery-restaurant in San Francisco.

name: Thomas Creek Brewery
description: Since the beginning of the brewery in 1998, Tom Davis has been winning the hearts and taste buds of people all over the Southeast. His goal is to make the finest hand crafted beer, and please every beer lover that tries a Thomas Creek brew.
hoursOfOperation: Monday – Friday 8:00 AM - 6:00 PM  Saturday 10:00 AM - 2:00 PM

name: Thomas Hooker Brewing
description: Thomas Hooker Brewing Company, located in Bloomfield, is Connecticut's local brewery with a national reputation. One taste and you'll recognize why small batch local brewing with quality ingredients produces a superior beer.    Built on the premise that small manufactures creating quality products are still to backbone of this country, we are proud to be in our second decade of producing great quality craft beers in Hartford County. We offer eleven unique beers (7 ales and 4 lagers) that are highly respected and recognized for consistency and quality. Recently named as the 73rd best brewer in the world by RateBeer.com, and ranked number 15 in the top 50 American Micro Breweries by the Beer Advocate, Connecticut should be proud of their small brewer with a huge reputation.

name: Thompson Brewing Co.
description: The Thompson Brewing Co. has a rich history of brewing high quality Ales, Lagers, Pilsners and more. Quality is our number one priority when it comes to brewing. We take extra steps unique to each of our brews to ensure their excellence.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Fri: 4:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 3:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: Thorn Street Brewery
description: At Thorn Street Brewery, we are committed to bringing the neighborhood brewery back to reality and making you that better beer. We can think of no better neighborhood than North Park to begin this project. It’s a neighborhood where folks pride themselves on walking or riding their bike to get locally produced food, where people devote large parts of their property to growing their own edibles, where people love gardening, fishing, and of course brewing their own beers. No where that I have seen in a major city is there such a community where the residents seem so bound together by a common philosophy. Reduce your carbon footprint, eat local, buy local, produce something local, be self sufficient as much as you can, smile, and please try to leave the world a little better than you found it, because, after all, we are just renting it.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu: 4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri: 2:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 11:00 am  Sun: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Thr3e Wise Men Brewing Company
description: Located in beautiful Broad Ripple in Indianapolis, Indiana, Scotty's Thr3e Wise Men Brewing Company opened on January 17, 2011. Thr3e Wise Men will not only brew beer but will also be serving pizza, appetizers and desserts.  Thr3e Wise Men greets its guests with a classic lodge feel - exposed beams, concrete floors and warm wood walls.  Of course, Scotty prides himself on staying ahead of the technology curve and wanted to be the first one of the first Indiana restaurants to adorn dining room tables with Apple iPads so customers are able to learn more about Thr3e Wise Men Brewing Co., the beers, and Scotty's two other restaurant concepts.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: Three Angels Brewing
description: Grow local, Brew local, Drink local. Great beers should be distributed on the backs of their followers, not on the trucks of distributors. Three Angels Brewing is a nano scale operation, focusing on the production and development of brews utilizing predominantly locally grown inputs. Economics is an after thought, Quality is a requirement, and Excellence is determined and awarded by consumers, not judges.

name: Three Barrel Brewing Company
description: Artisan crafted brews produced from San Luis Valley grown malt, hops, honey and fresh mountain water.    Flavors may vary, check in to see what's new!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri:	9:00 am - 5:30 pm

name: Three Brothers Brewing
description: Three Brothers Brewing is a craft-brewery that is currently distributing local beer to western Virginia! Look for our tasting room to open in early 2013.    At Three Brothers Brewing,our mission is to brew and sell the best craft beer possible. As a family owned business, we focus on both the community that we live in and the community that we have created.  We're proud of our commitment to tap into local products and services to bring you what you are looking for... a truly unique, quality craft beer for our retailers and consumers.
hoursOfOperation: Call

name: Three Creeks Brewing
description: Where we utilize only the finest ingredients available for all of our food and brewing activities, while striving to impress even the most sensitive of palates, Our menu of excellent yet casual and unpretentious pub food is served in a family-friendly, smoke-free environment that all patrons will enjoy. Our old west livery stable provides a comfortable, warm and rustic atmosphere that includes a full restaurant, 10 barrel brewing system, comfortable bar area complete with large screen TV’s and pool tables as well as a large patio for the enjoyment of our hand crafted ales.
hoursOfOperation: Sunday-Thursday: 11:30am - 9pm  Friday-Saturday: 11:30am - 10pm

name: Three Floyds Brewing Company
description: Three Floyds Brewing Company LLC was founded in 1996 by brothers Nick and Simon with their father Mike Floyd. The original brewery was built by Nick and Simon in a run down warehouse located in Hammond, Indiana. The first beers brewed by the brothers were designed to be a departure from the fairly bleak craft brewing scene in the region. Nick and Simon brewed intense balanced beers that were and still remain “not normal” by conventional standards.    In November of 2005, after receiving numerous visitors to the brewery over the years, Three Floyds opened its own brewpub at the production facility. What was once office space is now a refuge for the craft beer enthusiast. With all the Three Floyds mainstays, seasonal offerings, special small batch beers and many guest beers it is a mecca for craft beer. The pub also has a full service kitchen providing pub fare of the best quality supported by a 3000 square foot organic herb and vegetable garden.

name: Three Freaks Brewery
description: The mission of 3 Freaks brewery is to offer small batch hand crafted beer that is truly flavorful. This will be provided to our craft beer family in a laid back atmosphere where we love to talk beer. And yes, you are part of the family. We are a humble brewery and don't have all the answers but we still love to talk beer.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Thu: 1:00 pm - 8:30 pm  Fri: 1:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 6:00 pm

name: Three Heads Brewing
description: Ales with character.  Characters with ales. Three Heads Brewing is dedicated to one thing…making great beer.

name: Three Magnets Brewing Company
description: Three Magnets Brewing Co. is a soon-to-be opened brewery in Olympia, WA. Stay tuned for more details...

name: Three Needs Brewery and Taproom
description: Freshly-brewed self and local beers, as well as a small but decent selection of beers on tap. Red felt pool table in the back, and friendly barstaff.

name: Charlottesville
description: On June 3, 1781, in the heart of the Revolutionary War, Jack Jouette made his legendary horseback ride to Charlottesville to warn Governor Thomas Jefferson and his legislators of an attempt at their capture by an advancing British Calvary.  Led only by moonlight, Jack rode 40 miles along a backwoods trail marked by three distinct axe notches in the trees, a path later known as Three Notch'd Road.  We here at Three Notch'd Brewing Co. will never be as legendary as some of the most revered characters in Virginia history, but we do aim to leave our humble mark in the world of craft beer.    Jack left his mark, we're leaving ours, how will you leave yours?    Three Notch'd Brewing Company, LEAVE YOUR MARK.

name: Three Phase Brewing
description: Three Phase Brewing Company is a start up craft brewery. Three friends hanging out and making great beer for everyone to enjoy.

name: Three Rivers Eatery And Brewhouse
description: The Three Rivers Eatery and Brewhouse was established in 1997 by John Silva, Bob and Cindy Beckley in Farmington, New Mexico. The restaurant and brewery is located in downtown Farmington, on 101 East Main Street. It was formerly called the Andrews Building, and was built and opened in 1912. It was built to house The Farmington Drug Store and The Farmington Times-Hustler Newspaper (now The Daily Times), which became the longest standing drugstore and fountain in New Mexico.    The unique decor consists mostly of priceless items found in the building during the renovation. Three Rivers believes in preserving their historical heritage of downtown Farmington. The restaurant was expanded in July, 1999. The addition includes an outdoor private patio, a bar, and the largest beer label and beer coaster collections in New Mexico. The restaurant has occupancy to provide for large party dining and special private parties. We also sell t-shirts, caps and 1/2 gallon jugs of all our brews.

name: Three Skulls Ales
description: Avast, ye scurvy dogs! Three Skulls Ales celebrates those scallywags who traveled the Caribbean seas pillaging anything they could get their hands on.  Of course we all know that those pirates who roamed the seas were a nasty lot.  But they certainly did enjoy large amounts of good grog!  We also celebrate those few women who took to the seas to join the men who thirsted for booty.  They were as fierce as the men!  Enjoy!

name: Three Spirits Brewery
description: Three Spirits is a microbrewery soon to be located in Southwest Charlotte. We will produce high quality, unfiltered craft beers served in a soothing environment. This will be a place like no other microbrewery you have been to in the past. Initially we will start with 4 different beers. A red lager, "Red Moon Rising", an IPA, "Hopper's Delight", a brown ale, "Agate Have It!", and a light golden ale called "Southern Bliss". There are 5 other recipes which will be released throughout the year. Pending finding the right spot, we hope to be open by the Fall.

name: Three Weavers Brewing Company
description: We created Three Weavers with one goal in mind: create a community through beer.  We believe in spending time with family and friends.  We craft beers that promote such gatherings.  The seasonality and variety of our products give reason to frequently gather, share and to become a community.    We are a craft brewery based in Inglewood, California.  Founded in 2013, we are deeply rooted in the concept of responsibility - to our environment, to our industry, to our community, and to our employees. Three Weavers exists to share our love and appreciation of beer with the world.

name: ThumbCoast Brewing Company
description: Your Port Huron craft beer destination! 20 beers on tap, all the time, from our own brewery and other great breweries from around the Country.

name: Thunder Canyon Brewery
description: Thunder Canyon Brewery, Located in the foothills Mall in Northwest Tucson opened in November of 1997.    Tucson's most award winning brewpub. Locally owned and independent.     Our objective is simple: We serve the finest, hand-crafted beers produced from a working, on-site brewery; we offer healthy, contemporary bistro-style cuisine; and we serve it all up in a fun, clean and friendly environment.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Thu - Sat: 11:00 am - 2:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm

name: Thunderhead Brewing Company
description: Every Thunderhead can begins life in Kearney, NE.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:	1:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Tue:	7:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Wed:	5:00 pm - 12:00 am  Thu - Sat:	11:00 am - 1:00 am  Sun:	11:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: Thunderhead Brewery #2
hoursOfOperation: Open Daily 11:00am-1:00am.

name: Tibbs Brewing Company
description: Tibbs Brewing Company was created to produce hand crafted, high quality, small batch craft beers. We will be brewing on a one barrel (31 US gallons) system to allow for constant experimental batches, while maintaining a core group of staple beers

name: Tied House Brewery & Cafe
description: Tied House is the South Bay's original microbrewery. Family owned and in operation since 1988. We feature hand crafted brews and yummy pub grub.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thurs: 11:30 am - 10:00 pm  Fri: 11:30 am - 11:00 pm  Sat: 11:30 am - 10:00 pm  Sun: 11:30 am - 9:00 pm

name: San Jose
description: Tied House is the South Bay's original microbrewery. Family owned and in operation since 1988. We feature hand crafted brews and yummy pub grub.

name: Tight Lines Brewery
description: Tight Lines Brewery creates home-crafted beers right in the heart of Brookings, OR. We are family owned and operated and look forward to sharing our family's passion with you and yours.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Sat: 3:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Tight Lines Brewing Company
description: Tight Lines Brewing Company will be Morehead City's only operating brewery and restaurant. Founded in a historic building in downtown Morehead City, Tight Lines will capture the heritage and lifestyle of Carteret County through producing premium brews.

name: Tighthead Brewing Company
description: Tighthead Brewing Company was founded in 2010 by Owner and Master Brewer, Bruce Dir. Like most brewery adventures, the dream goes back many years and has uncountable iterations. The final version came down to one man finally finding the heart, with a little shove, to drop out of Corporate America and follow what is every brewers dream...opening your own brewery!

name: Timeless Pints Brewing Company
description: Lakewood's first microbrewery!     On Father's Day, several years ago, my son and I purchased a home brewing kit for my husband. As an Engineer and a lover of craft beer, he was excited to experiment with his own concoctions. Since his first trial run, he's produced multiple variety of stouts, ales, lagers and IPA's as well as very happy friends, family and neighbors. His love for the unique keeps him constantly in search of "new and different" ingredients and the hope of a perfect combination.    One hot July evening, some friends disclosed they were embarking on a new restaurant idea. They asked Chris (my husband) if he would brew the beer specifically for their new endeavor. The ABC frowns on beer sold without the proper licensing and selling from the kitchen counter is not a viable option. Thus a new venture began.    What was once a dream is now a reality and we can now bring our own craft beer to our local Lakewood/Long Beach community. You'll find us just behind the Long Beach Airport.
hoursOfOperation: Thu: 4:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri: 2:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Tin Man Brewing Company
description: Tin Man Brewing Co. was assembled in 2012, an alloy of production brewery and restaurant. Committed to sustaining a habitable environment for all living and mechanical being, we utilize innovative processes to minimize waste and maximize taste. Forging new ground, we were one of the first small craft breweries in the United States to use a mash filter.

name: Tin Whiskers Brewery and Taproom
description: The three founders of Tin Whiskers Brewing Co., LLC are George Kellerman, Jake Johnson, and Jeff Moriarty. They first met in 2005 while going to the University of Minnesota for bachelor degrees in Electrical Engineering. Over time, they all worked together as hardware design engineers for a small engineering services company specializing in RF-centric products. Being young engineers working downtown Minneapolis, they attended various happy hours together. It quickly became clear that they all really loved craft beer and were very intrigued with the science of the brewing process.    Jake and Jeff are the two brewers of the company who designed and honed the recipes. They got their start in 2006 brewing extract kits on Jake's Mom's kitchen stove much to her chagrin. (A few boil-overs did occur on her stove, whoops!) They brewed countless extract kits until in 2010, when after touring Surly and Flat Earth, they were inspired to turn their passion (like the founders of those breweries) into a business. From that point forward it has been all grain brewing and loving it. Nowadays, Jake focuses on the brewing aspect of the business while Jeff focuses on the brewing as well as the business side of the operation.    George, in the early years, was a force within the brewery by helping out at every brew session and providing needed muscle for cleaning and moving material around the brewhouse. He focused a lot on the quality of our beer and pushed us to design better more complex beers. He has moved on to be in charge of our online presence including developing our own beer wiki engine.
hoursOfOperation: Wednesday: 4-10PM  Thursday 4-10PM  Friday 3-11PM  Saturday 12-11PM

name: Tipping Point Tavern
description: Here at Tipping Point Tavern you will find the finest artisan smoked meats, local beers, good friends and a relaxed atmosphere. We use as much local meats and produce as possible in the kitchen. Whether you are from around the world or around the corner we guarantee you will have a good time at the tavern.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thurs: 11:30am till Midnight  Fri & Sat: 11:30am till 1:00am  Sun: 11:30 till 9:00

name: Tired Hands Brewing Company
description: We value local over imported, small batches over mass production, and striking a successful balance between giving back to our community and personal profit. Localization guides everything we do, from sourcing raw ingredients and materials, to employing area talent.    Tired Hands Brewing Company will operate at 16 Ardmore Avenue, Ardmore Pa, on a six barrel brewhouse. We will focus our brewing on two very broad styles of beers that hold a special place in my heart: Belgian/French farmhouse ales and American hop-forward ales.    All cheeses, meats, and seasonal produce served at our cafe (simple and satisfying fare from honest local producers) will be sourced from within 100 miles of our brewery.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Sun: 4:00 pm - 12:00 am

name: Titletown Brewing
description: Titletown Brewing Co was founded in 1996 inside the historic Chicago Northwestern Train Depot in the heart of Green Bay, WI.  The brewpub is open year-round serving unique, hand-crafted dishes, fresh "honest" pints, and hand made Sno-Cap Root Beer.  Titletown's Beerworks production brewery was completed in 2014, bottling award winning beers just footsteps from the existing brewpub.
hoursOfOperation: 11am - 9pm 7 days a week

name: Tivoli Brewing
description: The Tivoli Beer story traces its roots to 1864, when German immigrant Moritz Sigi founded a brewery in the newly settled town of Denver. Taken over in 1900 by John Good and renamed Tivoli, this brewery would become one of the largest breweries in the West, selling its light golden lager nearly everywhere west of the Mississippi until closing its doors in 1969. In 2012, a group of Colorado Natives formed the Tivoli Distributing Company to bring this Colorado legend back to life.

name: Toasted and Tapped Brewery and Restaurant Flowery Branch
description: Toasted and Tapped began as a challenge to a group of friends.  The challenge was to take our combined skills and create a brewpub that excels in providing tasty beers, inspired food, and excellent customer service.  After meeting in college, the group entered the work place to refine the skills required to create and operate a successful brewpub.  In January of 2010, with inspired council from family, Paul Coggins relocated to Georgia to focus the group on one purpose.  With the help of God, the group was charged to create the best dining experience for the community.  After many months of construction, permitting, setbacks, and discoveries; Toasted and Tapped opened its doors to the public on November 26th, 2010.  We at Toasted and Tapped are excited to offer the best food, beer, and service we can to the community which gives us so much.
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Closed  Tuesday - Wednesday 11:00am - 10:00pm  Thursday 11:00am - 10:00pm (Team Trivia at 8pm)  Friday - Saturday 11:00am - Midnight  Sunday - Starting March 6th - 1pm to 9pm

name: TomCat Brewing Company
description: Closed in 1996. Became Pale Ale Brewing.

name: Tommyknocker Brewery
description: We are located in the Colorado Mountains in the cozy historic mining town of Idaho Springs. You can still feel the presence of the miners and see how the town looked during the mining days of the 1890’s.     Just 25 miles west of Denver and 20 miles east of Summit Co., we are easily found from either direction. Skiers can sit by our fireplace and warm up with a great beer after skiing or fill up on a delicious lunch on the way up to the slopes.
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Sat 11:00am- 2:00am  Sun 11:00am-12:00am

name: Top Frog Brewery
description: Premium quality beer with a hometown feel.
hoursOfOperation: Growler Fill's - By Appointment Only.

name: Top of the Hill Restaurant and Brewery
hoursOfOperation: Restaurant is open everyday from 11:00 a.m. – 2:00 a.m.  Full Lunch Menu served until 3:00 p.m.  Full Dinner Menu served 5:00 p.m. – 10:00 p.m.  Limited menu served 3:00 – 5:00 p.m. and 10:00 p.m. – 2:00 a.m.

name: Top Rung Brewery
description: Top Rung Brewing is a 10 barrel production brewery with tasting room at the brewery. Top Rung Brewing is a destination for craft beer drinkers to enjoy their beverage and view a production brewery facility. Our tasting room is family friendly and while we will only offer snacks, we partner with local food vendors and food trucks as well as allow patrons to bring in their own food of their choice or have it delivered. Top Rung Brewing.....bringing quality craft beer to Lacey.
hoursOfOperation: Fri - Sat: 2:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Top Shelf Brewery
description: Top Shelf Brewery is the newest brewery to hit Connecticut. It was created to provide top of the line locally hand crafted brews. After we finish all of the necessary paperwork with the government we will bring you the highest quality beer the area has to offer. Our 3 flagship beers will be available in stores around state as well as on draft in all of your favorite bars and restaurants. Our taproom will consist of 8+ taps where you will not only be able to drink our 3 flagship beers but many others that are only available in our taproom. All of these hand crafted beers will be available to go from our taproom via 22oz bombers.

name: Toppling Goliath Brewing Company
description: Toppling Goliath is a stealth brewery, flying fast, under the radar. This has been true since the day we quietly opened our first ½ barrel brewery and tap room on the west side of Decorah, IA in 2009. The batches were small but the taste was gigantic, and word spread like wildfire.    Today, our team brews at a larger production facility on the edge of town, regularly experimenting at the tap room to satisfy our craving for new and exciting creations. Numbers are not our game, making a lot of the same beer is just too boring, and life is just too short.    The history of Toppling Goliath lies in the dreams of tomorrow, not the pages of the past. The past is for those who rely on high volume and low value. The past is for those who duplicate rather than design. The past is for cowards. We are forward thinkers and cunning crafters, quietly building our revolution. “Big Beers Brewed in Small Batches.”
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	 12:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Tow Yard Brewing Co.
description: We are a brewery, tasting room, and restaurant located in downtown Indianapolis. Our draft list is made up of our own beers, brewed under the direction of Head Brewer Bradley Zimmerman, and a constantly rotating cast of other delicious brews. Our location is within walking distance of Banker's Life Fieldhouse, Lucas Oil Stadium, and The Indiana Convention Center.     Our restaurant, The Larder, offers a variety of delicious eats for lunch and dinner. Chef Tommy Thompson's menu reflects his South Florida/New Orleans upbringing and his travels across the U.S. and abroad.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 1:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: Town Hall Brewery
description: The Minneapolis Town Hall Brewery (Town Hall) opened in October 1997 after its founders graduated from business school and spent a couple of years in corporate America.    Town Hall founders Pete and Scot met as seventh graders at Kromrey Middle School in Middleton WI.  At the tender age of 13 both knew what they wanted to do for a living... make and drink good beer.  Just kidding!!    To make a long story short, Pete and Scot spent their formative years playing baseball at the West Middleton Town Hall.  Ever since, the words "Town Hall" evoke memories of community, relaxing with friends and happiness.  When Pete and Scot were reacquainted in Minneapolis they opened the Town Hall.    Tucked away on the fringes of downtown Minneapolis, the Town Hall offers a refreshing alternative to other eating and drinking establishments.  Its relaxed environment attracts a diverse crowd of college students, business people, professors, theater patrons and many more.    The Town Hall makes some of the best beer in America and provides an atmosphere where its patrons can relax and enjoy them.  Please come and taste our award winning beer and fantastic food.  Food and beverages are served in our bar, dining room and lounge.  Outdoor seating is available on our spacious patio from April 1 (weather permitting) until the snow flies in winter.

name: Town Hall Tap
hoursOfOperation: Monday-Thursday: 11am – 1am  Friday: 11am – 2am  Saturday: 9am – 2am  Sunday: 10am – 12am

name: Track 7 Brewing Company
description: The Graham and Scott families established Track 7 Brewing Company as an outlet for creative expression through unique and artisanal beers. The name, Track 7 Brewing Company, was selected in part due to the brewery’s proximity to the old Western Pacific railroad tracks, west of Curtis Park, and as a nod to the integral role the railroad has and continues to play in Sacramento’s rich history.    Track 7's approach to beer is in the vein of the firmly-hopped West Coast tradition, but without fidelity to a singular “style”. This unfocused approach allows Track 7 to experiment with all varieties of beer, regardless of American, Belgian, English, or German inspiration.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri:	5:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat:	2:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun:	12:00 pm - 4:00 pm

name: Wells Park
description: Tractor Brewing Co. produces world class beers. Come see the brewery. Try the beers and enjoy delicious BBQ next door! Open 7 days a week    Helping New Mexicans Get Plowed with Great Beer Since 1999.
hoursOfOperation: MONDAY -THURSDAY 3:00PM – CLOSE    FRIDAY-SUNDAY 1:00PM – CLOSE

name: Trade Route Brewing Company
description: At Trade Route Brewing Company, we like to think of ourselves as explorers charting the beer frontier. We are inspired by time honored brewing traditions of the world. We make beer for the adventurous. We make beer for you.

name: Trade Winds Brewing
description: Maui's first microbrewery.

name: Traffic Jam and Snug
description: The Traffic Jam and Snug, established 1965, is truly one of Detroit's hidden treasures. Known throughout Midtown for our in-house bakery, microbrewery, and dairy, our curiously intimate multi-level dining rooms, and an eclectic menu of made-from-scratch dishes, there is simply nothing quite like The Traffic Jam.

name: Transient Artisan Ales
description: Transient Artisan Ales was formed not due to a lack of great beer, or with the intentions of growing a massive craft beer brand.  Rather, our goal is to recognize and appreciate the bounty of our local environment, take time to enjoy a simple and beautiful thing, and provide others the opportunity to do the same.    As the name Transient implies, our beers are meant to change with age, and even from batch to batch.  We use a blend of expressive yeasts and encourage the influence of the local Midwest microflora and the natural environment on our small-batch offerings through open-top fermentation.

name: Transmitter Brewing
description: Transmitter Brewing was formed to bring a unique perspective on traditional beer styles to the local NYC beer scene. Through the informed use and interactions of yeast and hops, we hope to add to the conversation about what is craft beer.

name: Trap Rock Restaurant and Brewery
description: Trap Rock Restaurant & Brewery opened its doors 1997 and combines seasonal craft brews with seasonal, American food. Designed by Morris Nathanson, Trap Rock Restaurant offers a working microbrewery and a comfortable European ski lodge atmosphere.
hoursOfOperation: Monday-Thursday: 11:30AM-10PM  Friday-Saturday: 11:30AM-11PM  Sunday: 12 Noon-9PM

name: Trapp Family Lodge Brewery
description: More than a decade ago Johannes von Trapp started thinking about brewing his own beer, for guests of the resort. His dream was to produce an American version of the tasty Lager he has enjoyed over the years on his trips to the countryside near his ancestral Austrian home.     Johannes' dream became reality in the Spring of 2010, with the opening of the Trapp Family Brewery. The modest facility (60,000 or so gallons a year) is located in the lower level of the DeliBakery (formerly the Austrian Tea Room), where draughts of the heavenly concoction will be available year round.

name: Treehaus Brewery
description: Treehaus Craft Brewery is a start-up family owned and operated micro brewery located in Charlottesville, VA. Curious about our name? We were planning to start our brewing operation in a tree house! We lost the ability to acquire Treehouse as an LLC so we switched "house" to "haus" and voila! Treehaus Craft Brewery was born!    The treehouse fell through but we have started construction on our BrewHaus to house our test system so that we can perfect our recipes.     Our master brewer, Christoph Reinicke, attended Seibold Institute for brewing and interned with Starr Hill Brewery in Crozet, Va from 2011-2012. His mother Ann also attended Seibold, studying brewery management. Make sure you follow us on Facebook for the latest happenings! Thank you for checking us out and we hope to serve you soon!

name: Tri-City Brewing Company
description: Tri City Brewing is located in Bay City, Michigan, in the heart of the Tri Cities. Tri City Brewing was founded in 2007 by a local group of home brewers. Look around our website to learn more about our history and the beers that we brew.  Read more...

name: Triangle Brewing Company
description: We are a locally owned craft brewery situated in downtown Durham, North Carolina. Triangle Brewing Company is dedicated to producing well balanced, full-flavored, yet highly drinkable Belgian and American style ales.    Triangle beers are made with the finest hops and barley malt. Flavors harmonize, not fight for individual attention. Triangle beers are not pasteurized nor do we add preservatives (except for a healthy addition of hops). Seeing beer as equal to, if not superior to, wine, Triangle beers are designed to complement food. Because of this effort, soon one will be able to walk into any fine restaurant and pub in the Raleigh, Durham, Chapel Hill region and be pretty sure of finding a Triangle beer available.
hoursOfOperation: Tours every Saturday 1pm to 2:30pm

name: Trickster's Brewing Company
description: We are a production brewery nestled in Coeur d'Alene, Idaho just doing draft right now with bottles to follow by December 2012.  We have 5 year round brands which are as follows: Blonde Ale, Amber Ale, Brown Ale, IPA, and Extra Pale Ale along with seasonal beers that are always changing.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat: 11:00 am - 7:00 pm

name: Trillium Brewing
description: We are a family owned and operated brewery in the Fort Point Channel neighborhood of Boston, Massachusetts. We created Trillium to realize our dream of bringing creative and flavorful beers to you. These beers are what we envision might have been made today, if a centuries old beer culture had naturally evolved in New England.  To achieve this vision, we stand our craft beers on the shoulders of native ingredients and artisan practices, balancing them with modern-day expertise.

name: Trinity Brewhouse
description: Always fresh, always crisp.  Crafted with the finest quality hops from around the world, and filtered Scituate Reservoir water from right here in Little Rhody.    The beers, ales, porters and stouts available at the Brewhouse Pub are brewed on premises - ensuring a high quality product that is always satisfying and never flat.    Our Brewmaster takes great pride in providing our customers with the freshest beer in the city.  If we were any fresher...you'd slap us!    Stop by for a pint or two in house - or grab a Growler To Go and enjoy great Trinity Brewhouse Beer at your own leisure.
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Thursday : 11:30AM-1:00AM  Friday 11:30AM-2:00AM  Saturday Noon-2:00AM  Sunday Noon to 1:00 AM

name: TRiNiTY Brewing
description: TRiNiTY BREWiNG Company is a Public Ale and Lager House. Inspired by Belgian and English tap houses, our pub focuses on three major concepts: Artisanal Beer, Slow Food, and Conscious People. Cheers!
hoursOfOperation: Hours	  Mon - Thu:	12:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Fri:	12:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Sat:	11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Sun:	11:00 am - 8:00 pm

name: Triple 7 Restaurant & Brewery at Main St Station
Triple C Brewing Company
description: In October 2011 Triple C Brewing Company incorporated and our beer dreams started coming true. Triple C are Chris, Chris, and Christina. Chris and Chris met while working at a local bank and quickly realized we weren't cut out for banking and dreamed of owning our own business. While home brewing late one evening, the three Cs had a crazy idea to start a brewery. All of our hard work is finally paying off and we anticipate an early summer 2012 opening of our South End microbrewery! We can't wait to share our beer with Charlotte and beyond and look forward welcoming everyone to our spacious tap room very soon.
hoursOfOperation: MONDAY - closed   TUESDAY 5 - 9 pm  WEDNESDAY 5 - 9 pm  THURSDAY 5 - 9 pm  FRIDAY 4 - 9 pm  SATURDAY 2 - 9 pm  SUNDAY 1 - 6 pm

name: Triple Crossing Brewing Company
description: Triple Crossing Brewing Company grew out of the love of great beer, and the idea that beer is best enjoyed when shared with friends, straight out of the tap.

name: Triple J Chophouse and Brew Co
Triple Rock Brewery and Alehouse
description: Even as one of the oldest brewpubs in the country, Triple Rock is all about keeping things fresh. Fresh craft beer served along fresh food, with menus and specials changing and updating all the time. On any two consecutive days here you will likely find something new and different to try, or you’re welcome to stick with your favorites (those will be fresh too).     That’s one of the advantages of Triple Rock, where you can watch our brewers make the beer and know that you’ll be drinking it as soon as its done—no kegging, no bottling necessary, just straight from the tanks to your glass. Also, with 11 serving tanks and 8 fermenters on the premises, we can always keep something fresh on our beer board. Do you feel yourself getting thirsty?
hoursOfOperation: Monday – 11:30 – 1am  Tuesday – 11:30 – 1am  Wednesday – 11:30 – 1am  Thursday – 11:30 – 2am  Friday – 11:30 – 2am  Saturday – 11:30 – 2am  Sunday – 11:30 – 12am

name: Triple Voodoo Brewing
description: Triple Voodoo Brewing is life to the extreme and at full volume. Born from the underground beer scene in San Francisco, we have been brewing some of the most extreme beer styles this city has seen to date! From our amazing and complex Inception Belgian Style Ale to our mind blowing 32% ABV Thermonuclear Stout that we conjured to compete for the "Strongest Beer in the World", our mission is to bring you an amazing high ABV craft beer line-up. Here's the team who work around the clock 24/7 to make all these happen.

name: Triplehorn Brewing Co.
description: Triplehorn Brewing Co. may  be considered “Just another WA brewery”, au contraire mon frere! Pardon my French. We are another GREAT WA brewery!    Our intent is to quench the thirst of the masses. Rice is not a primary ingredient in great beer, and we won’t compromise our Liquid of the Gods. If you have a malty, hoppy, silky big beer desire, you are welcome. Our taproom gives full vantage of the brewing experience. Come for the beer; enjoy the brash, bold, and often audacious intimacy.

name: Triptych Brewing
description: A triptych (trip-tik) is a work of art, divided into three equal parts and built around a common theme. Triptych Brewing is three guys from three different walks of life sharing our passion for great, local beer with YOU. Built upon the traditional ingredients of hops, barley, and water and serving the communities of Champaign, Urbana, and Savoy, Triptych Brewing is dedicated to exploring the art of craft beer with the community.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 3:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri: 3:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 11:00 pm

name: Triton Brewing Company
description: Operated by its member-managers, Jon W. Lang and David M. Waldman, Triton Brewing Company is a brewery producing high-quality craft beer for distribution in Indiana.     Triton Brewing Company is a creative outlet in the form of a traditional, community-based production brewery located in the heartland of Indiana. The shareholders, employees, and libations of Triton Brewing Company embody exemplary strength of character, resolute integrity, and consistent quality in all their forms. We are dedicated to increasing a sense of fun and community through the creation of fine traditionally crafted ale and lager.    Beer and other beverages produced at our Indianapolis facility are available for sale throughout Indiana and Central Illinois. A tasting room at the brewery and a second tap room location provide other marketing opportunities.    Triton Brewing Company is the realization of the dream of Mr. Lang and Mr. Waldman that Indiana be a significant contributor to the world beer culture and can produce local beers that Hoosiers can be proud of and can purchase statewide.

name: Princeton
description: Restaurant & Brewery Serving Our Own Craft Beer and Locally Grown Organic Foods
hoursOfOperation: Monday-Thursday: 11am-1:00am  Friday-Saturday: 11am-2:00am  Sunday: Noon-Midnight

name: New Hope
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Wed: 11:30am-1:00am  Thurs-Sat: 11:30am-2:00am  Sun: Noon-Midnight

name: Tröegs Brewing Company
description: Tröegs Brewing Company was established in 1997 by brothers Chris and John Trogner. Since then, the Central PA natives have been handcrafting world-class beers that blend traditional brewing techniques with the innovation and eclecticism of the American craft brewing movement. Today, the Hershey, PA-based brewery produces six year-round beers (Hopback Amber Ale, Troegenator Double Bock, JavaHead Stout, Tröegs Pale Ale, DreamWeaver Wheat, and Perpetual IPA); four seasonal releases as part of the Hop Cycle series (Cultivator Helles Bock, Sunshine Pils, Hop Knife Harvest Ale, and Blizzard of Hops Winter IPA); and two limited beers (Nugget Nectar and Mad Elf Ale).     In addition to these beers, Tröegs produces a variety of experimental, small batch beers as part of its Scratch Beer Series. These beers are available exclusively at the brewery and most are draft-only limited releases, although some popular Scratch Beers (Fresh Hop Ale, Fest Lager, etc.) are bottled for release through the General Store at the brewery.     In late 2013, Tröegs introduced a special line of cork & cage bottle releases. The first, LaGrave, is available year-round. Master of Pumpkins was also released in 2013 and will continue with availability in the fall. Other beers such as Jovial have since followed suit. The addition of a canning line not only offers the brewery more flexibility in the way it presents its beers, but also allows Tröegs to provide customers with more packaging options. To date, Tröegs has released Perpetual IPA and Sunshine Pils in 12-ounce cans and Troegenator in 16-ounce cans. Plans to release other seasonal and limited beers in cans are currently in the works.     The Splinter Series is an extremely limited line of barrel-aged beers packaged in cork & cage bottles. While only a handful of these beers have been produced, Tröegs plans to expand this series with the inclusion of Nebulous (barrel-aged LaGrave with Brett), bourbon barrel-aged Troegenator, and others.     Tröegs currently distributes its beers throughout Delaware, Massachusetts, Maryland, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Virginia and Washington D.C. In addition, Tröegs plans to expand into other New England markets in 2015.    Our state-of-the-art facility gives visitors a glimpse into the workings of a full production brewery by offering both guided tasting and self-guided tours. Our Tasting Room provides ample seating with views of the brewhouse, where you can sit back and enjoy one of our six year-round beers as well as a variety of seasonal and small-batch experimental brews.     Our Snack Bar reflects our constant desire to explore, discover and share by focusing on fresh, simple fare that is locally sourced and house-made. With that in mind, we feature a seasonally rotating menu with daily chef’s specials.    www.troegs.com
hoursOfOperation: Sun:  11:00am - 9:00pm Thu:  11:00am - 10:00pm Fri:  11:00am - 10:00pm Sat:  11:00am - 10:00pm  General Store Hours  ------------------------------  Sunday: 11am to 5pm  Monday - Saturday: 11am to 8pm

name: Trophy Brewing Company
description: Trophy Brewing Co. represents Chris Powers and David “Woody” Lockwood’s long-held dream of having their own brewery. A place where they can take ideas about and for beers, scratched down on napkins over late night drinking sessions, and turn them into a reality. Trophy is not big, we feature a 3 BBL brewhouse with 3 single batch and 2 double batch fermenters; but what does come out of those tanks; we take pride in.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 5:00 pm - 12:00 am  Fri - Sat: 5:00 pm - 2:00 am  Sun: 5:00 pm - 12:00 am

name: Trout River Brewing
description: Trout River Brewing was founded in July 1996 by Dan and Laura Gates. We began brewing in early December of that year. We still own and operate this microbrewery in the northeastern region of Vermont--The Northeast Kingdom! Come visit this special and beautiful place and taste all that the Kingdom has to offer.    Trout River Brewing prides itself on creating and serving fresh, all natural, premium ales and lagers. Our beers are made with pure Vermont water, the best imported and domestic malts and hops, and quality yeasts. Nothing else is added and we take nothing away!
hoursOfOperation: Our pub and retail shop is open Fridays & Saturdays from 4-9 pm

name: Trumer Pils
description: American and European brewmasters have come together to create the Trumer Brauerei Berkeley. With a passionate commitment to the Pilsner style, this international team has worked tirelessly to preserve every detail of the original Trumer Pils process of its centuries old brewery in Salzburg, Austria. Their efforts have paid off. Trumer Brauerei Berkeley combines the heritage and tradition of the old world with the new world's dedication to craft brewing.

name: TRVE Brewing Company
description: TRVE Brewing is the Denver brewery dedicated to bringing you beer that's beyond the pale. A neighborhood spot where you can hang out and have some killer beer.
hoursOfOperation: Monday-Tuesday:Closed  Wednesday-Thursday:4PM-10PM  Friday-Saturday:4PM-12AM  Sunday:2PM-8PM

name: Tuckahoe Brewing Company
description: Tuckahoe Brewing Company was established in January of 2011 by four friends who had been brewing beer for fun for several years. We were brewing five and ten gallon batches while we barbequed and enjoyed drinking beer with family and friends. Going to the next level and brewing commercially was a thought that was always in the back of each our minds, but after we heard enough of our friends say ...the same thing, we decided to take the idea seriously.     We expect to begin with four recipes, a Belgian Wit, an English Style Porter, a Pale Ale. Cape May County is a beautiful place, and brewing a beer that captures that beauty in both its ingredients and the finished product is one of our goals. We want to provide the people of Cape May County beers that will always remind them of home.    Please look for our beers on tap in bars and restaurants around Cape May County, and bottled for take home as well. Also, please stop by and see us this fall at 9 Stoney Road in Dennis Township.

name: Tugboat Brewing Company
description: Tugboat Ale is remarkably different from the glut of pasteurized "can beer made available by other beverage merchants.  Using the time honored traditions of brewers in Great Britain, our ales retain their freshness because the yeast is allowed to live.  A slow process of fermentation continues in our kegs, allowing the beer to retain an unparalleled freshness.  What's more, we deliberately choose not to filter our beer.  The pasteurization process that strips body and color from beer is a necessary evil in 'big batch' commercial brewing.  But, thankfully, that ain't us. We filter our coffee. Not our beer.

name: Tunnel Vision Brewery at Pond Hill Farm
description: Northern Michigan's Microbrewery located just north of Harbor Springs on the beautiful and scenic M119 (Tunnel of Trees Scenic Byway).
hoursOfOperation: 11am-6pm daily

name: Tuppers' Hop Pocket Brewing Company
description: An interest in history and beer led Bob and Ellie Tupper to  a quest throughout the United States and Europe to talk to brewers and sample classic examples of traditional brewing styles.  In 1978 they began taking formal tasting notes on each new beer they could find.    By the early 1990s the Tuppers had tasted and evaluated over 6,000 beers and visited hundreds of breweries.  They had found many excellent beers, but envisioned an ale that no one had made—one that would encompass bold American flavors and traditional European brewing techniques.  They asked Old Dominion Brewing Co., which they felt was one of the very best craft breweries in the country, to work with them to develop this ideal ale.  Tuppers’ Hop Pocket Ale was the result.      In 1997 the Tuppers again worked with the Old Dominion brewers to create Tuppers’ Hop Pocket Pils, based on the Keller or Hefe Pils style of Northern Bavaria, but with a unique American boldness to the flavor.    The Tuppers live in Bethesda, Maryland, where Bob teaches history.  Ellie works in Washington as a production editor of scientific books.  The Tuppers still travel and taste beers and now have notes on over 14,000 different brews.

name: Turkey Hill Brewing Company
description: Located just minutes from downtown Bloomsburg and Bloomsburg University off of Exit 236 on Interstate 80 and directly adjacent to The Inn at Turkey Hill,  Turkey Hill Brewing Company Pub & Grille offers casual dining in a unique atmosphere as well as some of the area’s best craft beer brewed on site.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	4:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Fri - Sat:	4:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sun:	4:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Turoni's Main Street Brewery
description: Turoni's Pizzery & Brewery takes great pride in serving you, and we thank you. We are dedicated to warm and friendly service to our guests by employees who give a damn. We pledge to provide the best products at the best value. If we are not proud of it we WILL NOT serve it!    Turoni's pizza has been made in Evansville for over three decades, yet never before has the recipe been reproduced by commercial establishments because of the difficulties involved in preparation.    Turoni's has been able to overcome these difficulties to share with you a freshly made pizza crust that is crisp and light enough to hold our secret sauce, gobs of gooey mozzarella cheese, and your favorite ingredients (including a few exotic ones) to make what we call "Our Specialty", Turoni's thin crust pizza. This flavor and texture makes Turoni's pizza very unique.

description: Turoni's Pizzery & Brewery takes great pride in serving you, and we thank you. We are dedicated to warm and friendly service to our guests by employees who give a damn. We pledge to provide the best products at the best value. If we are not proud of it we WILL NOT serve it!

description: Turtle Anarchy Brewing Company is a family owned microbrewery in Franklin, TN specializing in craft brewed ales.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 5:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat: 4:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Turtle Mountain Brewing Company
description: he Story Behind Turtle Mountain Brewing Company  TMBC is the end result of way too much dreaming (and drinking) on the part of the proprietor, Nico Ortiz. Starting with a student exchange to Germany when he was 16, he has dedicated his life to the pursuit of good beer. This brewpub is the result of over 23 years of "market research" in hundreds of bars, brewpubs, breweries, garages, and beer festivals all over the world.    The name " Turtle Mountain" comes from the Tewa name for Sandia Peak. Alfonso Ortiz (Nico's father) was born and raised at Oke Owingeh, north of Espanola, and one of six Pueblos that speak Tewa. Nico's father's Indian name was "Oku Pin", which translates as " Turtle Mountain". As a tribute to his father, who provided the inspirational and financial means to open the pub, Nico has named it Turtle Mountain Brewing Company.

name: Tustin Brewing Company
description: Tustin Brewery began in 1996 and is Tustin's most popular place to meet, eat and drink the best brews in Orange County. Our mug club is over 1200 members strong!
hoursOfOperation: Monday-Friday 3-6  Thursday 6 - Close 	  Sunday-Thursday 10 pm - Close

name: Twain's Billiards and Tap
description: We are a full service brewpub, restaurant, and poolhall located in downtown Decatur, GA. Open since 1996, we have been brewing our own crafted ales since November 2006, with Jordan Fleetwood on board as our brewmaster. Join us soon for a pint or two, some fresh, tasty grub, and few friendly games. We look forward to seeing you!

name: Twelve Bar Brews
description: Balanced. Finessed. Pleasant. Yeah, not so much.    Our beers are dry-tasting and dry-hopped, with a flavor profile that is anything but 'balanced.'  Our beers are like us; boisterous, unpretentious, and fun.
hoursOfOperation: 11-6 Friday  11-3 Saturday  Closed Sunday through Thursday

name: Twelve Degree Brewing
description: Twelve Degree Brewing is an artisanal, Belgian-inspired brewery located in the heart of Old Town Louisville, Colorado.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 4:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri: 3:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sat: 12:00 pm - 12:00 am  Sun: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Twelve Rounds Brewing Company
description: Our passion for great brews and great food both began in the kitchen. Dan started brewing around 1990, using extracts. He took up the hobby in earnest which meant taking over the garage 5 years ago and transitioning to all-grain brewing. Both Dan and Elle love to cook and brewing days became a natural outlet for hosting all days BBQs with family and friends. The 5-gallon kettle over the kitchen stove grew to a half-barrel, propane-fueled brew rig. And the backyard gained a pellet-smoker alongside the Weber grill. That’s what we call going the distance with brewing and charcuterie!    With family and friends raving about our creation, it’s time to take it seriously. We entered the 2011 California State Fair and won three medals including first place for our Knock-Out Stout and second place for The Contender – our Pale Ale. The following year we won first place for our Scottish Ale which we plan on featuring as one of our seasonal brews.    In early 2012 we decided to pursue opening our own microbrewery. Our first challenge seemed almost insurmountable: finding a name! We hit trademark snags with our first three names and finally scored with Twelve Rounds.

name: Twelve String Brewing Company
description: Located in Spokane Valley, WA, 12 String Brewing Company marries the brewer’s love of music, especially the 12 string guitar, with his passion for brewing spectacular beer. Our goal is to craft a variety of great beer in the Northwest tradition. We will also feature several other beers from our brewing friends.    Yes, 12 string brewing company crafts great beer in the Northwest tradition. This is an example of a small scale brewing company at its best! The brewery includes an onsite tap room with plenty of seating and from time to time, great live music.  And when not brewing one of his great beers, you just may just find the brewer hanging out, playing his 12 string guitar.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu:	3:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri:	3:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Sat:	12:00 pm - 11:00 pm

name: Twin Lakes Brewing Company
description: In 1985, while attending the University of California at Berkeley, Samuel Hobbs wrote a chemistry paper, for a laugh, on “aqueous beer foam” (the head of a beer). It would take 21 years for that initial interest to manifest itself into something drinkable. The spark would come after 9/11 while he drank homebrewed stout with five of his friends. Motivated by patriotic feelings and the American dream of creating a business, the energy was set in motion to start Twin Lakes Brewing Company. Weeks later, Sam and his longtime friends Matt Day, Jack Wick, and Mark Fesche developed a unique 15 gallon gravity fed pilot system and began working to create their first signature brews.    They decided to locate the brewery at the beautiful “Twin Lakes Farm” in Greenville, Delaware. This historic 252 acre farm has been in Sam’s family for seven generations and has a deep rock well aquifer which supplies perfect water for brewing. Local artisans converted an old tractor barn and art studio to accommodate a five vessel, gravity fed brewery and tasting room. Finally, on April 13, 2006, the first two brands, Greenville Pale Ale and Route 52 Pilsner, were launched.     Today Twin Lakes Brewery also produces Tweed’s Tavern Stout, Caesar Rodney Golden Ale and Winterthur Wheat, as well as seasonal styles Oktoberfest and Jublicious. Currently, Twin Lakes beer is available on tap at many fine restaurants and taverns in Delaware and Southeastern Pennsylvania. Growlers (half gallon jugs of beer) can be purchased at the brewery and kegs are available at most regional beer and liquor stores.

name: Adam's NW Bistro & Brewery
description: Adam's Northwest Bistro & Brewery focuses on taking Northwest ingredients, and turning it into something good and comforting on your plate. We pride ourselves in making our dishes from scratch, from our slow cooked braises and hand formed burgers, to our hot soups and even our Bacon! Not only is our food from scratch but we brew our own hand-crafted beers next door also. Our goal is to provide you with service and atmosphere as if you were eating in our home.

name: Two Brothers Tap House
description: After living in France, the Ebel brothers developed a passion for flavorful specialty beer. After returning to the states, they had trouble finding that type of beer in Chicago so they opened Two Brothers Brewing Company in 1996. To get them started, the brothers' grandfather, a retired dairy farmer, donated his bulk milk tanks, which were quickly converted to fermenters. Currently, the brewery resides in a 40,000 square foot facility 30 miles west of Chicago. In addition to their traditional style beers, Two Brothers Brewing Company produces many specialty beers including the Project Opus Sour series. Adjacent to the brewery, Two Brothers Tap House opened in 2008 as a restaurant which serves elevated, seasonal, and organic American pub fare. In 2011, the Ebel brothers purchased Walter Payton's Roundhouse located in Aurora, IL. The Two Brothers Roundhouse is a full service brewpub restaurant, music venue, offers banquet space for large parties and weddings and hosts the Two Brothers Cafe and Beer Bar!     Two Brothers Brewing Company's award winning products are currently available in Illinois, Indiana, Ohio, Minnesota, Pennsylvania, Florida, New York, Iowa and Missouri.
