name: Two Fathers Beer Company
description: Two Fathers Beer Company is a family sharing a passion for what we love: Coastal Virginia, handcrafting, and (obviously) beer. Throw that in a vat and you’ve got a lip-smacking selection for craft-beer aficionados, casual beer drinkers and everyone in between.

name: Two Fisted Brewing Company
description: To bring great beer and great friends together because great friends deserve great beer. Coming soon to West Michigan. A new Microbrewery with an old feel. A low key, easy going and relaxed pub to meet up with friends, have a hand crafted beer and conversation.

name: Two Goats Brewing
description: Built in a renovated 19th Century barn with a sweeping view of Seneca Lake, Two Goats Brewing is an unpretentious gathering place on the Finger Lakes Wine Trail for people who just want to drink great beer and enjoy time with their friends. Or make some new ones!
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Thur: 4 - 10pm  Wed: Closed  Fri, Sat: 12 - 12pm  Sun: 12 - 8pm

name: Two Henrys Brewing Company
description: The Two Henrys Brewing Company brews modern and traditional hand-crafted beer styles in small batches in Plant City, FL. Because local and small is just better.    With our beers we celebrate Florida’s short history and people that made our great state possible. We strive to make great beers and sneak in a Florida history lesson whether you want it or not.     Our beers can be found at our tasting room starting on or about October 1, 2013 and select bars and restaurants in the Tampa Bay area. In the meantime, read about our coming beers and namesakes ,the Two Henrys, below…or don’t.

name: Two Kilts Brewing Co
description: Two Kilts Brewing Co. was founded in 2009 by owners and brewers Chris Dillon, and Alex McGaw.  Fueled by a passion for all things craft beer they opened a modest 6  barrel brewery and in 2 short years have expanded to their current 15 barrel brewery. They specialize in hand crafting fine American Ales and Lagers, brewed with hints of European influence.

name: Two Rascals Brewing Company
description: The "Two Rascals" are Daniel and Brandon, wildland firefighters with the dream of starting a brewery together. When not protecting our beautiful state from fire, they can be found homebrewing, working on recipes, studying the business of craft brew and spending time with family and friends.     The Rascals have been dreaming up their brewery for three years.  As of 2012, they are no longer dreaming but instead, putting in the man hours and hard labor it takes to build a brewery in a historic building.    The “Two Rascals Brewing Company” will provide much needed distribution of local craft brewed beer to the western slope. Their general concept  is to offer a variety of craft beers; ranging from light to full-bodied flavors.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Tue:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Wed:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Thu:  4:00pm - 9:00pm Fri:  1:00pm - 10:00pm Sat:  1:00pm - 10:00pm Sun:  1:00pm - 8:00pm

name: Two Roads Brewing Company
description: Two Roads isn’t just the logo on our brewery building, it’s our philosophy. Life always seems to offer up two ways to go. It just so happens, we prefer the one less taken and having some fun along the way – in our lives, our careers and especially for our beers!  Now our “road less traveled” philosophy is being brought to life in the beers that we create and how we create them.

name: Two-Shy Brewing
description: Two-Shy Brewing crafts fine ales and lagers like Phat Odd Stout, Influence IPA, Dead-On Amber, Reformation Red, Picnic Pale, Ignition Double IPA, Everlasting ESB, Toby's Best, Uberdunkelweizen and more!

name: Two22 Brew
description: Two22 Brew is a place to socialize, find out about local charities, & give where you live--all while enjoying a great beer.     Two22 Brew is partnered with a small, local family foundation. Their mission is to carry out a broad range of charitable gifting to support Colorado entities in the fields of education, environmental action, and whole person enrichment.     Two22 Brew will give back $2.22 of every $10 of profit to local non-profits.

name: Tyranena Brewing Company
description: he legend of Tyranena (pronounced Tie·rah·nee·nah) began long ago, in a time before history was written. Legend tells of a foreign tribe that built a series of stone structures and effigy mounds on the edge of a lake they called Tyranena.    Today, these structures lie preserved deep under the waters of Rock Lake. No one knows for sure who built them, the purposes they served, how and why they are now submerged, or even the meaning of the word Tyranena.    We invite you to develop your own theories while enjoying one of the new legends of Tyranena, the Legendary Wisconsin Beers of the Tyranena Brewing Company.    Ask for a Legendary Wisconsin Beer where you drink.
hoursOfOperation: Tasting Room & Beer Garden hours are:  4:30 p.m. to 11:00 p.m. on Wednesday & Thursday  3:00 p.m. to midnight on Friday & Saturday  Noon to 8:00 p.m. on Sunday

name: Uinta Brewing Company
description: Named after the only major east-west running mountain range located in the continental U.S., Uinta Brewing Company's journey began in 1993 with the reality that passion for craft beer and a hankering for the great outdoors could align in Salt Lake City, UT.     Built on an axis point that endorses sustainability, community involvement and innovation, their compass guides them on a path to admirable, consistent craft beer leading consumers to discover a brand with passion, personality and soul.  Precisely, GREAT BEER is Uinta's True North.

name: Ukiah Brewing Company
description: The first certified organic brewpub in the nation!   Our food and beer is organic!  Our beer is brewed on site.   Our burgers are ground fresh daily.  We buy from local farmers, local wineries and local fisheries!  We love sustainability!
hoursOfOperation: Sunday - 11:00am to 9:00pm  Monday - 11:00am to 9:00pm  Tuesday - 11:00am to 9:00pm  Wednesday - 11:00am to 9:00pm  Thursday - 11:00am to 9:00pm  Friday - 11:00am to 10:00pm  Saturday - 11:00am to 10:00pm

name: Uncle Bear's Brewhouse Grill
description: “COME, SIT AND STAY”    Who Was Uncle Bear, You Ask?             Well he was a fun loving good fella, of the Labrador mix named “Bear”. In the good ole’ days as a young pup, he could be found cruising the college campus at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, body surfin’ at Doggie Beach in Ocean Beach (San Diego), skiing down the snow capped mountains in Ruidoso, New Mexico, relaxing in the Hot Springs of Arkansas and finally making his home in the Valley of the Sun. Since Bear was an active dog and on the go, he wanted to create a place where he and his friends could “Come, Sit And Stay”.        Well Uncle Bears’ Brewhouse Grill is that place. Born out of Bear’s  love for craft beer and excellent food, we have created an upbeat, fun atmosphere where friends, family and co-workers can come to enjoy a variety of delicious menu selections & NOW our own locally brewed craft beer. The Uncle Bear’s Brewhouse opened in 2013, as well as the 4 Grill and Bar locations were re-branded to the Grill and Tap concept that same year.    On the menu, whenever you see Bear’s paw print  you can be assured the item is a long-term house favorite or a new favorite we are sure Bear would have loved. Try any one of the items from the “Famous” Sliders, Backyard Burgers and Birds, Big Plates and Serious Sizzles, Gourmet Pizza, Bear “Bites” or Wing selections and you are in for a true treat.        The unique motif has been designed to resemble all of the places Bear or your family dog would hang out such as the garage, backyard or home.     In addition to the excellent food menu, we feature fantastic house drinks and NOW a wonderful selection of craft beers brewed on site in our state of the art display brewery. Be sure to try a Flight Bone (5-4oz. tasters) or a Growler (64oz. take-home jug) or a pint of our craft beer. With all the goodies mentioned above and numerous sporting events on a slew of TV’s, we promise you will be treated to a “Doggone Good” experience compliments of our attentive, knowledgeable and enthusiastic team..
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri: 11:00 am - 2:00 am  Sat - Sun: 10:00 am - 2:00 am

name: Uncle Billy's Brewery
description: Uncle Billy’s Brewery is located in the heart of South Austin on Barton Springs Road, with a short walk to Barton Springs Pool and Zilker Park.  Uncle Billy's Brewery and Barbecue features a brewery on site serving hand crafted beers by brewer Michael Waters. Uncle Billy's offers a delicious menu that includes barbecue, burgers and salads. Enjoy drinks and live music on the dog friendly outdoor patio.    Award-winning beers from on-site microbrewery & delicious BBQ! Daily specials, happy hour & outdoor seating.

name: Uncle Ernies Bayfront Grill & Brew House
Uncommon Brewers
description: Uncommon Brewers (UB) is a community-oriented organic microbrewery beginning operations in Santa Cruz county. Incorporating traditional Belgian brewing techniques, cutting-edge innovation from the modern West Coast, and grounded in the principles of sustainability voiced by the Slow Food Movement, our goal is to make uncommon beers for uncommon people. After nearly six years of research and development, we are now ready to bring that vision to market.

name: Under Cover Ale Works
description: Our 15-barrel brewery is dedicated to the production of high profile ales for our UnderCover allies. We encourage you to visit the brewery located in Blairsden, California. Take a tour of the brewery and enjoy our high profile ales while relaxing or playing a game of disc golf.
hoursOfOperation: 10am to evening-ish

description: A Chicago Craft Brewery focused on making great beer with an emphasis on Belgian and French styles.

name: Union Ale Brewing Company
description: Union Ale is Santa Barbara's sports bar and ale house. We specialize in Burgers, Flatbreads and Craft Beer. We have Santa Barbara's best onsite beer selections with 24 taps of craft beers from across the nation. We have a bottled beer list that will make you drool. We smoke our meats in house and bake our breads in house. Showing every NFL game, Lakers and Clippers game, and all of your favorite March Madness, Union Ale is the place to be. So come on down and fill up a boot. Cheers.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Thu: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 12:30 am

name: Union Barrel Works
description: Union Barrel Works is a restaurant and brew pub located in Reamstown, Pennsylvania in an historic building which originally functioned as a hardware store. It later became Reamstown Garment and was a sewing factory. The building itself was built in 1911 and still has the original hardwood maple floors and authentic tin ceiling. Come visit us for a great atmosphere, better food and excellent beer!

name: Union Brewing Company
description: At Union Brewing Company, our artisan ales are hand crafted two barrels at a time using time honored traditions, natural ingredients and traditional methods. Our beers are never filtered or force carbonated. They condition and carbonate naturally in casks and are hand drawn by authentic beer engines at the perfect drinking temperature to maximize all the flavors. (No, they are not warm!) We really like beer, and we love cask conditioned real ales. We think you will too!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 4:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Fri: 3:00 pm - 1:00 am  Sat: 12:00 pm - 1:00 am  Sun: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Union Craft Brewing Company
description: Union Craft Brewing is a homegrown, independent craft brewery located in the Clipper Mill area of Woodberry. We are dedicated to providing the good people of Baltimore fresh, handcrafted, and approachable beers and to fostering the community that forms whenever great beer is flowing.

name: Unity Vibration Living Kombucha Tea
description: Small Artisan Kombucha Manufacturer located in Michigan that began selling in 2009. Has evolved product into a Kombucha Tea that may contain more than 0.5% ABV to keep the integrity, maximum nutrient content, texture, and flavor intact and impeccable. Also selling first pure Kombucha Beer on the market, Triple Goddess, in Raspberry and Ginger that contains 8-9% ABV. Company currently operates out of small micro-brewery in Depot Town, Ypsilanti, Michigan.

name: Unknown Brewing
description: Live Without Boundaries.    Man needs job. Man finds a job. Man finds a passion in that job.  That passion becomes a life mission written on a napkin (own a brewery by age 30.)  That mission becomes:  THE UNKNOWN BREWING COMPANY.

name: Unruly Brewery
description: Provide awesome hand crafted beers in a one of a kind atmosphere that blends our attitude with a fully restored historic building from the 1890's.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Thu: 5:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 3:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: Upland Brewing Company
description: We’ve been brewing ales, lagers, and sours in Bloomington, Indiana since 1998. Many of our brews are unique twists on traditional recipes, while others are products of our own imaginations. We’re proud to say that several of our beers have brought home national and international medals and awards, but what we really care about is brewing the kinds of beer we like to drink, and providing a fresh local option to our communities. It never hurts to get a pat on the back, though! Along the way, we’ve made lots of friends and drank our unfair share of good beer, all while trying to do good in our communities and do well as a craft brewery.
hoursOfOperation: Upland offers free tours from 3-5 pm every Saturday and Sunday.    Brewpub:  pen 11:00am until midnight Monday through Thursday  Open 11:00am until 1:00am Friday and Saturday  Open noon until midnight Sunday

name: Upright Brewing Company
description: Upright Brewing specializes in farmhouse inspired beers rooted in France and Belgium but made with local ingredients and a Pacific Northwest twist. The name is a reference to Charles Mingus and his primary instrument. Mingus was a musician whose compositions defy categorization. At Upright we use a special saison yeast and open fermenters to produce beers that are a true hybrid style, sharing Mingus’ spirit of exercising creativity and craft.

name: Lee Hill
description: Located in Boulder with two tap rooms (Flatiron Park & Lee Hill), Upslope taps into Colorado's active lifestyle by offering superior quality, hand-crafted ales & lagers in cans for the on-the-go beer enthusiast.    Ascend to New Heights.
hoursOfOperation: Tue:  2:00pm - 8:00pm Wed:  2:00pm - 8:00pm Thu:  2:00pm - 8:00pm Fri:  2:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  2:00pm - 9:00pm

name: Flatiron Park
hoursOfOperation: MONDAY-SUNDAY: 11 AM-10 PM

name: Upstate Brewing Company
description: Upstate Brewing Company is a new production micro-brewery in the Southern Tier (Finger Lakes Region) of New York state. We are open Saturday afternoons 1-4 & you can watch our brew team in action most Saturdays. Our beers are currently on tap at restaurants and bars throughout the Southern Tier.
hoursOfOperation: We are open Saturdays from 1-4 & ALL tastings are FREE! ANY growler will be filled for $8 (Cash/Check only for now)

name: Eleventh Street
description: Derived from the Native American meaning of Omaha,  “upstream” or “against the current”, the Upstream Brewing  Company is just that—a restaurant different from the rest.    Since opening in 1996, the Upstream has been all about fresh—from the handcrafted beers to the locally grown produce to the lively atmosphere. Not to mention the friendly, knowledgeable staff. So stop in today, and find out why we’ve been named one of Omaha’s “Best” several years running.
hoursOfOperation: Friday - Saturday: 11:00am – 2:00am   Sunday Brunch: 10:00am – 2:00pm  Sunday Dinner: 2:00pm – 10:00pm

name: Wright Plaza
hoursOfOperation: Monday: 11:00am – 11:00pm  Tuesday: 11:00am – 10:00pm  Wednesday - Thursday: 11:00am – 11:00pm  Friday-Saturda: 11:00am – midnight  Sunday Brunch: 10:00am – 2:00pm  Sunday Dinner: 2:00pm – 9:00pm

name: Urban Chestnut Brewing Company
description: Situated in an old 1920's garage that has been outfitted to accommodate our ‘new world meets old world’ brewery, UCBC is located in a district of St. Louis known as Midtown Alley—a part of town with some history that is undergoing a revolution of its own. A great place for us to be a part of the vibrant urban culture yet remain grounded by our chestnut roots. Please visit us and experience what our Beer Divergency is all about.

name: Urban Family Brewing
description: We are a family-run brewery located in the heart of Ballard, Seattle.

name: Urban Growler Brewing Company
description: Urban Growler Brewing Company (UGBC) is a packaging microbrewery located in St. Paul, Minnesota and opening in 2013. We'll sell our own artisanal beer and food onsite in the brewery taproom and kegs offsite to Metro area retailers.

name: Urban Legend Brewing Company
description: Urban Legend Brewing Company makes unique beers the traditional way. Beer is our passion. We believe that our beer can make the world and our local community a better place! We use only the highest quality ingredients and make small batches to ensure that we supply our community with the purest, freshest, highest quality beer possible. Our goal is to support local businesses and American manufacturing wherever possible. We are committed to recycling, reusing, and reducing our carbon footprint while at the same time making unique beers for discerning beer lovers and craft beer newbies. We will think local and will contribute to the local economy.   The beer we produce will be available in our brewery and at local bars, restaurants and liquor stores. Fresh beer always tastes the best! Pints in the taproom, growlers to go, and small scale, local distribution is our way of ensuring our product is in its prime when it gets to your glass. We have a number of staple beers on draught plus we will be providing a rotating line of seasonal and specialty brews. We love to rediscover ancient beer recipes as well as spend a lot of time developing a unique styles.  As we say.....Great Beer, Born Here.

name: Urbn St. Brewing Co.
description: URBN St. Brewing Co., founded by Alex Carballo, Jon Mangini, and head brewer Callaway Ryan, is a craft brewery located in El Cajon, CA.

name: Utah Brewers Cooperative
description: Wasatch Beers (Schirf Brewing Company) was formed when Greg Schirf found his way to Utah from Milwaukee, America’s beer capital, only to discover that his newly adopted home state did not have a brewery of its own. Recognizing a need and an opportunity, he committed to rectify this situation. In 1986, Schirf opened the first brewery in the resort town of Park City and named his beers after the majestic Wasatch Mountains that rise just east of Salt Lake City. In July 1989, Schirf Brewing opened its new company headquarters and the first brew pub in Utah at the top of historic Main Street in Park City.    In fact, it was Schirf who proposed the bill to the Utah Legislature in 1988 that would make brew pubs legal in Utah. There are now more than 12 thriving brew pubs in the state thanks to Schirf and the bill's sponsor, Senator Mike Demeitrick of Price, Utah.

name: Uwharrie Brewing Company, LLC
description: A craft brewery in planning, aiming to use the freshest and most local ingredients available. Our beers are inspired by current trends in the craft beer industry as well as the people and flavors of the Uwharrie region and the Piedmont of North Carolina.

name: Valhöll Brewing
description: Just come check us out. You never know what you might find. We have a fun loving environment and we love to see new people.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Sat:	4:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun:	12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Valiant Brewing
description: Valiant Brewing Company is a craft brewery in for Orange, California which serves the Southern California area with an exceptional line up of craft beer.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 5:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Valkyrie Brewing Company
description: Valkyrie Brewing Company (formally known as Viking) is a small, family owned and operated microbrewery located in Northwest Wisconsin in the village of Dallas. Since 1994, Valkyrie has brewed dozens of styles of beer in small, handcrafted batches for our customers' enjoyment.    Valkyrie’s mission is to provide people with excellent tasting, top quality beer.   We are committed to producing beer that is:  the BEST quality possible  brewed with the finest ingredients available   made by the most sustainable methods achievable
hoursOfOperation: Tours: Saturdays at 1PM

name: Vallensons Brewing Company
description: Vallensons Brewery    Our small home brewery located in Pearland Texas just South of Houston was founded in December 2008. We have been brewing great beers for over 14 years and one day aspire to have our own Nanobrewery. Since any start-up is always tough, we feel starting small and expanding later is the best way to go.     As a Nanobrewery we brew 1/2  barrel of beer at a time which means we can afford to brew different styles of beer in smaller quantities (less cost) while focusing attention to traditional styles with a creative twist. At Vallensons we like to experiment and thus far our beers have been very successful.     Vallensons plans to be different then the standard brewery by carving a niche out of the craft brewing industry. Vallensons Brewing Company plans to build its reputation on quality, character and consistency and the best part of it all is that we plan on having fun along the way. We believe that if you put passion into what you love then you will yield success.

name: Valley Brewing Company
description: Since 1853, El Dorado Brewing Company operated in California's Central Valley providing beer for the local residents of San Joaquin county. When the Prohibition Act was passed, the company ceased operations for a period of time but still maintained the recipes and brewing knowledge. In 1994, Kellie Jacobs re-established the operations under the name of Valley Brewing Company Inc. and set out to build Valley Brewing Company into the premier brewery that operated in years past.    Over a decade later, Valley Brewing Company has won numerous awards for various beers such as Uberhoppy, West Coast IPA, Luna Blanca and London Tavern. The London Tavern won a silver medal in the 2010 World Beer Cup and Uberhoppy just recently won another prestigious award in 2011. Valley Brewing Company and will continue it's focus on brewing the San Joaquin Valley's top beers and provide our loyal customers with not only award winning beer but bragging rights that they represent Valley Brew!    Come in and enjoy our award winning beers and enjoy the ambiance of our beautiful microbrewery located in Stockton, California. See you soon.
hoursOfOperation: Daily 11:00am - Closing

name: Valley Center Brewery
description: alley Center Brewery is a locally owned and operated, pico brewery located in the hills of North San Diego County, in the town of Valley Center. What started as a homebrewing hobby has blossomed into an idea to produce and develop beer for the local town to support the business and lifestyles of the area. With our unique community surroundings, Valley Center Brewery has developed four mainstay beers for its bottle and keg production, services local restaurants, and provides quality product geared towards Valley Center's taste. We welcome you to pull up a barrel and have a cold one by us!
hoursOfOperation: Sunday                11am - 5pm  Monday                   Closed  Tuesday                  Closed  Wednesday         11am - 5pm  Thursday             11am - 5pm  Friday                  11am  -  7pm  Saturday              11am  -  7pm

name: Van Houten Brewing Co
description: Family-owned craft brewery in planning specializing in unfiltered, cask-conditioned session beers and old style traditions made in small batches with a California perspective, based in Marin County.
hoursOfOperation: we're still in planning. stay tuned!

name: Van Houzen Brewing Company
description: Van Houzen Brewing Company is a small operation focused on bringing you high-alcohol Artisan Ales.  Founded in early 2011, we completed our build out and became licensed on Oct. 31st, 2011… Halloween.  We are a family owned and operated business set up in the lower level of Sugar Grove Gathering Place in Newton, Iowa.      Our story began as many others had: a fascination with beer, the many different styles and processes of brewing, the extensive history of this versatile beverage, home brewing, and of course, consumption of beers big and small, from every corner of the world.  The eventual result of all this has evolved into a commercial nano-brewery.      While our capacity is quite small, all our beers are hand crafted and unfiltered, offering you the most true and pure representation of traditional beer styles.  VHBC employs an all natural brewing process incorporated from Belgian, German, and American brewing practices, executed on a custom designed brewhouse.      We are excited to offer four styles to the public, available through reputable Cafes and Alehouses in Eastern and Central Iowa.  Ask your local pub to give it a shot, support Iowa beer, and Prost!

name: Van Port Brewing
description: VanPort Brewing is a group of friends that all graduated from Portland State University.  In fact between the founding members there are 5 degrees from Portland State University.  We derive our name from the Vanport Flood that destroyed the city of Vanport City, Oregon, in 1948.  Vanport was also the first name of Portland State University.    We are dedicated to creating excellent home brewed beers, with aspirations of producing commercial quality beer.

name: Vander Mill Winery, Cider Mill & Microbrewery
Vault Brewing Company
description: Vault Brewing Company is a new brewpub slated to open late summer of 2012.  Housed in the original Yardley National Bank building, it will offer a wide selection of seasonal beers, gourmet wood-fired flat breads, and fine tapas – all in an upscale environment that pays homage to the regal and old world era when turn-of-the-century banks were in their glory.  The name comes from the 120-year-old vault at the center of the building which will be showcased in its use as the oak-aging room.

name: Venice Beach Beer Company
description: The VBBC was started in 2010 by two friends living in Venice that share a love for great beer. In June of 2012, their "VENICE" Amber Ale and "JUNE GLOOM," a Belgian White, hit the market with an overwhelmingly positive response.

name: Verboten Brewing
description: Verboten is an award-winning artisan craft brewery located in Loveland, Colorado. Our beers are an exciting mix between traditional styles and experimental brews, lovingly fretted over by our brewer, Josh Grenz. Verboten opened in 2013 and in 2014 took home two World Beer Cup medals.     Carefully handcrafted from conception until our brew fills your glass, Verboten provides an endlessly exciting journey for craft beer lovers. Our tagline is "Beer for All," and we believe there is a perfect beer out there for everyone.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 3:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 1:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun: 1:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: Vermont Beer Company
description: The Vermont Beer Co. can be found at The Perfect Pear CafÃ© in Bradford Vermont. Brewing beer on a 10 gallon system allows us to rotate our beers more often and makes us the smallest brewery in Vermont.    We serve our ales exclusively on draft on premise in The Perfect Pear Cafe dining room, out on our deck over-looking the Waits River and coming soon in our new Pub located just under the Pear.    Adam Coulter, enthusiastic home brewer and long time chef of The Perfect Pear has turned in his chef coat and turned his attention to upholding the tradition of brewing great beer in Vermont.    Featuring beers such as Waits River Red Ale, First Tap India Pale Ale & Devil's Den Brown Porter, The Pear offers two rotating house taps as well as two rotating guest taps showcasing some of the finest microbreweries from New England and beyond.
hoursOfOperation: Open Lunch Tuesday-Saturday 11:30-2:00    Dinner - Tuesday- Saturday 5:00- 9:00    Pub - Tuesday-Saturday 2:00-Close

name: Vermont Hard Cider Company
description: At Woodchuck®, we do things our own way. We start with the finest ingredients crafted at our local cidery here in Middlebury, Vermont. Then our cider-master meticulously oversees the details of every small batch before any bottle or keg leaves our back door. It’s this special attention and love for our product that ensures we always deliver a smooth unique hard cider that is true to our roots.   Independent to the core®.

name: Vermont Pub & Brewery
description: VPB is the third oldest brewpub on the East Coast.
hoursOfOperation: Sun-Wed 11:30 a.m. to 1 a.m.   Thu-Sat   11:30 a.m. to 2 a.m.

name: Vertigo Brewing
description: The early seeds of Vertigo Brewing were sown back in 1995 when Mike Haines and Mike Kinion began experimenting with brewing at U-Brew in Tigard, Oregon. But what began as a light hobby soon developed into a deep passion. They quickly outgrew the offerings of U-Brew and expanded their operation into a homebrew setup. Fifteen years later, the two Mikes have a lot of batches, awards, and experience under their belts. Starting in May of 2008, Vertigo Brewing was christened a fully-licensed brewery in a Hillsboro warehouse.   Vertigo Brewing is currently operating a one barrel system, producing eight to ten barrels a month. But as demand takes off, the two Mikes are eagerly looking forward to an expanded business operation. Vertigo prides itself on producing a unique blend of beer offerings that manage to stand out in the beer-saturated market of the Northwest.

name: Veteran Beer Company
description: The Veteran Beer Company is dedicated to providing lives of quality for military Veterans through the creation of meaningful post-service careers. The company will produce, sell, and deliver beers of superior quality, striving to employ Veterans in every role within the organization and the supply chain while adhering to the highest principles of military service, conducting business with integrity, courage, and loyalty.

name: Veterans United Craft Brewery
description: Veterans United Craft Brewery is dedicated to satiating healthy appetites with flavorful beer through the use of fresh, quality ingredients and hope to expand the definition of what beer can be through our hard work and innovation. We also value ideas and technologies that reinforce our social and environmental responsibility to our local community.     Join us Wednesday through Saturday in our brand new taproom to experience our beer right from the source. We'll be serving our flagship Raging Blonde Ale and Hopbanshee IPA, as well as taproom-exclusive brews and some great guest beers.     Take home a 32 or 128 oz. Growler or just enjoy a few pints.     Enjoy a tour of the brewery production area on Saturdays, from 1:30pm–4:30pm (one every hour; cost is $5 and includes a guided tour, tasting glass, and sample pours of our beers on tap).    Keep an eye on our Facebook and Twitter feeds or sign up for our e-newsletter to see when talented local musicians and delicious food trucks will be around.     Veterans United Craft Brewery is committed to making a positive contribution to Jacksonville and beyond, and we look forward to sharing a pint with you!

name: Victory Brewing Company
description: Having trained in Germany, we appreciate the artistic freedom we have here in the US. Here creativity is embraced by a fervent core of consumers and we are happy to serve that audience with our experience in traditional methods, selection of choice, often imported ingredients, and the best processing that technology can offer us. We relish the opportunity to please both ourselves and our audience with our flavorful creations.  We've invested more than our lives in this. Take a look at Victory Brewing Company's Beers.
hoursOfOperation: BREWERY HOURS (For Shipping and Receiving)  8:00 am to 4:00 pm Monday through Thursday    RESTAURANT  Visit our Brewpub page.  Monday – Saturday 11:30am – Midnight  Sunday 11:30am – 10:00pm    RETAIL STORE   Visit our online store.  610-873-0881 ext. 206  Sunday 11:30am – 8:00pm  Monday -Thursday 11:30am – 8:30pm  Friday – Saturday 11:30am – 10:00pm

name: Vierling Restaurant & Marquette Harbor Brewery
description: In December 1995, the Vierling became one of Michigan’s first brew pubs with the addition of a five barrel micro-brewing system.  The brew equipment, direct from Budapest, Hungary is configured to produce some of the finest ales and lagers in 155 gallon hand-crafted batches.  The relatively small sized batches of beer insures a fast product turn-over which enables the Vierling to serve the freshest beer possible with a multitude of varieties.

name: Viking Braggot Company
description: Viking Braggot Company is Eugene's newest brewery and the only brewery to offer a full line of braggots! What are braggots? It is one of the oldest fermented drinks, pioneered by the Vikings that takes elements of beer and fermented honey (or mead). We are updating this ancient tradition by creating a modern beverage that combines local honey and organic craft beer ingredients!

name: Village Idiot Brewing Company
description: Our brewery is a 1.5 BBL (46.5 gallons) artisanal, small-batch, neighborhood business brewing quality beer for good people who appreciate good beer.  We offer samples, pints, and growler fills. Our unique tasting room is situated at the location of the former Bridgetown Pub, just a short drive from NJ Turnpike Exit 5 or the Mt. Holly exit off 295. We combine fresh ingredients with beer education and a brewery tour to refresh, enlighten and inform.    Our limited brewery license prevents us from serving food, but  we encourage our customers to carry-in or order delivery from one of the many restaurants in downtown Mt. Holly within walking distance.    Village Idiot Brewing Company is a very unique concept that we have seen blend in and work successfully in other Main Street settings across the country.  Our small size allows us to be nimble and offer tap selections that change frequently.

name: Brewpub
description: A Brewery Founded on the Principles of Craft and Precision, with an Obsession for the Details of Quality, and a Belief in the Power of Beer to Bring People Together.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 2:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Vine Park Brewing Company
description: The fun place to brew your own beer and make your wines!    The only place in the Midwest where you and friends, co-workers, or even family can meet to create your custom beers & wines. We provide the equipment, supplies, recipes, and expert Brew Coaches to assist you. You get the fun & the beverage. We take care of the mess & expertise.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu:	12:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri:	12:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat:	9:00 am - 5:00 pm

name: Vino's Pizza Pub & Brewery
description: Vino's beers are brewed fresh with only the finest natural ingredients. No chemicals and no preservatives. We strive to produce flavorful brews, emphasizing quality not quantity.    In this section of our site, we want to acquaint you with all of our handcrafted ales, give you a brief overview of the history of beer, and introduce you to a few brewing terms in an attempt to expand your understanding of the process. Once you've checked out all of our brews, you might want to learn more about our brewing process and our head brewer.    Try one of Vino's brews on your next visit with a great pizza or calzone, or take one home to drink later in one of our convenient growlers. We think you will enjoy the unique flavors of our fresh, handcrafted ales!

name: Vintage 50 Restaurant and Brew Lounge
description: Vintage 50, at this Leesburg, Virginia classically modern brewery.  Whether you enjoy a fine California cabernet paired with innovative New American fare, or a cold beer brewed on-site paired with classic comfort food, you will feel at home at Vintage 50. Guests will relax in style while enjoying libations from near and far as well as a menu that features fresh, seasonal ingredients.

name: Vintage Brewing Co
description: In 2002 Brittany, Trent & Mark Kraemer opened Vintage Spirits & Grill on the corner of University & Frances near the UW-Madison campus.  In 2009, they, along with Bryan & Scott manning and Mike Bridges decided to expand their family business and took over the vacant space formerly occupied by JT Whitneys.    They brought in a creative culinary team and set about creating a restaurant and brewery that features both excellent made-from-scratch food, and outstanding hand crafted beers.    "At Vintage Brewing Company, we're dedicated to bringing you world-class beer: fresh, flavorful, varied, & distinctive. We champion the craft of beer brewing as a harmony of art and science, where hard work and precision are guided by vision and passion. Cheers to great beer!"
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 2:00 am

name: Virtue Cider
description: Virtue works in partnership with local farmers, using the highest quality Midwestern heirloom apples, to produce ciders that combine old world traditions with modern craft cider fermentation and aging techniques. Our cider house is located in Fennville, Michigan.

name: Von Jakob Brewery
description: As Von Jakob Vineyard, we have brought exceptional wines to the Southern Illinois area and beyond for over 15 years. Now, we are excited to introduce Von Jakob Brewery, complete with hand-crafted brews, made exclusively at our Orchard location in Alto Pass, Illinois.    Offering eight styles of beer ranging from our crisp, clean, lightly-hopped American Pilsner to our rich, dark Stout, you are sure to find a beer that delights your palate. Or, if you are having trouble choosing just one, we offer a flight of all eight delicious beers. We also have a great selection of domestic beers as well as premium beers from around the world for your enjoyment.    And for our wine enthusiasts out there, do not worry – our winery isn’t going anywhere. We just thought we would offer you a different libation of choice, should you want to explore it.    We sincerely thank you for your support over the years, and we welcome you to come and experience this next adventure with us!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat: 10:00 am - 6:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Von Scheidt Brewing Company
description: VonScheidt Brewing Co. is Twin Falls' home town pub & brewery. Featuring the best live music in the Magic Valley and local beers brewed in house by brewmaster Pat VonScheidt. Delicious food is served daily and we're open till the last cat leaves!

name: Voodoo Brewing Company
description: Brewers of Artisan Beer Styles and is not a brewpub.

name: W Brewing
description: We are bringing back the Craft in German Lager's here in the United States. Keeping it exclusive and tasty per every batch we create.

name: Wachusett Brewing Company
description: History Wachusett Brewery founders Ned, Kevin and Peter developed a significant appreciation for beer while attending Worcester Polytechnic Institute. Adventures in biking, canoeing, and hiking that led the trio to the northern New England states allowed them to visit some of the first operating craft breweries. Armed with a we can do this attitude the three cast off from their careers in engineering and biology to found the Wachusett Brewing Co. in 1993. Wachusett Country Ale was introduced to beer fans of Massachusetts the next year after lots of experimenting to get the formula just right. When Wachusett opened, the three designed and built most of the equipment; did the brewing and filling, selling and delivering, and everything else that a small startup brewery needed. Ned, Kevin and Peter are now backed by some of the most passionate and capable co-workers in the industry. Wachusett Ales continue to be hand crafted with the finest ingredients available, bottled and kegged in our Westminster facility. The three have never strayed from their plan to brew and sell the freshest, highest quality beers possible.

name: Waddell's Brewpub & Grille
description: Our Brewpub & Grille in the Five Mile area is named after legend Rube Waddell, the eccentric baseball pitcher with a wicked curve and a blazing fastball, Waddell’s Brewpub & Grille is proud to offer Spokane’s Best Draft selection! Pouring some of the best Craft Brew’s in the Inland Northwest as well as our own beers brewed right here at our restaurant. Waddell’s is always rotating over 80% of our 50 tap handle line up. If IPA’s are what you crave then look no further then here with over 15 hoppy IPA’s on hand. Great brew’s, food and friends what every pub wish they had. Come to Waddell’s where you can meet new friend’s and buy your old mate’s a proper pint. Cheer’s!

name: Wagner Valley Brewing Company
description: Welcome to Wagner Valley Brewing Company, established in 1997. We are a small craft-brewing operation located in the Finger Lakes region of western New York.     The brew system at Wagner's is an imported 20-BBL German-style, steam fired, four-vessel brew house, specifically designed for decoction mashing.    Wagner Valley Brewing Company is unique by adhering to the Reinheitsgebot of 1516, a German Purity Law that states: "Only the finest Malt, Hops, Yeast and Water can be used in the production of beer". This quality standard, used for our standard beers, in conjunction with with our Brewers' talent has resulted in Wagner Valley Brewing continuously winning the most prestigious of brewing awards, capturing numerous G.A.B.F., World Beer Cup and Tap New York medals.
hoursOfOperation: Open Year Round for Tours, Tastings, & Sales, 10am-5pm Daily    We are closed only on Christmas, Thanksgiving & New Year’s Day

name: Wakarusa Brewery
description: The sum of experiences between John and James means a variety of beers including ales, pale ales, stouts and IPAS. Sometimes, a dry hard cider will make an appearance. The Wakarusa Brewery will offer a few flagship beers with a mix of crafted seasonals.

name: Wakonda Brewing Co
description: Wakonda is the central Oregon Coast's very own nano-brewery located in beautiful Florence, Oregon.

name: Walkabout Brewing Company
description: Walkabout Brewing Company was established in 1997 in Central Point, Oregon by founder and head brewer, Ross Litton. A native of Perth, Australia, Ross has been a resident of Oregon for 21 years.    Walkabout brews have traditionally been available primarily in Southern Oregon; however distribution has now been expanded to include all Oregon and Southern Washington. The beers can be found on draft in bars and restaurants and in bottles at stores and markets.     Walkabout bottles Worker's Pale Ale, Jabberwocky Strong Ale and Point the Bone IPA in 22oz bottles. Walkabout is distributed by Point Blank Distributing in Portland, Bend and the Willamette Valley, Summit Distributing in Southern Oregon, Bigfoot Distributing on the Oregon coast and by Alpha Distributing in Washington State.    Walkabout products are brewed in a 7 barrel brew house in Medford, Oregon. The brewery is not only a manufacturing facility but houses a tasting room with a large patio and outdoor area, dock sales are available.

name: Wallace Brewing Company
description: Wallace Brewing Company, 15-barrel microbrewery, began selling its beer in January 2009, in historic Wallace, Idaho.    A collaborative effort of Wallace’s Chase Sanborn, Dean Cooper, Rick Magnuson and the Zanettis, the brewery pays homage to the town’s notorious past, creating a brand of beers with mining and bordello-inspired monikers such as ‘Dirty Blonde’, ‘Jackleg Stout’, ‘RedLight Irish Red Ale’, and ‘Idaho Select Light Lager’ .    “We want to brew in the honest spirit of the mining heritage,” General Manager, Chase Sanborn said. “It’s not only the prevailing reputation of the town, but also one that can elevate the Wallace Brewing brand.

name: Walnut Brewery
description: Boulder's Original Brewpub and winner of multiple Great American Beer Festival® awards including the 2008 Silver Medal & 2010 Gold Medal in the "English-Style Dark Mild Ale or Brown Ale" categories for "Old Elk Brown Ale"    We are located in the heart of downtown Boulder with great food, great service & great people!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 12:00 am

name: Walter's Beer
description: For 100 years, Walter’s Beer was as much a family tradition as it was a refreshing malt beverage. The Walters family toiled through fires, Prohibition and fierce competition to deliver the classic recipe that gave generations of beer enthusiasts a reason to relax at the end of the day. Your time has come to experience this bold, historic brew.

name: Wander Brewing
description: Wander Brewing is a production craft brewery located in Bellingham, WA. Wander was created to produce both traditional and innovative ales and lagers while maintaining our commitment to sustainable practices in our community.

name: Wanderlust Brewing Company
description: Local Flagstaff, Arizona microbrewery with an insatiable lust for exploring the world around us through fermented delights.

name: War Horse Brewing Company
description: The most no-nonsense member of the 3 Brothers family, stepping into War Horse Brewing Co. is like stepping back in time into a WWII pilots hangout. WE WANT YOU to join us for a cold one at War Horse Brewing Company.
hoursOfOperation: We're open every day from 10am until 6pm.

name: Wasatch Brewery
description: Wasatch Beers (Schirf Brewing Company) was formed when Greg Schirf found his way to Utah from Milwaukee,America’s beer capital, only todiscover that his newly adopted home state did not have a brewery of its own. Recognizing a need and an opportunity, he committed to rectify this situation. In 1986, Schirf opened the first brewery in the resort town of Park City and named his beers after the majestic Wasatch Mountains that rise just east of Salt Lake City. In July 1989, Schirf Brewing opened its new company headquarters and the first brew pub in Utah at the top of historic Main Street in Park City.

name: Watch City Brewing Company
description: Welcome to Watch City Brewing Company. As both a restaurant and brewery it is at the core of a vibrant dining scene in the Metrowest. Since 1996 it has consistently provided its customers with fresh, handcrafted beer and intensely appetizing and delicious meals. Watch City beer is highly regarded on both a local and national level, winning distinctions for a number of the styles produced at it’s Moody St. locale. Much like the jeweled pocket watches this city once manufactured, there’s a professional respect for the craftmanship of it’s Brew Master, Aaron Mateychuk. The beer is always satisfying and never sparing for flavor or character.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed:	11:30 am	-	10:00 pm  Thu:	11:30 am - 10:30 pm  Fri - Sat:	11:30 am - 11:00 pm  Sun:	11:30 am - 10:00 pm

name: Water Street Brewing Co.
description: We love brewing. We offer high quality craft beer, brewed on premises and  served directly from our tanks. Our patrons feel like they’re in the middle of a brewery...because they are. On brew day and during fermentation you will experience all the wonderful sites, smells and sounds of the brewing process.    You will find familiar and not-so-familiar styles on tap. We like to keep things interesting—there’s always something new. While somewhat conservative in the big tanks you never know what we'll put on tap for small batches. Toasted coconut stout anyone?
hoursOfOperation: Tues.—Thurs.  4 pm—11 pm  Fri.—Sat.  12 pm—12 am  Sun.  12 pm—7 pm

name: Water Tower Brewing
description: (No longer brewing)

name: Waterline Brewing Company
description: Coming in 2015 to downtown Wilmington, North Carolina. Great Beer Brewed Here! A cozy industrial area off Front Street, where Art and Beer converge.

name: Waterway Brewing Company
description: Great People! Great Fun! Great Beer! Private, exclusive brewpub. Not open to the general public. Admission only to members and their guests. Membership by invitation only. No exceptions, ever. Trespassers will be shot. Survivors will be shot again.

name: Wedge Brewing Company
description: The Wedge Brewing Co. is located in the lower level of the Wedge Studios situated in the River Arts District of Asheville, N.C. The building is a classic brick warehouse adjacent  to the railroad tracks. The original use of the structure was probably as a food warehouse. The space the brewery is in at onetime stored slaughtered hogs.    We chose this location because it is in the last frontier of Asheville.    We chose this specific space because it is a perfect fit for our brewing system and gives us great outdoor potential.
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Thurs:  4pm - 10pm+  Friday: 3pm - 10pm+  Sat + Sun: 2pm - 10pm+

name: Weeping Radish Farm Brewery
description: The Weeping Radish is the Oldest Microbrewery in North Carolina. 25 years ago it was illegal for breweries to sell their own beer directly to consumers; they had to go through a distributor. This made it impossible for microbreweries or small brewpubs to exist. In 1985 Uli Bennewitz went to his local senator and together they passed a bill allowing microbreweries to sell their own beer on site. A year later on the July 4th, 1986 the Weeping Radish Brewery opened for business.      Raised in a small village in Bavaria, Uli was determined to bring the high quality beer he was used to across the ocean to North Carolina. A Master Brewer came over from Germany and brewed the first batches of Corolla Gold, Fest, and Black Radish. Strictly adhering to the Reinheitsgebot Purity Law of 1516, all Weeping Radish beers are brewed using hops, malt, yeast and water â€“ no additives, chemicals or preservatives.      Our beer list has expanded over the years and currently on draft in the pub we have the OBX KÃ¶lsch, IPA 25, and Radler as well as our original Corolla Gold, Fest and Black Radish. And for those of you with a sweet tooth we make a fantastic Root Beer!
hoursOfOperation: PUB & Retail Hours  Monday: Closed  Tuesday, Wednesday & Thursday: 11 -4  Friday & Saturday: 11 - 4 / Sunday: 12 - 4

name: WelznGarnr
description: A local, small town, small batch Micro-brewery started by two guys with a dream. Many styles of beer will be brewed and made available to the public for the purpose of information and enjoyment. We can't sell the beer yet, yet. We intend to start selling soon though...

name: West Bend Lithia Beer Company
description: Based in West Bend WI Lithia is committed to brewing quality beer to benefit the community. The Beer That Made Milwaukee Jealous!    In the Lithia Beer spirit and tradition, Lithia is based not only on the finest natural, quality ingredients and processes, but also on extremely pure, hand-crafted, mineral-containing water. West Bend Lithia Beer  is a serious beer drinker’s beer, not a chemically concocted, watered down, commodity beer...it’s simply more beer and less water. Lithia Beer contains no corn or rice grains.     Only the finest hops, and slow roasted, as well as other malts, are utilized. A true pre-Prohibition brew. Lithia Beer is serious beer for serious beer drinkers.    “A great beer that’s   great for the community too” ™    Recreating the Lithia Beer line, as with all good brews, will be a work in progress. Our first brew, Regner Red, a great Rich, Crisp & Creamy Style Red Ale, a very smooth, drinkable brew, was developed in the great spirit of Lithia beer of the past before prohibition. Popular tastes in beer have changed and matured, as have the brewing process and ingredients. We have chosen to develop extremely high quality, natural beers that will be popular with the sophisticated customers of our time and in our community. We utilized the same process to roll out other Lithia Premium Beers such as Bucky Blonde Ale, arguably the most complex, richest blonde beer ever brewed.    Most importantly, Lithia Beer will again, and exclusively, be based in West Bend & Washington County, where it belongs. It’s heritage will now continue to benefit our community for hopefully, the next hundred years. A portion of Lithia Beer proceeds are donated to The Museum of Wisconsin Art, The Washington County Historical & Humane  Society’s, and rebuilding Regner Park plus many other area charities.
hoursOfOperation: 8 am - 4 pm Monday thru Thursday  8 am - 3 pm Friday

name: West County Cider
description: West County Cider continues the centuries-old cider making tradition and adds some modern refinements.    We provide a wide variety of hard ciders for the table, from very dry to sweet. Some have a champagne-like flavor, while others are more robust with tannins from traditional American and European cider apples.    We use fruit from our own orchard of traditional and untraditional cider varieties as well as apples grown by other New England orchards. Commercial yeast is added; occasionally we use the wild yeast on the apples. West County Ciders stand out by the simplicity of our ingredients: whole apples, a little yeast, and a bit of sulfite (found in nearly all wines). No sugars, water, flavorings, sorbate, carbon dioxide, or concentrates are used in any of our ciders, allowing for a crisp, clean apple taste in every bottle.

name: West Flanders
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm

name: West O Beer
description: Our passion is making high quality craft beer, so we built a state of the art brewery in West Okoboji, Iowa. We have access to some of the best water in the world, and it's a quality you can taste.

name: West Sixth Brewing
description: West Sixth Brewing founders Ben, Brady, Joe, and Robin all came to the same conclusion at about the same time – Lexington, KY needs more high quality local craft beer. Since we came from very different backgrounds with diverse sets of experiences and talents, we joined forces to create beer that can be enjoyed not only by craft beer experts, but also by those who just want something tasty to drink after going for a bike ride.    Though we all got to this point in our lives in different ways, we strongly agree on West Sixth’s goals. We will provide a taproom and beer garden where the beer list is never the same but that is always local. We will be a brewery that measures its success not only by making great craft beer but also by how it helps our community. We will always strive to protect our environment even if it costs us more to do so. And last, but not least, we all share a desire to create the best beer possible and to be an integral part of building a great beer culture for our great town.
hoursOfOperation: Monday – Thursday: 3pm – 10pm  Friday and Saturday: Noon – Midnight  Sunday: 1pm-6pm

name: Westbend Vineyards & Brewhouse
description: We are on our final steps to get started and we are very excited. We will have a couple of different beers to choose from. We will also have beer kegs for rent for parties,weddings,restaurants, etc.
hoursOfOperation: Tasting & Sales:  Monday ~ Closed  Tues - Sat ~ 11:00 - 5:00  Sunday ~ 12:00 - 5:00    Tours ($3/person):  Tues-Fri. ~ Available upon request  Saturday ~ 12:00, 1:30 & 3:00  Sunday ~ 1:30 & 3:00

name: Westbrook Brewing Company
description: Westbrook Brewing is a new craft brewery in Mt. Pleasant, SC. Our mission is to make the most interesting, drinkable, and generally awesome beer possible. We love experimenting with different ingredients and brewing techniques, and we hope you’ll have as much fun drinking our beer as we do making it.
hoursOfOperation: Thursdays 4-7  Fridays 4-7  Saturdays 12-4

name: Western Pacific Brewing
description: Oroville's first micro-brewery.

name: Westfield River Brewing Company
description: WRBC beers will be available at local bars, restaurants, and retail stores. Please check back frequently for updates on where you can purchase our tasty brews.     We will also hold brewery tours with tastings on Friday evenings and Saturday afternoons, two weekends each month. Please check back for updates on when the tours will begin.

name: Westminster Brewing Co
description: Imagine a little, community-focused brewery looking to make   thirsty neighbors and friends a great product, then find it tucked   away in a casual, friendly setting and you are at the Westminster   Brewing Company! Located in our namesake city on the Front   Range of awesome Colorado, this production brewery's main   objective is to serve our community and help craft beer fans,   both seasoned and the newly initiated, find the varieties and   flavors they desire.

name: Weston Brewing Company
description: The Weston Brewing Company was first established in 1842 by German immigrant John Georgian. Georgian brought the tradition of lager brewing with him when he settled in Weston. The brewery was designed to utilize ice from the river during winter and lagering cellars dug deep into the ground to create ideal conditions for his beer which needed to be stored below 60 degrees for more than six weeks. In creating the brewery, the Weston Brewing Company became one of the first lager breweries in the United States.

name: Westport Brewing Company
description: Westport Brewing Company is the first microbrewery on the Washington Coast since 1944 when Pacific Brewing Company closed its doors. Emulating traditional brewing conditions, we brew our beer with local water without amendments, regionally grown hops, and domestic malts. We take advantage of our unique location, on a peninsula between the Pacific Ocean and Grays Harbor, to ferment our beer in polyethylene fermenters at ambient temperatures. This results in smooth, clear, unhurried beer with sparkling clarity, deep, complex flavor profiles, and remarkable consistency between styles.    We currently brew 19 styles of beer and are always exploring new recipes to appeal to the craft-wise thirsty palates of the region.    We currently brew in a 3-Barrel brewhouse but have plans to expand in the near future.    Our brewery welcomes visitors Thursday through Monday, noon to 6PM, each week to sample our wide variety of beer, visit with Mark and Robin and enjoy the beauty of Westport and the Washington Coast!
hoursOfOperation: Mon: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm  Thu - Sun: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Wet 'N Reckless Brewing
description: A nanobrewery that makes awesome interesting beer and provides a nice place to drink it
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 3:30 pm - 10:00 pm  Sat: 2:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Wet Dog Cafe & Astoria Brewing Company
description: The Wet Dog Café was founded in 1995. The Brewery was added in 1997 under the name Pacific Rim Brewery. The name of the Brewery was changed to Astoria Brewing Co. in 2005 to commemorate Astoria’s First Brewing Company which was established in 1872. The Wet Dog was named after….the original owners dog…he loved the water and was always WET.    Our Brew Master uses only the finest ingredients to create our exceptional beers. Each beer is handcrafted using a wide range of hops & grains, thus creating unique flavors. It takes approximately 2 weeks for grain, water & hops to become our tasty brews. Our brewery has a 4 barrel system & in 2008 we added two 8 barrel fermenting tanks allowing us to produce over 800 barrels annually.

name: Wet Head Brewery
description: Born from a friendship and chance to drink on the job, Billy Jack and Loren started a journey to make beer for themselves.  What grew out of that was the opportunity to create  something for others.  We quickly realized that our experiments needed to be captured and recreated due to popular demand.  This created a year long journey to acquire the needed  regulatory approval.  In January of 2013, it all became official and we were able to open to the public.  Our dream has shifted a few times but the desire to create something loved and consumed by many hasn't changed.  It has been a wonderful and stressful journey so far and we can't wait to see where it takes us next.
hoursOfOperation: Fri:  5:00pm - 9:00pm Sat:  4:00pm - 9:00pm  Other days upon request.

name: Weyerbacher Brewing Company
description: Established in 1995, Weyerbacher Brewing Company, Inc. was founded in the historic city of Easton, Pennsylvania. We bring artistry, mischief and adventure to the world of brewing so every Weyerbacher beer is an incredible experience.    We, the brewers of Weyerbacher, are continually pushing the envelope of taste experiences, obliterating style guidelines and having a blast while we're at it! Cheers!

name: Whaler's Brewing Company
description: Bringing locally produced beer (by locally produced people) to Wakefield, RI.

name: Smithfiled
description: Brewpub located in Smithfield, VA. Opening fall of 2014.

name: Whetstone Station Restaurant and Brewery
description: Beautiful views, great food and beer in a fun atmosphere on the water. Brattleboro waterfront restaurant. Roof deck and Bier Garten now open! Full restaurant opening soon!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	11:30 am - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat:	11:30 am - 11:00 pm  Sun:	11:30 am - 10:00 pm

name: White Bluffs Brewing
description: Opening November 2010 in Richland, WA, White Bluffs Brewing has been creating great brews since day one. You're thinking, "Well, of course they would say that about themselves"! Don't take our word for it, come and in taste what our fans are talking about or read what they're recommending on Yelp!    Our love of beer, quality ingredients, and 25+ years of experience gives us more than one reason to serve Richland, Kennewick, Pasco and the Northwest with great beer.    Stop in and say hi, we'd love to give you a tour and hang out while you enjoy our humble brewery!    We say "we brew beer with character for people with taste,"  Check us out and find out why.
hoursOfOperation: Tu-Th: 4:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Fri: 4:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: White Flame Brewing Company
hoursOfOperation: Tuesday - Thursday: 4-10ish  Friday & Saturday: 4-12ish

name: White Lion Brewing Company
description: White Lion symbolizes grace with limitless boundaries, the consumer being part of something bigger than them; positioned between lessons taught and possibilities inspired by their energy and spirit.

name: White Rabbit Brewing Company
hoursOfOperation: Fri - Sat: 6:00 pm - 11:00 pm

name: White River Brewing
description: As a small batch brewery, White River Brewing Company specializes in traditional European beers, particularly styles from Belgium, Britain, and Germany, all with an American twist. With uncompromising quality, at White River Brewing Company we work hard to make each flavorful, complex sip, a special occasion. With every batch we use only the finest ingredients available, individually chosen to add layers and complexity to each of our products.     Quality Craft BeerDesigned to appeal to the weekend warrior and discerning enthusiast in all of us, our four staple offerings and seasonal rotating beers are adding steam to the craft beer revolution in Southwest Missouri, and delivering a unique experience in every bottle.

name: White Street Brewing Company
description: White Street Brewing Co., proud to be located in historic downtown Wake Forest, is a small, locally owned independent manufacturer of craft beer. You can enjoy White Street's flavorful handcrafted ales and lagers in restaurants and bars throughout the Triangle and beyond. Or sit down in our taproom where you can see the entire brewing operation and let us pour you some brewed-on-the-premises goodness.    While snacks are available in our taproom, we are not a restaurant. Our focus is brewing beer and we're not only passionate about it, but we're darn good at it, too. From tours and t-shirts to dart leagues and other special events, you will discover Something's Brewing on White Street.
hoursOfOperation: Monday-Thursday, 4pm - 10pm  Friday 4pm - 10pm  Saturday 12pm - 12am  Sunday 12pm - 10pm

name: Whitehorse Brewing LLC
description: Whitehorse Brewing is located in Berlin Pennsylvania a few blocks from mainstreets lower diamond. The brewery is located on the edge of the farms that surround Brothersvalley and Somerset county. Our name comes from "Whitehorse Mountain" located right outside of Berlin, where we hunt, play and live.  Whitehorse beers are all natural and made from water, yeast, barley and hops. Some of our seasonal beers will feature natural flavors like brothers valley real maple sugar from our maple trees, and other natural local flavors.    We brew beer here because, well we love it and local is how we have always lived. To us Whitehorse isn't part of a new "slow food movement" it is just our way of life. We pride ourselves in using as much local product as possible and maintaining our natural rural roots in creating the beers we know you will love.    At Whitehorse we believe being environmentally concious and sustainable is important. For example our grains are recycled by giving them to a local farmer who uses it for feed for his livestock which causes no waste into the local environment.    We work to ensure our recipes and products are something we love but also you absolutely enjoy and will also appreciate the perfection we put into them. Please enjoy our beers as much as we enjoy creating them.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 5:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 9:00 am - 5:00 pm

name: Wichita Brewing Company
description: Wichita Brewing Company offers a welcoming neighborhood brewpub experience, including 9 flat screen televisions to watch your favorite games, friendly staff, and great entertainment. We are local beer enthusiasts, and we have carefully hand-crafted a variety of unique beers for your enjoyment. We also have an exciting menu of appetizers, pizzas and sandwiches, all baked in our wood-fired pizza oven. So, stop in for lunch with your co-workers, bring the family for dinner, or meet your friends for a few brews after work. We're waiting for you!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	11:00 am - 12:00 am  Fri - Sat:	11:00 am - 2:00 am  Sun:	11:00 am - 12:00 am

name: Wicked Beaver Brewing Company
description: Wicked Beaver is a West Texas Craft Brewery, formed in Spring of 2009. We are a hands-on Brewery, with no automation to speak of, this keeps us in touch with every batch of beer we brew.  	  On an old dirt road, far from the beaten path, deep in the midst of no-where lives a Wicked Beaver. Why is he Wicked, you may ask? He is Wicked from the ways of the world, so many demands, too many deadlines, minor appreciation, and never enough time. So with little more than the stick in his hand and the Hops in his hanker chief, he journeyed West. Upon arriving in the West he hopped from the tailgate, choked on the dust, and kicked a tumble weed rolling his direction. This is the West, the place full of opportunity “he asked himself” and sighed but after a few Wicked Cold months, the landscape began to change, grass became lush green, trees bloomed and the flowers opened. The Wicked Beaver found the warm days, and cool nights were perfect to pursue his passion.    The Wicked Beaver and his brewing partners have been Brewing Craft Specialty Beer’s in secret for years, perfecting the fragrant aroma by blending only best hops and hand selecting the Malted Barley for the most unique varieties of flavors and textures. The Wicked Beaver is ready to share his unique creations with you!

name: Wicked Weed Brewing Company
description: In 2009 Walt and Luke sat at a craft beer bar and talked about the dream of opening their own brewery that would focus on big West Coast hoppy ales and authentic Belgain ales that would inspire those who drank them. From that conversation forward there would be no looking back. A business plan was developed and hundreds of test batches brewed. In 2011 Walt and Luke’s lifelong friend Ryan Guthy and his parents Rick and Denise all sat down at their house in the mountains of Western North Carolina to taste some of Luke and Walt’s creations while looking over the plans for what would be Wicked Weed Brewing.  After being thoroughly impressed with the full flavor and vision of the project, the Guthys joined the Dickinsons and the team was assembled.  Over the next months Wicked Weed Brewing found a home at 91 Biltmore avenue, a building that seemed destined to be a brewery.  With the creativity of Luke, vision of Walt, dedication of Ryan, exquisite taste of Denise and wisdom of Rick a truly unique brewery was born.  So from the humble beginning of a basement, the dream of Wicked Weed Brewing has come to life. Our beer is bold, full of excitement and flavor.  Always focused on drinkability and pushing the boundaries of what we think we are capable of.  Wicked Weed Brewing will always evolve, always grow and always aspire to be greater.  Join us in bringing something a little Wicked to Asheville.

name: Wicks Brewing Co
description: Wicks Brewing Company is not your typical Brewery. Besides brewing up barrels of delicious Craft Beer and having a full tasting bar, we offer our guests other amenities as well.     If you are an avid homebrewer or wish to jump into the hobby of homebrewing, we carry everything you need to brew your own Craft Beer or Soft Drinks at home...yes, Soft Drinks as well. There’s no tastier Root Beer than one you made yourself.     If you would like to brew your own Craft Beer or Soft Drinks, but don’t have the room to do it at home or just plain don’t want to own the tools & equipment, we have that covered as well. We have six separate stations where you can brew your own Craft Beer or Soft Drink right here at Wicks Brewing. This system is known as a Brew on Premise (or BOP). All you need to do is choose one of our recipes you would like to try and we will walk you thru the whole brewing process using one of our BOP stations and the ingredients from our stock.    Hungry?...Well, we can take care of that as well. We have an onsite, fully stocked kitchen. The delicious choices on our menu range from appetizers to salads to hardy meals and even desserts.     Make Wicks Brewing your next destination for fun & relaxation, you’ll be happy you did.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Thu - Sat: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 6:00 pm

name: Widmer Brothers Brewing
description: Widmer Brothers Brewing is located in beautiful and brew-friendly Portland, OR. Our publicly-held brewery employs over 150 people who are as passionate about quality craft beer as Kurt & Rob themselves.    We opened the brewery in 1984, and built a new 40-barrel brewing system in our current Russell Street location in 1990. We've grown steadily ever since. In 1996, we completed installation of a state-of-the art 250-barrel brewhouse, bringing our capacity to 220,000 barrels per year. In 1996, for the first time in our brewery’s history we also installed a bottling line, capable of producing 500 bottles per minute. In 2008 we added six new 1500-barrel fermentation tanks that increased our capacity to 450,000 barrels per year, and added a new keg filling line capable of filling 300 kegs per hour.

name: Wiens Brewing Company
description: Wiens Brewing Company is a new Temecula brewery! We were happy to open our doors on November 10th, 2012. You may ask if we are affiliated with the winery in Temecula, Wiens Family Cellars, and the answer is yes. The Wiens family has come together yet again in the community of Temecula to open another fun destination. Along with making wine, the Wiens family has been brewing beer for nearly 17 years. At Wiens Brewing Company you can enjoy tastings of beer, pints, or even have a half-gallon-growler filled to enjoy at home. This Temecula brewery tasting room is very spacious with open areas to see the brewhouse and all of our shiny tanks. Come down and try some of our latest beers while we are open Monday through Thursday from 3pm to 8pm, Friday from 1pm to 8pm, or join us on the weekends from noon to 8pm. Spend a day in Temecula and enjoy Temecula's newest brewery, Wiens Brewing Company.
hoursOfOperation: Hours: M-Th: 3-8, F: 1-8  Weekends: 12-8

name: Wild Cider
description: The World's Best Cider. Produced and packaged in the shadow of the Great Colorado Rockies. Indulge your senses with all our different ciders. Get Wild!

name: Wild Donkey Brewing Co.
description: Donkey Punch Brewing Co. features full-flavored craft beers like no others. We hope to see you come out and experience the punch!
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Thu: 2:00 pm - 8:30 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Wild Earth Brewing
description: One of Washington's new artisanal breweries, Wild Earth Brewing handcrafts its products in the foothills of the Cascade Mountains. Brewed in small batches for our onsite taproom and limited distribution of kegs and bottles around the area. We aim to continually challenge ourselves through unique production methods and ingredients to bring our customers the best beer possible. Stop by our taproom for the latest bottle offerings, growler fills, or to enjoy a fresh pint of our latest batch.
hoursOfOperation: Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 8:00 pm

name: Wild Goose Brewery, LLC
description: Wild Goose Brewery was purchased by Flying Dog Brewing Company.

name: Wild Heaven Craft Beers
description: Wild Heaven is a Georgia company created by lifelong Georgians - founder Nick Purdy (also Publisher of Paste Magazine) with beer recipes designed by Trappeze Pub owner Eric Johnson. Our core year-round portfolio is focused on world-class beers designed to offer something new to the beer landscape—not simply creating our version of what everyone else is doing.

name: Wild Onion Brewing
description: Handcrafted Lagers & Ales, Brewed on Site! Available by the Pint, Growler, Can, or Keg!
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Thu: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 12:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 8:00 pm

name: Wild Wolf Brewing Co
description: Currently a homebrew shop and nano - brewery serving growlers of beer and rootbeer. We offer homebrew demonstrations every saturday at noon!     Look for our Pub coming later this fall

name: Wild Woods Brewery
description: Wild Woods is a microbrewery in Boulder, Colorado that creates handcrafted beers inspired by the outdoors. Our beers begin with recognizable styles and are brewed to highlight elements of the wilderness.
hoursOfOperation: Tue - Fri: 4:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat: 2:00 pm - 9:00 pm

name: Wildcard Brewing Company
description: Wildcard Brewing Company was just a dream until experience, encouragement and circumstance made it a reality. The idea behind the name Wildcard is to pursue the unknown. Wildcard Brewing Company’s owners left stability for chaos, moved to England to learn the craft of beer making, and started a business in an uncertain economy, all in pursuit of a dream. You’d call them crazy, adventurous, unpredictable....a wildcard. Our story is one of the unexpected; a place where there are no limits, where perseverance and a free spirit will turn dreams into reality.     It started when Jeff and Jenny brewed two beers to give away as wedding favors at a brewery in San Luis Obispo where they went to college. Homebrew projects and burst bottle explosions ensued in the years after. But a casual passion soon turned career as Jeff and Jenny headed to England. Jeff studied brewing science at the University of Sunderland and Jenny conducted “research” in various local pubs. Once back in the states Jeff headed straight for the most competitive brewing location, the Pacific Northwest. Now 4 years later the pair are back in Jeff’s hometown of Redding building out their production brewery.    Wildcard is small startup business focused on brewing flavorful beers and enriching the communities that enjoy them. Spending dollars locally is just a part of that commitment. We will source products and services within 500 miles of our facility as much as possible and intend to exclusively sell beers within that same area. Supporting local businesses not only has great economic impacts but environmental as well. We don’t want to just do business in the Redding community we want to be a part of it. It is important to give back as much as possible to the community and we will make it a point to donate and get involved in local causes and efforts.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Thu: 2:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Wilde Yaupon Brewing Co
description: Planned micro-brewery specializing in non-traditional beers, including Lambics, Rauchbier, barrels aged Stouts and Sours. Currently experimenting with recipes, and setting up funding. Expected opening year is 2017

name: Wildlife Brewing and Pizza
description: Wildlife Brewing and Pizza was founded in 2003 by Owner & Head Brewer Ric Harmon. Since then we have been serving up Award-Winning Micro Brews, Tasty Pizza Creations, and delivering Great Service.

name: Wiley Brewing Company
description: Wiley Brewing Company is a "Genius" entrepreneurial brewery in the early stages of development. Specialities include "Estate" and "Big" brews for the courageous beer drinker.

name: Wiley Roots Brewing Company
description: Wiley Roots Brewing Company is a small, artisan craft brewery that opened in Greeley, Colorado in June of 2013.
hoursOfOperation: Wed - Fri: 3:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Sat: 2:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Sun: 2:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Williamsburg AleWerks
description: Williamsburg AleWerks is located in the heart of the early colonies in Williamsburg, Virginia. Established in 2006 we have rolled out a broad range of beer offerings and quickly established a reputation for fine beer. We operate a direct fired brick-clad Peter Austin brew house and ferment all our beers in state-of-the-art conical fermentors.

name: Willimantic Brewing Company
description: Our original Main Street Café was founded in 1991, and began operations as a small deli in the old Capitol Theatre building on Main Street in Willimantic, CT. Occupying both the lobby and concession area of the theatre, seating was limited to 50 people. After 3 years we were bursting at the seams and made the move to 877 Main Street, another historic building. There we expanded to a full service restaurant and featured American craft-brewed beers and an extensive menu.

name: Wind River Brewing Company
description: Wind River Brewing Company is located at the base of the Wind River Mountains in downtown Pinedale, Wyoming. Our brewery is the spot for those who appreciate the art of handcrafted superior brews with a wide range of flavors and notes. We brew award winning beers, created in-house using only the finest ingredients and pure glacier water.    "We are known for having legendary beer and the best food in town." If you're looking for a quick bite to eat or want to relax and sample our entire selection of beer we welcome you to join us at Wind River Brewing Co.

name: Main Cidery
description: We are the first, and only, licensed and bonded cidery in the Piedmont of the Carolinas.  We produce various types of Award Winning Hand-Crafted Hard Ciders with a commitment to sustainable agricultural practices.     As an extension of Windy Hill Orchard and Cidery, we are family owned and operated and located in York, SC.     Please be sure to visit our facebook page and our orchard website for details about upcoming events, product news, and hours and directions.
